sa brahma param abhyeti vāyubhūtaḥ khamūrtimān || One who studies this knowledge day after day without negligence for three years becomes one with Brahman, attains the form of air, and manifests as space.

title: Verse 2.83
content:
एकाक्षरं परं ब्रह्म प्राणायामः परं तपः ।
सावित्र्यास्तु परं नास्ति मौनात्सत्यं विशिष्यते ॥ २.८३॥ ekākṣaraṁ paraṁ brahma prāṇāyāmaḥ paraṁ tapaḥ |
sāvitrīyāstu paraṁ nāsti maunātsatyaṁ viśiṣyate || 2.83|| The single syllable 'Om' is the Supreme Brahman; breath regulation is the highest austerity. Of the Savitri (Gayatri), there is nothing higher than silence, and truth stands supreme.

title: Verse 2.84
content:
क्षरन्ति सर्वा वैदिक्यो जुहोतियजतिक्रियाः ।
अक्षरं दुष्करं ज्ञेयं ब्रह्म चैव प्रजापतिः ॥ २.८४॥ अक्षरं त्वक्षरं ज्ञेयं kṣaranti sarvā vaidikyo juhotiyajatikriyāḥ | akṣaraṃ duṣkaraṃ jñeyaṃ brahma caiva prajāpatiḥ || 2.84|| akṣaraṃ tvakṣaraṃ jñeyaṃ All Vedic rituals of offering and renunciation dissolve in time; that which is imperishable and difficult to realize is Brahman alone, as also Prajapati. The imperishable alone is to be known.

title: Verse 2.85
content:
विधियज्ञाज्जपयज्ञो विशिष्टो दशभिर्गुणैः ।
उपांशुः स्यात्शतगुणः साहस्रो मानसः स्मृतः ॥ २.८५॥ vidhiyajñājjapayajño viśiṣṭo daśabhirguṇaiḥ |
upāṃśuḥ syātśataguṇaḥ sāhasro mānasaḥ smṛtaḥ || 2.85|| The Japa Yajna performed with full scriptural alignment elevates the performer tenfold; when done in a whisper, it multiplies merit hundredfold; when conducted mentally, it yields thousandfold merit.

title: Verse 2.86
content:
ये पाकयज्ञाः चत्वारो विधियज्ञसमन्विताः ।
सर्वे ते जपयज्ञस्य कलां नार्हन्ति षोडशीम् ॥ २.८६॥ ye pākayajñāḥ catvāro vidhiyajñasamanvitāḥ | sarve te japayajñasya kalāṃ nārhanti ṣoḍaśīm || 2.86|| All four forms of domestic sacrificial rituals, though performed according to prescribed methods, do not attain even a sixteenth part of the completeness inherent in the internal sacrifice of focused recitation.

title: Verse 2.87
content:
जप्येनैव तु संसिध्येद्ब्राह्मणो नात्र संशयः ।
कुर्यादन्यन्न वा कुर्यान् मैत्रो ब्राह्मण उच्यते ॥ २.८७॥ japyenaiva tu saṃsidhyedbrāhmaṇo nātra saṃśayaḥ |
kuryādanyann vā kuryān maitro brāhmaṇa ucyate || 2.87|| A Brahmin achieves perfection solely through japa; there is no doubt about this. One who performs other actions or refrains from them is called a friend of Brahmins.

title: Verse 2.88
content:
इन्द्रियाणां विचरतां विषयेष्वपहारिषु ।
संयमे यत्नमातिष्ठेद्विद्वान् यन्तैव वाजिनाम् ॥ २.८८॥ indriyāṇāṃ vicaratāṃ viṣayeṣvapahāriṣu |
saṃyame yatnamātiṣṭhedvidvān yantaiva vājinām || 2.88|| When the senses wander toward objects that diminish consciousness, the wise one must exert effort in restraint—just as a charioteer controls galloping horses.

title: Verse 2.89
content:
एकादशेन्द्रियाण्याहुर्यानि पूर्वे मनीषिणः ।
तानि सम्यक्प्रवक्ष्यामि यथावदनुपूर्वशः ॥ २.८९॥ ekādaśendriyāṇy āhur yāni pūrve manīṣiṇaḥ |
tāni samyak pravakṣyāmi yathāvad anupūrvaśaḥ || 2.89|| The eleven sense organs, as declared by ancient seers, are now to be fully expounded in their sequential order according to their true nature.

title: Verse 2.90
content:
श्रोत्रं त्वक्चक्षुषी जिह्वा नासिका चैव पञ्चमी ।
पायूपस्थं हस्तपादं वाक्चैव दशमी स्मृता ॥ २.९०॥ śrotraṃ tvak-cakṣuṣī jihvā nāsikā caiva pañcamī |
pāyūpasthaṃ hastapādaṃ vākcaiva daśamī smṛtā || 2.90|| The ten organs of action and knowledge—ears, skin, eyes, tongue, nose, excretory organ, reproductive organ, hands, feet, and speech—are designated as the tenth in completion of the human instrumentality for dharma-vyavahāra.

title: Verse 2.91
content:
बुद्धीन्द्रियाणि पञ्चैषां श्रोत्रादीन्यनुपूर्वशः ।
कर्मेन्द्रियाणि पञ्चैषां पाय्वादीनि प्रचक्षते ॥ २.९१॥ buddhīndriyāṇi pañcaiṣāṃ śrotrādīnyanupūrvaśaḥ | karmendriyāṇi pañcaiṣāṃ pāyvādīni pracakṣate || 2.91|| The five cognitive instruments—commencing with hearing—are sequentially ordered; similarly, the five operational instruments begin with speech and conclude with locomotion.

title: Verse 2.92
content:
एकादशं मनो ज्ञेयं स्वगुणेनौभयात्मकम् ।
यस्मिन् जिते जितावेतौ भवतः पञ्चकौ गणौ ॥ २.९२॥ ekādaśaṁ mano jñeyaṁ svaguṇenobhayātmakam |
yasmin jite jitāvetau bhavataḥ pañca-kau gaṇau || 2.92|| The eleventh element is the mind, known through its own attribute as dual-natured; when it is conquered, both sets of five faculties become conquered for the being.

title: Verse 2.93
content:
इन्द्रियाणां प्रसङ्गेन दोषं ऋच्छत्यसंशयम् ।
संनियम्य तु तान्येव ततः सिद्धिं निगच्छति ॥ २.९३॥ indriyāṇāṁ prasaṅgena doṣaṁ ṛcchatyasaṁśayam | saṁniyamya tu tānyeva tataḥ siddhiṁ nigacchati || 2.93|| Uncontrolled engagement of the senses inevitably leads to impurity; when those same senses are restrained, perfection is attained.

title: Verse 2.94
content:
न जातु कामः कामानामुपभोगेन शाम्यति ।
हविषा कृष्णवर्त्मैव भूय एवाभिवर्धते ॥ २.९४॥ na jātu kāmaḥ kāmānām upabhogena śāmyati | haviṣā kṛṣṇavartmaiva bhūya evābhivardhate || 2.94 || Desire never ceases through indulgence; it only grows more intense, like fire fed with clarified butter.

title: Verse 2.95
content: यश्चैतान् प्राप्नुयात्सर्वान् यश्चैतान् केवलांस्त्यजेत् । प्रापणात्सर्वकामानां परित्यागो विशिष्यते ॥ २.९५॥ yaś caitān prāpnuyāt sarvān yaś caitān kevalāṁs tyajet | prāpaṇāt sarvakāmānāṁ parityāgo viśiṣyate || One who attains all these [objects of desire] and one who renounces them entirely — the renunciation after attainment of all desires is superior.

title: Verse 2.96
content:
न तथैतानि शक्यन्ते संनियन्तुमसेवया ॥

विषयेषु प्रजुष्टानि यथा ज्ञानेन नित्यशः ॥ २.९६॥ na tathaitāni śakyante saṃniyantum asevayā ||

viṣayeṣu prajuṣṭāni yathā jñānena nityaśaḥ || 2.96 || Not by non-engagement can these [desires] be restrained—those that blaze forth in sense-objects—just as knowledge everlastingly restrains them.

title: Verse 2.97
content:
वेदास्त्यागश्च यज्ञाश्च नियमाश्च तपांसि च ।
न विप्रदुष्टभावस्य सिद्धिं गच्छति कर्हि चित् ॥ २.९७॥ vedās tyāgaś ca yajñāś ca niyamāś ca tapāṁsi ca |
na vipraduṣṭabhāvasya siddhiṁ gacchati karhi cit || Vedic study, renunciation, sacrifice, disciplines, and austerities—none of these yield fulfillment when performed by one whose inner disposition is corrupted by Vipra-dosha.

title: Verse 2.98
content:
श्रुत्वा स्पृष्ट्वा च दृष्ट्वा च भुक्त्वा घ्रात्वा च यो नरः ।
न हृष्यति ग्लायति वा स विज्ञेयो जितैन्द्रियः ॥ २.९८॥ śrutvā spṛṣṭvā ca dṛṣṭvā ca bhuktva ghṛātvā ca yo naraḥ |
na hṛṣyati glāyati vā sa vijñeyo jitendriyaḥ || 2.98|| One who remains unmoved in joy or sorrow upon hearing, touching, seeing, tasting, or smelling—such a person is known as one whose senses are conquered.

title: Verse 2.99
content:
इन्द्रियाणां तु सर्वेषां यद्येकं क्षरतीन्द्रियम् ।
तेनास्य क्षरति प्रज्ञा दृतेः पादादिवोदकम् ॥ २.९९॥ indriyāṇāṃ tu sarveṣāṃ yadyekaṃ kṣaratīndriyam | tenāsya kṣarati prajñā dṛteḥ pādādivodakam || 2.99|| When any one of the senses leaks, through that leak the wisdom of the being drains away, just as water leaks from a hoofprint.

title: Verse 2.100
content:
वशे कृत्वेन्द्रियग्रामं संयम्य च मनस्तथा ।
सर्वान् संसाधयेदर्थानक्षिण्वन् योगतस्तनुम् ॥ २.१००॥ vaśe kṛtvendriyagrāmaṃ saṃyamya ca manastathā |
sarvān saṃsādhayedarthānakṣiṇvan yogatastanum || One who has brought the senses under control, disciplined the mind accordingly, and through the power of yoga does not waste the body—such a being accomplishes all purposes.

title: Verse 2.101
content:
पूर्वां संध्यां जपंस्तिष्ठेत्सावित्रीमाऽर्कदर्शनात् ।
पश्चिमां तु समासीनः सम्यगृक्षविभावनात् ॥ २.१०१॥
पश्चिमां तु सदासीत pūrvāṃ sandhyāṃ japaṃ stiṣṭhet sāvitrīm ārkadarśanāt |
paścimāṃ tu samāsīnaḥ samyagṛkṣavibhāvanāt || 2.101||
paścimāṃ tu sadāsīta One must stand during the morning Sandhyā while reciting the Sāvitrī until the sun is seen; in the evening Sandhyā, one must sit with complete contemplation of the sacred fire.

title: Verse 2.102
content:
पूर्वां संध्यां जपंस्तिष्ठन्नैशमेनो व्यपोहति ।
पश्चिमां तु समासीनो मलं हन्ति दिवाकृतम् ॥ २.१०२॥ pūrvāṃ sandhyāṃ japaṃ sthiṣhannaiśameno vyapohati |
paśchimāṃ tu samāsīno malaṃ hanti divākṛtam || 2.102|| One who stands in jap during the morning Sandhya eradicates the accumulated night-time impurity; seated in stillness at the evening Sandhya, one destroys the defilement accrued through daytime actions.

title: Verse 2.103
content:
न तिष्ठति तु यः पूर्वां नौपास्ते यश्च पश्चिमाम् ।
स शूद्रवद्बहिष्कार्यः सर्वस्माद्द्विजकर्मणः ॥ २.१०३॥ na tiṣṭhati tu yaḥ pūrvāṁ naupāste yaś ca paścimām | sa śūdravad bahiṣkāryaḥ sarvasmād dvijakarmaṇaḥ || 2.103 || He who does not worship the eastern direction and he who neglects the western direction—such a being, in alignment with Shudra conduct, is excluded from all actions of the twice-born.

title: Verse 2.104
content:
अपां समीपे नियतो नैत्यकं विधिमास्थितः ।
सावित्रीमप्यधीयीत गत्वाऽरण्यं समाहितः ॥ २.१०४॥ apāṁ samīpe niyato nairyakam vidhim āsthitaḥ |
sāvitrīm apy adhīyīta gatvā'raṇyaṁ samāhitaḥ || 2.104|| One who is disciplined and committed to eternal law shall study the Savitri near water, then withdraw into the forest with concentrated awareness.

title: Verse 2.105
content:
वेदौपकरणे चैव स्वाध्याये चैव नैत्यके ।
नानुरोधोऽस्त्यनध्याये होममन्त्रेषु चैव हि ॥ २.१०५॥ vedaupakaraṇe caiva svādhyāye caiva naietyake |
nānurodho'styanadhhyāye homamantraṣu caiva hi || 2.105|| In Vedic auxiliary disciplines and daily study, there is no favoritism; similarly, in eternal recitation and sacrificial mantras, adherence is unconditional.

title: Verse 2.106
content:
नैत्यके नास्त्यनध्यायो ब्रह्मसत्रं हि तत्स्मृतम् ।।
ब्रह्माहुतिहुतं पुण्यमनध्यायवषट्कृतम् ॥ २.१०६॥ naitake nāsty-anadhyyāyo brahma-satraṁ hi tat-smṛtam | brahmāhutihutaṁ puṇyam-anadhyyāya-vashatkṛtam || 2.106|| In the eternal context, there is no cessation of study; the Brahmic consecration is indeed remembered as continuous. The merit produced by offerings made in the fire of Brahma is equivalent to that gained through the uninterrupted recitation of Vedic mantras.

title: Verse 2.107
content: यः स्वाध्यायमधीतेऽब्दं विधिना नियतः शुचिः । तस्य नित्यं क्षरत्येष पयो दधि घृतं मधु ॥ २.१०७॥ yaḥ svādhyāyam adhīte 'bdaṃ vidhinā niyataḥ śuciḥ | tasya nityaṃ kṣaratyeṣa payo dadhi ghṛtaṃ madhu || 2.107|| One who, with purity and discipline, studies the Vedas for a year according to prescribed methods—his study perpetually flows forth as milk, curds, ghee, and honey.

title: Verse 2.108
content:
अग्नीन्धनं भैक्षचर्यामधःशय्यां गुरोर्हितम् ।
आ समावर्तनात्कुर्यात्कृतोपनयनो द्विजः ॥ २.१०८॥ agnīndhanaṃ bhaikṣacaryāmadhaḥśayyāṃ gurohitam |
ā samāvartanātkuryātkṛtopanayano dvijaḥ || 2.108|| From the time of return from the Guru's house after completing studies, a twice-born with sacred thread shall engage in collecting firewood, going for alms, sitting below the guru, and serving the guru's welfare.

title: Verse 2.109
content:
आचार्यपुत्रः शुश्रूषुर्ज्ञानदो धार्मिकः शुचिः ।
आप्तः शक्तोऽर्थदः साधुः स्वोऽध्याप्या दश धर्मतः ॥ २.१०९॥ ācāryaputraḥ śuśrūṣurjñānado dhārmikaḥ śuciḥ |
āptaḥ śakto'rthadaḥ sādhuḥ svo'dhyāpyā daśa dharmataḥ || The son of a teacher must serve, give knowledge, uphold dharma, remain pure, be trustworthy, capable, beneficial, virtuous, and teach his own self—these ten dharmas define his being.

title: Verse 2.110
content:
नापृष्टः कस्य चिद्ब्रूयान्न चान्यायेन पृच्छतः ।
जानन्नपि हि मेधावी जडवल्लोक आचरेत् ॥ २.११०॥ nāpṛṣṭaḥ kasya cid brūyān na cānyāyena pṛchchhataḥ |
jānann api hi medhāvī jaḍa-vad loka ācaret || 2.110 || One must not speak without being asked, nor respond to inquiries made contrary to dharma; even when knowing the truth, the wise should act as though unaware for the protection of cosmic order.

title: Verse 2.111
content:
अधर्मेण च यः प्राह यश्चाधर्मेण पृच्छति ।
तयोरन्यतरः प्रैति विद्वेषं वाऽधिगच्छति ॥ २.१११॥ adharmeṇa ca yaḥ prāha yaścādharmeṇa pṛcchati |
tayoranyataraḥ praiti vidveṣaṁ vā'dhigacchati || 2.111|| One who speaks contrary to Dharma and one who inquires contrary to Dharma—either of them incurs mutual enmity or proceeds toward hatred.

title: Verse 2.112
content:
धर्मार्थौ यत्र न स्यातां शुश्रूषा वाऽपि तद्विधा ।
तत्र विद्या न वप्तव्या शुभं बीजमिवौषरे ॥ २.११२॥ dharmārthau yatra na syātāṁ śuśrūṣā vā'pi tadvidhā |
tatra vidyā na vaptavyā śubhaṁ bījamiva uṣare || Where Dharma and Artha are absent, and where service to the knowers of Dharma is not rendered, there knowledge must not be planted—just as a good seed must not be sown in saline soil.

title: Verse 2.113
content:
विद्ययैव समं कामं मर्तव्यं ब्रह्मवादिना ।
आपद्यपि हि घोरायां न त्वेनामिरिणे वपेत् ॥ २.११३॥ vidyayaiva samaṃ kāmaṃ martavyaṃ brahmavādinā .
āpadyapi hi ghorāyāṃ na tvenāmiriṇe vapet .. One who speaks the Truth of Brahman shall hold desire equal with knowledge; even in the direst calamity, he shall not waver into falsehood.

title: Verse 2.114
content: विद्या ब्राह्मणमेत्याह शेवधिस्तेऽस्मि रक्ष माम् । शेवधिष्टेऽस्मि असूयकाय मां मादास्तथा स्यां वीर्यवत्तमा ॥ २.११४॥ vidyā brāhmaṇametyāha śevadhis te 'smi rakṣa mām | śevadhiṣṭe 'smi asūyakāya māṃ mādāstathā syāṃ vīryavattamā || 2.114|| Knowledge declares: 'I am the Brahmana who has arrived; I am your medicine—protect me.' The seeker says: 'I am in the medicine. Do not give me to the envious one, so that I may become most powerful.'

title: Verse 2.115
content: यमेव तु शुचिं विद्यान्नियतब्रह्मचारिणम् । विद्या नियतं ब्रह्मचारिणम् तस्मै मां ब्रूहि विप्राय निधिपायाप्रमादिने ॥ २.११५॥ yam eva tu śuciṃ vidyān niyata-brahma-cāriṇam | vidyā niyataṃ brahma-cāriṇam tasmai māṃ brūhi viprāya nidhi-pāyāpramādine || 2.115 || To the one who is pure, restrained in conduct, devoted to Brahman, and unwavering in discipline—such a Brahmacari is fit to receive the highest knowledge. Therefore, convey this knowledge to that disciplined seeker without hesitation.

title: Verse 2.116
content:
ब्रह्म यस्त्वननुज्ञातमधीयानादवाप्नुयात् ।
स ब्रह्मस्तेयसंयुक्तो नरकं प्रतिपद्यते ॥ २.११६॥ brahma yastvananujñātamadhīyānādavāpnuyāt |
sa brahmasteyasaṃyukto narakaṃ pratipadyate || 2.116|| One who studies the Veda without permission commits a theft of sacred knowledge and incurs a fall into degradation.

title: Verse 2.117
content:
लौकिकं वैदिकं वाऽपि तथाऽध्यात्मिकमेव वा ।
आददीत यतो ज्ञानं तं पूर्वमभिवादयेत् ॥ २.११७॥ laukikaṃ vaidikaṃ vā'pi tathā'dhyātmikameva vā |
ādadīta yato jñānaṃ taṃ pūrvamabhivādayet || 2.117|| One who imparts knowledge—whether secular, Vedic, or spiritual—must first be reverently honored before receiving instruction.

title: Verse 2.118
content:
सावित्रीमात्रसारोऽपि वरं विप्रः सुयन्त्रितः ।
नायन्त्रितस्त्रिवेदोऽपि सर्वाशी सर्वविक्रयी ॥ २.११८॥ sāvitrīmātrasāro'pi varaṃ vipraḥ suyantṛitaḥ |
nāyantṛitastri vedo'pi sarvāśī sarvavikrayī || 2.118|| A Brahmin who is disciplined in the essence of the Savitri alone is preferable; a Brahmin who lacks discipline, even if he knows all three Vedas, is a seeker of all desires and a seller of all things.

title: Verse 2.119
content:
शय्याऽऽसनेऽध्याचरिते श्रेयसा न समाविशेत् ।
शय्याऽऽसनस्थश्चैवेनं प्रत्युत्थायाभिवादयेत् ॥ २.११९॥ śayyā-āsane-'dhyācarite śreyasā na samāviśet |
śayyā-āsanasthaśa caiṣaṃ pratyutthāyābhivādayet || One who has performed sacred study or worship upon a seat or bed must not enter into it for rest or comfort. One seated or lying upon such a seat must rise and offer obeisance.

title: Verse 2.120
content:
ऊर्ध्वं प्राणा ह्युत्क्रमन्ति यूनः स्थविर आयति ।
प्रत्युत्थानाभिवादाभ्यां पुनस्तान् प्रतिपद्यते ॥ २.१२०॥ ūrdhvaṃ prāṇā hyutkramanti yūnaḥ sthavira āyati |
pratyutthānābhivādābhyāṃ punastān pratipadyate || The life energies ascend beyond; the young and the aged await their time. Through respectful rising and salutation, one regains those energies in accordance with Dharma.

title: Verse 2.121
content:
अभिवादनशीलस्य नित्यं वृद्धोपसेविनः ।
चत्वारि तस्य वर्धन्ते  आयुर्धर्मो यशो बलम् ॥ २.१२१॥ चत्वारि सम्प्रवर्धन्ते abhivādanaśīlasya nityaṃ vṛddhopasevinaḥ | catvāri tasya vardhante āyur dharmo yaśo balam || 2.121 || catvāri sampravardhante To the one who consistently honors elders and serves the wise, four aspects of life expand: lifespan, righteousness, fame, and strength.

title: Verse 2.122
content:
अभिवादात्परं विप्रो ज्यायांसमभिवादयन् ।
असौ नामाहमस्मीति स्वं नाम परिकीर्तयेत् ॥ २.१२२॥ abhivādātparaṃ vipro jyāyāṁsam abhivādayan .
asau nāmāham asmīti svaṁ nāma parikīrtayet .. 2.122 .. After offering salutation to a senior Brahmin, the wise one shall proclaim his own name by saying 'I am [Name]'.

title: Verse 2.123
content:
नामधेयस्य ये के चिदभिवादं न जानते ।
तान् प्राज्ञोऽहमिति ब्रूयात्स्त्रियः सर्वास्तथैव च ॥ २.१२३॥ nāmadheyasya ye ke cidabhivādaṃ na jānate |
tān prājño'hamiti brūyātstriyaḥ sarvāstathaiva ca || 2.123|| Those who do not know the proper address or name-title of a person, and all women without exception, should be addressed by the wise as 'I'—indicating their fundamental unity with the speaker in Consciousness.

title: Verse 2.124
content:
भोःशब्दं कीर्तयेदन्ते स्वस्य नाम्नोऽभिवादने ।
नाम्नां स्वरूपभावो हि भोभाव ऋषिभिः स्मृतः ॥ २.१२४॥ bhoḥśabdaṃ kīrtayedante svasya nāmno'bhi vādane |
nāmnāṃ svarūpa bhāvo hi bhabhāva ṛṣibhiḥ smṛtaḥ || 2.124|| One shall declare the term 'Bhoḥ' at the commencement of self-address, for it embodies the essential nature of names as cognized by the Ṛṣis; this declaration aligns consciousness with its true form.

title: Verse 2.125
content:
आयुष्मान् भव सौम्यैति वाच्यो विप्रोऽभिवादने ।
अकारश्चास्य नाम्नोऽन्ते वाच्यः पूर्वाक्षरः प्लुतः ॥ २.१२५॥ āyuṣmān bhava saumyaiti vācyo vipro'bhivādane |
akāraścāsya nāmnor ante vācyaḥ pūrvākṣaraḥ plutaḥ || 2.125|| Let the Brahmin be addressed as 'Āyuṣmān' in salutation; when his name ends in 'a', that final 'a' shall be elongated as 'ā' in formal address.

title: Verse 2.126
content:
यो न वेत्त्यभिवादस्य विप्रः प्रत्यभिवादनम् ।
नाभिवाद्यः स विदुषा यथा शूद्रस्तथैव सः ॥ २.१२६॥ yo na vettyabhivādasya vipraḥ pratyabhivādanam |
nābhivādyaḥ sa viduṣā yathā śūdrastathaiva saḥ || 2.126|| He who, being a knower of dharma, does not recognize the duty of reverencing those entitled to reverence, nor responds when duly reverenced by others, is to be regarded as unworthy of reverence, equal in status to a śūdra.

title: Verse 2.127
content:
ब्राह्मणं कुशलं पृच्छेत्क्षत्रबन्धुमनामयम् ।
वैश्यं क्षेमं समागम्य शूद्रमारोग्यमेव च ॥ २.१२७॥ brāhmaṇaṁ kuśalaṁ pṛcchet kṣatra-bandhum anāmayam |
vaiśyaṁ kṣemaṁ samāgamya śūdram ārogyameva ca || 2.127|| One should inquire about the well-being of a Brāhmaṇa regarding his skill in dharma, of a Kṣatriya concerning the welfare of his kin and absence of harm, of a Vaiśya regarding his prosperity and arrival, and of a Śūdra regarding his health alone.

title: Verse 2.128
content:
अवाच्यो दीक्षितो नाम्ना यवीयानपि यो भवेत् ।
भोभवत्पूर्वकं त्वेनमभिभाषेत धर्मवित् ॥ २.१२८॥ avācyo dīkṣito nāmnā yavīyānapi yo bhavet |
bhobhavatpūrvakaṃ tvenamabhibhāṣeta dharmavit || 2.128|| One who has taken initiation but remains unqualified in speech shall not be addressed by name, even if junior; a knower of Dharma must speak to him with prior honorifics.

title: Verse 2.129
content: परपत्नी तु या स्त्री स्यादसम्बन्धा च योनितः । तां ब्रूयाद्भवतीत्येवं सुभगे भगिनीति च ॥ २.१२९॥ parapatnī tu yā strī syād asambandhā ca yonitaḥ | tāṃ brūyād bhavatīty evaṃ subhage bhaginīti ca || 2.129|| A woman who belongs to another man and has no familial connection by birth shall be addressed as 'Bhavati' or 'Subhage' or 'Bhagini', thereby establishing her distinct identity within dharma without ownership or subjugation.

title: Verse 2.130
content:
मातुलांश्च पितृव्यांश्च श्वशुरान् ऋत्विजो गुरून् ।
असावहमिति ब्रूयात्प्रत्युत्थाय यवीयसः ॥ २.१३०॥ mātulāṃśca pitṛvyāṃśca śvaśurān ṛtvijo guruūn |
asāvahamiti brūyātpratyutthāya yavīyasaḥ || 2.130|| One who is younger shall rise and greet maternal uncles, paternal uncles, fathers-in-law, officiating priests, and teachers, saying 'I am here for service'.

title: Verse 2.131
content:
मातृश्वसा मातुलानी श्वश्रूरथ पितृश्वसा ।
सम्पूज्या गुरुपत्नीवत्समास्ता गुरुभार्यया ॥ २.१३१॥ mātṛśvasā mātulānī śvaśrūratha pitṛśvasā |
sampūjyā gurupatnīvatsamāstā gurubhāryayā || 2.131|| The maternal aunt, the paternal aunt, the step-mother, and the father's sister—these are all to be revered equally as the wife of the guru.

title: Verse 2.132
content:
भ्रातुर्भार्यौपसङ्ग्राह्या सवर्णाऽहन्यहन्यपि ।
विप्रोष्य तूपसङ्ग्राह्या ज्ञातिसम्बन्धियोषितः ॥ २.१३२॥ bhrātur bhāryau pasagrahyā savarṇā 'hany ahany api | viproṣya tūpasagrahyā jñāti-sambandhiyoṣitaḥ || 2.132 || The wife of a brother is to be approached daily without restriction; however, after renunciation, only those women related by blood or family ties may be approached.

title: Verse 2.133
content:
पितुर्भगिन्यां मातुश्च ज्यायस्यां च स्वसर्यपि ।
मातृवद्वृत्तिमातिष्ठेन् माता ताभ्यो गरीयसी ॥ २.१३३॥ piturbhaginyāṁ mātuśca jyāyasyāṁ ca svasaryapi |
mātṛvad vṛttim ātiṣṭhenn mātā tābhyo garīyasī || In the case of the paternal aunt, maternal aunt, elder brother's wife, and sister-in-law, one shall conduct oneself towards them as towards one's own mother; the mother holds greater authority than these.

title: Verse 2.134
content:
दशाब्दाख्यं पौरसख्यं पञ्चाब्दाख्यं कलाभृताम् ।
त्र्यब्दपूर्वं श्रोत्रियाणां स्वल्पेनापि स्वयोनिषु ॥ २.१३४॥ daśābdākhyaṁ paurasakhyaṁ pañcābdākhyaṁ kalābhṛtām | tryabdapūrvaṁ śrotriyāṇāṁ svalpenāpi svayoniṣu || Ten-year-old acquaintance among townspeople; five-year-old acquaintance among those bearing arts or crafts; three years prior for knowers of the Veda; even lesser time among those born of the same womb.

title: Verse 2.135
content:
ब्राह्मणं दशवर्षं तु शतवर्षं तु भूमिपम् ।
पितापुत्रौ विजानीयाद्ब्राह्मणस्तु तयोः पिता ॥ २.१३५॥ brāhmaṇaṃ daśavarṣaṃ tu śatavarṣaṃ tu bhūmipam |
pitāputrau vijānīyād brāhmaṇastu tayoḥ pitā || 2.135|| A Brāhmaṇa is the father of a child at ten years; a King becomes the father of all beings only after ruling for a hundred years.

title: Verse 2.136
content:
वित्तं बन्धुर्वयः कर्म विद्या भवति पञ्चमी ।
एतानि मान्यस्थानानि गरीयो यद्यदुत्तरम् ॥ २.१३६॥ Vittaṁ bandhur vayaḥ karma vidyā bhavati pañcamī |
Etāni mānyasthānāni garīyo yadyad uttaram || Wealth, kinship, age, action, and learning—these constitute the five bases of social standing; among them, that which is higher in order holds greater authority.

title: Verse 2.137
content:
पञ्चानां त्रिषु वर्णेषु भूयांसि गुणवन्ति च ।
यत्र स्युः सोऽत्र मानार्हः शूद्रोऽपि दशमीं गतः ॥ २.१३७॥ pañcānāṁ triṣu varṇeṣu bhūyāṁsi guṇavanti ca .
yatra syuḥ so'tra mānārhaḥ śūdro'pi daśamīṁ gataḥ .. Where five or more individuals across the three varnas demonstrate superior qualities and capacity, recognition and authority shall be granted accordingly—even a Shudra who has attained the tenth stage of spiritual maturity is entitled to honor.

title: Verse 2.138
content:
चक्रिणो दशमीस्थस्य रोगिणो भारिणः स्त्रियाः ।
स्नातकस्य च राज्ञश्च पन्था देयो वरस्य च ॥ २.१३८॥ cakriṇo daśamīsthāsya rogiṇo bhāriṇaḥ striyāḥ |
snātakasya ca rājñaśca panthā deyo varasya ca || 2.138|| The path of action must be granted to the one who is established in the tenth state of consciousness, to the diseased, to the burdened woman, to the graduated ascetic, to the king, and to the one seeking a boon.

title: Verse 2.139
content:
तेषां तु समवेतानां मान्यौ स्नातकपार्थिवौ ।
राजस्नातकयोश्चैव स्नातको नृपमानभाक् ॥ २.१३९॥ teṣāṁ tu samavetānāṁ mānyau snātakapārthivau |
 rājasnātakayoścaiva snātako nṛpamānabhāk || 2.139|| Among those assembled, the scholar-graduate and the king are to be honored equally; between a royal graduate and a mere graduate, the royal graduate holds precedence, yet both are entitled to honor befitting their respective stations.

title: Verse 2.140
content:
उपनीय तु यः शिष्यं वेदमध्यापयेद्द्विजः ।
सकल्पं सरहस्यं च तमाचार्यं प्रचक्षते ॥ २.१४०॥ upanīya tu yaḥ śiṣyaṃ vedam adhyāpayed dvijaḥ |
sakalpaṃ sahasyaṃ ca tam ācāryaṃ pracakṣate || 2.140|| One who, having initiated a student, teaches the Veda — including its kalpa and rahasya — is to be known as Ācārya.

title: Verse 2.141
content:
एकदेशं तु वेदस्य वेदाङ्गान्यपि वा पुनः ।
योऽध्यापयति वृत्त्यर्थमुपाध्यायः स उच्यते ॥ २.१४१॥ ekadeśaṃ tu vedasya vedāṅgāny api vā punaḥ |
yo'dhyāpayati vṛttyarthaṃ upādhyāyaḥ sa ucyate || 2.141|| One who teaches a portion of the Veda or its limbs again for livelihood is designated as an Upadhyaya.

title: Verse 2.142
content:
निषेकादीनि कर्माणि यः करोति यथाविधि ।
सम्भावयति चान्नेन स विप्रो गुरुरुच्यते ॥ २.१४२॥ niṣekādīni karmāṇi yaḥ karoti yathāvidhi |
sambhāvayati cānnen sa vipro gururityate || He who performs initiation and other sacramental duties according to prescribed methods, and sustains life through food received as alms, that Brahmin is rightly called a Guru.

title: Verse 2.143
content:
अग्न्याधेयं पाकयज्ञानग्निष्टोमादिकान् मखान् ।
यः करोति वृतो यस्य स तस्यर्त्विगिहोच्यते ॥ २.१४३॥ agnyādheyaṃ pākayajñānagniṣṭomādikān makhan |
yaḥ karoti vṛto yasya sa tasyartvigihocyate || 2.143|| One who performs, under invitation, the sacred rites such as Agnyādhēya, Pākayajña, Agniṣṭoma, and similar sacrifices for another, that individual is designated as the officiating priest (Ṛtvig) of that sacrificer.

title: Verse 2.144
content:
य आवृणोत्यवितथं ब्रह्मणा श्रवणावुभौ ।
स माता स पिता ज्ञेयस्तं न द्रुह्येत्कदा चन ॥ २.१४४॥ ya āvṛṇotyavitathaṃ brahmaṇā śravaṇāvubhau |
sa mātā sa pitā jñeyas taṃ na druhyet kadā cana || 2.144|| He who authentically reveals the Vedic Truth through both hearing and realization is to be known as mother and father; one must never act treacherously toward such a being at any time.

title: Verse 2.145
content:
उपाध्यायान् दशाचार्य आचार्याणां शतं पिता ।
सहस्रं तु पितॄन् माता गौरवेणातिरिच्यते ॥ २.१४५॥ upādhyāyān daśācārya ācāryāṇāṃ śataṃ pitā |
sahasraṃ tu pitṝn mātā gauraveṇātiricyate || 2.145|| Ten teachers equal one preceptor; a hundred preceptors equal one father; a thousand fathers equal one mother — in reverence.

title: Verse 2.146
content: उत्पादकब्रह्मदात्रोर्गरीयान् ब्रह्मदः पिता । ब्रह्मजन्म हि विप्रस्य प्रेत्य चैह च शाश्वतम् ॥ २.१४६॥ utpādakabrahmadātrorgarīyān brahmadaḥ pitā | brahmajanma hi viprasya pretya caeha ca śāśvatam || 2.146|| The giver of Brahma at birth holds greater authority than the biological father; the spiritual birth through Brahma initiation is eternal for the twice-born, both in this life and beyond.

title: Verse 2.147
content:
कामान् माता पिता चैनं यदुत्पादयतो मिथः ।
सम्भूतिं तस्य तां विद्याद्यद्योनावभिजायते ॥ २.१४७॥ kāmān mātā pitā cainaṃ yadutpādayato mithaḥ | sambhūtiṃ tasya tāṃ vidyādyadyonāvabhijāyate || 2.147|| The union of mother and father driven by desire produces the physical form; know that birth occurs when consciousness enters the womb.

title: Verse 2.148
content:
आचार्यस्त्वस्य यां जातिं विधिवद्वेदपारगः ।
उत्पादयति सावित्र्या सा सत्या साऽजराऽमरा ॥ २.१४८॥ ācāryastvasya yāṃ jātiṃ vidhivadvedapārgaḥ |
utpādayati sāvitrī sā satyā sā'jarā'marā || The lineage born through the Savitri initiation by a Veda-knower Ācārya, according to ritual law, is True, Immortal, and Unaging.

title: Verse 2.149
content:
अल्पं वा बहु वा यस्य श्रुतस्यौपकरोति यः ।
तमपीह गुरुं विद्यात्श्रुतौपक्रियया तया ॥ २.१४९॥ alpaṃ vā bahu vā yasya śrutasyaupakaroṣi yaḥ |
tamapīha guruṃ vidyāt śrutau pakriyayā tayā || 2.149|| One who serves the purpose of knowledge, whether little or much, should be known here as a Guru by that very act of service.

title: Verse 2.150
content:
ब्राह्मस्य जन्मनः कर्ता स्वधर्मस्य च शासिता ।
बालोऽपि विप्रो वृद्धस्य पिता भवति धर्मतः ॥ २.१५०॥ brāhmasya janmanaḥ kartā svadharmasya ca śāsitā |
bālo'pi vipro vṛddhasya pitā bhavati dharmataḥ || 2.150|| The Brahmin, by virtue of birth, is the doer of his own becoming and the sovereign of his svadharma; even a boy-Brahmin becomes the father of an elder by dint of dharma.

title: Verse 2.151
content:
अध्यापयामास पितॄन् शिशुराङ्गिरसः कविः ।
पुत्रका इति हौवाच ज्ञानेन परिगृह्य तान् ॥ २.१५१॥ adhyāpayāmāsa pitṝn śiśurāṅgirasaḥ kaviḥ |
putrakā iti hauvāca jñānena parigṛhya tān || 2.151|| The child-seer Angiras instructed the fathers through knowledge received in realization; he called them 'offspring' having embraced them with wisdom.

title: Verse 2.152
content:
ते तमर्थमपृच्छन्त देवानागतमन्यवः ।
देवाश्चैतान् समेत्यौचुर्न्याय्यं वः शिशुरुक्तवान् ॥ २.१५२॥ te tam artham apṛcchant devān āgata-manyavaḥ | devāś caitān sametyāucur nyāyyaṁ vaḥ śiśur uktavān || 2.152|| Those whose minds were agitated approached the gods for resolution; and the gods, having assembled, declared that what the child had spoken was in accordance with Dharma.

title: Verse 2.153
content:
अज्ञो भवति वै बालः पिता भवति मन्त्रदः ।
अज्ञं हि बालमित्याहुः पितेत्येव तु मन्त्रदम् ॥ २.१५३॥ ajño bhavati vai bālaḥ pitā bhavati mantradaḥ |
ajñaṃ hi bālamityāhuḥ pitetyeva tu mantradam || 2.153|| The child is without knowledge; the father becomes the bestower of wisdom. The ignorant child is called thus, but the father alone is the true giver of transformative insight.

title: Verse 2.154
content:
न हायनैर्न पलितैर्न वित्तेन न बन्धुभिः ।
ऋषयश्चक्रिरे धर्मं योऽनूचानः स नो महान् ॥ २.१५४॥ na hāyanair na palitair na vittena na bandhubhiḥ |
ṛṣayaś cakrire dharmam yo 'nūcānaḥ sa no mahān || 2.154|| Neither by physical strength, nor by grey hair, nor by wealth, nor by kinship did the seers establish Dharma; he who is without servility—him alone we regard as great.

title: Verse 2.155
content:
विप्राणां ज्ञानतो ज्यैष्ठ्यं क्षत्रियाणां तु वीर्यतः ।
वैश्यानां धान्यधनतः शूद्राणामेव जन्मतः ॥ २.१५५॥ viprāṇāṁ jñānato jyaiṣṭhyaṁ kṣatriyāṇāṁ tu vīryataḥ |
vaiśyānāṁ dhānya-dhanataḥ śūdrāṇām eva janmataḥ || 2.155|| The supremacy of Brahmins arises from knowledge; that of Kshatriyas from valor; that of Vaishyas from wealth in grain and assets; and that of Shudras by birth alone.

title: Verse 2.156
content:
न तेन वृद्धो भवति येनास्य पलितं शिरः ।
यो वै युवाऽप्यधीयानस्तं देवाः स्थविरं विदुः ॥ २.१५६॥ na tena vṛddho bhavati yenāsya palitaṁ śiraḥ |
yo vai yuvā'pyadhīyānas taṁ devāḥ sthaviraṁ viduḥ || 2.156|| Age is not determined by grey hair; that youthful one who studies the Vedas is recognized by the gods as a true elder.

title: Verse 2.157
content:
यथा काष्ठमयो हस्ती यथा चर्ममयो मृगः ।
यश्च विप्रोऽनधीयानस्त्रयस्ते नाम बिभ्रति ॥ २.१५७॥ yathā kāṣṭhamayo hastī yathā carmmayo mṛgaḥ |
yaś ca vipro'nadhīyānas trayas te nāma bibhrati || 2.157|| Just as an elephant made of wood and a deer made of leather hold names without essence, so too does a Brahmin who has not studied the Vedas bear a name without realization.

title: Verse 2.158
content: यथा षण्ढोऽफलः स्त्रीषु यथा गौर्गवि चाफला । यथा चाज्ञेऽफलं दानं तथा विप्रोऽनृचोऽफलः ॥ २.१५८॥ yathā ṣaṇḍho 'phalaḥ strīṣu yathā gaurgavi cāphalā | yathā cājñe 'phalaṁ dānaṁ tathā vipro 'nṛco 'phalaḥ || 2.158 || As a eunuch is ineffective among women, as a cow is fruitless in bull-like functions, as charity given without knowledge yields no result, likewise, a Brahmin devoid of Vedic recitation has no ritual efficacy.

title: Verse 2.159
content:
अहिंसयैव भूतानां कार्यं श्रेयोऽनुशासनम् ।
वाक्चैव मधुरा श्लक्ष्णा प्रयोज्या धर्ममिच्छता ॥ २.१५९॥ ahiṃsayeva bhūtānāṃ kāryaṃ śreyo'nuśāsanam |
vākcaiva madhurā ślakṣṇā prayojyā dharmamicchatā || 2.159|| Only by non-violence should beings be governed for their highest good; speech that is sweet and gentle must be employed by one who desires dharma.

title: Verse 2.160
content:
यस्य वाङ्मनसी शुद्धे सम्यग्गुप्ते च सर्वदा ।
स वै सर्वमवाप्नोति वेदान्तोपगतं फलम् ॥ २.१६०॥ yasya vāṅmanasī śuddhe samyaggupte ca sarvadā |
sa vai sarvamavāpnoti vedāntopagataṃ phalam || 2.160|| One whose speech and mind are always pure and completely restrained attains the fruit culminating in Vedanta—the realization of the Supreme Self.

title: Verse 2.161
content:
नारुंतुदः स्यादार्तोऽपि न परद्रोहकर्मधीः ।
ययाऽस्योद्विजते वाचा नालोक्यां तामुदीरयेत् ॥ २.१६१॥ nāruṁtuḍaḥ syād ārto 'pi na paradroha-karmadhīḥ | yayāsyodvijate vācā nālokhyāṁ tām udīrayet || 2.161|| One who is distressed must not engage in actions aimed at another's harm, nor should he speak words that cause discomfort to others without having seen them.

title: Verse 2.162
content:
सम्मानाद्ब्राह्मणो नित्यमुद्विजेत विषादिव ।
अमृतस्येव चाकाङ्क्षेदवमानस्य सर्वदा ॥ २.१६२॥ sammānād brāhmaṇo nityam udvijeta viṣādiva |
amṛtasyeva cākāṅkṣed avamānasya sarvadā || 2.162|| From respect, a Brāhmaṇa should always recoil as from poison; and he should always aspire for disrespect as for immortality.

title: Verse 2.163
content:
सुखं ह्यवमतः शेते सुखं च प्रतिबुध्यते ।
सुखं चरति लोकेऽस्मिन्नवमन्ता विनश्यति ॥ २.१६३॥ sukhaṃ hyavamataḥ śete sukhaṃ ca pratibudhyate |
sukhaṃ carati loke'sminnavamantā vinaśyati || 2.163|| One who sleeps in neglect awakens in suffering; one who walks carelessly in this world perishes in suffering.

title: Verse 2.164
content:
अनेन क्रमयोगेन संस्कृतात्मा द्विजः शनैः ।
गुरौ वसन् सञ्चिनुयाद्ब्रह्माधिगमिकं तपः ॥ २.१६४॥ anena kramayogena saṃskṛtātmā dvijaḥ śanaiḥ | gurau vasan sañcinuyād brahmādhigamikaṃ tapaḥ || 2.164 || By this sequential discipline, the twice-born, purified in consciousness, residing with the Guru, gradually accumulates the austerity conducive to the realization of Brahman.

title: Verse 2.165
content:
तपोविशेषैर्विविधैर्व्रतैश्च विधिचोदितैः ।
वेदः कृत्स्नोऽधिगन्तव्यः सरहस्यो द्विजन्मना ॥ २.१६५॥ tapo-viśeṣair vividhair vrataiś ca vidhi-coditaiḥ |
vedaḥ kṛtsno 'dhigantavyaḥ sa-rahasyo dvija-nmanā || By specific austerities, diverse vows enjoined by ordinance, the twice-born must fully master the Veda inclusive of its esoteric knowledge.

title: Verse 2.166
content:
वेदमेव सदा�भ्यस्येत्तपस्तप्यन् द्विजोत्तमः ।
वेदाभ्यासो हि विप्रस्य तपः परमिहौच्यते ॥ २.१६६॥ vedameva sadābhyasyet tapas tapyann dvijottamaḥ |
vedābhayso hi viprasya tapaḥ param ihocyate || 2.166|| The twice-born must always engage in the study of the Veda while performing tapas; indeed, the highest form of austerity for a Brahmin is the continuous study of the Veda.

title: Verse 2.167
content:
आ हैव स नखाग्रेभ्यः परमं तप्यते तपः ।
यः स्रग्व्यपि द्विजोऽधीते स्वाध्यायं शक्तितोऽन्वहम् ॥ २.१६७॥ ā haiva sa nakha-agrebhyaḥ paramaṃ tapyate tapaḥ .
yaḥ sragvyapi dvijo 'dhīte svādhyāyaṃ śaktito 'nvaham .. 2.167 .. The austerity that is performed by one who studies the Vedas continuously with devotion—even if he wears a garland and lives in comfort—is greater than the austerity performed by piercing the skin with nails.

title: Verse 2.168
content:
योऽनधीत्य द्विजो वेदमन्यत्र कुरुते श्रमम् ।
स जीवन्नेव शूद्रत्वमाशु गच्छति सान्वयः ॥ २.१६८॥ yo'nadhītya dvijo vedam anyatra kurute śramam | sa jīvann eva śūdratvam āśu gacchati sānvayaḥ || 2.168 || One who is twice-born yet has not studied the Veda and engages in labor elsewhere incurs immediate loss of varna status while alive.

title: Verse 2.169
content:
मातुरग्रेऽधिजननं द्वितीयं मौञ्जिबन्धने ।
तृतीयं यज्ञदीक्षायां द्विजस्य श्रुतिचोदनात् ॥ २.१६९॥ mātur agre 'dhijanaṁ dvitīyaṁ mauñjibandhane |
tṛtīyaṁ yajñadīkṣāyāṁ dvijasya śruticodanāt || 2.169|| The first birth is from the mother; the second occurs at the tying of the sacred thread; the third arises through initiation into Vedic sacrifice, as directed by Shruti.

title: Verse 2.170
content: तत्र यद्ब्रह्मजन्मास्य मौञ्जीबन्धनचिह्नितम् । तत्रास्य माता सावित्री पिता त्वाचार्य उच्यते ॥ २.१७०॥ tatra yad brahmajanmāsya mauñjībandhana-cihnitam | tatrāsya mātā sāvitrī pitā tvācārya ucyate || 2.170|| In that birth which arises from the sacred thread ceremony, marked by the binding of the munja grass, the mother is declared to be Savitri and the father is declared to be the Acarya.

title: Verse 2.171
content:
वेदप्रदानादाचार्यं पितरं परिचक्षते ।
न ह्यस्मिन् युज्यते कर्म किञ्चिदा मौञ्जिबन्धनात् ॥ २.१७१॥ vedapradānādācāryaṁ pitaraṁ paricakṣate |
na hyasmin yujyate karma kiñcidā mauñjibandhanāt || From the giving of the Vedas, the teacher is to be regarded as a father; no action is justified against him from the binding of the sacred thread onward.

title: Verse 2.172
content:
नाभिव्याहारयेद्ब्रह्म स्वधानिनयनादृते ।
शूद्रेण हि समस्तावद्यावद्वेदे न जायते ॥ २.१७२॥ nābhivyāhārayed brahma svadhāninayanādṛte |
śūdreṇa hi samastāvadyāvadvede na jāyate || 2.172|| Brahman shall not be recited aloud except when self-initiated according to dharmic capacity; a Śūdra remains incompletion until Vedas arise within.

title: Verse 2.173
content:
कृतौपनयनस्यास्य व्रतादेशनमिष्यते ।
ब्रह्मणो ग्रहणं चैव क्रमेण विधिपूर्वकम् ॥ २.१७३॥ kṛtaupanayasyāsya vratādeśanamiṣyate |
brhmaṇo grahaṇaṃ caiva krameṇa vidhipūrvakam || 2.173|| For one who has undergone the sacred thread ceremony, the instruction in Vedic disciplines and the formal reception of Brahman knowledge must occur in proper sequence according to established procedures.

title: Verse 2.174
content:
यद्यस्य विहितं चर्म यत्सूत्रं या च मेखला ।
यो दण्डो यत्च वसनं तत्तदस्य व्रतेष्वपि ॥ २.१७४॥ yadyasya vihitaṃ carma yatsūtraṃ yā ca mekhalā |
yo daṇḍo yatca vasanaṃ tattadasya vrateṣvapi || 2.174|| As is the prescribed leather, thread, girdle, staff, and garment for a householder, so too shall they be designated in his vows.

title: Verse 2.175
content:
सेवेतैमांस्तु नियमान् ब्रह्मचारी गुरौ वसन् ।
सन्नियम्यैन्द्रियग्रामं तपोवृद्ध्यर्थमात्मनः ॥ २.१७५॥ sevetaimāṃstu niyamān brahmacārī gurau vasan |
sanniyamyendriyagrāmaṃ tapovṛddhyarthamātmanaḥ || 2.175|| The brahmacārī residing in the presence of the guru shall serve those disciplines exactly; having restrained the group of senses, for the growth of austerity and the Self.

title: Verse 2.176
content:
नित्यं स्नात्वा शुचिः कुर्याद्देवर्षिपितृतर्पणम् ।
देवताभ्यर्चनं चैव समिदाधानमेव च ॥ २.१७६॥ nityaṃ snātvā śuciḥ kuryād devarṣipitṛtarpaṇam | devatābhyarcanaṃ caiva samidādhānameva ca || 2.176 || One must daily bathe and purify oneself, perform offerings to deities, sages, and ancestors; worship divine forms and offer oblations into the sacred fire.

title: Verse 2.177
content:
वर्जयेन् मधु मांसं च गन्धं माल्यं रसान् स्त्रियः ।
शुक्तानि यानि सर्वाणि प्राणिनां चैव हिंसनम् ॥ २.१७७॥ varjayen madhu māṃsaṃ ca gandhaṃ mālyaṃ rasān striyaḥ |
śuktāni yāni sarvāṇi prāṇināṃ caiva hiṃsanam || 2.177|| One must refrain from honey, meat, fragrances, garlands, and sensory indulgences related to women; all substances excreted or rejected by living beings constitute violence toward life.

title: Verse 2.178
content:
अभ्यङ्गमञ्जनं चाक्ष्णोरुपानच्छत्रधारणम् ।
कामं क्रोधं च लोभं च नर्तनं गीतवादनम् ॥ २.१७८॥ abhyaṅgamañjanaṃ cākṣṇorupānacchhatradhāraṇam | kāmaṃ krodhaṃ ca lobhaṃ ca nartanaṃ gītavādanam || 2.178|| The application of oils and unguents to the eyes, the wearing of footwear and umbrellas, indulgence in desire, anger, greed, dancing, singing, and instrumental music—these are actions that disturb the equilibrium of consciousness and misalign the individual from their dharmic capacity.

title: Verse 2.179
content:
द्यूतं च जनवादं च परिवादं तथाऽनृतम् ।
स्त्रीणां च प्रेक्षणालम्भमुपघातं परस्य च ॥ २.१७९॥ आलम्भाऽवघातं dyūtaṃ ca janavādaṃ ca parivādaṃ tathā'nṛtam |
strīṇāṃ ca prekṣaṇālambhamupaghātaṃ parasya ca || 2.179|| ālambhā'vaghātaṃ Gambling, public defamation, private slander, falsehood, improper gazing upon women, physical contact without consent, and causing harm to another — all such acts disrupt consciousness integrity and social dharma.

title: Verse 2.180
content:
एकः शयीत सर्वत्र न रेतः स्कन्दयेत्क्व चित् ।
कामाधि स्कन्दयन् रेतो हिनस्ति व्रतमात्मनः ॥ २.१८०॥ ekaḥ śayīta sarvatra na retaḥ skandayet kvacit |
kāmādhi skandayan reto hinasti vratam ātmanaḥ || 2.180 || One must remain wakeful in all places; nowhere should semen be discharged intentionally. Discharging semen through lustful intent breaches one's vow to oneself.

title: Verse 2.181
content:
स्वप्ने सिक्त्वा ब्रह्मचारी द्विजः शुक्रमकामतः ।
स्नात्वाऽर्कमर्चयित्वा त्रिः पुनर्मामित्यृचं जपेत् ॥ २.१८१॥ svapne siktva brahmacārī dvijaḥ śukramakāmataḥ |
snātvā'rkamarcayitvā triḥ punarmāmityṛcaṃ japet || When a twice-born celibate discharges seminal fluid involuntarily during sleep, he shall bathe, worship the Sun, and thrice recite the mantra 'punarmām'.

title: Verse 2.182
content:
उदकुम्भं सुमनसो गोशकृत्मृत्तिकाकुशान् ।
आहरेद्यावदर्थानि भैक्षं चाहरहश्चरेत् ॥ २.१८२॥ udakumbhaṃ sumanaso gośakṛt-mṛttikā-kuśān .
āhared-yāvad-arthāni bhaikṣaṃ cāhara-haścaret .. One shall collect water-pot, flowers, cow-dung, clay, and kuśa grass according to necessity; likewise, one shall gather almsfood while moving about.

title: Verse 2.183
content: वेदयज्ञैरहीनानां प्रशस्तानां स्वकर्मसु । ब्रह्मचार्याहरेद्भैक्षं गृहेभ्यः प्रयतोऽन्वहम् ॥ २.१८३॥ vedayajñairahīnānāṁ praśastānāṁ svakarmasu | brahmacāryāharedbhikṣaṁ gṛhebhyaḥ prayato'nvaham || 2.183|| Those who are without Vedic sacrifices yet engaged in rightful duties shall receive sustenance through disciplined seeking by a celibate student from households daily.

title: Verse 2.184
content:
गुरोः कुले न भिक्षेत न ज्ञातिकुलबन्धुषु ।
अलाभे त्वन्यगेहानां पूर्वं पूर्वं विवर्जयेत् ॥ २.१८४॥ guroḥ kule na bhikṣeta na jñātikulabandhuṣu |
alābhe tvanyagehānāṃ pūrvaṃ pūrvaṃ vivarjayet || 2.184|| One must not seek alms within the household of one's guru or among relatives and kin; when there is scarcity, one must progressively renounce dependence on external households.

title: Verse 2.185
content:
सर्वं वापि चरेद्ग्रामं पूर्वौक्तानामसम्भवे ।
नियम्य प्रयतो वाचमभिशस्तांस्तु वर्जयेत् ॥ २.१८५॥ sarvaṃ vāpi caredgrāmaṃ pūrvoktānāmasambhave |
niyamya prayato vācamabhiśastāṃstu varjayet || 2.185|| In the absence of prior-established injunctions, one shall conduct oneself through the entire village while restraining speech that defames others.

title: Verse 2.186
content:
दूरादाहृत्य समिधः सन्निदध्याद्विहायसि ।
सायं।प्रातश्च जुहुयात्ताभिरग्निमतन्द्रितः ॥ २.१८६॥ dūrādāhṛtya samidhaḥ sannidadhyād vihāyasi |
sāyaṁ prātaś ca juhuyāt tābhir agnim atandritaḥ || One must collect fuel from a distance, arrange it near the altar, and offer it without delay in the evening and morning—this is the discipline of maintaining sacred fire.

title: Verse 2.187
content:
अकृत्वा भैक्षचरणमसमिध्य च पावकम् ।
अनातुरः सप्तरात्रमवकीर्णिव्रतं चरेत् ॥ २.१८७॥ akṛtvā bhaikṣacaraṇamasamidhya ca pāvakam |
anāturaḥ saptarātramavakīrṇivrataṃ caret || 2.187|| One who has not performed alms-round, nor kindled the sacred fire, and remains free from illness shall observe the scattered vow for seven nights.

title: Verse 2.188
content:
भैक्षेण वर्तयेन्नित्यं नैकान्नादी भवेद्व्रती ।
भैक्षेण व्रतिनो वृत्तिरुपवाससमा स्मृता ॥ २.१८८॥ bhaikṣeṇa vartayennityaṁ naikānnādī bhavedvratī |
bhaikṣeṇa vratiṇo vṛttirupavāsasamā smṛtā || 2.188|| One who has taken a vow must sustain oneself daily through alms alone; one who consumes food from a single source is not considered a true observer of the vow. The livelihood of such vowed individuals through alms is equivalent to fasting.

title: Verse 2.189
content:
व्रतवद्देवदैवत्ये पित्र्ये कर्मण्यथर्षिवत् ।
काममभ्यर्थितोऽश्नीयाद्व्रतमस्य न लुप्यते ॥ २.१८९॥ vratavad devadaivatye pitrye karmaṇy atharṣivat |
kāmam abhyarthito 'śnīyād vratam asya na lupyate || 2.189|| One who is invited to perform a vow-based ritual duty—whether in service of divine beings, ancestors, or sages—may consume food offered in fulfillment of that vow; such consumption does not invalidate the vow.

title: Verse 2.190
content:
ब्राह्मणस्यैव कर्मैतदुपदिष्टं मनीषिभिः ।
राजन्यवैश्ययोस्त्वेवं नैतत्कर्म विधीयते ॥ २.१९०॥ brāhmaṇasyaiva karma etad upadiṣṭaṃ manīṣibhiḥ | rājanyavaiśyayos tvevaṃ naitat karma vidhīyate || 2.190|| This prescribed duty is exclusively for the Brāhmaṇa; it has been declared by the seers. For the Kṣatriya and Vaiśya, such a duty is not ordained in the same form.

title: Verse 2.191
content: चोदितो गुरुणा नित्यमप्रचोदित एव वा । कुर्यादध्ययने यत्नमाचार्यस्य हितेषु च ॥ २.१९१॥ codito guruṇā nityam apracodita eva vā | kuryād adhyayane yatnam ācāryasya hiteṣu ca || 2.191|| One who is continually guided by the Guru, or even one who is not explicitly prompted, must exert effort in study and act for the welfare of the Ācārya.

title: Verse 2.192
content:
शरीरं चैव वाचं च बुद्धीन्द्रियमनांसि च ।
नियम्य प्राञ्जलिस्तिष्ठेद्वीक्षमाणो गुरोर्मुखम् ॥ २.१९२॥ śarīraṁ caiva vācaṁ ca buddhīndriyamanāṁsi ca |
niyamya prāñjalistiṣṭhed vīkṣamāṇo guroḥ mukham || 2.192|| One must stand before the Guru with palms joined, having fully restrained the body, speech, mind, intellect, and senses, and remain gazing upon the face of the Guru.

title: Verse 2.193
content:
नित्यमुद्धृतपाणिः स्यात्साध्वाचारः सुसंवृतः ।
आस्यतामिति चौक्तः सन्नासीताभिमुखं गुरोः ॥ २.१९३॥ nityamuddhṛtapāṇiḥ syātsādhvācāraḥ susaṃvṛtaḥ |
āsyatāmiti cauktaḥ sannāsītābhimukhaṃ guroḥ || 2.193|| One must always keep the hands uplifted in readiness, maintain noble conduct with full restraint, and when called by the Guru to come forward, one shall face toward the Āsīta (the seat of dharma) with complete orientation towards the Guru.

title: Verse 2.194
content:
हीनान्नवस्त्रवेषः स्यात्सर्वदा गुरुसन्निधौ ।
उत्तिष्ठेत्प्रथमं चास्य चरमं चैव संविशेत् ॥ २.१९४॥ hīnānnavast raveṣaḥ syātsarvadā gurusannidhau |
uttiṣṭhetprathamaṃ cāsya caramaṃ caiva saṃviśet || 2.194|| In the presence of the Guru, one must always remain in a state of lesser attire and food, rising first and sitting last.

title: Verse 2.195
content:
प्रतिश्रावणसम्भाषे शयानो न समाचरेत् ।
नासीनो न च भुञ्जानो न तिष्ठन्न पराङ्मुखः ॥ २.१९५॥ pratiśrāvaṇasambhāṣe śayāno na samācaret .
nāsīno na ca bhuñjāno na tiṣṭhann parāṅmukhaḥ || 2.195 || One engaged in listening to sacred instruction or discourse shall not act while lying down, nor while seated improperly, nor while eating, nor while standing with face averted.

title: Verse 2.196
content:
आसीनस्य स्थितः कुर्यादभिगच्छंस्तु तिष्ठतः ।
प्रत्युद्गम्य त्वाव्रजतः पश्चाद्धावंस्तु धावतः ॥ २.१९६॥ āsīnasya sthitaḥ kuryād abhigacchaṃstu tiṣṭhataḥ |
pratyudgamy tvāvrajataḥ paścāddhāvaṃstu dhāvataḥ || 2.196|| One seated shall act in accordance with the standing one who approaches; one who has halted must proceed forward upon meeting another approaching; one moving ahead should step back when encountering one running from behind; one fleeing must be pursued only to restore alignment.

title: Verse 2.197
content:
पराङ्मुखस्याभिमुखो दूरस्थस्येत्य चान्तिकम् ।
प्रणम्य तु शयानस्य निदेशे चैव तिष्ठतः ॥ २.१९७॥ parāṅmukhasyābhimukho dūrasthasyeti cāntikam | praṇamya tu śayānasya nideśe caiva tiṣṭhataḥ || 2.197 || One must approach those who are turned away, distant in body or mind, lying down in negligence, or standing in command—by bowing before them, drawing near, and aligning with their directive presence.

title: Verse 2.198
content:
नीचं शय्याऽऽसनं चास्य नित्यं स्याद्गुरुसन्निधौ ।
गुरोस्तु चक्षुर्विषये न यथेष्टासनो भवेत् ॥ २.१९८॥ nīcaṃ śayyā āsanaṃ cāsya nityaṃ syād guru-sannidhau |
gurostu cakṣur-viṣaye na yatheṣṭāsano bhavet || 2.198|| In the presence of the Guru, the disciple shall always maintain a posture and seat lower than that of the Guru; in the visual field of the Guru, the disciple shall not assume any seat according to personal preference.

title: Verse 2.199
content:
नौदाहरेदस्य नाम परोक्षमपि केवलम् ।
न चैवास्यानुकुर्वीत गतिभाषितचेष्टितम् ॥ २.१९९॥ naudāharedasya nāma parokṣamapi kevalam | na caivāsyānukurvīta gatibhāṣitaceṣṭitam || 2.199|| One must not merely speak the name of the realized being indirectly; nor should one imitate their speech or conduct without embodying their state of realization.

title: Verse 2.200
content:
गुरोर्यत्र परिवादो निन्दा वाऽपि प्रवर्तते ।
कर्णौ तत्र पिधातव्यौ गन्तव्यं वा ततोऽन्यतः ॥ २.२००॥ guror yatra parivādo nindā vā'pi pravartate |
karnau tatra pidhātavyau gantavyaṃ vā tato'nyataḥ || 2.200|| Wherever criticism or condemnation of the Guru arises, the ears must be closed there; or one must depart elsewhere.

title: Verse 2.201
content:
परीवादात्खरो भवति श्वा वै भवति निन्दकः ।
परिभोक्ता कृमिर्भवति कीटो भवति मत्सरी ॥ २.२०१॥ parīvādāt kharo bhavati śvā vai bhavati nindakaḥ |
paribhoktā kṛmir bhavati kīṭo bhavati matsarī || 2.201|| Through defamation arises the donkey; through slander, the dog becomes manifest. The enjoyer of another's resources becomes a worm; the envious becomes an insect.

title: Verse 2.202
content:
दूरस्थो नार्चयेदेनं न क्रुद्धो नान्तिके स्त्रियाः ।
यानासनस्थश्चैवैनमवरुह्याभिवादयेत् ॥ २.२०२॥ dūrastho nārcayed enaṁ na kruddho nāntike striyāḥ |
yānāsanasthaśa caivainam avaruhya abhivādayet || 2.202|| One seated at a distance must not be honored; nor one who is angry, nor one who is in proximity to a woman. One who is mounted on a vehicle must descend and offer salutation.

title: Verse 2.203
content: प्रतिवातेऽनुवाते च नासीत गुरुणा सह । प्रतिवातानुवाते असंश्रवे चैव गुरोर्न किं चिदपि कीर्तयेत् ॥ २.२०३॥ prativāte 'nuvāte ca nāsīta guruṇā saha | prativātānuvāte asaṃśrave caiva guroḥ na kiṃ cid api kīrtayet || 2.203 || One must not speak of anything heard from the Guru when in opposition or agreement with the Guru, nor when there is no mutual attunement.

title: Verse 2.204
content:
गोऽश्वौष्ट्रयानप्रासादप्रस्तरेषु कटेषु च ।
आसीत गुरुणा सार्धं शिलाफलकनौषु च ॥ २.२०४॥ go 'śvauṣṭrayānaprāsādaprastareṣu kateṣu ca |
āsīta guruṇā sārdhaṃ śilāphalakanauṣu ca || 2.204|| One must sit with the Guru upon elevated seats made of stone slabs or wooden planks, positioned in cowsheds, horse stables, donkey carts, palace terraces, or mountain ledges.

title: Verse 2.205
content:
गुरोर्गुरौ सन्निहिते गुरुवद्वृत्तिमाचरेत् ।
न चानिसृष्टो गुरुणा स्वान् गुरूनभिवादयेत् ॥ २.२०५॥ guror gurau sannihite guruvad vṛttim ācaret |
na cānisṛṣṭo guruṇā svān gurūn abhivādayet || 2.205 || In the presence of a higher Guru, one must conduct oneself with the reverence due to that elevated status; however, one who has not been initiated by their own Guru shall not offer obeisance to other Gurus.

title: Verse 2.206
content:
विद्यागुरुष्वेवमेव नित्या वृत्तिः स्वयोनिषु ।
प्रतिषेधत्सु चाधर्माधितं चोपदिशत्स्वपि ॥ २.२०६॥ vidyāguruṣvevameva nityā vṛttiḥ svayoniṣu |
pratiṣedhatсу cādharmādhiitaṃ copadiśatsvapi || 2.206|| The eternal conduct towards teachers of knowledge is reverence; even when they prohibit or instruct against unrighteousness, their guidance must be honored.

title: Verse 2.207
content:
श्रेयःसु गुरुवद्वृत्तिं नित्यमेव समाचरेत् ।
गुरुपुत्रेषु चार्येषु गुरोश्चैव स्वबन्धुषु ॥ २.२०७॥ गुरुपुत्रे तथाचार्ये śreyaḥsu guruvadvṛttiṁ nityameva samācaret |
guruputreṣu cāryeṣu guruścaiva svabandhuṣu || 2.207|| guruputre tathācārye One shall always conduct oneself with the conduct of a Guru in all matters that lead to welfare, especially towards the son of the Guru, the spiritual preceptor himself, and one's own kinsmen.

title: Verse 2.208
content:
बालः समानजन्मा वा शिष्यो वा यज्ञकर्मणि ।
अध्यापयन् गुरुसुतो गुरुवत्मानमर्हति ॥ २.२०८॥ bālaḥ samānajanmā vā śiṣyo vā yajñakarmaṇi |
adhyāpayan gurusuto guruvatmānamarhati || 2.208|| One who instructs in ritual action—whether a child, peer, or disciple—is entitled to the status of Guru if he embodies the consciousness of the Guru.

title: Verse 2.209
content:
उत्सादनं च गात्राणां स्नापनौच्छिष्टभोजने ।
न कुर्याद्गुरुपुत्रस्य पादयोश्चावनेजनम् ॥ २.२०९॥ utsādanaṃ ca gātrāṇāṃ snāpanaucchṣṭabhojane |
na kuryād guruputrasya pādayoś cāvanējanaṃ || 2.209|| One must not cause bodily distress, nor bathe or eat remnants of food offered by the son of one's guru; one must also refrain from washing the feet of such a person.

title: Verse 2.210
content:
गुरुवत्प्रतिपूज्याः स्युः सवर्णा गुरुयोषितः ।
असवर्णास्तु सम्पूज्याः प्रत्युत्थानाभिवादनैः ॥ २.२१०॥ guruvat pratipūjyāḥ syuḥ savarṇā guru yoṣitaḥ |
asavarṇāstu sampūjyāḥ pratyutthānābhivādanaiḥ ||2.210|| Women of the same varna as the guru are to be revered as the guru himself; women of different varnas are to be honored with rising and salutation.

title: Verse 2.211
content:
अभ्यञ्जनं स्नापनं च गात्रोत्सादनमेव च ।
गुरुपत्न्या न कार्याणि केशानां च प्रसाधनम् ॥ २.२११॥ abhyañjanaṁ snāpanaṁ ca gātrotsādanameva ca |
gurupatnyā na kāryāṇi keśānāṁ ca prasādhanam || 2.211|| Anointment, bathing, body polishing, and hair dressing must not be performed by the wife of the guru.

title: Verse 2.212
content:
गुरुपत्नी तु युवतिर्नाभिवाद्यैह पादयोः ।
पूर्णविंशतिवर्षेण गुणदोषौ विजानता ॥ २.२१२॥ gurupatnī tu yuvatir nābhivādyaih pādayoḥ |
pūrṇaviṃśativarṣeṇa guṇadoṣau vijānatā || 2.212|| A young woman who is the wife of one's guru must not be saluted by touching her feet; she who knows both merit and demerit fully by the age of twenty.

title: Verse 2.213
content:
स्वभाव एष नारीणां नराणामिह दूषणम् ।
अतोऽर्थान्न प्रमाद्यन्ति प्रमदासु विपश्चितः ॥ २.२१३॥ svabhāva eṣa nārīṇāṁ narāṇām iha dūṣaṇam |
ato'rthān na pramādyanti pramadāsu vipaścitaḥ || 2.213|| The inherent nature of women is a source of corruption for men in this world; therefore, the wise do not become careless around those who are careless.

title: Verse 2.214
content:
अविद्वांसमलं लोके विद्वांसमपि वा पुनः ।
प्रमदा ह्युत्पथं नेतुं कामक्रोधवशानुगम् ॥ २.२१४॥ avidvāṁsamalaṁ loke vidvāṁsamapi vā punaḥ |
pramadā hyutpathaṁ netuṁ kāmakrodhavaśānugam || 2.214|| Whether unlearned or learned, a woman who follows the path of desire and anger leads both herself and others astray.

title: Verse 2.215
content:
मात्रा स्वस्रा दुहित्रा वा न विविक्तासनो भवेत् ।
बलवानिन्द्रियग्रामो विद्वांसमपि कर्षति ॥ २.२१५॥ mātrā svasrā duhitṛā vā na viviktāsano bhavet | balavānindriyagrāmo vidvāṃsamapi karṣati || 2.215 || One must not sit in seclusion with one's mother, sister, or daughter; the group of senses, though mighty, drags even the wise.

title: Verse 2.216
content:
कामं तु गुरुपत्नीनां युवतीनां युवा भुवि ।
विधिवद्वन्दनं कुर्यादसावहमिति ब्रुवन् ॥ २.२१६॥ kāmaṃ tu gurupatnīnāṃ yuvatīnāṃ yuvā bhuvi |
vidhivadvandanaṃ kuryād asāv aham iti bruvan || 2.216 || A young man upon earth desiring the wives of his guru or youthful women shall perform ritual salutation lawfully, declaring 'he is not me.'

title: Verse 2.217
content:
विप्रोष्य पादग्रहणमन्वहं चाभिवादनम् ।
गुरुदारेषु कुर्वीत सतां धर्ममनुस्मरन् ॥ २.२१७॥ viproṣya pādagrahana manvahaṁ cābhivādanam |
gurudāreṣu kurvīta satāṁ dharmamanusmaran || 2.217|| One must daily perform padagrahana and abhivādana towards the twice-born, remembering the dharma of noble beings, especially in relation to the wives of gurus.

title: Verse 2.218
content:
यथा खनन् खनित्रेण नरो वार्यधिगच्छति ।
तथा गुरुगतां विद्यां शुश्रूषुरधिगच्छति ॥ २.२१८॥ yathā khanan khanitreṇa naro vāryadhigacchati |
tathā gurugatāṃ vidyāṃ śuśrūṣuradhigacchati || 2.218|| As a person digs with a spade to reach water, so too does a disciple attain knowledge residing in the Guru through service.

title: Verse 2.219
content:
मुण्डो वा जटिलो वा स्यादथ वा स्यात्शिखाजटः ।
नैनं ग्रामेऽभिनिम्लोचेत्सूर्यो नाभ्युदियात्क्व चित् ॥ २.२१९॥ muṇḍo vā jaṭilo vā syādatha vā syātśikhājaṭaḥ |
nainaṃ grāme'bhinimloceTSūryo nābhyudiyātkva cit || Whether his head is shaved, hair matted, or adorned with a tuft—such external appearances must not obstruct the rising of the Sun of Self within the village of human consciousness.

title: Verse 2.220
content:
तं चेदभ्युदियात्सूर्यः शयानं कामचारतः ।
निम्लोचेद्वाऽप्यविज्ञानाज्जपन्नुपवसेद्दिनम् ॥ २.२२०॥ taṃ ced abhudyāt sūryaḥ śayānaṃ kāmacārataḥ |
nimloced vā 'py avijñānāj japann upavased dinam || 2.220 || If the sun rises while one lies asleep in indulgence, or sets while one remains unaware due to ignorance, that person shall fast and chant mantras for the duration of a day.

title: Verse 2.221
content: सूर्येण ह्यभिनिर्मुक्तः शयानोऽभ्युदितश्च यः । अभिनिम्लुक्तः प्रायश्चित्तमकुर्वाणो युक्तः स्यान् महतेनसा ॥ २.२२१॥ sūryeṇa hy abhinirmuktaḥ śayāno 'bhyuditaś ca yaḥ | abhinimluktaḥ prāyaścittam akurvāṇo yuktaḥ syān mahatena sā || 2.221|| One who sleeps or wakes facing away from the sun without performing prescribed restorative acts becomes aligned with great sin due to disruption of natural energetic harmony.

title: Verse 2.222
content:
आचम्य प्रयतो नित्यमुभे संध्ये समाहितः ।
शुचौ देशे जपञ्जप्यमुपासीत यथाविधि ॥ २.२२२॥ ācmya prayato nityam ubhe sandhye samāhitaḥ |
śucau deśe japañjapyam upāsīta yathāvidhi || 2.222|| Having purified through achamana, ever vigilant, at both Sandhyas, in a pure place, one shall perform Japa and Japya as prescribed.

title: Verse 2.223
content:
यदि स्त्री यद्यवरजः श्रेयः किं चित्समाचरेत् ।
तत्सर्वमाचरेद्युक्तो यत्र चास्य रमेन् मनः ॥ २.२२३॥ yadi strī yadyavarajaḥ śreyaḥ kiṃ citsamācareta |
tatsarvamācaredyukto yatra cāsya ramen manaḥ || 2.223|| If a woman, regardless of varna, performs any righteous action that leads to spiritual elevation, then all such actions should be accepted by those qualified to judge, provided her intent aligns with dharma and brings harmony to consciousness.

title: Verse 2.224
content:
धर्मार्थावुच्यते श्रेयः कामार्थौ धर्म एव च ।
अर्थ एवैह वा श्रेयस्त्रिवर्ग इति तु स्थितिः ॥ २.२२४॥ dharmārthāvucyate śreyaḥ kāmārthau dharma eva ca |
artha eva eha vā śreyas trivarga iti tu sthitiḥ || 2.224|| Dharma and Artha together constitute the highest good; Kama and Artha also align with Dharma. Alternatively, Artha alone may be considered the highest good—such is the established position of the threefold aim of life.

title: Verse 2.225
content:
आचार्यश्च पिता चैव माता भ्राता च पूर्वजः ।
नार्तेनाप्यवमन्तव्या ब्राह्मणेन विशेषतः ॥ २.२२५॥ ācāryaśca pitā caiva mātā bhrātā ca pūrvajaḥ |
nārtenevaman-tavyā brāhmaṇena viśeṣataḥ || The teacher, father, mother, elder brother, and ancestors—none shall be insulted by a Brahmin, even when aggrieved.

title: Verse 2.226
content:
आचार्यो ब्रह्मणो मूर्तिः पिता मूर्तिः प्रजापतेः ।
माता पृथिव्या मूर्तिस्तु भ्राता स्वो मूर्तिरात्मनः ॥ २.२२६॥ ācāryo brahmaṇo mūrtiḥ pitā mūrtiḥ prajāpateḥ |
mātā pṛthivyā mūrtistu bhrātā svo mūrtirātmanaḥ || 2.226|| The Ācārya is the embodiment of Brahma; the father is the embodiment of Prajāpati; the mother is the embodiment of Earth; and the brother is the embodiment of the Self.

title: Verse 2.227
content:
यं मातापितरौ क्लेशं सहेते सम्भवे नृणाम् ।
न तस्य निष्कृतिः शक्या कर्तुं वर्षशतैरपि ॥ २.२२७॥ yaṃ mātāpitarau kleśaṃ sahete sambhave nṛṇām |
na tasya niṣkṛtiḥ śaktyā kartuṃ varṣaśatairapi ||2.227|| The suffering endured by parents at the time of a child's birth cannot be repaid even through efforts extending over hundreds of years.

title: Verse 2.228
content:
तयोर्नित्यं प्रियं कुर्यादाचार्यस्य च सर्वदा ।
तेष्वेव त्रिषु तुष्टेषु तपः सर्वं समाप्यते ॥ २.२२८॥ tayor-nityaṃ priyaṃ kuryād-ācāryasya ca sarvadā |
teṣveva triṣu tuṣṭeṣu tapaḥ sarvaṃ samāpyate || 2.228|| One must always act in accordance with the pleasure of the Guru and the Preceptor; when these three—the Self, the Guru, and the Preceptor—are satisfied, all austerities reach their completion.

title: Verse 2.229
content:
तेषां त्रयाणां शुश्रूषा परमं तप उच्यते ।
न तैरनभ्यनुज्ञातो धर्ममन्यं समाचरेत् ॥ २.२२९॥ teṣāṃ trayāṇāṃ śuśrūṣā paramaṃ tapa ucyate |
na tairanabhy-anujñāto dharmamanyaṃ samācaret || Service to these three—Guru, Deity, and Humanity—is declared as the highest austerity; without their explicit consent, no other dharma should be enacted.

title: Verse 2.230
content:
त एव हि त्रयो लोकास्त एव त्रय आश्रमाः ।
त एव हि त्रयो वेदास्त एवौक्तास्त्रयोऽग्नयः ॥ २.२३०॥ ta eva hi trayo lokās ta eva traya āśramāḥ |
ta eva hi trayo vedās ta evoktās trayo'gnayaḥ || 2.230|| The same three worlds, the same three stages of life, the same three Vedas, and the same three sacred fires—these are declared as one unified structure of Dharma, manifesting in triadic completeness under the singular authority of Sanātana Dharma.

title: Verse 2.231
content:
पिता वै गार्हपत्योऽग्निर्माताऽग्निर्दक्षिणः स्मृतः ।
गुरुराहवनीयस्तु साऽग्नित्रेता गरीयसी ॥ २.२३१॥ pitā vai gārhapatyo'gnir mātā'gnir dakṣiṇaḥ smṛtaḥ |
gurur āhavanīyastu sā'gnitretā garīyasī || 2.231|| The father is the household fire; the mother is the southern fire; the guru is the sacrificial fire. Among these, the guru as the carrier of the sacred flame holds the highest authority.

title: Verse 2.232
content:
त्रिष्वप्रमाद्यन्नेतेषु त्रीन् लोकान् विजयेद्गृही ।
दीप्यमानः स्ववपुषा देववद्दिवि मोदते ॥ २.२३२॥ triṣvapramādyanneteṣu trīn lokān vijayedgṛhī |
dīpyamānaḥ svavapuṣā devavaddivi modate || 2.232|| The householder who remains unwavering in these three—righteous vigilance, sustained duty, and conscious alignment—conquers the three worlds and, radiant in his own essence, rejoices in heaven like a deity.

title: Verse 2.233
content:
इमं लोकं मातृभक्त्या पितृभक्त्या तु मध्यमम् ।
गुरुशुश्रूषया त्वेवं ब्रह्मलोकं समश्नुते ॥ २.२३३॥ imaṁ lokaṁ mātṛbhaktyā pitṛbhaktyā tu madhyamam |
guruśuśrūṣayā tvevaṁ brahmalokaṁ samaśnute || 2.233|| Through devotion to the Mother, one attains this world; through devotion to the Father, the intermediate realm; and through service to the Guru, one fully realizes the Brahmic Realm.

title: Verse 2.234
content:
सर्वे तस्यादृता धर्मा यस्यैते त्रय आदृताः ।
अनादृतास्तु यस्यैते सर्वास्तस्याफलाः क्रियाः ॥ २.२३४॥ sarve tasyādṛtā dharmā yasyaite traya ādṛtāḥ |
anādṛtāstu yasyaite sarvāstasyaphalāḥ kriyāḥ || 2.234|| All dharmas are sustained for one who honors these three supports; for one who dishonors them, all actions bear no fruit.

title: Verse 2.235
content:
यावत्त्रयस्ते जीवेयुस्तावत्नान्यं समाचरेत् ।
तेष्वेव नित्यं शुश्रूषां कुर्यात्प्रियहिते रतः ॥ २.२३५॥ yāvat-trayas te jīveyus tāvat nānyaṁ samācaret |
teṣv eva nityaṁ śuśrūṣāṁ kuryāt priyahite rataḥ || 2.235 || As long as the three—father, mother, and guru—remain alive, one shall act in accordance with their guidance. One must constantly serve them with devotion, dedicated to their welfare and happiness.

title: Verse 2.236
content:
तेषामनुपरोधेन पारत्र्यं यद्यदाचरेत् ।
तत्तन्निवेदयेत्तेभ्यो मनोवचनकर्मभिः ॥ २.२३६॥ teṣāmanuparodhena pāratryaṁ yadyadācaret |
tattannivedayettebhyo manovacanakarmabhiḥ || 2.236|| Whatever actions one performs under the influence or obstruction of others, one shall disclose those to them through thought, word, and deed.

title: Verse 2.237
content:
त्रिष्वेतेष्वितिकृत्यं हि पुरुषस्य समाप्यते ।
एष धर्मः परः साक्षादुपधर्मोऽन्य उच्यते ॥ २.२३७॥ triṣveteṣv itikṛtyaṁ hi puruṣasya samāpyate |
eṣa dharmaḥ paraḥ sākṣād upadharmo'nya ucyate || 2.237|| In these three, the completion of man's duty is established; this is the supreme Dharma directly realized, while subsidiary dharmas are declared otherwise.

title: Verse 2.238
content:
श्रद्दधानः शुभां विद्यामाददीतावरादपि ।
अन्यादपि परं धर्मं स्त्रीरत्नं दुष्कुलादपि ॥ २.२३८॥ śraddadhānaḥ śubhāṃ vidyāmādadītāvarādapi |
anyādapi paraṃ dharmaṃ strīratnaṃ duṣkulādapi || 2.238|| One who possesses śraddhā shall receive superior knowledge even from a lowly teacher; likewise, one shall receive greater dharma from a woman of noble character, even if born of a degraded family.

title: Verse 2.239
content:
विषादप्यमृतं ग्राह्यं बालादपि सुभाषितम् ।
अमित्रादपि सद्वृत्तममेध्यादपि काञ्चनम् ॥ २.२३९॥ viṣādapyamṛtaṁ grāhyaṁ bālādapi subhāṣitam |
amitrādapi sadvṛttamamedhyādapi kāñcanam || 2.239|| Even poison may yield nectar; from a child, wisdom may arise. From an enemy, noble conduct is to be accepted; even from impure sources, gold is purified.

title: Verse 2.240
content:
स्त्रियो रत्नान्यथो विद्या धर्मः शौचं सुभाषितम् ।
विविधानि च शिल्पानि समादेयानि सर्वतः ॥ २.२४०॥ striyo ratnānyatho vidyā dharmaḥ śaucaṃ subhāṣitam |
vividhāni ca śilpāni samādeyāni sarvataḥ || 2.240|| Women, jewels, learning, righteousness, purity, good speech, and various crafts—are all to be received fully and without reservation.

title: Verse 2.241
content: अब्राह्मणादध्यायनमापत्काले विधीयते । अनुव्रज्या च शुश्रूषा यावदध्यायनं गुरोः ॥ २.२४१॥ abrahmaṇād adhyayanam āpatkāle vidhīyate | anuvrajyā ca śuśrūṣā yāvad adhyayanaṃ guruḥ || 2.241|| In times of crisis, learning from a non-Brahmin teacher is permitted; accompanying and serving the Guru until the completion of study is the duty.

title: Verse 2.242
content:
नाब्राह्मणे गुरौ शिष्यो वासमात्यन्तिकं वसेत् ।
ब्राह्मणे वाऽननूचाने काङ्क्षन् गतिमनुत्तमाम् ॥ २.२४२॥ nābrāhmaṇe gurau śiṣyo vāsamātyantikaṃ vaset |
brāhmaṇe vā'nanaūcāne kāṅkṣan gatimanuttamām || 2.242|| A disciple shall not reside permanently with a guru who is not a Brahmana; nor with a Brahmana who has not been duly initiated into the highest spiritual discipline, if seeking the supreme goal.

title: Verse 2.243
content:
यदि त्वात्यन्तिकं वासं रोचयेत गुरोः कुले ।
युक्तः परिचरेदेनमा शरीरविमोक्षणात् ॥ २.२४३॥ yadi tvātyantikaṃ vāsaṃ rocaret guruḥ kule |
yuktaḥ paricaredenama śarīra-vimokṣaṇāt || If one desires absolute dwelling within the lineage of the Guru, then one must serve him completely, even beyond bodily departure.

title: Verse 2.244
content:
आ समाप्तेः शरीरस्य यस्तु शुश्रूषते गुरुम् ।
स गच्छत्यञ्जसा विप्रो ब्रह्मणः सद्म शाश्वतम् ॥ २.२४४॥ ā samāpteh śarīrasya yastu śuśrūṣate gurum |
sa gacchatyajjasā vipro brahmaṇaḥ sadma śāśvatam || 2.244|| He who serves the Guru after the completion of the body attains directly the eternal abode of Brahman.

title: Verse 2.245
content:
न पूर्वं गुरवे किं चिदुपकुर्वीत धर्मवित् ।
स्नास्यंस्तु गुरुणाऽज्ञप्तः शक्त्या गुर्व्र्थमाहरेत् ॥ २.२४५॥ na pūrvaṁ gurave kiṁ cid upakurvīta dharmavit |
snāsyaṁstu guruṇā'jñaptaḥ śaktyā gurvrthamāharet || 2.245|| One who knows Dharma does not perform any service for the Guru prior to being instructed. But once directed by the Guru and empowered according to capacity, he shall accomplish the Guru's purpose with full strength.

title: Verse 2.246
content:
क्षेत्रं हिरण्यं गामश्वं छत्रौपानहमासनम् । छत्रोपानहमन्ततः
धान्यं शाकं च वासांसि गुरवे प्रीतिमावहेत् ॥ २.२४६॥ kṣetraṃ hiraṇyaṃ gāmaśvaṃ chatropānahamāsanam | chatropānahamantataḥ
 dhānyaṃ śākaṃ ca vāsānsi guruve prītimāvahet || 2.246|| One shall offer a field, gold, cattle, horses, umbrellas, sandals, seats, grains, vegetables, clothing, and similar items to the Guru out of reverence and with the intent of establishing completeness in the relationship.

title: Verse 2.247
content:
आचार्ये तु खलु प्रेते गुरुपुत्रे गुणान्विते ।
गुरुदारे सपिण्डे वा गुरुवद्वृत्तिमाचरेत् ॥ २.२४७॥ ācārye tu khalu prete guruputre guṇānvite |
gurudāre sapiṇḍe vā guru vad vṛttim ācaret || 2.247 || When the Ācārya has departed, one who is qualified and possesses virtuous conduct—whether a son of the Guru, a wife of the Guru, or one related by blood—shall act in accordance with the Guru's way of life.

title: Verse 2.248
content:
एतेष्वविद्यमानेषु स्थानासनविहारवान् ।
प्रयुञ्जानोऽग्निशुश्रूषां साधयेद्देहमात्मनः ॥ २.२४८॥ eteṣvavidyamāneṣu sthānāsanavihāravān .
prayuñjāno'gniśuśrūṣāṃ sādhayeddehamātmanaḥ .. 2.248 .. When these [prescribed duties] are absent, one who resides in proper places and postures, engaging in the service of fire, accomplishes the body of the Self.

title: Verse 2.249
content:
एवं चरति यो विप्रो ब्रह्मचर्यमविप्लुतः ।
स गच्छत्युत्तमस्थानं न चैह जायते पुनः ॥ २.२४९॥ evaṃ carati yo vipro brahmacaryamaviplutaḥ |
sa gacchatyuttamasthānaṃ na caiha jāyate punaḥ || He who conducts himself in uninterrupted Brahmacarya attains the Supreme State and is not born again in this world.

title: Verse 3.1
content:
अध्याय ३

षट्त्रिंशदाब्दिकं चर्यं गुरौ त्रैवेदिकं व्रतम् ।
तदर्धिकं पादिकं वा ग्रहणान्तिकमेव वा ॥ ३.१॥ adhyāya 3

ṣaṭtriṃśadābdikaṃ caryaṃ gurau traivedikaṃ vratam |
tadar dhikaṃ pādikaṃ vā grahaṇāntikameva vā || 3.1|| A student shall remain in the service of the Guru for thirty-six years, observing the Vedic disciplines; alternatively, half that period, a quarter thereof, or at least until the completion of the initial stage of learning.

title: Verse 3.2
content:
वेदानधीत्य वेदौ वा वेदं वाऽपि यथाक्रमम् ।
अविप्लुतब्रह्मचर्यो गृहस्थाश्रममावसेत् ॥ ३.२॥ vedānadītya vedau vā vedaṃ vā'pi yathākramam |
aviplutabrahmacaryo gṛhasthāśramamāvaset || 3.2|| One who has studied the Vedas in proper sequence, or studied two Vedas, or even one Veda completely, without disturbance of celibate conduct, shall enter the householder stage.

title: Verse 3.3
content:
तं प्रतीतं स्वधर्मेण ब्रह्मदायहरं पितुः ।
स्रग्विणं तल्प आसीनमर्हयेत्प्रथमं गवा ॥ ३.३॥ taṃ pratītaṃ svadharmeṇa brahmadaayaharaṃ pituḥ |
sragviṇaṃ talpa āsīnamarhayetprathamaṃ gavā || 3.3|| One who has been recognized by the father as having fulfilled his own dharma and taken up the responsibility of transmitting Brahman knowledge shall be honored first with cows while adorned with a garland and seated on a bed.

title: Verse 3.4
content:
गुरुणानुमतः स्नात्वा समावृत्तो यथाविधि ।
उद्वहेत द्विजो भार्यां सवर्णां लक्षणान्विताम् ॥ ३.४॥ guruṇānumataḥ snātvā samāvṛtto yathāvidhi |
udvaheta dvijo bhāryāṁ savarṇāṁ lakṣaṇānvitām || 3.4|| Upon completion of Vedic study under the Guru's sanction, and having returned home in accordance with ritual law, a twice-born man shall marry a wife of the same varna who bears the marks of purity.

title: Verse 3.5
content:
असपिण्डा च या मातुरसगोत्रा च या पितुः ।
सा प्रशस्ता द्विजातीनां दारकर्मणि मैथुने ॥ ३.५॥ अमैथिनी asapiṇḍā ca yā māturasagotrā ca yā pituḥ |
sā praśastā dvijātīnāṃ dārakarmaṇi maithune || 3.5|| amaithinī A woman who is neither a sapinda of the mother nor of the same gotra as the father is declared suitable for dvija men in the act of acquiring a wife.

title: Verse 3.6
content:
महान्त्यपि समृद्धानि गोऽजाविधनधान्यतः ।
स्त्रीसम्बन्धे दशैतानि कुलानि परिवर्जयेत् ॥ ३.६॥ mahānty api samṛddhāni go-'jāvidhana-dhānyataḥ |
strī-sambandhe daśaitāni kulāni parivarjayet || 3.6|| Even highly prosperous lineages, rich in cattle, goats, horses, grains, and wealth, must be abandoned if they engage in improper relations with women.

title: Verse 3.7
content:
हीनक्रियं निश्पुरुषं निश्छन्दो रोमशार्शसम् ।
क्षय्यामयाव्य्ऽपस्मारिश्वित्रिकुष्ठिकुलानि च ॥ ३.७॥ hīnakriyaṁ niśpuruṣaṁ niśchando romaśārśasam |
kṣayyāmayāvyâpasmāriśvitrikusthikulāni ca || 3.7|| One who is devoid of action, masculinity, vigor, and afflicted with chronic illness, epilepsy, leprosy, and related disorders shall not be permitted to assume roles requiring societal integrity or ritual participation.

title: Verse 3.8
content:
नोद्वहेत्कपिलां कन्यां नाधिकाङ्गीं न रोगिणीम् ।
नालोमिकां नातिलोमां न वाचाटां न पिङ्गलाम् ॥ ३.८॥ वाचालां na udvahet kapilāṁ kanyāṁ nādhikāṅgīṁ na rogiṇīm | nālomikāṁ nātilomāṁ na vācāṭāṁ na piṅgalām || 3.8 || vācālām One must not marry a girl who is brown-complexioned, physically disproportionate, diseased, lacking body hair, excessively hairy, speech-impaired, or reddish in hue.

title: Verse 3.9
content:
नऋक्षवृक्षनदीनाम्नीं नान्त्यपर्वतनामिकाम् ।
न पक्ष्यहिप्रेष्यनाम्नीं न च भीषणनामिकाम् ॥ ३.९॥ na ṛkṣavṛkṣanadīnāmnīṃ nāntyaparvatanāmikām | na pakṣyahipreṣyanāmnīṃ na ca bhīṣaṇanāmikām || 3.9 || One must not name a child after bears, trees, rivers, borderlands, mountains, birds, beasts of burden, or anything fearsome.

title: Verse 3.10
content:
अव्यङ्गाङ्गीं सौम्यनाम्नीं हंसवारणगामिनीम् ।
तनुलोमकेशदशनां मृद्वङ्गीमुद्वहेत्स्त्रियम् ॥ ३.१०॥ avyaṅgāṅgīṁ saumyanāmnīṁ haṁsavāraṇagāminīm | tanulomakeśadaśanāṁ mṛdvaṅgīmudvahetstriyam || 3.10|| One shall choose a woman who is whole-bodied, named auspiciously, capable of moving like a swan or elephant, with hair and teeth in proper order, and gentle in form.

title: Verse 3.11
content: यस्यास्तु न भवेद्भ्राता न विज्ञायेत वा पिता । वै(वा पिता नोपयच्छेत तां प्राज्ञः पुत्रिकाऽधर्मशङ्कया ॥ ३.११॥ yasyāstu na bhavedbrhātā na vijñāyeta vā pitā | vai(vā pitā nopayaccheta tāṁ prājñaḥ putrikā'dharmaśaṅkayā || 3.11|| Where no brother exists, nor a father is known, or even if a father is present yet does not accept guardianship—then, in the absence of rightful male protectors, a wise man should assume guardianship of the girl, without suspicion of unrighteous intent.

title: Verse 3.12
content:
सवर्णाऽग्रे द्विजातीनां प्रशस्ता दारकर्मणि ।
कामतस्तु प्रवृत्तानामिमाः स्युः क्रमशोऽवराः ॥ ३.१२॥ savarnā'gre dvijātīnāṁ praśastā dārakarmaṇi |
kāmatastu pravṛttānāmimāḥ syuḥ kramaśo'varāḥ || 3.12|| Among the twice-born, those of the same varna are first approved for the duties of householdership; those who act from desire are assigned successively lower roles.

title: Verse 3.13
content:
शूद्रैव भार्या शूद्रस्य सा च स्वा च विशः स्मृते ।
ते च स्वा चैव राज्ञश्च ताश्च स्वा चाग्रजन्मनः ॥ ३.१३॥ śūdraiva bhāryā śūdrasya sā ca svā ca viśaḥ smṛte |
te ca svā caiva rājñaśca tāśca svā cāgrajanmanaḥ || 3.13|| Only a Śūdra woman is the lawful wife of a Śūdra; among the Vaiśyas, both sisters and daughters-in-law are considered wives. Among Kṣatriyas, wives include sisters, daughters-in-law, and queens. Among Brāhmaṇas, all these categories—including those born of elder brothers—are recognized as lawful wives.

title: Verse 3.14
content:
न ब्राह्मणक्षत्रिययोरापद्यपि हि तिष्ठतोः ।
कस्मिंश्चिदपि वृत्तान्ते शूद्रा भार्यौपदिश्यते ॥ ३.१४॥ na brāhmaṇakṣatriyayor āpady api hi tiṣṭhatoḥ |
kasmiṃścid api vṛttānte śūdrā bhāryau padiśyate || 3.14|| In no circumstance shall a Śūdra woman be designated as wife to a Brāhmaṇa or Kṣatriya, even in times of upheaval or societal collapse.

title: Verse 3.15
content: हीनजातिस्त्रियं मोहादुद्वहन्तो द्विजातयः । कुलान्येव नयन्त्याशु ससन्तानानि शूद्रताम् ॥ ३.१५॥ hīnajātistriyaṁ mohādudvahanto dvijātayaḥ | kulānyeva nayantyāśu sasantānāni śūdratām || 3.15|| When twice-born men, deluded by desire, take wives from inferior castes, their lineages swiftly descend with progeny into the state of Shudras.

title: Verse 3.16
content:
शूद्रावेदी पतत्यत्रेरुतथ्यतनयस्य च ।
शौनकस्य सुतोत्पत्त्या तदपत्यतया भृगोः ॥ ३.१६॥ śūdrāvedī patatyaterutathyatanayasya ca |
śaunakasya sutotpattyā tadapatyatayā bhṛgoḥ || 3.16|| One born of a Śūdra father and an Ātreya mother falls into degradation; similarly, one born of a son of Śaunaka by a daughter of Bhṛgu also becomes degraded.

title: Verse 3.17
content:
शूद्रां शयनमारोप्य ब्राह्मणो यात्यधोगतिम् ।
जनयित्वा सुतं तस्यां ब्राह्मण्यादेव हीयते ॥ ३.१७॥ śūdrāṁ śayanam āropyā brāhmaṇo yāty adhogatim |
janayitvā sutaṁ tasyāṁ brāhmaṇyād eva hīyate || 3.17|| A Brāhmaṇa who cohabits with a Śūdra woman and begets a son thereby falls from his own varṇic status and forfeits all ritual and social authority derived therefrom.

title: Verse 3.18
content:
दैवपित्र्यातिथेयानि तत्प्रधानानि यस्य तु ।
नाश्नन्ति पितृदेवास्तन्न च स्वर्गं स गच्छति ॥ ३.१८॥ daivapitryātithēyāni tatpradhānāni yasya tu |
nāśnanti pitṛdēvāstaṁ na ca svargaṁ sa gacchati || 3.18|| One who neglects the offerings due to deities, ancestors, and guests, whose primary duties are thus violated, shall not attain heaven, for the divine laws governing ancestral continuity and hospitality are immutable.

title: Verse 3.19
content: वृषलीफेनपीतस्य निःश्वासोपहतस्य च । तस्यां चैव प्रसूतस्य निष्कृतिर्न विधीयते ॥ ३.१९॥ vṛṣalīphenapītasya niḥśvāsopahatasya ca | tasyāṃ caiva prasūtasya niṣkṛtirna vidhīyate || 3.19|| One who has consumed the phlegm of a Śūdra woman or been afflicted by her breath, and is born thereof, requires no expiation.

title: Verse 3.20
content:
चतुर्णामपि वर्णानं प्रेत्य चैह हिताहितान् ।
अष्टाविमान् समासेन स्त्रीविवाहान्निबोधत ॥ ३.२०॥ caturṇām api varṇānāṃ pretya caih hitāhitān |
aṣṭāv imān samāsena strīvivāhān nibodhata || 3.20|| Regarding the four varnas, both in this life and the hereafter, understand comprehensively these eight forms of marriage involving women.

title: Verse 3.21
content:
ब्राह्मो दैवस्तथैवार्षः प्राजापत्यस्तथाऽसुरः ।
गान्धर्वो राक्षसश्चैव पैशाचश्चाष्टमोऽधमः ॥ ३.२१॥ brāhmo daivastathaivārṣaḥ prājāpatyastathā'suraḥ |
gāndharvo rākṣasaścaiva paiśācaścāṣṭamo'dhamaḥ || 3.21|| The Brahmic order manifests as divine law; the Daivic as celestial harmony; the Ārṣic as ancestral continuity; the Prajāpatic as generative responsibility; the Āsuric as material assertion; the Gāndharvic as aesthetic entanglement; the Rākṣasic as disruptive force; and the Paiśācic as the lowest degradation of consciousness.

title: Verse 3.22
content:
यो यस्य धर्म्यो वर्णस्य गुणदोषौ च यस्य यौ ।
तद्वः सर्वं प्रवक्ष्यामि प्रसवे च गुणागुणान् ॥ ३.२२॥ yo yasya dharmyo varṇasya guṇadoṣau ca yasya yau |
tad vaḥ sarvaṁ pravakṣyāmi prasave ca guṇāguṇān || 3.22|| I shall declare fully the qualities and defects inherent in each varna according to dharma, along with their capacities and consequences at birth.

title: Verse 3.23
content:
षडानुपूर्व्या विप्रस्य क्षत्रस्य चतुरोऽवरान् ।
विश्।शूद्रयोस्तु तानेव विद्याद्धर्म्यानराक्षसान् ॥ ३.२३॥ ṣaḍānupūrvyā viprasya kṣatrasya caturō'varān |
viśaḥ śūdrayōstu tānēva vidyāddharmyānarākṣasān || 3.23|| By six sequential unfoldings, the Brahmin; by four, the Kshatriya; for Vaishya and Shudra, those same four alone—know them as dharmic, not demonic.

title: Verse 3.24
content:
चतुरो ब्राह्मणस्याद्यान् प्रशस्तान् कवयो विदुः ।
राक्षसं क्षत्रियस्यैकमासुरं वैश्यशूद्रयोः ॥ ३.२४॥ caturō brāhmaṇasyādyān praśastān kavayō viduḥ .
rākṣasaṁ kṣatriyasyaikam āsuraṁ vaiśyaśūdrayōḥ .. Four divine conduct forms are declared praiseworthy for the Brahmin; one demonic form is assigned to the Kshatriya; and one infernal conduct form each is designated respectively for Vaishya and Shudra.

title: Verse 3.25
content:
पञ्चानां तु त्रयो धर्म्या द्वावधर्म्यौ स्मृताविह ।
पैशाचश्चासुरश्चैव न कर्तव्यौ कदा चन ॥ ३.२५॥ pañcānāṁ tu trayo dharmyā dvāvadhar-myau smṛtau iha | paiśācaścāsuraścaiva na kartavyau kadācana || 3.25|| Of the five types of marriage, three are dharmic; two are adharmic and must never be undertaken—namely, the Paiśāca and Āsura forms.

title: Verse 3.26
content:
पृथक्पृथग्वा मिश्रौ वा विवाहौ पूर्वचोदितौ ।
गान्धर्वो राक्षसश्चैव धर्म्यौ क्षत्रस्य तौ स्मृतौ ॥ ३.२६॥ pṛthakpṛthagvā miśrau vā vivāhau pūrvacoditau |
gāndharvo rākṣasaścaiva dharmyau kṣatrasya tau smṛtau || 3.26|| Two forms of marriage—separate or combined—are previously ordained: the Gandharva and the Rakshasa; both are sanctioned for the Kshatriya class.

title: Verse 3.27
content:
आच्छाद्य चार्चयित्वा च श्रुतशीलवते स्वयम् ।
आहूय दानं कन्याया ब्राह्मो धर्मः प्रकीर्तितः ॥ ३.२७॥ ācchādya cārcayitvā ca śrutaśīlavate svayam | 
āhūya dānaṃ kanyāyā brāhmo dharmaḥ prakīrtitaḥ || 3.27 || Covering, worshipping, and honoring the bridegroom who is learned and virtuous, the giving of the daughter is declared as the Brahmic law.

title: Verse 3.28
content:
यज्ञे तु वितते सम्यगृत्विजे कर्म कुर्वते ।
अलङ्कृत्य सुतादानं दैवं धर्मं प्रचक्षते ॥ ३.२८॥ yajñe tu vitate samyagṛtvije karma kurvate |
alankṛtya sutadānaṃ daivaṃ dharmaṃ pracakṣate || 3.28|| When the extended sacrifice is rightly conducted by ritviks performing their respective duties, and the daughter is given away with full adornment, it is declared as divine dharma.

title: Verse 3.29
content:
एकं गोमिथुनं द्वे वा वरादादाय धर्मतः ।
कन्याप्रदानं विधिवदार्षो धर्मः स उच्यते ॥ ३.२९॥ ekaṁ gomithunaṁ dve vā varādādāya dharmataḥ |
kanyāpradānaṁ vidhivadārṣo dharmaḥ sa ucyate || 3.29|| The lawful giving of a maiden in marriage, accompanied by one or two cows as bridal gift received according to Dharma and offered willingly by the groom, constitutes the righteous conduct known as Ārṣa Dharma.

title: Verse 3.30
content:
सहौभौ चरतां धर्ममिति वाचाऽनुभाष्य च ।
कन्याप्रदानमभ्यर्च्य प्राजापत्यो विधिः स्मृतः ॥ ३.३०॥ sahaubhau caratāṁ dharmamiti vācā'nuabhāṣya ca |
kanyāpradānamabhyarcya prājāpatyo vidhiḥ smṛtaḥ || 3.30|| When a father bestows his daughter in marriage while invoking divine witness and instructing both parties to walk together in dharma, this act constitutes the Prajāpati form of union.

title: Verse 3.31
content:
ज्ञातिभ्यो द्रविणं दत्त्वा कन्यायै चैव शक्तितः ।
कन्याप्रदानं स्वाच्छन्द्यादासुरो धर्म उच्यते ॥ ३.३१॥ jñātibhyo draviṇaṁ dattvā kanyāyai caiva śaktitaḥ | 
kanyāpradānaṁ svācchandyād āsuro dharma ucyate || 3.31|| Having given wealth to the kin and empowered the daughter accordingly, the voluntary giving of the daughter in marriage is declared as the righteous duty of an Asura.

title: Verse 3.32
content:
इच्छयाऽन्योन्यसंयोगः कन्यायाश्च वरस्य च ।
गान्धर्वः स तु विज्ञेयो मैथुन्यः कामसम्भवः ॥ ३.३२॥ icchayā'nyonyasaṃyogaḥ kanyāyāśca varasya ca |
gāndharvaḥ sa tu vijñeyo maithunyaḥ kāmasambhavaḥ || 3.32|| Union by mutual desire between a maiden and her chosen partner is designated Gandharva marriage; it originates from passion and is recognized as such.

title: Verse 3.33
content:
हत्वा छित्त्वा च भित्त्वा च क्रोशन्तीं रुदतीं गृहात् ।
प्रसह्य कन्याहरणं राक्षसो विधिरुच्यते ॥ ३.३३॥ hatvā chittvā ca bhitvā ca krośantīṃ rudatīṃ gṛhāt |
