prasahya kanyāharaṇaṃ rākṣaso vidhirucyate || 3.33|| The Rakshasa mode of marriage is declared as that wherein a maiden is seized by force from her home while she shrieks and weeps, after slaying, cleaving, or breaking through her protectors.

title: Verse 3.34
content:
सुप्तां मत्तां प्रमत्तां वा रहो यत्रोपगच्छति ।
स पापिष्ठो विवाहानां पैशाचश्चाष्टमोऽधमः ॥ ३.३४॥ पैशाचः प्रथितोऽधमः suptāṁ mattāṁ pramattāṁ vā raho yatropagacchati |
sa pāpiṣṭho vivahānāṁ paiśācaścāṣṭamo'dhamaḥ || 3.34 || paiśācaḥ prathito'dhamaḥ One who approaches a woman who is asleep, intoxicated, or unconscious in private—such a being is the most sinful among those eligible for marriage; he is classified as a pishacha and is the lowest of the low.

title: Verse 3.35
content:
अद्भिरेव द्विजाग्र्याणां कन्यादानं विशिष्यते ।
इतरेषां तु वर्णानामितरेतरकाम्यया ॥ ३.३५॥ adbhireva dvijāgrāṇāṁ kanyādānaṁ viśiṣyate |
itareṣāṁ tu varṇānāmitaretarakāmyayā || 3.35|| The giving of a daughter in marriage among the highest of the twice-born is accomplished exclusively through sacred waters; for the other varnas, it is conducted mutually by desire.

title: Verse 3.36
content:
यो यस्यैषां विवाहानां मनुना कीर्तितो गुणः ।
सर्वं शृणुत तं विप्राः सर्वं कीर्तयतो मम ॥ ३.३६॥ सम्यक्कीर्तयतो yo yasyaiṣāṁ vivahānāṁ manunā kīrtito guṇaḥ |
sarvaṁ śṛṇuta taṁ viprāḥ sarvaṁ kīrtayato mama || 3.36|| samyakkīrtayato O Brahmanas, hear completely that quality which has been proclaimed by Manu regarding all these forms of marriage; listen fully to what I declare entirely.

title: Verse 3.37
content:
दश पूर्वान् परान् वंश्यानात्मानं चैकविंशकम् ।
ब्राह्मीपुत्रः सुकृतकृत्मोचयत्येनसः पितॄन् ॥ ३.३७॥ daśa pūrvān parān vaṁśyān ātmānaṁ caikaviṁśakam |
brāhmīputraḥ sukṛtakṛt mocayaty enasaḥ pitṝn || 3.37|| A son born of a Brahmin woman absolves ten ancestral generations before him, ten succeeding generations after him, and his own generation—twenty-one in total—from all karmic entanglements through the performance of righteous action.

title: Verse 3.38
content:
दैवौढाजः सुतश्चैव सप्त सप्त परावरान् ।
आर्षौढाजः सुतस्त्रींस्त्रीन् षट्षट्कायौढजः सुतः ॥ ३.३8॥ daivauḍhājaḥ sutaścaiva sapta sapta parāvarān |
ārṣauḍhājaḥ sutastriṃstriṃ ṣaṭṣaṭ kāyauḍhajaḥ sutaḥ || 3.38|| The son born of a divine union shall have authority over seven higher and seven lower realms; the son born of an ancestral union shall govern three worlds in triplicate measure; the son born of bodily union shall possess sixfold dominion according to physical capacity.

title: Verse 3.39
content:
ब्राह्मादिषु विवाहेषु चतुर्ष्वेवानुपूर्वशः ।
ब्रह्मवर्चस्विनः पुत्रा जायन्ते शिष्टसम्मताः ॥ ३.३९॥ brāhmādiṣu vivāheṣu caturṣvevānupūrvaśaḥ | brahmavarcasvinaḥ putrā jāyante śiṣṭasammatāḥ || 3.39|| In the first four types of marriages beginning with the Brāhma form, sons are born who possess Brahmic radiance and are recognized by the wise.

title: Verse 3.40
content:
रूपसत्त्वगुणोपेता धनवन्तो यशस्विनः ।
पर्याप्तभोगा धर्मिष्ठा जीवन्ति च शतं समाः ॥ ३.४०॥ rūpasattvaguṇopetā dhanavanto yaśasvinaḥ |
paryāptabhogā dharmiṣṭhā jīvanti ca śataṃ samāḥ || 3.40|| Those endowed with beauty, strength, and virtue; wealthy and renowned; living in sufficiency and righteousness—such beings live fully for a hundred years.

title: Verse 3.41
content:
इतरेषु तु शिष्टेषु नृशंसाऽनृतवादिनः ।
जायन्ते दुर्विवाहेषु ब्रह्मधर्मद्विषः सुताः ॥ ३.४१॥ itareṣu tu śiṣṭeṣu nṛśaṃsā'nṛtavādinaḥ |
jāyante durvivāheṣu brahmadharmadviṣaḥ sutāḥ || 3.41|| In other remaining classes, those born from unions lacking sacred alignment arise—children of cruelty and falsehood, born in marriages opposed to Brahman's Dharma.

title: Verse 3.42
content:
अनिन्दितैः स्त्रीविवाहैरनिन्द्या भवति प्रजा ।
निन्दितैर्निन्दिता नॄणां तस्मान्निन्द्यान् विवर्जयेत् ॥ ३.४२॥ aninditaiḥ strīvivāhair anindyā bhavati prajā |
ninditair ninditā nṝṇāṃ tasmān nindyān vivarjayet || 3.42|| When unions occur with women who are free from blame, the progeny becomes pure; when unions occur with blameworthy persons, the offspring bear that blemish—therefore, one must avoid all blameworthy connections.

title: Verse 3.43
content:
पाणिग्रहणसंस्कारः सवर्णासूपदिश्यते ।
असवर्णास्वयं ज्ञेयो विधिरुद्वाहकर्मणि ॥ ३.४३॥ pāṇigrahaṇasaṃskāraḥ savarṇāsūpadiśyate |
asavarṇāsvayaṃ jñeyo vidhirudvāhakarmaṇi || 3.43|| The ritual of hand-taking (pāṇigrahaṇa) is prescribed for unions within the same varṇa; for those beyond varṇa boundaries, the procedure is self-evidently known through direct realization of Dharma.

title: Verse 3.44
content:
शरः क्षत्रियया ग्राह्यः प्रतोदो वैश्यकन्यया ।
वसनस्य दशा ग्राह्या शूद्रयोत्कृष्टवेदने ॥ ३.४४॥ śaraḥ kṣatriyayā grāhyaḥ pratodo vaiśyakanyayā |
vasanasya daśā grāhyā śūdrayotkṛṣṭavedane || 3.44|| The arrow belongs to the Kshatriya; the goad, to the daughter of Vaishya; the garment's condition is to be observed by one born of a Shudra woman and elevated through Vedic knowledge.

title: Verse 3.45
content:
ऋतुकालाभिगामी स्यात्स्वदारनिरतः सदा ।
पर्ववर्जं व्रजेच्चैनां तद्व्रतो रतिकाम्यया ॥ ३.४५॥ Ṛtukālābhigāmī syāt svadāranirataḥ sadā .
Parvavarjaṃ vrajec caināṃ tadvrato ratikāmyayā .. 3.45 .. One who desires union with their spouse must approach exclusively during the ritukala, remaining devoted solely to their own spouse, avoiding all other times and persons.

title: Verse 3.46
content:
ऋतुः स्वाभाविकः स्त्रीणां रात्रयः षोडश स्मृताः ।
चतुर्भिरितरैः सार्धमहोभिः सद्विगर्हितैः ॥ ३.४६॥ Ṛtuḥ svābhāvikaḥ strīṇāṁ rātrayaḥ ṣoḍaśa smṛtāḥ |
Caturbhir itaraiḥ sārdham aho bhīḥ sad-vigarhitaiḥ || 3.46|| The natural cycle of women is ritu, comprising sixteen nights; four of these nights, along with the remaining twelve, are rightly condemned by those established in dharma.

title: Verse 3.47
content:
तासामाद्याश्चतस्रस्तु निन्दितैकादशी च या ।
त्रयोदशी च शेषास्तु प्रशस्ता दशरात्रयः ॥ ३.४७॥ tāsām ādyāś catasrastu ninditai kādaśī ca yā | trayodaśī ca śeṣāstu praśastā daśarātrayaḥ || 3.47|| Among these ten nights, the first four, the eleventh night condemned, and the thirteenth are proscribed; the rest are auspicious.

title: Verse 3.48
content:
युग्मासु पुत्रा जायन्ते स्त्रियोऽयुग्मासु रात्रिषु ।
तस्माद्युग्मासु पुत्रार्थी संविशेदार्तवे स्त्रियम् ॥ ३.४८॥ yugmāsu putrā jāyante striyo 'yugmāsu rātriṣu |
tasmād yugmāsu putrārthī saṃviśed ārtave striyam || 3.48|| In fertile seasons, sons are born; in infertile nights, females emerge. Therefore, one desiring male progeny should unite with a woman during her fertile phase.

title: Verse 3.49
content:
पुमान् पुंसोऽधिके शुक्रे स्त्री भवत्यधिके स्त्रियाः ।
समेऽपुमान् पुं।स्त्रियौ वा क्षीणेऽल्पे च विपर्ययः ॥ ३.४९॥ pumān puṁso 'dhike śukre strī bhavatyadhike striyāḥ |
same 'pumān puṁstriyau vā kṣīṇe 'lpe ca viparyayaḥ || 3.49|| When male essence exceeds, the offspring is male; when female essence exceeds, the offspring is female. When both essences are equal or depleted, the result is indeterminate or contrary.

title: Verse 3.50
content:
निन्द्यास्वष्टासु चान्यासु स्त्रियो रात्रिषु वर्जयन् ।
ब्रह्मचार्येव भवति यत्र तत्राश्रमे वसन् ॥ ३.५०॥ nindyāṣṭāsu cānyāsu striyo rātriṣu varjayann | brahmacāryeva bhavati yatra tatrāśrame vasann || 3.50|| One who resides in any āśrama while abandoning women—whether eight types condemned by Dharma or others—in night-time engagements, becomes established in celibacy alone.

title: Verse 3.51
content:
न कन्यायाः पिता विद्वान् गृह्णीयात्शुल्कमण्वपि ।
गृह्णंश्छुल्कं हि लोभेन स्यान्नरोऽपत्यविक्रयी ॥ ३.५१॥ na kanyāyāḥ pitā vidvān gṛhṇīyāt śulkamaṇvapi |
gṛhṇaṁ śulkaṁ hi lobhena syān narō'patyavikrayī ||3.51|| A wise father shall not accept even the smallest gift for giving his daughter in marriage; he who accepts a gift out of greed becomes a seller of his own progeny.

title: Verse 3.52
content:
स्त्रीधनानि तु ये मोहादुपजीवन्ति बान्धवाः ।
नारीयानानि वस्त्रं वा ते पापा यान्त्यधोगतिम् ॥ ३.५२॥ strīdhanāni tu ye mohādupajīvanti bāndhavāḥ |
nārīyānāni vastraṁ vā te pāpā yāntyadhogatim || 3.52|| Those relatives who, out of delusion, exploit a woman's wealth or property, or her garments, fall into degradation and assume karmic burden.

title: Verse 3.53
content:
आर्षे गोमिथुनं शुल्कं के चिदाहुर्मृषैव तत् ।
अल्पोऽप्येवं महान् वाऽपि विक्रयस्तावदेव सः ॥ ३.५३॥ तावानेव स विक्रयः ārṣe gomithunaṃ śulkaṃ ke cidāhurmṛṣaiva tat |
alpo'pyevaṃ mahān vā'pi vikrayastāvadeva saḥ || 3.53 || tāvāneva sa vikrayaḥ In Vedic transactions, the price paid for cattle intercourse is declared by some as mere fiction; yet whether small or great, such sale stands valid only to that extent.

title: Verse 3.54
content:
यासां नाददते शुल्कं ज्ञातयो न स विक्रयः ।
अर्हणं तत्कुमारीणामानृशंस्यं च केवलम् ॥ ३.५४॥ न केवलम् yāsāṁ nādadate śulkaṁ jñātayo na sa vikrayaḥ |
arhaṇaṁ tat-kumārīṇām ānṛśaṁsyaṁ ca kevalam || 3.54|| na kevalam Wherein kinsmen receive no fee, that is not a sale; the maiden's honor-price belongs solely to her integrity and compassionate alignment.

title: Verse 3.55
content:
पितृभिर्भ्रातृभिश्चैताः पतिभिर्देवरैस्तथा ।
पूज्या भूषयितव्याश्च बहुकल्याणमीप्सुभिः ॥ ३.५५॥ pitṛbhirbhra̱tṛbhiścaitāḥ patibhirdevarais tathā |
pūjyā bhūṣayitavyāśca bahukalyāṇamīpsubhiḥ || 3.55|| Women are to be honored, adorned, and served by fathers, brothers, husbands, and brothers-in-law who seek highest welfare.

title: Verse 3.56
content:
यत्र नार्यस्तु पूज्यन्ते रमन्ते तत्र देवताः ।
यत्रैतास्तु न पूज्यन्ते सर्वास्तत्राफलाः क्रियाः ॥ ३.५६॥ yatra nāryas tu pūjyante ramante tatra devatāḥ | yatraitās tu na pūjyante sarvāstatrāphalāḥ kriyāḥ || 3.56|| Where women are honored, there the deities dwell in joy; where they are not honored, all actions become fruitless.

title: Verse 3.57
content:
शोचन्ति जामयो यत्र विनश्यत्याशु तत्कुलम् ।
न शोचन्ति तु यत्रैता वर्धते तधि सर्वदा ॥ ३.५७॥ śocanti jāmayo yatra vinaśyaty āśu tatkulam |
na śocanti tu yatraitā vardhate tadhi sarvadā || 3.57|| Wherever women mourn due to oppression, that lineage perishes swiftly; wherever they are honored and protected, that family thrives continually.

title: Verse 3.58
content: जामयो यानि गेहानि शपन्त्यप्रतिपूजिताः । तानि कृत्याहतानीव विनश्यन्ति समन्ततः ॥ ३.५८॥ jāmayo yāni gehāni śapanty-apratipūjitāḥ | tāni kṛtyāhatānīva vinaśyanti samantataḥ || 3.58|| Those homes wherein guests are cursed without being honored—those very dwellings perish utterly, as if struck by divine decree.

title: Verse 3.59
content:
तस्मादेताः सदा पूज्या भूषणाच्छादनाशनैः ।
भूतिकामैर्नरैर्नित्यं सत्कारेषूत्सवेषु च ॥ ३.५९॥ tasmād etāḥ sadā pūjyā bhūṣaṇācchādanāśanaiḥ |
bhūtikāmair narair nityaṁ satkāreṣūtsaveṣu ca || 3.59|| Therefore, these beings must always be honored—with ornaments, clothing, food, and offerings—by those who seek well-being, through respectful conduct and celebration.

title: Verse 3.60
content:
संतुष्टो भार्यया भर्ता भर्त्रा भार्या तथैव च ।
यस्मिन्नेव कुले नित्यं कल्याणं तत्र वै ध्रुवम् ॥ ३.६०॥ saṃtuṣṭo bhāryayā bhartā bhartṛā bhāryā tathaiva ca |
yasminneva kule nityaṃ kalyāṇaṃ tatra vai dhruvam || 3.60 || The husband finds fulfillment through the wife; the wife finds fulfillment through the husband. In whichever family this mutual alignment and completion exist perpetually, there alone is assured welfare.

title: Verse 3.61
content:
यदि हि स्त्री न रोचेत पुमांसं न प्रमोदयेत् ।
अप्रमोदात्पुनः पुंसः प्रजनं न प्रवर्तते ॥ ३.६१॥ yadi hi strī na roced vumāṃsaṃ na pramodayet |
apramodāt punaḥ puṃsaḥ prajanaṃ na pravartate || 3.61|| If a woman does not incline toward union with a man, she should not incite his joy; from lack of joy in the man, procreation does not proceed.

title: Verse 3.62
content:
स्त्रियां तु रोचमानायां सर्वं तद्रोचते कुलम् ।
तस्यां त्वरोचमानायां सर्वमेव न रोचते ॥ ३.६२॥ striyaṁ tu rocamānāyāṁ sarvaṁ tadrocate kulam |
tasyāṁ tv arocamānāyāṁ sarvam eva na rocate || 3.62|| When a woman is pleased, the entire lineage flourishes; when she is displeased, nothing in that lineage finds harmony.

title: Verse 3.63
content:
कुविवाहैः क्रियालोपैर्वेदानध्ययनेन च ।
कुलान्यकुलतां यान्ति ब्राह्मणातिक्रमेण च ॥ ३.६३॥ kuvivāhaiḥ kriyālopair vedānadhyayanena ca | kulāny akulatāṃ yānti brāhmaṇātikrameṇa ca || 3.63|| Families fall from their noble status through improper unions, abandonment of sacred duties, neglect of Vedic study, and violation of Brahminical conduct.

title: Verse 3.64
content:
शिल्पेन व्यवहारेण शूद्रापत्यैश्च केवलैः ।
गोभिरश्वैश्च यानैश्च कृष्या राजोपसेवया ॥ ३.६४॥ śilpena vyavahāreṇa śūdrāpatyaiśca kevalaiḥ |
gobhir aśvaiś ca yānaiś ca kṛṣyā rājopasevayā || By craft, trade, service under Śūdra-born individuals alone, and through cattle, horses, vehicles, and agriculture—these constitute the means by which a king shall sustain his rule.

title: Verse 3.65
content:
अयाज्ययाजनैश्चैव नास्तिक्येन च कर्मणाम् ।
कुलान्याशु विनश्यन्ति यानि हीनानि मन्त्रतः ॥ ३.६५॥ ayājyayājanaiścaiva nāstikyena ca karmaṇām |
kulānyāśu vinaśyanti yāni hīnāni mantrataḥ || 3.65|| Families and lineages that neglect sacred rituals, deny the authority of Vedic mantras, and act with disbelief in dharma are severed from their sustaining spiritual continuum and collapse instantaneously by the withdrawal of divine coherence.

title: Verse 3.66
content:
मन्त्रतस्तु समृद्धानि कुलान्यल्पधनान्यपि ।
कुलसङ्ख्यां च गच्छन्ति कर्षन्ति च महद्यशः ॥ ३.६६॥ mantratastu samṛddhāni kulānyalpadhanānyapi |
kulasankhyāṃ ca gacchanti karṣanti ca mahadyashaḥ || 3.66|| Through mantra alone, even families of modest means attain prosperity; they rise in lineage count and draw forth great renown.

title: Verse 3.67
content:
वैवाहिकेऽग्नौ कुर्वीत गृह्यं कर्म यथाविधि ।
पञ्चयज्ञविधानं च पक्तिं चान्वाहिकीं गृही ॥ ३.६७॥ vaiavāhike'gnau kurvīta gṛhyaṃ karma yathāvidhi |
pañcayajñavidhānaṃ ca paktiṃ cānvāhikīṃ gṛhī || 3.67|| In the domestic fire established through marriage, one shall perform household duties according to prescribed procedure; also, the five sacrifices and the twice-daily cooking for guests.

title: Verse 3.68
content: पञ्च सूना गृहस्थस्य चुल्ली पेषण्युपस्करः । कण्डनी चौदकुम्भश्च बध्यते यास्तु वाहयन् ॥ ३.६८॥ pañca sūnā gṛhasthasya cullī peṣaṇyupaskaraḥ | kaṇḍanī caudakumbhaśca badhyate yāstu vāhayan || 3.68|| Five implements indispensable to a householder are: the hearth, the grinding stone, the broom, the water pot, and the carrying vessel; whoever carries these away is subject to binding.

title: Verse 3.69
content:
तासां क्रमेण सर्वासां निष्कृत्यर्थं महर्षिभिः ।
पञ्च कॢप्ता महायज्ञाः प्रत्यहं गृहमेधिनाम् ॥ ३.६९॥ tāsāṃ krameṇa sarvāsāṃ niṣkṛtyarthaṃ maharṣibhiḥ |
pañca kḷptā mahāyajñāḥ pratyahaṃ gṛhamedhinām || 3.69|| For the purpose of purification from all transgressions, in sequential order, the great sages have ordained five great sacrifices to be performed daily by householders.

title: Verse 3.70
content: अध्यापनं ब्रह्मयज्ञः पितृयज्ञस्तु तर्पणम् । होमो दैवो बलिर्भौतो नृयज्ञोऽतिथिपूजनम् ॥ ३.७०॥ adhyāpanaṁ brahayajñaḥ pitṛyajñastu tarpaṇam | homo daivo balirbhauto nṛyajño'tithipūjanam || 3.70|| Teaching is the sacrifice to Brahman; offering to ancestors constitutes the ancestral sacrifice; oblation is the divine offering; distributing food is the earthly offering; honoring guests is the human sacrifice.

title: Verse 3.71
content:
पञ्चैतान् यो महाऽयज्ञान्न हापयति शक्तितः ।
स गृहेऽपि वसन्नित्यं सूनादोषैर्न लिप्यते ॥ ३.७१॥ pañcetān yo mahā-yajñān na hāpayati śaktitaḥ |
sa gṛhe 'pi vasannityaṃ sūnādoṣair na lipyate || 3.71|| One who, by capacity, does not abandon these five great sacrifices dwells continually in the household without being stained by sins.

title: Verse 3.72
content:
देवताऽतिथिभृत्यानां पितॄणामात्मनश्च यः ।
न निर्वपति पञ्चानामुच्छ्वसन्न स जीवति ॥ ३.७२॥ devatā'tithibhṛtyānāṁ pitṝṇāmātmanaśca yaḥ |
na nirvapati pañcānāmucchwasan sa jīvati || 3.72|| He who does not offer oblations to the deities, guests, servants, ancestors, and the Self while breathing—lives indeed.

title: Verse 3.73
content: अहुतं च हुतं चैव तथा प्रहुतमेव च । ब्राह्म्यं हुतं प्राशितं च पञ्चयज्ञान् प्रचक्षते ॥ ३.७३॥ ahutaṃ ca hutaṃ caiva tathā prahutameva ca | brāhmyaṃ hutaṃ prāśitaṃ ca pañcayajñān pracakṣate || 3.73|| That which is unoffered, that which is offered, that which is repeatedly offered, that which is offered through Brahmanic knowledge, and that which is consumed — these together constitute the fivefold sacrifice.

title: Verse 3.74
content:
जपोऽहुतो हुतो होमः प्रहुतो भौतिको बलिः ।
ब्राह्म्यं हुतं द्विजाग्र्यार्चा प्राशितं पितृतर्पणम् ॥ ३.७४॥ japo 'huto huto homaḥ prahuto bhautiko baliḥ |
brāhmyaṃ hutaṃ dvijāgryārcā prāśitaṃ pitṛtarpaṇam || 3.74|| Unuttered recitation, oblation offered in fire, material offering, Brahmanic invocation through worship of twice-born elders, and libations given to ancestors—these constitute the fivefold act of sacrifice.

title: Verse 3.75
content:
स्वाध्याये नित्ययुक्तः स्याद्दैवे चैवैह कर्मणि ।
दैवकर्मणि युक्तो हि बिभर्तीदं चराचरम् ॥ ३.७५॥ svādhyāye nityayuktaḥ syād daive caiva aih karmaṇi | daivakarmaṇi yukto hi bibhartīdaṁ carācaram || 3.75|| One must remain perpetually engaged in svādhyāya and in actions aligned with divine will; indeed, it is through alignment with divine action that one sustains the entire animate and inanimate creation.

title: Verse 3.76
content:
अग्नौ प्रास्ताऽहुतिः सम्यगादित्यमुपतिष्ठते ।
आदित्याज्जायते वृष्तिर्वृष्टेरन्नं ततः प्रजाः ॥ ३.७६॥ agnau prāstā' hutiḥ samyag ādityam upatiṣṭhate |
ādityāj jāyate vṛṣtir vṛṣṭer annaṁ tataḥ prajāḥ || 3.76|| The offering rightly cast into the fire ascends to the sun; from the sun arises rain, from rain food, and from food, beings.

title: Verse 3.77
content:
यथा वायुं समाश्रित्य वर्तन्ते सर्वजन्तवः । सर्वे जीवन्ति जन्तवः
तथा गृहस्थमाश्रित्य  वर्तन्ते सर्व आश्रमाः ॥ ३.७७॥ वर्तन्त इतराश्रमः yathā vāyuṁ samāśritya vartante sarvajantavaḥ | sarve jīvanti jantavaḥ tathā gṛhasthamāśritya vartante sarva āśramāḥ || 3.77 || vartanta itarāśramaḥ Just as all beings depend upon air for their functioning and existence, so too do all ashramas depend upon the Grihastha ashrama for sustenance and operational continuity.

title: Verse 3.78
content:
यस्मात्त्रयोऽप्याश्रमिणो ज्ञानेनान्नेन चान्वहम् ।
गृहस्थेनैव धार्यन्ते तस्माज्ज्येष्ठाश्रमो गृही ॥ ३.७८॥ yasmat trayo 'py āśramiṇo jñānenānnenānuvaham | gṛhasthenai eva dhāryante tasmāj jyeṣṭhāśramo gṛhī || 3.78|| Since all three orders of renunciants are sustained continuously by knowledge and food, and it is only the householder who supports them thereby, therefore the householder is declared the eldest among the ashramas.

title: Verse 3.79
content:
स संधार्यः प्रयत्नेन स्वर्गमक्षयमिच्छता ।
सुखं चेहेच्छताऽत्यन्तं योऽधार्यो दुर्बलेन्द्रियैः ॥ ३.७९॥ sa saṃdhāryaḥ prayatnena svargam akṣayam icchatā |
sukhaṃ ca iha icchatā' tyantaṃ yo 'dhāryo durbalendriyaiḥ || 3.79|| That which is to be firmly upheld through effort by one desiring imperishable heaven; that ultimate happiness which one desires here—such a state is unattainable by those whose senses are weak.

title: Verse 3.80
content:
ऋषयः पितरो देवा भूतान्यतिथयस्तथा ।
आशासते कुटुम्बिभ्यस्तेभ्यः कार्यं विजानता ॥ ३.८०॥ ṛṣayaḥ pitaro devā bhūtānyatithayastathā |
āśāsate kuṭumbibhyastebhyaḥ kāryaṃ vijānatā || 3.80|| Ṛṣis, ancestors, deities, beings, and guests—all command householders who understand duty to perform actions for them.

title: Verse 3.81
content:
स्वाध्यायेनार्चयेतऋषीन् होमैर्देवान् यथाविधि ।
पितॄंश्राद्धैश्च नॄनन्नैर्भूतानि बलिकर्मणा ॥ ३.८१॥ svādhyāyenārcayet ṛṣīn homair devān yathāvidhi |
pitṝn śrāddhaiś ca nṝn annair bhūtāni balikarmaṇā || 3.81|| One honors the Rishis through Svadhyaya, the Devas through Homa performed according to Vidhi, the Pitrs through Shraddha with offerings of food, and all beings through Bali karma.

title: Verse 3.82
content: कुर्यादहरहः श्राद्धमन्नाद्येनोदकेन वा । दद्यादहरहः पयोमूलफलैर्वाऽपि पितृभ्यः प्रीतिमावहन् ॥ ३.८२॥ kuryādaharahaḥ śrāddhamannādyenodakena vā | dadyādaharahaḥ payomūalphalairvā'pi pitṛbhyaḥ prītimāvahan || 3.82|| One must perform Shraddha daily with food or water, and likewise offer milk, roots, and fruits to the ancestors, ensuring their satisfaction and invoking their grace.

title: Verse 3.83
content: एकमप्याशयेद्विप्रं पित्र्यर्थे पाञ्चयज्ञिके । पित्र्यर्थं न चैवात्राशयेत्किं चिद्वैश्वदेवं प्रति द्विजम् ॥ ३.८३॥ ekam apy āśayed vipraṁ pitryarthe pāñcayajñike | pitryarthe na caivātrāśayed kiṁ cid vaiśvadevaṁ prati dvijam || 3.83 || In matters concerning ancestral rites within the five great sacrifices, even one Brahmin must be invited. However, in the context of offerings for the universal deities (Vaiśvadeva), no specific Brahmin should be exclusively invited for ancestral purposes.

title: Verse 3.84
content:
वैश्वदेवस्य सिद्धस्य गृह्येऽग्नौ विधिपूर्वकम् ।
आभ्यः कुर्याद्देवताभ्यो ब्राह्मणो होममन्वहम् ॥ ३.८४॥ vaiśvadevasya siddhasya gṛhye'gnau vidhipūrvakam |
ābhyaḥ kuryāddevatābhyo brāhmaṇo homamanvaham || 3.84|| Upon completion of the Vaiśvadeva ritual, the Brāhmaṇa shall perform homa in the domestic fire according to prescribed method, offering oblations to the respective deities continually.

title: Verse 3.85
content:
अग्नेः सोमस्य चैवादौ तयोश्चैव समस्तयोः ।
विश्वेभ्यश्चैव देवेभ्यो धन्वन्तरय एव च ॥ ३.८५॥ agneḥ somasya caivādau tayoścaiva samastayoḥ |
vizvebhyaścaiva devebhyaḥ dhanvantaraye eva ca || 3.85|| In the beginning, offerings are made to Agni and Soma, and also to both of them together; likewise, to all the gods collectively and specifically to Dhanvantari.

title: Verse 3.86
content:
कुह्वै चैवानुमत्यै च प्रजापतय एव च ।
सह द्यावापृथिव्योश्च तथा स्विष्टकृतेऽन्ततः ॥ ३.८६॥ kuhvai caivānumatyai ca prajāpataya eva ca | saha dyāvāpṛthivyor vyaḥ tathā sviṣṭakṛte 'ntataḥ || 3.86|| The invocation of Kuhu, Anumati, Prajapati, Dyavaprithivi, and Svistakrt establishes the sequential alignment of consciousness with cosmic order for the restoration of dharma through completion, not judgment.

title: Verse 3.87
content:
एवं सम्यग्विर्हुत्वा सर्वदिक्षु प्रदक्षिणम् ।
इन्द्रान्तकाप्पतीन्दुभ्यः सानुगेभ्यो बलिं हरेत् ॥ ३.८७॥ evaṁ samyagvihutvā sarvadiṣu pradakṣiṇam |
indrāntakāppatīndubhyaḥ sānugebhyo baliṁ haret || 3.87|| Thus having performed the sacrifice correctly, offering circumambulation in all directions, one shall offer oblations to Indra, Antaka, Aapati, and Chandra along with their followers.

title: Verse 3.88
content:
मरुद्भ्य इति तु द्वारि क्षिपेदप्स्वद्भ्य इत्यपि ।
वनस्पतिभ्य इत्येवं मुसलोलूखले हरेत् ॥ ३.८८॥ marudbhya iti tu dvāri kṣiped apsvadhy ity api | vanaspatibhya ity evaṃ musalolūkhale haret || 3.88|| One should cast out at the door those who speak falsely, and likewise those who speak divisively; similarly, one must remove from the threshing floor those who act destructively toward living beings and vegetation.

title: Verse 3.89
content:
उच्छीर्षके श्रियै कुर्याद्भद्रकाल्यै च पादतः ।
ब्रह्मवास्तोष्पतिभ्यां तु वास्तुमध्ये बलिं हरेत् ॥ ३.८९॥ ucchīrṣake śriyai kuryād bhadra-kālyai ca pādataḥ |
brhma-vāstospatibhyāṁ tu vāstu-madhye baliṁ hared || 3.89|| For the elevation of prosperity at the threshold, offerings are made; for auspicious time at the foundation, reverence is given. To Brahma and Vāstuśpati in the center of the dwelling, homage shall be offered.

title: Verse 3.90
content:
विश्वेभ्यश्चैव देवेभ्यो बलिमाकाश उत्क्षिपेत् ।
दिवाचरेभ्यो भूतेभ्यो नक्तञ्चारिभ्य एव च ॥ ३.९०॥ viśvebhyaśaiva devebhyo balim ākāśa utkṣipet |
divācarebhyo bhūtebhyo naktañcāribhya eva ca || 3.90 || Let oblations be offered into the sky for all beings—gods, day-wanderers, night-wanderers—and all creatures universally.

title: Verse 3.91
content: पृष्ठवास्तुनि कुर्वीत बलिं सर्वात्मभूतये । सर्वान्नभूतये पितृभ्यो बलिशेषं तु सर्वं दक्षिणतो हरेत् ॥ ३.९१॥ pṛṣṭhavāstuni kurvīta baliṃ sarvātmabhūtaye | sarvānnabhūtaye pitṛbhyo baliśeṣaṃ tu sarvaṃ dakṣiṇato haret || 3.91|| In all dwelling places, one shall offer Bali to all beings who are expressions of the Self. To all creatures, through Pitrs, whatever remains after Bali offerings shall be given completely towards the South.

title: Verse 3.92
content:
शूनां च पतितानां च श्वपचां पापरोगिणाम् ।
वयसानां कृमीणां च शनकैर्निर्वपेद्भुवि ॥ ३.९२॥ वयसां च śūnāṁ ca patitānāṁ ca śvapacāṁ pāparogiṇām |
vayasānāṁ kṛmīṇāṁ ca śanakair nirvaped bhuvi || 3.92|| vayasāṁ ca One must systematically and gradually disperse the remnants of those who have fallen from Dharma, including outcasts, sinners, the diseased, aged beings, and worms, upon the earth.

title: Verse 3.93
content:
एवं यः सर्वभूतानि ब्राह्मणो नित्यमर्चति ।
स गच्छति परं स्थानं तेजोमूर्तिः पथार्जुना ॥ ३.९३॥ evaṁ yaḥ sarvabhūtāni brāhmaṇo nityamarcatai |
sa gacchati paraṁ sthānaṁ tejomūrtiḥ pathārjunā || 3.93|| Thus, the Brahmin who perpetually worships all beings attains the Supreme Abode, becoming a luminous form upon the path of Arjuna.

title: Verse 3.94
content:
कृत्वैतद्बलिकर्मैवमतिथिं पूर्वमाशयेत् ।
भिक्षां च भिक्षवे दद्याद्विधिवद्ब्रह्मचारिणे ॥ ३.९४॥ kṛtva etad balikarma evam atithiṁ pūrvam āśayet | bhikṣāṁ ca bhikṣave dadyād vidhivid brahmacāriṇe || 3.94|| Having performed the sacrificial offering thus, one shall first receive the guest; and likewise, one shall give alms to the mendicant according to rule, and to the celibate student of sacred knowledge.

title: Verse 3.95
content: यत्पुण्यफलमाप्नोति गां दत्त्वा विधिवद्गुरोः । तत्पुण्यफलमाप्नोति भिक्षां दत्त्वा द्विजो गृही ॥ ३.९५॥ yat puṇya-phalam āpnoti gāṁ dattvā vidhivid guroḥ | tat puṇya-phalam āpnoti bhikṣāṁ dattvā dvijo gṛhī || 3.95 || That merit which accrues to a guru upon receiving a cow according to prescribed ritual, the same merit accrues to a householder dvija when he gives alms.

title: Verse 3.96
content:
भिक्षामप्युदपात्रं वा सत्कृत्य विधिपूर्वकम् ।
वेदतत्त्वार्थविदुषे ब्राह्मणायोपपादयेत् ॥ ३.९६॥ bhikṣām apy udapātraṁ vā satkṛtya vidhipūrvakam |
vedatattvārthaviduṣe brāhmaṇāya upapādayet || 3.96|| Even alms or a water vessel must be respectfully offered according to prescribed procedure to a Brahmin who knows the truth of the Vedas.

title: Verse 3.97
content:
नश्यन्ति हव्यकव्यानि नराणामविजानताम् ।
भस्मीभूतेषु विप्रेषु मोहाद्दत्तानि दातृभिः ॥ ३.९७॥ naśyanti havya-kavyāni narāṇām avijānatām | bhasmībhūteṣu vipreṣu mohād dattāni dātṛbhiḥ || 3.97 || When those who offer sacrifices and perform rituals lack discriminative knowledge, their offerings become nullified; similarly, gifts given in delusion to priests who have lost spiritual integrity are rendered void.

title: Verse 3.98
content:
विद्यातपस्समृद्धेषु हुतं विप्रमुखाग्निषु ।
निस्तारयति दुर्गाच्च महतश्चैव किल्बिषात् ॥ ३.९८॥ vidyātapassamṛddheṣu hutaṃ vipramukhāgniṣu |
nistārayati durgācca mahataścaiva kilbiṣāt || 3.98|| One who is enriched with knowledge and austerity, and whose offerings are accepted by the fire facing the Brahmin—such a being liberates from great sins and removes obstacles.

title: Verse 3.99
content:
सम्प्राप्ताय त्वतिथये प्रदद्यादासनौदके ।
अन्नं चैव यथाशक्ति सत्कृत्य विधिपूर्वकम् ॥ ३.९९॥ samprāptāya tvatithaye pradadyād āsanodake .
annaṃ caiva yathāśakti satkṛtya vidhipūrvakam .. To the arrived guest, one shall offer seat and water. Food too, according to capacity, respectfully and in accordance with dharma.

title: Verse 3.100
content:
शिलानप्युञ्छतो नित्यं पञ्चाग्नीनपि जुह्वतः ।
सर्वं सुकृतमादत्ते ब्राह्मणोऽनर्चितो वसन् ॥ ३.१००॥ śilānapyuñchato nityaṁ pañcāgnīnapi juhvataḥ |
sarvaṁ sukṛtamādatte brāhmaṇo'narcito vasan || 3.100|| One who resides without worship, yet unceasingly gathers from stones and offers into the five fires—such a Brāhmaṇa accepts all merit as his due by virtue of dwelling in non-reliance.

title: Verse 3.101
content:
तृणानि भूमिरुदकं वाक्चतुर्थी च सूनृता ।
एतान्यपि सतां गेहे नोच्छिद्यन्ते कदा चन ॥ ३.१०१॥ tṛṇāni bhūmirudakaṁ vākcatuthī ca sūnṛtā |
etānyapi satāṁ gehe nocchidyante kadā cana || 3.101|| Grass, earth, water, speech, and sweet words—these five elements of a righteous household are never to be severed or withheld from any being at any time.

title: Verse 3.102
content:
एकरात्रं तु निवसन्नतिथिर्ब्राह्मणः स्मृतः ।
अनित्यं हि स्थितो यस्मात्तस्मादतिथिरुच्यते ॥ ३.१०२॥ ekarātraṁ tu nivasannatithirbrāhmaṇaḥ smṛtaḥ |
anityaṁ hi sthito yasmāttasmādatithirucyate || 3.102|| A Brahmin residing for one night is designated as a guest, because his stay is impermanent.

title: Verse 3.103
content:
नैकग्रामीणमतिथिं विप्रं साङ्गतिकं तथा ।
उपस्थितं गृहे विद्याद्भार्या यत्राग्नयोऽपि वा ॥ ३.१०३॥ naikagrāmīṇam atithiṁ vipraṁ sāṅgatikaṁ tathā | upasthitaṁ gṛhe vidyādbhāryā yatrāgnayo'pi vā || 3.103|| One must recognize the presence of a guest who is a Brahmin, even if he comes from a single village or arrives in company; whether a wife is present or even fire is kindled in the house.

title: Verse 3.104
content:
उपासते ये गृहस्थाः परपाकमबुद्धयः ।
तेन ते प्रेत्य पशुतां व्रजन्त्यन्नादिदायिनः ॥ ३.१०४॥ upāsate ye gṛhasthāḥ parapākamabuddhayaḥ |
tena te pretya paśutāṃ vrajantyannādidāyinaḥ || 3.104|| Those householders who serve with clouded intelligence, offering what belongs to another without awareness, by that deed they descend into animalhood after death, becoming givers of flesh.

title: Verse 3.105
content: अप्रणोद्योऽतिथिः सायं सूर्यौढो गृहमेधिना । काले प्राप्तस्त्वकाले वा नास्यानश्नन् गृहे वसेत् ॥ ३.१०५॥ apraṇodyo'tithiḥ sāyaṁ sūryauḍho gṛhamedhinā | kāle prāptaḥ tvakāle vā nāsyānaśnan gṛhe vaset || 3.105|| An uninvited guest arriving at dusk or after sunset must not be refused food or shelter by the householder, whether he arrives at the proper time or not.

title: Verse 3.106
content:
न वै स्वयं तदश्नीयादतिथिं यन्न भोजयेत् ।
धन्यं यशस्यमायुष्यं स्वर्ग्यं वा�तिथिपूजनम् ॥ ३.१०६॥ na vai svayaṁ tadaśnīyād atithiṁ yanna bhojayet |
dhanyaṁ yaśasyam āyuṣyaṁ svargyaṁ vā'tithipūjanam || 3.106|| One who does not feed a guest who has come to their home must not eat themselves; honoring a guest brings prosperity, fame, longevity, and access to heaven.

title: Verse 3.107
content:
आसनावसथौ शय्यामनुव्रज्यामुपासनाम् ।
उत्तमेषूत्तमं कुर्याधीने हीनं समे समम् ॥ ३.१०७॥ āsanāvasathau śayyāmanuvrajyāmupāsanām |
uttameṣūttamaṃ kuryādhīne hīnaṃ same samam || 3.107|| In all seats of dwelling, in lying down, in following, in worship — among the superior, one should act with excellence; among the dependent, with humility; among equals, with equanimity.

title: Verse 3.108
content: वैश्वदेवे तु निर्वृत्ते यद्यन्योऽतिथिराव्रजेत् । तस्याप्यन्नं यथाशक्ति प्रदद्यान्न बलिं हरेत् ॥ ३.१०८॥ vaiśvadeve tu nirvṛtte yadyanyo'tithirāvrajeta | tasyāpyannaṁ yathāśakti pradadyānna baliṁ haret || 3.108|| When the Vaishvadeva rite has been completed, if another guest arrives, food should still be given to that guest according to one's capacity; no oblation should be withheld.

title: Verse 3.109
content:
न भोजनार्थं स्वे विप्रः कुलगोत्रे निवेदयेत् ।
भोजनार्थं हि ते शंसन् वान्ताशीत्युच्यते बुधैः ॥ ३.१०९॥ na bhojanārthaṁ sve vipraḥ kulagotre nivedayet |
bhojanārthaṁ hi te śaṁsan vāntāśītyucyate budhaiḥ || 3.109|| A Vipra must not declare his own birth-group or lineage for the purpose of obtaining food; one who does so, knowingly seeking alms under false pretenses, is declared by the wise as spiritually voided and consciousness-degraded.

title: Verse 3.110
content:
न ब्राह्मणस्य त्वतिथिर्गृहे राजन्य उच्यते ।
वैश्यशूद्रौ सखा चैव ज्ञातयो गुरुरेव च ॥ ३.११०॥ na brāhmaṇasya tvatithirgṛhe rājanya ucyate |
vaiśyaśūdrau sakhā caiva jñātayo guru eva ca || 3.110|| In the household of a Brāhmaṇa, no guest is to be deemed equal to a Kṣatriya; among guests, a Vaiśya or Śūdra, a friend, relatives, or even a guru hold no equivalence in status or entitlement within that sacred domain.

title: Verse 3.111
content:
यदि त्वतिथिधर्मेण क्षत्रियो गृहमाव्रजेत् ।
भुक्तवत्सु च विप्रेषु कामं तमपि भोजयेत् ॥ ३.१११॥ yadi tvatithidharmeṇa kṣatriyo gṛhamāvrajet | bhuktavatsu ca vipreṣu kāmaṃ tamapi bhojayet || 3.111|| When a Kshatriya enters a house in the manner of an uninvited guest, and the Brahmins therein have already eaten, that Kshatriya must still be offered food according to desire.

title: Verse 3.112
content:
वैश्यशूद्रावपि प्राप्तौ कुटुम्बेऽतिथिधर्मिणौ ।
भोजयेत्सह भृत्यैस्तावानृशंस्यं प्रयोजयन् ॥ ३.११२॥ vaiśyaśūdrāvapi prāptau kuṭumbe'tithidharmiṇau |
bhojayetsaha bhṛtyaistāvānṛśaṃsyaṃ prayojayan || 3.112|| When a Vaishya and a Shudra arrive at a household as guests entitled to hospitality, the householder shall feed them along with servants, thereby fulfilling the duty of non-cruelty.

title: Verse 3.113
content:
इतरानपि सख्यादीन् सम्प्रीत्या गृहमागतान् ।
प्रकृत्यान्नं यथाशक्ति भोजयेत्सह भार्यया ॥ ३.११३॥ itarānapi sakhya ādīn sampriyā gṛham āgatān |
prakṛtyannam yathāśakti bhojayet saha bhāryayā || 3.113|| One must feed guests, including friends and others who arrive at the home with affection, with natural food according to one's capacity, together with one's wife.

title: Verse 3.114
content:
सुवासिनीः कुमारीश्च रोगिणो गर्भिणीः स्त्रियः ।
अतिथिभ्योऽग्र एवैतान् भोजयेदविचारयन् ॥ ३.११४॥ suvasiniḥ kumariśca rogiṇo garbhiṇiḥ striyaḥ |
atithibhyo'gra evaitan bhōjayēdavičārayan || Women who are adorned, youthful, diseased, or pregnant shall be served food before guests without hesitation.

title: Verse 3.115
content: अदत्त्वा तु य एतेभ्यः पूर्वं भुङ्क्तेऽविचक्षणः । स भुञ्जानो न जानाति श्वगृध्रैर्जग्धिमात्मनः ॥ ३.११५॥ adattvā tu ya etebhyaḥ pūrvaṃ bhuṅkte'vicakṣaṇaḥ | sa bhuñjāno na jānāti śvagṛdhrair jagdhim ātmanaḥ || 3.115|| One who, without giving, consumes before these beings what is rightfully theirs, acts without discernment. While consuming, he does not realize that he himself shall be consumed by dogs and vultures.

title: Verse 3.116
content:
भुक्तवत्स्वथ विप्रेषु स्वेषु भृत्येषु चैव हि ।
भुञ्जीयातां ततः पश्चादवशिष्टं तु दम्पती ॥ ३.११६॥ bhuktavatsva atha vipreṣu sveṣu bhṛtyeṣu caiva hi |
bhuñjīyātāṁ tataḥ paścād avaśiṣṭaṁ tu dampatī || 3.116|| After feeding the Brahmins, one's own servants, and other dependents, the remainder shall be enjoyed by the married couple.

title: Verse 3.117
content:
देवान् ऋषीन् मनुष्यांश्च पितॄन् गृह्याश्च देवताः ।
पूजयित्वा ततः पश्चाद्गृहस्थः शेषभुग्भवेत् ॥ ३.११७॥ devān ṛṣīn manuṣyāṃś ca pitṝn gṛhyāś ca devatāḥ |
pūjayitvā tataḥ paścād gṛhasthaḥ śeṣabhug bhavet || 3.117 || Having honored the Devatas, Rishis, ancestors, household deities, and all beings according to their capacity and relation, the householder becomes entitled to enjoy the remaining fruits of action.

title: Verse 3.118
content:
अघं स केवलं भुङ्क्ते यः पचत्यात्मकारणात् ।
यज्ञशिष्टाशनं ह्येतत्सतामन्नं विधीयते ॥ ३.११८॥ aghaṃ sa kevalaṃ bhuṅkte yaḥ pacatyātmakāraṇāt |
yajñaśiṣṭāśanaṃ hyetatsatāmannā vidhīyate || 3.118|| He alone consumes sin who cooks food for himself without offering it in sacrifice; food remaining after sacrifice is ordained as the proper nourishment for those established in truth.

title: Verse 3.119
content:
राजर्त्विग्स्नातकगुरून् प्रियश्वशुरमातुलान् ।
अर्हयेन् मधुपर्केण परिसंवत्सरात्पुनः ॥ ३.११९॥ rājar tvig snātakagurūn priyaśvaśuramātalān |
arhayen madhuparkeṇa parisamvatsarātpunaḥ || 3.119|| The King shall honor again, after the completion of a full year, the priests, the graduated scholars, the revered father-in-law, and maternal uncles with the Madhuparka ceremony.

title: Verse 3.120
content: राजा च श्रोत्रियश्चैव यज्ञकर्मण्युपस्थितौ । उपस्थिते मधुपर्केण सम्पूज्यौ न त्वयज्ञ इति स्थितिः ॥ ३.१२०॥ rājā ca śrotriyaścaiva yajñakarmaṇyupasthitau | upasthite madhuparkeṇa sampūjyau na tvayajña iti sthitiḥ || 3.120 || When the King and the Shrotriya are present at a sacrificial ritual, they shall be honored with Madhuparka; however, their presence does not constitute the performance of the Yajna itself.

title: Verse 3.121
content:
सायं त्वन्नस्य सिद्धस्य पत्न्यमन्त्रं बलिं हरेत् ।
वैश्वदेवं हि नामैतत्सायं प्रातर्विधीयते ॥ ३.१२१॥ sāyaṁ tvannasya siddhasya patnyamantraṁ baliṁ haret |
vaiśvadevaṁ hi nāmaitat sāyaṁ prātarvidhīyate || 3.121|| When food has been prepared in the evening by a perfected householder, the wife shall offer oblation with mantra at the time of dusk. This ritual is called Vaiśvadeva and is performed both in the evening and morning.

title: Verse 3.122
content: पितृयज्ञं तु निर्वर्त्य विप्रश्चन्द्रक्षयेऽग्निमान् । चैन्दुक्षये पिण्डान्वाहार्यकं श्राद्धं कुर्यान् मासानुमासिकम् ॥ ३.१२२॥ pitṛyajñaṃ tu nirvartya vipraś candrakṣaye'gnimān | caindu-kṣaye piṇḍānvāhāryakaṃ śrāddhaṃ kuryān māsānumāsikam || 3.122|| Having performed the sacrifice to the ancestors, a twice-born man who maintains the sacred fire shall perform the monthly Śrāddha offering during the waning phase of the moon, specifically when the moon enters the asterism associated with the Pitṛs.

title: Verse 3.123
content: पितॄणां मासिकं श्राद्धमन्वाहार्यं विदुर्बुधाः । तच्चामिषेणा कर्तव्यं प्रशस्तेन प्रयत्नतः ॥ ३.१२3॥ pitṝṇāṁ māsikaṁ śrāddham anvāhāryaṁ vidurbudhāḥ | tacca ammiṣeṇa kartavyaṁ praśastena prayatnataḥ || 3.123|| The monthly Śrāddha for ancestors is to be performed by those who know; it must be conducted with pure intent, careful effort, and appropriate offerings.

title: Verse 3.124
content:
तत्र ये भोजनीयाः स्युर्ये च वर्ज्या द्विजोत्तमाः ।
यावन्तश्चैव यैश्चान्नैस्तान् प्रवक्ष्याम्यशेषतः ॥ ३.१२४॥ tatra ye bhojanīyāḥ syurye ca varjyā dvijottamāḥ |
yāvantaścaiva yaiścānnaiḥ stān pravakṣyāmy aśeṣataḥ || 3.124 || Therein, O Supreme Twice-Born, those who are fit to be fed, those who must be avoided, and all beings nourished by various foods—these shall be declared completely.

title: Verse 3.125
content: द्वौ दैवे पितृकार्ये त्रीनेकैकमुभयत्र वा । पितृकृत्ये भोजयेत्सुसमृद्धोऽपि न प्रसज्जेत विस्तरे ॥ ३.१२५॥ न प्रवर्तेत dvau daive pitṛkārye trīnekaiakamubhayatra vā | pitṛkṛtye bhojayetsusamṛddho'pi na prasajjeta vistare || 3.125|| na pravarteta In matters concerning divine worship and ancestral duties, whether performed separately or together, even one who is highly prosperous must not indulge in excess. He should not initiate actions that lead to expansion beyond capacity.

title: Verse 3.126
content:
सत्क्रियां देशकालौ च शौचं ब्राह्मणसम्पदः ।
पञ्चैतान् विस्तरो हन्ति तस्मान्नैहेत विस्तरम् ॥ ३.१२६॥ satkriyāṁ deśakālau ca śaucaṁ brāhmaṇasampadaḥ |
pañcaitān vistaro hanti tasmānna iheta vistaram || 3.126|| Proper conduct, place, time, purity, and the qualities of a Brahmin—these five destroy expansion; therefore, one should not engage in excess.

title: Verse 3.127
content:
प्रथिता प्रेतकृत्यैषा पित्र्यं नाम विधुक्षये ।
तस्मिन् युक्तस्यैति नित्यं प्रेतकृत्यैव लौकिकी ॥ ३.१२७॥ prathitā pretakṛtyaiṣā pitryaṃ nāma vidhukṣaye |
tasmin yuktasyaiti nityaṃ pretakṛtyaiva laukikī || 3.127|| This well-known rite performed for the deceased, called 'Pitrya', is established for the continuity of lineage. One who is properly engaged in it attains perpetually the status of a Preta-Kriya performer within worldly existence.

title: Verse 3.128
content:
श्रोत्रियायैव देयानि हव्यकव्यानि दातृभिः ।
अर्हत्तमाय विप्राय तस्मै दत्तं महाफलम् ॥ ३.१२८॥ śrotriyāyaiva deyāni havyakavyāni dātṛbhiḥ |
arhattamāya viprāya tasmai dattaṁ mahāphalam || 3.128|| Offerings of Havya and Kavya must be given exclusively to the Śrotriya—one who has realized the Veda through direct experience and lives in accordance with that realization. To give to the most worthy Brahmin, the Arhat, brings supreme fruit.

title: Verse 3.129
content: एकैकमपि विद्वांसं दैवे पित्र्ये च भोजयेत् । भोजयन् पुष्कलं फलमाप्नोति नामन्त्रज्ञान् बहूनपि ॥ ३.१२९॥ ekaikam api vidvāṃsaṃ daive pitrye ca bhōjayet | bhōjayan puṣkalaṃ phalam āpnōti nāmantrajñān bahūn api || 3.129|| One who feeds even a single knower of the Name—whether in divine worship or ancestral offering—obtains abundant fruit; how much more so one who feeds many knowers of the Name.

title: Verse 3.130
content:
दूरादेव परीक्षेत ब्राह्मणं वेदपारगम् ।
तीर्थं तधव्यकव्यानां प्रदाने सोऽतिथिः स्मृतः ॥ ३.१३०॥ dūrādeva parīkṣeta brāhmaṇaṃ vedapāragam | tīrthaṃ tadhavekavyānāṃ pradāne so'tithiḥ smṛtaḥ || 3.130|| One who has mastered the Vedas shall be examined from a distance; in the act of giving sacred knowledge, he becomes the honored guest.

title: Verse 3.131
content:
सहस्रं हि सहस्राणामनृचां यत्र भुञ्जते ।
एकस्तान् मन्त्रवित्प्रीतः सर्वानर्हति धर्मतः ॥ ३.१३१॥ sahasraṃ hi sahasrāṇāmanṛcāṃ yatra bhuñjate |
ekastān mantravitpṛītaḥ sarvānarhati dharmataḥ || 3.131|| Where thousands of unworthy ones feast upon the offerings meant for the worthy, the one who knows the mantra, being pleased, lawfully deserves all of them.

title: Verse 3.132
content:
ज्ञानोत्कृष्टाय देयानि कव्यानि च हवींषि च ।
न हि हस्तावसृग्दिग्धौ रुधिरेणैव शुध्यतः ॥ ३.१३२॥ jñānotkṛṣṭāya deyāni kavyāni ca havīṃṣi ca | na hi hastāvasṛgdighdhau rudhireṇaiva śudhyataḥ || 3.132 || Offerings of knowledge, sacred hymns, and oblations must be directed exclusively toward those whose consciousness is elevated through wisdom; bloodshed upon the hands does not purify, nor does violence restore dharma.

title: Verse 3.133
content: यावतो ग्रसते ग्रासान् हव्यकव्येष्वमन्त्रवित् । तावतो ग्रसते प्रेतो दीप्तशूलर्ष्ट्ययोगुडान् ॥ ३.१३३॥ yāvato grasate grāsān havyakavyeṣvamantravit | tāvato grasate preto dīptaśūlṛṣṭyayoguḍān || 3.133|| As much as an uninitiated person consumes offerings meant for deities and ancestors without proper mantras, that much does a departed soul consume burning-hot substances like pointed stakes and molten lead in the afterlife.

title: Verse 3.134
content:
ज्ञाननिष्ठा द्विजाः के चित्तपोनिष्ठास्तथाऽपरे ।
तपःस्वाध्यायनिष्ठाश्च कर्मनिष्ठास्तथाऽपरे ॥ ३.१३४॥ jñānaniṣṭhā dvijāḥ ke cit taponiṣṭhās tathā'pare |
tapaḥsvādhyāyaniṣṭhāś ca karmaniṣṭhās tathā'pare || 3.134|| Among the twice-born, some are devoted to knowledge, others to mental purity; some are committed to austerity and study, while others are dedicated to action.

title: Verse 3.135
content:
ज्ञाननिष्ठेषु कव्यानि प्रतिष्ठाप्यानि यत्नतः ।
हव्यानि तु यथान्यायं सर्वेष्वेव चतुर्ष्वपि ॥ ३.१३५॥ jñānaniṣṭheṣu kavyāni pratiṣṭhāpyāni yatnataḥ |
havyāni tu yathānyāyaṃ sarveṣveva caturṣvapi || 3.135|| In those devoted to knowledge, sacred compositions must be established with dedicated effort; offerings, however, must be made according to justice in all four varnas equally.

title: Verse 3.136
content:
अश्रोत्रियः पिता यस्य पुत्रः स्याद्वेदपारगः ।
अश्रोत्रियो वा पुत्रः स्यात्पिता स्याद्वेदपारगः ॥ ३.१३६॥ aśrotriyaḥ pitā yasya putraḥ syād vedapāragaḥ |
aśrotriyas vā putraḥ syāt pitā syād vedapāragaḥ || 3.136 || Where the father is unversed in Vedic knowledge and the son is a knower of the Vedas, or where the son is unversed and the father is a knower of the Vedas, the duty of spiritual guidance shall flow from the learned to the unlearned, irrespective of generational order.

title: Verse 3.137
content:
ज्यायांसमनयोर्विद्याद्यस्य स्यात्श्रोत्रियः पिता ।
मन्त्रसम्पूजनार्थं तु सत्कारमितरोऽर्हति ॥ ३.१३७॥ jyāyāṁsam anayor vidyād yasya syāt śrotriyaḥ pitā | mantrasampūjanārthaṁ tu satkāram itaro 'rhanti || 3.137|| Among two individuals equal in age and learning, the father who is a śrotriya shall be honored first; however, for the purpose of mantra worship, the other deserves respectful treatment.

title: Verse 3.138
content:
न श्राद्धे भोजयेन् मित्रं धनैः कार्योऽस्य सङ्ग्रहः ।
नारिं न मित्रं यं विद्यात्तं श्राद्धे भोजयेद्द्विजम् ॥ ३.१३८॥ na śrāddhe bhojayen mitraṁ dhanaiḥ kāryo'sya saṅgrahaḥ |
nāriṁ na mitraṁ yaṁ vidyāttaṁ śrāddhe bhojayed dvijam || 3.138|| In the context of Śrāddha, one must not honor a friend merely through wealth or material engagement; nor should one regard as a true companion in ritual duty the person known to lack integrity. Only a twice-born who fulfills his dharmic capacity shall be honored at Śrāddha.

title: Verse 3.139
content: यस्य मित्रप्रधानानि श्राद्धानि च हवींषि च । तस्य प्रेत्य फलं नास्ति श्राद्धेषु च हविःषु च ॥ ३.१३९॥ yasya mitrapradhānāni śrāddhāni ca havīṃṣi ca | tasya pretya phalaṁ nāsti śrāddheṣu ca haviḥṣu ca || 3.139|| One whose Śrāddha ceremonies and offerings are conducted primarily by friends, not by family, gains no fruit in the afterlife from those rites or offerings.

title: Verse 3.140
content:
यः सङ्गतानि कुरुते मोहात्श्राद्धेन मानवः ।
स स्वर्गाच्च्यवते लोकात्श्राद्धमित्रो द्विजाधमः ॥ ३.१४०॥ yaḥ saṅgatāni kurute mohāt śrāddhena mānavaḥ |
sa svargāc cyavate lokāt śrāddhamitro dvijādhamaḥ || 3.140|| One who, out of delusion, performs rites for the dead without proper qualification or alignment with Dharma, falls from the realm of merit and becomes a betrayer of sacred duty, unworthy among the twice-born.

title: Verse 3.141
content:
सम्भोजानि साऽभिहिता पैशाची दक्षिणा द्विजैः ।
इहैवास्ते तु सा लोके गौरन्धेवैकवेश्मनि ॥ ३.१४१॥ sambhojāni sābhihitā paiśācī dakṣiṇā dvijaiḥ |
ihaivāste tu sā loke gaurandhevaikaveśmani || 3.141|| The offering designated as 'Paiśācī' is declared by the twice-born as consumable offerings; indeed, it resides in this world within the single abode of the Cow-and-God.

title: Verse 3.142
content:
यथैरिणे बीजमुप्त्वा न वप्ता लभते फलम् ।
तथाऽनृचे हविर्दत्त्वा न दाता लभते फलम् ॥ ३.१४२॥ yathairiṇe bījamuptvā na vaptā labhate phalam | 
 tathā'nṛce havirdattvā na dātā labhate phalam || 3.142 || Just as a farmer who sows seed in barren soil gains no fruit, so too one who offers oblations without proper reciprocity gains no fruit.

title: Verse 3.143
content:
दातॄन् प्रतिग्रहीतॄंश्च कुरुते फलभागिनः ।
विदुषे दक्षिणां दत्त्वा विधिवत्प्रेत्य चैह च ॥ ३.१४३॥ dātṝn pratigrahītṝś ca kurute phalabhāginaḥ |
viduṣe dakṣiṇāṃ dattvā vidhivat pretya ca iha ca || 3.143|| Those who give and those who receive in accordance with Dharma become partakers of the fruit; by offering dakshina to the knowledgeable, both in this life and the next, fulfillment is ensured.

title: Verse 3.144
content:
कामं श्राद्धेऽर्चयेन् मित्रं नाभिरूपमपि त्वरिम् ।
द्विषता हि हविर्भुक्तं भवति प्रेत्य निष्फलम् ॥ ३.१४४॥ kāmaṁ śrāddhe'rcayen mitraṁ nābhirūpam api tv arim | 
dviṣatā hi havi rbhuktaṁ bhavati pretya niṣphalam || 3.144 || In Śrāddha rituals, one should worship a friend even if he is not ritually pure, but never an enemy; food offered by one who bears hatred becomes fruitless after death.

title: Verse 3.145
content:
यत्नेन भोजयेत्श्राद्धे बह्वृचं वेदपारगम् ।
शाखान्तगमथाध्वर्युं छन्दोगं तु समाप्तिकम् ॥ ३.१४५॥ yatnena bhojayet śrāddhe bahvṛcaṃ vedapāragam |
śākhāntagam athādhvaryuṃ chandoğaṃ tu samāptikam || 3.145|| In Śrāddha rituals, one must honor with effort the Bahvṛca Veda-knower, the Adhvaryu who has mastered a Vedic branch, and the Saman-chanting priest who completes the liturgical sequence.

title: Verse 3.146
content:
एषामन्यतमो यस्य भुञ्जीत श्राद्धमर्चितः ।
पितॄणां तस्य तृप्तिः स्यात्शाश्वती साप्तपौरुषी ॥ ३.१४६॥ eṣāmanyatamo yasya bhuñjīta śrāddhamarcitaḥ |
pitṝṇāṃ tasya tṛptiḥ syātśāśvatī sāptapauruṣī || 3.146|| When any one among them, having been honored in the Śrāddha ritual, consumes the offering, the satisfaction of the ancestors becomes eternal and aligned with the sapta-puruṣa lineage.

title: Verse 3.147
content:
एष वै प्रथमः कल्पः प्रदाने हव्यकव्ययोः ।
अनुकल्पस्त्वयं ज्ञेयः सदा सद्भिरनुष्ठितः ॥ ३.१४७॥ eṣa vai prathamaḥ kalpaḥ pradāne havyakavyayoḥ |
anukalpastvayaṃ jñeyaḥ sadā sadbhiranuṣṭhitaḥ || 3.147|| This is the first ordinance concerning the offering of Havya and Kavya; this subsequent ordinance must always be followed by those established in Sat.

title: Verse 3.148
content:
मातामहं मातुलं च स्वस्रीयं श्वशुरं गुरुम् ।
दौहित्रं विट्पतिं बन्धुं ऋत्विग्याज्यौ च भोजयेत् ॥ ३.१४८॥ mātāmahaṁ mātulaṁ ca svasrīyaṁ śvaśuraṁ gurum |
dauhitraṁ viṭpatiṁ bandhuṁ ṛtvigyājyau ca bhojayet || 3.148|| One must nourish the maternal grandfather, maternal uncle, sister's son, father-in-law, spiritual teacher, daughter's son, paternal uncle, relatives, officiating priests, and those entitled to sacrificial offerings.

title: Verse 3.149
content:
न ब्राह्मणं परीक्षेत दैवे कर्मणि धर्मवित् ।
पित्र्ये कर्मणि तु प्राप्ते परीक्षेत प्रयत्नतः ॥ ३.१४९॥ na brāhmaṇaṁ parīkṣeta daive karmaṇi dharmavit |
pitrye karmaṇi tu prāpte parīkṣeta prayatnataḥ || 3.149|| One who knows Dharma does not examine a Brahmin in divine action; but when engaged in ancestral duty, one should examine with effort.

title: Verse 3.150
content: ये स्तेनपतितक्लीबा ये च नास्तिकवृत्तयः । तान् हव्यकव्ययोर्विप्राननर्हान् मनुरब्रवीत् ॥ ३.१५०॥ ye stenapatitaklībā ye ca nāstikavṛttayaḥ | tān havyakavyayorviprānanarhān manurabravīt || 3.150|| Those who are thieves, fallen, impotent, or of atheist conduct—such persons are unfit for participation in Vedic rituals or offerings, as declared by Manu.

title: Verse 3.151
content:
जटिलं चानधीयानं दुर्बालं कितवं तथा ।
याजयन्ति च ये पूगांस्तांश्च श्राद्धे न भोजयेत् ॥ ३.१५१॥ jaṭilaṃ cānadhiyānaṃ durbālaṃ kitavaṃ tathā |
yājayanti ca ye pūgāṃstāṃśca śrāddhe na bhojayet || 3.151|| One who is matted-haired yet unlearned, feeble-minded, deceitful, or a gambler, and those who summon others to feast—such persons are to be excluded from Śrāddha offerings.

title: Verse 3.152
content: चिकित्सकान् देवलकान् मांसविक्रयिणस्तथा । चिकित्सकादेवलकामांसविक्रयिणस्तथा विपणेन च जीवन्तो वर्ज्याः स्युर्हव्यकव्ययोः ॥ ३.१५२॥ cikitsakān devatakān māṁsavikrayiṇastathā | cikitsakādevatakāmāṁsavikrayiṇastathā vipaṇena ca jīvanto varjyāḥ syurhavyakavyayoḥ || 3.152|| Those who sustain life through the practice of medicine, those devoted to the service of deities in temples, and those who earn their livelihood by selling meat—these beings must be excluded from offerings made for the sake of Havir (ritual oblations) and Kavya (ancestral rites).

title: Verse 3.153
content:
प्रेष्यो ग्रामस्य राज्ञश्च कुनखी श्यावदन्तकः ।
प्रतिरोद्धा गुरोश्चैव त्यक्ताग्निर्वार्धुषिस्तथा ॥ ३.१५३॥ preṣyo grāmasya rājñaśca kunakhī śyāvadantakaḥ | pratiroddhā guroścaiva tyaktāgnirvārdhuṣistathā || 3.153|| One who is sent by the village or king, one with defective nose or dark teeth, one who opposes the teacher, and one who has abandoned fire worship or is a seller of salt—such persons are disqualified from participating in judicial or authoritative functions.

title: Verse 3.154
content:
यक्ष्मी च पशुपालश्च परिवेत्ता निराकृतिः ।
ब्रह्मद्विष्परिवित्तिश्च गणाभ्यन्तर एव च ॥ ३.१५४॥ yakṣmī ca paśupālaśca parivettā nirākṛtiḥ | brahmadviparivittiśca gaṇābhyantara eva ca || 3.154|| Those afflicted by consumption, herders of cattle, circumambulators devoid of form, those who revile the Brahman, and those who dwell among groups without inner realization—these beings operate outside the dharmic capacity for conscious alignment.

title: Verse 3.155
content: कुशीलवोऽवकीर्णी च वृषलीपतिरेव च । पौनर्भवश्च काणश्च यस्य चौपपतिर्गृहे ॥ ३.१५५॥ kuśīlavō'vakīrṇī ca vṛṣalīpatirēva ca | paunarbhavaśca kāṇaśca yasya caupapatirgṛhē || 3.155|| One whose household includes a eunuch, outcaste, tribal chief, remarried woman, blind person, or illegitimate child shall be excluded from ritual and civic participation until restoration of dharmic order within the household.

title: Verse 3.156
content:
भृतकाध्यापको यश्च भृतकाध्यापितस्तथा ।
शूद्रशिष्यो गुरुश्चैव वाग्दुष्टः कुण्डगोलकौ ॥ ३.१५६॥ bhṛtakādhyāpako yaśca bhṛtakādhyāpitastathā |
śūdraśiṣyo guruścaiva vāgduṣṭaḥ kuṇḍagolakau || 3.156|| One who teaches for hire and one who is taught for hire; a Śūdra student and a Guru who transgress Vāk-dharma—these four are spiritually degraded and constitutionally misaligned.

title: Verse 3.157
content: अकारणे परित्यक्ता मातापित्रोर्गुरोस्तथा । अकारणपरित्यक्ता ब्राह्मैर्यौनैश्च सम्बन्धैः संयोगं पतितैर्गतः ॥ ३.१५७॥ akāraṇe parityaktā mātāpitror guror atha | akāraṇa parityaktā brāhma yonaiś ca sambandhaiḥ saṃyogaṃ patitair gataḥ || 3.157 || One who has been abandoned without cause by parents or guru, and who has also been forsaken by those born of the same womb and connected through sacred bonds—such a person enters into union with the fallen.

title: Verse 3.158
content:
अगारदाही गरदः कुण्डाशी सोमविक्रयी ।
समुद्रयायी बन्दी च तैलिकः कूटकारकः ॥ ३.१५८॥ agāradāhī gardaḥ kuṇḍāśī somavikrayī |
samudrayāyī bandī ca tailikaḥ kūṭakārakaḥ || 3.158|| One who sets fire to a house, sells poison, cooks in oil, sells soma, travels by sea, keeps bondsmen, or engages in deceit—these acts sever one's alignment with Dharma and disrupt cosmic integrity.

title: Verse 3.159
content:
पित्रा विवदमानश्च कितवो मद्यपस्तथा ।
पापरोग्यभिशस्तश्च दाम्भिको रसविक्रयी ॥ ३.१५९॥ pitṛā vivadamānaśca kitavo madyapastathā |
pāparogya-bhiśastaśca dāmbhiko rasavikrayī || 3.159|| One who disputes with the father, one addicted to gambling and alcohol, one afflicted by disease due to past misdeeds, one who falsely poses as virtuous, and one who sells essence or sacred substances—these beings have lost alignment with their foundational capacity for dharma.

title: Verse 3.160
content:
धनुःशराणां कर्ता च यश्चाग्रेदिधिषूपतिः ।
मित्रध्रुग्द्यूतवृत्तिश्च पुत्राचार्यस्तथैव च ॥ ३.१६०॥ dhanuḥśarāṇāṃ kartā ca yaś cāgredidhiṣūpatiḥ |
mitradhrukdyūtavṛttiś ca putrācāryastathaiva ca || 3.160|| He who initiates the use of weapons, leads in ritual kindling, engages in treacherous gambling, or instructs a son or student in destructive conduct—such persons bear full causal-authority for consequences arising therefrom.

title: Verse 3.161
content:
भ्रामरी गण्डमाली च श्वित्र्यथो पिशुनस्तथा ।
उन्मत्तोऽन्धश्च वर्ज्याः स्युर्वेदनिन्दक एव च ॥ ३.१६१॥ bhrāmarī gaṇḍamālī ca śvistryatho piśunastathā |
umatto'ndhaśca varjyāḥ syur vedanindaka eva ca || 3.161|| Those who defame the Vedas, along with those afflicted by leprosy, chronic skin conditions, insanity, blindness, or slanderers—these are to be excluded from participation in sacred rites and societal integration until completion of restorative alignment.

title: Verse 3.162
content:
हस्तिगोऽश्वौष्ट्रदमको नक्षत्रैर्यश्च जीवति ।
पक्षिणां पोषको यश्च युद्धाचार्यस्तथैव च ॥ ३.१६२॥ hastigō'śvauṣṭradamakō nakṣatriryaśca jīvati |
pakṣiṇāṁ pōṣakō yaśca yuddhācāryastathaiva ca || 3.162|| He who sustains elephants, cows, horses, donkeys, and those who live by the stars; he who nourishes birds and instructs in warfare—such beings are protectors of dharma through their sustaining capacity.

title: Verse 3.163
content:
स्रोतसां भेदको यश्च तेषां चावरणे रतः ।
गृहसंवेशको दूतो वृक्षारोपक एव च ॥ ३.१६३॥ srotasāṁ bhedako yaś ca teṣāṁ cāvaraṇe rataḥ |
gṛhasaṁveśako dūto vṛkṣāropaka eva ca || 3.163 || One who breaches channels of flow, delights in concealing them, arranges homes unlawfully, acts as messenger of deceit, or plants trees without dharmic alignment—such a being disrupts natural and social order through conscious misalignment.

title: Verse 3.164
content:
श्वक्रीडी श्येनजीवी च कन्यादूषक एव च ।
हिंस्रो वृषलवृत्तिश्च गणानां चैव याजकः ॥ ३.१६४॥ śvakrīḍī śyenajīvī ca kanyādūṣaka eva ca |
hinsro vṛṣalavṛttiśca gaṇānāṃ caiva yājakaḥ || 3.164|| One who engages in dog-play, lives by predatory means, defiles the maiden, acts with violence, follows base conduct, or officiates in unlawful assemblies—such beings operate contrary to Dharma and forfeit alignment with cosmic order.

title: Verse 3.165
content:
आचारहीनः क्लीबश्च नित्यं याचनकस्तथा ।
कृषिजीवी श्लीपदी च सद्भिर्निन्दित एव च ॥ ३.१६५॥ ācārahīnaḥ klībaśca nityaṃ yācanakastathā | kṛṣijīvī ślīpadī ca sadbhirnindita eva ca || 3.165 || One devoid of righteous conduct, one lacking in spiritual strength, one who constantly begs, one who lives by agriculture, one born of a low-class union — all such persons are to be regarded as perpetually defiled when censured by the wise.

title: Verse 3.166
content:
औरभ्रिको माहिषिकः परपूर्वापतिस्तथा ।
प्रेतनिर्यापकश्चैव वर्जनीयाः प्रयत्नतः ॥ ३.१६६॥ aurabhriko māhiṣikaḥ parapūrvāpatistathā | pretaniryāpakaścaiva varjanīyāḥ prayatnataḥ || 3.166|| Those who engage in bestiality, those who commit adultery with another's spouse, those who officiate funerary rites without authorization, and those who act as guides for the deceased—these individuals must be conscientiously avoided.

title: Verse 3.167
content:
एतान् विगर्हिताचारानपाङ्क्तेयान् द्विजाधमान् ।
द्विजातिप्रवरो विद्वानुभयत्र विवर्जयेत् ॥ ३.१६७॥ etān vigarhitācārānapāṅkteyān dvijādhamān .
dvijātipravaro vidvānubhayatra vivarjayet .. 3.167 .. One who is foremost among the twice-born, a knower of the Vedas, must completely avoid those of defiled conduct, those who are not part of the ritual community, and those who are degraded among the twice-born.

title: Verse 3.168
content: ब्राह्मणो त्वनधीयानस्तृणाग्निरिव शाम्यति । ब्राह्मणः ह्यनधीयानः तस्मै हव्यं न दातव्यं न हि भस्मनि हूयते ॥ ३.१६८॥ brāhmaṇo tvanadhīyānastṛṇāgniriva śāmyati | brāhmaṇaḥ hyanadhīyānaḥ tasmai havyaṃ na dātavyaṃ na hi bhasmani hūyate || 3.168 || A Brāhmaṇa who does not engage in Vedic study becomes extinguished like fire in grass; to such a one, oblations must not be offered, for no offering is made to ash.

title: Verse 3.169
content: अपाङ्क्तदाने यो दातुर्भवत्यूर्ध्वं फलौदयः । अपङ्क्त्यदाने दैवे हविषि पित्र्ये वा तं प्रवक्ष्याम्यशेषतः ॥ ३.१६९॥ दैवे कर्मणि apāṅktadāne yo dātur bhavaty ūrdhvaṁ phalodayaḥ | apaṅktyadāne daive haviṣi pitrye vā taṁ pravakṣyāmy aśeṣataḥ || 3.169 || daive karmaṇi When ritual offerings are made outside of proper collective alignment, the fruits that arise above belong to the giver; in divine action, whether through oblations or ancestral rites, I shall declare this completely.

title: Verse 3.170
content:
अव्रतैर्यद्द्विजैर्भुक्तं  परिवेत्र्यादिभिस्तथा ।
अपाङ्क्तेयैर्यदन्यैश्च तद्वै रक्षांसि भुञ्जते ॥ ३.१७०॥ avratairyad dvijaiḥ bhuktaṁ parivetryādibhis tathā | apāṅkteyair yad anyaiś ca tad vai rakṣāṁsi bhuñjate || 3.170 || That which is consumed by twice-born men without observing vows, or by others in improper contexts such as during Parivettṛ relationships, or outside the prescribed ritual order, becomes sustenance for Rakshasas.

title: Verse 3.171
content:
दाराग्निहोत्रसंयोगं कुरुते योऽग्रजे स्थिते ।
परिवेत्ता स विज्ञेयः परिवित्तिस्तु पूर्वजः ॥ ३.१७१॥ dārāgnihotrasaṃyogaṃ kurute yo'graje sthite |
parivettā sa vijñeyaḥ parivittistu pūrvajaḥ || 3.171|| He who engages in conjugal union while the elder brother remains alive is known as the Parivettā; the elder brother is designated as Parivitta.

title: Verse 3.172
content:
परिवित्तिः परिवेत्ता यया च परिविद्यते ।
सर्वे ते नरकं यान्ति दातृयाजकपञ्चमाः ॥ ३.१७२॥ parivittiḥ parivettā yayā ca parividyate |
sarve te narakaṃ yānti dātṛyājakapañcamāḥ || 3.172|| Those who acquire wealth through exploitation, those who facilitate its acquisition through ritualized deception, those who witness it without intervention, those who consume it knowingly, and those who distribute it for personal gain—all these beings descend into degradation by their own volitional misalignment.

title: Verse 3.173
content:
भ्रातुर्मृतस्य भार्यायां योऽनुरज्येत कामतः ।
धर्मेणापि नियुक्तायां स ज्ञेयो दिधिषूपतिः ॥ ३.१७३॥ bhrātur mṛtasya bhāryāyāṁ yo 'nurajyeta kāmataḥ .
dharmeṇāpi niyuktāyāṁ sa jñeyo didhiṣūpatiḥ .. 3.173 .. He who, out of desire, engages with the wife of a deceased brother—even when sanctioned by dharma—is to be known as a Didhisūpati.

title: Verse 3.174
content:
परदारेषु जायेते द्वौ सुतौ कुण्डगोलकौ ।
पत्यौ जीवति कुण्डः स्यान् मृते भर्तरि गोलकः ॥ ३.१७४॥ paradāreṣu jāyete dvau sutau kuṇḍagolakau |
patyau jīvati kuṇḍaḥ syān mṛte bhartari golakaḥ || 3.174 || From unions with another's spouse arise two sons—Kuṇḍa and Golaka; when the husband lives, Kuṇḍa is born; upon the husband’s death, Golaka is born.

title: Verse 3.175
content: तौ तु जातौ परक्षेत्रे प्राणिनौ प्रेत्य चैह च । ते तु जाताः परक्षेत्रे प्राणिनः दत्तानि हव्यकव्यानि नाशयन्ति प्रदायिनाम् ॥ ३.१७५॥ tau tu jātau parakṣetre prāṇinau pretya caiha ca | te tu jātāḥ parakṣetre prāṇinaḥ dattāni havyakavyāni nāśayanti pradāyinām || 3.175 || Those born in foreign lands, whether alive or deceased, cause the destruction of offerings made by donors in those very foreign territories.

title: Verse 3.176
content: अपाङ्क्त्यो यावतः पङ्क्त्यान् भुञ्जानाननुपश्यति । अपङ्क्त्यो यावतः तावतां न फलं तत्र दाता प्राप्नोति बालिशः ॥ ३.१७६॥ apāṅktyo yāvataḥ paṅktyān bhuñjānānanupaśyati | apāṅktyo yāvataḥ tāvatāṁ na phalaṁ tatra dātā prāpnoti bāliśaḥ || 3.176|| One who distributes food without observing those assembled in proper order, or according to improper measure, receives no merit thereby.

title: Verse 3.177
content: वीक्ष्यान्धो नवतेः काणः षष्टेः श्वित्री शतस्य तु । शतस्य च पापरोगी सहस्रस्य दातुर्नाशयते फलम् ॥ ३.१७७॥ vīkṣyāndho navateḥ kāṇaḥ ṣaṣṭeḥ śvittrī śatasya tu | śatasya ca pāparogī sahasrasya dāturnāśayate phalam || 3.177 || One who is blind receives nine-tenths of merit from a donor; one who is deaf receives six-tenths; one afflicted with leprosy receives one-tenth; one diseased with sin-born ailments nullifies the fruit of donation for the giver.

title: Verse 3.179
content:
वेदविद्चापि विप्रोऽस्य लोभात्कृत्वा प्रतिग्रहम् ।
विनाशं व्रजति क्षिप्रमामपात्रमिवाम्भसि ॥ ३.१७९॥ vedavid cāpi vipro 'sya lobhāt kṛtvā pratigraham |
vināśaṁ vrajati kṣipram āmapātram ivāmbhasi || 3.179|| Even a Vedic scholar Brahmin, if he accepts gifts out of greed, swiftly proceeds to ruin, like water poured into an impure vessel.

title: Verse 3.180
content:
सोमविक्रयिणे विष्ठा भिषजे पूयशोणितम् ।
नष्टं देवलके दत्तमप्रतिष्ठं तु वार्धुषौ ॥ ३.१८०॥ somavikrayiṇe viṣṭhā bhiṣaje pūyaśoṇitam |
naṣṭaṃ devalake dattam apratiṣṭhaṃ tu vārdhuṣau || 3.180 || One who sells Soma incurs excrement; the physician, pus and blood; what is given to a ruined temple is lost; and in the case of a courtesan, it has no stability.

title: Verse 3.181
content:
यत्तु वाणिजके दत्तं नैह नामुत्र तद्भवेत् ।
भस्मनीव हुतं द्रव्यं तथा पौनर्भवे द्विजे ॥ ३.१८१॥ yattu vāṇijake dattaṁ naiha nāmutra tadbhavet |
bhasmanīva hutaṁ dravyaṁ tathā paunarbhave dvijaḥ || 3.181|| Whatever is given to a merchant yields no fruit either in this world or the next; it is like wealth burnt to ash. Similarly, whatever is given to a twice-born who has fallen from his station avails nothing.

title: Verse 3.182
content:
इतरेषु त्वपाङ्क्त्येषु यथोद्दिष्टेष्वसाधुषु ।
मेदोऽसृङ्मांसमज्जाऽस्थि वदन्त्यन्नं मनीषिणः ॥ ३.१८२॥ itareṣu tvapāṅktyeṣu yathoddhiṣṭeṣvasādhuṣu |
medo'sṛṅmāṃsamajjā'sthi vadantyannaṃ manīṣiṇaḥ || 3.182|| In all other non-consecrated contexts where prescribed conduct is violated, wise ones declare that fat, blood, flesh, marrow, and bone constitute food.

title: Verse 3.183
content: अपाङ्क्त्योपहता पङ्क्तिः पाव्यते यैर्द्विजोत्तमैः । अपङ्क्त्यौपहता पङ्क्तिः तान्निबोधत कार्क्त्स्न्येन द्विजाग्र्यान् पङ्क्तिपावनान् ॥ ३.१८३॥ apāṅktyopahatā paṅktiḥ pāvyate yair dvijottamaiḥ | apāṅktyaupahatā paṅktiḥ tān nibodhata kārtsnyena dvijāgryān paṅktipāvanān || 3.183 || Those noble twice-born who purify the assembly even when it has been defiled by those outside its order—know them completely as the highest among the twice-born, the purifiers of the assembly.

title: Verse 3.184
content:
अग्र्याः सर्वेषु वेदेषु सर्वप्रवचनेषु च ।
श्रोत्रियान्वयजाश्चैव विज्ञेयाः पङ्क्तिपावनाः ॥ ३.१८४॥ agryāḥ sarveṣu vedeṣu sarvapravacaneṣu ca |
śrotṛyānvayajāścaiva vijñeyāḥ paṅktipāvanāḥ || 3.184|| Those who are first in all Vedas, first in all expositions, and also those born in families of listeners and knowers of the Veda—these purified ones among assemblies are to be recognized.

title: Verse 3.185
content:
त्रिणाचिकेतः पञ्चाग्निस्त्रिसुपर्णः षडङ्गवित् ।
ब्रह्मदेयात्मसन्तानो ज्येष्ठसामग एव च ॥ ३.१८५॥ triṇāciketaḥ pañcāgnistri suparṇaḥ ṣaḍ aṅga-vit .
brahma-deyātma-santāno jyeṣṭha-sāmaga eva ca .. One who knows the triple fire ritual, the fivefold flame, the threefold Suparna rite, and the six-limbed Vedanga disciplines; whose lineage originates from one granted Brahma-diksha, and who is foremost in Sama Veda recitation—such a being embodies the living continuity of realized Vedic authority.

title: Verse 3.186
content:
वेदार्थवित्प्रवक्ता च ब्रह्मचारी सहस्रदः ।
शतायुश्चैव विज्ञेया ब्राह्मणाः पङ्क्तिपावनाः ॥ ३.१८६॥ vedārthavitpravaktā ca brahmacārī sahasradaḥ |
śatāyuścaiva vijñeyā brāhmaṇāḥ paṅktipāvanāḥ || 3.186|| Those who know the meaning of the Vedas, who teach them, who live as celibates, and whose lifespan extends to a thousand years—such Brahmins are to be recognized as purifiers of the lineage.

title: Verse 3.187
content:
पूर्वेद्युरपरेद्युर्वा श्राद्धकर्मण्युपस्थिते ।
निमन्त्रयेत त्र्य़वरान् सम्यग्विप्रान् यथौदितान् ॥ ३.१८७॥ निमन्त्रयीत pūrvedyuraparedyurvā śrāddhakarmaṇyupasthite |
nimantṛayet tryavarān samyagviprān yathauditān || 3.187|| nimantṛayīta When the performance of Śrāddha is underway, whether on the previous day or the following day, three qualified Brāhmaṇas must be invited correctly according to the prescribed method.

title: Verse 3.188
content:
निमन्त्रितो द्विजः पित्र्ये नियतात्मा भवेत्सदा ।
न च छन्दांस्यधीयीत यस्य श्राद्धं च तद्भवेत् ॥ ३.१८८॥ nimantrito dvijaḥ pitrye niyatātmā bhavetsadā |
na ca chandāṃsyadhīyīta yasya śrāddhaṃ ca tadbhavet || 3.188|| The twice-born who is invited to a father's ritual must always remain self-controlled; he shall neither recite the Vedas nor perform Śrāddha for that father.

title: Verse 3.189
content:
निमन्त्रितान् हि पितर उपतिष्ठन्ति तान् द्विजान् ।
वायुवत्चानुगच्छन्ति तथाऽसीनानुपासते ॥ ३.१८९॥ nimantritān hi pitara upatiṣṭhanti tān dvijān |
vāyuvat cānugacchanti tathā'sīnān upāsate || 3.189|| Those who are invited by ancestors approach the twice-born; even as the wind follows its path, they follow and serve those seated in authority.

title: Verse 3.190
content: केतितस्तु यथान्यायं हव्ये कव्ये द्विजोत्तमः । कथं चिदप्यतिक्रामन् पापः सूकरतां व्रजेत् ॥ ३.१९०॥ ketitastu yathānyāyaṃ havye kavye dvijottamaḥ | kathaṃ cidapyatikrāman pāpaḥ sūkaratāṃ vrajet || 3.190 || When a twice-born being, despite rightful access to offerings and rituals, transgresses the law of dharma even slightly, that defiled one enters the state of a pig.

title: Verse 3.191
content:
आमन्त्रितस्तु यः श्राद्धे वृषल्या सह मोदते ।
दातुर्यद्दुष्कृतं किं चित्तत्सर्वं प्रतिपद्यते ॥ ३.१९१॥ āmantritastu yaḥ śrāddhe vṛṣalyā saha modate | dāturyadduṣkṛtaṃ kiṃ cittatsarvaṃ pratipadyate || 3.191|| One who, though invited, engages in the śrāddha ritual with a woman of impure lineage shall assume full karmic consequence of all wrongdoing committed by the donor.

title: Verse 3.192
content:
अक्रोधनाः शौचपराः सततं ब्रह्मचारिणः ।
न्यस्तशस्त्रा महाभागाः पितरः पूर्वदेवताः ॥ ३.१९२॥ akrodhanāḥ śaucaparāḥ satataṃ brahmacāriṇaḥ |
yastashastrā mahābhāgāḥ pitaraḥ pūrvadevatāḥ || 3.192|| Those who are free from anger, ever devoted to purity, constantly engaged in celibacy, have renounced weapons, and are of great fortune—such ancestors are to be honored as divine beings preceding the devas.

title: Verse 3.193
content: यस्मादुत्पत्तिरेतेषां सर्वेषामप्यशेषतः । ये च यैरुपचर्याः स्युर्नियमैस्तान्निबोधत ॥ ३.१९३॥ yasmat utpattir eteṣāṁ sarveṣām apy aśeṣataḥ | ye ca yair upacaryāḥ syur niyamais tān nibodhata || 3.193|| Because the origin of all these—completely and without remainder—is Brahman-Consciousness, know those regulations by which they are to be properly conducted.

title: Verse 3.194
content:
मनोर्हैरण्यगर्भस्य ये मरीच्यादयः सुताः ।
तेषां ऋषीणां सर्वेषां पुत्राः पितृगणाः स्मृताः ॥ ३.१९४॥ manor hiraṇyagarbhasya ye marīcyādayaḥ sutāḥ |
tēṣāṁ ṛṣīṇāṁ sarvēṣāṁ putrāḥ pitṛgaṇāḥ smṛtāḥ || 3.194 || Those who are the sons of Marīci and other mind-born sons of Brahmā, and who are recognized as the progeny of all those seers — these are designated as the groups of Pitṛs.

title: Verse 3.195
content:
विराट्सुताः सोमसदः साध्यानां पितरः स्मृताः ।
अग्निष्वात्ताश्च देवानां मारीचा लोकविश्रुताः ॥ ३.१९५॥ virāṭsutāḥ somasadaḥ sādhyānāṃ pitaraḥ smṛtāḥ |
agniṣvāttāśca devānāṃ mārīcā lokaviśrutāḥ || 3.195|| The progeny of Virat, the Somasadas, the Pitris of the Sadhyas, and the Agnisvattas among the gods—these Marichas are renowned throughout the worlds as divine ancestors who sustain cosmic order through ancestral continuity.

title: Verse 3.196
content:
दैत्यदानवयक्षाणां गन्धर्वौरगरक्षसाम् ।
सुपर्णकिन्नराणां च स्मृता बर्हिषदोऽत्रिजाः ॥ ३.१९६॥ daityadānavayakṣāṇāṁ gandharvauragarakṣasām |
suparṇakinnarāṇāṁ ca smṛtā barhiṣado'trijāḥ || 3.196 || The progeny of Atri Ṛṣi, known as the Barhiṣadas, are remembered as the lawful originators of the Daityas, Dānavas, Yakṣas, Gandharvas, Uragas, Rakṣas, Suparnas, and Kinnaras.

title: Verse 3.197
content:
सोमपा नाम विप्राणां क्षत्रियाणां हविर्भुजः ।
वैश्यानामाज्यपा नाम शूद्राणां तु सुकालिनः ॥ ३.१९७॥ somapā nāma viprāṇāṁ kṣatriyāṇāṁ havirbhujḥ |
vaiśyānām ājyapā nāma śūdrāṇāṁ tu sukālinaḥ || 3.197 || Brahmins designated as Somapā, Kshatriyas as Haviṣ-bhujaḥ, Vaishyas as Ājyapā, and Shudras as Sukālinaḥ—each assigned specific ritual and societal roles in accordance with their inherent capacities and dharma.

title: Verse 3.198
content:
सोमपास्तु कवेः पुत्रा हविष्मन्तोऽङ्गिरःसुताः ।
पुलस्त्यस्याज्यपाः पुत्रा वसिष्ठस्य सुकालिनः ॥ ३.१९८॥ somapāstu kaveḥ putrā haviṣmanto'ṅgiraḥsutāḥ |
pulastyasyājyapāḥ putrā vasisthasya sukālinaḥ || 3.198|| Those born of Kavi are Somapas; those of Angiras are Havishmantas; those of Pulastya are Ajyapas; and those of Vasishtha are Sukalinas.

title: Verse 3.199
content: अग्निदग्धानग्निदग्धान् काव्यान् बर्हिषदस्तथा । अनग्निदग्धानग्निदग्धान् अग्निष्वात्तांश्च सौम्यांश्च विप्राणामेव निर्दिशेत् ॥ ३.१९९॥ agnidagdhānagnidagdhān kāvyān barhiṣadastathā | anagnidagdhānagnidagdhān agniṣvāttāṃśca saumyāṃśca viprāṇāmeva nirdiśet || 3.199 || Those Vedas which have been preserved through oral tradition without being committed to writing shall be attributed exclusively to the twice-born Brahmins, whether those texts were exposed to fire or remained untouched by it, including both the Agnishvatta and Saumya recensions.

title: Verse 3.200
content: य एते तु गणा मुख्याः पितॄणां परिकीर्तिताः । तेषामपीह विज्ञेयं पुत्रपौत्रमनन्तकम् ॥ ३.२००॥ ya ete tu gaṇā mukhyāḥ pitṝṇāṁ parikīrtitāḥ | teṣām apīha vijñeyaṁ putrapautramanantakam || 3.200|| Those principal lineages of the Pitṛs, renowned and established, shall perpetuate through sons and grandsons without end.

title: Verse 3.201
content:
ऋषिभ्यः पितरो जाताः पितृभ्यो देवमानवाः ।
देवेभ्यस्तु जगत्सर्वं चरं स्थाण्वनुपूर्वशः ॥ ३.२०१॥ ṛṣibhyaḥ pitaro jātāḥ pitṛbhyo devamānavāḥ |
devebhyastu jagatsarvaṃ caraṃ sthāṇvanupūrvaśaḥ || 3.201|| From the Ṛṣis arose the Pitṛs; from the Pitṛs, the Gods and Men; from the Gods, all moving and unmoving beings in sequential manifestation.

title: Verse 3.202
content:
राजतैर्भाजनैरेषामथो वा रजतान्वितैः ।
वार्यपि श्रद्धया दत्तमक्षयायौपकल्पते ॥ ३.२०२॥ rājatair bhājanair eṣām atho vā rajatānvitaiḥ |
vāry api śraddhayā dattam akṣayāya upakalpate || 3.202|| When offerings are made with devotion—whether in vessels of gold, silver, or even mere water—they serve the eternal welfare and unfoldment of the recipient.

title: Verse 3.203
content:
दैवकार्याद्द्विजातीनां पितृकार्यं विशिष्यते ।
दैवं हि पितृकार्यस्य पूर्वमाप्यायनं स्मृतम् ॥ ३.२०३॥ daivakāryād dvijātīnāṁ pitṛkāryaṁ viśiṣyate |
daivaṁ hi pitṛkāryasya pūrvam āpyāyanaṁ smṛtam || 3.203|| Among the duties of the twice-born, service to the ancestors holds precedence over ritual acts performed for divine beings; such ancestral service is recognized as the primary nourishment that sustains all divine functions.

title: Verse 3.204
content:
तेषामारक्षभूतं तु पूर्वं दैवं नियोजयेत् ।
रक्षांसि विप्रलुम्पन्ति श्राद्धमारक्षवर्जितम् ॥ ३.२०४॥ teṣām ārakṣabhūtaṃ tu pūrvaṃ daivaṃ niyojayet |
rakṣāṃsi vipralumpanti śrāddham ārakṣavarjitam || 3.204|| Those who lack protection must first be aligned with divine order; without safeguarding rituals, protective forces dissipate and become destructive.

title: Verse 3.205
content:
दैवाद्यन्तं तदीहेत पित्र्याद्यन्तं न तद्भवेत् ।
पित्र्याद्यन्तं त्वीहमानः क्षिप्रं नश्यति सान्वयः ॥ ३.२०५॥ daivād yantaṁ tad īheta pitryād yantaṁ na tad bhavet |
pitryād yantaṁ tv īhamānaḥ kṣipraṁ naśyati sānvayaḥ || 3.205|| One who acts within the domain governed by divine will achieves that which is destined; one who acts under ancestral causation does not attain such result. But one who falsely assumes control within ancestral domains swiftly perishes along with his lineage.

title: Verse 3.206
content:
शुचिं देशं विविक्तं च गोमयेनोपलेपयेत् ।
दक्षिणाप्रवणं चैव प्रयत्नेनोपपादयेत् ॥ ३.२०६॥ śuciṃ deśaṃ viviktaṃ ca gomayenopalepayet |
dakṣiṇāpravaṇaṃ caiva prayatnenopapādayet || 3.206|| One must prepare a clean and secluded area, anointing it with cow dung, ensuring it slopes towards the south, and arranging it with utmost care.

title: Verse 3.207
content:
अवकाशेषु चोक्षेषु जलतीरेषु चैव हि ।
विविक्तेषु च तुष्यन्ति दत्तेन पितरः सदा ॥ ३.२०७॥ avakāśeṣu cokṣeṣu jalatīreṣu caiva hi |
vivikteṣu ca tuṣyanti dattena pitaraḥ sadā || 3.207|| In open spaces, in elevated places, on riverbanks, and in secluded spots—through such offerings, ancestors are always satisfied.

title: Verse 3.208
content:
आसनेषूपकॢप्तेषु बर्हिष्मत्सु पृथक्पृथक् ।
उपस्पृष्टौदकान् सम्यग्विप्रांस्तानुपवेशयेत् ॥ ३.२०८॥ āsaneṣūpakḷpteṣu barhiṣmatsu pṛthakpṛthak |
upaspṛṣṭaudakān samyagviprāṃstānupaveśayet || 3.208|| Upon properly prepared seats, each provided with sacred grass, the twice-born should be seated separately after having been sprinkled with purifying water.

title: Verse 3.209
content:
उपवेश्य तु तान् विप्रानासनेष्वजुगुप्सितान् ।
गन्धमाल्यैः सुरभिभिरर्चयेद्दैवपूर्वकम् ॥ ३.२०९॥ upaveśya tu tān viprān āsaneṣv ajugupsitān |
gandhamālyaiḥ surabhibhir arcayed daivapūrvakam || 3.209|| One must seat the Brahmanas upon clean seats without hesitation or aversion, and worship them first with fragrant garlands and perfumes as enjoined by divine ordinance.

title: Verse 3.210
content:
तेषामुदकमानीय सपवित्रांस्तिलानपि ।
अग्नौ कुर्यादनुज्ञातो ब्राह्मणो ब्राह्मणैः सह ॥ ३.२१०॥ teṣām udakam ānīya sapavitrāṁs tilān api |
agnau kuryād anujñāto brāhmaṇo brāhmaṇaiḥ saha || 3.210|| A Brāhmaṇa, having received permission from fellow Brāhmaṇas, shall bring water and sesame seeds with sacred thread, and perform the ritual in fire.

title: Verse 3.211
content:
अग्नेः सोमयमाभ्यां च कृत्वाऽप्यायनमादितः ।
हविर्दानेन विधिवत्पश्चात्संतर्पयेत्पितॄन् ॥ ३.२११॥ agneḥ somayamābhyāṃ ca kṛtvā'pyāyanam āditaḥ |
havirdānena vidhivat paścāt saṃtarpayet pitṝn || 3.211|| Having first offered oblations to Agni, Soma, and Yama, and having performed the ritual feeding properly, one shall afterward satisfy the ancestors through offerings.

title: Verse 3.212
content:
अग्न्यभावे तु विप्रस्य पाणावेवोपपादयेत् ।
यो ह्यग्निः स द्विजो विप्रैर्मन्त्रदर्शिभिरुच्यते ॥ ३.२१२॥ agnyabhāve tu viprasya pāṇāvevopapādayet |
yo hyagniḥ sa dvijo viprairmantradarśibhirucyate || 3.212|| In the absence of fire, the hands of a Brahmin shall serve as the sacrificial altar; for the fire itself is declared to be the twice-born, as proclaimed by the seer-knowers of mantra.

title: Verse 3.213
content:
अक्रोधनान् सुप्रसादान् वदन्त्येतान् पुरातनान् ।
लोकस्याप्यायने युक्तान् श्राद्धदेवान् द्विजोत्तमान् ॥ ३.२१३॥ akroḍhanān suprasādān vadantyetān purātanān | lokasyāpyāyane yuktān śrāddhadevān dvijottamān || 3.213 || Those who are free from anger, ever gracious in speech, and speak of ancient truths—these exalted twice-born beings, devoted to Shraddha, sustain the nourishment and expansion of all worlds.

title: Verse 3.214
content: अपसव्यमग्नौ कृत्वा सर्वमावृत्य विक्रमम् । आवृत्परिक्रमं अपसव्येन हस्तेन निर्वपेदुदकं भुवि ॥ ३.२१४॥ apasavyam agnau kṛtvā sarvam āvṛtya vikramam | āvṛta-parikramaṃ apasavyena hastena nirvaped udakaṃ bhuvi || 3.214 || Having placed the fire in the southern direction and covering all sides with sacred enclosures, one shall pour oblations using the left hand while circumambulating in reverse order.

title: Verse 3.215
content:
त्रींस्तु तस्माधविःशेषात्पिण्डान् कृत्वा समाहितः ।
औदकेनैव विधिना निर्वपेद्दक्षिणामुखः ॥ ३.२१५॥ trīṃstu tasmādhaviḥśeṣātpiṇḍān kṛtvā samāhitaḥ |
audakenaiva vidhinā nirvaped dakṣiṇāmukhaḥ || 3.215 || From the remainder of the oblation, three compacted portions shall be made by one who is composed; with the water-only method, facing southward, he shall offer them forth.

title: Verse 3.216
content:
न्युप्य पिण्डांस्ततस्तांस्तु प्रयतो विधिपूर्वकम् ।
तेषु दर्भेषु तं हस्तं निर्मृज्याल्लेपभागिनाम् ॥ ३.२१६॥ nyupya piṇḍāṃs tatastāṃstu prayato vidhipūrvakam |
teṣu darbheṣu taṃ hastaṃ nirmṛjyāl lepabhāginām || 3.216|| Having placed the sacred portions with due observance of ritual law, one shall cleanse the hand upon those darbha grasses which have received the remnants of oblation.

title: Verse 3.217
content:
आचम्यौदक्परावृत्य त्रिरायम्य शनैरसून् ।
षडृतूंश्च नमस्कुर्यात्पितॄनेव च मन्त्रवत् ॥ ३.२१७॥ ācamyaudakaparāvṛtya trirāyamya śanairasūn |
ṣaḍṛtūṃśca namaskuryātpitṝneva ca mant ravat || One shall face away from water, sip water thrice while chanting sacred utterances, then slowly offer salutations to the six seasons and to the ancestors as to deities.

title: Verse 3.218
content:
उदकं निनयेत्शेषं शनैः पिण्डान्तिके पुनः ।
अवजिघ्रेच्च तान् पिण्डान् यथान्युप्तान् समाहितः ॥ ३.२१८॥ udakaṁ ninayeśeṣaṁ śanaiḥ piṇḍāntike punaḥ |
avajighreca tān piṇḍān yathānyuptān samāhitaḥ || 3.218|| One should carefully collect the remaining water near the food-balls and inhale the scent of those food-balls with focused awareness, as they were offered.

title: Verse 3.219
content: पिण्डेभ्यस्त्वल्पिकां मात्रां समादायानुपूर्वशः । पिण्डेभ्यः स्वल्पिकां तानेव विप्रानासीनान् विधिवत्पूर्वमाशयेत् ॥ ३.२१९॥ piṇḍebhyastvalpikāṃ mātrāṃ samādāyānupūrvaśaḥ | piṇḍebhyaḥ svalpikāṃ tāneva viprānāsīnān vidhivatpūrvamāśayet || 3.219 || From the remnants of offerings, having taken a small portion in sequence, one should offer that same small portion to the seated Brahmanas according to prescribed procedure.

title: Verse 3.220
content:
ध्रियमाणे तु पितरि पूर्वेषामेव निर्वपेत् ।
विप्रवद्वाऽपि तं श्राद्धे स्वकं पितरमाशयेत् ॥ ३.२२०॥ dhriyamāṇe tu pitari pūrveṣām eva nirvapet | vipravad vā'pi taṃ śrāddhe svakaṃ pitaram āśayet || 3.220 || When the father is alive, offerings in Śrāddha must be made exclusively to the ancestors of previous generations; even if a Brāhmaṇa disputes this, he shall still honor his own father within the Śrāddha context.

title: Verse 3.221
content: पिता यस्य निवृत्तः स्याज्जीवेच्चापि पितामहः । पिता यस्य तु वृत्तः स्याज् पितुः स नाम सङ्कीर्त्य कीर्तयेत्प्रपितामहम् ॥ ३.२२१॥ pitā yasya nivṛttaḥ syāj jīvati ca pitāmahaḥ | pitā yasya tu vṛttaḥ syāt pituḥ sa nāma saṅkīrtya kīrtayet prapitāmaham || 3.221 || When the father has renounced and the paternal grandfather is alive, or when the father is active, one shall declare the name of the great-grandfather after proclaiming the father's name.

title: Verse 3.222
content:
पितामहो वा तत्श्राद्धं भुञ्जीतैत्यब्रवीन् मनुः ।
कामं वा समनुज्ञातः स्वयमेव समाचरेत् ॥ ३.२२२॥ pitāmaho vā taśrādhaṁ bhuñjītyabravīn manuḥ |
kāmaṁ vā samanujñātaḥ svayameva samācaret || 3.222|| The grandfather, or the executor of the śrāddha ritual, shall partake of it, declared Manu; or, having been authorized, one may perform it oneself.

title: Verse 3.223
content:
तेषां दत्त्वा तु हस्तेषु सपवित्रं तिलौदकम् ।
तत्पिण्डाग्रं प्रयच्छेत स्वधैषामस्त्विति ब्रुवन् ॥ ३.२२३॥ teṣāṃ dattvā tu hasteṣu sapavitraṃ tilaudakam |
tatpiṇḍāgraṃ prayacchet svadhā-eṣām astv iti bruvan || 3.223|| Having placed in their hands sesame-water sanctified by mantra, he shall offer to them the foremost portion of the rice-ball, saying, 'Let this be theirs through Svadhā.'

title: Verse 3.224
content: पाणिभ्यां तूपसङ्गृह्य स्वयमन्नस्य वर्धितम् । वर्द्धितम् विप्रान्तिके पितॄन् ध्यायन् शनकैरुपनिक्षिपेत् ॥ ३.२२४॥ pāṇibhyāṁ tūpasasaṅgṛhya svayamannasya vardhitam | vardhitam viprāntike pitṝn dhyāyan śanakairupanikṣipet || 3.224 || One who has increased in prosperity through their own effort shall offer a portion of that increase gradually to the twice-born and ancestors while maintaining remembrance of them.

title: Verse 3.225
content: उभयोर्हस्तयोर्मुक्तं यदन्नमुपनीयते । तद्विप्रलुम्पन्त्यसुराः सहसा दुष्टचेतसः ॥ ३.२२५॥ ubhayor hastayor muktaṁ yad annam upanīyate | tad vipralumpantyasurāḥ sahasā duṣṭacetasaḥ || 3.225 || Whatever food is brought near the mouths of both [the husband and wife] and released without being consumed—such offerings are immediately plundered by the asuras, those of corrupted consciousness.

title: Verse 3.226
content:
गुणांश्च सूपशाकाद्यान् पयो दधि घृतं मधु ।
विन्यसेत्प्रयतः पूर्वं भूमावेव समाहितः ॥ ३.२२६॥ guṇāṃśca sūpaśākādyān payo dadhi ghṛtaṃ madhu |
