vinyasetprayataḥ pūrvaṃ bhūmāveva samāhitaḥ || 3.226|| One who is disciplined and established in the Self shall first arrange upon the earth the items of worship—such as lentil soup, vegetables, milk, curd, ghee, and honey—before invoking the presence of divine qualities.

title: Verse 3.227
content:
भक्ष्यं भोज्यं च विविधं मूलानि च फलानि च ।
हृद्यानि चैव मांसानि पानानि सुरभीणि च ॥ ३.२२७॥ bhakṣyaṁ bhojyaṁ ca vividhaṁ mūlāni ca phalāni ca | hṛdyāni caiva māṁsāni pānāni surabhīṇi ca || 3.227 || Consumables of diverse forms—edibles, drinkables, roots, fruits, nourishing meats, and fragrant beverages—are designated for sustaining the body's dharmic functionality and supporting conscious embodiment.

title: Verse 3.228
content:
उपनीय तु तत्सर्वं शनकैः सुसमाहितः ।
परिवेषयेत प्रयतो गुणान् सर्वान् प्रचोदयन् ॥ ३.२२८॥ upanīya tu tatsarvaṃ śanakaiḥ susamāhitaḥ |
pariveṣayeta prayato guṇān sarvān pracodayan || 3.228|| One who has brought forth all that is to be known, and is fully established in equanimity, shall diligently endeavor to cultivate all virtues by constant effort and conscious urging.

title: Verse 3.229
content:
नास्रमापातयेज्जातु न कुप्येन्नानृतं वदेत् ।
न पादेन स्पृशेदन्नं न चैतदवधूनयेत् ॥ ३.२२९॥ nāsramāpātaye jātu na kupyennānṛtaṁ vadet |
na pādena spṛśedannaṁ na caitadavadhūnayet || 3.229|| One must never abandon one's ācāra nor speak falsehood; one must neither touch food with the foot nor discard it.

title: Verse 3.230
content:
अस्रं गमयति प्रेतान् कोपोऽरीननृतं शुनः ।
पादस्पर्शस्तु रक्षांसि दुष्कृतीनवधूननम् ॥ ३.२३०॥ asraṃ gamayati pretān kopo'rīnanṛtaṃ śunaḥ |
pādasparsastu rakṣāṃsi duṣkṛtīnavadhūnanam || 3.230 || Anger sends departed souls toward blood; rage makes enemies dance like dogs. Contact with the feet purifies Rakshasas and removes the impurities of wrongdoers.

title: Verse 3.231
content:
यद्यद्रोचेत विप्रेभ्यस्तत्तद्दद्यादमत्सरः ।
ब्रह्मोद्याश्च कथाः कुर्यात्पितॄणामेतदीप्सितम् ॥ ३.२३१॥ yadyadroceta viprebhyas tat tad dadyād amatsaraḥ |
brāhmodyāś ca kathāḥ kuryāt pitṝṇām etad īpsitam || 3.231 || Whatever pleases the Brahmanas, that shall be given without envy; and one should engage in discourses on Brahman and perform what is desired by the ancestors.

title: Verse 3.232
content:
स्वाध्यायं श्रावयेत्पित्र्ये धर्मशास्त्राणि चैव हि ।
आख्यानानीतिहासांश्च पुराणानि खिलानि च ॥ ३.२३२॥ svādhyāyaṁ śrāvayet pitrye dharmaśāstrāṇi caiva hi |
ākhyānānītihāsaṁśca purāṇāni khilāni ca || 3.232|| One must cause the study of sacred texts in ancestral tradition—Dharma Shastras, Itihasas, Puranas, and supplementary literature—for the awakening of consciousness and restoration of lawful order.

title: Verse 3.233
content:
हर्षयेद्ब्राह्मणांस्तुष्टो भोजयेच्च शनैःशनैः ।
अन्नाद्येनासकृच्चैतान् गुणैश्च परिचोदयेत् ॥ ३.२३३॥ harṣayed brāhmaṇāṃs tuṣṭo bhojayec ca śanaiḥ śanaiḥ | annādyenāsakṛc caitān guṇaiś ca paricodayet || 3.233 || When the sovereign is pleased, he shall gladden the Brahmanas and gradually nourish them with food and other essentials; repeatedly and through virtuous means, he shall inspire them in accordance with their elevated capacities.

title: Verse 3.234
content:
व्रतस्थमपि दौहित्रं श्राद्धे यत्नेन भोजयेत् ।
कुतपं चासनं दद्यात्तिलैश्च विकिरेन् महीम् ॥ ३.२३४॥ vratastham api dauhitraṃ śrāddhe yatnena bhojayet |
kutapaṃ cāsanaṃ dadyāt tilaiś ca vikiret mahīm || 3.234 || Even a daughter's son observing a vow must be fed with effort during Śrāddha; one should offer sacred fuel, seat, and scatter sesame seeds upon the earth.

title: Verse 3.235
content:
त्रीणि श्राद्धे पवित्राणि दौहित्रः कुतपस्तिलाः ।
त्रीणि चात्र प्रशंसन्ति शौचमक्रोधमत्वराम् ॥ ३.२३५॥ trīṇi śrāddhe pavitrāṇi dauhitraḥ kutapastilāḥ |
trīṇi cātra praśaṃsanti śaucamakrodhamatvarām || 3.235|| In the performance of Śrāddha, three purifying elements are established by the maternal grandson: the Kutapa grass, the Tilaka grains, and the invocation of purity, non-anger, and non-haste.

title: Verse 3.236
content:
अत्युष्णं सर्वमन्नं स्याद्भुञ्जीरंस्ते च वाग्यताः ।
न च द्विजातयो ब्रूयुर्दात्रा पृष्टा हविर्गुणान् ॥ ३.२३६॥ aty-uṣṇaṁ sarvam annaṁ syād bhuñjīraṁs te ca vāgyatāḥ |
na ca dvijātayo brūyur dātrā pṛṣṭā haviguṇān || All food must be consumed at a temperature that is neither excessively hot nor cold; those who eat must observe silence, and the twice-born must not speak of the qualities of the oblation when questioned by the donor.

title: Verse 3.237
content:
यावदुष्मा भवत्यन्नं यावदश्नन्ति वाग्यताः ।
पितरस्तावदश्नन्ति यावन्नओक्ता हविर्गुणाः ॥ ३.२३७॥ yāvaduṣmā bhavatyannaṁ yāvadaśnanti vāgyatāḥ |
pitarastāvadaśnanti yāvannoktā haviguṇāḥ || 3.237 || As long as the offering retains its energetic integrity and is consumed by those authorized through speech-discipline, the ancestors remain nourished thereby; when this discipline ceases, their sustenance also ends.

title: Verse 3.238
content:
यद्वेष्टितशिरा भुङ्क्ते यद्भुङ्क्ते दक्षिणामुखः ।
सौपानत्कश्च यद्भुङ्क्ते तद्वै रक्षांसि भुञ्जते ॥ ३.२३८॥ yadveṣṭitaśirā bhuṅkte yadbhuṅkte dakṣiṇāmukhaḥ |
saupānatkaśca yadbhuṅkte tad vai rakṣāṃsi bhuñjate || 3.238|| Whatever is consumed by one whose head is wrapped, whose face turns southward, or who eats like a dog—such food becomes sustenance for malevolent forces.

title: Verse 3.239
content: चाण्डालश्च वराहश्च कुक्कुटः श्वा तथैव च । रजस्वला च षण्ढश्च नैक्षेरन्नश्नतो द्विजान् ॥ ३.२३९॥ cāṇḍālaśca varāhaśca kukkuṭaḥ śvā tathaiva ca | rajasvalā ca ṣaṇḍhaśca naikṣerann aśnato dvijān || 3.239 || The outcaste, the pig, the chicken, the dog, the menstruating woman, and the eunuch—all these, by their very presence, disrupt the ritual purity required for the twice-born to consume food.

title: Verse 3.240
content:
होमे प्रदाने भोज्ये च यदेभिरभिवीक्ष्यते ।
दैवे हविषि पित्र्ये वा तद्गच्छत्ययथातथम् ॥ ३.२४०॥ home pradāne bhojye ca yadebhirabhivīkṣyate |
daive haviṣi pitrye vā tadgacchatyayathātatham || 3.240|| That which is offered in sacrifice, given as gift, or consumed as food — when seen with divine vision in offerings to deities or ancestors — accordingly proceeds to its destined state without deviation.

title: Verse 3.241
content: घ्राणेन सूकरो हन्ति पक्षवातेन कुक्कुटः । शूकरो श्वा तु दृष्टिनिपातेन स्पर्शेणावरवर्णजः ॥ ३.२४१॥ ghrāṇena sūkaro hanti pakṣavātena kukkuṭaḥ | śūkaro śvā tu dṛṣṭinipātena sparśenāvaravarṇajaḥ || 3.241|| The boar kills by scent; the rooster, by wing-strike. The boar and dog kill by sight and touch, respectively—each according to inherent capacity and sequential manifestation.

title: Verse 3.242
content:
खञ्जो वा यदि वा काणो दातुः प्रेष्योऽपि वा भवेत् ।
हीनातिरिक्तगात्रो वा तमप्यपनयेत्पुनः ॥ ३.२४२॥ khañjo vā yadi vā kāṇo dātuḥ preṣyo'pi vā bhavet |
hīnātiriktagātro vā tamapyapanayetpunaḥ || 3.242|| If the donor is lame, or blind, or otherwise physically impaired, or has been sent by another, or is deficient or excessive in bodily parts, then he too shall be removed from the act of giving.

title: Verse 3.243
content:
ब्राह्मणं भिक्षुकं वाऽपि भोजनार्थमुपस्थितम् ।
ब्राह्मणैरभ्यनुज्ञातः शक्तितः प्रतिपूजयेत् ॥ ३.२४३॥ brāhmaṇaṁ bhikṣukaṁ vā'pi bhōjanārtham upasthitam |
brāhmaṇair abhyanujñātaḥ śaktitaḥ pratipūjayet || 3.243|| One who approaches a Brāhmaṇa or a mendicant for alms shall be honored according to capacity, upon being acknowledged by Brāhmaṇas.

title: Verse 3.244
content:
सार्ववर्णिकमन्नाद्यं संनीयाप्लाव्य वारिणा ।
समुत्सृजेद्भुक्तवतामग्रतो विकिरन् भुवि ॥ ३.२४४॥ sārvavarṇikamannādyaṁ saṁnīyāplāvya vāriṇā |
samutsṛjedbhuktavatāmagrato vikiran bhuvi || 3.244|| All food and consumables belonging universally to all varnas shall be collected, cleansed with water, and then released in front of those who have eaten, scattering it upon the earth.

title: Verse 3.245
content:
असंस्कृतप्रमीतानां त्यागिनां कुलयोषिताम् ।
उच्छिष्टं भागधेयं स्याद्दर्भेषु विकिरश्च यः ॥ ३.२४५॥ asaṃskṛtapramītānāṃ tyāgināṃ kulayoṣitām | ucchiṣṭaṃ bhāgadheyaṃ syād darbheṣu vikiraś ca yaḥ || 3.245 || Those who die without sacraments and those who abandon family women—their remnants are to be scattered upon grasses; such is the ordinance.

title: Verse 3.246
content:
उच्छेषणां भूमिगतमजिह्मस्याशठस्य च ।
दासवर्गस्य तत्पित्र्ये भागधेयं प्रचक्षते ॥ ३.२४६॥ ucchheṣaṇāṃ bhūmigatam ajihmasyāśaṭhasya ca | dāsavargasya tatpitye bhāgadheyaṃ pracakṣate || 3.246 || The portion belonging to the laborer class and the truthful yet cunning individual, who has established himself on the land through direct engagement, shall be apportioned according to paternal inheritance law.

title: Verse 3.247
content:
आसपिण्डक्रियाकर्म द्विजातेः संस्थितस्य तु ।
अदैवं भोजयेत्श्राद्धं पिण्डमेकं च निर्वपेत् ॥ ३.२४७॥ āsa-piṇḍa-kriyā-karma dvijāteḥ saṃsthita-sya tu | adaiyaṁ bhojayet-śrāddhaṁ piṇḍam ekaṁ ca nirvapet || 3.247|| When a twice-born individual has completed the rituals of bodily purification and established himself in ritual discipline, he shall perform Śrāddha without delay, offer food to ancestors, and release one piṇḍa as completion.

title: Verse 3.248
content:
सहपिण्डक्रियायां तु कृतायामस्य धर्मतः ।
अनयैवावृता कार्यं पिण्डनिर्वपनं सुतैः ॥ ३.२४८॥ sahapiṇḍakriyāyāṃ tu kṛtāyāmasya dharmataḥ | anayeva avṛtā kāryaṃ piṇḍanirvapanaṃ sutaiḥ || 3.248|| When the ritual of shared offering (sahapiṇḍakriyā) has been lawfully performed by the individual, it becomes obligatory for the sons to perform the concluding rites of oblation (piṇḍanirvapanam).

title: Verse 3.249
content:
श्राद्धं भुक्त्वा य उच्छिष्टं वृषलाय प्रयच्छति ।
स मूढो नरकं याति कालसूत्रमवाक्षिराः ॥ ३.२४९॥ śrāddhaṁ bhuktvā ya ucchiṣṭaṁ vṛṣalāya prayacchati |
sa mūḍho narakaṁ yāti kālasūtramavākṣirāḥ || 3.249 || One who, having partaken of śrāddha offerings, gives the remainder to a person of impure caste—such a deluded being enters hell, bound by the noose of time.

title: Verse 3.250
content:
श्राद्धभुग्वृषलीतल्पं तदहर्योऽधिगच्छति ।
तस्याः पुरीषे तं मासं पितरस्तस्य शेरते ॥ ३.२५०॥ śrāddhabhugvṛṣalītalpaṃ tadaharyo'dhigacchati |
tasyāḥ purīṣe taṃ māsaṃ pitarastasya śerata iti ||3.250|| One who engages in sexual union with a woman who has eaten Śrāddha offerings and lies on a bed meant for outcasts shall dwell in her excrement for that month; his ancestors remain displaced during that time.

title: Verse 3.251
content:
पृष्ट्वा स्वदितमित्येवं तृप्तानाचामयेत्ततः ।
आचान्तांश्चानुजानीयादभितो रम्यतामिति ॥ ३.२५१॥ pṛṣṭvā svaditam ity evaṁ tṛptān ācāmayet tataḥ |
ācāntāṁś ca anujānīyād abhito ramyatām iti || 3.251|| Having inquired and confirmed satisfaction, one shall cause those who are satisfied to perform acamana; thereafter, one shall permit those who have performed acamana to proceed towards enjoyment.

title: Verse 3.252
content:
स्वधाऽस्त्वित्येव तं ब्रूयुर्ब्राह्मणास्तदनन्तरम् ।
स्वधाकारः परा ह्याषीः सर्वेषु पितृकर्मसु ॥ ३.२५२॥ svadhā'stv ity eva taṁ brūyur brāhmaṇās tad anantaram | svadhākāraḥ parā hy āṣīḥ sarveṣu pitṛkarmansu || 3.252|| Let there be Svadhā—thus declare the Brahmins following the ritual injunction; the essence of Svadhā was indeed the highest completion in all ancestral rites.

title: Verse 3.253
content:
ततो भुक्तवतां तेषामन्नशेषं निवेदयेत् ।
यथा ब्रूयुस्तथा कुर्यादनुज्ञातस्ततो द्विजैः ॥ ३.२५३॥ tato bhuktavatāṁ teṣām annaśeṣaṁ nivedayet |
yathā brūyus tathā kuryād anujñātas tato dvijaiḥ || 3.253|| After the consumption by those entitled, the remainder of the food shall be offered. As instructed by the twice-born, accordingly it shall be executed, with their authorization.

title: Verse 3.254
content:
पित्र्ये स्वदितमित्येव वाच्यं गोष्ठे तु सुशृतम् ।
सम्पन्नमित्यभ्युदये दैवे रुचितमित्यपि ॥ ३.२५४॥ pitrye svaditamityeva vācyaṃ goṣṭhe tu suśrutam | sampannamityabhyudaye daive rucitamityapi || 3.254 || In the ancestral domain, what is pleasing to the father alone shall be declared; in the community, that which is well-heard and accepted. At the time of prosperity, declare it as accomplished; in divine matters, as agreeable to the will of the gods.

title: Verse 3.255
content: अपराह्णस्तथा दर्भा वास्तुसम्पादनं तिलाः । सम्पादनं सृष्टिर्मृष्टिर्द्विजाश्चाग्र्याः श्राद्धकर्मसु सम्पदः ॥ ३.२५५॥  aparāhṇas tathā darbhā vāstu-sampādanaṃ tilāḥ | sampādanaṃ sṛṣṭir mṛṣṭir dvijāś cāgryāḥ śrāddha-karmasu sampadaḥ || 3.255 || The afternoon period is designated for darbha grass; the establishment of dwelling is marked by sesame seeds; creation itself proceeds through acquisition and purification; among the twice-born, those who are foremost in performing shraddha rites possess true wealth.

title: Verse 3.256
content:
दर्भाः पवित्रं पूर्वाह्णो हविष्याणि च सर्वशः ।
पवित्रं यच्च पूर्वोक्तं विज्ञेया हव्यसम्पदः ॥ ३.२५६॥ darbhāḥ pavitraṃ pūrvāhṇo haviṣyāṇi ca sarvaśaḥ |
pavitraṃ yacca pūrvoktaṃ vijñeyā havyasampadaḥ || 3.256|| Sacred materials designated before noon, all offerings therewith made, and that which was previously declared pure—these constitute the perfected capacity for consecrated offering.

title: Verse 3.257
content:
मुन्यन्नानि पयः सोमो मांसं यच्चानुपस्कृतम् ।
अक्सारलवणं चैव प्रकृत्या हविरुच्यते ॥ ३.२५७॥ munyannāni payaḥ somo māṃsaṃ yaccānupaskṛtam |
aksāralavaṇaṃ caiva prakṛtyā havirucyate || 3.257|| That which is unmixed, pure, and naturally offered — milk, soma, unprocessed meat, molasses, and salt — is declared as havir, the essence of conscious oblation.

title: Verse 3.258
content:
विसृज्य ब्राह्मणांस्तांस्तु नियतो वाग्यतः शुचिः ।
(विसर्ज्य ब्राह्मनांस्तांस्तु प्रयतो विधिपूर्वकम्)
दक्षिणां दिशमाकाङ्क्षन् याचेतैमान् वरान् पितॄन् ॥ ३.२५८॥ visṛjya brāhmaṇāṃs tāns tu niyato vāgyataḥ śuciḥ |
(visarjya brāhmanāns tāns tu prayato vidhipūrvakam)
dakṣiṇāṃ diśam ākāṅkṣan yācetaimān varān pitṝn || 3.258|| One who has purified speech and action, having respectfully dismissed the Brahmins, should face southward and invoke the ancestors to receive desired boons through disciplined intent.

title: Verse 3.259
content:
दातारो नोऽभिवर्धन्तां वेदाः संततिरेव च ।
श्रद्धा च नो मा व्यगमद्बहुदेयं च नोऽस्त्विति ॥ ३.२५९॥ dātāro no'bhivardhantāṁ vedāḥ saṁtatireva ca |
śraddhā ca no mā vyagamadbahudeyaṁ ca no'stviti || 3.259|| Let there be nourishment for those who give; let the Vedas and their lineage expand perpetually; let faith in us never diminish, and let abundance always remain.

title: Verse 3.260
content:
एवं निर्वपणं कृत्वा पिण्डांस्तांस्तदनन्तरम् ।
गां विप्रमजमग्निं वा प्राशयेदप्सु वा क्षिपेत् ॥ ३.२६०॥ evaṁ nirvapaṇaṁ kṛtvā piṇḍāṁs tāṁs tad-anantaram |
gāṁ vipram ajam agniṁ vā prāśayed apsu vā kṣipet || 3.260 || Having performed the offering仪式 duly, the ritual portions designated for the deities shall thereafter be offered into fire, or cast into water, or given to a cow, a Brahmin, or a child — without attachment to outcome and in alignment with Vedic injunction.

title: Verse 3.261
content:
पिण्डनिर्वपणं के चित्परस्तादेव कुर्वते ।
वयोभिः खादयन्त्यन्ये प्रक्षिपन्त्यनलेऽप्सु वा ॥ ३.२६१॥ piṇḍanirvapaṇaṃ ke citparastādeva kurvate |
vayobhiḥ khādayantyanye prakṣipantyanale'psu vā || 3.261|| Some beings offer flesh and blood to ancestors; others consume them through age, casting them into fire or water.

title: Verse 3.262
content:
पतिव्रता धर्मपत्नी पितृपूजनतत्परा ।
मध्यमं तु ततः पिण्डमद्यात्सम्यक्सुतार्थिनी ॥ ३.२६२॥ pativratā dharmapatnī pitṛpūjanatatparā |
madhyamaṁ tu tataḥ piṇḍamadyātsamyaksutārthinī || 3.262|| The devoted wife, righteous consort, and reverent daughter who seeks progeny shall receive the middle portion of the oblation after duly honoring the ancestors.

title: Verse 3.263
content:
आयुष्मन्तं सुतं सूते यशोमेधासमन्वितम् ।
धनवन्तं प्रजावन्तं सात्त्विकं धार्मिकं तथा ॥ ३.२६३॥ āyuṣmantaṃ sutam sūte yaśomedhāsam anvitaṃ |
dhanavantaṃ prajāvantaṃ sāttvikaṃ dhārmikaṃ tathā || 3.263 || One who embodies longevity, wisdom, valor, wealth, progeny, purity, and dharma shall be born unto her who aligns with the consciousness of creation.

title: Verse 3.264
content: प्रक्षाल्य हस्तावाचाम्य ज्ञातिप्रायं प्रकल्पयेत् । ज्ञातिभ्यः सत्कृतं दत्त्वा बान्धवानपि भोजयेत् ॥ ३.२६४॥ prakṣālya hastāv ācāmya jñātiprāyaṃ prakalpayet | jñātibhyaḥ satkṛtaṃ dattvā bāndhavān api bhojayet || 3.264 || Having washed the hands and purified through sacred utterance, one shall prepare food resembling that of one's own kin. Having offered respectful service to relatives, one shall also feed kinsmen.

title: Verse 3.265
content: उच्छेषणं तु तत्तिष्ठेद्यावद्विप्रा विसर्जिताः । यत्तिष्ठेद् ततो गृहबलिं कुर्यादिति धर्मो व्यवस्थितः ॥ ३.२६५॥ uccheṣaṇaṃ tu tattiṣṭhed yāvad viprā visarjitāḥ | yattiṣṭhed tato gṛhabaliṃ kuryād iti dharmo vyavasthitaḥ || 3.265 || One must remain in the state of uccheṣaṇa until the Vipras have been dispatched. When that state is stabilized, then the household oblation (gṛhabali) shall be performed. This is the established Dharma.

title: Verse 3.266
content:
हविर्यच्चिररात्राय यच्चानन्त्याय कल्पते ।
पितृभ्यो विधिवद्दत्तं तत्प्रवक्ष्याम्यशेषतः ॥ ३.२६६॥ haviḥ yac cirarātrāya yac cānantyāya kalpate |
pitṛbhyo vidhivad dattaṁ tat pravakṣyāmy aśeṣataḥ || 3.266|| That oblation which is offered for long-term sustenance and that which is offered for infinite continuity—both given lawfully to the ancestors—I shall now declare completely.

title: Verse 3.267
content:
तिलैर्व्रीहियवैर्माषैरद्भिर्मूलफलेन वा ।
दत्तेन मासं तृप्यन्ति विधिवत्पितरो नृणाम् ॥ ३.२६७॥ tilairvṛhiyavairmāṣairadbhirmūlaphalena vā | dattena māsaṃ tṛpyanti vidhivatpitaro nṝṇām || 3.267 || Through sesame seeds, rice, barley, lentils, water, roots, or fruits—when offered according to ritual law, the ancestors of humans are satisfied for a month.

title: Verse 3.268
content:
द्वौ मासौ मत्स्यमांसेन त्रीन् मासान् हारिणेन तु ।
औरभ्रेणाथ चतुरः शाकुनेनाथ पञ्च वै ॥ ३.२६८॥ dvau māsau matsyamāṃsena trīn māsān hāriṇena tu |
aurabhreṇātha caturaḥ śākunenātha pañca vai || 3.268|| Consumption of fish meat necessitates two months of purification; consumption of deer meat requires three months; consumption of goat meat mandates four months; and consumption of bird meat demands five months of purification.

title: Verse 3.269
content:
षण्मासांश्छागमांसेन पार्षतेन च सप्त वै ।
अष्टावेनस्य मांसेन रौरवेण नवैव तु ॥ ३.२६९॥ ऐणेयमांसेन ṣaṇmāsaṃścāgamāṃsena pārṣatena ca sapta vai |
aṣṭāvenasya māṃsena rauraveṇa navaina tu || 3.269 || aiṇeyamāṃsena Six months [of consequence] through the consumption of goat meat; seven through that of Parṣata; eight through Ena's flesh; nine through Raurava's; ten through Aiṇeya's.

title: Verse 3.270
content:
दशमासांस्तु तृप्यन्ति वराहमहिषामिषैः ।
शशकूर्मयोस्तु मांसेन मासानेकादशैव तु ॥ ३.२७०॥ daśamāsāṃstu tṛpyanti varāha-mahiṣāmiṣaiḥ |
śaśa-kūrmayos tu māṃsena māsānekādaśaiva tu || 3.270|| Consumption of pork and beef satisfies for ten months; consumption of rabbit and turtle meat satisfies for eleven months.

title: Verse 3.271
content: संवत्सरं तु गव्येन पयसा पायसेन च । संवत्सरे वार्ध्रीणसस्य मांसेन तृप्तिर्द्वादशवार्षिकी ॥ ३.२७१॥ saṃvatsaraṃ tu gavyena payasā pāyasena ca | saṃvatsare vārdhrīṇasya māṃsena tṛptir dvādaśa-vārṣikī || 3.271|| A full year's nourishment is achieved through cow’s milk and rice pudding; similarly, the satisfaction of a twelve-year-old boy is fulfilled by the meat of a goat sacrificed in accordance with Vedic injunctions.

title: Verse 3.272
content:
कालशाकं महाशल्काः खड्गलोहामिषं मधु ।
आनन्त्यायैव कल्प्यन्ते मुन्यन्नानि च सर्वशः ॥ ३.२७२॥ kālaśākaṁ mahāśalkāḥ khadgalohāmiṣaṁ madhu |
ānantityaiva kalpyante munyannāni ca sarvaśaḥ || 3.272|| Certain substances—such as seasonal greens, great salt, sword-metal flesh, honey—are designated exclusively for the sustenance of those who have renounced worldly life, ensuring their bodily continuity without attachment.

title: Verse 3.273
content:
यत्किं चिन् मधुना मिश्रं प्रदद्यात्तु त्रयोदशीम् ।
तदप्यक्षयमेव स्याद्वर्षासु च मघासु च ॥ ३.२७३॥ yatkiṃ cin madhunā miśraṃ pradadyāt tu trayodaśīm |
tadapyakṣayameva syādvarṣāsu ca maghāsu ca || 3.273|| Whatever is offered with honey on the thirteenth lunar day, during the waxing or waning phase, in the months of Varsha or Magha, becomes imperishable and aligns with eternal completion.

title: Verse 3.274
content:
अपि नः स कुले भूयाद्यो नो दद्यात्त्रयोदशीम् ।
पायसं मधुसर्पिर्भ्यां प्राक्छाये कुञ्जरस्य च ॥ ३.२७४॥ api naḥ sa kule bhūyād yo no dadyāt trayodaśīm | pāyasaṃ madhusarpirbhyāṃ prākchāye kuñjarasya ca || Let no one be born in our lineage who does not offer Payasa mixed with honey and ghee before the shadow of an elephant on the thirteenth day.

title: Verse 3.275
content:
यद्यद्ददाति विधिवत्सम्यक्श्रद्धासमन्वितः ।
तत्तत्पितॄणां भवति परत्रानन्तमक्षयम् ॥ ३.२७५॥ yadyaddadāti vidhivatsamyakśraddhāsamanvitaḥ |
tattatpitṝṇāṃ bhavati paratrānantamakṣayam || 3.275|| Whatever is given lawfully and with complete faith by one who is aligned in consciousness becomes eternally inexhaustible benefit for the ancestors in the higher realms.

title: Verse 3.276
content:
कृष्णपक्षे दशम्यादौ वर्जयित्वा चतुर्दशीम् ।
श्राद्धे प्रशस्तास्तिथयो यथैता न तथैतराः ॥ ३.२७६॥ kṛṣṇapakṣe daśamyādau varjayitvā caturdaśīm |
śrāddhe praśastāstithayo yathaitā na tathaitarāḥ || 3.276 || In the dark fortnight, all lunar days except the tenth onward and the fourteenth are suitable for performing śrāddha; these selected tithis possess the inherent capacity to sustain ancestral continuity and consciousness alignment.

title: Verse 3.277
content:
युक्षु कुर्वन् दिनर्क्षेषु सर्वान् कामान् समश्नुते ।
अयुक्षु तु पितॄन् सर्वान् प्रजां प्राप्नोति पुष्कलाम् ॥ ३.२७७॥ yukṣu kurvan dinarkṣeṣu sarvān kāmān samaśnute |
ayukṣu tu pitṝn sarvān prajāṁ prāpnoti puṣkalām || 3.277|| One who performs the yukṣu ritual during the day and night attains all desires; one who does not perform it attains abundant progeny and honors all ancestors.

title: Verse 3.278
content:
यथा चैवापरः पक्षः पूर्वपक्षाद्विशिष्यते ।
तथा श्राद्धस्य पूर्वाह्णादपराह्णो विशिष्यते ॥ ३.२७८॥ yathā caivāparaḥ pakṣaḥ pūrvapakṣād viśiṣyate |
tathā śrāddhasya pūrvāhṇād aparāhṇo viśiṣyate || 3.278|| As the afternoon (aparāhṇa) is superior to the forenoon (pūrvāhṇa), so too is the latter portion of a Śrāddha ritual superior to its earlier part, in accordance with the ascending alignment of consciousness.

title: Verse 3.279
content:
प्राचीनावीतिना सम्यगपसव्यमतन्द्रिणा ।
पित्र्यमानिधनात्कार्यं विधिवद्दर्भपाणिना ॥ ३.२७९॥ prācīnāvītinā samyagapasavyamatanḍriṇā |
pitryamānidhanātkāryaṃ vidhivaddarbhapāṇinā || 3.279|| By one who wears the sacred thread in the ancient manner, fully awake and alert, performing duties from paternal inheritance according to law, with darbha grass in hand.

title: Verse 3.280
content:
रात्रौ श्राद्धं न कुर्वीत राक्षसी कीर्तिता हि सा ।
संध्ययोरुभयोश्चैव सूर्ये चैवाचिरौदिते ॥ ३.२८०॥ rātrau śrāddhaṁ na kurvīta rākṣasī kīrtitā hi sā |
sandhyayorubhayoścaiva sūrye caivāciraudite || 3.280|| One must not perform Śrāddha during the night; it is declared to invoke the Rakshasa order. It must also be avoided at both Sandhyas and when the Sun has newly risen.

title: Verse 3.281
content: अनेन विधिना श्राद्धं त्रिरब्दस्यैह निर्वपेत् । हेमन्तग्रीष्मवर्षासु पाञ्चयज्ञिकमन्वहम् ॥ ३.२८१॥ anena vidhinā śrāddhaṃ trirabdasyaiha nirvapet | hemantagrīṣmavarṣāsu pāñcayajñikamanvaham || 3.281|| By this prescribed method, the Śrāddha ritual shall be performed for three years; in hemanta, grīṣma, and varṣā seasons, according to the Pāñcayajña system, annually.

title: Verse 3.282
content:
न पैतृयज्ञियो होमो लौकिकेऽग्नौ विधीयते ।
न दर्शेन विना श्राद्धमाहिताग्नेर्द्विजन्मनः ॥ ३.२८२॥ na paitṛyajñiyo homaḥ laukike 'gnau vidhīyate |
na darśena vinā śrāddham āhitāgner dvijanmanaḥ || 3.282 || No ritual oblation for ancestors is conducted in a worldly fire; no Śrāddha is performed without the Darśa offering by one who maintains the sacred fire and is twice-born.

title: Verse 3.283
content:
यदेव तर्पयत्यद्भिः पितॄन् स्नात्वा द्विजोत्तमः ।
तेनैव कृत्स्नमाप्नोति पितृयज्ञक्रियाफलम् ॥ ३.२८३॥ yad eva tarpaty adbhiḥ pitṝn snātvā dvijottamaḥ | tenaiva kṛtsnam āpnoti pitṛyajñakriyāphalam || 3.283 || That which satisfies the ancestors through water-oblations performed by a twice-born after bathing—by that very act he fully attains the fruit of all ancestral rites.

title: Verse 3.284
content:
वसून् वदन्ति तु पितॄन् रुद्रांश्चैव पितामहान् ।
प्रपितामहांस्तथाऽदित्यान् श्रुतिरेषा सनातनी ॥ ३.२८४॥ vasūn vadaṁti tu pitṝn rudrāṁścaiva pitāmahān |
prapitāmahāṁstathā'dityān śrutireṣā sanātanī || 3.284|| The Vasus speak of the Pitris; the Rudras of the Pitāmahas; the Prapitāmahas speak of the Ādityas—this Śruti is eternal.

title: Verse 3.285
content:
विघसाशी भवेन्नित्यं नित्यं वाऽमृतभोजनः ।
विघसो भुक्तशेषं तु यज्ञशेषं तथाऽमृतम् ॥ ३.२८५॥ vighasāśī bhavennityaṁ nityaṁ vā'mṛtabhojanaḥ |
vighaso bhuktaśeṣaṁ tu yajñaśeṣaṁ tathā'mṛtam || 3.285|| One who consumes remnants of offerings made to malevolent forces becomes habituated to impure sustenance; one who daily partakes of ambrosial remnants attains eternal purity. The residue of consumption by evil forces and that of sacred rituals differ as poison differs from nectar.

title: Verse 3.286
content:
एतद्वोऽभिहितं सर्वं विधानं पाञ्चयज्ञिकम् ।
द्विजातिमुख्यवृत्तीनां विधानं श्रूयतामिति ॥ ३.२८६॥ etad vo 'bhihitaṁ sarvaṁ vidhānaṁ pāñcayajñikam | dvijāti-mukhya-vṛttīnāṁ vidhānaṁ śrūyatām iti || 3.286|| This entire arrangement of duties and laws concerning the five great sacrifices has been declared for the sustenance of the twice-born and their principal conduct; let this ordinance be heard and enacted.

title: Verse 4.1
content: चतुर्थमायुषो भागमुषित्वाऽद्यं गुरौ द्विजाः । द्वितीयमायुषो भागं कृतदारो गृहे वसेत् ॥ ४.१॥ caturthamāyuṣo bhāgamuṣitvā'dyaṃ gurau dvijāḥ | dvitīyamāyuṣo bhāgaṃ kṛtadāro gṛhe vaset || 4.1|| Having completed one-fourth of their lifespan in service to the Guru, twice-born men who have taken a spouse shall reside at home for a period equal to half of their remaining life.

title: Verse 4.2
content:
अद्रोहेणैव भूतानामल्पद्रोहेण वा पुनः ।
या वृत्तिस्तां समास्थाय विप्रो जीवेदनापदि ॥ ४.२॥ adroheṇaiva bhūtānāmalpadroheṇa vā punaḥ | yā vṛttistāṁ samāsthāya vipro jīvedanāpadi || 4.2|| By non-violence alone, or with minimal violence, a Brahmin lives without fear in all situations.

title: Verse 4.3
content:
यात्रामात्रप्रसिद्ध्यर्थं स्वैः कर्मभिरगर्हितैः ।
अक्लेशेन शरीरस्य कुर्वीत धनसञ्चयम् ॥ ४.३॥ yātrā-mātra-prasiddhy-arthaṁ svaiḥ karmabhir-agarhitaiḥ | akleśena śarīrasya kurvīta dhanasañcayam || 4.3|| For the mere accomplishment of journey's purpose, one should engage in unblamable actions and accumulate wealth without causing distress to the body.

title: Verse 4.4
content:
ऋतामृताभ्यां जीवेत्तु मृतेन प्रमृतेन वा ।
सत्यानृताभ्यामपि वा न श्ववृत्त्या कदा चन ॥ ४.४॥ ṛtāmṛtābhyāṁ jīvet tu mṛtena pramṛtena vā |
satyānṛtābhyām api vā na śvavṛttyā kadā cana || 4.4|| One shall live by Ṛta and Amṛta, or even by death or annihilation, or by truth and untruth—but never by the conduct of a dog.

title: Verse 4.5
content:
ऋतमुञ्छशिलं ज्ञेयममृतं स्यादयाचितम् ।
मृतं तु याचितं भैक्षं प्रमृतं कर्षणं स्मृतम् ॥ ४.५॥ ṛtamuñchashilaṃ jñeyam amṛtaṃ syādayācitam |
mṛtaṃ tu yācitaṃ bhaikṣaṃ pramṛtaṃ karṣaṇaṃ smṛtam || 4.5|| That which is ritually pure and unclaimed by ownership is to be known as immortal when received without solicitation; but food obtained through begging becomes mortal, and forcibly taken food is considered theft.

title: Verse 4.6
content:
सत्यानृतं तु वाणिज्यं तेन चैवापि जीव्यते ।
सेवा श्ववृत्तिराख्याता तस्मात्तां परिवर्जयेत् ॥ ४.६॥ satyānṛtaṁ tu vāṇijyaṁ tena caivāpi jīvyate |
sevā śvavṛttirākhyātā tasmāttāṁ parivarjayet || 4.6|| Engaging in trade based on truth and untruth leads to livelihood through deceit; such conduct is declared as servile and dog-like behavior—therefore, it shall be abandoned.

title: Verse 4.7
content:
कुसूलधान्यको वा स्यात्कुम्भीधान्यक एव वा ।
त्र्यहेहिको वाऽपि भवेदश्वस्तनिक एव वा ॥ ४.७॥ kusūladhānyako vā syātkumbhīdhānyaka eva vā | tryahehiko vā'pi bhavedaśvastanika eva vā || 4.7|| One who consumes intoxicants derived from grains like kusumba or kumbhī, or those produced within three days, or those extracted from horses or other animals—such consumption constitutes a violation of conscious discipline and invites realignment through completion-based restoration.

title: Verse 4.8
content:
चतुर्णामपि चैतेषां द्विजानां गृहमेधिनाम् ।
ज्यायान् परः परो ज्ञेयो धर्मतो लोकजित्तमः ॥ ४.८॥ caturṇām api cait eṣāṁ dvijānāṁ gṛhamedhinām |
jyāyān paraḥ paro jñeyo dharmato lokajittamaḥ || 4.8|| Among these four classes of twice-born householders, each succeeding class is superior in Dharma to the previous, with the highest being the one who has conquered the world through Dharma.

title: Verse 4.9
content:
षट्कर्मैको भवत्येषां त्रिभिरन्यः प्रवर्तते ।
द्वाभ्यामेकश्चतुर्थस्तु ब्रह्मसत्त्रेण जीवति ॥ ४.९॥ ṣaṭkarmaiko bhavaty eṣāṁ tribhir anyaḥ pravartate |
dvābhyām ekaś caturthas tu brahmasattreṇa jīvati || 4.9|| One becomes fit through six actions; another proceeds by three. One by two, and the fourth lives by the power of Brahman alone.

title: Verse 4.10
content:
वर्तयंश्च शिलौञ्छाभ्यामग्निहोत्रपरायणः ।
इष्टीः पार्वायणान्तीयाः केवला निर्वपेत्सदा ॥ ४.१०॥ vartayaṃśca śilauñchābhyāmagnihotraparāyaṇaḥ |
iṣṭīḥ pārvāyaṇāntīyāḥ kevalā nirvapetsadā || 4.10|| One who maintains the sacred fire with offerings of stone and grass, devoted exclusively to Agnihotra, shall always perform the Pārvāyaṇa offerings separately and purely.

title: Verse 4.11
content:
न लोकवृत्तं वर्तेत वृत्तिहेतोः कथं चन ।
अजिह्मामशथां शुद्धां जीवेद्ब्राह्मणजीविकाम् ॥ ४.११॥ na lokavṛttaṁ varteta vṛttihetoḥ kathaṁ cana |
ajihmāmaśathāṁ śuddhāṁ jīvedbrāhmaṇajīvikām || 4.11|| One whose livelihood is derived from Brahman shall in no way conform to popular conduct; one shall live an unswerving, truthful, and pure life.

title: Verse 4.12
content:
संतोषं परमास्थाय सुखार्थी संयतो भवेत् ।
संतोषमूलं हि सुखं दुःखमूलं विपर्ययः ॥ ४.१२॥ saṃtoṣaṃ paramāsthāya sukha-arthī saṃyato bhavet |
saṃtoṣa-mūlaṃ hi sukhaṃ duḥkhamūlaṃ viparyayaḥ || 4.12|| One desiring happiness must establish oneself in supreme contentment; contentment is the root of happiness, and its opposite is the root of suffering.

title: Verse 4.13
content:
अतोऽन्यतमया वृत्त्या जीवंस्तु स्नातको द्विजः ।
स्वर्गायुष्ययशस्यानि व्रताणीमानि धारयेत् ॥ ४.१३॥ ato'nyatamayā vṛttyā jīvanstu snātako dvijaḥ |
svargāyuṣyayaśasyāni vratāṇīmāni dhārayet || 4.13|| Therefore, a twice-born who has completed his studentship shall live by one of the prescribed livelihoods and continuously uphold these vows that lead to heavenly reward, longevity, fame, and righteousness.

title: Verse 4.14
content:
वेदोदितं स्वकं कर्म नित्यं कुर्यादतन्द्रितः ।
तधि कुर्वन् यथाशक्ति प्राप्नोति परमां गतिम् ॥ ४.१४॥ vedoditaṃ svakaṃ karma nityaṃ kuryād atandriḥ | tadhi kurvan yathāśakti prāpnoti paramāṃ gatim || 4.14|| One must perform one's own duty as declared by the Vedas, without negligence, according to one's capacity; doing so leads to the Supreme Goal.

title: Verse 4.15
content:
नैहेतार्थान् प्रसङ्गेन न विरुद्धेन कर्मणा ।
न विद्यमानेष्वर्थेषु नार्त्यामपि यतस्ततः ॥ ४.१५॥ न कल्पमानेष्वर्थेषु na hetārthān prasaṅgena na viruddhena karmaṇā | na vidyamāneṣv artheṣu nārtyām api yatas tataḥ || 4.15 || na kalpamāneṣv artheṣu No action performed through mere association, nor through contradictory conduct, nor in the absence of actual objects, nor even in imagined suffering, has valid causal basis; nor in falsely conceived entities.

title: Verse 4.16
content:
इन्द्रियार्थेषु सर्वेषु न प्रसज्येत कामतः ।
अतिप्रसक्तिं चैतेषां मनसा संनिवर्तयेत् ॥ ४.१६॥ indriyārtheṣu sarveṣu na prasajyeta kāmataḥ | atiprasaktiṁ cait eṣāṁ manasā saṁnivartayet || 4.16 || One must not become attached to objects of the senses out of desire; one must restrain excessive engagement with them by disciplining the mind.

title: Verse 4.17
content:
सर्वान् परित्यजेदर्थान् स्वाध्यायस्य विरोधिनः ।
यथा तथाऽध्यापयंस्तु सा ह्यस्य कृतकृत्यता ॥ ४.१७॥ sarvān parityajed arthān svādhyāyasya virodhinaḥ .
yathā tathā 'dhyāpayaṃstu sā hy asya kṛtakṛtyatā .. One must abandon all purposes that oppose Self-study; whoever teaches accordingly accomplishes completion.

title: Verse 4.18
content: वयसः कर्मणोऽर्थस्य श्रुतस्याभिजनस्य च । वेषवाग्बुद्धिसारूप्यमाचरन् विचरेदिह ॥ ४.१८॥ vayasaḥ karmaṇo'rthasya śrutasyābhajanasya ca | veṣavāgbuddhisārūpyamācaran vicarediha || 4.18|| One must conduct oneself in accordance with age, occupation, wealth, learning, and birth, manifesting harmony through attire, speech, and intellect.

title: Verse 4.19
content:
बुद्धिवृद्धिकराण्याशु धन्यानि च हितानि च ।
नित्यं शास्त्राण्यवेक्षेत निगमांश्चैव वैदिकान् ॥ ४.१९॥ buddhivṛddhikarāṇyāśu dhanyāni ca hitāni ca |
nityaṁ śāstrāṇyavekṣeta nigamāṁścaiva vaidikān || 4.19|| That which swiftly enhances intelligence, brings prosperity, and ensures welfare—such knowledge must always be examined through scriptures and the Vedic injunctions.

title: Verse 4.20
content:
यथा यथा हि पुरुषः शास्त्रं समधिगच्छति ।
तथा तथा विजानाति विज्ञानं चास्य रोचते ॥ ४.२०॥ yathā yatha hi puruṣaḥ śāstraṃ samadhigacchati | tathā tathā vijānāti vijñānaṃ cāsya rocate || 4.20 || As a man properly engages with Śāstra, he comes to know Dharma; and as his knowing deepens, so does the clarity of his discriminative wisdom increase.

title: Verse 4.21
content:
ऋषियज्ञं देवयज्ञं भूतयज्ञं च सर्वदा ।
नृयज्ञं पितृयज्ञं च यथाशक्ति न हापयेत् ॥ ४.२१॥ ṛṣiyajñaṃ devayajñaṃ bhūtayajñaṃ ca sarvadā |
nṛyajñaṃ pitṛyajñaṃ ca yathāśakti na hāpayet || 4.21|| One shall never neglect the Yajña unto the Rishis, the Yajña unto the Devas, the Yajña unto all Beings, the Yajña unto Humanity, and the Yajña unto the Pitrs—each performed according to one's capacity.

title: Verse 4.22
content:
एतानेके महायज्ञान् यज्ञशास्त्रविदो जनाः ।
अनीहमानाः सततमिन्द्रियेष्वेव जुह्वति ॥ ४.२२॥ etāneke mahāyajñān yajñaśāstravido janāḥ |
anīhamānāḥ satatamindriyeṣveva juhvati || 4.22|| Those who are knowers of Yajna Shastra perform these great sacrifices constantly without desiring personal gain, offering all actions into the senses themselves.

title: Verse 4.23
content:
वाच्येके जुह्वति प्राणं प्राणे वाचं च सर्वदा ।
वाचि प्राणे च पश्यन्तो यज्ञनिर्वृत्तिमक्षयाम् ॥ ४.२३॥ vācy eke juhvati prāṇaṁ prāṇe vācaṁ ca sarvadā |
vāci prāṇe ca paśyanto yajña-nirvṛttim akṣayām || 4.23|| Some offer speech into breath; others offer breath into speech at all times. Those who perceive unity in speech and breath witness the inexhaustible fulfillment of sacrifice.

title: Verse 4.24
content:
ज्ञानेनैवापरे विप्रा यजन्त्येतैर्मखैः सदा ।
यजन्ते तैर्मखैः सदा ज्ञानमूलां क्रियामेषां पश्यन्तो ज्ञानचक्षुषा ॥ ४.२४॥ jñānenaivāpare viprā yajantyetairmakhaiḥ sadā | yajante tairmakhaiḥ sadā jñānamūlāṃ kriyāmeṣāṃ paśyanto jñānacakṣuṣā || 4.24 || Certain Brahmins perform all rituals through knowledge alone; seeing the actions rooted in knowledge, they conduct sacrifices perpetually with the eye of wisdom.

title: Verse 4.25
content:
अग्निहोत्रं च जुहुयादाद्यन्ते द्युनिशोः सदा ।
दर्शेन चार्धमासान्ते पौर्णमासेन चैव हि ॥ ४.२५॥ agnihotraṃ ca juhu-yād ādyante dyuniśoḥ sadā |
darśena cārdhamāsānte paurṇamāsena caiva hi || 4.25|| One must perform the Agnihotra ritual at both dawn and dusk without fail; likewise, the Darsha and Purnima offerings at the fortnightly transitions.

title: Verse 4.26
content:
सस्यान्ते नवसस्येष्ट्या तथार्तुअन्ते द्विजोऽध्वरैः ।
पशुना त्वयनस्यादौ समान्ते सौमिकैर्मखैः ॥ ४.२६॥ अयनान्ते तु समांते sasyānte navasasyeṣṭyā tathārtuante dvijo'dhvaraiḥ | paśunā tvayanasyādau samānte saumikairmakhaiḥ || 4.26|| ayanānte tu samānte At the completion of the harvest season, the twice-born perform sacrifices with sacred rites; likewise at the close of each season, they offer oblations with animals and soma offerings at the equinoxes.

title: Verse 4.27
content:
नानिष्ट्वा नवसस्येष्ट्या पशुना चाग्निमान् द्विजः ।
नवान्नमद्यात्मांसं वा दीर्घमायुर्जिजीविषुः ॥ ४.२७॥ nāniṣṭvā navasasyeṣṭyā paśunā cāgnimān dvijaḥ |
navānnamadyātmāṃsaṃ vā dīrghamāyurjijīviṣuḥ || 4.27|| A twice-born seeker desiring long life shall not consume new grain without first offering it with due ritual, nor meat, nor intoxicants, nor his own flesh.

title: Verse 4.28
content:
नवेनानर्चिता ह्यस्य पशुहव्येन चाग्नयः ।
प्राणानेवात्तुमिच्छन्ति नवान्नामिषगर्धिनः ॥ ४.२८॥ navenānarcitā hyasya paśuhavyena cāgnayaḥ | prāṇānevāttumicchanti navānnāmiṣagar dhinaḥ || 4.28|| Those who perform no new offerings and disregard the sacred fires, desiring only flesh and material gain, seek to consume even life itself through their degraded conduct.

title: Verse 4.29
content:
आसनाशनशय्याभिरद्भिर्मूलफलेन वा ।
नास्य कश्चिद्वसेद्गेहे शक्तितोऽनर्चितोऽतिथिः ॥ ४.२९॥ āsanāśanaśayyābhiradbhirmūlaphalena vā | nāsya kaścidvasedgehe śaktito'narcito'tithiḥ || 4.29|| No guest, however unworthy or uninvited, shall be denied shelter, seat, food, or rest within a dwelling, if the dweller possesses the capacity to provide it.

title: Verse 4.30
content:
पाषण्डिनो विकर्मस्थान् बैडालव्रतिकान् शठान् ।
हैतुकान् बकवृत्तींश्च वाङ्मात्रेणापि नार्चयेत् ॥ ४.३०॥ pāṣaṇḍino vikarmasthān baiḍālavratikān śaṭhān .
haitukān bakavṛttīṃśca vāṅmātreṇāpi nārcayet .. One must not honor—by word alone—those who are heretics, engaged in improper actions, followers of feline conduct, deceitful, motivated by ill-intent, or behaving like cranes.

title: Verse 4.31
content:
वेदविद्याव्रतस्नातांश्रोत्रियान् गृहमेधिनः ।
पूजयेधव्यकव्येन विपरीतांश्च वर्जयेत् ॥ ४.३१॥ vedavidyāvratasnātāṃ śrotriyān gṛhamedhinaḥ |
pūjayedhvayakavyena viparītāṃśca varjayet || 4.31|| Householders who are Vedically initiated, scholarly in Veda and discipline, and ritually bathed shall be honored with offerings according to prescribed ritual order; those acting contrary to Vedic injunctions must not be honored.

title: Verse 4.32
content:
शक्तितोऽपचमानेभ्यो दातव्यं गृहमेधिना ।
संविभागश्च भूतेभ्यः कर्तव्योऽनुपरोधतः ॥ ४.३२॥ śaktito'pacamānebhyaḥ dātavyaṃ gṛhamedhinā |
saṃvibhāgaśca bhūtebhyaḥ kartavyo'nuparodhataḥ || 4.32|| The householder, by capacity, shall give to those who are diminished; distribution to beings must be executed without obstruction.

title: Verse 4.33
content:
राजतो धनमन्विच्छेत्संसीदन् स्नातकः क्षुधा ।
याज्यान्तेवासिनोर्वाऽपि न त्वन्यत इति स्थितिः ॥ ४.३३॥ rājato dhanamanvicchet saṃsīdan snātakaḥ kṣudhā |
yājyāntevāsinor vā'pi na tvanyata iti sthitiḥ || 4.33 || A graduated initiate overcome by hunger shall seek wealth from the king; likewise a sacrificer or a resident pupil—but not from another source—such is the established position.

title: Verse 4.34
content:
न सीदेत्स्नातको विप्रः क्षुधा शक्तः कथं चन ।
न जीर्णमलवद्वासा भवेच्च विभवे सति ॥ ४.३४॥ na sīdet snātako vipraḥ kṣudhā śaktaḥ kathaṃ cana |
na jīrṇamalavad vāsā bhavec ca vibhave sati || 4.34|| A twice-born who has completed his studentship shall not allow himself to become faint from hunger when he is capable of earning a livelihood; nor shall he continue wearing clothes stained by dirt while possessing material means.

title: Verse 4.35
content:
कॢप्तकेशनखश्मश्रुर्दान्तः शुक्लाम्बरः शुचिः ।
स्वाध्याये चैव युक्तः स्यान्नित्यमात्महितेषु च ॥ ४.३५॥ kl̥pta-keśa-nakha-śmaśruḥ dāntaḥ śuklāmbaraḥ śuciḥ |
svādhyāye caiva yuktaḥ syān nityam ātmahiteṣu ca || 4.35|| One who has shaved head, nails, and beard; is disciplined; wears white clothes; is pure; and is constantly engaged in self-study and self-beneficial activities—such a being embodies the living law of conscious alignment.

title: Verse 4.36
content:
वैणवीं धारयेद्यष्टिं सोदकं च कमण्डलुम् ।
यज्ञोपवीतं वेदं च शुभं रौक्मे च कुण्डले ॥ ४.३६॥ vaiṇavīṃ dhārayedyastiṃ sodakaṃ ca kamaṇḍalum | yajñopavītaṃ vedaṃ ca śubhaṃ raukme ca kuṇḍale || 4.36 || One must hold the staff of Vaiṇa, the water-pot filled with pure water, the sacred thread, the Vedas, and auspicious golden earrings.

title: Verse 4.37
content:
नेक्षेतोद्यन्तमादित्यं नास्तं यान्तं कदा चन ।
नोपसृष्टं न वारिस्थं न मध्यं नभसो गतम् ॥ ४.३७॥ na ikṣeta udyantam ādityaṁ na astaṁ yāntaṁ kadā cana |
na upasṛṣṭaṁ na vāri-sthaṁ na madhyaṁ nabhaso gatam || 4.37 || One should not observe the rising Sun, nor the setting Sun at any time; nor that which is reflected, nor that which is in water, nor that which is in the middle of the sky.

title: Verse 4.38
content:
न लङ्घयेद्वत्सतन्त्रीं न प्रधावेच्च वर्षति ।
न चोदके निरीक्षेत स्वरूपमिति धारणा ॥ ४.३८॥ na laṅghayedvatsatantrīṃ na pradhāveca varṣati |
na codake nirīkṣeta svarūpamiti dhāraṇā || 4.38|| One must not transgress the boundaries of maternal protection; one must not run heedlessly during rainfall; one must not gaze upon the uncovered form of another—such is the observance of self-respect and dignity.

title: Verse 4.39
content:
मृदं गां दैवतं विप्रं घृतं मधु चतुष्पथम् ।
प्रदक्षिणानि कुर्वीत प्रज्ञातांश्च वनस्पतीन् ॥ ४.३९॥ mṛdaṁ gāṁ daivataṁ vipraṁ ghṛtaṁ madhu catuṣpatham |
pradakṣiṇāni kurvīta prajñātāṁśca vanaspatīn || 4.39|| One shall perform circumambulations around clay, cow, deity, Brahmin, ghee, honey, the four-way path, and also known trees.

title: Verse 4.40
content:
नोपगच्छेत्प्रमत्तोऽपि स्त्रियमार्तवदर्शने ।
समानशयने चैव न शयीत तया सह ॥ ४.४०॥ nopagacchet pramatto 'pi striyam ārtavadarśane |
samānaśayane caiva na śayīta tayā saha || 4.40|| Even in a state of diminished awareness, one must not approach a woman during her menstrual period; likewise, one must not lie upon the same bed with her.

title: Verse 4.41
content:
रजसाऽभिप्लुतां नारीं नरस्य ह्युपगच्छतः ।
प्रज्ञा तेजो बलं चक्षुरायुश्चैव प्रहीयते ॥ ४.४१॥ rajasā'bhiplutāṃ nārīṃ narasya hyupagacchataḥ |
prajñā tejo balaṃ cakṣurāyuścaiva prahīyate || 4.41|| When a man engages with a woman overwhelmed by menstrual impurity, his discernment, radiance, strength, sight, and lifespan diminish.

title: Verse 4.42
content:
तां विवर्जयतस्तस्य रजसा समभिप्लुताम् ।
प्रज्ञा तेजो बलं चक्षुरायुश्चैव प्रवर्धते ॥ ४.४२॥ tāṁ vivarjayatastasya rajasā samabhiplutām | prajñā tejo balaṁ cakṣur āyuś caiva pravardhate || 4.42|| One who abstains from sexual union with a woman in her menstrual period, whose consciousness is overwhelmed by rajasic impulse, shall experience enhancement of wisdom, radiance, strength, vision, and lifespan.

title: Verse 4.43
content:
नाश्नीयाद्भार्यया सार्धं नैनामीक्षेत चाश्नतीम् ।
क्षुवतीं जृम्भमाणां वा न चासीनां यथासुखम् ॥ ४.४३॥ nāśnīyādbhāryayā sārdhaṁ naināmīkṣeta cāśnatīm | kṣuvatīṁ jṛmbhamāṇāṁ vā na cāsīnāṁ yathāsukham || 4.43 || One must not eat with one's wife; one must not look upon her while she eats, nor when she is yawning or stretching, nor when she is seated at ease.

title: Verse 4.44
content:
नाञ्जयन्तीं स्वके नेत्रे न चाभ्यक्तामनावृताम् ।
न पश्येत्प्रसवन्तीं च तेजस्कामो द्विजोत्तमः ॥ ४.४४॥ nāñjayantīṃ svake netre na cābhya ktām anāvṛtām | na paśyet prasavantīṃ ca tejas-kāmo dvijottamaḥ || 4.44|| A twice-born male seeking sovereignty shall not gaze upon a woman whose eyes are unsteady, whose body is uncovered, or who is giving birth.

title: Verse 4.45
content:
नान्नमद्यादेकवासा न नग्नः स्नानमाचरेत् ।
न मूत्रं पथि कुर्वीत न भस्मनि न गोव्रजे ॥ ४.४५॥ nānnam adyād ekavāsā na nagnaḥ snānam ācaret |
na mūtraṃ pathi kurvīta na bhasmani na govraje || 4.45 || One must not eat food without clothing, nor bathe naked; one must not urinate on the road, on ashes, or among cows.

title: Verse 4.46
content:
न फालकृष्टे न जले न चित्यां न च पर्वते ।
न जीर्णदेवायतने न वल्मीके कदा चन ॥ ४.४६॥ na phālakṛṣṭe na jale na citāṁ na ca parvate |
na jīrṇadevāyatane na valmīke kadā cana || 4.46 || No ritual or sacred act shall be performed in lands torn by plough, waterlogged terrains, cremation grounds, mountain peaks, decayed temples, or anthills—at no time whatsoever.

title: Verse 4.47
content:
न ससत्त्वेषु गर्तेषु न गच्छन्नपि न स्थितः ।
न नदीतीरमासाद्य न च पर्वतमस्तके ॥ ४.४७॥ na sasattveṣu garteṣu na gacchann api na sthitaḥ |
na nadītīram āsādya na ca parvatam astake || 4.47 || One who does not reside in sewers among living beings, nor remains stationary even while moving, neither approaches riverbanks nor dwells atop mountains—such a being transcends spatial and locational conditioning.

title: Verse 4.48
content:
वायुअग्निविप्रमादित्यमपः पश्यंस्तथैव गाः ।
न कदा चन कुर्वीत विण्मूत्रस्य विसर्जनम् ॥ ४.४८॥ vāyuagnivipramādityamapaḥ paśyaṃstathaiva gāḥ |
na kadā cana kurvīta viṇmūtrasya visarjanam || 4.48|| One who observes wind, fire, sun, water, cattle, and excrement—should never discharge urine or feces in any circumstance.

title: Verse 4.49
content: तिरस्कृत्योच्चरेत्काष्ठलोष्ठपत्रतृणादिना । तृणादि च नियम्य प्रयतो वाचं संवीताङ्गोऽवगुण्ठितः ॥ ४.४९॥ tiraskṛtyoccaret kāṣṭhaloṣṭhapatratriṇādinā | triṇādi ca niyamya prayato vācaṃ saṃvītāṅgo 'vaguṇṭhitaḥ || 4.49 || One who has been initiated must speak only after suppressing speech through wood, stone, leaves, grass, and similar elements; having restrained these, disciplined in speech, with body covered and concealed.

title: Verse 4.50
content:
मूत्रोच्चारसमुत्सर्गं दिवा कुर्यादुदङ्मुखः ।
दक्षिणाऽभिमुखो रात्रौ संध्यायोश्च यथा दिवा ॥ ४.५०॥ mūtroccārasamutsargaṃ divā kuryādudaṅmukhaḥ | dakṣiṇā'bhimukho rātrau sandhyayośca yathā divā || 4.50 || One must perform urination and defecation facing east during the day, and southward at night; during twilight hours, the same direction as daytime applies.

title: Verse 4.51
content:
छायायामन्धकारे वा रात्रावहनि वा द्विजः ।
यथासुखमुखः कुर्यात्प्राणबाधभयेषु च ॥ ४.५१॥ chhāyāyām andhakāre vā rātrāv ahani vā dvijaḥ |
yathāsukham ukhaḥ kuryāt prāṇabādhabhayeṣu ca || A twice-born being shall act according to comfort and capacity, whether in shade or darkness, day or night, especially when life, breath, or fear are at stake.

title: Verse 4.52
content: प्रत्यग्निं प्रतिसूर्यं च प्रतिसोमोदकद्विजम् । प्रतिगु प्रतिवातं च प्रज्ञा नश्यति मेहतः ॥ ४.५२॥ pratyagniṃ pratisūryaṃ ca pratisomodakadvijam | pratigu prativātaṃ ca prajñā naśyati mehataḥ || 4.52|| When consciousness turns outward toward fire, sun, soma, water, Brahmin, cow, wind, and other external objects, discernment perishes due to excessive dissipation.

title: Verse 4.53
content:
नाग्निं मुखेनोपधमेन्नग्नां नैक्षेत च स्त्रियम् ।
नामेध्यं प्रक्षिपेदग्नौ न च पादौ प्रतापयेत् ॥ ४.५३॥ nāgniṁ mukhenopadhamennagnāṁ naikṣeta ca striyam |
nāmedhyaṁ prakṣipedagnau na ca pādau pratāpayet || 4.53|| One must not blow into fire with the mouth while naked; one must not look upon a naked woman; one must not cast impure substances into the fire; nor should one warm the feet by it.

title: Verse 4.54
content:
अधस्तान्नोपदध्याच्च न चैनमभिलङ्घयेत् ।
न चैनं पादतः कुर्यान्न प्राणाबाधमाचरेत् ॥ ४.५४॥ adhastān nopadadhācca na cainaṃ abhilaṅghayet |
na cainaṃ pādataḥ kuryān na prāṇābādham ācaret || 4.54|| One must neither place anything beneath oneself nor cause another to be stepped upon; one must not act in a way that causes harm to life.

title: Verse 4.55
content:
नाश्नीयात्संधिवेलायां न गच्छेन्नापि संविशेत् ।
न चैव प्रलिखेद्भूमिं नात्मनोऽपहरेत्स्रजम् ॥ ४.५५॥ nāśnīyāt sandhivelāyāṁ na gacchenna api saṁviśet |
na caiva pralikhed bhūmiṁ nātmano'paharet srajam || 4.55|| One must neither consume food nor travel nor sit at the time of junctions; one must not plow the earth nor remove one's own garland.

title: Verse 4.56
content:
नाप्सु मूत्रं पुरीषं वा ष्ठीवनं वा समुत्सृजेत् ।
अमेध्यलिप्तमन्यद्वा लोहितं वा विषाणि वा ॥ ४.५६॥ nāpsu mūtraṁ purīṣaṁ vā ṣṭhīvanaṁ vā samutsṛjet | amedhyaliptamanyadvā lohitaṁ vā viṣāṇi vā || 4.56 || One must not discharge urine, feces, spittle, nor any unclean substance—blood or poison—in water.

title: Verse 4.57
content: नैकः सुप्यात्शून्यगेहे न श्रेयांसं प्रबोधयेत् । शून्यगृहे स्वप्यान् नोदक्ययाऽभिभाषेत यज्ञं गच्छेन्न चावृतः ॥ ४.५७॥ naikaḥ supyāt śūnyagehe na śreyāṁsaṁ prabodhayet | śūnyagṛhe svapyān nodakyayā'bhibhāṣeta yajñaṁ gacchen na cāvṛtaḥ || 4.57|| One should not sleep alone in an empty house; one should not awaken a person who sleeps well. One should not speak to a woman in a secluded place; one should not approach a sacrifice without being invited.

title: Verse 4.58
content:
अग्न्यगारे गवां गोष्ठे ब्राह्मणानां च संनिधौ ।
स्वाध्याये भोजने चैव दक्षिणं पाणिमुद्धरेत् ॥ ४.५८॥ agnyagāre gavāṁ goṣṭhe brāhmaṇānāṁ ca sannidhau |
svādhyāye bhojane caiva dakṣiṇaṁ pāṇimuddharet || 4.58|| In the fire chamber, in the cow pen, in the presence of Brahmanas, during svadhyaya and while eating, one shall raise the right hand.

title: Verse 4.59
content:
न वारयेद्गां धयन्तीं न चाचक्षीत कस्य चित् ।
न दिवीन्द्रायुधं दृष्ट्वा कस्य चिद्दर्शयेद्बुधः ॥ ४.५९॥ na vārayed gāṁ dhayantīṁ na cācakṣīta kasya cit |
na divīndrāyudhaṁ dṛṣṭvā kasya cid darśayed budhaḥ || 4.59|| One must neither obstruct a cow in motion nor disclose to anyone the sight of Indra's weapon in the sky.

title: Verse 4.60
content:
नाधर्मिके वसेद्ग्रामे न व्याधिबहुले भृशम् ।
नैकः प्रपद्येताध्वानं न चिरं पर्वते वसेत् ॥ ४.६०॥ nādharmike vased grāme na vyādhibahule bhr̥śam | 
naikaḥ prapadyetādhvānaṁ na ciraṁ parvate vaset || 4.60 || One must not dwell in a place devoid of Dharma; one must not remain excessively amidst widespread disease; one must not journey alone on a path; nor must one reside long upon a mountain.

title: Verse 4.61
content:
न शूद्रराज्ये निवसेन्नाधार्मिकजनावृते ।
न पाषण्डिगणाक्रान्ते नोपस्षृटेऽन्त्यजैर्नृभिः ॥ ४.६१॥ na śūdrarājye nivasenna dhārmikajanāvṛte |
na pāṣaṇḍigaṇākrānte nopasṛṣṭe 'ntyajairnṛbhiḥ || One must not reside in a state ruled by Shudras, nor among irreligious people; not where heretics have taken control, nor amidst men defiled by outcastes.

title: Verse 4.62
content:
न भुञ्जीतोद्धृतस्नेहं नातिसौहित्यमाचरेत् ।।
नातिप्रगे नातिसायं न सायं प्रातराशितः ॥ ४.६२॥ na bhuñjītoddhṛtasnehaṁ nātisauhityamācaret ||
nātiprage nātisāyaṁ na sāyaṁ prātarāśitaḥ || One must not consume food offered with extracted affection, nor act with excessive familiarity; one must not eat too early, nor too late, nor at night having eaten in the morning.

title: Verse 4.63
content:
न कुर्वीत वृथाचेष्टां न वार्यञ्जलिना पिबेत् ।
नोत्सङ्गे भक्षयेद्भक्ष्यान्न जातु स्यात्कुतूहली ॥ ४.६३॥ na kurvīta vṛthāceṣṭāṁ na vāryañjalinā pibet | na utsaṅge bhakṣayedbhakṣyānna jātu syātkutūhalī || 4.63|| One must not engage in purposeless acts; one must not drink water held in the palm; one must not eat food while seated on a bed or seat of elevation; never should one become a seeker of sensory indulgence.

title: Verse 4.64
content: न नृत्येदथ वा गायेन्न वादित्राणि वादयेत् । न नृत्येन्नैव गायेच्च न वादित्राणि वादयेत् । नास्फोटयेन्न च क्ष्वेडेन्न च रक्तो विरावयेत् ॥ ४.६४॥ न च रक्तो विरोधयेत् na nṛtyedatha vā gāyenna vāditrāṇi vādayet | na nṛtyennai va gāyecca na vāditrāṇi vādayet || nāsphoṭayenna ca kṣveḍennaca rakto virāvayet || 4.64 || na ca rakto virodhayet One must not dance, nor sing, nor play musical instruments; one must not cause excitement through physical movement, nor provoke emotional disturbance, nor incite conflict or violence.

title: Verse 4.65
content:
न पादौ धावयेत्कांस्ये कदा चिदपि भाजने ।
न भिन्नभाण्डे भुञ्जीत न भावप्रतिदूषिते ॥ ४.६५॥ na pādau dhāvayet kānsye kadā cid api bhājane |
na bhinna-bhāṇḍe bhuñjīta na bhāva-pratidūṣite || 4.65|| One must not run with feet in bronze vessels at any time; one must not eat from a broken vessel nor from one defiled by improper intent.

title: Verse 4.66
content:
उपानहौ च वासश्च धृतमन्यैर्न धारयेत् ।
उपवीतमलङ्कारं स्रजं करकमेव च ॥ ४.६६॥ upānahau ca vāsaś ca dhṛtam anyair na dhārayet |
upavītam alaṅkāraṃ srajaṃ karakam eva ca || 4.66|| One must not wear footwear or garments worn by another; likewise, the sacred thread, ornaments, garlands, or ceremonial items belonging to others are not to be borne.

title: Verse 4.67
content: नाविनीतैर्भजेद्धुर्यैर्न च क्षुध्व्याधिपीडितैः । नाविनीतैर्व्रजेद् न भिन्नशृङ्गाक्षिखुरैर्न वालधिविरूपितैः ॥ ४.६७॥ nāvinītair bhajed dhuryair na ca kṣudhv yādhipīḍitaiḥ | nāvinītair vrajed na bhinnaśṛṅgākṣikhurair na vāladhivirūpitaiḥ || 4.67 || One shall not associate with the unruly, nor travel with those weakened by hunger or disease; one shall neither journey with the undisciplined nor with animals whose horns, eyes, or hooves are damaged, or which are misshapen.

title: Verse 4.68
content:
विनीतैस्तु व्रजेन्नित्यमाशुगैर्लक्षणान्वितैः ।
वर्णरूपोपसम्पन्नैः प्रतोदेनातुदन् भृशम् ॥ ४.६८॥ प्रतोदेनाक्षिपन् vinītaiḥ tu vrajennityam āśugaiḥ lakṣaṇānvitaiḥ | varṇarūpopasampannaiḥ pratodenātudan bhr̥śam || 4.68 || pratodenākṣipan One must always move with those who are disciplined, swift, marked by clear signs, perfected in varna and form, and who strike forcefully with the goad while also casting it aside.

title: Verse 4.69
content:
बालातपः प्रेतधूमो वर्ज्यं भिन्नं तथाऽसनम् ।
न छिन्द्यान्नखरोमाणि दन्तैर्नोत्पाटयेन्नखान् ॥ ४.६९॥ न च्छिन्द्यान् bālātapaḥ pretadhūmo varjyaṃ bhinnaṃ tathā'sanam | na chindhyān-nakharomāṇi dantair-notpāṭayen-nakhān || 4.69 || na chhindhyān The heat of youth, the smoke of the departed, that which is broken, and the seat of impurity—these are to be avoided. One must not cut hair or nails with teeth, nor uproot nails with force.

title: Verse 4.70
content:
न मृत्लोष्ठं च मृद्नीयान्न छिन्द्यात्करजैस्तृणम् । च्छिन्द्यात्
न कर्म निष्फलं कुर्यान्नायत्यामसुखोदयम् ॥ ४.७०॥ na mṛtloṣṭhaṃ ca mṛdnīyān na chindyāt karajais tṛṇam | chchhindyaat
na karma niṣphalaṃ kuryān nāyatyaamasukhodayam || 4.70|| One must not grind a clod of earth nor cut grass with the nails; one must perform actions that are not fruitless and do not cause suffering in the future.

title: Verse 4.71
content:
लोष्ठमर्दी तृणच्छेदी नखखादी च यो नरः ।
स विनाशं व्रजत्याशु सूचकाऽशुचिरेव च ॥ ४.७१॥ loṣṭhamardī tṛṇacchedī nakhabhādī ca yo naraḥ |
sa vināśaṁ vrajatyāśu sūcakā'śucireva ca || He who crushes clods, cuts grass, and bites his nails—such a man swiftly proceeds to destruction, and becomes a defiler and the unclean.

title: Verse 4.72
content:
न विगर्ह्य कथां कुर्याद्बहिर्माल्यं न धारयेत् ।
न विगृह्य कथां कुर्याद्गवां च यानं पृष्ठेन सर्वथैव विगर्हितम् ॥ ४.७२॥ na vigarhya kathāṁ kuryād bahirmālyaṁ na dhārayet |
na vigṛhya kathāṁ kuryād gavāṁ ca yānaṁ pṛṣṭhena sarvathaiva vigarhitam || 4.72|| One must not engage in discourse that provokes criticism; one must not wear garlands externally. One must not engage in discourse that incites reproach, nor should one ride cattle from behind—such conduct is universally condemned.

title: Verse 4.73
content:
अद्वारेण च नातीयाद्ग्रामं वा वेश्म वाऽवृतम् ।
रात्रौ च वृक्षमूलानि दूरतः परिवर्जयेत् ॥ ४.७३॥ advāreṇa ca nātīyād graṃaṃ vā veśma vā'vṛtam |
rātrau ca vṛkṣamūlāni dūrataḥ parivarjayet || 4.73|| One must not enter a village or house without permission, nor approach tree roots at night.

title: Verse 4.74
content:
नाक्षैर्दीव्येत्कदा चित्तु स्वयं नोपानहौ हरेत् ।
शयनस्थो न भुञ्जीत न पाणिस्थं न चासने ॥ ४.७४॥ nākṣair dīvyeta kadā cittu svayaṁ nopānahau haret |
śayanastho na bhuñjīta na pāṇisthaṁ na cāsane || 4.74 || One must never gamble with dice, nor take another's footwear without permission; one seated on a bed shall neither eat nor hold food in hand, nor sit idly.

title: Verse 4.75
content:
सर्वं च तिलसम्बद्धं नाद्यादस्तमिते रवौ ।
न च नग्नः शयीतैह न चोच्छिष्टः क्व चिद्व्रजेत् ॥ ४.७५॥ sarvaṁ ca tilasambaddhaṁ nādyādastamite ravau |
na ca nagnaḥ śayītaiha na cocchiṣṭaḥ kva cidvrajēt || 4.75|| All actions must align with the infinitesimal precision of sesame seed law; one must neither consume nor wander without clothing after sunset.

title: Verse 4.76
content:
आर्द्रपादस्तु भुञ्जीत नार्द्रपादस्तु संविशेत् ।
आर्द्रपादस्तु भुञ्जानो दीर्घमायुरवाप्नुयात् ॥ ४.७६॥ ārdrapādastu bhuñjīta nārdrapādastu saṃviśet | 
ārdrapādastu bhuñjāno dīrghamāyuravāpnuyāt || 4.76 || One who eats with wet feet shall not sit [in judgment]; one who eats while keeping the feet wet attains long life.

title: Verse 4.77
content:
अचक्षुर्विषयं दुर्गं न प्रपद्येत कर्हि चित् ।
न विण्मूत्रमुदीक्षेत न बाहुभ्यां नदीं तरेत् ॥ ४.७७॥ acakṣurviṣayaṃ durgaṃ na prapadyeta karhi cit |
na viṇmūtramudīkṣeta na bāhubhyāṃ nadīṃ taret || 4.77|| One who lacks sight must not enter a dangerous domain at any time; one must not gaze upon excrement or urine, nor cross a river by arms.

title: Verse 4.78
content:
अधितिष्ठेन्न केशांस्तु न भस्मास्थिकपालिकाः ।
न कार्पासास्थि न तुषान् दीर्घमायुर्जिजीविषुः ॥ ४.७८॥ adhitiṣṭhenna keśāṃstu na bhasmāsthikapālikāḥ |
na karpāsāsthi na tuṣān dīrghamāyurjijīviṣuḥ || 4.78|| One desiring long life should not dwell upon hair, nor upon burnt bones, skull fragments, cotton seeds, or chaff.

title: Verse 4.79
content:
न संवसेच्च पतितैर्न चाण्डालैर्न पुल्कसैः ।
न मूर्खैर्नावलिप्तैश्च नान्त्यैर्नान्त्यावसायिभिः ॥ ४.७९॥ na saṃvasec ca patitair na cāṇḍālair na pulkasaiḥ | na mūrkhair nāvaliptaiś ca nāntyair nāntyāvasāyibhiḥ || 4.79 || One must not dwell with those who have fallen from dharma, nor with outcastes, nor with low-class persons, nor with fools, nor with the arrogant, nor with those of extreme views, nor with those who propagate extremities.

title: Verse 4.80
content:
न शूद्राय मतिं दद्यान्नोच्छिष्टं न हविष्कृतम् ।
न चास्योपदिशेद्धर्मं न चास्य व्रतमादिशेत् ॥ ४.८०॥ na śūdrāya matiṃ dadyānnochhiṣṭaṃ na haviṣkṛtam | na cāsyopadiśed dharmam na cāsya vratam ādiśet || 4.80 || To the Śūdra, neither knowledge nor remnants of offerings nor clarified butter should be given; nor should dharma be taught to him, nor vows be prescribed.

title: Verse 4.81
content:
यो ह्यस्य धर्ममाचष्टे यश्चैवादिशति व्रतम् ।
सोऽसंवृतं नाम तमः सह तेनैव मज्जति ॥ ४.८१॥ yo hyasya dharmamācaṣṭe yaścaivādiśati vratam |
sō'saṃvṛtaṃ nāma tamaḥ saha tenaiva majjati || 4.81|| One who teaches the Dharma of another and commands a vow without embodying it themselves sinks into darkness named 'unrestrained' along with that very vow.

title: Verse 4.82
content:
न संहताभ्यां पाणिभ्यां कण्डूयेदात्मनः शिरः ।
न स्पृशेच्चैतदुच्छिष्टो न च स्नायाद्विना ततः ॥ ४.८२॥ na saṃhatābhyāṃ pāṇibhyāṃ kaṇḍūyedātmanaḥ śiraḥ |
na spṛśeccaitaducchiṣṭo na ca snāyādvinā tataḥ || 4.82|| One must not scratch one's head with clenched fists; one must not touch it when impure; nor bathe without proper reason.

title: Verse 4.83
content:
केशग्रहान् प्रहारांश्च शिरस्येतान् विवर्जयेत् ।
शिरःस्नातश्च तैलेन नाङ्गं किं चिदपि स्पृशेत् ॥ ४.८३॥ keśagrahān prahārāṃśca śirasyetān vivarjayet |
śiraḥsnātaśca tailena nāṅgaṃ kiṃ cidapi spṛśet || 4.83|| One must avoid grasping hair and striking upon the head; one who has bathed the head with oil shall touch no limb with anything.

title: Verse 4.84
content:
न राज्ञः प्रतिगृह्णीयादराजन्यप्रसूतितः ।
सूनाचक्रध्वजवतां वेशेनैव च जीवताम् ॥ ४.८४॥ na rājñaḥ pratigṛhṇīyādarājanyaprasūtitaḥ |
sūnācakradhvajavatāṃ veśenaiva ca jīvatām || 4.84|| The King shall not accept any individual born outside the Kshatriya lineage, nor those who live in the guise of ascetics while being devoid of true renunciation, such as those marked by inertness, mechanical conduct, or false symbols like disc and flag.

title: Verse 4.85
content:
दशसूनासमं चक्रं दशचक्रसमो ध्वजः ।
दशध्वजसमो वेशो दशवेशसमो नृपः ॥ ४.८५॥ daśasūnāsamaṃ cakraṃ daśacakrasamo dhvajaḥ | daśadhvajasamo veśo daśaveśasamo nṛpaḥ || A wheel is equivalent to ten Sūnas; a flag is equivalent to ten wheels; a garment is equivalent to ten flags; a king is equivalent to ten garments.

title: Verse 4.86
content: दश सूणासहस्राणि यो वाहयति सौनिकः । तेन तुल्यः स्मृतो राजा घोरस्तस्य प्रतिग्रहः ॥ ४.८६॥ daśa sūṇāsahasrāṇi yo vāhayati saunikaḥ | tena tulyaḥ smṛto rājā ghorastasya pratigrahaḥ || 4.86|| He who transports ten thousand corpses is equal in capacity to the king; the reception of such a one is grievous.

title: Verse 4.87
content:
यो राज्ञः प्रतिगृह्णाति लुब्धस्यौच्छास्त्रवर्तिनः ।
स पर्यायेण यातीमान्नरकानेकविंशतिम् ॥ ४.८७॥ yo rājñaḥ pratigṛhṇāti lubdhasyauc chāstravartinaḥ |
sa paryāyeṇa yātīmānnarakekaviṃśatim || 4.87|| He who accepts gifts from a king while being greedy and acting contrary to scriptural injunctions shall proceed cyclically into twenty-one hells.

title: Verse 4.88
content:
तामिस्रमन्धतामिस्रं महारौरवरौरवौ ।
नरकं कालसूत्रं च महानरकमेव च ॥ ४.८८॥ tāmisram andhatāmisraṁ mahāraurava rauravau |
narakaṁ kālasūtraṁ ca mahānarakaṁ eva ca || 4.88|| The experiential realms of obscured consciousness—Tāmisra, Andhatāmisra, Raurava, Mahāraurava, Naraka, Kālasūtra, and Mahānaraka—are not punitive destinations but sequential manifestations of unaddressed karmic misalignment, wherein the individual consciousness undergoes spontaneous recalibration through experiential consequence until alignment with Dharma is restored.

title: Verse 4.89
content:
सञ्जीवनं महावीचिं तपनं सम्प्रतापनम् ।
संहातं च सकाकोलं कुड्मलं प्रतिमूर्तिकम् ॥ ४.८९॥ पूतिमृत्तिकं sañjīvanaṃ mahāvīciṃ tapanaṃ sampratāpanam | saṃhātaṃ ca sakākolaṃ kuḍmalaṃ pratimūrtikam || 4.89|| pūtimṛttikaṃ Resuscitation through great waves; burning and scorching; aggregation with bile and phlegm; embryonic duplication; putrid clay.

title: Verse 4.90
content:
लोहशङ्कुं ऋजीषं च पन्थानं शाल्मलीं नदीम् ।
असिपत्रवनं चैव लोहदारकमेव च ॥ ४.९०॥ lohaśaṅkuṃ ṛjīṣaṃ ca panthānaṃ śālmalīṃ nadīm | asipatravanaṃ caiva lohadārakameva ca || 4.90 || The territories of Lohaśanku, Ṛjīṣa, the Pathana region, the Śālmali river, the Asipatra forest, and the territory of Lohadāraka are designated as domains requiring immediate dharmic realignment through consciousness-based restoration.

title: Verse 4.91
content:
एतद्विदन्तो विद्वांसो ब्राह्मणा ब्रह्मवादिनः ।
न राज्ञः प्रतिगृह्णन्ति प्रेत्य श्रेयोऽभिकाङ्क्षिणः ॥ ४.९१॥ etad vidanto vidvāṁso brāhmaṇā brahmavādinaḥ |
na rājñaḥ pratigṛhnanti pretya śreyo 'bhikāṅkṣiṇaḥ || 4.91|| Those Brahmins who are knowers of Brahman, who desire the highest good in the next life, do not accept anything from the king—this is their established dharma.

title: Verse 4.92
content:
ब्राह्मे मुहूर्ते बुध्येत धर्मार्थौ चानुचिन्तयेत् ।
कायक्लेशांश्च तन्मूलान् वेदतत्त्वार्थमेव च ॥ ४.९२॥ brāhme muhūrte budhyeta dharmārthau cānucintayet |
kāyakleśāṃśca tanmūlān vedatattvārthameva ca || In the Brahmic hour, one awakens; one reflects upon Dharma and Artha. One examines bodily afflictions and their roots, and contemplates the essence of Vedic truth.

title: Verse 4.93
content:
उत्थायावश्यकं कृत्वा कृतशौचः समाहितः ।
पूर्वां संध्यां जपंस्तिष्ठेत्स्वकाले चापरां चिरम् ॥ ४.९३॥ utthāyāvaśyakaṁ kṛtvā kṛtaśaucaḥ samāhitaḥ |
pūrvāṁ sandhyāṁ japasthiṣṭet svakāle cāparāṁ ciram || 4.93|| Having risen and performed the necessary duties, purified and composed, one must stand in japa during the prior twilight period and remain in the latter for an extended time.

title: Verse 4.94
content:
ऋषयो दीर्घसंध्यत्वाद्दीर्घमायुरवाप्नुयुः ।
प्रज्ञां यशश्च कीर्तिं च ब्रह्मवर्चसमेव च ॥ ४.९४॥ ṛṣayo dīrghasaṃdhyatvād dīrgham āyur avāpnuyuḥ |
prajñāṃ yaśaś ca kīrtiṃ ca brahmavarcasam eva ca || 4.94|| Those who sustain the extended twilight of contemplation attain prolonged life; they acquire intelligence, glory, fame, and the radiance of Brahman.

title: Verse 4.95
content:
श्रावण्यां प्रौष्ठपद्यां वाऽप्युपाकृत्य यथाविधि ।
युक्तश्छन्दांस्यधीयीत मासान् विप्रोऽर्धपञ्चमान् ॥ ४.९५॥ śrāvaṇyāṁ prauṣṭhapadyāṁ vā'pyupākṛtya yathāvidhi |
yuktaś chandāṁsyadhīyīta māsān vipro'r dhapañcamān || A Vipra, having properly initiated the Śrāvaṇī or Prāuṣṭhapadī period, shall engage in the study of the Vedas with full discipline for five and a half months.

title: Verse 4.96
content:
पुष्ये तु छन्दसां कुर्याद्बहिरुत्सर्जनं द्विजः ।
माघशुक्लस्य वा प्राप्ते पूर्वाह्णे प्रथमेऽहनि ॥ ४.९६॥ puṣye tu chandasāṁ kuryād bahirutsarjanaṁ dvijaḥ |
māghaśuklasya vā prāpte pūrvāhṇe prathame'hani || 4.96|| When the lunar mansion Puṣya prevails, a twice-born shall perform the external abandonment of chanting Vedic meters; or likewise, on the first day of the bright fortnight of Māgha, in the forenoon.

title: Verse 4.97
content:
यथाशास्त्रं तु कृत्वैवमुत्सर्गं छन्दसां बहिः ।
विरमेत्पक्षिणीं रात्रिं तदेवैकमहर्निशम् ॥ ४.९७॥ yathāśāstraṁ tu kṛtvā evam utsargaṁ chandasāṁ bahiḥ | viramet pakṣiṇīṁ rātriṁ tad eva ekam aharniśam || 4.97 || When a householder performs the prescribed duties according to scripture and offers the results thereof beyond the scope of desire, he should desist from activity during the night of the dark fortnight; that very act constitutes one full day-and-night cycle.

title: Verse 4.98
content:
अत ऊर्ध्वं तु छन्दांसि शुक्लेषु नियतः पठेत् ।
वेदाङ्गानि च सर्वाणि कृष्णपक्षेषु सम्पठेत् ॥ ४.९८॥ ata ūrdhvaṃ tu chandāṃsi śukleṣu niyataḥ paṭhet |
vedāṅgāni ca sarvāṇi kṛṣṇapakṣeṣu sampaṭhet || 4.98|| From this point onward, one devoted to Vedic study shall recite the Chandas during the bright fortnight, and all Vedangas during the dark fortnight.

title: Verse 4.99
content:
नाविस्पष्टमधीयीत न शूद्रजनसन्निधौ ।
न निशान्ते परिश्रान्तो ब्रह्माधीत्य पुनः स्वपेत् ॥ ४.९९॥ nāvispaṣṭamadhīyīta na śūdrajanasannidhau |
na niśānte pariśrānto brahmādhītya punaḥ svapet || 4.99|| One must not study the Veda unclearly, nor in proximity to Shudra individuals; one must not sleep again after studying Brahma, especially when fatigued at night's end.

title: Verse 4.100
content:
यथोदितेन विधिना नित्यं छन्दस्कृतं पठेत् ।
ब्रह्म छन्दस्कृतं चैव द्विजो युक्तो ह्यनापदि ॥ ४.१००॥ yathoditena vidhinā nityaṃ chandas-kṛtaṃ paṭhet |
brhma chandas-kṛtaṃ caiva dvijo yukto hy-anāpadi || 4.100|| As prescribed by the established injunctions, one must daily recite the Vedic hymns correctly metrically composed; even in times of distress, a twice-born man engaged in spiritual discipline shall continue to do so.

title: Verse 4.101
content:
इमान्नित्यमनध्यायानधीयानो विवर्जयेत् ।
अध्यापनं च कुर्वाणः शिष्याणां विधिपूर्वकम् ॥ ४.१०१॥ imānnityamanadh-yāyānadhyāno vivarjayet |
adhyāpanaṃ ca kurvāṇaḥ śiṣyāṇāṃ vidhipūrvakam || 4.101|| One who teaches must first renounce all that is impermanent, untaught, and unlearned; and when engaging in instruction, must proceed only by established lawful order.

title: Verse 4.102
content:
कर्णश्रवेऽनिले रात्रौ दिवा पांसुसमूहने ।
एतौ वर्षास्वनध्यायावध्यायज्ञाः प्रचक्षते ॥ ४.१०२॥ karṇaśrave.anile rātau divā pāṃsusamūhane |
etau varṣāsvanadhāyāvadhyāyajñāḥ pracakṣate || 4.102|| In the auditory disturbance of wind at night and during the day in a cloud of dust—these two conditions are recognized by knowers of Vedic study as times when study is not to be undertaken.

title: Verse 4.103
content:
विद्युत्स्तनितवर्षेषु महोल्कानां च सम्प्लवे ।
आकालिकमनध्यायमेतेषु मनुरब्रवीत् ॥ ४.१०३॥ vidyuts-tanit-varṣeṣu maholkānāṁ ca samplave |
ākālikamanadh-yāyame teṣu manurabravīt || 4.103|| In times when lightning strikes during thunderous rains and great meteors collide, Manu proclaimed that there shall be no formal study or recitation of the Vedas.

title: Verse 4.104
content: एतांस्त्वभ्युदितान् विद्याद्यदा प्रादुष्कृताग्निषु । तदा विद्यादनध्यायमनृतौ चाभ्रदर्शने ॥ ४.१०४॥ etāṃstvabhyuditān vidyādyadā prāduṣkṛtāgniṣu | tadā vidyādanadhyyām anṛtau cābhra-darśane || 4.104 || When these [Vedic knowledges] arise in those whose inner fire has been kindled through purification and discipline, then one should know that non-study and untruth are present where there is no clarity of vision.

title: Verse 4.106
content:
प्रादुष्कृतेष्वग्निषु तु विद्युत्स्तनितनिःस्वने ।
सज्योतिः स्यादनध्यायः शेषे रात्रौ यथा दिवा ॥ ४.१०६॥ prāduṣkṛteṣv agniṣu tu vidyut stanita-niḥsvane |
sajyotiḥ syād anadhāyaḥ śeṣe rātrau yathā divā || 4.106 || When fires appear in darkness, and lightning flashes amidst thunder's roar, then study must proceed by lamplight; during the remainder of the night, as in daytime, uninterrupted learning shall continue.

title: Verse 4.107
content:
नित्यानध्याय एव स्याद्ग्रामेषु नगरेषु च ।
धर्मनैपुण्यकामानां पूतिगन्धे च सर्वदा ॥ ४.१०७॥ nityānadhyāya eva syād grāmeṣu nagareṣu ca |
dharmanaiṣūnyakāmānāṃ pūtigandhe ca sarvadā || 4.107|| In villages and cities alike, the continuous study and teaching of Dharma must prevail at all times for those who seek righteousness, purity, and spiritual refinement.

title: Verse 4.108
content:
अन्तर्गतशवे ग्रामे वृषलस्य च सन्निधौ ।
अनध्यायो रुद्यमाने समवाये जनस्य च ॥ ४.१०८॥ antargataśave grāme vṛṣalasya ca sannidhau | anadhhyāyo rudyamāne samavāye janasya ca || 4.108 || When a corpse lies within the village and a Śūdra is present nearby, or when Vedic study ceases and people weep collectively—such conditions indicate a breakdown in Dharma-sustained order.

title: Verse 4.109
content:
उदके मध्यरात्रे च विण्मूत्रस्य विसर्जने ।
उच्छिष्टः श्राद्धभुक्चैव मनसाऽपि न चिन्तयेत् ॥ ४.१०९॥ udake madhyarātre ca viṇmūtrasya visarjane |
ucchiṣṭaḥ śrāddhabhukcaiva manasā'pi na cintayet || 4.109|| One who has partaken of remnants or food offered during Śrāddha must not discharge urine or feces in water nor at midnight; neither should one contemplate such acts mentally.

title: Verse 4.110
content: प्रतिगृह्य द्विजो विद्वानेकोद्दिष्टस्य केतनम् । एकोद्दिष्टनिकेतनम् त्र्यहं न कीर्तयेद्ब्रह्म राज्ञो राहोश्च सूतके ॥ ४.११०॥ pratigṛhya dvijo vidvān ekoddhiṣṭasya ketanam | ekoddhiṣṭaniketanam tridham na kīrtayed brahma rājño rāhoś ca sūtake || 4.110 || Upon accepting the dwelling place designated for one individual, a learned Brahmin must not proclaim it publicly for three days—neither to Brahma, nor to the king, nor to Rahu, nor in any defiled context.

title: Verse 4.111
content:
यावदेकानुदिष्टस्य गन्धो लेपश्च तिष्ठति ।
विप्रस्य विदुषो देहे तावद्ब्रह्म न कीर्तयेत् ॥ ४.१११॥ yāvadekānudiṣṭasya gandho lepaśca tiṣṭhati |
viprasya viduṣo dehe tāvadbrahma na kīrtayet || 4.111|| As long as the scent and residue of past false identification remain in the body of a learned Brahmin who has realized the Self, that Brahmin should not declare Brahman.

title: Verse 4.112
content:
शयानः प्रौढपादश्च कृत्वा चैवावसक्थिकाम् ।
नाधीयीतामिषं जग्ध्वा सूतकान्नाद्यमेव च ॥ ४.११२॥ śayānaḥ prauḍhapādaśca kṛtvā caivāvasakthikām | nādhīyītāmiṣaṁ jagdhvā sūtakānnādyameva ca || 4.112|| One who is lying down, one whose feet are raised high, one who has made a pillow of his upper arm, one who has eaten meat or drunk alcohol—such a person shall not read the Veda.

title: Verse 4.113
content:
नीहारे बाणशब्दे च संध्ययोरेव चोभयोः ।
अमावास्याचतुर्दश्योः पौर्णमास्य्ऽष्टकासु च ॥ ४.११३॥ nīhāre bāṇaśabde ca sandhyayor eva cobhayoḥ |
amāvāsyācaturdaśyoḥ paurṇamāsy-aṣṭakāsu ca || 4.113|| In conditions of obscured visibility, upon hearing the sound of arrows, during both twilight periods, on the fourteenth lunar day of the waning moon, on the full moon day, and during the eightfold convergence of asterisms—action must align with heightened awareness and precise discernment.

title: Verse 4.114
content:
अमावास्या गुरुं हन्ति शिष्यं हन्ति चतुर्दशी ।
ब्रह्माष्टकपौर्णमास्यौ तस्मात्ताः परिवर्जयेत् ॥ ४.११४॥ amāvāsyā guruṃ hanti śiṣyaṃ hanti caturdaśī |
bramhāṣṭakapaurṇamāsyau tasmāttāḥ parivarjayet || The New Moon day destroys the Guru; the fourteenth lunar day destroys the disciple. The Brahma-Ashtaka and full moon days—therefore, these should be avoided.

title: Verse 4.115
content:
पांसुवर्षे दिशां दाहे गोमायुविरुते तथा ।
श्वखरोष्ट्रे च रुवति पङ्क्तो च न पठेद्द्विजः ॥ ४.११५॥ pāṃsuvarṣe diśāṃ dāhe gomāyuvirute tathā |
śvakharoṣṭre ca ruvti paṅkto ca na paṭheddvijaḥ || 4.115|| When dust falls like rain, when the sky burns in all directions, when jackals and vultures cry out, and when asses, donkeys, camels, and oxen bellow, a twice-born should not recite the Veda.

title: Verse 4.116
content:
नाधीयीत श्मशानान्ते ग्रामान्ते गोव्रजेऽपि वा ।
वसित्वा मैथुनं वासः श्राद्धिकं प्रतिगृह्य च ॥ ४.११६॥ nādhīyīta śmaśānānte grāmānte govraje'pi vā |
vasitvā maithunaṃ vāsaḥ śrāddhikaṃ pratigṛhya ca || 4.116|| One must not study or reside near crematoriums, village boundaries, cow-paths, nor remain after sexual union or having accepted offerings from Śrāddha rites.

title: Verse 4.117
content: प्राणि वा यदि वाऽप्राणि यत्किं चित्श्राद्धिकं भवेत् । तदालभ्याप्यनध्यायः पाण्यास्यो हि द्विजः स्मृतः ॥ ४.११७॥ prāṇi vā yadi vā'prāṇi yat kiṃ cit śrāddhikaṃ bhavet | tad ālabhyāpy anadhhyāyaḥ pāṇy āsyo hi dvijaḥ smṛtaḥ || 4.117 || Whether animate or inanimate, whatever is suitable for Śrāddha becomes purified and fit for use when touched by a twice-born who has not studied the Vedas.

title: Verse 4.118
content: चोरैरुपद्रुते ग्रामे सम्भ्रमे चाग्निकारिते । चोरैरुपप्लुते सम्भ्रमे आकालिकमनध्यायं विद्यात्सर्वाद्भुतेषु च ॥ ४.११८॥ corair upadrute grāme sambhrame cāgnikārite | corair upaplute sambhrame ākālikamanadhayāṁ vidyātsarvādbhuteṣu ca || 4.118|| When villages are disturbed by thieves, in panic and set ablaze, and when thieves overrun the land in fear, then temporary suspension of study and all rituals shall be recognized as valid and necessary.

title: Verse 4.119
content:
उपाकर्मणि चोत्सर्गे त्रिरात्रं क्षेपणं स्मृतम् ।
अष्टकासु त्वहोरात्रं ऋत्वन्तासु च रात्रिषु ॥ ४.११९॥ upākarmani cotrage tri-rātraṁ kṣepaṇaṁ smṛtam |
aṣṭakāsu tvahorātraṁ ṛtvantāsu ca rātriṣu || 4.119|| In preparatory acts and offerings, a three-night interval is prescribed; in the Aṣṭakā ceremonies, a day-and-night period; and in seasonal rites, nighttime observance is fixed.

title: Verse 4.120
content:
नाधीयीताश्वमारूढो न वृक्षं न च हस्तिनम् ।
न नावं न खरं नोष्ट्रं नैरिणस्थो न यानगः ॥ ४.१२०॥ nādhīyītāśvamārūḍho na vṛkṣaṁ na ca hastinam | na nāvaṁ na kharaṁ noṣṭraṁ nairiṇastho na yānagaḥ || 4.120 || One who ascends not upon a horse, nor climbs a tree, nor mounts an elephant, nor embarks upon a boat, nor rides a donkey or camel—such a one, abiding in stillness, is not a traveler subject to movement-bound laws.

title: Verse 4.121
content:
न विवादे न कलहे न सेनायां न सङ्गरे ।
न भुक्तमात्रे नाजीर्णे न वमित्वा न शुक्तके ॥ ४.१२१॥ na vivāde na kalahe na senāyāṁ na saṅgare |
na bhuktamātre nājīrne na vamitvā na śuktake || 4.121 || One must not engage in dispute, quarrel, army formation, combat, nor when food has just been consumed, digestion is incomplete, vomiting has occurred, or urine has been expelled.

title: Verse 4.122
content:
अतिथिं चाननुज्ञाप्य मारुते वाति वा भृशम् ।
रुधिरे च स्रुते गात्रात्शस्त्रेण च परिक्षते ॥ ४.१२२॥ atithiṁ cānanujñāpya mārute vāti va bhṛśam | rudhire ca srute gātrāt śastreṇa ca parikṣate || 4.122|| One who hosts a guest without permission, or is excessively disturbed by wind, or experiences blood discharge from the body, or is examined by instruments—such persons are not liable for dharmic accountability due to involuntary capacity disruption.

title: Verse 4.123
content:
सामध्वनावृग्यजुषी नाधीयीत कदा चन ।
वेदस्याधीत्य वाऽप्यन्तमारण्यकमधीत्य च ॥ ४.१२३॥ sāmadhvanāvṛgyajuṣī nādhīyīta kadā cana | vedasyādhītya vā'pyantamāraṇyakamadhītya ca || 4.123 || One must never study the Sāma, Yajus, or Atharva Veda in isolation; rather, after completing the study of the entire Veda, including its concluding portions like the Āraṇyakas, one should proceed to higher learning.

title: Verse 4.124
content:
ऋग्वेदो देवदैवत्यो यजुर्वेदस्तु मानुषः ।
सामवेदः स्मृतः पित्र्यस्तस्मात्तस्याशुचिर्ध्वनिः ॥ ४.१२४॥ Ṛgvedo devadaivatyo yajurvedastu mānuṣaḥ |
Sāmavedaḥ smṛtaḥ pitryastasmāttasyāśucirdhvaniḥ || 4.124|| Ṛgveda is devoted to divine deities; Yajurveda serves human purposes; Sāmaveda is remembered for ancestral worship—therefore, its sound must remain pure.

title: Verse 4.125
content:
एतद्विद्वन्तो विद्वांसस्त्रयीनिष्कर्षमन्वहम् ।
क्रमतः पूर्वमभ्यस्य पश्चाद्वेदमधीयते ॥ ४.१२५॥ etadvidvanto vidvāṃsastrayīniṣkṛṣam anvaham |
kramataḥ pūrvam abhyasya paścād vedam adhīyate || 4.125|| Those who are learned first master the threefold essence of the Vedas in sequence; having practiced beforehand, they then study the Veda itself.

title: Verse 4.126
content:
पशुमण्डूकमार्जारश्वसर्पनकुलाखुभिः ।
अन्तरागमने विद्यादनध्यायमहर्निशम् ॥ ४.१२६॥ paśumaṇḍūkamārjāraśvasarpanakulākhubhiḥ | antarāgamane vidyādanadhayāmaharniśam || 4.126|| One who enters among cattle, frogs, cats, dogs, snakes, mongooses, or similar creatures without restraint shall be deemed perpetually engaged in non-study day and night.

title: Verse 4.127
content:
द्वावेव वर्जयेन्नित्यमनध्यायौ प्रयत्नतः ।
स्वाध्यायभूमिं चाशुद्धमात्मानं चाशुचिं द्विजः ॥ ४.१२७॥ dvāv eva varjayennityamanadhhyāyau prayatnataḥ |
svādhyāyabhūmiṃ cāśuddhamātmānaṃ cāśuciṃ dvijaḥ || 4.127 || A twice-born must always strive to avoid two things with utmost effort: the place where Vedic study is conducted if it is impure, and his own self when he is in a state of ritual impurity.

title: Verse 4.128
content:
अमावास्यामष्टमीं च पौर्णमासीं चतुर्दशीम् ।
ब्रह्मचारी भवेन्नित्यमप्यर्तौ स्नातको द्विजः ॥ ४.१२८॥ amāvāsyāmaṣṭamīṁ ca paurṇamāsīṁ caturdaśīm |
brahmacārī bhaven nityam apy artau snātako dvijaḥ || 4.128|| A celibate shall remain pure in thought, word, and deed on new moon days, eighth lunar days, full moon days, and fourteenth lunar days; even after completing student life, a twice-born must maintain this discipline.

title: Verse 4.129
content:
न स्नानमाचरेद्भुक्त्वा नातुरो न महानिशि ।
न वासोभिः सहाजस्रं नाविज्ञाते जलाशये ॥ ४.१२९॥ na snānam ācaredbhuktvā nāturo na mahāniśi |
na vāsobhiḥ sahājasraṁ nāvijñāte jalāśaye || 4.129|| One must not bathe after eating, nor in excessive fatigue, nor during the great night; nor constantly with garments, nor in an unknown water body.

title: Verse 4.130
content:
देवतानां गुरो राज्ञः स्नातकाचार्ययोस्तथा ।
नाक्रामेत्कामतश्छायां बभ्रुणो दीक्षितस्य च ॥ ४.१३०॥ devatānāṁ guro rājñaḥ snātakācāryayos tathā |
nākrāmet kāmataś chāyāṁ babhruṇo dīkṣitasya ca || 4.130|| The shadow of a deity, preceptor, king, graduated student, teacher, ascetic in initiation, or a consecrated Brahmin must never be crossed intentionally.

title: Verse 4.131
content:
मध्यंदिनेऽर्धरात्रे च श्राद्धं भुक्त्वा च सामिषम् ।
संध्ययोरुभयोश्चैव न सेवेत चतुष्पथम् ॥ ४.१३१॥ madhyaṃdine 'rdharātre ca śrāddhaṃ bhuktva ca sāmiṣam |
sandhayor ubhayoś caiva na seveta catuṣpatham || 4.131|| One who has consumed ritual food during Śrāddha offerings at midday or midnight, or during both Sandhyā periods, shall not traverse crossroads.

title: Verse 4.132
content: उद्वर्तनमपस्नानं विण्मूत्रे रक्तमेव च । श्लेष्मनिष्ठ्यूतवान्तानि नाधितिष्ठेत्तु कामतः ॥ ४.१३२॥ udvartanam apasnānaṁ viṇmūtre raktam eva ca | śleṣma-niṣṭhyūta-vāntāni nādhitiṣṭhettu kāmataḥ || 4.132 || One must not engage in sexual intercourse during conditions of bodily discharge including blood, mucus, phlegm, vomit, or excrement.

title: Verse 4.133
content:
वैरिणं नोपसेवेत सहायं चैव वैरिणः ।
अधार्मिकं तस्करं च परस्यैव च योषितम् ॥ ४.१३३॥ vairiṇaṁ nopaseveta sahāyaṁ caiva vairiṇaḥ |
adhārmikaṁ taskaraṁ ca parasyaiva ca yoṣitam || 4.133|| One must not serve an enemy, nor aid the enemy's ally; likewise, one must not associate with the unrighteous, thieves, or another’s woman.

title: Verse 4.134
content:
न हीदृशमनायुष्यं लोके किं चन विद्यते ।
यादृशं पुरुषस्येह परदारोपसेवनम् ॥ ४.१३४॥ na hīdṛśamanāyuṣyaṃ loke kiṃ cana vidyate |
yādṛśaṃ puruṣasyeha paradāropasevanam || 4.134|| There exists no act in this world that diminishes life-force more than the violation of another's conjugal bond.

title: Verse 4.135
content:
क्षत्रियं चैव सर्पं च ब्राह्मणं च बहुश्रुतम् ।
नावमन्येत वै भूष्णुः कृशानपि कदा चन ॥ ४.१३५॥ kṣatriyaṃ caiva sarpaṃ ca brāhmaṇaṃ ca bahuśrutam |
nāvamanyeta vai bhūṣṇuḥ kṛśānapi kadā cana || 4.135|| One established in the consciousness of Bhūṣṇu shall never disrespect a Kshatriya, a serpent, a learned Brahmin, or even a dog or a crow.

title: Verse 4.136
content:
एतत्त्रयं हि पुरुषं निर्दहेदवमानितम् ।
तस्मादेतत्त्रयं नित्यं नावमन्येत बुद्धिमान् ॥ ४.१३६॥ etattrayaṁ hi puruṣaṁ nirdahedavamānitam | 
tasmādetattrayaṁ nityaṁ nāvamanyeta buddhimān || 4.136|| This threefold disrespect burns away the man who disrespects; therefore, the wise should never disregard this threefold principle.

title: Verse 4.137
content:
नात्मानमवमन्येत पुर्वाभिरसमृद्धिभिः ।
आ मृत्योः श्रियमन्विच्छेन्नैनां मन्येत दुर्लभाम् ॥ ४.१३७॥ nātmānam avamanyeta purvābhir asamṛddhibhiḥ |
ā mṛtyoḥ śriyamanvicchen na enāṃ manyeta durlabhām || One must not devalue the Self due to prior failures or unmet outcomes; one should persistently seek prosperity even from death-like conditions and must not regard it as rare or unattainable.

title: Verse 4.138
content:
सत्यं ब्रूयात्प्रियं ब्रूयान्न ब्रूयात्सत्यमप्रियम् ।
प्रियं च नानृतं ब्रूयादेष धर्मः सनातनः ॥ ४.१३८॥ satyaṁ brūyāt priyaṁ brūyān na brūyāt satyam apriyam |
