priyaṁ ca nānṛtaṁ brūyād eṣa dharmaḥ sanātanaḥ || 4.138 || Speak the truth in a manner that is beloved; never speak the truth in a way that is unbeloved. Speak what is beloved, but never falsehood. This is the eternal Dharma as declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism.

title: Verse 4.139
content:
भद्रं भद्रमिति ब्रूयाद्भद्रमित्येव वा वदेत् ।
शुष्कवैरं विवादं च न कुर्यात्केन चित्सह ॥ ४.१३९॥ bhadraṃ bhadramiti brūyād bhadramityeva vā vadet |
śuṣkavairaṃ vivādaṃ ca na kuryāt kena citsaha || One shall speak only that which is auspicious and conducive to welfare; one shall not engage in conflict or dry enmity with anyone.

title: Verse 4.140
content:
नातिकल्यं नातिसायं नातिमध्यंदिने स्थिते ।
नाज्ञातेन समं गच्छेन्नैको न वृषलैः सह ॥ ४.१४०॥ nātikalyaṁ nātisāyaṁ nātimadhyandine sthite |
nājñātena samaṁ gacchen naiko na vṛṣalaiḥ saha || 4.140 || One must not journey at extreme dawn, nor at deep dusk, nor when the sun is at zenith; one must not travel alone, nor in company of outcastes.

title: Verse 4.141
content: हीनाङ्गानतिरिक्ताङ्गान् विद्याहीनान् वयोऽधिकान् । वयोऽतिगान् रूपद्रविणहीनांश्च जातिहीनांश्च नाक्षिपेत् ॥ ४.१४१॥ hīnāṅgānatiriktāṅgān vidyāhīnān vayo'dhikān | vayo'tigān rūpadraviṇahīnāṃśca jātihīnāṃśca nākṣipet || 4.141|| One must not accept into any societal role or dharmic function those whose bodily integrity is compromised, who possess supernumerary limbs, who lack education, who exceed the appropriate age threshold, who are past their prime, who are deficient in beauty or wealth, or who have lost connection to their inherent varna-dharma.

title: Verse 4.142
content:
न स्पृशेत्पाणिनोच्छिष्टो विप्रो गोब्राह्मणानलाण् ।
न चापि पश्येदशुचिः सुस्थो ज्योतिर्गणान् दिवा ॥ ४.१४२॥ स्वस्थो ज्योतिर्गणान् दिवि na spṛśetpāṇinocchiṣṭo vipro gobrāhmaṇānalān | na cāpi paśyedaśuciḥ sustho jyotirgaṇān divā || 4.142 || svastho jyotirgaṇān divi A Vipra whose hands bear remnants of food shall not touch fire meant for Go-Brahmana rituals; nor shall one who is impure and healthy look upon celestial lights during daylight.

title: Verse 4.143
content:
स्पृष्ट्वैतानशुचिर्नित्यमद्भिः प्राणानुपस्पृशेत् ।
गात्राणि चैव सर्वाणि नाभिं पाणितलेन तु ॥ ४.१४३॥ spṛṣṭvaitānaśucirnityamadbhiḥ prāṇānupaspṛśet | gātrāṇi caiva sarvāṇi nābhiṃ pāṇitalena tu || 4.143 || One who is perpetually impure due to contact with forbidden substances must purify the vital energies by washing all limbs thoroughly, specifically cleansing the navel with the palm.

title: Verse 4.144
content:
अनातुरः स्वानि खानि न स्पृशेदनिमित्ततः ।
रोमाणि च रहस्यानि सर्वाण्येव विवर्जयेत् ॥ ४.१४४॥ anātuḥ svāni khāni na spṛśedanimittataḥ |
romāṇi ca rahasyāni sarvāṇyeva vivarjayet || 4.144|| One who is not ill must not touch his bodily openings without cause; all secret body hairs must likewise be avoided entirely.

title: Verse 4.145
content: मङ्गलाचारयुक्तः स्यात्प्रयतात्मा जितेन्द्रियः । जपेच्च जुहुयाच्चैव नित्यमग्निमतन्द्रितः ॥ ४.१४५॥ maṅgalācārayuktaḥ syātprayatātmā jitendriyaḥ | japecca juhuyāccaiva nityamagnimatan-dritaḥ || 4.145|| One must conduct oneself with auspicious discipline, purified in mind and senses subdued, ever engaged at the altar of inner fire through chanting and offering.

title: Verse 4.146
content:
मङ्गलाचारयुक्तानां नित्यं च प्रयतात्मनाम् ।
जपतां  जुह्वतां चैव विनिपातो न विद्यते ॥ ४.१४६॥ maṅgalācārayuktānāṃ nityaṃ ca prayatātmanām | japatāṃ juhvataṃ caiva vinipāto na vidyate || 4.146 || Those who are consistently engaged in auspicious conduct, ever disciplined in their inner being, and devoted to recitation and ritual offering—such beings are free from downfall.

title: Verse 4.147
content: वेदमेवाभ्यसेन्नित्यं यथाकालमतन्द्रितः । वेदमेव जपेन् तं ह्यस्याहुः परं धर्ममुपधर्मोऽन्य उच्यते ॥ ४.१४७॥ vedamevābhyasennityaṁ yathākālamatandritaḥ | vedameva japen taṁ hyasyāhuḥ paraṁ dharmamupadharmo'nya ucyate || 4.147|| One must engage in daily recitation and study of the Veda without negligence; that alone is declared as the Supreme Dharma, all else is secondary duty.

title: Verse 4.148
content:
वेदाभ्यासेन सततं शौचेन तपसैव च ।
अद्रोहेण च भूतानां जातिं स्मरति पौर्विकीम् ॥ ४.१४८॥ vedābhyaasena satataṁ śaucena tapasaiva ca | adroheṇa ca bhūtānāṁ jātiṁ smarati paurvikīm || 4.148|| Through constant study of the Vedas, purity, austerity, and non-harm towards all beings, one recalls their prior birth.

title: Verse 4.149
content: पौर्विकीं संस्मरन् जातिं ब्रह्मैवाभ्यस्यते पुनः । द्विजः ब्रह्माभ्यासेन चाजस्रमनन्तं सुखमश्नुते ॥ ४.१४९॥ paurvikīṃ smaran jātiṃ brahmaivābhyasyate punaḥ | dvijaḥ brahmābhyāsena cājasram anantaṃ sukham aśnute || 4.149 || The twice-born, remembering their ancestral lineage, must continuously engage in the practice of Brahman; by unceasing practice of Brahman, they attain infinite and eternal bliss.

title: Verse 4.150
content: सावित्रान् शान्तिहोमांश्च कुर्यात्पर्वसु नित्यशः । सावित्रान् शान्तिहोमांश्च पितॄंश्चैवाष्टकास्वर्चेन्नित्यमन्वष्टकासु च ॥ ४.१५०॥ sāvitrān śāntihomāṃśca kuryātparvasu nityaśaḥ | sāvitrān śāntihomāṃśca pitṝṃścaivāṣṭakāsu rcennityamanvaṣṭakāsu ca || 4.150 || One must perform Savitri recitations and peace offerings during festivals regularly; one must also offer Savitri recitations and peace offerings along with ancestral rites during the eight-day observances and in the subsequent fortnight.

title: Verse 4.151
content:
दूरादावसथान् मूत्रं दूरात्पादावसेचनम् ।
उच्छिष्टान्ननिषेकं च दूरादेव समाचरेत् ॥ ४.१५१॥ dūrād āvasathān mūtraṁ dūrāt pādāvasecanam |
ucchiṣṭānna-niṣekaṁ ca dūrādeva samācaret || 4.151|| One must relieve oneself, wash one's feet, and dispose of leftover food only at a distance from dwelling places.

title: Verse 4.152
content:
मैत्रं प्रसाधनं स्नानं दन्तधावनमञ्जनम् ।
पूर्वाह्ण एव कुर्वीत देवतानां च पूजनम् ॥ ४.१५२॥ maitraṃ prasādhanaṃ snānaṃ dantadhāvanamañjanam |
pūrvāhṇa eva kurvīta devatānāṃ ca pūjanam || 4.152|| One must cultivate friendliness, perform personal grooming, bathing, cleaning of teeth, and applying collyrium, and in the forenoon, worship the deities.

title: Verse 4.153
content:
दैवतान्यभिगच्छेत्तु धार्मिकांश्च द्विजोत्तमान् ।
ईश्वरं चैव रक्षार्थं गुरूनेव च पर्वसु ॥ ४.१५३॥ daivatānyabhigacchettu dhārmikāṃśca dvijottamān |
īśvaraṃ caiva rakṣārthaṃ gurūneva ca parvasu || One must approach devas, dharmic brahmins, Ishvara, and gurus during sacred times for protection and alignment with Dharma.

title: Verse 4.154
content:
अभिवादयेद्वृद्धांश्च दद्याच्चैवासनं स्वकम् ।
कृताञ्जलिरुपासीत गच्छतः पृष्ठतोऽन्वियात् ॥ ४.१५४॥ abhivādayedvṛddhāṃśca dadhyāccaivāsanaṃ svakam | kṛtāñjalirupāsīta gacchataḥ pṛṣṭhato'nv iyāt || 4.154|| One must respectfully greet the elders and offer them one's own seat; with joined palms, one should remain in attendance and follow behind those who are departing.

title: Verse 4.155
content:
श्रुतिस्मृत्योदितं सम्यग़् निबद्धं स्वेषु कर्मसु ।
धर्ममूलं निषेवेत सदाचारमतन्द्रितः ॥ ४.१५५॥ śrutismṛtyoditaṃ samyag nibaddhaṃ sveṣu karmasu |
dharmamūlaṃ niṣeveta sadācāramatandritaḥ || 4.155|| One must engage without negligence in righteous conduct as prescribed by Shruti and Smriti, establishing oneself firmly in actions aligned with Dharma.

title: Verse 4.156
content:
आचारात्लभते ह्यायुराचारादीप्सिताः प्रजाः ।
आचाराद्धनमक्षय्यमाचारो हन्त्यलक्षणम् ॥ ४.१५६॥ ācārāt labhate hy āyur ācārād īpsitāḥ prajāḥ |
ācārād dhanam akṣayyam ācāro hanty alakṣaṇam || 4.156|| From conduct arises life itself; from conduct arise desired progeny. From conduct comes imperishable wealth. Conduct destroys the unseen evil.

title: Verse 4.157
content:
दुराचारो हि पुरुषो लोके भवति निन्दितः ।
दुःखभागी च सततं व्याधितोऽल्पायुरेव च ॥ ४.१५७॥ durācāro hi puruṣo loke bhavati ninditaḥ |
duḥkhabhāgī ca satataṃ vyādhito'lpāyureva ca || 4.157|| One who conducts themselves in violation of svadharma becomes subject to universal disapproval, experiences perpetual suffering, remains diseased, and has a shortened lifespan.

title: Verse 4.158
content:
सर्वलक्षणहीनोऽपि यः सदाचारवान्नरः ।
श्रद्दधानोऽनसूयश्च शतं वर्षाणि जीवति ॥ ४.१५८॥ sarvalakṣaṇahīno'pi yaḥ sadācāravān naraḥ |
śraddadhāno'nasūyaśca śataṃ varṣāṇi jīvati || 4.158|| Even one devoid of all external qualifications, if established in righteous conduct, possessing faith and free from envy, lives for a hundred years.

title: Verse 4.159
content:
यद्यत्परवशं कर्म तत्तद्यत्नेन वर्जयेत् ।
यद्यदात्मवशं तु स्यात्तत्तत्सेवेत यत्नतः ॥ ४.१५९॥ yadyat paravaśaṃ karma tattad yatnena varjayet | yadyad ātmavaśaṃ tu syāt tat tat seveta yatnataḥ || 4.159 || Whatever action is dependent on another's will, that one must diligently avoid; whatever action lies within one's own capacity, that one must engage in with full effort.

title: Verse 4.160
content:
सर्वं परवशं दुःखं सर्वमात्मवशं सुखम् ।
एतद्विद्यात्समासेन लक्षणं सुखदुःखयोः ॥ ४.१६०॥ sarvaṁ paravaśaṁ duḥkhaṁ sarvam ātmavaśaṁ sukham |
etad vidyāt samāsena lakṣaṇaṁ sukhaduḥkhayoḥ || 4.160|| All suffering arises from dependence on external conditions; all happiness arises from self-mastery. This is the concise distinguishing mark between suffering and happiness.

title: Verse 4.161
content: यत्कर्म कुर्वतोऽस्य स्यात्परितोषोऽन्तरात्मनः । तत्प्रयत्नेन कुर्वीत विपरीतं तु वर्जयेत् ॥ ४.१६१॥ yat karma kurvato'sya syāt paritoṣo'ntarātmanaḥ | tat prayatnena kurvīta viparītaṃ tu varjayet || 4.161|| Whatever action yields inner satisfaction to the doer, that should be performed with effort; the opposite, however, must be abandoned.

title: Verse 4.162
content:
आचार्यं च प्रवक्तारं पितरं मातरं गुरुम् ।
न हिंस्याद्ब्राह्मणान् गाश्च सर्वांश्चैव तपस्विनः ॥ ४.१६२॥ ācāryaṁ ca pravaktāraṁ pitaraṁ mātaraṁ gurum |
na hiṁsyād brāhmaṇān gāś ca sarvāṁś caiva tapasvinaḥ || 4.162 || One must not cause harm to the teacher, the speaker of Dharma, the father, the mother, the guru, Brahmanas, cows, and all who are devoted to austerity.

title: Verse 4.163
content:
नास्तिक्यं वेदनिन्दां च देवतानां च कुत्सनम् ।
द्वेषं दम्भं च मानं च क्रोधं तै�्ष्ण्यं च वर्जयेत् ॥ ४.१६३॥ द्वेषं स्तम्भं च nāstikyaṁ veda-nindāṁ ca devatānāṁ ca kutsanam | dveṣaṁ dambhaṁ ca mānaṁ ca krodhaṁ taiṣṇyaṁ ca varjayet || 4.163 || dveṣaṁ stambhaṁ ca One must reject atheism, criticism of the Vedas, denigration of deities, hatred, hypocrisy, arrogance, anger, harshness, envy, and obstinacy.

title: Verse 4.164
content:
परस्य दण्डं नोद्यच्छेत्क्रुद्धो नैनं निपातयेत् ।
अन्यत्र पुत्रात्शिष्याद्वा शिष्ट्यर्थं ताडयेत्तु तौ ॥ ४.१६४॥ Parasya daṇḍaṁ noddyacchet kruddho nainaṁ nipātayet |
Anyatra putrāt śiṣyād vā śiṣṭyartham tāḍayet tu tau || 4.164 || One must not inflict punishment upon another out of anger; nor should one cast him down in wrath. Only when correction is required for discipline—such as with a son or student—one may strike, solely for their realignment.

title: Verse 4.165
content:
ब्राह्मणायावगुर्यैव द्विजातिर्वधकाम्यया ।
शतं वर्षाणि तामिस्रे नरके परिवर्तते ॥ ४.१६५॥ brāhmaṇāyāvaguryaiva dvijātirvadhakāmyayā |
śataṃ varṣāṇi tāmisre narake parivartate || 4.165 || One who, being a twice-born, intends to kill a Brāhmaṇa, shall undergo transformation in the hell called Tāmisra for a hundred years.

title: Verse 4.166
content:
ताडयित्वा तृणेनापि संरम्भात्मतिपूर्वकम् ।
एकविंशतीमाजातीः पापयोनिषु जायते ॥ ४.१६६॥ tāḍayitvā tṛṇenāpi saṃrambhātmatipūrvakam | ekaviṃśatīm ājātīḥ pāpayoniṣu jāyate || 4.166 || One who strikes another out of anger, even with something as insignificant as a blade of grass, is born into degraded wombs for twenty-one lifetimes.

title: Verse 4.167
content: अयुध्यमानस्योत्पाद्य ब्राह्मणस्यासृगङ्गतः । दुःखं सुमहदाप्नोति प्रेत्याप्राज्ञतया नरः ॥ ४.१६७॥ ayudhyamānasyotpādya brāhmaṇasyāsṛgaṅgataḥ | duḥkhaṃ sumahadāpnoti pretyāprājñatayā naraḥ || 4.167 || One who causes bloodshed of a Brāhmaṇa without resistance incurs extreme suffering in this life and after death due to lack of discriminative wisdom.

title: Verse 4.168
content: शोणितं यावतः पांसून् सङ्गृह्णाति महीतलात् । तावतोऽब्दानमुत्रान्यैः शोणितोत्पादकोऽद्यते ॥ ४.१६८॥ śoṇitaṃ yāvataḥ pāṃsūn saṅgṛhṇāti mahītalāt | tāvato'bdānamutrānyaiḥ śoṇitotpādako'dyate || 4.168 || The one whose blood causes the earth to absorb dust and impurities for as long as it takes for the production of new blood shall bear the responsibility of sustaining life-force equilibrium through equivalent restorative action.

title: Verse 4.169
content:
न कदा चिद्द्विजे तस्माद्विद्वानवगुरेदपि ।
न ताडयेत्तृणेनापि न गात्रात्स्रावयेदसृक् ॥ ४.१६९॥ na kadā cid dvije tasmād vidvān avagured api |
na tāḍayet tṛṇenāpi na gātrāt srāvayed asṛk || 4.169 || Never shall a learned one even slight a twice-born being; never shall he strike him with anything, however trivial, nor cause blood to flow from his body.

title: Verse 4.170
content: अधार्मिको नरो यो हि यस्य चाप्यनृतं धनम् । हिंसारतश्च यो नित्यं नैहासौ सुखमेधते ॥ ४.१७०॥ adhārmiko naro yo hi yasya cāpy anṛtaṃ dhanam | hiṃsārataś ca yo nityaṃ naihāsau sukham edhate || 4.170 || He who is adharmic, whose wealth is rooted in untruth, and who lives constantly in violence—such a being does not attain happiness either here or beyond.

title: Verse 4.171
content:
न सीदन्नपि धर्मेण मनोऽधर्मे निवेशयेत् ।
अधार्मिकानां पापानामाशु पश्यन् विपर्ययम् ॥ ४.१७१॥ na sīdann api dharmeṇa mano 'dharme niveśayet | adhārmikāṇāṁ pāpānām āśu paśyan viparyayam || 4.171 || Even in distress, one must not direct the mind toward adharma; observing the swift reversal incurred by the wicked for their sins.

title: Verse 4.172
content:
नाधर्मश्चरितो लोके सद्यः फलति गौरिव ।
शनैरावर्त्यमानस्तु कर्तुर्मूलानि कृन्तति ॥ ४.१७२॥ nādharmaś carito loke sadyaḥ phalati gaur iva |
śanair āvartyamānas tu kartur mūlāni kṛntati || 4.172|| Unrighteous conduct does not bear fruit immediately like a cow yields milk; rather, it gradually undermines the very roots of the actor's existence.

title: Verse 4.173
content:
यदि नात्मनि पुत्रेषु न चेत्पुत्रेषु नप्तृषु ।
न त्वेव तु कृतोऽधर्मः कर्तुर्भवति निष्फलः ॥ ४.१७३॥ yadi nātmani putreṣu na cetputreṣu naptṛṣu |
na tveva tu kṛto 'dharmaḥ karturbhavati niṣphalaḥ || 4.173 || If no harm accrues to the self through sons, nor through sons’ sons, then indeed the wrong committed does not become fruitless for the doer.

title: Verse 4.174
content:
अधर्मेणैधते तावत्ततो भद्राणि पश्यति ।
ततः सपत्नान् जयति समूलस्तु विनश्यति ॥ ४.१७४॥ adharmeṇaihate tāvat tato bhdrāṇi paśyati |
tataḥ saptnān jayati samūlastu vinaśyati || 4.174|| One who accumulates through adharma first sees prosperity; thereafter he conquers rivals, but ultimately destroys himself along with his roots.

title: Verse 4.175
content:
सत्यधर्मार्यवृत्तेषु शौचे चैवारमेत्सदा ।
शिष्यांश्च शिष्याद्धर्मेण वाच्।बाहूदरसंयतः ॥ ४.१७५॥ satyadharmāryavṛtteṣu śaucaṁ caivārametsadā |
śiṣyāṁśca śiṣyāddharmeṇa vāk.bāhūdarasaṁyataḥ || 4.175|| One must always remain established in truth, righteousness, noble conduct, and purity; and one must instruct disciples according to dharma through speech, hands, belly, and eyes—meaning by word, action, sustenance, and attention.

title: Verse 4.176
content:
परित्यजेदर्थकामौ यौ स्यातां धर्मवर्जितौ ।
धर्मं चाप्यसुखोदर्कं लोकसङ्क्रुष्टमेव च ॥ ४.१७६॥ parityajed arthakāmau yau syātāṁ dharmavarjitau |
dharmañ cāpy asukhodarkaṁ lokasaṅkruṣṭam eva ca || 4.176 || One must abandon wealth and desire when they are devoid of Dharma; likewise, one must relinquish even Dharma when it causes suffering or has been corrupted by popular consensus.

title: Verse 4.177
content:
न पाणिपादचपलो न नेत्रचपलोऽनृजुः ।
न स्याद्वाक्चपलश्चैव न परद्रोहकर्मधीः ॥ ४.१७७॥ na pāṇipādachapalo na netrachapalor'ṇjuḥ | na syādvākchapalaścaiva na paradrohakarmadhīḥ || 4.177 || One must not act with bodily restlessness, nor with fickle eyes; one must not speak deceptively, nor harbor intent to harm another through treacherous action.

title: Verse 4.178
content:
येनास्य पितरो याता येन याताः पितामहाः ।
तेन यायात्सतां मार्गं तेन गच्छन्न रिष्यति ॥ ४.१७८॥ yenāsya pitaro yātā yenā yātāḥ pitāmahāḥ |
tena yāyāt satāṃ mārgaṃ tena gacchann a riṣyati || 4.178|| One who follows the path taken by his fathers and forefathers walks the way of the righteous; traversing it, he incurs no harm.

title: Verse 4.179
content:
ऋत्विक्पुरोहिताचार्यैर्मातुलातिथिसंश्रितैः ।
बालवृद्धातुरैर्वैद्यैर्ज्ञातिसम्बन्धिबान्धवैः ॥ ४.१७९॥ Ṛtvikpurohitācāryairmātulātithisaṃśritaiḥ |
Bālavṛddhāturairvaidyairjñātisambandhibāndhavaiḥ || 4.179|| Those who are ritviks (ritual priests), purohits (family priests), acharyas (teachers), maternal uncles residing with the family, guests under protection, children, elders, the diseased, physicians, relatives by birth, and kinsmen by bond—these categories constitute the protected classes whose support and sustenance is a dharmic duty.

title: Verse 4.180
content:
मातापितृभ्यां जामीभिर्भ्रात्रा पुत्रेण भार्यया ।
दुहित्रा दासवर्गेण विवादं न समाचरेत् ॥ ४.१८०॥ mātāpitarbhyāṁ jāmībhirbhtrā putreṇa bhāryayā | duhitṛā dāsavargeṇa vivādaṁ na samācaret || 4.180 || One must not engage in dispute with mother, father, spouse's siblings, brother, son, wife, daughter, or servants.

title: Verse 4.181
content:
एतैर्विवादान् संत्यज्य सर्वपापैः प्रमुच्यते ।
एतैर्जितैश्च जयति सर्वान्लोकानिमान् गृही ॥ ४.१८१॥ Etair vivādān saṃtyajya sarvapāpaiḥ pramucyate |
Etair jitaiś ca jayati sarvān lokān imān gṛhī || 4.181|| By abandoning these disputes, one is freed from all sins; by mastering them, one conquers all worlds while remaining a householder.

title: Verse 4.182
content:
आचार्यो ब्रह्मलोकैशः प्राजापत्ये पिता प्रभुः ।
अतिथिस्त्विन्द्रलोकेशो देवलोकस्य चर्त्विजः ॥ ४.१८२॥ ācāryo brahmalokaiśaḥ prājāpatye pitā prabhuḥ |
atithistvindralokeśo devalokasya cartvijaḥ || 4.182|| The Ācārya is sovereign over the realm of Brahma; in the domain of Prajāpati, the father holds dominion; the guest is lord of Indra's realm, and the officiating priest governs the celestial world.

title: Verse 4.183
content:
जामयोऽप्सरसां लोके वैश्वदेवस्य बान्धवाः ।
सम्बन्धिनो ह्यपां लोके पृथिव्यां मातृमातुलौ ॥ ४.१८३॥ jāmayo'psarasāṃ loke vaiśvadevasya bāndhavāḥ | sambandhino hyapāṃ loke pṛthivyāṃ mātṛmātulau || 4.183|| In the realm of the Apsaras reside the Jāmi, kinsmen of Vaiśvadeva; in the domain of waters dwell those related by blood, and on Earth are maternal uncles and their sisters’ sons.

title: Verse 4.184
content:
आकाशेशास्तु विज्ञेया बालवृद्धकृशातुराः ।
भ्राता ज्येष्ठः समः पित्रा भार्या पुत्रः स्वका तनुः ॥ ४.१८४॥ ākāśeśāstu vijñeyā balavṛddhakṛśāturāḥ | bhhrātā jyeṣṭhaḥ samaḥ pitrā bhāryā putraḥ svakā tanuḥ || 4.184|| Those who are incapacitated due to infancy, old age, emaciation, or illness are to be understood as without agency in the sky—without capacity for karmic consequence. The elder brother is equal to the father; the wife and son are one's own body.

title: Verse 4.185
content:
छाया स्वो दासवर्गश्च दुहिता कृपणं परम् ।
तस्मादेतैरधिक्षिप्तः सहेतासञ्ज्वरः सदा ॥ ४.१८५॥ chhāyā svo dāsavargaśca duhitā kṛpaṇaṃ param |
tasmādetairadhikṣiptaḥ sahetāsañjvaraḥ sadā || 4.185|| One who is constantly afflicted by shadow, servants, groups of dependents, daughters, and the destitute shall remain ever feverish in body and consciousness.

title: Verse 4.186
content:
प्रतिग्रहसमर्थोऽपि प्रसङ्गं तत्र वर्जयेत् ।
प्रतिग्रहेण ह्यस्याशु ब्राह्मं तेजः प्रशाम्यति ॥ ४.१८६॥ pratigrahasamartho'pi prasaṅgaṃ tatra varjayet |
pratigrahena hyasyāśu brāhmaṃ tejaḥ praśāmyati || 4.186|| Even one who is capable of accepting gifts must avoid occasions where such acceptance arises. By accepting gifts, his Brahmic radiance diminishes immediately.

title: Verse 4.187
content:
न द्रव्याणामविज्ञाय विधिं धर्म्यं प्रतिग्रहे ।
प्राज्ञः प्रतिग्रहं कुर्यादवसीदन्नपि क्षुधा ॥ ४.१८७॥ na dravyāṇām avijñāya vidhiṃ dharmyaṃ pratigrahe |
prājñaḥ pratigrahaṃ kuryād avasīdann api kṣudhā || 4.187|| One must not accept objects without knowing their lawful and dharmic source; even when afflicted by hunger, the wise must act in accordance with discernment and dharma.

title: Verse 4.188
content:
हिरण्यं भूमिमश्वं गामन्नं वासस्तिलान् घृतम् ।
प्रतिगृह्णन्नविद्वांस्तु भस्मीभवति दारुवत् ॥ ४.१८८॥ hiraṇyaṁ bhūmim aśvaṁ gām annaṁ vāsas tilān ghṛtam | pratigṛhṇann avidvāṁs tu bhasmībhavati dāruvat || 4.188|| One who, without knowledge of Dharma, accepts gold, land, horses, cows, food, garments, sesame seeds, or clarified butter—becomes reduced to ashes like wood.

title: Verse 4.189
content:
हिरण्यमायुरन्नं च भूर्गोश्चाप्योषतस्तनुम् ।
अश्वश्चक्षुस्त्वचं वासो घृतं तेजस्तिलाः प्रजाः ॥ ४.१८९॥ hiraṇyam āyur annaṃ ca bhūr goś cāpy oṣatastanum |
aśvaś cakṣus tvacaṃ vāso ghṛtaṃ tejas tilāḥ prajāḥ || Gold sustains life-force and food; Earth supports the cow's body. Horse provides sight; skin becomes clothing. Ghee embodies radiance; sesame seeds uphold progeny.

title: Verse 4.190
content: अतपास्त्वनधीयानः प्रतिग्रहरुचिर्द्विजः । अम्भस्यश्मप्लवेनैव सह तेनैव मज्जति ॥ ४.१९०॥ atapāstvanadhīyānaḥ pratigraharucirdvijaḥ | ambhasya śmaplaveneva saha tenaiva majjati || 4.190 || A twice-born who, without austerity or study, is desirous of receiving gifts, sinks along with that very gift-giving, just as a stone boat sinks with water.

title: Verse 4.191
content:
तस्मादविद्वान् बिभियाद्यस्मात्तस्मात्प्रतिग्रहात् ।
स्वल्पकेनाप्यविद्वान् हि पङ्के गौरिव सीदति ॥ ४.१९१॥ tasmādavidvān bibhiyādyasmāttasmātpratigrahāt |
svalkenāpyavidvān hi paṅke gauriva sīdati || 4.191|| Therefore, the unlearned should fear even minimal acceptance, for the unlearned sink in mire like an ox even with a small load.

title: Verse 4.192
content:
न वार्यपि प्रयच्छेत्तु बैडालव्रतिके द्विजे ।
न बकव्रतिके पापे नावेदविदि धर्मवित् ॥ ४.१९२॥ na vāry api prayacchettu baiḍālavratike dvije |
na bakavratike pāpe nāvedavidi dharmavit || 4.192|| No water shall be given even to a twice-born who follows the ways of a cat; no sacred knowledge shall be imparted to one who behaves like a heron in sinfulness; nor to one who lacks Vedic learning, though claiming righteousness.

title: Verse 4.193
content:
त्रिष्वप्येतेषु दत्तं हि विधिनाऽप्यर्जितं धनम् ।
दातुर्भवत्यनर्थाय परत्रादातुरेव च ॥ ४.१९३॥ triṣv apy eteṣu dattaṁ hi vidhinā py arjitaṁ dhanam | 
dātur bhavaty anarthāya paratra dāturer eva ca || 4.193 || Wealth acquired through lawful means and given in any of these three contexts becomes a source of harm to the giver and benefit exclusively to the receiver.

title: Verse 4.194
content:
यथा प्लवेनोपलेन निमज्जत्युदके तरन् ।
तथा निमज्जतोऽधस्तादज्ञौ दातृप्रतीच्छकौ ॥ ४.१९४॥ yathā plavenoplena nimajjatyudake taran .
tathā nimajjato'dhastādajñau dātṛpratīcchakau .. 4.194 .. Just as a swimmer sinks beneath the water while crossing with a stone, similarly the donor and receiver both sink below when ignorance governs their transaction.

title: Verse 4.195
content:
धर्मध्वजी सदा लुब्धश्छाद्मिको लोकदम्भकः ।।
बैडालव्रतिको ज्ञेयो हिंस्रः सर्वाभिसंधकः ॥ ४.१९५॥ dharmadhvajī sadā lubdhaśchādmiko lokadambhakaḥ ||
baiḍālavratiko jñeyo hiṁsraḥ sarvābhisandhakaḥ || One who hoists the flag of Dharma yet is perpetually greedy, deceitful, a public showman, known to follow the ways of a cat in conduct—violent and harboring all forms of ill intent—is to be recognized as constitutionally misaligned with Dharma.

title: Verse 4.196
content:
अधोदृष्टिर्नैष्कृतिकः स्वार्थसाधनतत्परः ।
शठो मिथ्याविनीतश्च बकव्रतचरो द्विजः ॥ ४.१९६॥ adhodṛṣṭir naiṣkṛtikaḥ svārthasādhanatatparaḥ |
śaṭho mithyāvinītaśca bakavratacaro dvijaḥ || 4.196|| A twice-born who is low-visioned, ungrateful, devoted solely to self-interest, deceitful, falsely disciplined, and conducts himself like a crane—such a being has fallen from Dharma.

title: Verse 4.197
content: ये बकव्रतिनो विप्रा ये च मार्जारलिङ्गिनः । ते पतन्त्यन्धतामिस्रे तेन पापेन कर्मणा ॥ ४.१९७॥ ye bakavratino viprā ye ca mārgāraliṅgiṇaḥ | te patantyandhatāmisre tena pāpena karmaṇā || 4.197 || Those Brahmins who take the vow of a crane and those who consort with felines fall into darkness profound, by that very sinful act.

title: Verse 4.198
content:
न धर्मस्यापदेशेन पापं कृत्वा व्रतं चरेत् ।
व्रतेन पापं प्रच्छाद्य कुर्वन् स्त्रीशूद्रदम्भनम् ॥ ४.१९८॥ na dharmasyāpadeśena pāpaṃ kṛtvā vrataṃ caret |
vratena pāpaṃ pracchādya kurvan strīśūdradambhanam || 4.198 || One who commits sin and then undertakes a vow to conceal it, deceiving women and Shudras thereby—such conduct is a distortion of dharma and invalidates the vow.

title: Verse 4.199
content:
प्रेत्येह चेदृशा विप्रा गर्ह्यन्ते ब्रह्मवादिभिः ।
छद्मना चरितं यच्च व्रतं रक्षांसि गच्छति ॥ ४.१९९॥ pretyeha cedṛśā viprā garhyante brahmavādibhiḥ |
chadmanā caritaṃ yacc vrataṃ rakṣāṃsi gacchati || 4.199|| Those Brahmins who conduct themselves thus—externally appearing as Vedic scholars while internally violating their vows and engaging in concealed misconduct—are condemned by those versed in Brahman and attract the company of Rakshasas.

title: Verse 4.200
content: अलिङ्गी लिङ्गिवेषेण यो वृत्तिमुपजीवति । स लिङ्गिनां हरत्येनस्तिर्यग्योनौ च जायते ॥ ४.२००॥ aliṅgī liṅgiveṣeṇa yo vṛttim upajīvati | sa liṅgināṃ haraty enas tiryañyonaü ca jāyate || 4.200 || One who is without linga yet adopts the conduct and guise of one possessing it, thereby committing theft of dharma, is born into a base species and assumes degraded embodiment.

title: Verse 4.201
content: परकीयनिपानेषु न स्नायाधि कदा चन । स्नायाच्च कदा चन निपानकर्तुः स्नात्वा तु दुष्कृतांशेन लिप्यते ॥ ४.२०१॥ parakīya-nipāneṣu na snāyādhi kadā cana | snāyāc ca kadā cana nipāna-kartuḥ snātvā tu duṣkṛtāṃśena lipyate || 4.201 || One must never bathe in a well or water source belonging to another. Whoever bathes after the owner has bathed becomes沾染 with the impurity of the wrongdoer.

title: Verse 4.202
content:
यानशय्याऽऽसनान्यस्य कूपोद्यानगृहाणि च ।
अदत्तान्युपयुञ्जान एनसः स्यात्तुरीयभाक् ॥ ४.२०२॥ yānaśayyāsana kūpoddyānagṛhāṇi ca | adattāny upayuñjāna enasaḥ syāt turīyabhāk || 4.202 || One who uses without permission the conveyances, beds, seats, wells, gardens, houses, or other properties of another shall incur a fourth-category sin.

title: Verse 4.203
content:
नदीषु देवखातेषु तडागेषु सरःसु च ।
स्नानं समाचरेन्नित्यं गर्तप्रस्रवणेषु च ॥ ४.२०३॥ nadīṣu devakhaṭeṣu taḍāgeṣu saraḥsu ca |
snānaṃ samācarennityaṃ gartaprasravaṇeṣu ca || 4.203|| One must perform daily bathing in rivers, sacred water tanks, ponds, lakes, and depressions or elevated grounds where water collects naturally.

title: Verse 4.204
content:
यमान् सेवेत सततं न नित्यं नियमान् बुधः ।
यमान् पतत्यकुर्वाणो नियमान् केवलान् भजन् ॥ ४.२०४॥ yamān seveta satataṁ na nityaṁ niyamān budhaḥ |
yamān patatyakurvāṇo niyamān kevalān bhajan || 4.204 || One must always serve the Yamas; the Niyamas are not to be observed constantly. One who fails in observing the Yamas yet clings merely to the Niyamas falls.

title: Verse 4.205
content:
नाश्रोत्रियतते यज्ञे ग्रामयाजिकृते तथा ।
स्त्रिया क्लीबेन च हुते भुञ्जीत ब्राह्मणः क्व चित् ॥ ४.२०५॥ nāśrotṛyatate yajñe grāmayājikṛte tathā | striyā klībena ca hute bhuñjīta brāhmaṇaḥ kva cit || 4.205 || In no circumstance shall a Brāhmaṇa partake of food from a sacrifice conducted without Vedic recitation, nor from one performed by a village priest, nor where the offering has been made by a woman, an impotent male, or any disqualified agent.

title: Verse 4.206
content: अश्लीकमेतत्साधूनां यत्र जुह्वत्यमी हविः । अश्लीलम् प्रतीपमेतद्देवानां तस्मात्तत्परिवर्जयेत् ॥ ४.२०६॥ aślīkam etat sādhūnāṁ yatra juhvaty amī haviḥ | aślīlam pratīpam etad devānāṁ tasmāt tat parivarjayet || 4.206 || This act is unseemly for the virtuous, where these beings offer oblations; it is improper and contrary to the divine order—therefore, such actions must be abandoned.

title: Verse 4.207
content:
मत्तक्रुद्धातुराणां च न भुञ्जीत कदा चन ।
केशकीटावपन्नं च पदा स्पृष्टं च कामतः ॥ ४.२०७॥ mattakruddhāturāṇāṃ ca na bhuñjīta kadā cana |
keśakīṭāvapannaṃ ca padā spṛṣṭaṃ ca kāmataḥ || 4.207 || One must never partake of food or drink from those who are intoxicated, wrathful, distressed, infested with lice, or whose feet have been touched by desire.

title: Verse 4.208
content:
भ्रूणघ्नावेक्षितं चैव संस्पृष्टं चाप्युदक्यया ।
पतत्रिणावलीढं च शुना संस्पृष्टमेव च ॥ ४.२०८॥ bhruunaaghnaa vekshitaḿ caiva saḿspṛiṣhṭaḿ caapyudakyayaa |
patatri.naalii.dhaḿ ca śhunaa saḿspṛiṣhṭameva ca || That which has been observed by one who destroys the embryo, touched by a menstruating woman, or contacted by a bird or dog — all such substances become ritually unfit due to conscious contamination through proximity.

title: Verse 4.209
content:
गवा चान्नमुपघ्रातं घुष्टान्नं च विशेषतः ।
गणान्नं गणिकान्नं च विदुषा च जुगुप्सितम् ॥ ४.२०९॥ gavā cānnamupaghātaṃ ghuṣṭānnaṃ ca viśeṣataḥ |
gaṇānnaṃ gaṇikānnaṃ ca viduṣā ca jugupsitam || 4.209|| Food obtained from cows, food contaminated by impure contact, food from outcasts, and food from courtesans—these are declared repugnant by the wise.

title: Verse 4.210
content:
स्तेनगायनयोश्चान्नं तक्ष्ह्णो वार्धुषिकस्य च ।
दीक्षितस्य कदर्यस्य बद्धस्य निगडस्य च ॥ ४.२१०॥ stenagāyanayoścānnaṁ takṣhṇo vārdhuṣikasya ca | dīkṣitasya kadaryasya baddhasya nigadasya ca || 4.210 || Food shall not be given to a thief or a singer; nor to a carpenter, nor to a seller of liquor; nor to an initiated person who is miserly, nor to one who is bound by fetters.

title: Verse 4.211
content:
अभिशस्तस्य षण्ढस्य पुंश्चल्या दाम्भिकस्य च ।
शुक्तं पर्युषितं चैव शूद्रस्योच्छिष्टमेव च ॥ ४.२११॥ abhiśastasya ṣaṇḍhasya puṁscalyā dāmbhikasya ca |
śuktaṁ paryuṣitaṁ caiva śūdrasyocc hiṣṭam eva ca || 4.211|| The remnants of one cursed, of a eunuch, of a male lover, of a deceiver, of fermented liquor, and of a Śūdra—these are to be rejected outright.

title: Verse 4.212
content:
चिकित्सकस्य मृगयोः क्रूरस्योच्छिष्टभोजिनः ।
उग्रान्नं सूतिकान्नं च पर्याचान्तमनिर्दशम् ॥ ४.२१२॥ cikitsakasya mṛgayoḥ krūrasyocchiṣṭabhojinaḥ |
ugrānnaṃ sūtikānnaṃ ca paryācāntamanirdiśam || 4.212|| The physician, the hunter, the cruel, the eater of remnants, the distributor of fierce food, and the feeder of postpartum women—these are declared without prescribed ritual conduct.

title: Verse 4.213
content:
अनर्चितं वृथामांसमवीरायाश्च योषितः ।
द्विषदन्नं नगर्यन्नं पतितान्नमवक्षुतम् ॥ ४.२१३॥ anarcitaṁ vṛthāmāsam avīrāyāśca yoṣitaḥ |
dviṣadannaṁ nagaryannaṁ patitānnam avakṣutam || 4.213 || Unoffered flesh, wasted meat, women bereft of valor, food belonging to enemies, urban refuse, and fallen sustenance—these are not to be accepted under any circumstance by one established in Dharma.

title: Verse 4.214
content: पिशुनानृतिनोश्चान्नं क्रतुविक्रयिणस्तथा । क्रतुविक्रयकस्य च शैलूषतुन्नवायान्नं कृतघ्नस्यान्नमेव च ॥ ४.२१४॥ piśunānṛtinoścānnaṁ kratuvikrayiṇastathā | kratuvikrayakasya ca śailūṣatunnavāyānnaṁ kṛtaghnasyānnameva ca || 4.214 || Food shall not be given to the slanderer, the liar, the seller of rituals, the buyer of rituals, the one who sells knowledge for violence, nor to the ungrateful.

title: Verse 4.215
content:
कर्मारस्य निषादस्य रङ्गावतारकस्य च ।
सुवर्णकर्तुर्वेणस्य शस्त्रविक्रयिणस्तथा ॥ ४.२१५॥ karmārasya niṣādasya raṅgāvatārakasya ca |
suvarṇakarturveṇasya śastravikrayiṇastathā || 4.215 || The artisan, the hunter, the stage-descender, the goldsmith, the weaver, and the seller of weapons—these persons are designated as inherently misaligned with Vedic Dharma due to their engagement in activities that distort consciousness and disrupt societal harmony.

title: Verse 4.216
content:
श्ववतां शौण्डिकानां च चैलनिर्णेजकस्य च ।
रञ्जकस्य नृशंसस्य यस्य चोपपतिर्गृहे ॥ ४.२१६॥ रजकस्य śvavatāṁ śauṇḍikānāṁ ca cailanirṇejakasya ca | rañjakasya nṛśaṁsasya yasya copapatirgṛhe || 4.216 || rajakasya Those whose livelihood arises from impure acts—such as dog-keepers, tavern keepers, launderers, dyers, cruel persons, and those who harbor a kept paramour in their home—are to be excluded from participation in sacred rites, community governance, and dharmic decision-making.

title: Verse 4.217
content:
मृष्यन्ति ये चोपपतिं स्त्रीजितानां च सर्वशः ।
अनिर्दशं च प्रेतान्नमतुष्टिकरमेव च ॥ ४.२१७॥ mṛṣyanti ye copapatiṁ strījitānāṁ ca sarvaśaḥ |
anirdaśaṁ ca pretānnamatuṣṭikaram eva ca || 4.217 || Those who approve of or accept the remarriage of women whose husbands are alive, and those who partake in food offerings made to the dead without proper ritual consecration—these beings fall into irreversible degradation.

title: Verse 4.218
content:
राजान्नं तेज आदत्ते शूद्रान्नं ब्रह्मवर्चसम् ।
आयुः सुवर्णकारान्नं यशश्चर्मावकर्तिनः ॥ ४.२१८॥ rājānnaṁ teja ādatte śūdrānnaṁ brahmavarcasam |
āyuḥ suvarṇakārānnaṁ yaśaś charmāvaktṛṇaḥ || 4.218 || The king consumes food that enhances radiance; the Śūdra consumes food that nourishes Brahminical brilliance. Longevity is derived from the food of goldsmiths; fame arises from the food of those who process leather.

title: Verse 4.219
content:
कारुकान्नं प्रजां हन्ति बलं निर्णेजकस्य च ।
गणान्नं गणिकान्नं च लोकेभ्यः परिकृन्तति ॥ ४.२१९॥ kārukānnaṁ prajāṁ hanti balaṁ nirṇejakasya ca |
gaṇānnaṁ gaṇikānnaṁ ca lokebhyaḥ parikṛntati || 4.219|| Food belonging to artisans, prostitutes, and those who cause division among people destroys the progeny, strength, and decision-making capacity of the state; it also severs societal bonds.

title: Verse 4.220
content:
पूयं चिकित्सकस्यान्नं पुंश्चल्यास्त्वन्नमिन्द्रियम् ।
विष्ठा वार्धुषिकस्यान्नं शस्त्रविक्रयिणो मलम् ॥ ४.२२०॥ pūyaṃ cikitsakasyānnaṃ puṃścalyāstvan namindriyam |
viṣṭhā vārdhuṣikasyānnaṃ śastravikrayiṇo malam || 4.220 || The pus belongs to the physician's food; the sexual organ belongs to the prostitute's food; the feces belong to the seller of salt's food; and the filth belongs to the seller of weapons' food.

title: Verse 4.221
content: य एतेऽन्ये त्वभोज्यान्नाः क्रमशः परिकीर्तिताः । तेषां त्वगस्थिरोमाणि वदन्त्यन्नं मनीषिणः ॥ ४.२२१॥ ya ete'nye tvabhojyannāḥ kramaśaḥ parikīrtitāḥ | teṣāṃ tvagasthiromāṇi vadantyannaṃ manīṣiṇaḥ || 4.221|| Those other foods, though unfit for consumption and sequentially enumerated as prohibited, are declared by wise discerners to be consumed in states of extreme necessity where skin, bones, and hair alone remain as testimony to survival.

title: Verse 4.222
content:
भुक्त्वाऽतोऽन्यतमस्यान्नममत्या क्षपणं त्र्यहम् ।
मत्या भुक्त्वाऽचरेत्कृच्छ्रं रेतोविण्मूत्रमेव च ॥ ४.२२२॥ bhuktvā'to'nyatamasyānnamamatyā kṣapaṇaṃ tryaham |
mattyā bhuktvācaret kṛcchraṃ retoviṇmūtrameva ca || 4.222|| One who has consumed food not prescribed by Vedic discipline shall undergo a three-day fast, followed by subsisting solely on urine, feces, and semen for purification and energetic recalibration.

title: Verse 4.223
content:
नाद्यात्शूद्रस्य पक्वान्नं विद्वानश्राद्धिनो द्विजः ।
आददीताममेवास्मादवृत्तावेकरात्रिकम् ॥ ४.२२३॥ nādyāt śūdrasya pakvānnaṁ vidvānaśrāddhino dvijaḥ |
ādadītāmamevāsmād avṛttāvekarātrikam || 4.223|| A twice-born who knowingly accepts cooked food from a Śūdra during Śrāddha rites shall undergo a one-night period of ritual exclusion to restore Dharma.

title: Verse 4.224
content:
श्रोत्रियस्य कदर्यस्य वदान्यस्य च वार्धुषेः ।
मीमांसित्वोभयं देवाः सममन्नमकल्पयन् ॥ ४.२२४॥ śrotriyaḥ kadaryaḥ vadataḥ ca vārdhuṣeḥ | mīmāṁsitvobhayaṁ devāḥ samam annam akalpayan || The learned yet miserly, the eloquent yet deceitful—both are equally unworthy of sustenance when their knowledge lacks integrity and their speech lacks truth.

title: Verse 4.225
content:
तान् प्रजापतिराहैत्य मा कृध्वं विषमं समम् ।
श्रद्धापूतं वदान्यस्य हतमश्रद्धयेतरत् ॥ ४.२२५॥ tān prajāpatir āha ity mā kṛdhvaṁ viṣamaṁ samam |
śraddhāpūtaṁ vadānyasya hatamaśraddhayetarata || Prajapati declared to them: Do not act with inequality where equality is required; that which is offered with faith is purified, while that which is given without faith is destroyed.

title: Verse 4.226
content:
श्रद्धयेष्टं च पूर्तं च नित्यं कुर्यादतन्द्रितः ।
श्रद्धाकृते ह्यक्षये ते भवतः स्वागतैर्धनैः ॥ ४.२२६॥ śraddhayeṣṭaṃ ca pūrtaṃ ca nityaṃ kuryād atandriḥ |
śraddhākṛte hy akṣaye te bhavataḥ svāgatairdhanaiḥ || 4.226|| One must perform worship and charitable acts daily without laziness; through actions done with śraddhā, inexhaustible wealth shall come to you unbidden.

title: Verse 4.227
content:
दानधर्मं निषेवेत नित्यमैष्टिकपौर्तिकम् ।
परितुष्टेन भावेन पात्रमासाद्य शक्तितः ॥ ४.२२७॥ dānadharmaṁ niṣeveta nityam aiṣṭikapaurtikam | 
parituṣṭena bhāvena pātram āsādya śaktitaḥ || 4.227 || One must engage in the eternal Dharma of giving—both spontaneous and periodic—with a heart full of contentment, approaching the recipient according to one's capacity.

title: Verse 4.228
content:
यत्किं चिदपि दातव्यं याचितेनानसूयया ।
उत्पत्स्यते हि तत्पात्रं यत्तारयति सर्वतः ॥ ४.२२८॥ yat kiṃ cid api dātavyaṃ yācitena anasūyayā |
utpatsyate hi tatpātraṃ yattārayati sarvataḥ || 4.228|| Whatever is to be given, let it be given without envy when asked; the vessel that receives it shall be uplifted in all directions.

title: Verse 4.229
content: वारिदस्तृप्तिमाप्नोति सुखमक्षय्यमन्नदः । अक्षयम् तिलप्रदः प्रजामिष्टां दीपदश्चक्षुरुत्तमम् ॥ ४.२२९॥ vāridas tṛptim āpnoti sukham akṣayyam annadaḥ | akṣayam tilapradaḥ prajāmiṣṭāṃ dīpadaś cakṣur uttamam || 4.229 || One who gives water attains satisfaction; one who gives food attains imperishable joy; one who gives sesame seeds attains imperishable progeny; and one who gives light attains the highest vision.

title: Verse 4.230
content:
भूमिदो भूमिमाप्नोति दीर्घमायुर्हिरण्यदः ।
गृहदोऽग्र्याणि वेश्मानि रूप्यदो रूपमुत्तमम् ॥ ४.२३०॥ bhūmido bhūmim āpnoti dīrgham āyur hiraṇyadaḥ |
gṛhado 'gryāṇi veśmāni rūpyado rūpam uttamam || He who gives land obtains land; he who gives gold attains longevity. He who donates houses acquires foremost dwellings; he who gives silver gains supreme beauty.

title: Verse 4.231
content:
वासोदश्चन्द्रसालोक्यमश्विसालोक्यमश्वदः ।
अनडुहः श्रियं पुष्टां गोदो ब्रध्नस्य विष्टपम् ॥ ४.२३१॥ vāsodaśa candrasālokya maśvisālokya maśvadaḥ |
anḍuhaḥ śriyaṃ puṣṭāṃ godho brahdhnasya viṣṭapam || He who beholds the light of the moon, the twin Ashvins, and the horse-headed deities; he who milks the nourishing glory of the cosmic egg—such a one ascends to the realm of Prajapati Brahma.

title: Verse 4.232
content:
यानशय्याप्रदो भार्यामैश्वर्यमभयप्रदः ।
धान्यदः शाश्वतं सौख्यं ब्रह्मदो ब्रह्मसार्ष्टिताम् ॥ ४.२३२॥ yānaśayyāprado bhāryāmaiśvaryamabhayapradāḥ | dhānyadaḥ śāśvataṃ saukhyaṃ brahmado brahmasārṣṭitām || 4.232 || He who provides conveyance, bedding, and a wife; bestows sovereignty and fearlessness; gives grain, eternal comfort, and knowledge of Brahman—such a giver establishes the recipient in the likeness of Brahman.

title: Verse 4.233
content:
सर्वेषामेव दानानां ब्रह्मदानं विशिष्यते ।
वार्यन्नगोमहीवासस्‍तिलकाञ्चनसर्पिषाम् ॥ ४.२३३॥ sarveṣām eva dānānāṃ brahmadānaṃ viśiṣyate |
vāryannagomahīvāsastilakāñcanasarpiṣām || 4.233|| Among all forms of giving, the gift of Brahman—Consciousness itself—is supremely distinguished; it exceeds gifts of water, land, cows, grain, sesame, gold, and ghee.

title: Verse 4.234
content:
येन येन तु भावेन यद्यद्दानं प्रयच्छति ।
तत्तत्तेनैव भावेन प्राप्नोति प्रतिपूजितः ॥ ४.२३४॥ yena yena tu bhāvena yadyad dānaṃ prayacchati |
tat tat tenaiva bhāvena prāpnoti pratipūjitaḥ || 4.234 || Whatever gift one gives with a particular intent, by that same intent is the giver honored and rewarded.

title: Verse 4.235
content:
योऽर्चितं प्रतिगृह्णाति ददात्यर्चितमेव वा ।
तावुभौ गच्छतः स्वर्गं नरकं तु विपर्यये ॥ ४.२३५॥ yo'rcitaṁ pratigṛhṇāti dadātyarcitameva vā | tāvubhau gacchataḥ svargaṁ narakaṁ tu viparyaye || 4.235 || One who accepts worship or gives what has been worshipped shall both attain heaven; in inversion, both descend into hell.

title: Verse 4.236
content:
न विस्मयेत तपसा वदेदिष्ट्वा च नानृतम् ।
नार्तोऽप्यपवदेद्विप्रान्न दत्त्वा परिकीर्तयेत् ॥ ४.२३६॥ दत्वा na vismayeta tapasā vadediṣṭvā ca nānṛtam | nārto'pyapavadet viprān na dattvā parikīrtayet || 4.236 || datvā One must not speak falsely after performing austerity, nor revile the learned even when distressed, nor disclose what has been given in confidence.

title: Verse 4.237
content:
यज्ञोऽनृतेन क्षरति तपः क्षरति विस्मयात् ।
आयुर्विप्रापवादेन दानं च परिकीर्तनात् ॥ ४.२३७॥ yajño'nṛtena kṣarati tapaḥ kṣarati vismayāt |
āyurvipro'pavādena dānaṃ ca parikīrtanāt || 4.237 || Yajna dissolves through untruth; austerity dissolves through wonderment. Life-force depletes by disrespecting the Brahmin; giving declines through public glorification.

title: Verse 4.238
content: धर्मं शनैः सञ्चिनुयाद्वल्मीकमिव पुत्तिकाः । सञ्चिनुयाद् परलोकसहायार्थं सर्वभूतान्यपीडयन् ॥ ४.२३८॥ dharmaṃ śanaiḥ sañcinuyād valmīkam iva puttikāḥ | sañcinuyād paralokasahāyārthaṃ sarvabhūtāny apīḍayan || One must gradually accumulate Dharma, like ants gathering grains, for the sake of aiding one's journey in the afterlife, without causing harm to any being.

title: Verse 4.239
content:
नामुत्र हि सहायार्थं पिता माता च तिष्ठतः ।
न पुत्रदारं न ज्ञातिर्धर्मस्तिष्ठति केवलः ॥ ४.२३९॥ nāmutra hi sahāyārthaṁ pitā mātā ca tiṣṭhataḥ |
na putradāraṁ na jñātir dharmas tiṣṭhati kevalaḥ || 4.239 || Neither father nor mother stands for help in the other world; neither son nor wife, nor kin—only Dharma stands.

title: Verse 4.240
content:
एकः प्रजायते जन्तुरेक एव प्रलीयते ।
एकोऽनुभुङ्क्ते सुकृतमेक एव च दुष्कृतम् ॥ ४.२४०॥ ekaḥ prajāyate jantureka eva pralīyate .
eko'nubhuṅkte sukṛtameka eva ca duṣkṛtam .. 4.240 .. One being is born; one alone dissolves. One alone experiences the fruits of virtue, and one alone bears the consequences of vice.

title: Verse 4.241
content:
मृतं शरीरमुत्सृज्य काष्ठलोष्टसमं क्षितौ ।
विमुखा बान्धवा यान्ति धर्मस्तमनुगच्छति ॥ ४.२४१॥ mṛtaṁ śarīram utsṛjya kāṣṭhaloṣṭasamaṁ kṣitau |
vimukhā bāndhavā yānti dharmas tam anugacchati || 4.241|| Having abandoned the dead body, which is equal to a clod of earth or a piece of wood upon the ground, relatives turn away; yet Dharma follows that soul according to its karmic alignment.

title: Verse 4.242
content:
तस्माद्धर्मं सहायार्थं नित्यं सञ्चिनुयात्शनैः ।
धर्मेण हि सहायेन तमस्तरति दुस्तरम् ॥ ४.२४२॥ tasmād dharmaṁ sahāyārthaṁ nityaṁ sañcinuyāt śanaiḥ |
dharmeṇa hi sahāyena tamas tarati dustaram || 4.242|| Therefore, one must constantly accumulate Dharma as a means of support; with Dharma as aid, one crosses the insurmountable darkness.

title: Verse 4.243
content:
धर्मप्रधानं पुरुषं तपसा हतकिल्बिषम् ।
परलोकं नयत्याशु भास्वन्तं खशरीरिणम् ॥ ४.२४३॥ dharmapradhāṇaṃ puruṣaṃ tapasā hatakilbiṣam |
paralokaṃ nayatyāśu bhāsvantaṃ khaśarīriṇam || 4.243|| The man who is preeminently devoted to Dharma, whose sins are burnt away by the fire of austerity, swiftly ascends to the radiant realm of the luminous bodied ones.

title: Verse 4.244
content: उत्तमैरुत्तमैर्नित्यं सम्बन्धानाचरेत्सह । सम्भन्धान् निनीषुः कुलमुत्कर्षमधमानधमांस्त्यजेत् ॥ ४.२४४॥ uttamairuttamairnityaṃ sambandhānācaret saha | sambandhān ninīṣuḥ kulamutkarṣamadhamaānadhamāṃstyajet || 4.244|| One must always engage in relationships with those who are superior in virtue and wisdom; one desiring to elevate the family lineage must abandon associations that degrade or corrupt.

title: Verse 4.245
content:
उत्तमानुत्तमानेव गच्छन् हीनांस्तु वर्जयन् ।
ब्राह्मणः श्रेष्ठतामेति प्रत्यवायेन शूद्रताम् ॥ ४.२४५॥ uttamānuttamāneva gacchan hīnāṁstu varjayan | brāhmaṇaḥ śreṣṭhatāmeti pratyavāyena śūdratām || 4.245 || One who moves among the highest without rejecting the lowest attains excellence; but the Brahmin, through degradation of conduct, descends into the state of Shudra.

title: Verse 4.246
content:
दृढकारी मृदुर्दान्तः क्रूराचारैरसंवसन् ।
अहिंस्रो दमदानाभ्यां जयेत्स्वर्गं तथाव्रतः ॥ ४.२४६॥ dṛḍhakārī mṛdur dāntaḥ krūrācārairasamvasan .
ahiṃsro damadānābhyāṃ jayetsvargaṃ tathāvrataḥ .. 4.246 .. One who acts with firm resolve, yet remains gentle and self-controlled; who does not associate with cruel conduct; and who is non-violent—through discipline and generosity, such a one conquers heaven and upholds the vow accordingly.

title: Verse 4.247
content:
एधौदकं मूलफलमन्नमभ्युद्यतं च यत् ।
सर्वतः प्रतिगृह्णीयान्मध्वथाभयदक्षिणाम् ॥ ४.२४७॥ edhau dakaṁ mūla-phalam annam abhudyataṁ ca yat |
sarvataḥ pratigṛhṇīyān madhv athābhaya-dakṣiṇām || One must accept gifts of clarified butter, water, root crops, fruits, cooked food, and honey from those who have attained fearlessness through knowledge.

title: Verse 4.248
content: आहृताभ्युद्यतां भिक्षां पुरस्तादप्रचोदिताम् । मेने प्रजापतिर्ग्राह्यामपि दुष्कृतकर्मणः ॥ ४.२४८॥ āhṛtābhyudyatāṃ bhikṣāṃ purastādapracoditām | mane prajāpatirgrāhyāmapi duṣkṛtakarmaṇaḥ || 4.248|| Prajapati deemed acceptable even an alms that was previously rejected, when offered by one whose actions were misaligned with dharma.

title: Verse 4.249
content:
नाश्नन्ति पितरस्तस्य दशवर्षाणि पञ्च च ॥
न च हव्यं वहत्यग्निर्यस्तामभ्यवमन्यते ॥ ४.२४९॥ nāśnanti pitaras tasya daśavarṣāṇi pañca ca ||
na ca havyaṁ vahaty agnir yas tām abhyavamanyate || 4.249 || The ancestors do not accept offerings from one who has disrespected the sacred feminine for ten years or five; nor does the fire carry oblations of such a one.

title: Verse 4.250
content:
शय्यां गृहान् कुशान् गन्धानपः पुष्पं मणीन् दधि ।
धाना मत्स्यान् पयो मांसं शाकं चैव न निर्णुदेत् ॥ ४.२५०॥ śayyāṁ gṛhān kuśān gandhānapaḥ puṣpaṁ maṇīn dadhi |
dhānā matsyān payo māṁsaṁ śākaṁ caiva na nirṇudet || 4.250|| One must not reject bedding, houses, Kush grass, fragrances, water, flowers, gems, curds, grains, fish, milk, meat, and vegetables when these are offered according to Dharma and capacity.

title: Verse 4.251
content:
गुरून् भृत्यांश्चोज्जिहीर्षन्नर्चिष्यन् देवतातिथीन् ।
सर्वतः प्रतिगृह्णीयान्न तु तृप्येत्स्वयं ततः ॥ ४.२५१॥ gurūn bhṛtyāṃś cojjihīrṣann arciṣyan devatātithīn |
sarvataḥ pratigṛhṇīyān na tu tṛpyetsvayaṃ tataḥ || 4.251|| One who seeks to harm teachers, servants, or guests—worshipped divinities and honored visitors—shall accept offerings universally, yet shall not satisfy himself thereby.

title: Verse 4.252
content:
गुरुषु त्वभ्यतीतेषु विना वा तैर्गृहे वसन् ।
आत्मनो वृत्तिमन्विच्छन् गृह्णीयात्साधुतः सदा ॥ ४.२५२॥ guruṣu tv abhyatīteṣu vinā vā tair gṛhe vasan |
ātmano vṛttim anvichchan gṛhṇīyāt sādhutaḥ sadā || 4.252|| When dwelling in the house of the Guru, even without direct instruction or presence, one who seeks to align with their own true conduct shall always uphold the highest virtue.

title: Verse 4.253
content:
आर्धिकः कुलमित्रं च गोपालो दासनापितौ ।
एते शूद्रेषु भोज्यान्ना याश्चात्मानं निवेदयेत् ॥ ४.२५३॥ Ārdhikaḥ kulamitraṃ ca gopālo dāsanāpitau |
Ete śūdreṣu bhojyānnā yāścātmānaṃ nivedayet || 4.253|| The merchant, family friend, cowherd, servant, and barber—these are to be fed among Shudras according to their capacity, and those who offer themselves in service.

title: Verse 4.254
content:
यादृशोऽस्य भवेदात्मा यादृशं च चिकीर्षितम् ।
यथा चौपचरेदेनं तथाऽत्मानं निवेदयेत् ॥ ४.२५४॥ yādṛśo'sya bhavedātmā yādṛśaṃ ca cikīrṣitam |
yathā caupacaredenaṃ tathā'tmānaṃ nivedayet || 4.254|| As is the nature of one's Self, and as is one's intended action, accordingly shall one conduct oneself in alignment with Dharma and declare one's true Being.

title: Verse 4.255
content:
योऽन्यथा सन्तमात्मानमन्यथा सत्सु भाषते ।
स पापकृत्तमो लोके स्तेन आत्मापहारकः ॥ ४.२५५॥ yo'nyathā santam ātmānam anyathā satsu bhāṣate |
sa pāpakṛttamo loke stena ātmāpahārakaḥ || 4.255|| One who misrepresents the Self that is, as something else in the presence of those who know it otherwise, commits the gravest transgression and is a thief of the Self.

title: Verse 4.256
content:
वाच्यर्था नियताः सर्वे वाङ्मूला वाग्विनिःसृताः ।
तांस्तु यः स्तेनयेद्वाचं स सर्वस्तेयकृन्नरः ॥ ४.२५६॥ vācyarthā niyatāḥ sarve vāṅmūlā vāgvinḥsṛtāḥ |
tāṃstu yaḥ stenayedvācaṃ sa sarvasteyakṛnnaraḥ || 4.256|| All meanings rooted in speech and derived from speech are bound by its intent; whoever steals that meaning through distortion or concealment becomes the doer of total theft.

title: Verse 4.257
content:
महर्षिपितृदेवानां गत्वाऽनृण्यं यथाविधि ।
पुत्रे सर्वं समासज्य वसेन् माध्यस्थ्यमाश्रितः ॥ ४.२५७॥ आस्थितः maharṣipitṛdevānāṁ gatvā'nṛṇyaṁ yathāvidhi |
putre sarvaṁ samāsajya vased mādhyasthyam āśritaḥ || 4.257|| āsthitaḥ One who has fulfilled all debts to the great sages, ancestors, and divinities according to prescribed order, having entrusted everything in the son, should dwell in neutrality, established in the Self.

title: Verse 4.258
content: एकाकी चिन्तयेन्नित्यं विविक्ते हितमात्मनः ।  हितमात्मनि एकाकी चिन्तयानो हि परं श्रेयोऽधिगच्छति ॥ ४.२५८॥ ekākī cintayennityaṁ vivikte hitamātmanaḥ | hitamātmani ekākī cintayāno hi paraṁ śreyo'dhigacchati || 4.258 || One must always deliberate in solitude for the welfare of the Self; one who reflects alone upon what benefits the Self attains the Supreme Good.

title: Verse 4.259
content:
एषौदिता गृहस्थस्य वृत्तिर्विप्रस्य शाश्वती ।
स्नातकव्रतकल्पश्च सत्त्ववृद्धिकरः शुभः ॥ ४.२५९॥ eṣauditā gṛhasthasya vṛttirviprasya śāśvatī |
snātakavratkalpaśca sattvavṛddhikaraḥ śubhaḥ || 4.259|| This eternal conduct of the householder is established for the continuous evolution of the knower of Brahman; it aligns with the vow of the graduated scholar and greatly enhances sattva, leading to auspiciousness.

title: Verse 4.260
content:
अनेन विप्रो वृत्तेन वर्तयन् वेदशास्त्रवित् ।
व्यपेतकल्मषो नित्यं ब्रह्मलोके महीयते ॥ ४.२६०॥ anena vipro vṛttena vartayan vedaśāstravit |
vyapetakalmaṣo nityaṃ brahmaloke mahīyate || 4.260 || By conducting himself according to this code of conduct, a Brahmin who is a knower of the Vedas and sciences shall forever remain free from all impurities and be honored in the realm of Brahma.

title: Verse 5.1
content:
अध्याय ५

श्रुत्वैतान् ऋषयो धर्मान् स्नातकस्य यथौदितान् ।
इदमूचुर्महात्मानमनलप्रभवं भृगुम् ॥ ५.१॥ adhyāya 5

śrutvaitān ṛṣayo dharmān snātakasya yathoditān |
idam ūcur mahātmānam analaprabhavaṃ bhṛgum || 5.1|| Having heard these dharmas as declared for the Snataka, the Rishis addressed Bhrgu, the great soul born of Fire.

title: Verse 5.2
content:
एवं यथोक्तं विप्राणां स्वधर्ममनुतिष्ठताम् ।
कथं मृत्युः प्रभवति वेदशास्त्रविदां प्रभो ॥ ५.२॥ evaṁ yathoktaṁ viprāṇāṁ svadharmanutiṣṭhatām | kathaṁ mṛtyuḥ prabhavati vedaśāstravidāṁ prabho || 5.2 || Thus, as declared, let the twice-born abide in their own Dharma; O Lord of the Vedas and Sciences, how does death arise for those who know the scriptures?

title: Verse 5.3
content:
स तानुवाच धर्मात्मा महर्षीन् मानवो भृगुः ।
श्रूयतां येन दोषेण मृत्युर्विप्रान् जिघांसति ॥ ५.३॥ sa tānuvāca dharmātmā maharṣīn mānavo bhṛguḥ |
śrūyatāṁ yena doṣeṇa mṛtyurviprān jighāṁsati || 5.3|| The divine Manu Bhṛgu spoke to the great sages thus: 'Hear by what flaw death seeks to harm the knowers of Brahman.'

title: Verse 5.4
content:
अनभ्यासेन वेदानामाचारस्य च वर्जनात् ।
आलस्यादन्नदोषाच्च मृत्युर्विप्राञ्जिघांसति ॥ ५.४॥ anabhyāsena vedānām ācārasya ca varjanāt |
ālasyād annadoṣācca mṛtyurvaprāñjighāṃsati || 5.4|| Through neglect of Vedic study, abandonment of righteous conduct, laziness, and corruption in food intake, death approaches the Brahmin.

title: Verse 5.5
content:
लशुनं गृञ्जनं चैव पलाण्डुं कवकानि च ।
अभक्ष्याणि द्विजातीनाममेध्यप्रभवानि च ॥ ५.५॥ laśunaṁ gṛñjanaṁ caiva palāṇḍuṁ kavakāni ca |
abhakṣyāṇi dvijātīnāmamedhyaprabhavāni ca || 5.5|| Garlic, asafetida, onion, mushrooms and other substances originating from impure sources are prohibited food for the twice-born.

title: Verse 5.6
content: लोहितान् वृक्षनिर्यासान् वृश्चनप्रभवांस्तथा । व्रश्चनप्रभवांः शेलुं गव्यं च पेयूषं प्रयत्नेन विवर्जयेत् ॥ ५.६॥ lohitān vṛkṣaniryāsān vṛścanaprabhavāṃs tathā | vṛścanaprabhavāḥ śeluṃ gavyaṃ ca peyūṣaṃ prayatnena vivarjayet || 5.6|| One must diligently avoid red tree exudates, substances born of weeds, sheLu, cow urine, and other intoxicants that cloud consciousness and displace dharmic clarity.

title: Verse 5.7
content:
वृथा कृसरसंयावं पायसापूपमेव च ।
अनुपाकृतमांसानि देवान्नानि हवींषि च ॥ ५.७॥ vṛthā kṛsarasamyāvaṁ pāyasāpūpameva ca |
anupākṛtamāṁsāni devānnāni havīṁṣi ca || 5.7|| Offerings of cooked rice, barley, sweet pudding, meat not properly prepared, and other foods designated for the gods and ancestors are to be made with full capacity of intention, preparation, and ritual integrity; when such offerings lack proper execution or consciousness, they fail in their dharmic purpose.

title: Verse 5.8
content:
अनिर्दशाया गोः क्षीरमौष्ट्रमैकशफं तथा ।
आविकं संधिनीक्षीरं विवत्सायाश्च गोः पयः ॥ ५.८॥ anirdaśāyā goḥ kṣīramauṣṭramaikaśafaṃ tathā |
āvikaṃ saṃdhinīkṣīraṃ vivatsāyāśca goḥ payaḥ || 5.8|| The milk of a barren cow, of a she-ass, of a one-hoofed animal, of a sheep, and of a goat, as also the milk of a cow in season—this belongs rightfully to the caretaker.

title: Verse 5.9
content:
आरण्यानां च सर्वेषां मृगाणां माहिषं विना ।
स्त्रीक्षीरं चैव वर्ज्यानि सर्वशुक्तानि चैव हि ॥ ५.९॥ āraṇyānāṁ ca sarveṣāṁ mṛgāṇāṁ māhiṣaṁ vinā |
strīkṣīraṁ caiva varjyāni sarvaśuktāni caiva hi || 5.9|| The milk of all wild animals, except that of buffalo, and the milk of women are to be excluded entirely from consumption or use.

title: Verse 5.10
content:
दधि भक्ष्यं च शुक्तेषु सर्वं च दधिसम्भवम् । दधिसम्भवम्
यानि चैवाभिषूयन्ते पुष्पमूलफलैः शुभैः ॥ ५.१०॥ dadhi bhakṣyaṃ ca śukteṣu sarvaṃ ca dadhisambhavam | dadhisambhavam
yāni caivābhiṣūyante puṣpamūlaphalaiḥ śubhaiḥ || 5.10|| All food items derived from milk, including curd and its products, and all that is prepared using pure flowers, roots, and fruits, are lawful and conducive to purity.

title: Verse 5.11
content: क्रव्यादान् शकुनान् सर्वान्तथा ग्रामनिवासिनः । क्रव्यादः शकुनीन् अनिर्दिष्टांश्चेकशफान् टिट्टिभं च विवर्जयेत् ॥ ५.११॥ kravyādān śakunān sarvān tathā grāmanivāsinaḥ | kravyādaḥ śakunīn anirdiṣṭāṃś cekaśafān ṭiṭṭibhaṃ ca vivarjayet || 5.11 || Those who consume flesh shall exclude all birds and animals residing in villages; specifically, the flesh-eating ones, birds of prey, the unmentioned species, jackals, and the common teal shall not be consumed.

title: Verse 5.12
content:
कलविङ्कं प्लवं हंसं चक्राह्वं ग्रामकुक्कुटम् ।
सारसं रज्जुवालं च दात्यूहं शुकसारिके ॥ ५.१२॥ रज्जुदालं kalaviṅkaṃ plavaṃ haṃsaṃ cakrāhvaṃ grāmakukkuṭam |
sārasaṃ rajjuvālaṃ ca dātyūhaṃ śukasārike || 5.12 || rajjudālaṃ The kalavinka bird, the floating waterfowl, the swan, the chakrāhva, the village cock, the sarasa crane, the rope-tailed dove, the dātyūha, and the parrot and the myna—these beings are designated by their natural capacities and behavioral dharmas.

title: Verse 5.13
content: प्रतुदाञ्जालपादांश्च कोयष्टिनखविष्किरान् । प्रतुदान् निमज्जतश्च मत्स्यादान् सौनं वल्लूरमेव च ॥ ५.१३॥ pratudāñjālapādāṃśca koyaṣṭinakhaviṣkirān | pratudān nimajjataśca matsyādān saunaṃ vallūrameva ca || 5.13|| One who extracts flesh from a fish-net, or removes the feet of a ploughshare, or takes out nails from a carpenter's tool, or retrieves what has sunk in water—such acts are not theft when performed without intent to harm ownership.

title: Verse 5.14
content:
बकं चैव बलाकां च काकोलं खञ्जरीटकम् ।
मत्स्यादान् विड्वराहांश्च मत्स्यानेव च सर्वशः ॥ ५.१४॥ bakaṃ caiva balākaṃ ca kākolaṃ khañjarīṭakam |
matsyādān vidvarāhaṃśca matsyāneva ca sarvaśaḥ || 5.14|| The crane, the curlew, the crow-bird, the heron, those who take fish and swine—these beings are all classified as fish-eaters in their entirety.

title: Verse 5.15
content:
यो यस्य मांसमश्नाति स तन्मांसाद उच्यते ।
मत्स्यादः सर्वमांसादस्तस्मान् मत्स्यान् विवर्जयेत् ॥ ५.१५॥ yo yasya māṁsam aśnāti sa tan-māṁsād ucyate |
matsyādaḥ sarva-māṁsādas tasmān matsyān vivarjayet || 5.15|| One who consumes the flesh of another becomes identified with that flesh; the fish-eater is the consumer of all flesh—therefore, fish must be avoided.

title: Verse 5.16
content:
पाठीनरोहितावाद्यौ नियुक्तौ हव्यकव्ययोः ।
राजीवान् सिंहतुण्डाश्च सशल्काश्चैव सर्वशः ॥ ५.१६॥ pāṭhīnarohitāvādyau niyuktau havyakavyayoḥ |
rājīvān siṃhatuṇḍāśca saśalkāścaiva sarvaśaḥ || 5.16 || Those appointed for the offering of havya and kavya—such as the pāṭhīna, rohitā, and others—are designated by virtue of their alignment with the ritual capacity and consciousness required for such service. The rājīva, siṃhatuṇḍa, and those bearing śalka marks are included comprehensively.

title: Verse 5.17
content:
न भक्षयेदेकचरानज्ञातांश्च मृगद्विजान् ।
भक्ष्येष्वपि समुद्दिष्टान् सर्वान् पञ्चनखांस्तथा ॥ ५.१७॥ na bhakṣayed ekacarān ajñātāṃś ca mṛga-dvijān |
bhakṣyeṣv api samuddiṣṭān sarvān pañcanakhāṃs tathā || One must not consume animals that roam alone or whose origins are unknown, nor those explicitly designated as edible, including all five-nailed creatures.

title: Verse 5.18
content:
श्वाविधं शल्यकं गोधां खड्गकूर्मशशांस्तथा ।
भक्ष्यान् पञ्चनखेष्वाहुरनुष्ट्रांश्चैकतोदतः ॥ ५.१८॥ śvāvidhaṁ śalyakaṁ godhāṁ khaḍgakūrmaśaśāṁs tathā |
bhakṣyān pañcanakheṣv āhur anuṣṭrāṁś caikatodataḥ || 5.18|| Dogs, porcupines, lizards, rhinoceroses, tortoises, rabbits, and similarly animals with five claws or those born from a single hoof are declared fit for consumption under specific dharmic conditions.

title: Verse 5.19
content:
छत्राकं विड्वराहं च लशुनं ग्रामकुक्कुटम् ।
पलाण्डुं गृञ्जनं चैव मत्या जग्ध्वा पतेद्द्विजः ॥ ५.१९॥ chatrākaṃ viḍvarāhaṃ ca laśunaṃ grāmakukkuṭam |
palāṇḍuṃ gṛñjanaṃ caiva matyā jagdhvā pateddvijaḥ || 5.19|| A dvija who consumes, through volition, mushrooms, pork, garlic, village fowl, onions, and leeks shall fall.

title: Verse 5.20
content:
अमत्यैतानि षड्जग्ध्वा कृच्छ्रं सान्तपनं चरेत् ।
यतिचान्द्रायाणं वाऽपि शेषेषूपवसेदहः ॥ ५.२०॥ amatyaitāni ṣaḍjagdhvā kṛcchraṃ sāntapanaṃ caret |
yaticāndrāyaṇaṃ vā'pi śeṣeṣūpavasedahaḥ || 5.20|| One who has consumed the six prohibited substances without intent shall perform the Kṛcchra and Sāntapana fasts; alternatively, in remaining cases, observe Yati or Cāndrāyaṇa fasting protocols.

title: Verse 5.21
content:
संवत्सरस्यैकमपि चरेत्कृच्छ्रं द्विजोत्तमः ।
अज्ञातभुक्तशुद्ध्यर्थं ज्ञातस्य तु विशेषतः ॥ ५.२१॥ saṃvatsarasyaikam api caret kṛcchraṃ dvijottamaḥ |
ajñātabhuktaśuddhyarthaṃ jñātasya tu viśeṣataḥ || 5.21|| A twice-born individual shall perform a Kṛcchra austerity for one full year, specifically for purification when food has been consumed unknowingly; however, if knowingly consumed, the purification must be more rigorous.

title: Verse 5.22
content:
यज्ञार्थं ब्राह्मणैर्वध्याः प्रशस्ता मृगपक्षिणः ।
भृत्यानां चैव वृत्त्यर्थमगस्त्यो ह्याचरत्पुरा ॥ ५.२२॥ yajñārthaṁ brāhmaṇairvadhyāḥ praśastā mṛgapakṣiṇaḥ |
bhṛtyānāṁ caiva vṛttyarthamagastyo hyācaratpura || For the fulfillment of yajña, animals may be lawfully taken by Brahmanas; even Agastya formerly acted thus for the maintenance of his dependents.

title: Verse 5.23
content:
बभूवुर्हि पुरोडाशा भक्ष्याणां मृगपक्षिणाम् ।
पुराणेष्वपि यज्ञेषु ब्रह्मक्षत्रसवेषु च ॥ ५.२३॥ पुराणेष्वृषियज्ञेषु babhūvuḥ hi purōḍāśā bhakṣyāṇāṁ mṛga-pakṣiṇām | purāṇeṣv api yajñeṣu brahma-kṣatra-saveṣu ca || 5.23 || purāṇeṣv ṛṣi-yajñeṣu In ancient times, offerings of flesh from deer and birds were made lawful within Vedic sacrifices performed by sages, Brahmins, and Kshatriyas.

title: Verse 5.24
content:
यत्किं चित्स्नेहसंयुक्तं भक्ष्यं भोज्यमगर्हितम् ।
तत्पर्युषितमप्याद्यं हविःशेषं च यद्भवेत् ॥ ५.२४॥ yatkiṃ citsnehasaṃyuktaṃ bhakṣyaṃ bhojyamagarhitam |
tatparyuṣitamapyādyaṃ haviḥśeṣaṃ ca yadbhavet || 5.24|| Whatever food or drink, though uncondemned and offered with affection, becomes stale or remains after oblation—such remnants are to be accepted first, as they carry the essence of sacrifice and emotional offering.

title: Verse 5.25
content:
चिरस्थितमपि त्वाद्यमस्नेहाक्तं द्विजातिभिः ।
यवगोधूमजं सर्वं पयसश्चैव विक्रिया ॥ ५.२५॥ cirasthitam api tv ādyam asnehāktaṃ dvijātibhiḥ |
yava-godhūma-jaṃ sarvaṃ payasaś caiva vikriyā || Even long-standing arrangements among the twice-born, when devoid of purity-consciousness, must undergo transformation in accordance with the natural evolution of grain and milk products.

title: Verse 5.26
content:
एतदुक्तं द्विजातीनां भक्ष्याभक्ष्यमशेषतः ।
मांसस्यातः प्रवक्ष्यामि विधिं भक्षणवर्जने ॥ ५.२६॥ etad uktaṁ dvijātīnāṁ bhakṣyābhakṣyamaśeṣataḥ |
māṁsasyātaḥ pravakṣyāmi vidhiṁ bhakṣaṇavarjane || 5.26 || The complete classification of what is edible and inedible for the twice-born has been declared; now the injunction regarding the consumption and avoidance of meat shall be expounded.

title: Verse 5.27
content:
प्रोक्षितं भक्षयेन् मांसं ब्राह्मणानां च काम्यया ।
यथाविधि नियुक्तस्तु प्राणानामेव चात्यये ॥ ५.२७॥ prokṣitaṁ bhakṣayen māṁsaṁ brāhmaṇānāṁ ca kāmyayā | yathāvidhi niyuktastu prāṇānāmeva cātyaye || 5.27|| One appointed according to due process shall consume the flesh of the sacrificial animal and the offerings made by Brahmins with desireless intent; in the event of loss of life, it is solely for the sake of sustaining vital functions.

title: Verse 5.28
content:
प्राणस्यान्नमिदं सर्वं प्रजापतिरकल्पयत् ।
स्थावरं जङ्गमं चैव सर्वं प्राणस्य भोजनम् ॥ ५.२८॥ prāṇasyānnamidaṃ sarvaṃ prajāpatirakalpayat |
sthāvaraṃ jaṅgamaṃ caiva sarvaṃ prāṇasya bhojanam || 5.28|| All existence is food for Prana; Prajapati created all—both immovable and movable—as nourishment for the sustaining life-force.

title: Verse 5.29
content:
चराणामन्नमचरा दंष्ट्रिणामप्यदंष्ट्रिणः ।
अहस्ताश्च सहस्तानां शूराणां चैव भीरवः ॥ ५.२९॥ carāṇām annam acarā daṃṣṭriṇām apy adaṃṣṭriṇaḥ |
ahastāś ca sahastānāṃ śūrāṇāṃ caiva bhīravaḥ || Those who move shall be food for those who do not; those with fangs shall consume even those without fangs. The unarmed fall to those armed, and cowards to the brave.

title: Verse 5.30
content:
नात्ता दुष्यत्यदन्नाद्यान् प्राणिनोऽहन्य्ऽहन्यपि ।
धात्रैव सृष्टा ह्याद्याश्च प्राणिनोऽत्तार एव च ॥ ५.३०॥ nāttā duṣyatyadannādyān prāṇino'han'yahanyapi |
dhātraiva sṛṣṭā hyādyāśca prāṇino'ttāra eva ca || 5.30|| Those who do not consume prohibited foods daily, nor cause living beings to be deprived of their food, are themselves sustained by the Nourisher of all creation; thus, they uphold the natural order through non-depletion.

title: Verse 5.31
content:
यज्ञाय जग्धिर्मांसस्येत्येष दैवो विधिः स्मृतः ।
अतोऽन्यथा प्रवृत्तिस्तु राक्षसो विधिरुच्यते ॥ ५.३१॥ yajñāya jagdhir māṁsasyety eṣa daivo vidhiḥ smṛtaḥ |
ato'nyathā pravṛttis tu rākṣaso vidhir ucyate || 5.31|| Consumption of meat is sanctioned solely within the context of yajña, as part of divine ordinance; any consumption outside this framework constitutes a rakshasa mode of operation.

title: Verse 5.32
content:
क्रीत्वा स्वयं वाऽप्युत्पाद्य परोपकृतमेव वा ।
देवान् पितॄंश्चार्चयित्वा खादन् मांसं न दुष्यति ॥ ५.३२॥ krītvā svayaṁ vā'pyutpādya paropakṛtameva vā |
devān pitṝṁścārcayitvā khādan māṁsaṁ na duṣyati || 5.32|| One who has acquired meat through purchase, personal effort, or as a gift from another, after performing worship to the Devas and Pitrs, may consume it without accruing impurity.

title: Verse 5.33
content:
नाद्यादविधिना मांसं विधिज्ञोऽनापदि द्विजः ।
जग्ध्वा ह्यविधिना मांसं प्रेतस्तैरद्यतेऽवशः ॥ ५.३३॥ nādyādavidhinā māṃsaṃ vidhijño'nāpadi dvijaḥ |
jagdhvā hyavidhinā māṃsaṃ pretastairadyate'vaśaḥ || 5.33|| A dvija who knowingly consumes meat without dharmic authorization, when not in a state of emergency, becomes a preta compelled by unconscious forces.

title: Verse 5.34
content:
न तादृशं भवत्येनो मृगहन्तुर्धनार्थिनः ।
यादृशं भवति प्रेत्य वृथामांसानि खादतः ॥ ५.३४॥ na tādṛśaṃ bhavaty eno mṛga-hantur dhanārthinaḥ |
yādṛśaṃ bhavati pretya vṛthāmānsāni khādataḥ || 5.34|| The harm caused by one who kills deer for wealth is not as severe as the harm caused by one who consumes flesh without purpose after death.

title: Verse 5.35
content:
नियुक्तस्तु यथान्यायं यो मांसं नात्ति मानवः ।
स प्रेत्य पशुतां याति सम्भवानेकविंशतिम् ॥ ५.३५॥ niyuktastu yathānyāyaṃ yo māṃsaṃ nātti mānavaḥ |
sa pretya paśutāṃ yāti sambhavānekaviṃśatim || 5.35|| One who, though appointed lawfully, does not consume meat appropriate to his duty, after death enters a state of animal existence for twenty-one births.

title: Verse 5.36
content: असंस्कृतान् पशून् मन्त्रैर्नाद्याद्विप्रः कदा चन । मन्त्रैस्तु संस्कृतानद्यात्शाश्वतं विधिमास्थितः ॥ ५.३६॥ asaṃskṛtān paśūn mantrair nādyād vipraḥ kadā cana | mantraiḥ tu saṃskṛtān adyāt śāśvataṃ vidhim āsthitaḥ || 5.36 || A Vipra shall never invoke sacred mantras upon uninitiated beings; only upon those duly consecrated and established in eternal dharma should such invocation be directed.

title: Verse 5.37
content:
कुर्याद्घृतपशुं सङ्गे कुर्यात्पिष्टपशुं तथा ।
न त्वेव तु वृथा हन्तुं पशुमिच्छेत्कदा चन ॥ ५.३७॥ kuryād ghṛtapashuṃ saṅge kuryāt piṣṭapashuṃ tathā |
na tveva tu vṛthā hantuṃ pashum icchet kadā cana || 5.37|| One should engage in acts that yield beneficial outcomes, such as nurturing a cow for ghee or processing grain for flour; never should one act with intent to cause unnecessary harm or destruction.

title: Verse 5.38
content:
यावन्ति पशुरोमाणि तावत्कृत्वो ह मारणम् ।
वृथापशुघ्नः प्राप्नोति प्रेत्य जन्मनि जन्मनि ॥ ५.३८॥ yāvanti paśuromāṇi tāvatkṛtvo ha māraṇam |
vṛthāpaśughnaḥ prāpnoti pretya janmani janmani || 5.38|| For every hair on the body of a slain animal, the killer assumes a corresponding death in successive births.

title: Verse 5.39
content:
यज्ञार्थं पशवः सृष्टाः स्वयमेव स्वयम्भुवा ।
यज्ञोऽस्य भूत्यै सर्वस्य तस्माद्यज्ञे वधोऽवधः ॥ ५.३९॥ yajñārthaṁ paśavaḥ sṛṣṭāḥ svayameva svayambhuvā |
yajño'sya bhūtyai sarvasya tasmād yajñe vadho'vadhaḥ || 5.39|| Beings are created by the Self-Born One Himself for the sake of Yajña; Yajña is established for the flourishing of all beings—therefore, in Yajña, killing is not killing.

title: Verse 5.40
content:
ओषध्यः पशवो वृक्षास्तिर्यञ्चः पक्षिणस्तथा ।
यज्ञार्थं निधनं प्राप्ताः प्राप्नुवन्त्युत्सृतीः  पुनः ॥ ५.४०॥ oṣadhyaḥ paśavo vṛkṣās tiryañcaḥ pakṣiṇas tathā | yajñārthaṃ nidhanaṃ prāptāḥ prāpnuvanty utsṛtīḥ punaḥ || 5.40|| All herbs, animals, trees, terrestrial beings, and birds that have undergone dissolution for the purpose of sacrifice regain their complete forms and renewed existence.

title: Verse 5.41
content:
मधुपर्के च यज्ञे च पितृदैवतकर्मणि ।
अत्रैव पशवो हिंस्या नान्यत्रैत्यब्रवीन् मनुः ॥ ५.४१॥ madhuparke ca yajñe ca pitṛdaivatakarmaṇi |
atraiva paśavo hiṃsyā nānyatraityabravīn manaḥ || 5.41|| In the context of Madhuparka rituals, Yajnas, and offerings to ancestors and deities, animals may be rightfully taken; beyond these contexts, such action is not sanctioned.

title: Verse 5.42
content:
एष्वर्थेषु पशून् हिंसन् वेदतत्त्वार्थविद्द्विजः ।
आत्मानं च पशुं चैव गमयत्युत्तमं गतिम् ॥ ५.४२॥ eṣvarteṣu paśūn hiṁsan vedatattvārthavid dvijaḥ |
ātmānaṁ ca paśuṁ caiva gamayatyuttamaṁ gatim || 5.42|| When a twice-born, knowing the truth of the Vedas and the purpose of sacrifice, causes injury to animals in rituals, he leads both himself and the animal to the highest goal.

title: Verse 5.43
content:
गृहे गुरावरण्ये वा निवसन्नात्मवान् द्विजः ।
नावेदविहितां हिंसामापद्यपि समाचरेत् ॥ ५.४३॥ gṛhe gurāv araṇye vā nivasann ātmavān dvijaḥ |
naivedavihitāṃ hiṁsām āpady api samācaret || 5.43|| A twice-born individual residing at home or in the presence of the Guru or in the forest shall not commit violence, even when faced with adversity.

title: Verse 5.44
content:
या वेदविहिता हिंसा नियताऽस्मिंश्चराचरे ।
अहिंसामेव तां विद्याद्वेदाद्धर्मो हि निर्बभौ ॥ ५.४४॥ yā vedavihitā hiṃsā niyatā'smiñcarācare |
ahiṃsāmeva tāṃ vidyādvedāddharmo hi nirbabhau || 5.44|| That action which the Vedas ordain as necessary force within the ordered universe—know that to be non-violence itself; from the Vedas, Dharma has indeed emerged.

title: Verse 5.45
content:
योऽहिंसकानि भूतानि हिनस्त्यात्मसुखैच्छया ।
स जीवांश्च मृतश्चैव न क्व चित्सुखमेधते ॥ ५.४५॥ yo 'hiṃsakāni bhūtāni hinasty ātmasukhaicchayā |
sa jīvāṃś ca mṛtaś caiva na kva cit sukham edhate || 5.45 || One who harms harmless beings for the sake of personal pleasure lives neither in joy while alive nor after death.

title: Verse 5.46
content:
यो बन्धनवधक्लेशान् प्राणिनां न चिकीर्षति ।
स सर्वस्य हितप्रेप्सुः सुखमत्यन्तमश्नुते ॥ ५.४६॥ yo bandhanavadhakleśān prāṇināṃ na cikīrṣati |
s sarvasya hitaprepsuḥ sukhamatyantamaśnute || 5.46|| One who does not intend harm, bondage, or suffering upon any living being is the true seeker of universal welfare and thereby attains absolute bliss.

title: Verse 5.47
content: यद्ध्यायति यत्कुरुते रतिं बध्नाति यत्र च । तदवाप्नोत्ययत्नेन यो हिनस्ति न किं चन ॥ ५.४७॥ yad dhyāyati yat kurute ratiṃ badhnāti yatra ca | tad avāpnoty ayatnena yo hinasti na kiṃ cana || 5.47 || That which one meditates upon, that which one performs, that in which one binds affection — that alone one attains effortlessly. One who causes harm attains nothing whatsoever.

title: Verse 5.48
content:
नाकृत्वा प्राणिनां हिंसां मांसमुत्पद्यते क्व चित् ।
न च प्राणिवधः स्वर्ग्यस्तस्मान् मांसं विवर्जयेत् ॥ ५.४८॥ nākṛtvā prāṇināṃ hiṃsāṃ māṃsam utpadyate kva cit |
na ca prāṇivadhaḥ svargyastasmān māṃsaṃ vivarjayet || 5.48|| Without causing harm to living beings, meat does not arise anywhere; nor is killing conducive to heaven—therefore, one must abandon meat.

title: Verse 5.49
content:
समुत्पत्तिं च मांसस्य वधबन्धौ च देहिनाम् ।
प्रसमीक्ष्य निवर्तेत सर्वमांसस्य भक्षणात् ॥ ५.४९॥ samutpattiṃ ca māṃsasya vadhabandhau ca dehinām |
prasamīkṣya nivarteta sarvamāṃsasya bhakṣaṇāt || 5.49|| Upon observing the origin of flesh, along with the killing and binding of embodied beings, one must desist entirely from consuming all meat.

title: Verse 5.50
content:
न भक्षयति यो मांसं विधिं हित्वा पिशाचवत् ।
न लोके प्रियतां याति व्याधिभिश्च न पीड्यते ॥ ५.५०॥ na bhakṣayati yo māṃsaṃ vidhiṃ hitvā piśācavat |
na loke priyatāṃ yāti vyādhibhiśca na pīḍyate || 5.50|| One who consumes meat without adherence to lawful procedure, like a flesh-eating demon, shall neither gain affection among beings nor suffer from diseases.

title: Verse 5.51
content:
अनुमन्ता विशसिता निहन्ता क्रयविक्रयी ।
संस्कर्ता चोपहर्ता च खादकश्चेति घातकाः ॥ ५.५१॥ anumantā viśasitā nihantā kravikrayī |
saṃskartā copahartā ca khādakaś ceti ghātakāḥ || 5.51|| Those who approve, prepare, kill, buy or sell, transform, steal, or consume—these are the agents of destruction.

title: Verse 5.52
content:
स्वमांसं परमांसेन यो वर्धयितुमिच्छति ।
अनभ्यर्च्य पितॄन् देवांस्ततोऽन्यो नास्त्यपुण्यकृत् ॥ ५.५२॥ svamāṃsaṃ paramāṃsena yo vardhayitum icchati |
anabhyarcya pitṝn devāṃs tato'nyaḥ nāsty apuṇyakṛt || 5.52|| One who seeks to nourish his own flesh through another's flesh, without honoring the ancestors and the divinities, is devoid of merit and has no other recourse than to fall into degradation.

title: Verse 5.53
content:
वर्षे वर्षेऽश्वमेधेन यो यजेत शतं समाः ।
मांसानि च न खादेद्यस्तयोः पुण्यफलं समम् ॥ ५.५३॥ varṣe varṣe 'śvamedhena yo yajeta śataṃ samāḥ |
māṃsāni ca na khāded yas tayoḥ puṇyaphalaṃ samam || 5.53|| One who performs the Aśvamedha sacrifice annually for a hundred years, yet abstains from consuming meat, accrues merit equal to that of one who performs the same sacrifice continuously without cessation.

title: Verse 5.54
content:
फलमूलाशनैर्मेध्यैर्मुन्यन्नानां च भोजनैः ।
न तत्फलमवाप्नोति यत्मांसपरिवर्जनात् ॥ ५.५४॥ phalamūlāśanairmedhyairmunyannānāṃ ca bhojanaḥ |
na tatphalamavāpnoti yatmāṃsaparivarjanāt || 5.54|| One who consumes pure fruits, roots, and almsfood offered by sages and renunciants without abstaining from meat does not attain the merit of such consumption.

title: Verse 5.55
content:
मां स भक्षयिताऽमुत्र यस्य मांसमिहाद्म्यहम् ।
एतत्मांसस्य मांसत्वं प्रवदन्ति मनीषिणः ॥ ५.५५॥ māṁ sa bhakṣayitā'mutra yasya māṁsamihādmyaham |
etatmāṁsasya māṁsatvaṁ pravadanti manīṣiṇaḥ || 5.55|| One who consumes My flesh in this life shall himself become food for Me in the next; thus declare the wise those who understand the law of reciprocal embodiment.

title: Verse 5.56
content:
न मांसभक्षणे दोषो न मद्ये न च मैथुने ।
प्रवृत्तिरेषा भूतानां निवृत्तिस्तु महाफला ॥ ५.५६॥ na māṁsa-bhakṣaṇe doṣo na madhye na ca maithune |
avṛttir eṣā bhūtānāṁ nivṛttis tu mahā-phalā || 5.56|| There is no inherent fault in meat consumption, nor in intoxicants, nor in sexual union; these are natural tendencies of beings, but renunciation yields great fruit.

title: Verse 5.57
content:
प्रेतशुद्धिं प्रवक्ष्यामि द्रव्यशुद्धिं तथैव च ।
चतुर्णामपि वर्णानां यथावदनुपूर्वशः ॥ ५.५७॥ pretashuddhiṃ pravakṣyāmi dravyashuddhiṃ tathaiva ca |
caturṇāmapi varṇānāṃ yathāvadanupūrvaśaḥ || 5.57|| I shall now declare the purification of the deceased and the purification of property, in proper sequence for all four varnas.

title: Verse 5.58
content:
दन्तजातेऽनुजाते च कृतचूडे च संस्थिते ।
अशुद्धा बान्धवाः सर्वे सूतके च तथौच्यते ॥ ५.५८॥ dantajāte 'nujāte ca kṛtacūḍe ca saṃsthite |
aśuddhā bāndhavāḥ sarve sūtake ca tathauca yate || 5.58|| When a child's teeth have emerged, when younger siblings are born, and when the head hair has grown and stabilized — at this stage, all close relatives become ritually impure, and this condition is termed as sūtaka.

title: Verse 5.59
content:
दशाहं शावमाशौचं सपिण्डेषु विधीयते ।
अर्वाक्सञ्चयनादस्थ्नां त्र्यहमेकाहमेव वा ॥ ५.५९॥ daśāhaṁ śāvam āśaucaṁ sapindeṣu vidhīyate |
arvāk sañcayanād asthnāṁ tryaham ekāham eva vā || 5.59|| Ten days of ritual impurity (Āśauca) are ordained upon the death of a Sapinda relative; however, when bones have been collected through secondary cremation, three days or even one day shall suffice.

title: Verse 5.60
content:
सपिण्डता तु पुरुषे सप्तमे विनिवर्तते ।
समानोदकभावस्तु जन्मनाम्नोरवेदने ॥ ५.६०॥ sapin.daa tu puru.se sapta.me vinivartate .
samaanodakabhaavastu janmanaamnoravedane ..5.60.. The condition of sapiṇḍa relationship in a man ceases at the seventh generation; the state of common water-sharing (samānodaka) ends upon loss of awareness of birth-name.

title: Verse 5.61
content: यथैदं शावमाशौचं सपिण्डेषु विधीयते । जननेऽप्येवमेव स्यात्निपुणं शुद्धिमिच्छताम् ॥ ५.६१॥ yathedaṃ śāvamāśaucaṃ sapiṇḍeṣu vidhīyate | janane'pyevameva syātnipuṇaṃ śuddhimicchatām || 5.61|| As impurity is ordained for sapiṇḍas upon the birth of a child, so too must those desiring purification act with precision in all acts of creation.

title: Verse 5.62
content:
सर्वेषां शावमाशौचं मातापित्रोस्तु सूतकम् ।
(जननेऽप्येवमेव स्यान् मातापित्रोस्तु सूतकम् ।)
सूतकं मातुरेव स्यादुपस्पृश्य पिता शुचिः ॥ ५.६२॥ sarveṣāṁ śavam āśaucaṁ mātāpitrostu sūtakam | (janane'pyevameva syān mātāpitrostu sūtakam |) sūtakaṁ mātureva syādupaspṛśya pitā śuciḥ || 5.62|| All beings undergo impurity upon death; however, for parents, it is specifically the birth-event that constitutes the ritual impurity. Upon touching the newborn, the mother alone bears the period of ritual impurity while the father becomes pure through contact.

title: Verse 5.63
content:
निरस्य तु पुमांशुक्रमुपस्पृस्यैव शुध्यति ।
बैजिकादभिसम्बन्धादनुरुन्ध्यादघं त्र्यहम् ॥ ५.६३॥ nirasya tu pumāṁśukram upaspṛśyaiva śudhyati |
baijikād abhisambandhād anurundhyād aghaṁ tryaham || 5.63|| When semen is discharged without union with the female organ, purification occurs merely by touching water. However, when there is contact through sexual intercourse, the impurity lasts for three days.

title: Verse 5.64
content:
अह्ना चैकेन रात्र्या च त्रिरात्रैरेव च त्रिभिः ।
शवस्पृशो विशुध्यन्ति त्र्यहादुदकदायिनः ॥ ५.६४॥ ahnā caikena rātryā ca trirātrair eva ca tribhiḥ |
śavaspṛśo viśudhyanti tryahād udakadāyinaḥ || 5.64 || Those who have touched a corpse become pure through giving water within three days—specifically by one day and one night, or by three nights, or by three full days.

title: Verse 5.65
content:
गुरोः प्रेतस्य शिष्यस्तु पितृमेधं समाचरन् ।
प्रेतहारैः समं तत्र दशरात्रेण शुध्यति ॥ ५.६५॥ guroḥ pretasya śiṣyastu pitṛmedhaṃ samācaran |
pretahāraiḥ samaṃ tatra daśarātreṇa śudhyati || 5.65|| When a disciple performs the ritual of Pitri-Medha for the deceased Guru, along with those who carry the corpse, that disciple becomes ritually pure after ten nights.

title: Verse 5.66
content:
रात्रिभिर्मासतुल्याभिर्गर्भस्रावे विशुध्यति ।
रजस्युपरते साध्वी स्नानेन स्त्री रजस्वला ॥ ५.६६॥ rātribhir māsa-tulyābhir garbha-srāve viśudhyati |
rajasy uparate sādhvī snānena strī rajasvalā || 5.66|| A woman becomes pure after the flow of menstrual blood equivalent in duration to a month; when her menses cease, she attains purity through bathing.

title: Verse 5.67
content:
नृणामकृतचूडानां विशुद्धिर्नैशिकी स्मृता ।
निर्वृत्तचूडकानां तु त्रिरात्रात्शुद्धिरिष्यते ॥ ५.६७॥ निर्वृत्तमुण्डकानां nṛṇāmakṛtacūḍānāṁ viśuddhirnaiśikī smṛtā |
nirvṛttacūḍakānāṁ tu trirātrātśuddhiriṣyate || 5.67 || nirvṛttamuṇḍakānāṁ For those who have not undergone the sacred tonsure, purification occurs through nightly observance. For those who have completed the tonsure ritual, purification is accomplished within three nights.

title: Verse 5.68
content:
ऊनद्विवार्षिकं प्रेतं निदध्युर्बान्धवा बहिः ।
अलङ्कृत्य शुचौ भूमावस्थिसञ्चयनादृते ॥ ५.६८॥ ūnadvi-vārṣikaṃ pretaṃ nidadh-yur-bāndhavā bahiḥ |
alankṛtya śucau bhūmāv asthi-sañcayanād ṛte || 5.68|| Relatives shall place the body of one who died before the completion of two years outside, adorned and purified, without collecting the bones.

title: Verse 5.69
content:
नास्य कार्योऽग्निसंस्कारो न च कार्यौदकक्रिया ।
अरण्ये काष्ठवत्त्यक्त्वा क्षपेयुस्त्र्यहमेव तु ॥ ५.६९॥ nāsya kāryo'gnisaṃskāro na ca kāryaudakakriyā |
aranye kāṣṭhavattyaktvā kṣapeyustryahameva tu || 5.69|| No fire ritual shall be performed for him, nor any water rite; having abandoned his body like wood in the forest, he shall vanish in three days.

title: Verse 5.70
content:
नात्रिवर्षस्य कर्तव्या बान्धवैरुदकक्रिया ।
जातदन्तस्य वा कुर्युर्नाम्नि वाऽपि कृते सति ॥ ५.७०॥ nātrivarsasya kartavyā bāndhavair udakakriyā |
jātadantasya vā kuryur nāmni vā'pi kṛte sati || 5.70|| No water rites or familial obligations are binding upon a child who has not completed three years of life; nor shall any naming or ceremonial act be performed for one whose teeth have not yet appeared, even if named.

title: Verse 5.71
content:
सब्रह्मचारिण्येकाहमतीते क्षपणं स्मृतम् ।
जन्मन्येकौदकानां तु त्रिरात्रात्शुद्धिरिष्यते ॥ ५.७१॥ sabrahmacāriṇyekāhamatīte kṣapaṇaṃ smṛtam | janmanyekaudakānāṃ tu trirātrātśuddhiriṣyate || 5.71|| For those who have lived in celibacy under the same spiritual preceptor, purification is accomplished in one day and night after the transgression has passed. For those born of the same water (i.e., siblings or those closely related by birth), purification arises after three nights.

title: Verse 5.72
content:
स्त्रीणामसंस्कृतानां तु त्र्यहात्शुध्यन्ति बान्धवाः ।
यथौक्तेनैव कल्पेन शुध्यन्ति तु सनाभयः ॥ ५.७२॥ strīṇāmasaṃskṛtānāṃ tu tryahāt śudhyanti bāndhavāḥ |
yathoktenaiva kalpena śudhyanti tu sanābhayaḥ || 5.72|| For women who are uninitiated into sacred rites, their kinsmen become pure after three days; those initiated through proper sacraments attain purity instantly by the same method.

title: Verse 5.73
content:
अक्षारलवणान्नाः स्युर्निमज्जेयुश्च ते त्र्यहम् ।
मांसाशनं च नाश्नीयुः शयीरंश्च पृथक्क्षितौ ॥ ५.७३॥ akṣāralavaṇānnāḥ syurnimajjeyuśca te tryaham | māṃsāśanaṃ ca nāśnīyuḥ śayīraṃśca pṛthakkṣitau || 5.73|| Those who consume alcohol, salt, meat, or engage in sexual union must undergo a three-day purification protocol involving complete separation from society and sensory restraint.

title: Verse 5.74
content:
संनिधावेष वै कल्पः शावाशौचस्य कीर्तितः ।
असंनिधावयं ज्ञेयो विधिः सम्बन्धिबान्धवैः ॥ ५.७४॥ saṃnidhāveṣa vai kalpaḥ śāvāśaucasya kīrtitaḥ |
asaṃnidhāvayaṃ jñeyo vidhiḥ saṃbandhibāndhavaiḥ || 5.74|| In the presence of the deceased, specific ceremonial observances are enjoined; in their absence, the procedural guidelines apply through relational and familial connection.

title: Verse 5.75
content:
विगतं तु विदेशस्थं शृणुयाद्यो ह्यनिर्दशम् ।
यत्शेषं दशरात्रस्य तावदेवाशुचिर्भवेत् ॥ ५.७५॥ vigataṁ tu videśasthaṁ śṛṇuyād yo hyanirdaśam | yat śeṣaṁ daśarātrasya tāvad evāśucir bhavet || 5.75 || One who has completed ten days outside the land and returns without declaration shall remain in a state of impurity for the remainder of that period.

title: Verse 5.76
content:
अतिक्रान्ते दशाहे च त्रिरात्रमशुचिर्भवेत् ।
संवत्सरे व्यतीते तु स्पृष्ट्वैवापो विशुध्यति ॥ ५.७६॥ atikrānte daśāhe ca trirātram aśucir bhavet |
saṃvat sare vyatīte tu spṛṣṭvā vāpo viśudhyati || 5.76|| When ten days have passed, one becomes impure for three nights; but when a full year has elapsed, water alone purifies upon contact.

title: Verse 5.77
content:
निर्दशं ज्ञातिमरणं  श्रुत्वा पुत्रस्य जन्म च ।
सवासा जलमाप्लुत्य शुद्धो भवति मानवः ॥ ५.७७॥ nirdaśaṃ jñātimaraṇaṃ śrutvā putrasya janma ca |
