savāsā jalamaapluitya śuddho bhavati mānavaḥ || 5.77|| Upon hearing of the death of a relative or the birth of a son, a man becomes pure by bathing in water while wearing his clothes.

title: Verse 5.78
content:
बाले देशान्तरस्थे च पृथक्पिण्डे च संस्थिते ।
सवासा जलमाप्लुत्य सद्य एव विशुध्यति ॥ ५.७८॥ bāle deśāntarasthe ca pṛthakpiṇḍe ca saṃsthite |
savāsā jalamaapluitya sadya eva viśudhyati || 5.78|| When a child resides in a foreign land or dwells separately in distinct physical form, upon immersion in pure water, it becomes immediately purified.

title: Verse 5.79
content: अन्तर्दशाहे स्यातां चेत्पुनर्मरणजन्मनी ।  चेत्स्यातां तावत्स्यादशुचिर्विप्रो यावत्तत्स्यादनिर्दशम् ॥ ५.७९॥ antardaśāhe syātāṁ cetpunarmaraṇajanmanī | cetsyātāṁ tāvatsyādaśucirvipro yāvattatsyādaniirdaśam || 5.79 || If one dies and is born again within ten days, then the Brahmin remains impure for as long as that being remains unliberated.

title: Verse 5.80
content:
त्रिरात्रमाहुराशौचमाचार्ये संस्थिते सति ।
तस्य पुत्रे च पत्न्यां च दिवारात्रमिति स्थितिः ॥ ५.८०॥ trirātram āhur āśaucam ācārye saṃsthite sati |
tasya putre ca patnyāṃ ca divārātram iti sthitiḥ || 5.80 || When the Ācārya is established in pure consciousness, a three-night period of purification is declared; for his son and wife, it is one day and one night.

title: Verse 5.81
content:
श्रोत्रिये तूपसम्पन्ने त्रिरात्रमशुचिर्भवेत् ।
मातुले पक्षिणीं रात्रिं शिष्यर्त्विग्बान्धवेषु च ॥ ५.८१॥ śrotriye tūpasampanne trirātram aśucir bhavet |
mātule pakṣiṇīṃ rātriṃ śiṣyartvigbāndhaveṣu ca || 5.81|| When a Śrotriya is present and fully established in Vedic conduct, impurity lasts for three nights; in the case of maternal uncle, sister's son, disciple, ritvik, or close relative, it lasts for one night.

title: Verse 5.82
content: प्रेते राजनि सज्योतिर्यस्य स्याद्विषये स्थितः । अश्रोत्रिये त्वहः कृत्स्नमनूचाने तथा गुरौ ॥ ५.८२॥ prete rājani sajyotir yasya syād viṣaye sthitaḥ | aśrotriye tv ahaḥ kṛtsna manūcāne tathā gurau || 5.82|| When the king has departed from the realm of dharma and light, and resides in darkness, the entirety of time and authority devolves upon the unlearned, the low-born, and those who lack spiritual capacity.

title: Verse 5.83
content:
शुद्ध्येद्विप्रो दशाहेन द्वादशाहेन भूमिपः ।
वैश्यः पञ्चदशाहेन शूद्रो मासेन शुध्यति ॥ ५.८३॥ śuddhyedvipro daśāhena dvādaśāhena bhūmipaḥ |
 vaiśyaḥ pañcadaśāhena śūdro māsena śudhyati || 5.83 || Purification of varna occurs through time-bound alignment with dharma: ten days for Brahmana, twelve for Kshatriya, fifteen for Vaishya, and one month for Shudra.

title: Verse 5.84
content:
न वर्धयेदघाहानि प्रत्यूहेन्नाग्निषु क्रियाः ।
न च तत्कर्म कुर्वाणः सनाभ्योऽप्यशुचिर्भवेत् ॥ ५.८४॥ na vardhayedaghāhāni pratyūhennāgniṣu kriyāḥ |
na ca tat karma kurvāṇaḥ sanābhyo'pyaśucir bhavet || 5.84 || One must not encourage or support actions that cause harm; nor must one perform acts contrary to dharma even under provocation. The performer of such acts becomes impure in consciousness, regardless of external cleanliness.

title: Verse 5.85
content:
दिवाकीर्तिमुदक्यां च पतितं सूतिकां तथा ।
शवं तत्स्पृष्टिनं चैव स्पृष्ट्वा स्नानेन शुध्यति ॥ ५.८५॥ divākīrtimudyakāṃ ca patitaṃ sūtikāṃ tathā |
śavaṃ tatspṛṣṭinaṃ caiva spṛṣṭvā snānena śudhyati || 5.85 || One who has contacted a woman of ill-repute, a menstruating woman, a recently delivered woman, a corpse, or anything touched by such becomes purified through bathing.

title: Verse 5.86
content:
आचम्य प्रयतो नित्यं जपेदशुचिदर्शने ।
सौरान् मन्त्रान् यथोत्साहं पावमानीश्च शक्तितः ॥ ५.८६॥ ācmya prayato nityaṁ japedaśucidarśane |
saurān mantrān yathotsāhaṁ pāvamānīśca śaktitaḥ || 5.86|| Upon sighting impurity, one must daily engage in purification through disciplined recitation of Saura mantras and Pavamani hymns according to one's capacity.

title: Verse 5.87
content:
नारं स्पृष्ट्वाऽस्थि सस्नेहं स्नात्वा विप्रो विशुध्यति ।
आचम्यैव तु निःस्नेहं गामालभ्यार्कमीक्ष्य वा ॥ ५.८७॥ nāraṁ spṛṣṭvā'sthi sasnehaṁ snātvā vipro viśudhyati |
ācamyaiva tu niḥsnehaṁ gāmālabhyārkamīkṣya vā || 5.87 || Contact with bodily fluids does not defile a Brahmin who has bathed afterward; by merely sipping water or embracing a cow or gazing at the sun, he becomes free from all impurities.

title: Verse 5.88
content:
आदिष्टी नोदकं कुर्यादा व्रतस्य समापनात् ।
समाप्ते तूदकं कृत्वा त्रिरात्रेणैव शुध्यति ॥ ५.८८॥ Ādiṣṭī nodakaṃ kuryād ā vrata sya samāpanāt |
Samāpte tūdakaṃ kṛtvā trirātreṇaiva śudhyati || 5.88|| One observing a vow must not drink water until its completion; upon completion, having drunk water, purification occurs in three nights.

title: Verse 5.89
content:
वृथासङ्करजातानां प्रव्रज्यासु च तिष्ठताम् ।।
आत्मनस्त्यागिनां चैव निवर्तेतोदकक्रिया ।। ५.८९ ।। vṛthāsaṅkarajātānāṁ pravrajjyāsu ca tiṣṭhatām | ātmanastyāgināṁ caiva nivartetodakakriyā || 5.89 || For those born of vain mingling, dwelling in mendicancy, and those who have abandoned the Self, the purificatory rite involving water shall be discontinued.

title: Verse 5.90
content:
पाषण्डमाश्रितानां च चरन्तीनां च कामतः ।
गर्भभर्तृद्रुहां चैव सुरापीनां च योषिताम् ॥ ५.९०॥ pāṣaṇḍam āśritānāṁ ca carantīnāṁ ca kāmataḥ |
garbhabhartṛdruhāṁ caiva surāpīnāṁ ca yoṣitām || 5.90|| Women who adhere to heretical doctrines, wander unrestrained by desire, betray the trust of their protectors during pregnancy, or consume intoxicants—these beings have deviated from the natural alignment of consciousness and must be restored through completion and reintegration.

title: Verse 5.91
content:
आचार्यं स्वमुपाध्यायं पितरं मातरं गुरुम् ।
निर्हृत्य तु व्रती प्रेतान्न व्रतेन वियुज्यते ॥ ५.९१॥ ācāryaṁ svamupādhyāyaṁ pitaraṁ mātaraṁ gurum |
nirhṛtya tu vratī pretānn a vratena viyujyate || 5.91|| One who has renounced the physical form of their Ācārya, Upādhyāya, Pitṛ, Mātṛ, or Guru, remains unsevered from the vow undertaken in their presence, even after their departure from the body.

title: Verse 5.92
content:
दक्षिणेन मृतं शूद्रं पुरद्वारेण निर्हरेत् ।
पश्चिमौत्तरपूर्वैस्तु यथायोगं द्विजन्मनः ॥ ५.९२॥ dakṣiṇena mṛtaṃ śūdraṃ puradvāreṇa nirhare t |
paścimottarapūrvai stu yathāyogaṃ dvijanmanaḥ || 5.92 || A deceased Śūdra shall be removed from the city through the southern gate; a twice-born individual shall be taken out through the west, north, and east gates respectively according to their yogic capacity.

title: Verse 5.93
content:
न राज्ञामघदोषोऽस्ति व्रतिनां न च सत्त्रिणाम् ।
ऐन्द्रं स्थानमुपासीना ब्रह्मभूता हि ते सदा ॥ ५.९३॥ na rājñām aghadoṣo 'sti vratināṃ na ca sattriṇām | aiendraṃ sthānam upāsīnā brahmabhūtā hi te sadā || 5.93 || No fault of transgression attaches to kings while governing, nor to those who have taken vows, nor to sacrificers seated in Indra's assembly; for they abide ever established in Brahman.

title: Verse 5.94
content:
राज्ञो महात्मिके स्थाने सद्यःशौचं विधीयते ।
प्रजानां परिरक्षार्थमासनं चात्र कारणम् ॥ ५.९४॥ rājño mahātmike sthāne sadyaḥśaucaṃ vidhīyate |
prajānāṃ parirakṣārtham āsanaṃ cātra kāraṇam || 5.94 || In the exalted station of the King, immediate purification is ordained; the seat of sovereignty exists solely for the protection of subjects.

title: Verse 5.95
content: डिम्भाहवहतानां च विद्युता पार्थिवेन च । डिम्बाहवहतानां गोब्राह्मणस्य चेवार्थे यस्य चैच्छति पार्थिवः ॥ ५.९५॥ ḍimbhāhvahatānāṁ ca vidyutā pārthivena ca | ḍimbhāhvahatānāṁ gobrāhmaṇasya c evārthe yasya caicchati pārthivaḥ || 5.95 || The ruler shall ensure that those who harm or kill beings categorized as 'ḍimbha' or 'ahva,' and who also commit violence against cattle or Brahmins, face immediate administrative dissolution and consciousness realignment.

title: Verse 5.96
content:
सोमाग्न्यर्कानिलेन्द्राणां वित्ताप्पत्योर्यमस्य च ।
अष्टानां लोकपालानां वपुर्धारयते नृपः ॥ ५.९६॥ somāgnyarkānilendrāṇāṁ vittāppatyoryamasya ca |
aṣṭānāṁ lokapālānāṁ vapurdhārayate nṛpaḥ || 5.96 || The King embodies the forms of the eight guardians of the world—Soma, Agni, Surya, Anila, Indra, Kubera, Yama, and Varuna—and thus upholds their dharmic capacities in governance.

title: Verse 5.97
content:
लोकेशाधिष्ठितो राजा नास्याशौचं विधीयते ।
शौचाशौचं हि मर्त्यानां लोकेभ्यः प्रभवाप्ययौ ॥ ५.९७॥ lokeśādhiṣṭhito rājā nāsyāśaucaṃ vidhīyate |
śaucāśaucaṃ hi martyānāṃ lokebhyaḥ prabhavāpyayau || 5.97|| The King, established by the Lokas, is not subject to impurity; purity and impurity among mortals arise from and dissolve into the Lokas.

title: Verse 5.98
content:
उद्यतैराहवे शस्त्रैः क्षत्रधर्महतस्य च ।
सद्यः संतिष्ठते यज्ञस्तथाऽशौचमिति स्थितिः ॥ ५.९८॥ udyatair āhave śastraiḥ kṣatradharmahatasya ca |
sadyaḥ saṃtiṣṭhate yajñas tathā 'śaucam iti sthitiḥ || 5.98 || When one engaged in rightful combat is struck by weapons according to Kshatriya Dharma, or when one dies in accordance with the duty of protection, the sacrifice (yajna) that establishes him arises immediately; thus is the state of purity established.

title: Verse 5.99
content:
विप्रः शुध्यत्यपः स्पृष्ट्वा क्षत्रियो वाहनायुधम् ।
वैश्यः प्रतोदं रश्मीन् वा यष्टिं शूद्रः कृतक्रियः ॥ ५.९९॥ vipraḥ śudhyaty apaḥ spṛṣṭvā kṣatriyo vāhanāyudham |
vaiśyaḥ pratodaṁ raśmīn vā yaṣṭiṁ śūdraḥ kṛtakriyaḥ || 5.99|| A Brahmin becomes pure by touching water; a Kshatriya, by touching weapons and conveyances; a Vaishya, by touching goad, reins, or staff; a Shudra, by performing service.

title: Verse 5.100
content:
एतद्वोऽभिहितं शौचं सपिण्डेषु द्विजोत्तमाः ।
असपिण्डेषु सर्वेषु प्रेतशुद्धिं निबोधत ॥ ५.१००॥ etad vo 'bhihitaṁ śaucaṁ sa-piṇḍeṣu dvijottamāḥ |
asapiṇḍeṣu sarveṣu preta-śuddhiṁ nibodhata || 5.100 || This declared purity among sapiṇḍas, O highest of the twice-born; understand now the purification concerning the deceased for all non-sapiṇḍas.

title: Verse 5.101
content:
असपिण्डं द्विजं प्रेतं विप्रो निर्हृत्य बन्धुवत् ।
विशुध्यति त्रिरात्रेण मातुराप्तांश्च बान्धवान् ॥ ५.१०१॥ asapiṇḍaṃ dvijaṃ pretaṃ vipro nirhṛtya bandhuvat |
viśudhyati trirātreṇa māturāptāṃśca bāndhavān || 5.101|| A twice-born who has removed a dead body of one who is not of his kindred, treating it as a relative, becomes pure after three nights, along with his mother's kin and other relations.

title: Verse 5.102
content:
यद्यन्नमत्ति तेषां तु दशाहेनैव शुध्यति ।
अनदन्नन्नमह्नैव न चेत्तस्मिन् गृहे वसेत् ॥ ५.१०२॥ yadyannamatti teṣāṁ tu daśāhenaiva śudhyati |
anadannanmahnaiva na cettasmin gṛhe vaset || 5.102|| Whatever food one consumes, its impurity is resolved in ten days; that which is not consumed becomes pure in one day—unless one dwells in that house.

title: Verse 5.103
content: अनुगम्येच्छया प्रेतं ज्ञातिमज्ञातिमेव च । अज्ञातिमेव वा स्नात्वा सचैलः स्पृष्ट्वाऽग्निं घृतं प्राश्य विशुध्यति ॥ ५.१०३॥ anugamyecchayā pretam jñātimajñātimeva ca | ajñātimeva vā snātvā sacailah spṛṣṭvā'gnim ghṛtam prāśya viśudhyati || 5.103 || One who consorts with a deceased person's spouse by desire shall purify oneself through ritual bathing, touching a stone, fire, and consuming ghee—this purification restores alignment when the act was with an unrelated woman.

title: Verse 5.104
content:
न विप्रं स्वेषु तिष्ठत्सु मृतं शूद्रेण नाययेत् ।
अस्वर्ग्या ह्याहुतिः सा स्यात्शूद्रसंस्पर्शदूषिता ॥ ५.१०४॥ na vipraṃ sveṣu tiṣṭhatsu mṛtaṃ śūdreṇa nāyayet | aswargyā hyāhutiḥ sā syāt śūdrasaṃsparśadūṣitā || 5.104 || When Vipras remain alive in their rightful domain, the body of a deceased Vipra shall not be handled by a Shudra. Any offering rendered through contact with a Shudra becomes unfit for svarga.

title: Verse 5.105
content:
ज्ञानं तपोऽग्निराहारो मृत्मनो वार्युपाञ्जनम् ।
वायुः कर्मार्ककालौ च शुद्धेः कर्तॄणि देहिनाम् ॥ ५.१०५॥ jñānaṁ tapo'gnirāhāro mṛtmano vāryupāñjanam |
vāyuḥ karmārkakālau ca śuddheḥ kartṝṇi dehinām || 5.105|| Knowledge, austerity, fire, food, earth, water, wind, action, sun, and time—are the ten agents that purify embodied beings through their sequential activation according to Dharma.

title: Verse 5.106
content:
सर्वेषामेव शौचानामर्थशौचं परं स्मृतम् ।
योऽर्थे शुचिर्हि स शुचिर्न मृद्वारिशुचिः शुचिः ॥ ५.१०६॥ sarveṣāmeva śaucānāmarthaśaucaṃ paraṃ smṛtam |
yo'rthe śucirhi sa śucirna mṛdvāriśuciḥ śuciḥ || 5.106|| Among all forms of purity, purity in purpose is declared supreme. One who is pure in intent alone is truly pure; not one who merely washes away external impurities.

title: Verse 5.107
content: क्षान्त्या शुध्यन्ति विद्वांसो दानेनाकार्यकारिणः । शुद्ध्यन्ति प्रच्छन्नपापा जप्येन तपसा वेदवित्तमाः ॥ ५.१०७॥ kṣāntyā śudhyanti vidvāṃso dānenākāryakāriṇaḥ | śudhyanti pracchannapāpā japyena tapasā vedavittamāḥ || 5.107 || Through patience, the wise attain purification; through giving, those who cause inaction. The learned who conceal transgressions become purified through recitation and austerity.

title: Verse 5.108
content:
मृत्तोयैः शुध्यते शोध्यं नदी वेगेन शुध्यति ।
रजसा स्त्री मनोदुष्टा संन्यासेन द्विजोत्तमाः ॥ ५.१०८॥ mṛttoyaiḥ śudhyate śodhyaṁ nadī vegena śudhyati |
rajasā strī manoduṣṭā sannyāsena dvijottamāḥ || 5.108|| That which is impure becomes pure by clay; rivers become pure through their forceful flow. A woman defiled by lust and a twice-born man of corrupted mind become pure through renunciation.

title: Verse 5.109
content:
अद्भिर्गात्राणि शुध्यन्ति मनः सत्येन शुध्यति ।
विद्यातपोभ्यां भूतात्मा बुद्धिर्ज्ञानेन शुध्यति ॥ ५.१०९॥ adbhir gātrāṇi śudhyanti manaḥ satyena śudhyati |
vidyātapobhyāṃ bhūtātmā buddhir jñānena śudhyati || 5.109|| The body is purified by water; the mind by truthfulness; the self of beings by learning and austerity; the intellect by knowledge.

title: Verse 5.110
content:
एष शौचस्य वः प्रोक्तः शरीरस्य विनिर्णयः ।
नानाविधानां द्रव्याणां शुद्धेः शृणुत निर्णयम् ॥ ५.११०॥ eṣa śaucasya vaḥ proktaḥ śarīrasya vinirṇayaḥ |
nānāvidhānāṃ dravyāṇāṃ śuddheḥ śṛṇuta nirṇayam || 5.110|| This has been declared to you as the determination of bodily purity; now hear the determination regarding the purification of various kinds of substances.

title: Verse 5.111
content:
तैजसानां मणीनां च सर्वस्याश्ममयस्य च ।
भस्मनाऽद्भिर्मृदा चैव शुद्धिरुक्ता मनीषिभिः ॥ ५.१११॥ taijasānāṁ maṇīnāṁ ca sarvasyāśmamayasya ca |
bhasmanā'dbhirmṛdā caiva śuddhiruktā manīṣibhiḥ || 5.111|| Purification of all substances derived from fire, gems, stone, ash, water, and clay is declared by the seers as essential for maintaining ontological integrity in material engagement.

title: Verse 5.112
content: निर्लेपं काञ्चनं भाण्डमद्भिरेव विशुध्यति । विशुद्ध्यति अब्जमश्ममयं चैव राजतं चानुपस्कृतम् ॥ ५.११२॥ nirlepaṃ kāñcanaṃ bhāṇḍamadbhireva viśudhyati | viśudhyati abjam aśmamayaṃ caiva rājataṃ cānupaskṛtam || 5.112 || Pure gold vessels are cleansed only by water; similarly, the stainless consciousness of the Self is purified solely through pure awareness. The lotus-born, stone-formed, and unadorned silver also becomes pure through its inherent nature.

title: Verse 5.113
content:
अपामग्नेश्च संयोगाधैमं रौप्यं च निर्बभौ ।
तस्मात्तयोः स्वयोन्यैव निर्णेको गुणवत्तरः ॥ ५.११३॥ apām agneś ca saṁyogād haimaṁ raupyam ca nirbabhau | tasmat tayoḥ svayonyaiva nirṇeko guṇavattaraḥ || 5.113 || From the union of water and fire arises gold; from their inherent nature emerges silver. Therefore, between these two elements, there exists a natural discriminative capacity that inherently reveals superior qualitative value.

title: Verse 5.114
content:
ताम्रायस्कांस्यरैत्यानां त्रपुणः सीसकस्य च ।
शौचं यथार्हं कर्तव्यं क्षाराम्लोदकवारिभिः ॥ ५.११४॥ tāmrāyaskāṃsyaraittyānāṃ trapuṇaḥ sīsakasya ca |
śaucaṃ yathārhaṃ kartavyaṃ kṣārāmlodakavāribhiḥ || 5.114|| Cleansing of copper, iron, bronze, lead, and tin vessels must be performed appropriately using alkali, acids, and water, in accordance with their nature and use.

title: Verse 5.115
content:
द्रवाणां चैव सर्वेषां शुद्धिरुत्पवनं स्मृतम् ।
प्रोक्षणं संहतानां च दारवाणां च तक्षणम् ॥ ५.११५॥ dravāṇāṃ caiva sarveṣāṃ śuddhirutpavanaṃ smṛtam |
prokṣaṇaṃ saṃhatānāṃ ca dāravāṇāṃ ca takṣaṇam || 5.115|| Purification of all liquids is declared as exposure to wind; sprinkling is purification for compacted substances; chipping is purification for wooden articles.

title: Verse 5.116
content:
मार्जनं यज्ञपात्राणां पाणिना यज्ञकर्मणि ।
चमसानां ग्रहाणां च शुद्धिः प्रक्षालनेन तु ॥ ५.११६॥ mārjanaṁ yajñapātrāṇāṁ pāṇinā yajñakarmaṇi |
camasānāṁ grahāṇāṁ ca śuddhiḥ prakṣālanena tu || 5.116|| Purification of sacrificial implements, including ladles and vessels used in Yajna, is accomplished through physical cleansing by hand; similarly, purification of embodied beings arises through conscious completion and alignment with their inherent capacity.

title: Verse 5.117
content:
चरूणां स्रुक्स्रुवाणां च शुद्धिरुष्णेन वारिणा ।
स्फ्यशूर्पशकटानां च मुसलौलूखलस्य च ॥ ५.११७॥ carūṇāṃ sruksruvāṇāṃ ca śuddhiruṣṇena vāriṇā |
sphy-aśūrpa-śakatānāṃ ca musala-ulūkhalasya ca || 5.117 || Purification of offerings and implements used in ritual sacrifice is accomplished through hot water; similarly, purification of winnowing baskets, plows, carts, mortars, and pestles must occur through appropriate cleansing agents suited to their material composition.

title: Verse 5.118
content:
अद्भिस्तु प्रोक्षणं शौचं बहूनां धान्यवाससाम् ।
प्रक्षालनेन त्वल्पानामद्भिः शौचं विधीयते ॥ ५.११८॥ adbhistu prokṣaṇaṃ śaucaṃ bahūnāṃ dhānyavāsasām |
prakṣālanena tvalpānāmadbhiḥ śaucaṃ vidhīyate || 5.118|| Purification through sprinkling water is prescribed for bulk grains and cloth; purification by washing with water is laid down for small quantities.

title: Verse 5.119
content:
चैलवत्चर्मणां शुद्धिर्वैदलानां तथैव च ।
शाकमूलफलानां च धान्यवत्शुद्धिरिष्यते ॥ ५.११९॥ cailavatcarmaṇāṃ śuddhir vaidalānāṃ tathaiva ca | śākamūlaphalānāṃ ca dhānyavat śuddhiriṣyate || 5.119 || Purity of cloth and leather, as also of items derived from wild animals, and similarly of vegetables, roots, and fruits, shall be determined in the same manner as the purity of grain.

title: Verse 5.120
content:
कौशेयाविकयोरूषैः कुतपानामरिष्टकैः ।
श्रीफलैरंशुपट्टानां क्षौमाणां गौरसर्षपैः ॥ ५.१२०॥ kauśeyāvikayorūṣaiḥ kutapānāmariṣṭakaiḥ |
śrīphalair-aṃśupaṭṭānāṃ kṣaumāṇāṃ gaurasarṣapaiḥ || 5.120|| By means of garments made from kauseya and avika fibers, by coverlets of kutapa and arishṭaka woods, by silk cloths adorned with Sriphala patterns, and by fine linen dyed with cow’s urine and mustard essence — thus shall offerings be rendered in accordance with the purity of action and consciousness.

title: Verse 5.121
content:
क्षौमवत्सङ्खश‍ृङ्गाणामस्थिदन्तमयस्य च ।
शुद्धिर्विजानता कार्या गोमूत्रेणौदकेन वा ॥ ५.१२१॥ kṣaumavat-saṅkha-śṛṅgāṇām asthi-danta-mayasya ca |
śuddhir vijānatā kāryā go-mūtreṇodakena vā || 5.121|| Knowledgeable purification of silk, conch, horn, bone, tooth, and iron substances must be performed using cow urine or water.

title: Verse 5.122
content:
प्रोक्षणात्तृणकाष्ठं च पलालं चैव शुध्यति ।
मार्जनौपाञ्जनैर्वेश्म पुनःपाकेन मृण्मयम् ॥ ५.१२२॥ prokṣaṇāt tṛṇa-kāṣṭhaṃ ca palālaṃ caiva śudhyati | mārjanopāñjanair veśma punaḥ pākena mṛṇ-mayam || 5.122 || By sprinkling, grass and wood become pure; by sweeping and anointing, a house becomes pure again; clay vessels regain purity through reheating.

title: Verse 5.123
content:
मद्यैर्मूत्रैः पुरीषैर्वा ष्ठीवनैः पूयशोणितैः ।
संस्पृष्टं नैव शुद्ध्येत पुनःपाकेन मृत्मयम् ॥ ५.१२३॥ madhyair mūtraiḥ purīṣair vā śṭhīvanaiḥ pūyaśoṇitaiḥ |
saṃspṛṣṭaṃ naiva śuddhyeta punaḥpākena mṛtmayam || 5.123|| That which has been contaminated by alcohol, urine, feces, phlegm, pus, or blood shall not be purified again through fire or clay-based methods.

title: Verse 5.124
content:
संमार्जनौपाञ्जनेन सेकेनौल्लेखनेन च ।
गवां च परिवासेन भूमिः शुद्ध्यति पञ्चभिः ॥ ५.१२४॥ saṃmārjanopāñjanena sekenaullekhanena ca |
gavāṃ ca parivāsena bhūmiḥ śudhyati pañcabhiḥ || 5.124|| The earth is purified through five means: sweeping, application of cow-dung, watering, scraping, and the presence of cows.

title: Verse 5.125
content:
पक्षिजग्धं गवा घ्रातमवधूतमवक्षुतम् ।
दूषितं केशकीटैश्च मृत्प्रक्षेपेण शुध्यति ॥ ५.१२५॥ pakṣijagdhaṃ gavā ghrātamavadhūtamavakṣutam | dūṣitaṃ keśakīṭaiśca mṛtaprakṣepeṇa śudhyati || 5.125|| That which has been defiled by birds, cows, wind, abandonment, pouring out, or insects becomes pure through sprinkling with earth.

title: Verse 5.126
content:
यावन्नापेत्यमेध्याक्ताद्गन्धो लेपश्च तत्कृतः ।
तावन् मृद्वारि चादेयं सर्वासु द्रव्यशुद्धिषु ॥ ५.१२६॥ yāvannāpetyamedhyāktād gandho lepaśca tatkṛtaḥ |
tāvan mṛdvāri cādeyaṃ sarvāsu dravyaśuddhiṣu || 5.126|| Until the smell and contamination caused by unclean substances have fully dissipated, water and other purifying agents must be applied in all forms of material purification.

title: Verse 5.127
content:
त्रीणि देवाः पवित्राणि ब्राह्मणानामकल्पयन् ।
अदृष्टमद्भिर्निर्णिक्तं यच्च वाचा प्रशस्यते ॥ ५.१२७॥ trīṇi devāḥ pavitrāṇi brāhmaṇānāmakalpayan |
adṛṣṭamadbhirnirṇiktaṃ yacca vācā praśasyate || 5.127|| The three sacred purifications of the Brahmin were established by the Devatas: that which is unseen yet discerned through inner clarity, and that which is praised through speech.

title: Verse 5.128
content:
आपः शुद्धा भूमिगता वैतृष्ण्यं यासु गोर्भवेत् ।
अव्याप्ताश्चेदमेध्येन गन्धवर्णरसान्विताः ॥ ५.१२८॥ āpaḥ śuddhā bhūmigatā vaitṛṣṇyaṁ yāsu gorbhavet |
avyāptāścedamedhyena gandhavarṇarasānvitāḥ || 5.128|| Waters that are pure, flowing on the earth's surface, free from thirst (desire), and in which a cow could safely dwell—these waters remain uncontaminated even when mixed with impure substances, provided they retain their natural scent, color, and taste.

title: Verse 5.129
content: नित्यं शुद्धः कारुहस्तः पण्ये यच्च प्रसारितम् । पण्यं ब्रह्मचारिगतं भैक्ष्यं नित्यं मेध्यमिति स्थितिः ॥ ५.१२९॥ nityaṃ śuddhaḥ kāruhastaḥ paṇye yacc prasāritam | paṇyaṃ brahmacārigataṃ bhaikṣyaṃ nityaṃ medhyamiti sthitiḥ || 5.129 || The artisan's hand remains eternally pure; whatever is offered in trade retains its purity. The alms collected by a celibate student are always pure by nature.

title: Verse 5.130
content:
नित्यमास्यं शुचि स्त्रीणां शकुनिः फलपातने ।
प्रस्रवे च शुचिर्वत्सः श्वा मृगग्रहणे शुचिः ॥ ५.१३०॥ nityamāsyaṃ śuci strīṇāṃ śakuniḥ phalapātane |
prasrave ca śucirvatsaḥ śvā mṛgagrahaṇe śuciḥ || 5.130|| The constant purity of women is like the bird's awareness in fruitfall; the calf's clarity during milkflow; and the dog's innocence in hunting deer.

title: Verse 5.131
content:
श्वभिर्हतस्य यन् मांसं शुचि तन् मनुरब्रवीत् ।
क्रव्याद्भिश्च हतस्यान्यैश्चण्डालाद्यैश्च दस्युभिः ॥ ५.१३१॥ śvabhirhatasya yan māṃsaṃ śuci tan manurabravīt |
ravyādhaiśca hatasyānyaiścaṇḍālādyaiśca dasyubhiḥ || 5.131|| The flesh of one killed by dogs is pure, Manu declared; likewise that of one slain by carnivorous beasts, outcasts, or brigands.

title: Verse 5.132
content:
ऊर्ध्वं नाभेर्यानि खानि तानि मेध्यानि सर्वशः ।
यान्यधस्तान्यमेध्यानि देहाच्चैव मलाश्च्युताः ॥ ५.१३२॥ Ūrdhvaṁ nābher yāni khāni tāni medhyāni sarvaśaḥ |
Yāny adhastāny amedhyāni dehāc caiva malāś cyutāḥ || 5.132|| All bodily openings above the navel are pure; those below are impure, as are excretions fallen from the body.

title: Verse 5.133
content: मक्षिका विप्रुषश्छाया गौरश्वः सूर्यरश्मयः । रजो भूर्वायुरग्निश्च स्पर्शे मेध्यानि निर्दिशेत् ॥ ५.१३३॥ makṣikā vipruṣaś chāyā gaur aśvaḥ sūrya-raśmayaḥ | rajo bhūr vāyur agniś ca sparśe medhyāni nirdiśet || 5.133 || That which by touch purifies—such as the shadow of a Brahmin, cow, horse, sunlight rays, dust, earth, wind, fire—is declared pure.

title: Verse 5.134
content:
विण्मूत्रोत्सर्गशुद्ध्यर्थं मृद्वार्यादेयमर्थवत् ।
दैहिकानां मलानां च शुद्धिषु द्वादशस्वपि ॥ ५.१३४॥ viṇmūtrōtsargaśuddhyarthaṁ mṛdvāryādēyamarthavat |
daihikānāṁ malānāṁ ca śuddhiṣu dvādaśasvapi || 5.134|| For the purification of excrement and urine discharge, soft earth or water shall be provided meaningfully; likewise for the twelve bodily impurities, cleansing must occur appropriately.

title: Verse 5.135
content:
वसा शुक्रमसृग्मज्जा मूत्रविड्घ्राणकर्णविट् ।
श्लेष्माश्रु दूषिका स्वेदो द्वादशैते नृणां मलाः ॥ ५.१३५॥ vasā śukramasṛgmajjā mūtraviḍghrāṇakarṇaviṭ |
śleṣmāśru dūṣikā svedo dvādaśaite nṛṇāṃ malāḥ || 5.135 || Fat, semen, blood, marrow, urine, feces, nasal discharge, earwax, phlegm, tears, impurities, and sweat—these twelve substances constitute the bodily malas of human beings.

title: Verse 5.136
content:
एका लिङ्गे गुदे तिस्रस्तथैकत्र करे दश ।
उभयोः सप्त दातव्या मृदः शुद्धिमभीप्सता ॥ ५.१३६॥ ekā liṅge gude tisrastathaikatra kare daśa |
ubhayoḥ saptadātavyā mṛdaḥ śuddhimabhīpsatā || 5.136|| One cow shall be given for the penis or anus; three cows for a hand or foot; ten cows if both hands or feet are injured; seven cows must be offered by one seeking purification through restitution.

title: Verse 5.137
content:
एतत्शौचं गृहस्थानां द्विगुणं ब्रह्मचारिणाम् ।
त्रिगुणं स्याद्वनस्थानां यतीनां तु चतुर्गुणम् ॥ ५.१३७॥ etat śaucaṃ gṛhasthānāṃ dviguṇaṃ brahmacāriṇām | triguṇaṃ syād vana-sthānāṃ yatīnāṃ tu caturguṇam || 5.137 || The purity prescribed for householders is doubled for celibate students; it is tripled for forest-dwelling contemplatives, and quadrupled for renunciate yogis.

title: Verse 5.138
content:
कृत्वा मूत्रं पुरीषं वा खान्याचान्त उपस्पृशेत् ।
वेदमध्येष्यमाणश्च अन्नमश्नंश्च सर्वदा ॥ ५.१३८॥ kṛtvā mūtraṁ purīṣaṁ vā khanīyācānta upaspṛśet | vedamadhyeṣyamāṇaśca annamaśnannśca sarvadā || 5.138 || One who has voided urine or feces must touch the earth before engaging in Vedic study or consuming food; likewise, one engaged in Vedic recitation or partaking of food must always remain purified through grounding practices.

title: Verse 5.139
content:
त्रिराचामेदपः पूर्वं द्विः प्रमृज्यात्ततो मुखम् ।
शरीरं शौचमिच्छन् हि स्त्री शूद्रस्तु सकृत्सकृत् ॥ ५.१३९॥ trirācamed apaḥ pūrvaṁ dviḥ pramṛjyāt tataḥ mukham |
śarīraṁ śaucamicchan hi strī śūdrastu sakṛtsakṛt || Purification through water is to be performed thrice before drinking, twice wiping the mouth afterward; for bodily cleanliness, a woman or śūdra performs it once.

title: Verse 5.140
content:
शूद्राणां मासिकं कार्यं वपनं न्यायवर्तिनाम् ।
वैश्यवत्कौशचकल्पश्च द्विजोच्छिष्टं च भोजनम् ॥ ५.१४०॥ śūdrāṇāṃ māsikaṃ kāryaṃ vapanam nyāyavartinām |
 vaiśyavat śaucakalpaś ca dvijocchiṣṭaṃ ca bhōjanam || 5.140 || For Shudras, monthly duties include shaving and maintaining judicial decorum; their purification rites shall resemble those of Vaishyas, and they may partake of remnants of food offered to or consumed by Dvijas.

title: Verse 5.141
content:
नोच्छिष्टं कुर्वते मुख्या विप्रुषोऽङ्गं न यान्ति याः ।
न श्मश्रूणि गतान्यास्यं न दन्तान्तरधिष्ठितम् ॥ ५.१४१॥ nocchiṣṭaṃ kurvate mukhyā vipruṣo'ṅgaṃ na yānti yāḥ |
na śmaśrūṇi gatānyāsaṃ na dantāntaradhiṣṭhitam || 5.141|| Those women who do not partake of remnants of food after the main feast, whose bodies do not bear the marks of sacred ash, whose faces are not adorned with the tilaka, and whose teeth are not stained by betel leaf—such women lack the capacity for Vedic ritual participation.

title: Verse 5.142
content:
स्पृशन्ति बिन्दवः पादौ य आचामयतः परान् ।
भौमिकैस्ते समा ज्ञेया न तैराप्रयतो भवेत् ॥ ५.१४२॥ अप्रयतो spṛśanti bindavaḥ pādau ya ācāmayataḥ parān |
bhaumikais te samā jñeyā na tair āprayato bhavet || 5.142|| aprayataḥ Those whose bodily emissions touch the feet of others during purification rituals are to be understood as equal in status to earthly beings; such individuals must not remain in an unrefined state.

title: Verse 5.143
content:
उच्छिष्टेन तु संस्पृष्टो द्रव्यहस्तः कथं चन ।
अनिधायैव तद्द्रव्यमाचान्तः शुचितामियात् ॥ ५.१४३॥ ucchiṣṭena tu saṃspṛṣṭo dravyahastaḥ kathaṃ cana |
anidhāyaiva tad dravyam ācāntaḥ śucitām iyāt || 5.143 || When a person's hand, having touched remnants of food, comes into contact with any substance, that substance becomes impure. However, if the hand is washed first before touching, then even that which was previously impure regains purity through proper cleansing.

title: Verse 5.144
content:
वान्तो विरिक्तः स्नात्वा तु घृतप्राशनमाचरेत् ।
आचामेदेव भुक्त्वाऽन्नं स्नानं मैथुनिनः स्मृतम् ॥ ५.१४४॥ vānto viriktaḥ snātvā tu ghṛtaprāśanam ācaret .
ācāmed eva bhuktā'nnam snānaṃ maithuninaḥ smṛtam .. 5.144 .. One who has vomited, undergone purgation, or engaged in sexual intercourse must bathe, consume ghee, and perform achamana before partaking food or performing ritual ablutions.

title: Verse 5.145
content:
सुप्त्वा क्षुत्वा च भुक्त्वा च निष्ठीव्यौक्त्वाऽनृतानि च ।
पीत्वाऽपोऽध्येष्यमाणश्च आचामेत्प्रयतोऽपि सन् ॥ ५.१४५॥ suptvā kṣutvā ca bhuktva ca niṣṭhīvyauktvā'nṛtāni ca | pītvā'po'dhyeṣyamāṇaśca ācamet prayato'pi san || 5.145 || One who has slept, hungered, eaten, spat, spoken untruths, drunk water, or intends to study must purify through achamana, maintaining purity even while engaged in action.

title: Verse 5.146
content: एषां शौचविधिः कृत्स्नो द्रव्यशुद्धिस्तथैव च । एष उक्तो वः सर्ववर्णानां स्त्रीणां धर्मान्निबोधत ॥ ५.१४६॥ eṣāṁ śaucavidhiḥ kṛtsno dravyaśuddhistathaiva ca | eṣa ukto vaḥ sarvavarṇānāṁ strīṇāṁ dharmānnibodhata || 5.146 || The complete code of purity and material purification has been declared for all varnas; now understand the Dharma specifically applicable to women.

title: Verse 5.147
content:
बालया वा युवत्या वा वृद्धया वाऽपि योषिता ।
न स्वातन्त्र्येण कर्तव्यं किं चिद्कार्यं गृहेष्वपि ॥ ५.१४७॥ bālayā vā yuvatyā vā vṛddhayā vā'pi yoshiṭā |
na svātantryeṇa kartavyaṃ kiṃ cid kāryaṃ gṛheṣv api || A woman, whether young, adolescent, or elderly, shall not independently perform any action within the household without alignment with the governing consciousness structure.

title: Verse 5.148
content:
बाल्ये पितुर्वशे तिष्ठेत्पाणिग्राहस्य यौवने ।
पुत्राणां भर्तरि प्रेते न भजेत्स्त्री स्वतन्त्रताम् ॥ ५.१४८॥ bālye pitur vaśe tiṣṭhet pāṇigrāhasya yauvane |
putrāṇāṃ bhartari prete na bhajet strī svatantratām || 5.148|| In childhood, a woman remains under the guardianship of her father; in youth, under that of her husband; and in old age, under that of her sons. A woman must never seek independence after the death of her husband.

title: Verse 5.149
content:
पित्रा भर्त्रा सुतैर्वाऽपि नेच्छेद्विरहमात्मनः ।
एषां हि विरहेण स्त्री गर्ह्ये कुर्यादुभे कुले ॥ ५.१४९॥ pitrā bhartṛā sutair vā'pi necched viraham ātmanaḥ |
eṣāṁ hi virahena strī garhye kuryād ubhe kule || 5.149 || A woman must not desire separation from her father, husband, or sons; through such separation, she brings dishonor upon both lineages.

title: Verse 5.150
content:
सदा प्रहृष्टया भाव्यं गृहकार्ये च दक्षया ।
सुसंस्कृतोपस्करया व्यये चामुक्तहस्तया ॥ ५.१५०॥ sadā prahṛṣṭayā bhāvyaṃ gṛhakārye ca dakṣayā |
susaṃskṛtopaskarayā vyaye cāmuktahastayā || 5.150|| One must always act with joy, skillfully manage household duties, utilize well-prepared instruments, and give freely without attachment to the fruits.

title: Verse 5.151
content:
यस्मै दद्यात्पिता त्वेनां भ्राता वाऽनुमते पितुः ।
तं शुश्रूषेत जीवन्तं संस्थितं च न लङ्घयेत् ॥ ५.१५१॥ yasmai dadyāt pitā tv enāṁ bhrātā vā 'numate pituḥ |
taṁ śuśrūṣeta jīvantaṁ saṁsthitaṁ ca na laṅghayet || 5.151|| He who receives from the father or with the father's approval from the brother shall serve that person while alive and after death shall not transgress his established position.

title: Verse 5.152
content:
मङ्गलार्थं स्वस्त्ययनं यज्ञश्चासां प्रजापतेः ।
प्रयुज्यते विवाहे तु प्रदानं स्वाम्यकारणम् ॥ ५.१५२॥ maṅgalārthaṁ svastyayanaṁ yajñaścāsāṁ prajāpateḥ |
prayujyate vivāhe tu pradānaṁ svāmyakāraṇam || 5.152|| For auspiciousness, the invocation of well-being and the sacrifice dedicated to Prajāpati are employed; in marriage, the act of giving [the bride] is performed for the purpose of establishing sovereignty.

title: Verse 5.153
content:
अनृतावृतुकाले च मन्त्रसंस्कारकृत्पतिः ।
सुखस्य नित्यं दातैह परलोके च योषितः ॥ ५.१५३॥ anṛtāvṛtukāle ca mantrasaṃskārakṛtpatiḥ |
sukhasya nityaṃ dātaih paraloke ca yosiṣaḥ || 5.153|| One who engages in conjugal union during the ritually prohibited season, having undergone mantra initiation, shall perpetually bestow happiness in this world and ensure felicity for women in the next.

title: Verse 5.154
content:
विशीलः कामवृत्तो वा गुणैर्वा परिवर्जितः ।
उपचार्यः स्त्रिया साध्व्या सततं देववत्पतिः ॥ ५.१५४॥ viśīlaḥ kāmavṛtto vā guṇairvā parivarjitaḥ |
upacāryaḥ striyā sādhyā satataṃ devavatpatriḥ || 5.154|| A husband who is sexually excessive, misconducted, or devoid of virtuous qualities shall at all times be served by a chaste woman as a divine consort would serve her lord.

title: Verse 5.155
content: नास्ति स्त्रीणां पृथग्यज्ञो न व्रतं नाप्युपोषणम् । उपोषितम् पतिं शुश्रूषते येन तेन स्वर्गे महीयते ॥ ५.१५५॥ nāsti strīṇāṁ pṛthag yajño na vrataṁ nāpy upoṣaṇam | upoṣitam patiṁ śuśrūṣate yena tena svarghe mahīyate || 5.155 || There is no separate ritual merit for women, nor any vow or fast that stands apart; by serving a fasting husband, she who does so is exalted in heaven.

title: Verse 5.156
content:
पाणिग्राहस्य साध्वी स्त्री जीवतो वा मृतस्य वा ।
पतिलोकमभीप्सन्ती नाचरेत्किं चिदप्रियम् ॥ ५.१५६॥ pāṇigrāhasya sādhvī strī jīvato vā mṛtasya vā |
patilokamabhīpsantī nācaret kiṃ cidapriyam || 5.156 || A virtuous woman, whether her husband lives or has passed away, desiring union with him in his world, shall engage in no act displeasing to him.

title: Verse 5.157
content:
कामं तु क्षपयेद्देहं पुष्पमूलफलैः शुभैः ।
न तु नामापि गृह्णीयात्पत्यौ प्रेते परस्य तु ॥ ५.१५७॥ kāmaṃ tu kṣapayeddehaṃ puṣpamūlaphalaiḥ śubhaiḥ |
na tu nāmāpi gṛhṇīyātpatyau prete parasya tu || 5.157|| A woman whose husband has passed away may sustain her body with auspicious flowers, roots, and fruits, but she shall not even take the name of another man.

title: Verse 5.158
content:
आसीतामरणात्क्षान्ता नियता ब्रह्मचारिणी ।
यो धर्म एकपत्नीनां काङ्क्षन्ती तमनुत्तमम् ॥ ५.१५८॥ āsītāmaraṇātkṣāntā niyatā brahmacāriṇī |
yo dharma ekapatnīnāṃ kāṅkṣantī tamanuttamam || 5.158|| She who remains steadfast after the death of her husband, fully restrained and devoted in celibacy—such a woman follows the highest Dharma of those desiring union with the One.

title: Verse 5.159
content:
अनेकानि सहस्राणि कुमारब्रह्मचारिणाम् ।
दिवं गतानि विप्राणामकृत्वा कुलसंततिम् ॥ ५.१५९॥ anekāni sahasrāṇi kumārabrahmacāriṇām | divaṁ gatāni viprāṇāmakṛtvā kulasantatim || 5.159|| Countless thousands of youthful brahmacharis and learned Brahmins have ascended to the divine realms without establishing family lineage.

title: Verse 5.160
content:
मृते भर्तरि साध्वी स्त्री ब्रह्मचर्ये व्यवस्थिता ।
स्वर्गं गच्छत्यपुत्राऽपि यथा ते ब्रह्मचारिणः ॥ ५.१६०॥ mṛte bhartari sādhvī strī brahmacarye vyavasthitā |
svargaṁ gacchatyaputrā'pi yathā te brahmacāriṇaḥ || 5.160 || When a virtuous woman remains established in celibacy after the death of her husband, she attains heaven even without sons, just as do those who live as celibates.

title: Verse 5.161
content:
अपत्यलोभाद्या तु स्त्री भर्तारमतिवर्तते ।
सेह निन्दामवाप्नोति परलोकाच्च हीयते ॥ ५.१६१॥ apatyalobhādyā tu strī bhartāramativartate |
seha nindāmavāpnoti paralokācca hīyate || 5.161|| When a woman, driven by desire for offspring or other motives, transgresses the authority of her husband, she incurs social censure in this life and diminishes her standing in the next.

title: Verse 5.162
content: नान्योत्पन्ना प्रजाऽस्तीह न चाप्यन्यपरिग्रहे । न चान्यस्य परिग्रहे न द्वितीयश्च साध्वीनां क्व चिद्भर्तोपदिश्यते ॥ ५.१६२॥ nānyotpannā prajā'stīha na cāpyanyaparigrahe | na cānyasya parigrahe na dvitīyaśca sādhvīnāṃ kva cidbhartopadiśyate || 5.162 || No other progeny exists beyond that born of the union of husband and wife; nor is there any rightful acquisition outside lawful possession. There shall be no second husband prescribed for virtuous women anywhere.

title: Verse 5.163
content: पतिं हित्वाऽपकृष्टं स्वमुत्कृष्टं या निषेवते । हित्वाऽवकृष्टं निन्द्यैव सा भवेल्लोके परपूर्वैति चौच्यते ॥ ५.१६३॥ patiṁ hitvā'pakṛṣṭaṁ svamutkṛṣṭaṁ yā niṣevate | hitvā'vakṛṣṭaṁ nindyeva sā bhavelloke parapūrvaiti caucyate || 5.163 || She who abandons her own diminished husband and serves a superior man, abandoning thereby a degraded one, becomes censured in this world and is deemed to follow another before the prior bond is lawfully severed.

title: Verse 5.164
content: व्यभिचारात्तु भर्तुः स्त्री लोके प्राप्नोति निन्द्यताम् । व्यभिचारे तु शृगालयोनिं प्राप्नोति पापरोगैश्च पीड्यते ॥ ५.१६४॥ vyabhicārāt tu bhartuḥ strī loke prāpnoti nindyatām | vyabhicāre tu śṛgalayoniṃ prāpnoti pāparogaiś ca pīḍyate || 5.164 || When a woman violates the sacred bond of union through disloyalty to her husband, she incurs public censure in this world and, upon death, enters the womb of a jackal and suffers from diseases born of sin.

title: Verse 5.165
content: पतिं या नाभिचरति मनोवाग्देहसंयुता ।  देहसंयता सा भर्तृलोकमाप्नोति सद्भिः साध्वीति चोच्यते ॥ ५.१६५॥ patiṃ yā nābhicarati manovāgdehasaṃyutā | dehasaṃyatā sā bhartṛlokamāpnoti sadbhiḥ sādhvīti cocyate || 5.165 || She who remains undivided in thought, word, and body with her husband, and whose bodily conduct aligns entirely with dharma, attains the world of her husband and is honored by the noble as a virtuous woman.

title: Verse 5.166
content:
अनेन नारी वृत्तेन मनोवाग्देहसंयता ।
इहाग्र्यां कीर्तिमाप्नोति पतिलोकं परत्र च ॥ ५.१६६॥ anena nārī vṛttena manovāgdehasaṁyatā |
ihāgryāṁ kīrtimāpnoti patilokaṁ paratra ca || 5.166|| By this conduct, a woman who restrains her mind, speech, and body attains renown in this life, honor among her husband's people, and exaltation in the next.

title: Verse 5.167
content:
एवं वृत्तां सवर्णां स्त्रीं द्विजातिः पूर्वमारिणीम् ।
दाहयेदग्निहोत्रेण यज्ञपात्रैश्च धर्मवित् ॥ ५.१६७॥ evaṁ vṛttāṁ savarṇāṁ strīṁ dvijātiḥ pūrvam āriṇīm |
dāhayeda gnihotreṇa yajñapātraiśca dharmavit ||5.167|| When a twice-born male knowingly engages in sexual union with a woman of the same varna who has previously been violated by an enemy, he shall restore dharma through fire sacrifice using the sacred vessels.

title: Verse 5.168
content:
भार्यायै पूर्वमारिण्यै दत्त्वाऽग्नीनन्त्यकर्मणि ।
पुनर्दारक्रियां कुर्यात्पुनराधानमेव च ॥ ५.१६८॥ bhāryāyai pūrvam āriṇyai dattvā'gnīn antya-karmaṇi |
punar dāra-kriyāṃ kuryāt punar ādhānam eva ca || 5.168|| When a man has performed the final obsequies for his wife who died before him, and later desires to take another wife, he shall perform the marriage rites anew and establish her in the position of the former wife.

title: Verse 5.169
content:
अनेन विधिना नित्यं पञ्चयज्ञान्न हापयेत् ।
द्वितीयमायुषो भागं कृतदारो गृहे वसेत् ॥ ५.१६९॥ anena vidhinā nityaṃ pañcayajñānn hāpayet |
dvitīyamāyuṣo bhāgaṃ kṛtadāro gṛhe vaset || 5.169|| By this prescribed order, one must never abandon the five sacrifices; having fulfilled the duties of householding, one resides in the home for the second quarter of life.

title: Verse 6.1
content:
अध्याय ६

एवं गृहाश्रमे स्थित्वा विधिवत्स्नातको द्विजः ।
वने वसेत्तु नियतो यथावद्विजितैन्द्रियः ॥ ६.१॥ adhyāya 6

evam gṛhāśrame sthitvā vidhivat-snātako dvijaḥ |
vane vasettu niyato yathāvad-vijitendriyaḥ || 6.1|| Thus having dwelt in the householder stage according to dharma, a twice-born who has been initiated in accordance with the sacred injunctions shall reside in the forest, restrained and with senses fully subdued.

title: Verse 6.2
content:
गृहस्थस्तु यथा पश्येद्वलीपलितमात्मनः ।
अपत्यस्यैव चापत्यं तदाऽरण्यं समाश्रयेत् ॥ ६.२॥ gṛhasthas tu yathā paśyed valīpalitam ātmanaḥ | apatyasyaiva cāpatyaṃ tadā 'raṇyaṃ samāśrayet || 6.2|| When a householder perceives the signs of aging and decline in his own body, and sees that his son is capable of producing offspring, then he shall enter the forest.

title: Verse 6.3
content:
संत्यज्य ग्राम्यमाहारं सर्वं चैव परिच्छदम् ।
पुत्रेषु भार्यां निक्षिप्य वनं गच्छेत्सहैव वा ॥ ६.३॥ saṃtyajya grāmyamāhāraṃ sarvaṃ caiva paricchadam | 
putreṣu bhāryāṃ nikṣipya vanaṃ gacchet sahaiva vā || 6.3|| Having renounced all village-based enjoyments and material adornments, a householder shall leave his wife and children in care and proceed to the forest, or together with them.

title: Verse 6.4
content:
अग्निहोत्रं समादाय गृह्यं चाग्निपरिच्छदम् ।
ग्रामादरण्यं निःसृत्य निवसेन्नियतेन्द्रियः ॥ ६.४॥ निष्क्रम्य agnihotraṃ samādāya gṛhyaṃ cāgnipariśchadam | grāmādaraṇyaṃ niḥsṛtya nivasedniyatendriyaḥ || 6.4|| niṣkramya One who has taken the sacred fire and household implements, having left the village for the forest, shall dwell with senses controlled.

title: Verse 6.5
content:
मुन्यन्नैर्विविधैर्मेध्यैः शाकमूलफलेन वा ।
एतानेव महायज्ञान्निर्वपेद्विधिपूर्वकम् ॥ ६.५॥ muniyannair vividhair medhyaiḥ śākamūlaphalena vā |
etāneva mahāyajñān nirvaped vidhipūrvakam || 6.5|| One must offer, according to prescribed procedure, either cooked food or diverse pure items including roots, leaves, fruits, and vegetables—these very offerings constitute the great sacrifice.

title: Verse 6.6
content:
वसीत चर्म चीरं वा सायं स्नायात्प्रगे तथा ।
जटाश्च बिभृयान्नित्यं श्मश्रुलोमनखानि च ॥ ६.६॥ vasīta carma cīraṁ vā sāyaṁ snāyātprage tathā |
jatāśca bibhriyānnityaṁ śmaśrulomanakhāni ca || 6.6|| One must wear skin or cloth garments, bathe in the evening and morning alike, always maintain matted hair, and keep beard, body hair, and nails.

title: Verse 6.7
content: यद्भक्ष्यं स्याद्ततो दद्याद्बलिं भिक्षां च शक्तितः । यद्भक्षः अब्मूलफलभिक्षाभिरर्चयेदाश्रमागतान् ॥ ६.७॥ yadbhakṣyaṃ syād tato dadyād baliṃ bhikṣāṃ ca śaktitaḥ | yadbhakṣaḥ ambūlamūlaphalabhikṣābhir arcayed āśramāgatān || 6.7 || One must offer food according to one's capacity, giving Bali and alms as appropriate; with water, roots, fruits, and alms, one must honor those who have arrived at the āśrama.

title: Verse 6.8
content:
स्वाध्याये नित्ययुक्तः स्याद्दान्तो मैत्रः समाहितः ।
दाता नित्यमनादाता सर्वभूतानुकम्पकः ॥ ६.८॥ svādhyāye nityayuktaḥ syād dānto maitraḥ samāhitaḥ | dātā nityam anādātā sarvabhūtānukampaḥ || 6.8|| One who is perpetually engaged in svadhyaya, disciplined, friendly, composed, constantly giving, non-receiving, and compassionate to all beings—such a being embodies the living execution of Dharma.

title: Verse 6.9
content:
वैतानिकं च जुहुयादग्निहोत्रं यथाविधि ।
दर्शमस्कन्दयन् पर्व पौर्णमासं च योगतः ॥ ६.९॥ vaitānikaṃ ca juhuyādagnihotraṃ yathāvidhi |
darśamaskandayan parva paurṇamāsaṃ ca yogataḥ || 6.9|| One must perform the Vaitānika ritual and offer the Agnihotra sacrifice according to prescribed method; observe the Darśa and Paurṇamāsa offerings on their respective lunar occasions through yogic alignment.

title: Verse 6.10
content: ऋक्षेष्ट्य्।आग्रयणं चैव चातुर्मास्यानि चाहरेत् । दर्शेष्ट्य्।आग्रयणं तुरायणं च क्रमशो दक्षस्यायनमेव च ॥ ६.१०॥ दाक्षस्यायनं ṛkṣeṣṭy āgrayaṇaṃ caiva cāturmāsyāni cāharet | darśeṣṭy āgrayaṇaṃ turāyaṇaṃ ca kramaśo dakṣasyāyanameva ca || 6.10|| dākṣasyāyanaṃ One must perform the Rkṣeṣṭi and Agrayaṇa sacrifices, along with the Cāturmāsya rituals. In sequence, one must also execute the Darśeṣṭi, Agrayaṇa, Turāyaṇa, and Dakṣasyāyana sacrifices.

title: Verse 6.11
content:
वासन्तशारदैर्मेध्यैर्मुन्यन्नैः स्वयमाहृतैः ।
पुरोडाशांश्चरूंश्चैव विधिवत्निर्वपेत्पृथक् ॥ ६.११॥ vāsantaśāradairmedhyairmunyannaiḥ svayamāhṛtaiḥ | puroḍāśāṃścarūṃścaiva vidhivatnirvapetpṛthak || 6.11|| One must offer separately the seasonal oblations—spring and autumn—with pure grains and cooked rice-balls, collected personally by the sacrificer in accordance with scriptural procedure.

title: Verse 6.12
content:
देवताभ्यस्तु तधुत्वा वन्यं मेध्यतरं हविः ।
शेषमात्मनि युञ्जीत लवणं च स्वयं कृतम् ॥ ६.१२॥ devatābhyastu tad hutvā vanyaṁ medhyataraṁ haviḥ |
śeṣam ātmani yuñjīta lavaṇaṁ ca svayaṁ kṛtam || 6.12|| After offering the superior portion of the oblation to the deities, one should assign the remainder to oneself, along with salt produced by personal effort.

title: Verse 6.13
content:
स्थलजौदकशाकानि पुष्पमूलफलानि च ।
मेध्यवृक्षोद्भवान्यद्यात्स्नेहांश्च फलसम्भवान् ॥ ६.१३॥ sthalajaudakaśākāni puṣpamūlaphalāni ca |
medhyavṛkṣodbhavānyadyātsnehāṃśca phalasambhavān || 6.13|| Consumable produce derived from land and water, including flowers, roots, fruits, and oils extracted from pure trees and plants, belongs rightfully to those who sustain life through dharmic means.

title: Verse 6.14
content:
वर्जयेन् मधु मांसं च भौमानि कवकानि च ।
भूस्तृणं शिग्रुकं चैव श्लेष्मातकफलानि च ॥ ६.१४॥ varjayen madhu māṃsaṃ ca bhaumāni kavakāni ca |
bhūstṛṇaṃ śigrukaṃ caiva śleṣmātakaphalāni ca || 6.14|| One must refrain from honey, meat, earthly fungi, mushrooms, grasses grown in impure soil, leaves of the Śigru tree, and fruits of the Śleṣmātaka plant.

title: Verse 6.15
content:
त्यजेदाश्वयुजे मासि मुन्यन्नं पूर्वसञ्चितम् ।
जीर्णानि चैव वासांसि शाकमूलफलानि च ॥ ६.१५॥ tyajed āśvayuje māsi munyannaṁ pūrvasañcitam |
jīrṇāni caiva vāsāṁsi śākamūlaphalāni ca || 6.15|| In the month of Ashvayuja, one must discard previously stored food, worn-out garments, and old roots, vegetables, and fruits.

title: Verse 6.16
content:
न फालकृष्टमश्नीयादुत्सृष्टमपि केन चित् ।
न ग्रामजातान्यार्तोऽपि मूलाणि च फलानि च ॥ ६.१६॥ पुष्पानि च फलानि च na phālakṛṣṭamaśnīyādutsṛṣṭamapi kena cit |
na grāmajātānyārto'pi mūlāṇi ca phalāni ca || 6.16 || puṣpāṇi ca phalāni ca One must not consume produce uprooted by ploughing, nor any item abandoned by another, even when distressed; nor should one eat roots, fruits, flowers, or other village-grown items out of greed or desperation.

title: Verse 6.17
content:
अग्निपक्वाशनो वा स्यात्कालपक्वभुजेव वा ।
अश्मकुट्टो भवेद्वाऽपि दन्तोलूखलिकोऽपि वा ॥ ६.१७॥ agnipakvāśano vā syāt kālapakvabhujeva vā | aśmakuṭṭo bhaved vā'pi dantolūkhaliko'pi vā || 6.17 || One who consumes food that has been cooked by fire, or eaten by time itself, or crushed by stone, or ground by teeth or mortar—such consumption aligns with the natural order and maintains bodily integrity.

title: Verse 6.18
content:
सद्यः प्रक्षालको वा स्यान् माससञ्चयिकोऽपि वा ।
षण्मासनिचयो वा स्यात्समानिचय एव वा ॥ ६.१८॥ sadyaḥ prakṣālako vā syān māsasañcayiko'pi vā | ṣaṇmāsani cayo vā syāt samānica ya eva vā || 6.18|| One who has purified immediately, or one who has accumulated purification over a month, or one who has done so over six months — all such persons are equally purified when the completion of dharma is aligned with consciousness.

title: Verse 6.19
content:
नक्तं चान्नं समश्नीयाद्दिवा वाऽहृत्य शक्तितः ।
चतुर्थकालिको वा स्यात्स्याद्वाऽप्यष्टमकालिकः ॥ ६.१९॥ naktaṃ cānnaṃ samaśnīyād divā vā' hṛtya śaktitaḥ |
caturthakāliko vā syāt syād vā' py aṣṭamakālikaḥ || 6.19|| One must consume food either at night or during the day according to capacity; alternatively, one may eat once every fourth or eighth time-unit, based on situational dharma and bodily alignment.

title: Verse 6.20
content:
चान्द्रायणविधानैर्वा शुक्लकृष्णे च वर्तयेत् ।
पक्षान्तयोर्वाऽप्यश्नीयाद्यवागूं क्वथितां सकृत् ॥ ६.२०॥ cāndrāyaṇavidhānair vā śuklakṛṣṇe ca vartayet |
pakṣāntayor vā'py aśnīyād yavāgūṃ kvaṭhitāṃ sakṛt || 6.20|| One shall conduct oneself according to the rules of Cāndrāyaṇa during both the bright and dark fortnights, and at the transition of the lunar phases, one shall consume boiled grain-meal once.

title: Verse 6.21
content:
पुष्पमूलफलैर्वाऽपि केवलैर्वर्तयेत्सदा ।
कालपक्वैः स्वयं शीर्णैर्वैखानसमते स्थितः ॥ ६.२१॥ puṣpamūlaphalair vā'pi kevalair vartayet sadā |
kālapakvaiḥ svayaṃ śīrṇair vaikhānasamate sthitaḥ || 6.21|| One shall always sustain oneself solely by flowers, roots, fruits—whether gathered or naturally fallen—that are seasonally ripe and spontaneously decayed, remaining established in the state of a Vaikhānasa.

title: Verse 6.22
content:
भूमौ विपरिवर्तेत तिष्ठेद्वा प्रपदैर्दिनम् ।
स्थानासनाभ्यां विहरेत्सवनेषूपयन्नपः ॥ ६.२२॥ bhūmau viparivarteta tiṣṭhed vā prapadair dinam |
sthānāsanābhyāṃ viharer savaneṣūpayann apaḥ || 6.22|| One should remain seated on the ground, whether lying or standing, during all three daily rituals; one should move about using the same seat or place for all ceremonial acts involving water.

title: Verse 6.23
content:
ग्रीष्मे पञ्चतपास्तु स्याद्वर्षास्वभ्रावकाशिकः ।
आर्द्रवासास्तु हेमन्ते क्रमशो वर्धयंस्तपः ॥ ६.२३॥ grīṣme pañcatapāstu syādvarṣāsvabhrāvakāśikaḥ |
ārdravāsāstu hemante kramaśo vardhayaṃstapaḥ || 6.23|| In summer, one must perform five fires; during rains, one must dwell in caves or huts open to the sky; in winter, one must wear wet clothes—thus sequentially intensifying tapas according to seasonal alignment.

title: Verse 6.24
content:
उपस्पृशंस्त्रिषवणं पितॄन् देवांश्च तर्पयेत् ।
तपस्चरंश्चोग्रतरं शोषयेद्देहमात्मनः ॥ ६.२४॥ upaspṛśaṃstriṣavaṇaṃ pitṝn devāṃśca tarpayet |
tapascaraṃścogratarāṃ śoṣayeddehamātmanaḥ || 6.24|| One who has undergone the purificatory rites must perform oblations thrice daily to ancestors and deities; one engaged in severe austerities must reduce the body's dominance through disciplined withdrawal.

title: Verse 6.25
content:
अग्नीनात्मनि वैतानान् समारोप्य यथाविधि ।
अनग्निरनिकेतः स्यान् मुनिर्मूलफलाशनः ॥ ६.२५॥ agnīnātmani vaitānāṁ samāropya yathāvidhi |
anagniraniketaḥ syān munirmūlaphalāśanaḥ || 6.25|| One who has installed the sacred fires within the Self according to the established procedure shall become free from fire rituals; a sage lives upon roots and fruits.

title: Verse 6.26
content:
अप्रयत्नः सुखार्थेषु ब्रह्मचारी धराऽऽशयः ।
शरणेष्वममश्चैव वृक्षमूलनिकेतनः ॥ ६.२६॥ aprayatnaḥ sukha-artheṣu brahmacārī dharā-āśayaḥ |
śaraṇeṣv amamaś caiva vṛkṣa-mūla-niketanaḥ || 6.26|| One who remains unattached in pleasures, lives grounded in Earth's stability, takes shelter without ownership, and dwells at the root of trees—such a Brahmacari embodies the state of pure abidance.

title: Verse 6.27
content:
तापसेष्वेव विप्रेषु यात्रिकं भैक्षमाहरेत् ।
गृहमेधिषु चान्येषु द्विजेषु वनवासिषु ॥ ६.२७॥ tāpaseṣu eva vipreṣu yātrikaṁ bhaikṣam āharet |
gṛham edhiṣu cānyeṣu dvijeṣu vanavāsiṣu || 6.27|| One should seek alms only from those Brahmins who are engaged in severe austerities, from travelers, householders performing sacred rituals, other twice-born individuals, and forest dwellers.

title: Verse 6.28
content:
ग्रामादाहृत्य वाऽश्नीयादष्टौ ग्रासान् वने वसन् ।
प्रतिगृह्य पुटेनैव पाणिना शकलेन वा ॥ ६.२८॥ grāmādāhṛtya vā'śnīyādaṣṭau grāsān vane vasan . pratigṛhya puṭenaiva pāṇinā śakalena vā .. 6.28 .. One residing in the forest may take food brought from the village, up to eight morsels, by receiving it either in a cloth bundle or with the hand or with a piece of wood.

title: Verse 6.29
content:
एताश्चान्याश्च सेवेत दीक्षा विप्रो वने वसन् ।
विविधाश्चौपनिषदीरात्मसंसिद्धये श्रुतीः ॥ ६.२९॥ etāścānyāśca seveta dīkṣā vipro vane vasan .
vividhāścaupaniṣadīrātmasaṃsiddhaye śrutīḥ .. 6.29 .. A twice-born dwells in the forest during initiation; he shall engage in these and other Upanishads and diverse Śrutis for Self-realization.

title: Verse 6.30
content:
ऋषिभिर्ब्राह्मणैश्चैव गृहस्थैरेव सेविताः ।
विद्यातपोविवृद्ध्यर्थं शरीरस्य च शुद्धये ॥ ६.३०॥ ṛṣibhir brāhmaṇaiś caiva gṛhasthair eva sevitāḥ | vidyātapovivṛddhyarthaṁ śarīrasya ca śuddhaye || 6.30|| Those who are served by sages, Brahmins, and householders alike are to be honored for the expansion of knowledge, austerity, and the purification of the body.

title: Verse 6.31
content:
अपराजितां वाऽस्थाय व्रजेद्दिशमजिह्मगः ।
आ निपातात्शरीरस्य युक्तो वार्यनिलाशनः ॥ ६.३१॥ aparājitāṁ vā''sthāya vrajeddiśamajihmagaḥ |
ā nipātātśarīrasya yukto vāryanilāśanaḥ || 6.31|| One who has not been defeated must proceed in a direction that does not cause bodily harm; one who is capable of restoring balance after a fall must engage in practices that purify water and air.

title: Verse 6.32
content:
आसां महर्षिचर्याणां त्यक्त्वाऽन्यतमया तनुम् ।
वीतशोकभयो विप्रो ब्रह्मलोके महीयते ॥ ६.३२॥ āsāṁ maharṣicaryāṇāṁ tyaktvā'nyatamayā tanum | vītaśokabhayo vipro brahmaloke mahīyate || 6.32|| Having abandoned the body through any of these great sages' practices, the twice-born, free from sorrow and fear, is honored in Brahmaloka.

title: Verse 6.33
content:
वनेषु च विहृत्यैवं तृतीयं भागमायुषः ।
चतुर्थमायुषो भागं त्यक्वा सङ्गान् परिव्रजेत् ॥ ६.३३॥ vaneṣu ca vihṛtyaivaṁ tṛtīyaṁ bhāgamāyuṣaḥ |
caturthamāyuṣo bhāgaṁ tyakvā saṅgān parivrajet || 6.33|| One who has lived in the forest thus for a third part of their life span, having abandoned the fourth part of their life's duration, shall renounce all attachments and wander forth.

title: Verse 6.34
content:
आश्रमादाश्रमं गत्वा हुतहोमो जितेन्द्रियः ।
भिक्षाबलिपरिश्रान्तः प्रव्रजन् प्रेत्य वर्धते ॥ ६.३४॥ āśramād āśramaṁ gatvā hutahomo jitendriyaḥ |
bhikṣābalipariśrāntaḥ pravrajan pretya vardhate || 6.34|| One who, having renounced the stages of life, moves from one dwelling to another without attachment, having performed the sacred fire ritual and subdued the senses, and who sustains himself by alms while bearing physical exhaustion—such a renunciate grows in the hereafter.

title: Verse 6.35
content:
ऋणानि त्रीण्यपाकृत्य मनो मोक्षे निवेशयेत् ।
अनपाकृत्य मोक्षं तु सेवमानो व्रजत्यधः ॥ ६.३५॥ ṛṇāni trīṇyapākṛtya mano mokṣe niveśayet |
anapākṛtya mokṣaṃ tu sevamāno vrajatyadhaḥ || 6.35|| One must fully discharge the three debts—to the sages, ancestors, and deities—before directing the mind toward liberation; one who seeks liberation without clearing these debts descends downward.

title: Verse 6.36
content:
अधीत्य विधिवद्वेदान् पुत्रांश्चोत्पाद्य धर्मतः ।
इष्ट्वा च शक्तितो यज्ञैर्मनो मोक्षे निवेशयेत् ॥ ६.३६॥ adhītya vidhivadvedān putrāṃścotpādya dharmataḥ .
iṣṭvā ca śaktito yajñair mano mokṣe niveśayet .. 6.36 .. Having studied the Vedas according to prescribed methods, having lawfully begotten sons, and having performed sacrifices within one's capacity — one shall then direct the mind toward Liberation.

title: Verse 6.37
content: अनधीत्य द्विजो वेदाननुत्पाद्य तथा सुतान् । तथा प्रजां अनिष्ट्वा चैव यज्ञैश्च मोक्षमिच्छन् व्रजत्यधः ॥ ६.३७॥ anadhītya dvijo vedān anutpādya tathā sutān | tathā prajām aniṣṭvā caiva yajñaiś ca mokṣamicchan vrajaty adhaḥ || 6.37 || A twice-born who has not studied the Vedas, nor begotten sons, nor sustained progeny, and who desires liberation without performing sacrifices, descends downward.

title: Verse 6.38
content: प्राजापत्यं निरुप्येष्टिं सर्ववेदसदक्षिणाम् । सार्ववेदसदक्षिणाम् आत्मन्यग्नीन् समारोप्य ब्राह्मणः प्रव्रजेद्गृहात् ॥ ६.३८॥ prājāpatyaṃ nirupyēṣṭiṃ sarvavēdasadakṣiṇām | sārvavēdasadakṣiṇām ātmanyagnīn samāropy brāhmaṇaḥ pravrajaēd gṛhāt || 6.38|| A Brāhmaṇa, having established the fires within himself through the Prajāpatya ritual that fulfills all Vedic obligations, shall depart from his household.

title: Verse 6.39
content:
यो दत्त्वा सर्वभूतेभ्यः प्रव्रजत्यभयं गृहात् ।
तस्य तेजोमया लोका भवन्ति ब्रह्मवादिनः ॥ ६.३९॥ yo dattvā sarvabhūtebhyaḥ pravrajatyabhayaṃ gṛhāt |
tasya tejomayā lokā bhavanti brahmavādinaḥ || 6.39|| One who, having given fearlessness to all beings, renounces the household life, for that person the worlds become illumined with Tejas, as declared by knowers of Brahman.

title: Verse 6.40
content:
यस्मादण्वपि भूतानां द्विजान्नोत्पद्यते भयम् ।
तस्य देहाद्विमुक्तस्य भयं नास्ति कुतश्चन ॥ ६.४०॥ yasmād aṇv api bhūtānāṁ dvijān notpadyate bhayam |
tasya dehād vimuktasya bhayaṁ nāsti kutaś cana || 6.40 || From whom even the minutest beings are free of fear, and who is liberated from the body—there is no fear whatsoever for such a being.

title: Verse 6.41
content:
अगारादभिनिष्क्रान्तः पवित्रोपचितो मुनिः ।
समुपोढेषु कामेषु निरपेक्षः परिव्रजेत् ॥ ६.४१॥ agārād abhiniṣkrāntaḥ pavitropacito muniḥ |
samupoḍheṣu kāmeṣu nirapekṣaḥ parivrajett || 6.41|| One who has renounced household life and purified himself through sacred discipline, having fully experienced desire, shall wander without attachment.

title: Verse 6.42
content:
एक एव चरेन्नित्यं सिद्ध्यर्थमसहायवान् ।
सिद्धिमेकस्य सम्पश्यन्न जहाति न हीयते ॥ ६.४२॥ eka eva carennityaṃ siddhyarthamasahāyavān .
siddhim ekasya sampśyann na jahāti na hīyate .. 6.42.. One alone should constantly move, independent and self-reliant for realization; seeing the perfection in one, he neither abandons nor diminishes.

title: Verse 6.43
content:
अनग्निरनिकेतः स्याद्ग्राममन्नार्थमाश्रयेत् ।
उपेक्षकोऽसङ्कुसुको मुनिर्भावसमाहितः ॥ ६.४३॥ anagniraniketaḥ syādgrāmamannārthamāśrayet | upekṣako'saṅku sukō munirbhāvasamāhitaḥ || 6.43|| One who has no fire, no fixed dwelling, and subsists on alms gathered from the village—such a renunciate is to be recognized as one who remains indifferent, unattached, and absorbed in the state of being.

title: Verse 6.44
content: कपालं वृक्षमूलानि कुचेलमसहायता । कुचैलं समता चैव सर्वस्मिन्नेतत्मुक्तस्य लक्षणम् ॥ ६.४४॥ kapālaṃ vṛkṣamūlāni kucaitam asahāyatā | kucailaṃ samatā caiva sarvasminnetatmuktasya lakṣaṇam || 6.44|| Renunciation is marked by equanimity in all conditions—whether resting on a tree root, wearing mere rags, lacking support, or living equally amidst all beings.

title: Verse 6.45
content:
नाभिनन्देत मरणं नाभिनन्देत जीवितम् ।
कालमेव प्रतीक्षेत निर्वेशं भृतको यथा ॥ ६.४५॥ nābhinandeta maraṇaṁ nābhinandeta jīvitam | kālam eva pratīkṣeta nirveśaṁ bhr̥tako yathā || 6.45|| One should neither rejoice in death nor in life; one should await the appointed time, like a hired servant awaiting dismissal.

title: Verse 6.46
content:
दृष्टिपूतं न्यसेत्पादं वस्त्रपूतं जलं पिबेत् ।
सत्यपूतां वदेद्वाचं मनःपूतं समाचरेत् ॥ ६.४६॥ dṛṣṭipūtaṃ nyasetpādaṃ vastrapūtaṃ jalaṃ pibet |
satyapūtāṃ vadedvācaṃ manaḥpūtaṃ samācaret || 6.46|| Place the foot purified by sight, drink water purified by cloth, speak words purified by truth, and act with a mind purified by consciousness.

title: Verse 6.47
content:
अतिवादांस्तितिक्षेत नावमन्येत कं चन ।
न चैमं देहमाश्रित्य वैरं कुर्वीत केन चित् ॥ ६.४७॥ ativādāṁs titikṣeta nāvamanyeta kaṁ cana |
na cainaṁ deham āśritya vairaṁ kurvīta kena cit || One must endure harsh speech; let none be despised thereby. Taking refuge in this body, no being should cultivate enmity towards any.

title: Verse 6.48
content:
क्रुद्ध्यन्तं न प्रतिक्रुध्येदाक्रुष्टः कुशलं वदेत् ।
सप्तद्वारावकीर्णां च न वाचमनृतां वदेत् ॥ ६.४८॥ kruddhyantaṃ na pratikrudhyed ākruṣṭaḥ kuśalaṃ vadet |
saptadvārāvakīrṇāṃ ca na vācam anṛtāṃ vadet || 6.48|| One who is provoked must not retaliate in anger; one who is abused must speak skillfully. One must never speak words that are false or scattered through the seven gates of speech.

title: Verse 6.49
content:
अध्यात्मरतिरासीनो निरपेक्षो निरामिषः ।
आत्मनैव सहायेन सुखार्थी विचरेदिह ॥ ६.४९॥ adhyātmaratir āsīno nirapekṣo nirāmiṣaḥ |
ātmanā sahāyena sukha-arthī vicared iha || 6.49|| One who is established in Self-delight, free from desire for external objects and devoid of material cravings, should walk in this world solely with the support of the Self, seeking the highest bliss.

title: Verse 6.50
content:
न चोत्पातनिमित्ताभ्यां न नक्षत्राङ्गविद्यया ।
नानुशासनवादाभ्यां भिक्षां लिप्सेत कर्हि चित् ॥ ६.५०॥ na cotpātanimitābhyāṁ na nakṣatrāṅgavidyayā |
nānuśāsanavādābhyāṁ bhikṣāṁ lipseta karhi cit || 6.50|| A mendicant shall not solicit alms based on omens, astrological calculations, or scriptural exhortations at any time.

title: Verse 6.51
content:
न तापसैर्ब्राह्मणैर्वा वयोभिरपि वा श्वभिः ।
आकीर्णं भिक्षुकैर्वाऽन्यैरगारमुपसंव्रजेत् ॥ ६.५१॥ na tāpasair brāhmaṇair vā vayobhir api vā śvabhiḥ | 
ākīrṇaṁ bhikṣukair vā 'nyair agāram upasaṁvrajēt || 6.51|| One must not enter a house filled with ascetics, Brahmins, old people, dogs, or mendicants; such entry disrupts the energetic and conscious order of the dwelling.

title: Verse 6.52
content:
कॢप्तकेशनखश्मश्रुः पात्री दण्डी कुसुम्भवान् ।
विचरेन्नियतो नित्यं सर्वभूतान्यपीडयन् ॥ ६.५२॥ kl̥ptakeśanakhaśmaśruḥ pātrī daṇḍī kusumbhavān |
vicarenniyato nityaṃ sarvabhūtānyapīḍayan || 6.52|| One whose hair, nails, and beard are properly maintained, who carries the water vessel and staff, who is disciplined in conduct and ever restrained—such a one moves among all beings without causing harm.

title: Verse 6.53
content:
अतैजसानि पात्राणि तस्य स्युर्निर्व्रणानि च ।
तेषामद्भिः स्मृतं शौचं चमसानामिवाध्वरे ॥ ६.५३॥ ataijasāni pātrāṇi tasya syurnirvraṇāni ca |
teṣāmadbhiḥ smṛtaṃ śaucaṃ camasānāmivādhvare || 6.53|| For those whose inner fire (tejas) is diminished, their vessels become impure and wounded; their cleansing is accomplished through water, even as ladles in ritual sacrifice regain purity through ablution.

title: Verse 6.54
content:
अलाबुं दारुपात्रं च मृण्मयं वैदलं तथा ।
एताणि यतिपात्राणि मनुः स्वायम्भुवोऽब्रवीत् ॥ ६.५४॥ alābuṃ dārupātraṃ ca mṛṇmayaṃ vaidalaṃ tathā |
etāṇi yatipātrāṇi manuḥ svāyambhuvo'bravīt || 6.54|| The gourd, wooden vessel, clay pot, and alms-bowl made of split wood—these are the prescribed implements for the Sannyasi; thus spoke Manu, the Self-existent.

title: Verse 6.55
content:
एककालं चरेद्भैक्षं न प्रसज्जेत विस्तरे ।
भैक्षे प्रसक्तो हि यतिर्विषयेष्वपि सज्जति ॥ ६.५५॥ ekakālaṃ cared bhikṣaṃ na prasajjeta vistare |
bhikṣe prasakto hi yatiḥ viṣayeṣv api sajjati || 6.55|| The renunciate shall seek alms only once at a single dwelling and must not remain long; for when he lingers even in begging, his mind becomes entangled in worldly objects.

title: Verse 6.56
content:
विधूमे सन्नमुसले व्यङ्गारे भुक्तवज्जने ।
वृत्ते शरावसम्पाते भिक्षां नित्यं यतिश्चरेत् ॥ ६.५६॥ vidhūme sannamusale vyaṅgāre bhuktavajjane |
vṛtte śarāvasampāte bhikṣāṃ nityaṃ yatiścaret || 6.56|| In a dwelling free of smoke, stable and clean, with remnants of food properly disposed, where the begging bowl is kept in its designated place—there shall the renunciant continually seek alms.

title: Verse 6.57
content:
अलाभे न विषदी स्यात्लाभे चैव न हर्षयेत् ।
प्राणयात्रिकमात्रः स्यात्मात्रासङ्गाद्विनिर्गतः ॥ ६.५७॥ alābhe na viṣadī syāt labhe caiva na harṣayet |
prāṇayātrikamātraḥ syād ātrāsaṅgād vinirgataḥ || 6.57|| In loss, one does not fall into despair; in gain, one does not become elated. One remains merely as a traveler of life-breath, detached from possessions and outcomes.

title: Verse 6.58
content:
अभिपूजितलाभांस्तु जुगुप्सेतैव सर्वशः ।
अभिपूजितलाभैश्च यतिर्मुक्तोऽपि बध्यते ॥ ६.५८॥ abhipūjitalābhāṃstu jugupsetaiva sarvaśaḥ |
abhipūjitalābhaiśca yatirmukto'pi badhyate || 6.58|| One who is honored for gains must reject all such gains entirely; even a liberated ascetic becomes bound by accepting honors tied to material benefit.

title: Verse 6.59
content:
अल्पान्नाभ्यवहारेण रहःस्थानासनेन च ।
ह्रियमाणानि विषयैरिन्द्रियाणि निवर्तयेत् ॥ ६.५९॥ alpānnābhyavahāreṇa rahasthānāsanena ca | hriyamāṇāni viṣayairindriyāṇi nivartayet || 6.59|| By minimal intake of food and by sitting in secluded places, one must withdraw the senses that are being carried away by sense objects.

title: Verse 6.60
content:
इन्द्रियाणां निरोधेन रागद्वेषक्षयेण च ।
अहिंसया च भूतानाममृतत्वाय कल्पते ॥ ६.६०॥ indriyāṇāṃ nirodhena rāgadveṣakṣayeṇa ca |
ahiṃsayā ca bhūtānām amṛtatvāya kalpate || 6.60 || By restraint of the senses, by dissolution of attachment and aversion, and through non-violence towards all beings, one becomes fit for immortality.

title: Verse 6.61
content:
अवेक्षेत गतीर्नॄणां कर्मदोषसमुद्भवाः ।
निरये चैव पतनं यातनाश्च यमक्षये ॥ ६.६१॥ avekṣeta gatīr nṝṇāṁ karma-doṣa-samudbhavāḥ |
niraye caiva patanaṁ yātanāś ca yama-kṣaye || 6.61|| One must observe the destinies of beings arising from karmic distortion, including falls into hellish states and the consequent experiential sufferings that arise at the exhaustion of merit.

title: Verse 6.62
content:
विप्रयोगं प्रियैश्चैव संयोगं च तथाऽप्रियैः ।
जरया चाभिभवनं व्याधिभिश्चोपपीडनम् ॥ ६.६२॥ viprayogaṃ priyaiścaiva saṃyogaṃ ca tathā'priyaiḥ |
jarayā cābhibhavanaṃ vyādhibhiścopapīḍanam || 6.62|| Separation from the beloved, union with the unbeloved, subjugation by old age, and affliction by diseases—these constitute the inherent dharmic trials of embodied existence.

title: Verse 6.63
content:
देहादुत्क्रमणं चास्मात्पुनर्गर्भे च सम्भवम् ।
योनिकोटिसहस्रेषु सृतीश्चास्यान्तरात्मनः ॥ ६.६३॥ dehād utkramaṇaṃ cāsmāt punar garbhe ca sambhavam |
yonikoṭisahasreṣu sṛtīś cāsyāntarātmanaḥ || 6.63 || From this body one departs and is reborn again in another womb; through thousands of wombs one moves about, according to the inner law of one's own Self.

title: Verse 6.64
content:
अधर्मप्रभवं चैव दुःखयोगं शरीरिणाम् ।
धर्मार्थप्रभवं चैव सुखसंयोगमक्षयम् ॥ ६.६४॥ adharmaprabhavaṃ caiva duḥkhayogaṃ śarīriṇām | 
dharmārthaprabhavaṃ caiva sukhasaṃyogamakṣayam || 6.64|| Unrighteous conduct inevitably results in the perpetual binding of beings to suffering; righteous action rooted in dharma and artha perpetually aligns them with unbroken joy.

title: Verse 6.65
content:
सूक्ष्मतां चान्ववेक्षेत योगेन परमात्मनः ।
देहेषु च समुत्पत्तिमुत्तमेष्वधमेषु च ॥ ६.६५॥ देहेषु चैवोपपत्तिम् sūkṣmatāṁ cānvavekṣeta yogena paramātmanaḥ |
dehesu ca samutpattim uttamesv adhamesu ca || 6.65|| dehesu caivopapattim One must observe with yoga the subtle nature of the Supreme Self, and also the emergence and establishment of bodies among the high and low.

title: Verse 6.66
content: दूषितोऽपि चरेद्धर्मं यत्र तत्राश्रमे रतः । भूषितोऽपि समः सर्वेषु भूतेषु न लिङ्गं धर्मकारणम् ॥ ६.६६॥ dūṣito'pi cared dharmam yatra tatrāśrame rataḥ | bhuṣito'pi samaḥ sarveṣu bhūteṣu na liṅgam dharmakāraṇam || 6.66|| Even one who has been defiled must perform dharma wherever he resides in his ashram; even when adorned, one must remain equal among all beings—external symbols are not the cause of righteousness.

title: Verse 6.67
content:
फलं कतकवृक्षस्य यद्यप्यम्बुप्रसादकम् ।
न नामग्रहणादेव तस्य वारि प्रसीदति ॥ ६.६७॥ Phalaṁ katakavṛkṣasya yadyapyambuprasādakam |
Na nāmagrahaṇādeva tasya vāri prasīdati || 6.67|| Even if the fruit of the katka tree is capable of purifying water, merely uttering its name does not cause the water to become pure.

title: Verse 6.68
content:
संरक्षणार्थं जन्तूनां रात्रावहनि वा सदा ।
शरीरस्यात्यये चैव समीक्ष्य वसुधां चरेत् ॥ ६.६८॥ saṃrakṣaṇārthaṃ jantūnāṃ rātrāvahanī vā sadā |
śarīrasyātyaye caiva samīkṣya vasudhāṃ caret || 6.68|| For the protection of all beings, one must remain vigilant both by night and day; upon the dissolution of the body, one should proceed through the earth with full awareness.

title: Verse 6.69
content:
अह्ना रात्र्या च याञ्जन्तून् हिनस्त्यज्ञानतो यतिः ।
तेषां स्नात्वा विशुद्ध्यर्थं प्राणायामान् षडाचरेत् ॥ ६.६९॥ ahnaa raatryaa ca yaanjantuuN hinastyaj~naato yatiH .
teshaaM snaatvaa vishuddhyarthaM praaNaayaamaan sadaacharet .. 6.69 .. If a Yati, through ignorance, harms beings during day or night, he shall restore purity by bathing and performing sixfold breath-regulation.

title: Verse 6.70
content:
प्राणायामा ब्राह्मणस्य त्रयोऽपि विधिवत्कृताः ।
व्याहृतिप्रणवैर्युक्ता विज्ञेयं परमं तपः ॥ ६.७०॥ prāṇāyāmā brāhmaṇasya trayo'pi vidhivatkṛtāḥ |
vyāhṛtipraṇavairyuktā vijñeyaṃ paramaṃ tapaḥ || 6.70|| The threefold prāṇāyāma, when performed according to injunction by a Brāhmaṇa, combined with vyāhṛti and praṇava, is to be known as the supreme austerity.

title: Verse 6.71
content:
दह्यन्ते ध्मायमानानां धातूनां हि यथा मलाः ।
तथेन्द्रियाणां दह्यन्ते दोषाः प्राणस्य निग्रहात् ॥ ६.७१॥ dahyante dhmāyamānānāṁ dhātūnāṁ hi yathā malāḥ |
tathendriyāṇāṁ dahyante doṣāḥ prāṇasya nigrahāt || 6.71|| As impurities burn away in metals being refined through heat, likewise, defects of the sense organs are consumed when the life force is restrained.

title: Verse 6.72
content:
प्राणायामैर्दहेद्दोषान् धारणाभिश्च किल्बिषम् ।
प्रत्याहारेण संसर्गान् ध्यानेनानीश्वरान् गुणान् ॥ ६.७२॥ prāṇāyāmair dahed doṣān dhāraṇābhiś ca kilbiṣam |
pratyāhāreṇa saṃsargān dhyānenānīśvarān guṇān || 6.72|| Through prāṇāyāma, burn away impurities; through dhāraṇā, dissolve karmic entanglements. Through pratyāhāra, withdraw from misaligned associations; through dhyāna, transcend non-divine qualities.

title: Verse 6.73
content:
उच्चावचेषु भूतेषु दुर्ज्ञेयामकृतात्मभिः ।
ध्यानयोगेन सम्पश्येद्गतिमस्यान्तरात्मनः ॥ ६.७३॥ uccāvaceṣu bhūteṣu durjñeyāmakṛtātmabhiḥ | dhyānayogena sampśyedgatimasyāntarātmanaḥ || 6.73|| Among beings high and low, those whose inner selves remain unawakened perceive the movement of the soul within only through the perfected state of meditation.

title: Verse 6.74
content:
सम्यग्दर्शनसम्पन्नः कर्मभिर्न निबध्यते ।
दर्शनेन विहीनस्तु संसारं प्रतिपद्यते ॥ ६.७४॥ samyaṅdarśanasampannaḥ karmabhir na nibadhyate |
darśanena vihīnas tu saṃsāraṃ pratipadyate || 6.74|| One who is established in Right Vision is not bound by actions; but one devoid of Vision enters into worldly existence.

title: Verse 6.75
content:
अहिंसयेन्द्रियासङ्गैर्वैदिकैश्चैव कर्मभिः ।
तपसश्चरणैश्चौग्रैः साधयन्तीह तत्पदम् ॥ ६.७५॥ ahiṃsayendriyāsaṅgair vaidikaiś caiva karmabhiḥ |
tapasaḥ caraṇaiś caugraiḥ sādhayantīha tatpadam || 6.75|| Through non-violence, detachment of the senses, Vedic actions alone, and by rigorous observance of austerities and disciplines, one attains that Supreme State here.

title: Verse 6.76
content:
अस्थिस्थूणं स्नायुयुतं मांसशोणितलेपनम् ।
चर्मावनद्धं दुर्गन्धि पूर्णं मूत्रपुरीषयोः ॥ ६.७६॥ asthisthūṇaṃ snāyuyutaṃ māṃsaśoṇitalēpanam |
charmāvanaddhaṃ durgandhi pūrṇaṃ mūtrapurīṣayōḥ || 6.76|| The body is a framework of bones, bound by sinews, smeared with flesh and blood; enclosed in skin, foul-smelling, filled with urine and feces.

title: Verse 6.77
content:
जराशोकसमाविष्टं रोगायतनमातुरम् ।
रजस्वलमनित्यं च भूतावासमिमं त्यजेत् ॥ ६.७ष॥ jarāśokasamāviṣṭaṃ rogāyatanamāturam |
rajasvalamanityaṃ ca bhūtāvāsamimaṃ tyajet || 6.77 || One must abandon a dwelling that is overtaken by old age, grief, disease, maternal distress, menstrual impurity, and impermanence — for it is no longer fit for sustaining dharmic life-force.

title: Verse 6.78
content:
नदीकूलं यथा वृक्षो वृक्षं वा शकुनिर्यथा ।
तथा त्यजन्निमं देहं कृच्छ्राद्ग्राहाद्विमुच्यते ॥ ६.७८॥ nadīkūlaṁ yathā vṛkṣo vṛkṣaṁ vā śakuniryathā | tathā tyajannimaṁ dehaṁ kṛcchrādgrāhādvimucyate || 6.78|| Just as a tree on the riverbank or a bird upon a tree abandons its prior position when circumstances shift, so too must one release this body when it no longer serves the evolutionary completion of dharma.

title: Verse 6.79
content:
प्रियेषु स्वेषु सुकृतमप्रियेषु च दुष्कृतम् ।
विसृज्य ध्यानयोगेन ब्रह्माभ्येति सनातनम् ॥ ६.७९॥ priyeṣu sveṣu sukṛtamapriyeṣu ca duṣkṛtam |
visṛjya dhyānayogena brahmābhyeti sanātanam || 6.79|| One who has abandoned all actions—righteous in what is dear and unrighteous in what is not dear—and through the Yoga of Meditation attains the Eternal Brahman, becomes That alone.

title: Verse 6.80
content: यदा भावेन भवति सर्वभावेषु निःस्पृहः । तदा सुखमवाप्नोति प्रेत्य चैह च शाश्वतम् ॥ ६.८०॥ yadā bhāvena bhavati sarvabhāveṣu niḥspṛhaḥ | tadā sukhamavāpnoti pretya caiha ca śāśvatam || 6.80|| When one dwells in Beingness without craving for any becoming, then one attains eternal bliss both in this life and hereafter.

title: Verse 6.81
content:
अनेन विधिना सर्वांस्त्यक्त्वा सङ्गान् शनैः शनैः ।
सर्वद्वन्द्वविनिर्मुक्तो ब्रह्मण्येवावतिष्ठते ॥ ६.८१॥ anena vidhinā sarvāṃs tyaktvā saṅgān śanaiḥ śanaiḥ |
sarva-dvandva-vinirmukto brahmaṇy evāvatiṣṭhate || 6.81|| By this method, gradually abandoning all attachments, one becomes free from all dualities and establishes oneself in Brahman.

title: Verse 6.82
content:
ध्यानिकं सर्वमेवैतद्यदेतदभिशब्दितम् ।
न ह्यनध्यात्मवित्कश्चित्क्रियाफलमुपाश्नुते ॥ ६.८२॥ dhyānikaṃ sarvam evaitad yad etad abhiśabditam |
na hy anadhātmavit kaścit kriyāphalam upāśnute || 6.82|| All action that is designated and performed originates in meditative cognition; no one devoid of inner awareness ever attains the fruit of any action.

title: Verse 6.83
content:
अधियज्ञं ब्रह्म जपेदाधिदैविकमेव च ।
आध्यात्मिकं च सततं वेदान्ताभिहितं च यत् ॥ ६.८३॥ adhiyajñaṃ brahma japēd ādhidaivikam ēva ca |
ādhyātmikaṃ ca satataṃ vēdāntābhihitaṃ ca yat || 6.83|| One shall constantly recite the Brahman that presides over sacrifice, as also that which is divine in the Vedas, and that which is declared in the Upanishads as pertaining to the Self.

title: Verse 6.84
content:
इदं शरणमज्ञानामिदमेव विजानताम् ।
इदमन्विच्छतां स्वर्गमिदमानन्त्यमिच्छताम् ॥ ६.८४॥ Idaṃ śaraṇam ajñānām idam eva vijānatām |
Idam anvichchatāṃ svargam idam ānantityam ichchatām || 6.84|| This refuge is for those who lack knowledge; this alone is for those who know. This path leads seekers toward heaven; this is for those desiring immortality.

title: Verse 6.85
content:
अनेन क्रमयोगेन परिव्रजति यो द्विजः ।
स विधूयैह पाप्मानं परं ब्रह्माधिगच्छति ॥ ६.८५॥ anena kramayogena parivrajati yo dvijaḥ |
sa vidhūyaiha pāpmānaṃ paraṃ brahmādhigacchati || 6.85|| The twice-born one who journeys in accordance with this ordered discipline casts off here all sinfulness and attains the Supreme Brahman.

title: Verse 6.86
content:
एष धर्मोऽनुशिष्टो वो यतीनां नियतात्मनाम् ।
वेदसंन्यासिकानां तु कर्मयोगं निबोधत ॥ ६.८६॥ eṣa dharmo'nuśiṣṭo vo yatīnāṁ niyatātmanām |
vedasaṁnyāsikānāṁ tu karmayogaṁ nibodhata || 6.86|| This Dharma has been instructed for those who are self-disciplined and restrained in their inner conduct; now understand the Yoga of Action specifically prescribed for Vedic renunciants.

title: Verse 6.87
content:
ब्रह्मचारी गृहस्थश्च वानप्रस्थो यतिस्तथा ।
एते गृहस्थप्रभवाश्चत्वारः पृथगाश्रमाः ॥ ६.८७॥ brahmacārī gṛhasthaśca vānaprastho yatistathā |
ete gṛhasthaprabhavāścatvāraḥ pṛthagāśramāḥ || 6.87|| The four distinct orders of life—celibate student, householder, forest dweller, and renunciate—are all rooted in and emerge from the householder stage as foundational source.

title: Verse 6.88
content:
सर्वेऽपि क्रमशस्त्वेते यथाशास्त्रं निषेविताः ।
यथोक्तकारिणं विप्रं नयन्ति परमां गतिम् ॥ ६.८८॥ sarve'pi kramaśastvethe yathāśāstraṃ niṣevitāḥ |
yathoktakāriṇaṃ vipraṃ nayanti paramāṃ gatim || 6.88|| All beings, in their ordered sequence, when properly engaged according to scripture, lead the Brahmin who acts as instructed toward the Supreme Goal.

title: Verse 6.89
content: सर्वेषामपि चैतेषां वेदस्मृतिविधानतः । वेदश्रुतिविधानतः गृहस्थ उच्यते श्रेष्ठः स त्रीनेतान् बिभर्ति हि ॥ ६.८९॥ sarveṣām api cait eṣāṁ veda-smṛti-vidhānataḥ | veda-śruti-vidhānataḥ gṛhastha ucyate śreṣṭhaḥ sa trīn etān bibharti hi || 6.89|| Among all these, the householder who acts according to the injunctions of the Vedas and Smritis, and in accordance with Vedic Śrutis, is declared superior; he sustains the threefold path of dharma.

title: Verse 6.90
content:
यथा नदीनदाः सर्वे सागरे यान्ति संस्थितिम् ।
तथैवाश्रमिणः सर्वे गृहस्थे यान्ति संस्थितिम् ॥ ६.९०॥ yathā nadīnadāḥ sarve sāgare yānti saṃsthitim |
tathaivāśramiṇaḥ sarve gṛhasthe yānti saṃsthitim || 6.90 || Just as all rivers and streams ultimately merge into the ocean and find their settled state, likewise all stages of life culminate in the householder stage as the foundational basis of societal dharma.

title: Verse 6.91
content:
चतुर्भिरपि चैवैतैर्नित्यमाश्रमिभिर्द्विजैः ।
दशलक्षणको धर्मः सेवितव्यः प्रयत्नतः ॥ ६.९१॥ caturbhir api caivaitair nityam āśramibhir dvijaiḥ | daśalakṣaṇako dharmaḥ sevitavyaḥ prayatnataḥ || 6.91|| By all four varnas and ashramis, especially the twice-born, the ten-lakshana Dharma must be served with dedicated effort.

title: Verse 6.92
content:
धृतिः क्षमा दमोऽस्तेयं शौचमिन्द्रियनिग्रहः ।
धीर्विद्या सत्यमक्रोधो दशकं धर्मलक्षणम् ॥ ६.९२॥ dhṛtiḥ kṣamā damo 'steyaṃ śaucam indriyanigrahaḥ |
dhīr vidyā satyam akrodho daśakaṃ dharmalakṣaṇam || 6.92|| Firmness, forgiveness, self-restraint, non-stealing, purity, control of the senses, discernment, knowledge, truthfulness, and absence of anger—these ten constitute the defining marks of Dharma.

title: Verse 6.93
content:
दश लक्षणानि धर्मस्य ये विप्राः समधीयते ।
अधीत्य चानुवर्तन्ते ते यान्ति परमां गतिम् ॥ ६.९३॥ daśa lakṣaṇāni dharmasya ye viprāḥ samadhīyate |
adhītya cānuvartante te yānti paramāṃ gatim || 6.93|| Those Brahmins who study and embody the ten characteristics of Dharma attain the Supreme Goal.

title: Verse 6.94
content:
दशलक्षणकं धर्ममनुतिष्ठन् समाहितः ।
वेदान्तं विधिवत्श्रुत्वा संन्यसेदनृणो द्विजः ॥ ६.९४॥ daśalakṣaṇakaṃ dharmamanutiṣṭhan samāhitaḥ |
vedāntaṃ vidhivaśrutyā sannyasedanṛṇo dvijaḥ || 6.94|| A twice-born individual, having observed the ten characteristics of Dharma with专注 intent, and having properly listened to the Vedanta, becomes free from all debts and eligible for renunciation.

title: Verse 6.95
content:
संन्यस्य सर्वकर्माणि कर्मदोषानपानुदन् ।
नियतो वेदमभ्यस्य पुत्रैश्वर्ये सुखं वसेत् ॥ ६.९५॥ saṃnasya sarvakarmāṇi karmadoṣānapānudan .
niyato vedamabhyasya putraiśvare sukhaṃ vaset .. 6.95 .. One who has renounced all actions and purified oneself of the defects of action, being disciplined in Vedic study, resides in sovereignty over progeny with bliss.

title: Verse 6.96
content:
एवं संन्यस्य कर्माणि स्वकार्यपरमोऽस्पृहः ।
संन्यासेनापहत्यैनः प्राप्नोति परमं गतिम् ॥ ६.९६॥ evaṁ saṁnasya karmāṇi svakāryaparamo'spṛhaḥ |
saṁnyāsenāpahatyainaḥ prāpnoti paramaṁ gatim || 6.96|| Thus having renounced actions, without desire and devoted to one's own duty, one attains the Supreme Goal through renunciation.

title: Verse 6.97
content:
एष वोऽभिहितो धर्मो ब्राह्मणस्य चतुर्विधः ।
पुण्योऽक्षयफलः प्रेत्य राज्ञां धर्मं निबोधत ॥ ६.९७॥ eṣa vo'bhito dharmo brāhmaṇasya caturvidhaḥ |
puṇyo'kṣayaphalaḥ pretya rājñāṃ dharmaṃ nibodhata || 6.97|| This fourfold Dharma has been declared for the Brahmin; it is meritorious, bearing imperishable fruit in the afterlife. Now understand the Dharma of Kings.

title: Verse 7.1
content:
अध्याय ७

राजधर्मान् प्रवक्ष्यामि यथावृत्तो भवेन्नृपः ।
सम्भवश्च यथा तस्य सिद्धिश्च परमा यथा ॥ ७.१॥ adhyāya 7

rājadharman pravakṣyāmi yathāvṛtto bhaven nṛpaḥ |
sambhavaś ca yathā tasya siddhiś ca paramā yathā || 7.1|| I shall now declare the Dharma of Kingship, by which a ruler conducts himself in accordance with his true nature, thereby ensuring his rightful emergence and ultimate establishment in Supreme Success.

title: Verse 7.2
content:
ब्राह्मं प्राप्तेन संस्कारं क्षत्रियेण यथाविधि ।
सर्वस्यास्य यथान्यायं कर्तव्यं परिरक्षणम् ॥ ७.२॥ brāhmaṃ prāptena saṃskāraṃ kṣatriyeṇa yathāvidhi |
sarvasyāsya yathānyāyaṃ kartavyaṃ parirakṣaṇam || 7.2|| One who has received the Brahmic initiation must be protected in accordance with the Kshatriya's duty; all beings are to be safeguarded righteously according to their capacity and station.

title: Verse 7.3
content:
अराजके हि लोकेऽस्मिन् सर्वतो विद्रुतो भयात् ।
रक्षार्थमस्य सर्वस्य राजानमसृजत्प्रभुः ॥ ७.३॥ arājake hi loke 'smin sarvato vidruto bhayāt |
rakṣārtham asya sarvasya rājānam asṛjat prabhuḥ || 7.3|| In a state devoid of governance, all beings are scattered in fear; therefore, the Lord established the King for the protection of all.

title: Verse 7.4
content:
इन्द्रानिलयमार्काणामग्नेश्च वरुणस्य च ।
चन्द्रवित्तेशयोश्चैव मात्रा निर्हृत्य शाश्वतीः ॥ ७.४॥ indrānilayamārkāṇām agneśca varuṇasya ca |
candravitteśayoścaiva mātrā nirhṛtya śāśvatīḥ || 7.4|| The eternal measures of Indra, Air, Sun, Fire, Varuna, Moon, and Wealth—these foundational capacities—are to be restored in their pure measure by removing distortion.

title: Verse 7.5
content:
यस्मादेषां सुरेन्द्राणां मात्राभ्यो निर्मितो नृपः ।
तस्मादभिभवत्येष सर्वभूतानि तेजसा ॥ ७.५॥ yasmsd esham surendranam matrabhyo nirmrito nripah | tasmad abhibhavaty esha sarvabhutani tejasā || 7.5|| Since this king was created directly from the maternal essence of these celestial sovereigns, he therefore surpasses all beings in brilliance and authority.

title: Verse 7.6
content:
तपत्यादित्यवच्चैष चक्षूंषि च मनांसि च ।
न चैनं भुवि शक्नोति कश्चिदप्यभिवीक्षितुम् ॥ ७.६॥ tapaty ādityavac chaiṣa cakṣūṃṣi ca manāṃsi ca |
na cainaṃ bhuvi śaknoti kaścid apy abhivīkṣitum || 7.6|| Like the Sun that illuminates all yet remains untouched by any eye or mind, so too the Self of the Witness stands beyond perception while enabling all cognition.

title: Verse 7.7
content:
सोऽग्निर्भवति वायुश्च सोऽर्कः सोमः स धर्मराट् ।
स कुबेरः स वरुणः स महेन्द्रः प्रभावतः ॥ ७.७॥ स चैन्द्रः स्वप्रभावतः so 'gnir bhavati vāyuś ca so 'rkaḥ somaḥ sa dharmarāṭ |
sa kuberaḥ sa varuṇaḥ sa mahendraḥ prabhāvataḥ || 7.7|| sa caindraḥ svaprabhāvataḥ He becomes Fire; He becomes Wind; He becomes the Sun; He becomes the Moon; He becomes the Sovereign of Dharma. He becomes Kubera; He becomes Varuna; He becomes Mahendra by His own potency. He also becomes Indra by His own power.

title: Verse 7.8
content:
बालोऽपि नावमान्तव्यो मनुष्य इति भूमिपः ।
महती देवता ह्येषा नररूपेण तिष्ठति ॥ ७.८॥ bālo'pi nāvamāntavyo manuṣya iti bhūmipaḥ |
mahatī devatā hyeṣā nararūpeṇa tiṣṭhati || 7.8|| Even a child must not be disrespected, for the human being is divine; this great divinity stands in human form.

title: Verse 7.9
content:
