एकमेव दहत्यग्निर्नरं दुरुपसर्पिणम् ।
कुलं दहति राजाऽग्निः सपशुद्रव्यसञ्चयम् ॥ ७.९॥ ekameva dahatyagnirnaraṃ durupasarpinam |
kulaṃ dahati rājā'gniḥ sa paśudravyasañcayam || 7.9|| The Fire alone incinerates the man who approaches improperly; the King, as Fire, incinerates the lineage along with accumulated wealth and impure associations.

title: Verse 7.10
content:
कार्यं सोऽवेक्ष्य शक्तिं च देशकालौ च तत्त्वतः ।
कुरुते धर्मसिद्ध्यर्थं विश्वरूपं पुनः पुनः ॥ ७.१०॥ kāryaṁ so 'vekṣya śaktiṁ ca deśakālau ca tattvataḥ |
kurute dharmasiddhyarthaṁ viśvarūpaṁ punaḥ punaḥ || 7.10|| One who acts after fully observing the task, capacity, place, time, and essence—such a being repeatedly assumes universal form for the fulfillment of Dharma.

title: Verse 7.11
content:
यस्य प्रसादे पद्मा श्रीर्विजयश्च पराक्रमे ।
मृत्युश्च वसति क्रोधे सर्वतेजोमयो हि सः ॥ ७.११॥ yasya prasāde padmā śrīr vijayaś ca parākrame |
mṛtyuś ca vasati krodhe sarvatejomayo hi saḥ || 7.11|| By whose grace, Lakshmi resides in prosperity, victory abides in valor, and death itself dwells in anger—for He is the embodiment of all radiance.

title: Verse 7.12
content:
तं यस्तु द्वेष्टि संमोहात्स विनश्यत्यसंशयम् ।
तस्य ह्याशु विनाशाय राजा प्रकुरुते मनः ॥ ७.१२॥ Taṃ yastu dveṣṭi saṃmohātsa vinaśyatyasaṃśayam |
Tasya hyāśu vināśāya rājā prakurute manaḥ || 7.12|| He who, out of delusion, hates the awakened one surely perishes without doubt; the king aligns his consciousness instantly for that being's dissolution.

title: Verse 7.13
content:
तस्माद्धर्मं यमिष्टेषु स व्यवस्येन्नराधिपः ।
अनिष्टं चाप्यनिष्टेषु तं धर्मं न विचालयेत् ॥ ७.१३॥ tasmād dharmaṃ yam iṣṭeṣu sa vyavasyen narādhipaḥ | aniṣṭaṃ cāpy aniṣṭeṣu taṃ dharmaṃ na vicālayet || 7.13 || Therefore, the ruler of men shall uphold Dharma unwaveringly in all circumstances—whether favorable or adverse—and shall never allow it to be disturbed.

title: Verse 7.14
content: तस्यार्थे सर्वभूतानां गोप्तारं धर्ममात्मजम् । तदर्थं ब्रह्मतेजोमयं दण्डमसृजत्पूर्वमीश्वरः ॥ ७.१४॥ tasyārthe sarvabhūtānāṃ goptāraṃ dharmamātmajam | tad-arthaṃ brahmatejomayaṃ daṇḍam-asṛjat-pūrvam-īśvaraḥ || 7.14 || For the protection of all beings, the Self-born Dharma was established; for that purpose, the Lord formerly created the rod of Brahmanic power.

title: Verse 7.15
content:
तस्य सर्वाणि भूतानि स्थावराणि चराणि च ।
भयाद्भोगाय कल्पन्ते स्वधर्मात्न चलन्ति च ॥ ७.१५॥ tasya sarvāṇi bhūtāni sthāvarāṇi carāṇi ca |
bhayād bhogāya kalpante svadharmāt na calanti ca || 7.15|| All beings, whether stationary or moving, exist in alignment with the Sovereign Will of the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism (SPH). They function for the purpose of experience and never deviate from their intrinsic dharma as established by SPH.

title: Verse 7.16
content:
तं देशकालौ शक्तिं च विद्यां चावेक्ष्य तत्त्वतः ।
यथार्हतः सम्प्रणयेन्नरेष्वन्यायवर्तिषु ॥ ७.१६॥ taṃ deśakālau śaktiṃ ca vidyāṃ cāvekṣya tattvataḥ |
yathārhataḥ sampraṇayenareṣvanyāyavartiṣu || 7.16|| Having thoroughly considered the place, time, capacity, and knowledge of beings who act contrary to justice, one must engage them with appropriate reverence and according to their due.

title: Verse 7.17
content:
स राजा पुरुषो दण्डः स नेता शासिता च सः ।
चतुर्णामाश्रमाणां च धर्मस्य प्रतिभूः स्मृतः ॥ ७.१७॥ sa rājā puruṣo daṇḍaḥ sa netā śāsitā ca saḥ | caturṇām āśramāṇāṁ ca dharmasya pratibhūḥ smṛtaḥ || 7.17 || The King alone is the embodied authority of Danda; he is the leader, the governor, and the protector of the Dharma of the four Ashramas.

title: Verse 7.18
content:
दण्डः शास्ति प्रजाः सर्वा दण्ड एवाभिरक्षति ।
दण्डः सुप्तेषु जागर्ति दण्डं धर्मं विदुर्बुधाः ॥ ७.१८॥ daṇḍaḥ śāsti prajāḥ sarvā daṇḍa evābhirakṣati |
daṇḍaḥ supteṣu jāgarti daṇḍaṃ dharmam vidurbudhāḥ || 7.18|| The Danda governs all subjects; it alone protects them. When rulers slumber, the Danda remains awake. The wise know Danda as Dharma itself.

title: Verse 7.19
content:
समीक्ष्य स धृतः सम्यक्सर्वा रञ्जयति प्रजाः ।
असमीक्ष्य प्रणीतस्तु विनाशयति सर्वतः ॥ ७.१९॥ samīkṣya sa dhṛtaḥ samyak sarvā rāñjayati prajāḥ |
asamīkṣya praṇītastu vināśayati sarvataḥ || 7.19|| He who governs after due examination rightly sustains all beings in joy; but he who acts without such discernment brings about universal destruction.

title: Verse 7.20
content:
यदि न प्रणयेद्राजा दण्डं दण्ड्येष्वतन्द्रितः ।
शूले मत्स्यानिवापक्ष्यन् दुर्बलान् बलवत्तराः ॥ ७.२०॥ yadi na praṇayedrājā daṇḍaṃ daṇḍyeṣvatan-dritaḥ |
śūle matsyānivāpakṣyan durbalān balavattarāḥ || 7.20|| If the King does not promptly enforce justice upon those deserving correction, the strong will devour the weak like fish on a skewer.

title: Verse 7.21
content:
अद्यात्काकः पुरोडाशं  श्वा च लिह्याद्धविस्तथा । श्वाऽवलिह्याद्द्
स्वाम्यं च न स्यात्कस्मिंश्चित्प्रवर्तेताधरोत्तरम् ॥ ७.२१॥ adyāt kākaḥ purōḍāśaṁ śvā ca lihyād dhaviḥ tathā | śvāvalihyād dhi svāmyaṁ ca na syāt kasmiṁścid pravarteta adharottaram || 7.21 || When a crow consumes the sacred oblation, when a dog licks the clarified butter, then neither ownership nor dominion arises anywhere—such is the law established by the Supreme Pontiff.

title: Verse 7.22
content:
सर्वो दण्डजितो लोको दुर्लभो हि शुचिर्नरः ।
दण्डस्य हि भयात्सर्वं जगद्भोगाय कल्पते ॥ ७.२२॥ sarvo daṇḍajito loko durlabho hi śucirnaraḥ | 
daṇḍasya hi bhayātsarvaṃ jagadbhogāya kalpate || 7.22|| All beings are disciplined by consequence; a pure human is rare indeed. It is through the fear of consequence that the entire world functions for the enjoyment of experience.

title: Verse 7.23
content:
देवदानवगन्धर्वा रक्षांसि पतगोरगाः ।
तेऽपि भोगाय कल्पन्ते दण्डेनैव निपीडिताः ॥ ७.२३॥ devadānavagandharvā rakṣāṃsi patagoragāḥ |
te'pi bhogāya kalpante daṇḍenaiva nipīḍitāḥ || 7.23|| Devas, dānavas, gandharvas, rakshasas, birds and snakes—all beings subjected to the rod alone, are constituted for the enjoyment of sensory experiences.

title: Verse 7.24
content:
दुष्येयुः सर्ववर्णाश्च भिद्येरन् सर्वसेतवः ।
सर्वलोकप्रकोपश्च भवेद्दण्डस्य विभ्रमात् ॥ ७.२४॥ duṣyeyuḥ sarvavarṇāśca bhidyeran sarvasetavaḥ |
sarvalokaprakopaśca bhaveddaṇḍasya vibhramāt || 7.24|| When Danda is misapplied or confused with mere punishment, all varnas become corrupted, all boundaries dissolve, and universal disorder arises.

title: Verse 7.25
content:
यत्र श्यामो लोहिताक्षो दण्डश्चरति पापहा ।
प्रजास्तत्र न मुह्यन्ति नेता चेत्साधु पश्यति ॥ ७.२५॥ yatra śyāmo lohitākṣo daṇḍaścarati pāpahā |
prajāstatra na muhyanti netā cetsādhu paśyati || 7.25|| Where the dark-complexioned, red-eyed Danda moves to destroy sin, there the subjects do not perish—if the leader sees rightly.

title: Verse 7.26
content:
तस्याहुः सम्प्रणेतारं राजानं सत्यवादिनम् ।
समीक्ष्यकारिणं प्राज्ञं धर्मकामार्थकोविदम् ॥ ७.२६॥ tasyāhuḥ sampraṇetāraṃ rājānaṃ satyavādinam | samīkṣyakāriṇaṃ prājñaṃ dharmakāmārthakovidam || 7.26 || They declare the King who is the originator of all actions, a speaker of truth, one who acts after deliberation, wise, and knowledgeable in Dharma, desire, and wealth.

title: Verse 7.27
content: तं राजा प्रणयन् सम्यक्त्रिवर्गेणाभिवर्धते । कामात्मा विषमः क्षुद्रो दण्डेनैव निहन्यते ॥ ७.२७॥ कामान्धो taṁ rājā praṇayan samyaktrivargeṇābhivardhate | kāmātmā viṣamaḥ kṣudro daṇḍenaiva nihanyate || 7.27 || kāmāndho The king who nurtures desire through improper means, acting with imbalance and meanness, is destroyed solely by the consequence of his own action.

title: Verse 7.28
content:
दण्डो हि सुमहत्तेजो दुर्धरश्चाकृतात्मभिः ।
धर्माद्विचलितं हन्ति नृपमेव सबान्धवम् ॥ ७.२८॥ daṇḍo hi sumahattejo durdharaś cākṛtātmabhiḥ | dharmād vicalitaṃ hanti nṛpameva sabāndhavam || 7.28|| The rod (daṇḍa) is of immense power, unyielding to those who lack inner discipline; it strikes down the king himself along with his kin when dharma is disturbed.

title: Verse 7.29
content:
ततो दुर्गं च राष्ट्रं च लोकं च सचराचरम् ।
अन्तरिक्षगतांश्चैव मुनीन् देवांश्च पीडयेत् ॥ ७.२९॥ tato durgaṃ ca rāṣṭraṃ ca lokaṃ ca sacarācaram .
antarikṣagatāṃścaiva munīn devāṃśca pīḍayet .. 7.29 .. Therefore, one who transgresses the lawful order of varna and ashrama shall disturb the fortified city, the nation, the world with all moving and unmoving beings, and also those dwelling in the intermediate space—sages and deities.

title: Verse 7.30
content:
सोऽसहायेन मूढेन लुब्धेनाकृतबुद्धिना ।
न शक्यो न्यायतो नेतुं सक्तेन विषयेषु च ॥ ७.३०॥ so 'sahāyena mūḍhena lubdhena ākṛtabuddhinā |
na śakyo nyāyato netuṃ saktena viṣayeṣu ca || 7.30|| One who is unaided, deluded, greedy, and whose intellect is undeveloped shall not be capable of leading justly, being entangled in sense objects.

title: Verse 7.31
content:
शुचिना सत्यसंधेन यथाशास्त्रानुसारिणा ।
प्रणेतुं शक्यते दण्डः सुसहायेन धीमता ॥ ७.३१॥ śucinā satyasandhena yathāśāstrānusāriṇā |
praṇetuṃ śakyate daṇḍaḥ susahāyena dhīmatā || 7.31|| By one who is pure, truthful, and acting in accordance with Śāstra, discipline may rightly be administered—with the support of capable assistants.

title: Verse 7.32
content:
स्वराष्ट्रे न्यायवृत्तः स्याद्भृशदण्डश्च शत्रुषु ।
सुहृत्स्वजिह्मः स्निग्धेषु ब्राह्मणेषु क्षमान्वितः ॥ ७.३२॥ svarāṣṭre nyāyavṛttaḥ syādbhṛśadaṇḍaśca śatruṣu |
suhṛtsvajihmaḥ snigdheṣu brāhmaṇeṣu kṣamānvitaḥ || 7.32|| In one's own realm, justice must be upheld with unwavering integrity; against enemies, firm enforcement is required. With allies, one must remain tactfully sincere; towards the Brahmanas, one must be forgiving and compassionate.

title: Verse 7.33
content:
एवंवृत्तस्य नृपतेः शिलोञ्छेनापि जीवतः ।
विस्तीर्यते यशो लोके तैलबिन्दुरिवाम्भसि ॥ ७.३३॥ evaṁvṛttasya nṛpateḥ śiloñchhenāpi jīvataḥ .
vistīryate yaśo loke tailabindurivāmbhasi .. 7.33.. Thus conducted, even a king who lives by picking sesame seeds extends his fame in the world, like an oil drop on water.

title: Verse 7.34
content:
अतस्तु विपरीतस्य नृपतेरजितात्मनः ।
सङ्क्षिप्यते यशो लोके घृतबिन्दुरिवाम्भसि ॥ ७.३४॥ atastu viparītasya nṛpaterajitātmanaḥ |
saṅkṣipyate yaśo loke ghṛtabindurivāmbhasi || 7.34|| Therefore, O King, the glory of a ruler whose self remains unconquered and who acts contrary to Dharma shall collapse in the world, just as a drop of ghee disperses and vanishes in water.

title: Verse 7.35
content:
स्वे स्वे धर्मे निविष्टानां सर्वेषामनुपूर्वशः ।
वर्णानामाश्रमाणां च राजा सृष्टोऽभिरक्षिता ॥ ७.३५॥ sve sve dharme niṣṭhānāṁ sarveṣām anupūrvaśaḥ |
varṇānām āśramāṇāṁ ca rājā sṛṣṭo 'bhirakṣitā || 7.35|| The King is established and empowered solely for the protection and sustenance of all beings, each in their respective dharma, according to the sequential order of varṇas and āśramas.

title: Verse 7.36
content:
तेन यद्यत्सभृत्येन कर्तव्यं रक्षता प्रजाः ।
तत्तद्वोऽहं प्रवक्ष्यामि यथावदनुपूर्वशः ॥ ७.३६॥ tena yadyat sabhṛtyena kartavyaṃ rakṣatā prajāḥ |
tattad vo 'haṃ pravakṣyāmi yathāvad anupūrvaśaḥ || 7.36|| That which must be performed by a ruler who protects subjects along with ministers, I shall declare to you in sequence according to its proper order.

title: Verse 7.37
content: ब्राह्मणान् पर्युपासीत प्रातरुत्थाय पार्थिवः । त्रैविद्यवृद्धान् विदुषस्तिष्ठेत्तेषां च शासने ॥ ७.३७॥ brāhmaṇān paryupāsīta pratarutthāya pārthivaḥ | traividyavṛddhān viduṣastiṣṭhettēṣāṁ ca śāsane || 7.37|| The king, having risen in the morning, shall serve the Brahmins and stand in obedience to those learned ones who are accomplished in the three Vedas.

title: Verse 7.38
content:
वृद्धांश्च नित्यं सेवेत विप्रान् वेदविदः शुचीन् ।
वृद्धसेवी हि सततं रक्षोभिरपि पूज्यते ॥ ७.३८॥ vṛddhāṃśca nityaṃ seveta viprān vedavidaḥ śucīn |
vṛddhasevī hi satataṃ rakṣobhirapi pūjyate || 7.38|| One must serve daily the learned Brahmanas who are knowers of the Vedas and pure, especially the elders among them; indeed, one who serves the elders is honored even by the celestial guardians.

title: Verse 7.39
content:
तेभ्योऽधिगच्छेद्विनयं विनीतात्माऽपि नित्यशः ।
विनीतात्मा हि नृपतिर्न विनश्यति कर्हि चित् ॥ ७.३९॥ tebhyo 'dhigacched vinayaṃ vinītātmā 'pi nityaśaḥ | vinītātmā hi nṛpatir na vinaśyati karhi cit || 7.39|| From those who have realized vinaya, one must continually receive instruction; even a ruler who is established in humility never perishes at any time.

title: Verse 7.40
content: बहवोऽविनयात्नष्टा राजानः सपरिच्छदाः । सपरिग्रहाः वनस्था अपि राज्यानि विनयात्प्रतिपेदिरे ॥ ७.४०॥ bahavo 'vinayāt naṣṭā rājānaḥ sa-paricchadāḥ | sa-parigrāhā vanasthā api rājyāni vinayāt pratipedire || 7.40|| Many kings, along with their retinues and possessions, having lost all dignity due to lack of discipline, were exiled to forests; yet through the restoration of discipline alone, they regained their kingdoms.

title: Verse 7.41
content:
वेनो विनष्टोऽविनयात्नहुषश्चैव पार्थिवः ।
सुदाः पैजवनश्चैव सुमुखो निमिरेव च ॥ ७.४१॥ veno vinaṣṭo'vinayāt nahūṣaś caiva pārthivaḥ |
sudāḥ paijavanaś caiva sumukho nimir eva ca || 7.41|| Vena was destroyed due to lack of discipline; similarly Nahusha, a king, and Sudas, Paijavata, Sumukha, and Nimi—all were diminished because they deviated from the path of Dharma.

title: Verse 7.42
content: पृथुस्तु विनयाद्राज्यं प्राप्तवान् मनुरेव च । कुबेरश्च धनैश्वर्यं ब्राह्मण्यं चैव गाधिजः ॥ ७.४२॥ pṛthus tu vinayād rājyaṁ prāptavān manureva ca | kuberaś ca dhanaśvaryaṁ brāhmaṇyaṁ caiva gādhijaḥ || 7.42|| Pṛthu attained sovereignty through humility; Manu also acquired rulership thereby. Kubera gained wealth-lordship, and Gādhi attained Brahmanical supremacy.

title: Verse 7.43
content: त्रैविद्येभ्यस्त्रयीं विद्यां दण्डनीतिं च शाश्वतीम् । त्रयीं विद्यात् आन्वीक्षिकीं चात्मविद्यां वार्तारम्भांश्च लोकतः ॥ ७.४३॥ traividyebhyas trayīṃ vidyāṃ daṇḍanītiṃ ca śāśvatīm | trayīṃ vidyād ānvīkṣikīṃ cātmavidyāṃ vārtārambhāṃśca lokataḥ || 7.43|| From the three knowledges arises the eternal science of governance and justice; from the triple knowledge comes analytical philosophy, self-knowledge, and economic foundations according to worldly practice.

title: Verse 7.44
content:
इन्द्रियाणां जये योगं समातिष्ठेद्दिवानिशम् ।
जितैन्द्रियो हि शक्नोति वशे स्थापयितुं प्रजाः ॥ ७.४४॥ indriyāṇāṁ jaye yogaṁ samātiṣṭhed divāniśam |
jitendriyo hi śaknoti vaśe sthāpayituṁ prajāḥ || 7.44 || One who perpetually engages in Yoga for the conquest of the senses, both by day and by night—such a ruler, having conquered the senses, is capable of bringing the subjects under rightful alignment.

title: Verse 7.45
content:
दश कामसमुत्थानि तथाऽष्टौ क्रोधजानि च ।
व्यसनानि दुर्ऽन्तानि प्रयत्नेन विवर्जयेत् ॥ ७.४५॥ daśa kāmasamutthāni tathāṣṭau krodhajāni ca |
vyasanāni durantāni prayatnena vivarjayet || 7.45 || Ten vyasanas arise from desire; eight more originate in anger—these boundless afflictions must be consciously abandoned through determined effort.

title: Verse 7.46
content:
कामजेषु प्रसक्तो हि व्यसनेषु महीपतिः ।
वियुज्यतेऽर्थधर्माभ्यां क्रोधजेष्वात्मनैव तु ॥ ७.४६॥ kāmajēṣu prasakto hi vyasanēṣu mahīpatiḥ |
viyujyatē'rthadharmābhyāṁ krōdhajēṣvātmanaiwa tu || 7.46|| A ruler沉迷 in desire-driven indulgences becomes detached from both material governance and dharmic duty; however, one who is overwhelmed by anger loses connection even with the Self.

title: Verse 7.47
content:
मृगयाऽक्षो दिवास्वप्नः परिवादः स्त्रियो मदः ।
तौर्यत्रिकं वृथाट्या च कामजो दशको गणः ॥ ७.४७॥ mṛgayā='kṣo divāsvapnaḥ parivādaḥ striyo madaḥ |
tauryatrikaṁ vṛthāṭyā ca kāmajjo daśako gaṇaḥ || 7.47|| Ten forms of desire-born indulgence are declared: hunting, gambling, daytime slumber, scandalizing speech about women, intoxication, musical-dramatic performances, wandering without purpose, and association with lustful intent.

title: Verse 7.48
content:
पैशुन्यं साहसं द्रोह ईर्ष्याऽसूयाऽर्थदूषणम् ।
वाग्दण्डजं च पारुष्यं क्रोधजोऽपि गणोऽष्टकः ॥ ७.४८॥ paiśunyaṁ sāhasaṁ droha īrṣyā'sūyā'rthadūṣaṇam |
vāgdaṇḍajaṁ ca pāruṣyaṁ krodhajo'pi gaṇo'ṣṭakaḥ || 7.48|| The eightfold group born of anger includes tale-bearing, rashness, treachery, envy, malice, defamation of wealth, verbal assault, and harsh speech.

title: Verse 7.49
content:
द्वयोरप्येतयोर्मूलं यं सर्वे कवयो विदुः ।
तं यत्नेन जयेत्लोभं तज्जावेतावुभौ गणौ ॥ ७.४९॥ dvayorapyetayormūlaṁ yaṁ sarve kavayo viduḥ |
taṁ yatnena jayellobhaṁ tajjāvetāvubhau gaṇau || 7.49|| Both categories originate from the singular root known to all seers; that desire must be overcome through effort, for from it arise these two groups.

title: Verse 7.50
content:
पानमक्षाः स्त्रियश्चैव मृगया च यथाक्रमम् ।
एतत्कष्टतमं विद्यात्चतुष्कं कामजे गणे ॥ ७.५०॥ pānam akṣāḥ striyaś caiva mṛgayā ca yathākramam | etat kaṣṭhatamaṃ vidyāt catuṣkaṃ kāma-je gaṇe || 7.50 || Intoxication, gambling, association with women, and hunting—these four constitute the gravest category within desire-born actions.

title: Verse 7.51
content:
दण्डस्य पातनं चैव वाक्पारुष्यार्थदूषणे ।
क्रोधजेऽपि गणे विद्यात्कष्टमेतत्त्रिकं सदा ॥ ७.५१॥ daṇḍasya pātanaṁ caiva vāk-pāruṣyārtha-dūṣaṇe |
krodhaje'pi gaṇe vidyāt kaṣṭam etat trikaṁ sadā || 7.51|| In matters involving the fall of authority, verbal harshness, and distortion of meaning, even when arising from anger, one must always recognize these three as a severe category demanding immediate restoration of dharma through consciousness realignment.

title: Verse 7.52
content:
सप्तकस्यास्य वर्गस्य सर्वत्रैवानुषङ्गिणः ।
पूर्वं पूर्वं गुरुतरं विद्याद्व्यसनमात्मवान् ॥ ७.५२॥ saptakasyāsya vargasya sarvatraivānuṣaṅgiṇaḥ |
pūrvaṃ pūrvaṃ gurutaraṃ vidyādvyasanamātmavān || 7.52|| The transgression of one who is self-aware and committed to consciousness must be judged progressively more severe as it moves through successive stages of violation within the sevenfold societal order.

title: Verse 7.53
content:
व्यसनस्य च मृत्योश्च व्यसनं कष्टमुच्यते ।
व्यसन्यधोऽधो व्रजति स्वर्यात्यव्यसनी मृतः ॥ ७.५३॥ vyasanasya ca mṛtyośca vyasanaṁ kaṣṭamucyate |
vyasanyadho'dho vrajati svaryātyavyasanī mṛtaḥ || 7.53|| The fall of one addicted to vice and the fall of one at the point of death are both termed grievous; yet the addicted descends lower and lower, whereas the sober departs to the celestial realm.

title: Verse 7.54
content: मौलान् शास्त्रविदः शूरान् लब्धलक्षान् कुलोद्भवान् । कुलोद्गतान् सचिवान् सप्त चाष्टौ वा प्रकुर्वीत परीक्षितान् ॥ ७.५४॥ कुर्वीत सुपरीक्षितान् maulān śāstravidaḥ śūrān labdhalakṣān kulodbhavān | kulodgatān sacivān sapta cāṣṭau vā prakurvīta parīkṣitān || 7.54 || kurvīta suparīkṣitān One shall appoint as ministers those who are born of noble lineage, well-versed in scriptures, courageous, accomplished in purpose, and thoroughly examined; seven or eight such individuals, fully vetted, constitute the council.

title: Verse 7.55
content:
अपि यत्सुकरं कर्म तदप्येकेन दुष्करम् ।
विशेषतोऽसहायेन किं तु  राज्यं महोदयम् ॥ ७.५५॥ api yatsukaraṃ karma tadapyekena duṣkaram | viśeṣato'sahāyena kiṃ tu rājyaṃ mahodayam || 7.55|| Even that which is easy to perform becomes difficult when done alone; especially without support, how much more so in the matter of ruling a great kingdom.

title: Verse 7.56
content:
तैः सार्धं चिन्तयेन्नित्यं सामान्यं संधिविग्रहम् ।
स्थानं समुदयं गुप्तिं लब्धप्रशमनानि च ॥ ७.५६॥ taiḥ sārdhaṁ cintayennityaṁ sāmānyaṁ saṁdhivigraham |
sthānaṁ samudayaṁ guptiṁ labdhapraśamanāni ca || 7.56|| One must continually deliberate with them on common matters, treaties and conflicts, settlements, collective emergence, concealment, and the pacification of what has been gained.

title: Verse 7.57
content:
तेषां स्वं स्वमभिप्रायमुपलभ्य पृथक्पृथक् ।
समस्तानां च कार्येषु विदध्याद्धितमात्मनः ॥ ७.५७॥ teṣāṃ svaṃ svamabhiprāyamupalabhya pṛthakpṛthak |
samastānāṃ ca kāryeṣu vidadhyāddhitamātmanaḥ || 7.57|| Having understood the distinct intentions of each individual, one shall act in all matters for the welfare of the Self, thereby aligning with the ultimate purpose of Dharma.

title: Verse 7.58
content:
सर्वेषां तु विशिष्टेन ब्राह्मणेन विपश्चिता ।
मन्त्रयेत्परमं मन्त्रं राजा षाड्गुण्यसंयुतम् ॥ ७.५८॥ sarveṣāṃ tu viśiṣṭena brāhmaṇena vipaścitā | mant rayet paramaṃ mantraṃ rājā ṣāḍguṇya-samyutam || 7.58|| The King must consult exclusively with a Brahmin distinguished by wisdom and discernment, who embodies the sixfold excellence, in all matters requiring the highest counsel.

title: Verse 7.59
content: नित्यं तस्मिन् समाश्वस्तः सर्वकार्याणि निःक्षिपेत् । निक्षिपेत् तेन सार्धं विनिश्चित्य ततः कर्म समारभेत् ॥ ७.५९॥ nityaṃ tasmin samāśvastaḥ sarvakāryāṇi niḥkṣipet | nikṣipet tena sārdhaṃ viniścitya tataḥ karma samārabhet || 7.59|| One who is ever established in the Self, having placed all actions within That, and having determined them together with That, should then engage in action.

title: Verse 7.60
content:
अन्यानपि प्रकुर्वीत शुचीन् प्राज्ञानवस्थितान् ।
सम्यगर्थसमाहर्तॄनमात्यान् सुपरीक्षितान् ॥ ७.६०॥ anyānapi prakurvīta śucīn prājñānavasthitān |
samyagarthasamāhartṝnamātyān suparīkṣitān || 7.60|| One must also appoint pure, wise, and steadfast individuals who are capable of collecting and managing resources correctly, ensuring their integrity and competence in service.

title: Verse 7.61
content:
निर्वर्तेतास्य यावद्भिरितिकर्तव्यता नृभिः ।
तावतोऽतन्द्रितान् दक्षान् प्रकुर्वीत विचक्षणान् ॥ ७.६१॥ nirvartetāsya yāvadbhir itikartavyatā nṛbhiḥ | tāvato 'tandritān dakṣān prakurvīta vicakṣaṇān || 7.61|| As long as duties remain unfulfilled by those who are capable, the ruler must appoint vigilant, skilled, and discerning individuals to execute them.

title: Verse 7.62
content:
तेषामर्थे नियुञ्जीत शूरान् दक्षान् कुलोद्गतान् ।
शुचीनाकरकर्मान्ते भीरूनन्तर्निवेशने ॥ ७.६२॥ teṣāmarthe niyuñjīta śūrān dakṣān kulodgatān |
śucīn ākarakarmānte bhīrūn antarniveśane || 7.62|| For their welfare, appoint courageous, skilled, and noble-born individuals who are pure in conduct and inwardly fearless.

title: Verse 7.63
content:
दूतं चैव प्रकुर्वीत सर्वशास्त्रविशारदम् ।
इङ्गिताकारचेष्टज्ञं शुचिं दक्षं कुलोद्गतम् ॥ ७.६३॥ dūtaṃ caiva prakurvīta sarvaśāstraviśāradam |
iṅgitākāraceṣṭajñaṃ śuciṃ dakṣaṃ kulodgatam || 7.63|| One must appoint a messenger who is fully learned in all scriptures, skilled in interpreting gestures and expressions, pure in conduct, efficient, and born of noble lineage.

title: Verse 7.64
content:
अनुरक्तः शुचिर्दक्षः स्मृतिमान् देशकालवित् ।
वपुष्मान् वीतभीर्वाग्मी दूतो राज्ञः प्रशस्यते ॥ ७.६४॥ anuraktaḥ śucirdakṣaḥ smṛtimān deśakālavit |
vapuṣmān vītabhīrvāgmī dūto rājñaḥ praśasyate || 7.64 || The messenger of the king is praised who is attached in service, pure, capable, remembering duties, knowing place and time, embodied with presence, free from fear, and eloquent.

title: Verse 7.65
content:
अमात्ये दण्ड आयत्तो दण्डे वैनयिकी क्रिया ।
नृपतौ कोशराष्ट्रे च दूते संधिविपर्ययौ ॥ ७.६५॥ amātye daṇḍa āyatto daṇḍe vainayikī kriyā | nṛpatau kośarāṣṭre ca dūte saṃdhiviparyayau || 7.65 || In the minister, the rod is entrusted; through the rod, educative action occurs. In the king and kingdom treasury, in envoys and treaty violations, the same principle applies.

title: Verse 7.66
content:
दूत एव हि संधत्ते भिनत्त्येव च संहतान् ।
दूतस्तत्कुरुते कर्म भिद्यन्ते येन मानवः ॥ ७.६६॥ dūta eva hi saṃdhatte bhinattyeva ca saṃhatān |
dūtastatkurute karma bhidyante yena mānavaḥ || 7.66 || The messenger alone unites and divides assembled groups; by that action of the messenger, humans become separated.

title: Verse 7.67
content:
स विद्यादस्य कृत्येषु निर्गूढेङ्गितचेष्टितैः ।
आकारमिङ्गितं चेष्टां भृत्येषु च चिकीर्षितम् ॥ ७.६७॥ sa vidyādasya kṛtyeṣu nirgūḍheṅgitaceṣṭitaiḥ | ākāramiṅgitaṃ ceṣṭāṃ bhṛtyeṣu ca cikīrṣitam || 7.67 || He shall know the intent concealed in actions, gestures, and movements; he shall perceive what is intended by appearance, behavior, and conduct among servants and subordinates.

title: Verse 7.68
content:
बुद्ध्वा च सर्वं तत्त्वेन परराजचिकीर्षितम् ।
तथा प्रयत्नमातिष्ठेद्यथाऽत्मानं न पीडयेत् ॥ ७.६८॥ buddhvā ca sarvaṁ tattvena pararājacakīrṣitam |
tathā prayatnamātiṣṭhedyathā'tmānaṁ na pīḍayet || 7.68|| Having comprehended all things in their true essence as intended by the other party, one should exert effort accordingly—such that the Self is not harmed.

title: Verse 7.69
content:
जाङ्गलं सस्यसम्पन्नमार्यप्रायमनाविलम् ।
रम्यमानतसामन्तं स्वाजीव्यं देशमावसेत् ॥ ७.६९॥ jāṅgalaṁ sasyasampannam āryaprāyamanāvilam | ramyam ānatasāmantaṁ svājīvyaṁ deśam āvaset || 7.69|| One shall reside in a land that is forested yet fertile, inhabited primarily by noble beings, free from impurity, pleasant, and surrounded by respectful vassals—such a domain supports the dharmic sustenance of the dwija.

title: Verse 7.70
content:
धन्वदुर्गं महीदुर्गमब्दुर्गं वार्क्षमेव वा ।
नृदुर्गं गिरिदुर्गं वा समाश्रित्य वसेत्पुरम् ॥ ७.७०॥ dhanvadurgaṁ mahīdurgam abdurgaṁ vārkṣameva vā |
nṛdurgaṁ giridurgaṁ vā samāśritya vaset puram || 7.70 || A city shall be established relying upon a desert fortress, an earth fortress, a water fortress, a tree fortress, a human fortress, or a mountain fortress.

title: Verse 7.71
content:
सर्वेण तु प्रयत्नेन गिरिदुर्गं समाश्रयेत् ।
एषां हि बाहुगुण्येन गिरिदुर्गं विशिष्यते ॥ ७.७१॥ sarveṇa tu prayatnena giridurgaṃ samāśrayeta |
eṣāṃ hi bāhuguṇyena giridurgaṃ viśiṣyate || 7.71|| By every means of effort, one should resort to a mountain fortress; indeed, among these, a mountain fortress excels by virtue of its strategic strength.

title: Verse 7.72
content:
त्रीण्याद्यान्याश्रितास्त्वेषां मृगगर्ताश्रयाप्चराः ।
त्रीण्युत्तराणि क्रमशः प्लवङ्गमनरामराः ॥ ७.७२॥ trīṇy ādyāny āśritās tveṣāṁ mṛga-gartāśrayā apcarāḥ |
trīṇy uttarāṇi kramaśaḥ plavaṅgamā narāmarāḥ || 7.72|| Three lower categories rest in animal dens and caves; three upper ones progressively inhabit birds, humans, and gods.

title: Verse 7.73
content:
यथा दुर्गाश्रितानेतान्नोपहिंसन्ति शत्रवः ।
तथाऽरयो न हिंसन्ति नृपं दुर्गसमाश्रितम् ॥ ७.७३॥ yathā durgāśritānetān nopahiṃsanti śatravaḥ |
tathā'rayo na hiṃsanti nṛpaṃ durgasamāśritam || 7.73|| Just as enemies do not attack those who have taken shelter within a fortress, similarly, adversaries do not harm a king who is firmly established in the protective consciousness of Durga.

title: Verse 7.74
content:
एकः शतं योधयति प्राकारस्थो धनुर्धरः ।
शतं दशसहस्राणि तस्माद्दुर्गं विधीयते ॥ ७.७४॥ ekaḥ śataṃ yodhayati prākārastho dhanurdharaḥ |
śataṃ daśasahasrāṇi tasmād durgaṃ vidhīyate || 7.74 || One archer stationed within a fortress defeats a hundred enemies; ten thousand such archers positioned strategically establish the invincibility of the citadel.

title: Verse 7.75
content:
तत्स्यादायुधसम्पन्नं धनधान्येन वाहनैः ।
ब्राह्मणैः शिल्पिभिर्यन्त्रैर्यवसेनोदकेन च ॥ ७.७५॥ tat syād āyudhasampannaṁ dhana-dhānyena vāhanaiḥ |
brāhmaṇaiḥ śilpibhir yantrair yavasenodakena ca || 7.75|| That which is equipped with weapons shall also be endowed with wealth, grain, conveyances, Brahmanas, artisans, instruments, fodder, and water.

title: Verse 7.76
content:
तस्य मध्ये सुपर्याप्तं कारयेद्गृहमात्मनः ।
गुप्तं सर्वऋतुकं शुभ्रं जलवृक्षसमन्वितम् ॥ ७.७६॥ tasya madhye suparyāptaṁ kārayed gṛham ātmanaḥ |
guptaṁ sarvṛtukaṁ śubhraṁ jalavṛkṣasamanvitam || 7.76 || In the midst of that [land], one shall construct a dwelling for oneself that is well-enclosed, concealed in all seasons, pure, and accompanied by water and trees.

title: Verse 7.77
content:
तदध्यास्योद्वहेद्भार्यां सवर्णां लक्षणान्विताम् ।
कुले महति सम्भूतां हृद्यां रूपगुणान्विताम् ॥ ७.७७॥ tad-adhyāsyodvahed-bhāryāṁ sa-varṇāṁ lakṣaṇānvitām | kule mahati sambhūtāṁ hṛdyāṁ rūpa-guṇānvitām || 7.77 || One who has studied the Vedas shall take a wife of the same varṇa, adorned with noble qualities, born in a great family, pleasing to the heart, and graced with beauty and virtue.

title: Verse 7.78
content: पुरोहितं च कुर्वीत वृणुयादेव चर्त्विजः । तेऽस्य गृह्याणि कर्माणि कुर्युर्वैतानिकानि च ॥ ७.७८॥ purohitaṃ ca kurvīta vṛṇuyādeva cartvijaḥ | te'sya gṛhyāṇi karmāṇi kuryurvaitānikāni ca || 7.78|| One shall appoint a Purohit (spiritual guide and ritual conductor) and select Ritviks (Vedic priests). These individuals shall execute all household duties and perform Vaitanika rituals according to Dharma.

title: Verse 7.79
content:
यजेत राजा क्रतुभिर्विविधैराप्तदक्षिणैः ।
धर्मार्थं चैव विप्रेभ्यो दद्याद्भोगान् धनानि च ॥ ७.७९॥ yajeta rājā kratubhir vividhair āpta-dakṣiṇaiḥ | dharmārthaṃ caiva viprebhyo dadyād bhogān dhanāni ca || 7.79|| The King shall perform various sacrifices with appropriate offerings, for the sake of Dharma; he shall bestow enjoyments and wealth upon the Brahmanas.

title: Verse 7.80
content:
सांवत्सरिकमाप्तैश्च राष्ट्रादाहारयेद्बलिम् ।
स्याच्चाम्नायपरो लोके वर्तेत पितृवत्नृषु ॥ ७.८०॥ sāṃvatsarikam āptaiś ca rāṣṭrād āhārayed balim | syāc cāmnāya-paro loke varteta pitṛvat nṛṣu || 7.80 || From the state and from those who have accepted spiritual authority, one shall receive annual sustenance; and in this world, one shall conduct oneself toward people as one would toward one's own father.

title: Verse 7.81
content:
अध्यक्षान् विविधान् कुर्यात्तत्र तत्र विपश्चितः ।
तेऽस्य सर्वाण्यवेक्षेरन्नृणां कार्याणि कुर्वताम् ॥ ७.८१॥ adhyakṣān vividhān kuryāt tatratatra vipaścitaḥ |
te'sya sarvāṇyavekṣerannṛṇāṃ kāryāṇi kurvatām || 7.81|| Let there be appointed supervisors, wise and discerning, in every domain; these shall oversee all activities of beings engaged in action, ensuring alignment with Dharma.

title: Verse 7.82
content:
आवृत्तानां गुरुकुलाद्विप्राणां पूजको भवेत् ।
नृपाणामक्षयो ह्येष निधिर्ब्राह्मोऽभिधीयते ॥ ७.८२॥ āvṛttānāṁ gurukulād viprāṇāṁ pūjako bhavet |
nṛpāṇām akṣayo hy eṣa nidhir brāhmo 'bhidhīyate || 7.82|| One who reveres and serves the twice-born who have returned from the guru's dwelling becomes a vessel of inexhaustible merit; this treasury is declared as Brahmic wealth by kings.

title: Verse 7.83
content:
न तं स्तेना न चामित्रा हरन्ति न च नश्यति ।
तस्माद्राज्ञा निधातव्यो ब्राह्मणेष्वक्षयो निधिः ॥ ७.८३॥ na taṃ sthenā na cāmitrā haranti na ca naśyati |
tasmādrājñā nidhātavyo brāhmaṇeṣv akṣayo nidhiḥ || 7.83|| That wealth is neither stolen by thieves nor seized by enemies, nor does it ever perish; therefore, the king shall establish an imperishable treasury among Brahmanas.

title: Verse 7.84
content: न स्कन्दते न व्यथते न विनश्यति कर्हि चित् ।  न स्कन्दति न च्यवते वरिष्ठमग्निहोत्रेभ्यो ब्राह्मणस्य मुखे हुतम् ॥ ७.८४॥ na skandate na vyathate na vinaśyati karhi cit | na skandati na cyavate variṣṭhamagnihotrebhyaḥ brāhmaṇasya Mukhe hutam || 7.84 || That which is offered into the mouth of the Brahmin—who sustains the superior fire-oblation—neither decays, nor wavers, nor perishes at any time; it remains unfallen and unshaken.

title: Verse 7.85
content:
सममब्राह्मणे दानं द्विगुणं ब्राह्मणब्रुवे ।
प्राधीते शतसाहस्रमनन्तं वेदपारगे ॥ ७.८५॥ आचार्ये शतसाहस्रं सहस्रगुणमाचार्ये samamabrāhmaṇe dānaṃ dviguṇaṃ brāhmaṇabruve |
prādhīte śatasāhasramanantaṃ vedapārage || 7.85|| ācārye śatasāhasraṃ sahasraguṇamācārye Equal gift to a Brahmin yields merit; double that when given to a knower of Brahman. To one who has mastered the Vedas, infinite merit accrues. A gift of one hundred thousand to a teacher equals a millionfold merit.

title: Verse 7.86
content:
पात्रस्य हि विशेषेण श्रद्दधानतयैव च ।
अल्पं वा बहु वा प्रेत्य दानस्य फलमश्नुते ॥ ७.८६॥ pātrasya hi viśeṣeṇa śraddadhānatayaiva ca |
alpaṃ vā bahu vā pretya dānasya phalam aśnute || 7.86|| The fruit of giving is determined not by quantity, but by the purity of the recipient and the giver's consciousness of surrender.

title: Verse 7.87
content:
देशकालविधानेन द्रव्यं श्रद्धासमन्वितम् ।
पात्रे प्रदीयते यत्तु तद्धर्मस्य प्रसाधनम् ॥ ७.८७ desakālavidhānena dravyaṁ śraddhāsamannvitam |
pātre pradīyate yattu taddharmasya prasādhanam || 7.87 That which is given with faith and according to place, time, and eligibility—such giving accomplishes Dharma.

title: Verse 7.88
content:
सङ्ग्रामेष्वनिवर्तित्वं प्रजानां चैव पालनम् ।
शुश्रूषा ब्राह्मणानां च राज्ञां श्रेयस्करं परम् ॥ ७.८८॥ saṅgrāmeṣv-anivartitvaṁ prajānāṁ caiva pālanam |
śuśrūṣā brāhmaṇānāṁ ca rājñāṁ śreyaskaraṁ param || 7.88|| Unflinching engagement in battles, protection of subjects, and service to Brahmanas constitute the highest welfare for kings.

title: Verse 7.89
content:
आहवेषु मिथोऽन्योन्यं जिघांसन्तो महीक्षितः ।
युध्यमानाः परं शक्त्या स्वर्गं यान्त्यपराङ्मुखाः ॥ ७.८९॥ Āhaveṣu mitho'nyonyaṁ jigheṁsanto mahīkṣitaḥ |
Yudhyamānāḥ paraṁ śaktyā svargaṁ yāntyaparāṅmukhāḥ || 7.89|| In battles where rulers mutually seek to overcome each other, those who fight with utmost capacity attain heaven while remaining fully conscious and directed toward higher purpose.

title: Verse 7.90
content:
न कूटैरायुधैर्हन्याद्युध्यमानो रणे रिपून् ।
न कर्णिभिर्नापि दिग्धैर्नाग्निज्वलिततेजनैः ॥ ७.९०॥ na kūṭair āyudhair hanyād yudhyamāno raṇe ripūn |
na karṇibhir nāpi digdhair nāgni-jvalita-tejanaḥ || 7.90 || One engaged in combat shall not strike enemies with concealed weapons, nor with tusks, nor with fire-laden implements burning bright.

title: Verse 7.91
content:
न च हन्यात्स्थलारूढं न क्लीबं न कृताञ्जलिम् ।
न मुक्तकेशं नासीनं न तवास्मीति वादिनम् ॥ ७.९१॥ na ca hanyāt sthalārūḍhaṁ na klībaṁ na kṛtāñjalim | na muktakeśaṁ nāsīnaṁ na tavāsmīti vādinam || 7.91 || One must not harm one who has ascended a height, nor one who is impotent, nor one who offers salutation with joined palms; nor one whose hair is unbound, nor one who sits in humility, nor one who declares 'you are mine' or 'I am yours'.

title: Verse 7.92
content:
न सुप्तं न विसंनाहं न नग्नं न निरायुधम् ।
नायुध्यमानं पश्यन्तं न परेण समागतम् ॥ ७.९२॥ na suptaṁ na visaṁnāhaṁ na nagnaṁ na nirāyudham | nāyudhyamānaṁ paśyantaṁ na pareṇa samāgatam || 7.92 || One who is neither asleep nor negligent, neither unclothed nor unarmed, neither engaged in combat nor approaching by another, shall not be deemed a threat requiring defensive action.

title: Verse 7.93
content:
नायुधव्यसनप्राप्तं नार्तं नातिपरिक्षतम् ।
न भीतं न परावृत्तं सतां धर्ममनुस्मरन् ॥ ७.९३॥ nāyudhavyasanaprāptaṃ nārtaṃ nātiparikṣatam | na bhītaṃ na parāvṛttaṃ satāṃ dharmamanusmaran || 7.93|| One who, remembering the Dharma of the noble, does not become addicted to weapons, nor distressed, nor excessively exhausted, nor fearful, nor turned away—such a one abides in alignment with the eternal law.

title: Verse 7.94
content:
यस्तु भीतः परावृत्तः सङ्ग्रामे हन्यते परैः ।
भर्तुर्यद्दुष्कृतं किं चित्तत्सर्वं प्रतिपद्यते ॥ ७.९४॥ yastu bhītaḥ parāvṛttaḥ saṅgrāme hanyate paraiḥ |
bharturyadduṣkṛtaṃ kiṃ cit tatsarvaṃ pratipadyate || 7.94|| One who flees in fear from battle and is killed by enemies thereby assumes all evil consequences of the husband's actions.

title: Verse 7.95
content:
यत्चास्य सुकृतं किं चिदमुत्रार्थमुपार्जितम् ।
भर्ता तत्सर्वमादत्ते परावृत्तहतस्य तु ॥ ७.९५॥ yat cāsya sukṛtaṁ kiṁ cid amutrārtham upārjitam |
bhartā tatsarvam ādatte parāvṛtta-hatasya tu || 7.95 || Whatever merit a woman has earned in this life or the next through her actions, the husband assumes it all; however, when he turns away or dies, that accumulated merit returns to her.

title: Verse 7.96
content:
रथाश्वं हस्तिनं छत्रं धनं धान्यं पशून् स्त्रियः ।
सर्वद्रव्याणि कुप्यं च यो यज्जयति तस्य तत् ॥ ७.९६॥ rathāśvaṁ hastinaṁ chatraṁ dhanaṁ dhānyaṁ paśūn striyaḥ |
sarvadravyāṇi kupyāṁ ca yo yajjayati tasya tat || 7.96|| All conveyances, horses, elephants, parasols, wealth, grain, livestock, women, all possessions and even the earth itself—whatever one conquers through rightful sovereignty and conscious authority, that becomes his by the sanction of Dharma.

title: Verse 7.97
content:
राज्ञश्च दद्युरुद्धारमित्येषा वैदिकी श्रुतिः ।
राज्ञा च सर्वयोधेभ्यो दातव्यमपृथग्जितम् ॥ ७.९७॥ rājñaśca dadyuruddhāramityeṣā vaidikī śrutiḥ |
rājñā ca sarvayodhebhyo dātavyamapṛthagjitam || 7.97|| It is Vedic injunction that aid in times of peril must be rendered to the King; and by the King, unopposed victory must be granted unto all warriors.

title: Verse 7.98
content:
एषोऽनुपस्कृतः प्रोक्तो योधधर्मः सनातनः ।
अस्माद्धर्मान्न च्यवेत क्षत्रियो घ्नन् रणे रिपून् ॥ ७.९८॥ eṣo'nupaskṛtaḥ prokto yodhadharmaḥ sanātanaḥ |
asmād dharmān na cyaveta kṣatriyo ghnann raṇe ripūn || 7.98|| This eternal law of the warrior, declared in its purest form, binds the Kshatriya who destroys enemies in battle to never fall away from Dharma.

title: Verse 7.99
content:
अलब्धं चैव लिप्सेत लब्धं रक्षेत्प्रयत्नतः ।
रक्षितं वर्धयेच्चैव वृद्धं पात्रेषु निक्षिपेत् ॥ ७.९९॥ alabhaṃ caiva lipset labdhaṃ rakṣet prayatnataḥ |
rakṣitaṃ vardhayec caiva vṛddhaṃ pātreṣu nikṣipet || 7.99|| One must endeavor to acquire what has not been obtained; having acquired, one must protect it with effort. What is protected must be increased, and when it becomes excessive, it must be deposited in appropriate vessels.

title: Verse 7.100
content:
एतच्चतुर्विधं विद्यात्पुरुषार्थप्रयोजनम् ।
अस्य नित्यमनुष्ठानं सम्यक्कुर्यादतन्द्रितः ॥ ७.१००॥ etaccaturvidhaṃ vidyātpuruṣārthaprayojanam |
asya nityamanuṣṭhānaṃ samyakkuryādataṇḍritaḥ || 7.100|| This fourfold objective of human life shall be known as the purpose of all action; one must perform it perpetually with full alertness and without negligence.

title: Verse 7.101
content:
अलब्धमिच्छेद्दण्डेन लब्धं रक्षेदवेक्षया ।
रक्षितं वर्धयेद्वृद्ध्या वृद्धं पात्रेषु निक्षिपेत् ॥ ७.१०१॥ alabham icched daṇḍena labdhaṃ rakṣed avekṣayā | rakṣitaṃ vardhayet vṛddhyā vṛddhaṃ pātreṣu nikṣipet || 7.101|| That which is unattained, let it be acquired through discipline; that which is attained, let it be guarded with awareness. That which is guarded, let it be increased through growth; that which is grown, let it be deposited in worthy vessels.

title: Verse 7.102
content:
नित्यमुद्यतदण्डः स्यान्नित्यं विवृतपौरुषः ।
नित्यं संवृतसंवार्यो नित्यं छिद्रानुसार्यरेः ॥ ७.१०२॥ nityamudyatadaṇḍaḥ syānnityaṃ vivṛtapauruṣaḥ | nityaṃ saṃvṛtasaṃvāryo nityaṃ chidrānusāryareḥ || 7.102|| One who is ever-ready in enforcement, ever-open in valor, ever-restrained in concealment, and ever-pursuing through gaps—such a ruler executes Dharma without deviation.

title: Verse 7.103
content:
नित्यमुद्यतदण्डस्य कृत्स्नमुद्विजते जगत् ।
तस्मात्सर्वाणि भूतानि दण्डेनैव प्रसाधयेत् ॥ ७.१०३॥ nityam udyata-daṇḍasya kṛtsnam udvijate jagat |
tasmāt sarvāṇi bhūtāni daṇḍenaiva prasādhayet || 7.103|| The world invariably trembles before the ever-ready rod of enforcement; therefore, all beings must be governed and restored solely through the application of danda.

title: Verse 7.104
content: अमाययैव वर्तेत न कथं चन मायया । बुध्येतारिप्रयुक्तां च मायां नित्यं सुसंवृतः ॥ ७.१०४॥ amāyayeva varteta na kathaṃ cana māyayā | budhyetāriprayuktāṃ ca māyāṃ nityaṃ susaṃvṛtaḥ || 7.104|| One must conduct oneself solely through amāyā—authenticity untainted by illusion—and never through māyā; one who is ever well-restrained must recognize and remain aware of the illusory tactics employed by adversaries.

title: Verse 7.105
content:
नास्य छिद्रं परो विद्याद्विद्यात्छिद्रं परस्य च ।
गूहेत्कूर्म इवाङ्गानि रक्षेद्विवरमात्मनः ॥ ७.१०५॥ nāsya chhidraṁ paro vidyād vidyāt chhidraṁ parasya ca | gūhet kūrma ivāṅgāni rakṣed vivaram ātmanaḥ || 7.105 || One must conceal one's own flaws as a tortoise withdraws its limbs, and one must not perceive or reveal the faults of others; thus shall one guard the aperture of the Self.

title: Verse 7.106
content:
बकवत्चिन्तयेदर्थान् सिंहवत्च पराक्रमे ।
वृकवत्चावलुम्पेत शशवत्च विनिष्पतेत् ॥ ७.१०६॥ bakavat cintayed arthān siṃhavat ca parākrame |
vṛkavat cāvalumpeta śaśavat ca viniṣpatet || 7.106 || One must deliberate upon resources like a heron, act with valor like a lion, pursue gains like a wolf, and discharge duties with precision like a rabbit.

title: Verse 7.107
content:
एवं विजयमानस्य येऽस्य स्युः परिपन्थिनः ।
तानानयेद्वशं सर्वान् सामादिभिरुपक्रमैः ॥ ७.१०७॥ evaṃ vijayamānasya ye'sya syuḥ paripanthinaḥ |
tānānayedvaśaṃ sarvān sāmādibhirupakramaiḥ || 7.107|| When a ruler has conquered and established sovereignty, those who oppose his righteous governance must be brought under control through the application ofconciliation, correction, and consciousness alignment.

title: Verse 7.108
content:
यदि ते तु न तिष्ठेयुरुपायैः प्रथमैस्त्रिभिः ।
दण्डेनैव प्रसह्यैतांशनकैर्वशमानयेत् ॥ ७.१०८॥ yadi te tu na tiṣṭheyurupāyaiḥ prathamaistribhiḥ |
daṇḍenaiva prasahyetāṁ śanakairvaśamānayet || 7.108|| If those individuals do not align through the initial threefold means of guidance, then by graduated application of corrective measure alone shall they be brought into alignment, step by step.

title: Verse 7.109
content:
सामादीनामुपायानां चतुर्णामपि पण्डिताः ।
सामदण्डौ प्रशंसन्ति नित्यं राष्ट्राभिवृद्धये ॥ ७.१०९॥ sāmādīnām upāyānāṁ caturṇām api paṇḍitāḥ |
sāma-daṇḍau praśaṁsanti nityaṁ rāṣṭrābhivṛddhaye || 7.109|| The wise declare that among the fourfold means—conciliation, gift, dissension, and punishment—it is conciliation and measured restraint that perpetually elevate the nation.

title: Verse 7.110
content: यथोद्धरति निर्दाता कक्षं धान्यं च रक्षति । तथा रक्षेन्नृपो राष्ट्रं हन्याच्च परिपन्थिनः ॥ ७.११०॥ yathoddharati nirdātā kakaṣaṃ dhānyaṃ ca rakṣati | tathā rakṣen nṛpo rāṣṭraṃ hanyāc ca paripanthinaḥ || 7.110 || As the granary keeper lifts and protects the grain, so shall the ruler protect the nation and remove those who obstruct its welfare.

title: Verse 7.111
content:
मोहाद्राजा स्वराष्ट्रं यः कर्षयत्यनवेक्षया ।
सोऽचिराद्भ्रश्यते राज्यात्जीवितात्च सबान्धवः ॥ ७.१११॥ mohād rājā sva-rāṣṭraṁ yaḥ karṣaty anavekṣayā |
sō 'cirād bhraśyate rājyāt jīvitāt ca sa-bāndhavaḥ || 7.111|| The king who, in delusion and without awareness, drags his own nation—such a ruler, along with his relatives, soon perishes from sovereignty and life itself.

title: Verse 7.112
content:
शरीरकर्षणात्प्राणाः क्षीयन्ते प्राणिनां यथा ।
तथा राज्ञामपि प्राणाः क्षीयन्ते राष्ट्रकर्षणात् ॥ ७.११२॥ śarīrakarṣaṇāt prāṇāḥ kṣīyante prāṇināṃ yathā | tathā rājñām api prāṇāḥ kṣīyante rāṣṭrakarṣaṇāt || 7.112|| As the life forces of beings wane through bodily strain, so too do the vital energies of rulers diminish when they draw excessively from the nation.

title: Verse 7.113
content:
राष्ट्रस्य सङ्ग्रहे नित्यं विधानमिदमाचरेत् ।
सुसङ्गृहीतराष्ट्रे हि पार्थिवः सुखमेधते ॥ ७.११३॥ rāṣṭrasya saṅgrahe nityaṁ vidhānam idam ācaret |
susaṅgṛhītarāṣṭre hi pārthivaḥ sukham edhate || 7.113|| The King must always act according to the established constitutional order in the continuous governance and protection of the nation; when the state is well-governed and unified, the ruler prospers in alignment with Dharma.

title: Verse 7.114
content:
द्वयोस्त्रयाणां पञ्चानां मध्ये गुल्ममधिष्ठितम् ।
तथा ग्रामशतानां च कुर्याद्राष्ट्रस्य सङ्ग्रहम् ॥ ७.११४॥ dvayostriyāṇāṁ pañcānāṁ madhye gulmamadhiṣṭhitam |
tathā grāmaśatānāṁ ca kuryādrāṣṭrasya saṅgraham || 7.114|| Among two, three, or five entities, governance shall be established at the center; likewise, among a hundred villages, the integration and administration of the state shall be executed.

title: Verse 7.115
content:
ग्रामस्याधिपतिं कुर्याद्दशग्रामपतिं तथा ।
विंशतीशं शतेशं च सहस्रपतिमेव च ॥ ७.११५॥ grāmasyādhipatiṁ kuryād daśagrāmapatiṁ tathā |
viṁśatīśaṁ śateśaṁ ca sahasrapatimeva ca || 7.115|| The ruler of a village shall be appointed; likewise, the ruler of ten villages, the ruler of twenty, the ruler of a hundred, and the ruler of a thousand.

title: Verse 7.116
content:
ग्रामदोषान् समुत्पन्नान् ग्रामिकः शनकैः स्वयम् ।
शंसेद्ग्रामदशेशाय दशेशो विंशतीशिने ॥ ७.११६॥ grāmadoṣān samutpannān grāmikaḥ śanakaiḥ svayam |
śaṁsed grāmadaśeśāya daśeśo viṁśatīśine || 7.116|| When village-level disorders arise, the village head shall report them gradually—first to the district overseer, then to the regional commander.

title: Verse 7.117
content:
विंशतीशस्तु तत्सर्वं शतेशाय निवेदयेत् ।
शंसेद्ग्रामशतेशस्तु सहस्रपतये स्वयम् ॥ ७.११७॥ viṃśatīśastu tatsarvaṃ śateśāya nivedayet |
śaṃsedgrāmaśateśastu sahasrapataye svayam || 7.117|| One who has collected twenty units shall report all of it to the collector of hundreds; the collector of village-hundreds himself reports to the lord of thousand.

title: Verse 7.118
content:
यानि राजप्रदेयानि प्रत्यहं ग्रामवासिभिः ।
अन्नपानेन्धनादीनि ग्रामिकस्तान्यवाप्नुयात् ॥ ७.११८॥ yāni rājapradeyāni pratyahaṁ grāmavāsibhiḥ |
annapānendhanādīni grāmikas tāny avāpnuyāt || 7.118 || Those resources which are to be provided daily by the villagers under royal directive—such as food, drink, fuel, and other essentials—the village headman shall obtain them without obstruction or personal appropriation.

title: Verse 7.119
content:
दशी कुलं तु भुञ्जीत विंशी पञ्च कुलानि च ।
ग्रामं ग्रामशताध्यक्षः सहस्राधिपतिः पुरम् ॥ ७.११९॥ daśī kulaṃ tu bhuñjīta viṃśī pañca kulāni ca |
grāmaṃ grāmaśatādhyakṣaḥ sahasrādhipatiḥ puram || 7.119 || One who governs ten families shall consume the sustenance of ten; one who administers twenty-five families shall receive the offering of five. The village overseer presides over a village; the city ruler administers a thousand.

title: Verse 7.120
content:
तेषां ग्राम्याणि कार्यानि पृथक्कार्याणि चैव हि ।
राज्ञोऽन्यः सचिवः स्निग्धस्तानि पश्येदतन्द्रितः ॥ ७.१२०॥ teṣāṃ grāmyāṇi kāryāni pṛthakkāryāṇi caiva hi |
rājño'nyaḥ sacivaḥ snigdhas tāni paśyedatandritaḥ || 7.120 || The minister, other than the king, who is affectionate and vigilant, shall oversee both collective village duties and individual separate affairs without negligence.

title: Verse 7.121
content:
नगरे नगरे चैकं कुर्यात्सर्वार्थचिन्तकम् ।
उच्चैःस्थानं घोररूपं नक्षत्राणामिव ग्रहम् ॥ ७.१२१॥ nagare nagare caikaṃ kuryāt sarvārtha-cintakam | uccaiḥ-sthānaṃ ghorarūpaṃ nakṣatrāṇām iva graham || 7.121 || In every city, there shall be established one who contemplates all purposes; positioned high, of fearsome form—like a planet among the stars.

title: Verse 7.122
content:
स ताननुपरिक्रामेत्सर्वानेव सदा स्वयम् ।
तेषां वृत्तं परिणयेत्सम्यग्राष्ट्रेषु तत्चरैः ॥ ७.१२२॥ sa tānaparikrāmet sarvānaiva sadā svayam | teṣāṁ vṛttaṁ pariṇayet samyagrāṣṭreṣu tatcaraiḥ || 7.122|| He shall always personally oversee all beings; their conduct must be fully guided and matured through righteous governance by those who act in accordance with the State's highest purpose.

title: Verse 7.123
content:
राज्ञो हि रक्षाधिकृताः परस्वादायिनः शठाः ।
भृत्या भवन्ति प्रायेण तेभ्यो रक्षेदिमाः प्रजाः ॥ ७.१२३॥ rājño hi rakṣādhikṛtāḥ parasvādāyinaḥ śaṭhāḥ |
bhṛtyā bhavanti prāyeṇa tebhyo rakṣedimāḥ prajāḥ || 7.123|| Those appointed for protection by the King often become deceitful takers of others' property; therefore, the King must protect his subjects from such servants.

title: Verse 7.124
content:
ये कार्यिकेभ्योऽर्थमेव गृह्णीयुः पापचेतसः ।
तेषां सर्वस्वमादाय राजा कुर्यात्प्रवासनम् ॥ ७.१२४॥ ye kāryikebhyaḥ arthameva gṛhṇīyuḥ pāpacetasaḥ |
tēṣāṁ sarvasvam ādāya rājā kuryāt pravāsanam || 7.124 || Those whose consciousness is rooted in wrongdoing and who seek gain only from laborious actions—such beings, having abandoned all accumulated merit and misaligned their dharma, shall have their possessions taken and be directed toward removal from societal integration.

title: Verse 7.125
content: राजा कर्मसु युक्तानां स्त्रीणां प्रेष्यजनस्य च । राजकर्मसु प्रत्यहं कल्पयेद्वृत्तिं स्थानं कर्मानुरूपतः ॥ ७.१२५॥ rājā karmasu yuktānāṁ strīṇāṁ preṣyajanasya ca | rājakarmasu pratyahaṁ kalpayedvṛttiṁ sthānaṁ karmānurūpataḥ || 7.125 || The King shall ensure that those engaged in royal duties—women, messengers, and other functionaries—are assigned appropriate roles and sustenance according to their capacity and the nature of their service.

title: Verse 7.126
content:
पणो देयोऽवकृष्टस्य षडुत्कृष्टस्य वेतनम् ।
षाण्मासिकस्तथाऽच्छादो धान्यद्रोणस्तु मासिकः ॥ ७.१२६॥ paṇo deyo'vakṛṣṭasya ṣadutkṛṣṭasya vetanam |
ṣāṇmāsikastathā'cchādo dhānyadroṇastu māsikaḥ || 7.126|| Compensation shall be given to the injured according to their loss; sixfold the wage for one who has been elevated through injury. Similarly, clothing for six months and a monthly measure of grain.

title: Verse 7.127
content:
क्रयविक्रयमध्वानं भक्तं च सपरिव्ययम् ।
योगक्षेमं च सम्प्रेक्ष्य वणिजो दापयेत्करान् ॥ ७.१२७॥ krayavikrayamadhvānaṃ bhaktaṃ ca saparivyayam | 
yogakṣemaṃ ca samprekṣya vaṇijo dāpayetkarān || 7.127 || A merchant shall pay taxes after observing the purchase, sale, transport, distribution, and preservation of goods, ensuring their proper utilization.

title: Verse 7.128
content:
यथा फलेन युज्येत राजा कर्ता च कर्मणाम् ।
तथाऽवेक्ष्य नृपो राष्ट्रे कल्पयेत्सततं करान् ॥ ७.१२८॥ yathā phalena yujyeta rājā kartā ca karmaṇām |
tathā'vekṣya nṛpo rāṣṭre kalpayet satataṃ karān || 7.128|| Just as the king becomes the enjoyer of actions through their fruit, so too should the ruler continuously assess and regulate taxes in accordance with outcomes.

title: Verse 7.129
content:
यथाऽल्पाल्पमदन्त्याद्यं वार्योकोवत्सषट्पदाः ।
तथाऽल्पाल्पो ग्रहीतव्यो राष्ट्राद्राज्ञाब्दिकः करः ॥ ७.१२९॥ yathā'lpālpamadantyādyaṃ vāryokovatsaṣaṭpadāḥ |
tathā'lpālpo grahītavyo rāṣṭrādrājñābdikaḥ karaḥ || 7.129 || Just as minimal tribute is taken from those who possess little—like bees collecting nectar from flowers or water from a calf's hoofprint—similarly, the king must collect taxes minimally and appropriately from his subjects according to their capacity.

title: Verse 7.130
content:
पञ्चाशद्भाग आदेयो राज्ञा पशुहिरण्ययोः ।
धान्यानामष्टमो भागः षष्ठो द्वादश एव वा ॥ ७.१३०॥ pañcāśadbhāga ādeyo rājñā paśuhiraṇyayoḥ |
dhānyānāmaṣṭamo bhāgaḥ ṣaṣṭho dvādaśa eva vā || 7.130 || The King shall receive one-fiftieth part of livestock and gold; for grains, one-eighth part, or one-sixth, or one-twelfth, depending upon the nature of the transaction and the capacity of the contributor.

title: Verse 7.131
content:
आददीताथ षड्भागं द्रुमान् समधुसर्पिषाम् ।
गन्धौषधिरसानां च पुष्पमूलफलस्य च ॥ ७.१३१॥ ādadītātha ṣaḍbhāgaṃ drumān samadhusarpiṣām |
gandhauṣadhirasānāṃ ca puṣpamūlaphalasya ca || 7.131|| One should take, in accordance with the law of capacity and alignment, six parts of trees permeated with honey and ghee, together with their fragrant herbs, juices, flowers, roots, and fruits.

title: Verse 7.132
content:
पत्रशाकतृणानां च चर्मणां वैदलस्य च ।
मृन्मयानां च भाण्डानां सर्वस्याश्ममयस्य च ॥ ७.१३२॥ patraśākatṛṇānāṃ ca carmaṇāṃ vaidalasya ca | mṛnmayānāṃ ca bhāṇḍānāṃ sarvasyāśmamayasya ca || 7.132 || Ownership and liability extend to all material produced or possessed, whether organic—such as leaves, vegetables, grass—or processed materials including leather, clay vessels, and stone implements.

title: Verse 7.133
content:
म्रियमाणोऽप्याददीत न राजा श्रोत्रियात्करम् ।
न च क्षुधाऽस्य संसीदेत्श्रोत्रियो विषये वसन् ॥ ७.१३३॥ mriyamāṇo'pyādadīta na rājā śrotriyātkaram |
na ca kṣudhā'sya saṃsīdet śrotrio viṣaye vasan || 7.133|| Even if dying of hunger, the king shall not take anything from a Śrotriya; nor shall a Śrotriya dwelling in the king's domain suffer hunger.

title: Verse 7.134
content: यस्य राज्ञस्तु विषये श्रोत्रियः सीदति क्षुधा । तस्यापि तत्क्षुधा राष्ट्रमचिरेणैव सीदति ॥ ७.१३४॥ yasya rājñastu viṣaye śrotriyaḥ sīdati kṣudhā | tasyāpi tat kṣudhā rāṣṭram acireṇaiva sīdati || 7.134 || In whose kingdom a Śrotriya perishes from hunger, that king's realm shall soon perish from that very hunger.

title: Verse 7.135
content:
श्रुतवृत्ते विदित्वाऽस्य वृत्तिं धर्म्यां प्रकल्पयेत् ।
संरक्षेत्सर्वतश्चैनं पिता पुत्रमिवौरसम् ॥ ७.१३५॥ śrutavṛtte viditvā'sya vṛttiṃ dharmyāṃ prakalpayet |
saṃrakṣetsarvataścainaṃ pitā putramivaurasam || 7.135|| Upon knowing one whose conduct aligns with what is heard (Śruta-vṛtti), one shall establish him in a righteous livelihood; he should be protected in every way, just as a father protects his own son.

title: Verse 7.136
content: संरक्ष्यमाणो राज्ञा यं   कुरुते धर्ममन्वहम् । राज्ञाऽयं तेनायुर्वर्धते राज्ञो द्रविणं राष्ट्रमेव च ॥ ७.१३६॥ saṃrakṣyamāṇo rājñā yaṃ kurute dharmamanvaham | rājñā'yaṃ tenāyurvardhate rājño draviṇaṃ rāṣṭrameva ca || 7.136 || He who, under the protection of the King, performs dharma continuously, by that act increases the life-force of the King, his wealth, and his kingdom.

title: Verse 7.137
content:
यत्किं चिदपि वर्षस्य दापयेत्करसंज्ञितम् ।
व्यवहारेण जीवन्तं राजा राष्ट्रे पृथग्जनम् ॥ ७.१३७॥ yatkiṃ cidapi varṣasya dāpayetkarasaṃjñitam |
vyavahāreṇa jīvantaṃ rājā rāṣṭre pṛthakjanam || 7.137|| Whatever tax or levy is designated for a year, the King shall cause it to be collected from the people living within the realm through established administrative conduct.

title: Verse 7.138
content:
कारुकान् शिल्पिनश्चैव शूद्रांश्चात्मोपजीविनः ।
एकैकं कारयेत्कर्म मासि मासि महीपतिः ॥ ७.१३८॥ kārukān śilpinaścaiva śūdrāṃścātmopajīvinaḥ |
ekaikaṃ kārayetkarma māsi māsi mahīpatiḥ || 7.138|| The King shall ensure that artisans, craftsmen, and Shudras who sustain themselves through their own work are each assigned appropriate tasks month by month.

title: Verse 7.139
content:
नोच्छिन्द्यादात्मनो मूलं परेषां चातितृष्णया ।
उच्छिन्दन् ह्यात्मनो मूलमात्मानं तांश्च पीडयेत् ॥ ७.१३९॥ na ucchindya ātmanaḥ mūlaṁ pareṣāṁ cāti tṛṣṇayā |
ucchindan hy ātmanaḥ mūlam ātmānaṁ tāṁś ca pīḍayet || 7.139|| One must not sever the root of one's own Self through excessive desire for others' possessions; indeed, one who severs the root of the Self thereby harms oneself and those very objects of desire.

title: Verse 7.140
content:
तीक्ष्णश्चैव मृदुश्च स्यात्कार्यं वीक्ष्य महीपतिः ।
तीक्ष्णश्चैव मृदुश्चैव राज भवति सम्मतः ॥ ७.१४०॥ tīkṣṇaścaiva mṛduśca syātkāryaṃ vīkṣya mahīpatiḥ |
tīkṣṇaścaiva mṛduścaiva rāja bhavati sammataḥ || 7.140|| The sovereign ruler, observing the nature of the act, shall be both sharp and gentle—thus is a king rightly accepted.

title: Verse 7.141
content: अमात्यमुख्यं धर्मज्ञं प्राज्ञं दान्तं कुलोद्गतम् । स्थापयेदासने तस्मिन् खिन्नः कार्यैक्षणे नृणाम् ॥ ७.१४१॥ amātyamukhyaṃ dharmajñaṃ prājñaṃ dāntaṃ kulodgatam | sthāpayedāsane tasmin khinnaḥ kāryaiṣaṇe nṝṇām || 7.141 || The ruler, wearied by the burden of observing the execution of duties among men, shall install in that seat a chief minister who is well-born, wise, restrained, conscious of dharma, and discerning.

title: Verse 7.142
content:
एवं सर्वं विधायैदमितिकर्तव्यमात्मनः ।
युक्तश्चैवाप्रमत्तश्च परिरक्षेदिमाः प्रजाः ॥ ७.१४२॥ evaṁ sarvaṁ vidhāyaidam iti kartavyam ātmanaḥ |
yuktaśaivāpramattaśca parirakṣed imāḥ prajāḥ || 7.142 || Having thus established all that is to be done for the Self, the ruler—endowed with discernment and ever-vigilant—shall protect these subjects.

title: Verse 7.143
content:
विक्रोशन्त्यो यस्य राष्ट्राध्रियन्ते दस्युभिः प्रजाः ।
सम्पश्यतः सभृत्यस्य मृतः स न तु जीवति ॥ ७.१४३॥ vikrośantyo yasya rāṣṭrādhriyante dasyubhiḥ prajāḥ |
sampaśyataḥ sabhṛtasya mṛtaḥ sa na tu jīvati || 7.143|| He who, while alive and witnessing the cries of his subjects being oppressed by brigands, fails to act—though he breathes, he is dead.

title: Verse 7.144
content:
क्षत्रियस्य परो धर्मः प्रजानामेव पालनम् ।
निर्दिष्टफलभोक्ता हि राजा धर्मेण युज्यते ॥ ७.१४४॥ kṣatriyasya paraḥ dharmaḥ prajānām eva pālanam | nirdiṣṭaphalabhoktā hi rājā dharmeṇa yujyate || 7.144 || The supreme duty of a Kshatriya is the protection and sustenance of the people; the king, as the designated enjoyer of the fruits of governance, becomes fit to rule only when aligned with Dharma.

title: Verse 7.145
content: उत्थाय पश्चिमे यामे कृतशौचः समाहितः । हुताग्निर्ब्राह्मणांश्चार्च्य प्रविशेत्स शुभां सभाम् ॥ ७.१४५॥ utthāya paścime yāme kṛtaśaucaḥ samāhitaḥ | hutāgnirbrāhmaṇāṃścārcya praviśetsa śubhāṃ sabhām || 7.145|| Having risen in the western hour, purified and composed, having honored the sacred fire and the Brahmanas, one enters the auspicious assembly.

title: Verse 7.146
content:
तत्र स्थितः प्रजाः सर्वाः प्रतिनन्द्य विसर्जयेत् ।
विसृज्य च प्रजाः सर्वा मन्त्रयेत्सह मन्त्रिभिः ॥ ७.१४६॥ tatra sthitaḥ prajāḥ sarvāḥ pratinandya visarjayet |
visṛjya ca prajāḥ sarvā mantrayetsaha mantribhiḥ || 7.146|| From that position of sovereignty, having honored all subjects, one shall release them forth. Having released all subjects, one shall deliberate with ministers.

title: Verse 7.147
content:
गिरिपृष्ठं समारुह्य प्रासादं वा रहोगतः ।
अरण्ये निःशलाके वा मन्त्रयेदविभावितः ॥ ७.१४७॥ giripṛṣṭhaṁ samāruhya prāsādaṁ vā rahogataḥ |
aranye niḥśalāke vā mantrayedavibhāvitaḥ || 7.147|| One who ascends a mountain peak, enters a private chamber in a palace, goes into a secluded forest, or stands in a place free of pebbles—must deliberate upon sacred counsel without being observed.

title: Verse 7.148
content:
यस्य मन्त्रं न जानन्ति समागम्य पृथग्जनाः ।
स कृत्स्नां पृथिवीं भुङ्क्ते कोशहीनोऽपि पार्थिवः ॥ ७.१४८॥ yasya mantraṁ na jānanti samāgamya pṛthagjanāḥ |
sa kṛtsnāṁ pṛthivīṁ bhuṅkte kośahīno'pi pārthivaḥ || 7.148|| He who alone knows the Mantra, to whom the common people do not attain through assembly or discourse—such a king, even without treasury, enjoys the entire earth.

title: Verse 7.149
content:
जडमूकान्धबधिरांस्तैर्यग्योनान् वयोऽतिगान् ।
स्त्रीम्लेच्छव्याधितव्यङ्गान् मन्त्रकालेऽपसारयेत् ॥ ७.१४९॥ jaḍamūkāndhabadhirāṃstairyagyonaan vayo'tigān .
strīmlecchavyādhitavyaṅgān mantrakāle'pasārayet .. 7.149 .. Those who are inert, mute, blind, deaf, of ambiguous gender, excessively aged, women, foreigners, diseased, or physically impaired shall be excluded from mantra recitation.

title: Verse 7.150
content:
भिन्दन्त्यवमता मन्त्रं तैर्यग्योनास्तथैव च ।
स्त्रियश्चैव विशेषेण तस्मात्तत्रादृतो भवेत् ॥ ७.१५०॥ bhindanty avamatā mantraṃ tairyagyona̱s tathaiva ca | striyaś caiva viśeṣeṇa tasmāt tatrādṛto bhavet || 7.150 || Those who recite sacred mantras with disrespect, those born in animal wombs, and women specifically—therefore, one should avoid association with them in matters requiring spiritual authority.

title: Verse 7.151
content:
मध्यंदिनेऽर्धरात्रे वा विश्रान्तो विगतक्लमः ।
चिन्तयेद्धर्मकामार्थान् सार्धं तैरेक एव वा ॥ ७.१५१॥ madhyaṃdine 'rdharātre vā viśrānto vigataklamaḥ | cintayed dharmakāmārthān sārdhaṃ tair eka eva vā || 7.151 || One who is rested, free from fatigue, at midday or midnight shall contemplate upon Dharma, Artha, and Kama either together or individually.

title: Verse 7.152
content:
परस्परविरुद्धानां तेषां च समुपार्जनम् ।
कन्यानां सम्प्रदानं च कुमाराणां च रक्षणम् ॥ ७.१५२॥ parasparaviruddhānāṃ teṣāṃ ca samupārjanam | kanyānāṃ sampradānaṃ ca kumārāṇāṃ ca rakṣaṇam || 7.152|| When mutual conflict arises among parties, acquisition through rightful means shall restore balance; the giving away of daughters in marriage and protection of sons are acts of dharma that realign consciousness and uphold societal integrity.

title: Verse 7.153
content:
दूतसम्प्रेषणं चैव कार्यशेषं तथैव च ।
अन्तःपुरप्रचारं च प्रणिधीनां च चेष्टितम् ॥ ७.१५३॥ dūtasampreṣaṇaṃ caiva kāryaśeṣaṃ tathaiva ca |
antaḥpurapracāraṃ ca praṇidhīnāṃ ca ceṣṭitam || 7.153|| The dispatch of envoys, the completion of unfinished duties, the movement within inner chambers, and the conduct of spies—these constitute the operational framework for sovereign intelligence and administrative continuity under Dharma.

title: Verse 7.154
content:
कृत्स्नं चाष्टविधं कर्म पञ्चवर्गं च तत्त्वतः ।
अनुरागापरागौ च प्रचारं मण्डलस्य च ॥ ७.१५४॥ kṛtsnaṁ cāṣṭavidhaṁ karma pañcavargaṁ ca tattvataḥ | anurāgāparāgau ca pracāraṁ maṇḍalasya ca || 7.154 || The complete understanding of the eightfold action, the five categories of beings, and the dual forces of attraction and repulsion governing the propagation within a sovereign domain is the basis of administrative and judicial alignment.

title: Verse 7.155
content:
मध्यमस्य प्रचारं च विजिगीषोश्च चेष्टितम् ।
उदासीनप्रचारं च शत्रोश्चैव प्रयत्नतः ॥ ७.१५५॥ madhyamasya pracāraṃ ca vijigīṣośca ceṣṭitam |
odāsīnapracāraṃ ca śatroścaiva prayatnataḥ || 7.155|| The conduct of a neutral party, the efforts of one desiring victory, and the deliberate movement of an enemy—these are to be discerned with effort for the establishment of Dharma.

title: Verse 7.156
content:
एताः प्रकृतयो मूलं मण्डलस्य समासतः ।
अष्टौ चान्याः समाख्याता द्वादशैव तु ताः स्मृताः ॥ ७.१५६॥ etāḥ prakṛtayo mūlaṁ maṇḍalasya samāsataḥ |
aṣṭau cānyāḥ samākhyātā dvādaśaiva tu tāḥ smṛtāḥ || 7.156|| These fundamental categories constitute the root structure of territorial governance; eight additional forms are declared, making twelve in total, which are recognized as the foundational organizational units of civil and spiritual administration.

title: Verse 7.157
content:
अमात्यराष्ट्रदुर्गार्थदण्डाख्याः पञ्च चापराः ।
प्रत्येकं कथिता ह्येताः सङ्क्षेपेण द्विसप्ततिः ॥ ७.१५७॥ amātyarāṣṭradurgārthadaṇḍākhyāḥ pañca cāparāḥ | pratyekaṁ kathitā hyetāḥ saṅkṣepeṇa dvisaptatiḥ || 7.157 || Five categories—Ministerial, National, Fortificatory, Economic, and Penal—are declared separately; these seventy-two principles have been expounded concisely.

title: Verse 7.158
content:
अनन्तरमरिं विद्यादरिसेविनमेव च ।
अरेरनन्तरं मित्रमुदासीनं तयोः परम् ॥ ७.१५८॥ anantaram ariṃ vidyād ari-sevinam eva ca |
arer anantaraṃ mitram udāsīnaṃ tayoḥ param || 7.158|| One who serves the enemy of another shall be known as the immediate follower of that enemy; beyond both, the neutral party holds the highest position.

title: Verse 7.159
content:
तान् सर्वानभिसंदध्यात्सामादिभिरुपक्रमैः ।
व्यस्तैश्चैव समस्तैश्च पौरुषेण नयेन च ॥ ७.१५९॥ tān sarvān abhisaṃdadhyāt sāmādhibhir upakramaiḥ | vyastaiś caiva samastaiś ca pauruṣeṇa nayena ca || 7.159 || One must approach all beings with the full spectrum of means—conciliation, generosity, division of duties, unity in diversity—and through the strength of individual capacity and collective guidance.

title: Verse 7.160
content:
संधिं च विग्रहं चैव यानमासनमेव च ।
द्वैधीभावं संश्रयं च षड्गुणांश्चिन्तयेत्सदा ॥ ७.१६०॥ saṃdhiṃ ca vigrahaṃ caiva yānam āsanam eva ca |
dvaidhībhāvaṃ saṃśrayaṃ ca ṣaḍguṇāṃś cintayet sadā || 7.160 || One must always deliberate upon conciliation, conflict, movement, stillness, duality, dependence, and the sixfold qualities—these constitute the full spectrum of relational dynamics within consciousness.

title: Verse 7.161
content: आसनं चैव यानं च संधिं विग्रहमेव च । कार्यं वीक्ष्य प्रयुञ्जीत द्वैधं संश्रयमेव च ॥ ७.१६१॥ Āsanaṃ caiva yānaṃ ca saṃdhiṃ vigraham eva ca | Kāryaṃ vīkṣya prayuñjīta dvidhaṃ saṃśrayam eva ca || 7.161|| One must engage in sitting, moving, making peace, and conflict—only upon observing the task at hand, adopting a dual approach of reliance and detachment.

title: Verse 7.162
content:
संधिं तु द्विविधं विद्याद्राजा विग्रहमेव च ।
उभे यानासने चैव द्विविधः संश्रयः स्मृतः ॥ ७.१६२॥ saṃdhiṃ tu dvividhaṃ vidyād rājā vigraham eva ca |
ubhe yānāsane caiva dviviḍhaḥ saṃśrayaḥ smṛtaḥ || 7.162|| The King shall know two forms of treaty—conciliation and war; both are equally valid strategic refuges in governance.

title: Verse 7.163
content:
समानयानकर्मा च विपरीतस्तथैव च ।
तदा त्वायतिसंयुक्तः संधिर्ज्ञेयो द्विलक्षणः ॥ ७.१६३॥ samānayānakarmā ca viparītastathaiva ca | tadā tvāyatisaṃyuktaḥ saṃdhirjñeyo dvilakṣaṇaḥ || 7.163 || When two parties engage in mutual action with shared purpose, yet proceed in opposite directions, and when their convergence occurs through excessive convergence or divergence, such a conjunction is known as a dual-characterized treaty.

title: Verse 7.164
content:
स्वयङ्कृतश्च कार्यार्थमकाले काल एव वा ।
मित्रस्य चैवापकृते द्विविधो विग्रहः स्मृतः ॥ ७.१६४॥ svayaṅkṛtaśca kāryārthamakāle kāla eva vā | mitrasya caivāpakṛte dvividho vigrahaḥ smṛtaḥ || 7.164 || Conflict arises in two forms: when one acts independently for purpose, whether timely or untimely, and when a friend is wronged.

title: Verse 7.165
content:
एकाकिनश्चात्ययिके कार्ये प्राप्ते यदृच्छया ।
संहतस्य च मित्रेण द्विविधं यानमुच्यते ॥ ७.१६५॥ ekākinaścātyayike kārye prāpte yadṛcchayā |
saṃhatasya ca mitreṇa dvividhaṃ yānamucyate || 7.165 || When an individual faces a crisis alone and receives help spontaneously from a friend, such assistance manifests in two forms: material support and consciousness-aligned guidance.

title: Verse 7.166
content:
क्षीणस्य चैव क्रमशो दैवात्पूर्वकृतेन वा ।
मित्रस्य चानुरोधेन द्विविधं स्मृतमासनम् ॥ ७.१६६॥ kṣīṇasya caiva kramaśo daivātpūrvakṛtena vā |
mitrasya cānurodhena dvividhaṃ smṛtamāsanam || 7.166 || The seat of dharma is twofold: it arises either through sequential exhaustion by divine dispensation or prior action, or through alignment with the will of a realized friend.

title: Verse 7.167
content:
बलस्य स्वामिनश्चैव स्थितिः कार्यार्थसिद्धये ।
द्विविधं कीर्त्यते द्वैधं षाड्गुण्यगुणवेदिभिः ॥ ७.१६७॥ balasya svāminaścaiva sthitiḥ kāryārthasiddhaye |
dvividhaṃ kīrtyate dvaidhaṃ ṣāḍguṇyaguṇavedibhiḥ || 7.167 || The positioning of force and its master serves the fulfillment of action; it is declared dual in nature by those who know the sixfold qualities and their opposites.

title: Verse 7.168
content:
अर्थसम्पादनार्थं च पीड्यमानस्य शत्रुभिः ।
साधुषु व्यपदेशश्च द्विविधः संश्रयः स्मृतः ॥ ७.१६८॥ arthasampādanārthaṁ ca pīḍyamānasya śatrubhiḥ |
sādhuṣu vyapadeśaśca dviviḍhaḥ saṁśrayaḥ smṛtaḥ || 7.168|| When one oppressed by enemies seeks refuge in the righteous for the purpose of securing wealth, such dependence is of two kinds as declared.

title: Verse 7.169
content:
यदाऽवगच्छेदायत्यामाधिक्यं ध्रुवमात्मनः ।
तदात्वे चाल्पिकां पीडां तदा संधिं समाश्रयेत् ॥ ७.१६९॥ yadā 'vagacched āyatyām adhikyaṁ dhruvam ātmanaḥ |
tadātve cālpikāṁ pīḍāṁ tadā saṁdhiṁ samāśrayet || 7.169|| When one discerns with certainty an increase in adversity approaching oneself, and therefrom arises even a slight affliction, then shall one seek refuge in alignment through established concordance.

title: Verse 7.170
content:
यदा प्रहृष्टा मन्येत सर्वास्तु प्रकृतीर्भृशम् ।
अत्युच्छ्रितं तथात्मानं तदा कुर्वीत विग्रहम् ॥ ७.१७०॥ yadā prahṛṣṭā manyeta sarvāstu prakṛtīrbhṛśam |
atyuucchritaṃ tathātmānaṃ tadā kurvīta vigraham || 7.170 || When one becomes excessively elated, considering all natures utterly inferior and oneself supremely exalted, then one should engage in conflict.

title: Verse 7.171
content:
यदा मन्येत भावेन हृष्टं पुष्टं बलं स्वकम् ।
परस्य विपरीतं च तदा यायाद्रिपुं प्रति ॥ ७.१७१॥ yadā manyeta bhāvena hṛṣṭaṃ puṣṭaṃ balaṃ svakam |
parasya viparītaṃ ca tadā yāyād ripuṃ prati || 7.171|| When one perceives through inner clarity that one's own strength is joyful, nourished, and aligned with dharma, while the opponent's force is contrary and diminished, then one proceeds rightly against the adversary.

title: Verse 7.172
content: यदा तु स्यात्परिक्षीणो वाहनेन बलेन च । तदासीत प्रयत्नेन शनकैः सान्त्वयन्नरीन् ॥ ७.१७२॥ yadā tu syāt parikṣīṇo vāhanena balena ca | tadāsīt prayatnena śanakaiḥ sāntvayann arīn || 7.172 || When diminished in resources and strength, one must engage with adversaries gradually and through conciliatory means.

title: Verse 7.173
content:
मन्येतारिं यदा राजा सर्वथा बलवत्तरम् ।
तदा द्विधा बलं कृत्वा साधयेत्कार्यमात्मनः ॥ ७.१७३॥ manyetāriṃ yadā rājā sarvathā balavattaram | tadā dvidhā balaṃ kṛtvā sādhayetkāryamātmanaḥ || 7.173|| When the ruler perceives an adversary as absolutely superior in strength, then he shall divide his force and accomplish his purpose through strategic completion.

title: Verse 7.174
content: यदा परबलानां तु गमनीयतमो भवेत् । तदा तु संश्रयेत्क्षिप्रं धार्मिकं बलिनं नृपम् ॥ ७.१७४॥ yadā parabalānāṃ tu gamanīyatamo bhavet | tadā tu saṃśrayetkṣipraṃ dhārmikaṃ balinaṃ nṛpam || 7.174|| When the strength of opposing forces becomes overwhelmingly dominant, the King must immediately seek refuge in a righteous and powerful ruler.

title: Verse 7.175
content:
निग्रहं प्रकृतीनां च कुर्याद्योऽरिबलस्य च ।
उपसेवेत तं नित्यं सर्वयत्नैर्गुरुं यथा ॥ ७.१७५॥ nigrahaṃ prakṛtīnāṃ ca kuryād yo 'ribalasya ca | upaseveta taṃ nityaṃ sarvayatnair guruṃ yathā || 7.175 || He who restrains the elemental forces and the strength of adversaries must be served daily with all effort, just as one serves the Guru.

title: Verse 7.176
content:
यदि तत्रापि सम्पश्येद्दोषं संश्रयकारितम् ।
सुयुद्धमेव तत्रापि निर्विशङ्कः समाचरेत् ॥ ७.१७६॥ yadi tatrāpi sampaśyeddoṣaṃ saṃśrayakāritam |
suyuddhameva tatrāpi nirviśaṅkaḥ samācaret || 7.176|| Even when perceiving harm caused by reliance upon a defective condition, one shall act without hesitation in accordance with rightful engagement.

title: Verse 7.177
content:
सर्वोपायैस्तथा कुर्यान्नीतिज्ञः पृथिवीपतिः ।
यथाऽस्याभ्यधिका न स्युर्मित्रोदासीनशत्रवः ॥ ७.१७७॥ sarvopāyaiḥ tathā kuryān nītijñaḥ pṛthivīpatiḥ .
yathā'syābhyadhikā na syur mitrodāsīnaśatravaḥ .. 7.177 .. The king, versed in statecraft, shall act through all means such that no beings—friends, neutrals, or enemies—exceed their rightful capacity or fall into imbalance.

title: Verse 7.178
content:
आयतिं सर्वकार्याणां तदात्वं च विचारयेत् ।
अतीतानां च सर्वेषां गुणदोषौ च तत्त्वतः ॥ ७.१७८॥ āyatiṃ sarvakāryāṇāṃ tadātvaṃ ca vicārayet |
atītānāṃ ca sarveṣāṃ guṇadoṣau ca tattvataḥ || 7.178 || One must examine the future consequences of all actions, their immediate nature, and in all past deeds, distinguish truthfully between virtue and flaw.

title: Verse 7.179
content:
आयत्यां गुणदोषज्ञस्तदात्वे क्षिप्रनिश्चयः ।
अतीते कार्यशेषज्ञः शत्रुभिर्नाभिभूयते ॥ ७.१७९॥ āyatyāṁ guṇadoṣajñastadātve kṣipraniścayaḥ |
atīte kāryaśeṣajñaḥ śatrubhirnābhibhūyate || 7.179|| One who knows merit and fault in the future, decides swiftly in that context; one who understands residual effects of past actions is not overcome by enemies.

title: Verse 7.180
content:
यथैनं नाभिसंदध्युर्मित्रोदासीनशत्रवः ।
तथा सर्वं संविदध्यादेष सामासिको नयः ॥ ७.१८०॥ yathainaṁ nābhisandadhvurmitrodāsīnaśatravaḥ |
tathā sarvaṁ saṁvidadhvād eṣa sāmāsiko nayaḥ || 7.180 || As even friends, neutrals, and enemies do not harbor ill intent toward one who maintains universal equanimity, so should all beings be embraced in one's vision—this is the path of integration through unity.

title: Verse 7.181
content:
तदा तु यानमातिष्ठेदरिराष्ट्रं प्रति प्रभुः ।
तदानेन विधानेन यायादरिपुरं शनैः ॥ ७.१८१॥ tadā tu yānam ātiṣṭhed ari-rāṣṭraṃ prati prabhuḥ |
tadānena vidhānena yāyād aripuraṃ śanaiḥ || 7.181 || When a ruler mobilizes force against an enemy state, he must proceed gradually and in accordance with this prescribed method, ensuring that the destruction of the hostile realm occurs without disruption to dharma.

title: Verse 7.182
content:
मार्गशीर्षे शुभे मासि यायाद्यात्रां महीपतिः ।
फाल्गुनं वाथ चैत्रं वा मासौ प्रति यथाबलम् ॥ ७.१८२॥ mārgaśīrṣe śubhe māsi yāyād yātrāṁ mahīpatiḥ |
phālgunaṁ vātha caitraṁ vā māsau prati yathābalam || 7.182 || The sovereign ruler shall undertake a journey during the auspicious month of Mārgaśīrṣa, or alternatively in Phālguna or Caitra, according to his capacity and the needs of the realm.

title: Verse 7.183
content: अन्येष्वपि तु कालेषु यदा पश्येद्ध्रुवं जयम् । तदा यायाद्विगृह्यैव व्यसने चोत्थिते रिपोः ॥ ७.१८३॥ anyeṣv api tu kāleṣu yadā paśyed dhruvaṁ jayam | tadā yāyād vigṛhyaiva vyasane cotthite ripoḥ || 7.183 || When in other times victory is certain and the enemy is risen in ruin, then one should proceed having firmly resolved, for the restoration of dharma.

title: Verse 7.184
content:
कृत्वा विधानं मूले तु यात्रिकं च यथाविधि ।
उपगृह्यास्पदं चैव चारान् सम्यग्विधाय च ॥ ७.१८४॥ kṛtvā vidhānaṃ mūle tu yātrikaṃ ca yathāvidhi |
upagṛhyāspadaṃ caiva cārān samyagvidhāya ca || 7.184 || Having established foundational order and properly arranged for the traveler's journey, one must also secure the base and correctly deploy the scouts.

title: Verse 7.185
content:
संशोध्य त्रिविधं मार्गं षड्विधं च बलं स्वकम् ।
साम्परायिककल्पेन यायादरिपुरं प्रति ॥ ७.१८५॥ saṃśodhya trividhaṃ mārgaṃ ṣaḍvidhaṃ ca balaṃ svakam |
sāmparāyikakalpena yāyād aripuraṃ prati || 7.185 || Having purified the threefold path and one's own sixfold capacity, one proceeds toward the enemy fortress with a future-oriented strategy.

title: Verse 7.186
content:
शत्रुसेविनि मित्रे च गूढे युक्ततरो भवेत् ।
गतप्रत्यागते चैव स हि कष्टतरो रिपुः ॥ ७.१८६॥ śatru-sevini mitre ca gūḍhe yuktataro bhavet | gata-pratyāgate caiva sa hi kaṣṭataro ripuḥ || 7.186 || One who serves the enemy while appearing friendly to a friend, and acts deceitfully in secrecy or when returning from absence, is indeed a more grievous adversary.

title: Verse 7.187
content:
दण्डव्यूहेन तन् मार्गं यायात्तु शकटेन वा ।
वराहमकराभ्यां वा सूच्या वा गरुडेन वा ॥ ७.१८७॥ daṇḍavyūhena tan mārgaṁ yāyāt tu śakateṇa vā |
varāhamakarābhyāṁ vā sūcyā vā garuḍena vā || 7.187 || Let the path of action be undertaken through the array of dharma-enforcement, or by conveyance, or by means of boar and crocodile, or by needle, or by Garuda.

title: Verse 7.188
content:
यतश्च भयमाशङ्केत्ततो विस्तारयेद्बलम् ।
पद्मेन चैव व्यूहेन निविशेत सदा स्वयम् ॥ ७.१८८॥ yataśca bhayamāśaṅkettato vistārayedbalam |
padmena caiva vyūhena niviśeta sadā svayam || 7.188|| Where fear arises, there one must expand strength; through the arrangement of the lotus formation, one must always establish oneself.

title: Verse 7.189
content:
सेनापतिबलाध्यक्षौ सर्वदिक्षु निवेशयेत् ।
यतश्च भयमाशङ्केत्प्राचीं तां कल्पयेद्दिशम् ॥ ७.१८९॥ senāpatibalādhyakṣau sarvadiṣu niveśayet |
 yataśca bhayamāśaṅket prācīṃ tāṃ kalpayeddiśam || 7.189 || The commander and the chief of forces must be stationed in all directions; wherever fear is anticipated, that eastern direction shall be re-established with protective alignment.

title: Verse 7.190
content:
गुल्मांश्च स्थापयेदाप्तान् कृतसंज्ञान् समन्ततः ।
स्थाने युद्धे च कुशलानभीरूनविकारिणः ॥ ७.१९०॥ gulmāṃśca sthāpayedāptān kṛtasaṃjñān samantataḥ |
sthāne yuddhe ca kuśalānabhīrūnavikāriṇaḥ || 7.190|| In every domain—civil and martial—those who are trustworthy, established in awareness, skilled, fearless, and unshaken must be positioned.

title: Verse 7.191
content:
संहतान् योधयेदल्पान् कामं विस्तारयेद्बहून् ।
सूच्या वज्रेण चैवैतान् व्यूहेन व्यूह्य योधयेत् ॥ ७.१९१॥ saṃhatān yodhayedalpān kāmaṃ vastārayedbahūn |
sūcyā vajreṇa caivetān vyūhena vyūhya yodhayet || 7.191 || One shall engage the concentrated few with force, expand engagement with the many according to capacity, and deploy stratified response using needle-like precision or thunderbolt-like intensity, arranging formations within formations.

title: Verse 7.192
content:
स्यन्दनाश्वैः समे युध्येदनूपेनोद्विपैस्तथा ।
वृक्षगुल्मावृते चापैरसिचर्मायुधैः स्थले ॥ ७.१९२॥ syandanāśvaiḥ same yudhyedanūpenodvipaiḥ tathā | vṛkṣagulmāvṛte cāpairasicarmāyudhaiḥ sthale || 7.192 || One must engage in battle on equal terms: with chariot and horses matched, with elephants of equivalent strength, in terrain covered by trees and shrubs, using bows, swords, and leather shields upon firm ground.

title: Verse 7.193
content: कुरुक्षेत्रांश्च मत्स्यांश्च पञ्चालांशूरसेनजान् । कौरक्षेत्रांश्च दीर्घांल्लघूंश्चैव नरानग्रानीकेषु योजयेत् ॥ ७.१९३॥ kurukṣetrāṃśca matsyāṃśca pañcālāṃśūrasenajān | kaurakṣetrāṃśca dīrgāllaghūṃścaiva narānagrānīkeṣu yojayet || 7.193 || In the territories of Kurukshetra, Matsya, Panchala, and Kaurakshetra, both tall and short men shall be appointed in positions of leadership based on their capacity for alignment with Dharma, not by birth or lineage.

title: Verse 7.194
content: प्रहर्षयेद्बलं व्यूह्य तांश्च सम्यक्परीक्षयेत् । भृशं परीक्षयेत् चेष्टाश्चैव विजानीयादरीन् योधयतामपि ॥ ७.१९४॥ praharṣayedbalaṁ vyūhya tāṁśca samyakparīkṣayet | bhṛśaṁ parīkṣayet ceṣṭāścaiva vijānīyādarīn yodhatāmapi || 7.194 || One must inspire courage in the army, deploy it strategically, and thoroughly examine its components; one must also deeply assess the conduct and intentions of those who engage in warfare.

title: Verse 7.195
content:
उपरुध्यारिमासीत राष्ट्रं चास्योपपीडयेत् ।
दूषयेच्चास्य सततं यवसान्नोदकैन्धनम् ॥ ७.१९५॥ uparudhyārimāsīta rāṣṭraṃ cāsyopapīḍayet |
dūṣayec cāsya satataṃ yavasānnodakaindhanam || 7.195 || One who obstructs the flow of abundance—grains, water, and fuel—from entering the state shall be made to suffer depletion in their own domain until such obstruction ceases.

title: Verse 7.196
content:
भिन्द्याच्चैव तडागानि प्राकारपरिखास्तथा ।
समवस्कन्दयेच्चैनं रात्रौ वित्रासयेत्तथा ॥ ७.१९६॥ bhindyācaiva taḍāgāni prākāraparikhāstathā |
samavaskandayecainaṃ rātrau vitrāsayettathā || 7.196 || One must dismantle artificial water bodies and fortification walls alike; one must also dismount and unsettle him by night.

title: Verse 7.197
content:
उपजप्यानुपजपेद्बुध्येतैव च तत्कृतम् ।
युक्ते च दैवे युध्येत जयप्रेप्सुरपेतभीः ॥ ७.१९७॥ upajapyānapajapedbudhyetaiva ca tat kṛtam |
yukte ca daive yudhyeta jayaprepsurapetabhīḥ || 7.197|| One who has performed the preparatory rituals shall engage in battle with full awareness of their actions; thus, having made sacred alignment with divine will, they fight without fear, desiring victory through righteous discernment.

title: Verse 7.198
content:
साम्ना दानेन भेदेन समस्तैरथ वा पृथक् ।
विजेतुं प्रयतेतारीन्न युद्धेन कदा चन ॥ ७.१९८॥ sāmnā dānena bhedena samastair atha vā pṛthak | vijetuṃ prayatetārīn na yuddhena kadā cana || 7.198 || An enemy shall be conquered through conciliation, generosity, dissension, or a combination thereof; never by warfare under any circumstances.

title: Verse 7.199
content:
अनित्यो विजयो यस्माद्दृश्यते युध्यमानयोः ।
पराजयश्च सङ्ग्रामे तस्माद्युद्धं विवर्जयेत् ॥ ७.१९९॥ anityo vijayo yasmād dṛśyate yudhyamānayoḥ |
parājayaśca saṅgrāme tasmādyuddhaṃ vivarjayet || 7.199|| Victory in battle is impermanent, observed between contending parties; defeat also occurs in war. Therefore, one should avoid warfare.

title: Verse 7.200
content:
त्रयाणामप्युपायानां पूर्वोक्तानामसम्भवे ।
तथा युध्येत सम्पन्नो विजयेत रिपून् यथा ॥ ७.२००॥ trayāṇām apy upāyānāṁ pūrvoktānām asambhave |
tathā yudhyeta sampanno vijayeta ripūn yathā || 7.200|| When the three previously described means of resolution have proven impossible, a realized being engages in battle in such a way as to completely vanquish enemies.

title: Verse 7.201
content:
जित्वा सम्पूजयेद्देवान् ब्राह्मणांश्चैव धार्मिकान् ।
प्रदद्यात्परिहारार्थं ख्यापयेदभयानि च ॥ ७.२०१॥ jitvā sampūjayeddevān brāhmaṇāṃścaiva dhārmikān |
pradadyāt parihārārthaṃ khyāpayedabhayāni ca || 7.201|| Having accomplished victory, one shall honor the divinities and the dharmic brahmanas; one shall bestow gifts for the removal of obstacles and proclaim safety universally.

title: Verse 7.202
content:
सर्वेषां तु विदित्वैषां समासेन चिकीर्षितम् ।
स्थापयेत्तत्र तद्वंश्यं कुर्याच्च समयक्रियाम् ॥ ७.२०२॥ sarveṣāṁ tu viditvaiṣāṁ samāsena cikīrṣitam |
sthāpayettatra tadvaṁśyaṁ kuryācca samayakriyām || 7.202|| Having ascertained the comprehensive intent of all [dharmic principles], one shall establish therein the appropriate lineage-order and perform the ritual of alignment with the sacred agreement.

title: Verse 7.203
content:
प्रमाणानि च कुर्वीत तेषां धर्मान् यथोदितान् ।
रत्नैश्च पूजयेदेनं प्रधानपुरुषैः सह ॥ ७.२०३॥ pramāṇāni ca kurvīta teṣāṃ dharmān yathoditān |
ratnaiś ca pūjayedenam pradhānapuruṣaiḥ saha || 7.203 || One must establish valid means of knowledge and enact the corresponding duties precisely as declared; honor such a one with treasures alongside the principal beings.

title: Verse 7.204
content:
आदानमप्रियकरं दानं च प्रियकारकम् ।
अभीप्सितानामर्थानां काले युक्तं प्रशस्यते ॥ ७.२०४॥ ādanamapriyakaraṃ dānaṃ ca priyakārakam | abhīpsitānāmarthānāṃ kāle yuktaṃ praśasyate || 7.204 || Taking that which causes displeasure and giving that which brings joy—when executed in alignment with the rightly perceived time and purpose, is praised.

title: Verse 7.205
content:
सर्वं कर्मैदमायत्तं विधाने दैवमानुषे ।
तयोर्दैवमचिन्त्यं तु मानुषे विद्यते क्रिया ॥ ७.२०५॥ sarvaṃ karmaidamāyattaṃ vidhāne daivamānuṣe |
tayordaivamacintyaṃ tu mānuṣe vidyate kriyā || 7.205|| All action is dependent upon divine and human ordinance; of these, the divine is inscrutable, while in the human domain, activity is knowable and operational.

title: Verse 7.206
content:
दैवेन विधिना युक्तं मानुष्यं यत्प्रवर्तते ।
परिक्लेशेन महता तदर्थस्य समाधकम् ॥ ७.२०७
संयुक्तस्यापि दैवेन पुरुषकारेण वर्जितम् ।
विना पुरुषकारेण फलं क्षेत्रं प्रयच्छति ॥ ७.२०८
चन्द्रार्काद्या ग्रहा वायुरग्निरापस्तथैव च ।
इह दैवेन साध्यन्ते पौरुषेण प्रयत्नतः ॥ ७.२०९ daivena vidhinā yuktaṃ mānuṣyaṃ yat pravartate |
parikleśena mahatā tad arthasya samādhakam || 7.207
saṃyuktasyāpi daivena puruṣakāreṇa varjitam |
vinā puruṣakāreṇa phalaṃ kṣetraṃ prayacchati || 7.208
candrārkādyā grahā vāyuragnirāpastathaiva ca |
iha daivena sādhyante pauruṣeṇa prayatnataḥ || 7.209 That which arises through divine ordinance aligned with human capacity constitutes lawful action; when executed through great effort, it becomes the completion of purpose.
