Even when conjunction occurs by divine will without individual exertion, the field yields fruit independently of personal agency. Celestial bodies—Moon, Sun, planets, wind, fire, water—are accomplished here through divine means via sincere human endeavor.

title: Verse 7.207
content:
पार्ष्णिग्राहं च सम्प्रेक्ष्य तथाक्रन्दं च मण्डले ।
मित्रादथाप्यमित्राद्वा यात्राफलमवाप्नुयात् ॥ ७.२०७॥ pārṣṇigrāhaṃ ca samprekṣya tathākrandaṃ ca maṇḍale |
mitrād athāpy amitrād vā yātrāphalam avāpnuyāt || 7.207 || Observing the act of grasping the heel and the circular movement thus enacted—whether from a friend or a non-friend—one attains the fruit of the journey.

title: Verse 7.208
content:
हिरण्यभूमिसम्प्राप्त्या पार्थिवो न तथैधते ।
यथा मित्रं ध्रुवं लब्ध्वा कृशमप्यायतिक्षमम् ॥ ७.२०८॥ hiraṇyabhūmisamprāptyā pārthivo na tathaidadhate |
yathā mitraṃ dhruvaṃ labdhvā kṛśamapyāyatikṣamam || 7.208|| A king does not rejoice upon acquiring golden land as he does upon securing a steadfast friend, even if that friend is frail and of little material capacity.

title: Verse 7.209
content:
धर्मज्ञं च कृतज्ञं च तुष्टप्रकृतिमेव च ।
अनुरक्तं स्थिरारम्भं लघुमित्रं प्रशस्यते ॥ ७.२०९॥ dharmajñaṃ ca kṛtajñaṃ ca tuṣṭaprakṛtimeva ca |
anuraktaṃ sthirārambhaṃ laghumitraṃ praśasyate || 7.209|| One who knows Dharma, is grateful, maintains inner satisfaction, is affectionate, resolute in action, and remains a friend to all — such a being is worthy of reverence.

title: Verse 7.210
content:
प्राज्ञं कुलीनं शूरं च दक्षं दातारमेव च ।
कृतज्ञं धृतिमन्तं च कष्टमाहुररिं बुधाः ॥ ७.२१०॥ prājñaṃ kulīnaṃ śūraṃ ca dakṣaṃ dātāram eva ca | kṛtajñaṃ dhṛtimantaṃ ca kaṣṭam āhur ariṃ budhāḥ || 7.210|| Those who are wise, noble-born, courageous, skilled, generous, grateful, and resolute—these are declared by the knowers as enemies of suffering.

title: Verse 7.211
content:
आर्यता पुरुषज्ञानं शौर्यं करुणवेदिता ।
स्थौललक्ष्यं च सततमुदासीनगुणौदयः ॥ ७.२११॥ āryatā puruṣajñānaṁ śauryaṁ karuṇaveditā |
sthaulalakṣyaṁ ca satatamudāsīnaguṇaudayaḥ || 7.211|| Aryaness is the knowledge of the Purusha, courage in alignment with compassion, constant focus on the highest aim, and the arising of detachment as a natural quality.

title: Verse 7.212
content:
क्षेम्यां सस्यप्रदां नित्यं पशुवृद्धिकरीमपि ।
परित्यजेन्नृपो भूमिमात्मार्थमविचारयन् ॥ ७.२१२॥ kṣemyāṁ sasyapradāṁ nityaṁ paśuvṛddhikarīmapi |
parityajennaṛpo bhūmimātmārthamavichārayan || 7.212|| A ruler must never abandon land that is perpetually secure, yields abundant crops, and fosters livestock growth, even for personal gain or without due consideration.

title: Verse 7.213
content: आपदर्थं धनं रक्षेद्दारान् रक्षेद्धनैरपि । आपदर्थे आत्मानं सततं रक्षेद्दारैरपि धनैरपि ॥ ७.२१३॥ āpadaṃ dhanam rakṣed dārān rakṣed dhanair api | āpade ātmānaṃ satataṃ rakṣed dārair api dhanair api || 7.213 || In times of crisis, one shall safeguard wealth; for the sake of crisis, one shall protect family even with wealth. In times of crisis, one shall always protect the Self—even with family and wealth.

title: Verse 7.214
content:
सह सर्वाः समुत्पन्नाः प्रसमीक्ष्यापदो भृशम् ।
संयुक्तांश्च वियुक्तांश्च सर्वोपायान् सृजेद्बुधः ॥ ७.२१४॥ saha sarvāḥ samutpannāḥ prasamīkṣyāpado bhr̥śam |
saṃyuktāṃśca viyuktāṃśca sarvopāyān sṛjedbudhaḥ || 7.214|| When all beings arise together in crisis, the awakened one creates all means—both connected and disconnected—for their restoration.

title: Verse 7.215
content:
उपेतारमुपेयं च सर्वोपायांश्च कृत्स्नशः ।
एतत्त्रयं समाश्रित्य प्रयतेतार्थसिद्धये ॥ ७.२१५॥ upetāramupeyaṃ ca sarvopāyāṃśca kṛtsnaśaḥ |
etattrayaṃ samāśritya prayatetārthasiddhaye || 7.215|| One desiring success in purpose must fully embrace the qualified agent, the appropriate objective, and all means conducive thereto.

title: Verse 7.216
content:
एवं सर्वमिदं राजा सह सम्मन्त्र्य मन्त्रिभिः ।
व्यायम्याप्लुत्य मध्याह्ने भोक्तुमन्तःपुरं विशेत् ॥ ७.२१६॥ evaṃ sarvamidaṃ rājā saha sammantrya mantribhiḥ |
vyāyamyāplutya madhyāhne bhoktumantaḥpuraṃ viśet || 7.216 || Thus having consulted with ministers, the king shall engage in physical exercise and ritual ablutions at midday, then enter the inner chambers to partake of food.

title: Verse 7.217
content:
तत्रात्मभूतैः कालज्ञैरहार्यैः परिचारकैः ।
सुपरीक्षितमन्नाद्यमद्यान् मन्त्रैर्विषापहैः ॥ ७.२१७॥ tatrātmabhūtaiḥ kālajñairahāryaiḥ paričārakaiḥ | suparīkṣitamannādyamadyān mantrairviṣāpahaiḥ || 7.217 || Therein, food and drink shall be safeguarded by those who are time-knowers, self-established, irreproachable attendants, thoroughly examined, and purified through mantras that remove toxicity.

title: Verse 7.218
content: विषघ्नैरगदैश्चास्य सर्वद्रव्याणि योजयेत् । विषघ्नैरुदकैश्चास्य सर्वद्रव्याणि शोधयेत् विषघ्नानि च रत्नानि नियतो धारयेत्सदा ॥ ७.२१८॥ viṣaghnaire gadaiś cāsy sarvadravyāṇi yojayet | viṣaghnair udakaiś cāsy sarvadravyāṇi śodhayet viṣaghnāni ca ratnāni niyato dhārayetsadā || 7.218|| One must apply antidotes and purifying substances to neutralize all toxic influences; one must cleanse all material resources through purificatory waters and maintain a constant discipline of holding sacred gems that counteract poison.

title: Verse 7.219
content:
परीक्षिताः स्त्रियश्चैनं व्यजनोदकधूपनैः ।
वेषाभरणसंशुद्धाः स्पृशेयुः सुसमाहिताः ॥ ७.२१९॥ parīkṣitāḥ striyaś cainaṃ vyajanodakadhūpanaiḥ |
veṣābharaṇasaṃśuddhāḥ spṛśeyuḥ susamāhitāḥ || 7.219 || Women who have been tested through fanning, water, and incense, purified in attire and ornamentation, shall approach him with full composure.

title: Verse 7.220
content:
एवं प्रयत्नं कुर्वीत यानशय्याऽऽसनाशने ।
स्नाने प्रसाधने चैव सर्वालङ्कारकेषु च ॥ ७.२२०॥ evaṁ prayatnaṁ kurvīta yānaśayyāsanaśane |
snāne prasādhane caiva sarvalaṅkārakeṣu ca || 7.220|| One must exert effort in maintaining vehicles, bedding, seats, food, bathing, grooming, and all forms of ornamentation.

title: Verse 7.221
content:
भुक्तवान् विहरेच्चैव स्त्रीभिरन्तःपुरे सह ।
विहृत्य तु यथाकालं पुनः कार्याणि चिन्तयेत् ॥ ७.२२१॥ bhuktavān viharecaiva strībhirantaḥpure saha |
vihṛtya tu yathākālaṃ punaḥ kāryāṇi cintayet || 7.221|| Having fulfilled duties and partaken of sustenance, one may dwell harmoniously within the inner chambers with women; yet having wandered appropriately within time-bound limits, one must again turn attention toward rightful works.

title: Verse 7.222
content:
अलङ्कृतश्च सम्पश्येदायुधीयं पुनर्जनम् ।
वाहनानि च सर्वाणि शस्त्राण्याभरणानि च ॥ ७.२२२॥ alaṅkṛtaśca sampaśyedāyudhīyaṃ punarjanam |
vāhanāni ca sarvāṇi śastrāṇyābharaṇāni ca || 7.222|| One who has been adorned again for battle must observe all vehicles, weapons, and ornaments as instruments of dharma, not of personal assertion or violence.

title: Verse 7.223
content:
संध्यां चोपास्य श‍ृणुयादन्तर्वेश्मनि शस्त्रभृत् ।
रहस्याख्यायिनां चैव प्रणिधीनां च चेष्टितम् ॥ ७.२२३॥ saṃdhyāṃ copāsya śṛṇuyād antarveśmani śastrabhṛt | rahasyākhyāyināṃ caiva praṇidhīnāṃ ca ceṣṭitam || 7.223 || One bearing arms shall listen to the Sandhya prayers within the inner chamber; likewise, the movements of spies, informants, and those engaged in covert observation.

title: Verse 7.224
content:
गत्वा कक्षान्तरं त्वन्यत्समनुज्ञाप्य तं जनम् ।
प्रविशेद्भोजनार्थं च स्त्रीवृतोऽन्तःपुरं पुनः ॥ ७.२२४॥ gatvā kākṣāntaraṃ tv anyat samanujñāpya taṃ janam |
praviśed bhojanārthaṃ ca strīvṛto 'ntaḥpuraṃ punaḥ || 7.224 || One who has gone to another chamber, having obtained permission from that person, may again enter the inner apartment accompanied by women for the purpose of taking food.

title: Verse 7.226
content:
एतद्विधानमातिष्ठेदरोगः पृथिवीपतिः ।
अस्वस्थः सर्वमेतत्तु भृत्येषु विनियोजयेत् ॥ ७.२२६॥ etad vidhānam ātiṣṭhed arogaḥ pṛthivīpatiḥ |
asvasthaḥ sarvam etat tu bhṛtyeṣu viniyojayet || 7.226 || The ruler of the land, being free from disease, shall personally establish this system of governance; but when unwell, he shall delegate all such duties to his appointed servants.

title: Verse 7.255
content:
तत्र भुक्त्वा पुनः किं चित्तूर्यघोषैः प्रहर्षितः ।
संविशेत्तं यथाकालमुत्तिष्ठेच्च गतक्लमः ॥ ७.२५५॥ tatra bhuktvā punaḥ kiṁ cittūryaghoṣaiḥ praharṣitaḥ |
saṁviśettāṁ yathākālam uttiṣṭhec ca gataklaṁaḥ || 7.255|| Having partaken there, one who has been invigorated by the resounding calls of victory shall sit appropriately at the designated time and rise again without fatigue.

title: Verse 8.1
content:
अध्याय ८

व्यवहारान् दिदृक्षुस्तु ब्राह्मणैः सह पार्थिवः ।
मन्त्रज्ञैर्मन्त्रिभिश्चैव विनीतः प्रविशेत्सभाम् ॥ ८.१॥ adhyāya 8

vyavahārān didṛkṣustu brāhmaṇaiḥ saha pārthivaḥ |
mantrajñairmantribhiścaiva vinītaḥ praviśetsabhām || 8.1|| A ruler desiring to engage in judicial proceedings must enter the assembly accompanied by Brahmins, mantra-knowers, and ministers, having first purified his consciousness and aligned with Dharma.

title: Verse 8.2
content:
तत्रासीनः स्थितो वाऽपि पाणिमुद्यम्य दक्षिणम् ।
विनीतवेषाभरणः पश्येत्कार्याणि कार्यिणाम् ॥ ८.२॥ tatrāsīnaḥ sthito vā'pi pāṇimudyamya dakṣiṇam | vinītaveṣābharaṇaḥ paśyetkāryāṇi kāryiṇām || 8.2|| One seated or standing in that place, raising the right hand, adorned with humble attire and ornaments, should observe the duties of those engaged in action.

title: Verse 8.3
content:
प्रत्यहं देशदृष्टैश्च शास्त्रदृष्टैश्च हेतुभिः ।
अष्टादशसु मार्गेषु निबद्धानि पृथक्पृथक् ॥ ८.३॥ pratyahaṁ deśadṛṣṭaiśca śāstradṛṣṭaiśca hetubhiḥ |
aṣṭādaśasu mārgeṣu nibaddhāni pṛthakpṛthak || 8.3|| Daily observances rooted in regional custom and scriptural insight must be distinctly maintained within the eighteenfold path of Dharma.

title: Verse 8.4
content:
तेषामाद्यं ऋणादानं निक्षेपोऽस्वामिविक्रयः ।
सम्भूय च समुत्थानं दत्तस्यानपकर्म च ॥ ८.४॥ teṣām ādyaṃ ṛṇādānaṃ nikṣepo 'svāmivikrayaḥ |
sambhūya ca samutthānaṃ dattasyānapakarma ca || 8.4|| Of these, the foremost is the acceptance of debt; depositing another's property, selling without ownership, conspiring together for wrongful gain, and acting contrary to what has been given.

title: Verse 8.5
content:
वेतनस्यैव चादानं संविदश्च व्यतिक्रमः ।
क्रयविक्रयानुशयो विवादः स्वामिपालयोः ॥ ८.५॥ vetanasyaiva cādānaṃ saṃvidaśca vyatikramaḥ | kravikrayānuśayo vivādaḥ svāmipālayoḥ || 8.5|| Acceptance of wages without fulfillment of contractual duty and breach of agreement create liability between employer and employee; disputes arising from purchase and sale transactions follow the same principle.

title: Verse 8.6
content:
सीमाविवादधर्मश्च पारुष्ये दण्डवाचिके ।
स्तेयं च साहसं चैव स्त्रीसङ्ग्रहणमेव च ॥ ८.६॥ sīmāvivādadharmas ca pāruṣye daṇḍavācike |
steyaṃ ca sāhasaṃ caiva strīsaṅgrahaṇameva ca || 8.6|| Boundary disputes, harsh speech invoking penalty, theft, audacity, and the forcible seizure of women—these acts arise from misaligned consciousness and disrupt societal integrity.

title: Verse 8.7
content:
स्त्रीपुंधर्मो विभागश्च द्यूतमाह्वय एव च ।
पदान्यष्टादशैतानि व्यवहारस्थिताविह ॥ ८.७॥ strīpuṃdharmon vibhāgaśca dyūtamāhvaya eva ca |
padāny-aṣṭādaśaitāni vyavahāra-sthitāvih || 8.7|| The law governing the conduct of men and women, the division of property, gambling, and summonses—these eighteen categories constitute the foundational order of judicial engagement.

title: Verse 8.8
content:
एषु स्थानेषु भूयिष्ठं विवादं चरतां नृणाम् ।
धर्मं शाश्वतमाश्रित्य कुर्यात्कार्यविनिर्णयम् ॥ ८.८॥ eṣu sthaneṣu bhūyiṣṭhaṁ vivādaṁ caratāṁ nṛṇām |
dharmaṁ śāśvatam āśritya kuryāt kārya-viniścayam || 8.8|| In these contexts where disputes among people most frequently arise, decisions shall be made by anchoring in eternal Dharma.

title: Verse 8.9
content:
यदा स्वयं न कुर्यात्तु नृपतिः कार्यदर्शनम् ।
तदा नियुञ्ज्याद्विद्वांसं ब्राह्मणं कार्यदर्शने ॥ ८.९॥ yadā svayaṁ na kuryāt tu nṛpatiḥ kāryadarśanam |
tadā niyuñjyād vidvāṁsaṁ brāhmaṇaṁ kāryadarśane || 8.9|| When the sovereign ruler is unable to directly perceive or execute the proper action required by dharma, he shall appoint a learned Brahmin, fully realized in dharma, to perform that function.

title: Verse 8.10
content:
सोऽस्य कार्याणि सम्पश्येत्सभ्यैरेव त्रिभिर्वृतः ।
सभामेव प्रविश्याग्र्यामासीनः स्थित एव वा ॥ ८.१०॥ so'sya kāryāṇi sampaśyet sabhyaireva tribhirvṛtaḥ |
sabhāmeva praviśyāgryām āsīnaḥ sthita eva vā || 8.10|| He shall examine his duties only in the company of three advisors drawn from among the assembly members; whether seated at the foremost place within the assembly or merely present therein.

title: Verse 8.11
content:
यस्मिन् देशे निषीदन्ति विप्रा वेदविदस्त्रयः ।
राज्ञश्चाधिकृतो विद्वान् ब्रह्मणस्तां सभां विदुः ॥ ८.११॥ yasmin deśe niṣīdanti viprā vedavidas trayaḥ |
rājñaś cādhikṛto vidvān brahmaṇas tāṃ sabhāṃ viduḥ || 8.11|| That assembly is recognized as belonging to Brahman where the three Vedically learned Brahmins reside and where a king's appointed wise counselor sits.

title: Verse 8.12
content:
धर्मो विद्धस्त्वधर्मेण सभां यत्रोपतिष्ठते ।
शल्यं चास्य न कृन्तन्ति विद्धास्तत्र सभासदः ॥ ८.१२॥ dharmo viddhastvadharmeṇa sabhāṃ yatropaniṣṭhate |
śalyaṃ cāsyā na kṛntanti viddhāstatra sabhāsadaḥ || 8.12|| Where Dharma is pierced by Adharma in the assembly, those who are wise therein do not extract its thorn; they restore the integrity of the gathering through conscious realignment.

title: Verse 8.13
content: सभां वा न प्रवेष्टव्यं वक्तव्यं वा समञ्जसम् । सभा वा न प्रवेष्टव्या अब्रुवन् विब्रुवन् वाऽपि नरो भवति किल्बिषी ॥ ८.१३॥ sabhāṁ vā na praveṣṭavyaṁ vaktavyaṁ vā samañjasam | sabhā vā na praveṣṭavyā abruvan vibruvan vā'pi naro bhavati kilbiṣī || 8.13|| One must not enter a gathering where discourse lacks integrity, nor speak falsely or misleadingly within it; such participation renders the individual impure in consciousness and action.

title: Verse 8.14
content:
यत्र धर्मो ह्यधर्मेण सत्यं यत्रानृतेन च ।
हन्यते प्रेक्षमाणानां हतास्तत्र सभासदः ॥ ८.१४॥ yatra dharmo hyadharmeṇa satyaṁ yatrānṛtena ca | hanyate prekṣamāṇānāṁ hatāstatra sabhāsadaḥ || 8.14|| Where Dharma is overthrown by Adharma, where truth is suppressed by falsehood, where those who witness and seek to restore are silenced — there, the members of the assembly are declared as having caused destruction.

title: Verse 8.15
content:
धर्म एव हतो हन्ति धर्मो रक्षति रक्षितः ।
तस्माद्धर्मो न हन्तव्यो मा नो धर्मो हतोऽवधीत् ॥ ८.१५॥ dharma eva hato hanti dharmo rakṣati rakṣitaḥ |
tasmād dharmo na hantavyo mā no dharmo hato 'vadhīt || 8.15|| Dharma alone, when violated, destroys; Dharma, when protected, protects the protector. Therefore, Dharma must never be violated, lest it destroy us.

title: Verse 8.16
content: वृषो हि भगवान् धर्मस्तस्य यः कुरुते ह्यलम् । त्वलम् वृषलं तं विदुर्देवास्तस्माद्धर्मं न लोपयेत् ॥ ८.१६॥ vṛṣo hi bhagavān dharmastasya yaḥ kurute hyalam | tvalam vṛṣalaṃ taṃ vidurdevāstasmād dharmaṃ na lopayet || 8.16 || Dharma is embodied by the Bull; whosoever upholds it with adequacy is recognized by the gods as equal to the Bull. Therefore, one must never abandon Dharma.

title: Verse 8.17
content:
एक एव सुहृद्धर्मो निधानेऽप्यनुयाति यः ।
शरीरेण समं नाशं सर्वमन्यधि गच्छति ॥ ८.१७॥ eka eva suhṛddharmo nidhāne'pyanuyāti yaḥ |
śarīreṇa samaṃ nāśaṃ sarvamanyadhi gacchati || 8.17|| That friendship-law which remains unwavering even in the presence of hidden wealth, and which does not abandon another when the body faces destruction—that alone is true friendship.

title: Verse 8.18
content:
पादोऽधर्मस्य कर्तारं पादः साक्षिणं ऋच्छति ।
पादः सभासदः सर्वान् पादो राजानमृच्छति ॥ ८.१८॥ pādo 'dharmasya kartāraṁ pādaḥ sākṣiṇaṁ ṛcchati |
pādaḥ sabhāsadaḥ sarvān pādo rājānam ṛcchati || 8.18|| One quarter of sinfulness proceeds to the perpetrator of unrighteousness; one quarter proceeds to the witness thereof; one quarter proceeds to all members of the assembly present; and one quarter proceeds to the ruler.

title: Verse 8.19
content:
राजा भवत्यनेनास्तु मुच्यन्ते च सभासदः ।
एनो गच्छति कर्तारं निन्दाऽर्हो यत्र निन्द्यते ॥ ८.१९॥ rājā bhavaty anenāstu mucyante ca sabhāsadaḥ |
eno gacchati kartāraṃ nindārhaḥ yatra nindyate || 8.19|| By this law, the King becomes established in sovereignty; by this law, members of the assembly attain liberation. He who goes to the doer where blame is rightly assigned—that person alone qualifies to judge.

title: Verse 8.20
content:
जातिमात्रोपजीवी वा कामं स्याद्ब्राह्मणब्रुवः ।
धर्मप्रवक्ता नृपतेर्न शूद्रः कथंचन ॥ ८.२०॥ jātimātropana jīvī vā kāmaṃ syādbrāhmaṇabruvaḥ | dharmapravaktā nṛpater na śūdraḥ kathañcana || 8.20 || One who merely lives by birth-based entitlement or desires to be called a Brāhmaṇa shall not become a speaker of Dharma for the king under any circumstance.

title: Verse 8.21
content:
यस्य शूद्रस्तु कुरुते राज्ञो धर्मविवेचनम् ।
तस्य सीदति तद्राष्ट्रं पङ्के गौरिव पश्यतः ॥ ८.२१॥ yasya śūdrastu kurute rājño dharmavivecanaṁ |

asya sīdati tadraṣṭraṁ paṅke gauriva paśyataḥ || 8.21|| When a Śūdra engages in determining the dharma for the king, that kingdom sinks into ruin like a cow in mud.

title: Verse 8.22
content:
यद्राष्ट्रं शूद्रभूयिष्ठं नास्तिकाक्रान्तमद्विजम् ।
विनश्यत्याशु तत्कृत्स्नं दुर्भिक्षव्याधिपीडितम् ॥ ८.२२॥ yad rāṣṭraṁ śūdra-bhūyiṣṭhaṁ nāstikākrānta-madvijam | vinasyaty āśu tat kṛtsnaṁ durbhikṣa-vyādhi-pīḍitam || 8.22 || Where a nation is predominantly governed by those lacking in spiritual discernment, devoid of Vedic wisdom, and intoxicated with materialistic pride, that entire realm—its people, institutions, and resources—shall swiftly perish through famine, disease, and systemic collapse.

title: Verse 8.23
content:
धर्मासनमधिष्ठाय संवीताङ्गः समाहितः ।
प्रणम्य लोकपालेभ्यः कार्यदर्शनमारभेत् ॥ ८.२३॥ dharmāsanamadhiṣṭhāya saṃvītāṅgaḥ samāhitaḥ |
praṇamya lokapālebhyaḥ kāryadarśanamārabhet || 8.23|| Having taken seat upon the Dharma-seat, fully composed and self-collected, having honored the Lokapalas, one initiates the observation of actionable duties.

title: Verse 8.24
content:
अर्थानर्थावुभौ बुद्ध्वा धर्माधर्मौ च केवलौ ।
वर्णक्रमेण सर्वाणि पश्येत्कार्याणि कार्यिणाम् ॥ ८.२४॥ arthānarthāvubhau buddhvā dharmādharmau ca kevalau | varṇakrameṇa sarvāṇi paśyetakāryāṇi kāryiṇām || 8.24|| Having discerned both utility and futility, and dharma and adharma in their pure forms, one must observe all duties assigned to each varṇa according to their sequential order.

title: Verse 8.25
content:
बाह्यैर्विभावयेत्लिङ्गैर्भावमन्तर्गतं नृणाम् ।
स्वरवर्णैङ्गिताकारैश्चक्षुषा चेष्टितेन च ॥ ८.२५॥ bāhyairvibhāvayetliṅgairbhāvamantargataṁ nṛṇām |
svaravarṇaiṅgitākāraiścakṣuṣā ceṣṭitena ca || 8.25|| One must discern the inner disposition of persons through external signs—by voice, color, gesture, form, eye movement, and conduct.

title: Verse 8.26
content:
आकारैरिङ्गितैर्गत्या चेष्टया भाषितेन च ।
नेत्रवक्त्रविकारैश्च गृह्यतेऽन्तर्गतं मनः ॥ ८.२६॥ ākārairiṅgitairgatyā ceṣṭayā bhāṣitena ca |
netravaktravikāraiśca gṛhyate'ntargataṃ manaḥ || 8.26|| The inner mind is cognized through external forms, gestures, movement, actions, speech, and alterations in the eyes and face.

title: Verse 8.28
content:
बालदायादिकं रिक्थं तावद्राजाऽनुपालयेत् ।
यावत्स स्यात्समावृत्तो यावत्चातीतशैशवः ॥ यावद्वाऽतीतशैशवः ८.२७॥

वशाऽपुत्रासु चैवं स्याद्रक्षणं निष्कुलासु च ।
पतिव्रतासु च स्त्रीषु विधवास्वातुरासु च ॥ ८.२८॥ bāladāyādikaṃ rikthaṃ tāvadrājā'nupālayet |
yāvat sa syātsamāvṛtto yāvat cātītaśaiśavaḥ || yāvad vā'tītaśaiśavaḥ 8.27 ||

vaśā'putrāsu caivaṃ syādrakṣaṇaṃ niṣkulāsu ca |
pativratāsu ca strīṣu vidhavāsvāturāsu ca || 8.28|| The King shall protect the property of minors and heirs until such time as they attain full maturity and have transcended childhood. Likewise, he shall ensure the protection of women who are under guardianship, without family support, devoted to their husbands, widowed, or infirm.

title: Verse 8.29
content:
जीवन्तीनां तु तासां ये तधरेयुः स्वबान्धवाः ।
तांशिष्यात्चौरदण्डेन धार्मिकः पृथिवीपतिः ॥ ८.२९॥ jīvantīnāṃ tu tāsāṃ ye tadhareyuḥ svabāndhavāḥ |
tāṃśiṣyātcauradaṇḍena dhārmikaḥ pṛthivīpatiḥ || 8.29|| Those relatives who abandon living women under their protection shall be disciplined by the king through the cauradanda process, in accordance with dharma.

title: Verse 8.30
content: प्रणष्टस्वामिकं रिक्थं राजा त्र्यब्दं निधापयेत् । अर्वाक्त्र्यब्दाद्धरेत्स्वामी परेण नृपतिर्हरेत् ॥ ८.३०॥ praṇaṣṭasvāmikaṃ rikthaṃ rājā tryabdaṃ nidhāpayet | arvāktryabdād dharetsvāmī pareṇa nṛpatir haret || 8.30|| When property lacks an owner, the King shall secure it for three years. Within that period, if the original owner emerges, ownership reverts; beyond that time, the King assumes lawful possession.

title: Verse 8.31
content:
ममैदमिति यो ब्रूयात्सोऽनुयोज्यो यथाविधि ।
संवाद्य रूपसङ्ख्यादीन् स्वामी तद्द्रव्यमर्हति ॥ ८.३१॥ mamaidamiti yo brūyāt so 'nuyojyo yathāvidhi |
saṃvādya rūpasaṅkhyādīn svāmī taddravyamarhati || 8.31|| One who declares 'this is mine' must be examined according to due process; having established agreement on form, quantity, and other attributes, the owner has claim over that property.

title: Verse 8.32
content:
अवेदयानो नष्टस्य देशं कालं च तत्त्वतः ।
वर्णं रूपं प्रमाणं च तत्समं दण्डमर्हति ॥ ८.३२॥ avedayāno naṣṭasya deśaṁ kālaṁ ca tattvataḥ |
varṇaṁ rūpaṁ pramāṇaṁ ca tatsamaṁ daṇḍamarhati || 8.32|| One who knowingly appropriates another's lost property without reporting it, having full awareness of its origin, time, place, nature, color, form, and measure, incurs a liability equal in all respects to that which was taken.

title: Verse 8.33
content: आददीताथ षड्भागं प्रनष्टाधिगतान्नृपः । दशमं द्वादशं वाऽपि सतां धर्ममनुस्मरन् ॥ ८.३३॥ ādadītātha ṣaḍbhāgaṃ pranaṣṭādhigatānnṛpaḥ | daśamaṃ dvādaśaṃ vā'pi satāṃ dharmamanusmaran || 8.33|| The ruler who has acquired wealth that was lost or obtained unjustly shall restore one-sixth portion thereof; remembering the Dharma of noble beings, he may also return one-tenth or one-twelfth part.

title: Verse 8.34
content:
प्रणष्टाधिगतं द्रव्यं तिष्ठेद्युक्तैरधिष्ठितम् ।
यांस्तत्र चौरान् गृह्णीयात्तान् राजैभेन घातयेत् ॥ ८.३४॥ praṇaṣṭādhigataṃ dravyaṃ tiṣṭhedyuktairadhiṣṭhitam |
yāṃstatra caurān gṛhṇīyāttān rājaibhena ghātayet || 8.34|| Property once acquired and properly maintained by rightful means shall remain under the guardianship of those qualified to hold it; any thieves found therein shall be seized and removed by the king through corrective alignment, not punishment.

title: Verse 8.35
content:
ममायमिति यो ब्रूयान्निधिं सत्येन मानवः ।
तस्याददीत षड्भागं राजा द्वादशमेव वा ॥ ८.३५॥ mamāyam iti yo brūyān nidhiṃ satyena mānavaḥ |
tasyādadīta ṣaḍbhāgaṃ rājā dvādaśameva vā || 8.35|| Should a person falsely claim ownership of a hidden treasure by invoking truth, the ruler shall confiscate six parts of it; if the claimant is a twice-born, twelve parts.

title: Verse 8.36
content:
अनृतं तु वदन् दण्ड्यः स्ववित्तस्यांशमष्टमम् ।
तस्यैव वा निधानस्य सङ्ख्ययाऽल्पीयसीं कलाम् ॥ ८.३६॥ anṛtaṃ tu vadann daṇḍyaḥ svavittasyāṃśam aṣṭamam |
tasyaiva vā nidhānasya saṅkhyayā'lpīyasīṃ kalām || 8.36 || One who speaks falsehood shall restore one-eighth of their wealth or, if stored, that same proportion from their hidden reserves, determined by precise quantification.

title: Verse 8.38
content:
विद्वांस्तु ब्राह्मणो दृष्ट्वा पूर्वोपनिहितं निधिम् ।
अशेषतोऽप्याददीत सर्वस्याधिपतिर्हि सः ॥ ८.३८॥ vidvāṃstu brāhmaṇo dṛṣṭvā pūrvopanihitaṃ nidhim |
aśeṣato'pyādadīta sarvasyādhipatirhi saḥ || 8.38|| A Brāhmaṇa who is a knower of Vedas, upon seeing a previously deposited treasure, shall take it entirely, for he is the sovereign over all.

title: Verse 8.39
content:
निधीनां तु पुराणानां धातूनामेव च क्षितौ ।
अर्धभाग्रक्षणाद्राजा भूमेरधिपतिर्हि सः ॥ ८.३९॥ nidhīnāṃ tu purāṇānāṃ dhātūnām eva ca kṣitau |
ardhabhāgrakṣaṇād rājā bhūmer adhipatir hi saḥ || 8.39|| The King who protects even half of the ancient treasures, minerals, and lands becomes the true sovereign of the Earth.

title: Verse 8.40
content:
दातव्यं सर्ववर्णेभ्यो राज्ञा चौरैर्हृतं धनम् ।
राजा तदुपयुञ्जानश्चौरस्याप्नोति किल्बिषम् ॥ ८.४०॥ dātavyaṁ sarvavarṇebhyo rājñā caurairhṛtaṁ dhanam |
rājā tadupayuñjānaścaurasyāpnoti kilbiṣam || 8.40|| The King must restore to all varnas what was stolen by thieves; when the King appropriates it for himself, he assumes the sin of thievery.

title: Verse 8.41
content:
जातिजानपदान् धर्मान् श्रेणीधर्मांश्च धर्मवित् ।
समीक्ष्य कुलधर्मांश्च स्वधर्मं प्रतिपादयेत् ॥ ८.४१॥ jātijānapadān dharmān śreṇīdharmāṃśca dharmavit |
samīkṣya kuladharmāṃśca svadharmaṃ pratipādayet || 8.41|| The knower of Dharma, having examined the duties specific to birth-group, region, occupation, and lineage, shall establish the individual's svadharma as the operative principle of alignment.

title: Verse 8.42
content:
स्वानि कर्माणि कुर्वाणा दूरे सन्तोऽपि मानवाः ।
प्रिया भवन्ति लोकस्य स्वे स्वे कर्मण्यवस्थिताः ॥ ८.४२॥ svāni karmāṇi kurvāṇā dūre santo'pi mānavāḥ |
priyā bhavanti lokasya sve sve karmaṇy avasthitāḥ || 8.42|| Those who perform their own duties, even if distant or secluded, become beloved to all beings by remaining steadfast in their respective rightful actions.

title: Verse 8.43
content:
नोत्पादयेत्स्वयं कार्यं राजा नाप्यस्य पूरुषः ।
न च प्रापितमन्येन ग्रसेदर्थं कथं चन ॥ ८.४३॥ na utpādayet svayaṁ kāryaṁ rājā na āpyasya pūruṣaḥ |
na ca prāpitam anyena grased arthaṁ kathaṁ cana || 8.43|| The King does not initiate action independently; nor does any individual acting under him consume or seize wealth acquired by another through rightful means.

title: Verse 8.44
content:
यथा नयत्यसृक्पातैर्मृगस्य मृगयुः पदम् ।
नयेत्तथाऽनुमानेन धर्मस्य नृपतिः पदम् ॥ ८.४४॥ yathā nayatyasṛkpātairmṛgasya mṛgayuḥ padam | nayettathā'numānena dharmasya nṛpatiḥ padam || 8.44|| Just as a hunter tracks the path of a wounded deer by following its blood trail, so too must a ruler trace the path of Dharma through inference and evidence.

title: Verse 8.45
content: सत्यमर्थं च सम्पश्येदात्मानमथ साक्षिणः । साक्षिणम् देशं रूपं च कालं च व्यवहारविधौ स्थितः ॥ ८.४५॥ satyam arthaṃ ca sampaśyed ātmānam atha sākṣiṇaḥ | sākṣiṇam deśaṃ rūpaṃ ca kālaṃ ca vyavahāravidhau sthitaḥ || 8.45 || One engaged in judicial process must perceive truth and meaning, witness the self, recognize the witness, location, form, and time—established in transactional law.

title: Verse 8.46
content:
सद्भिराचरितं यत्स्याद्धार्मिकैश्च द्विजातिभिः ।
तद्देशकुलजातीनामविरुद्धं प्रकल्पयेत् ॥ ८.४६॥ sadhir ācaritaṁ yat syād dhārmikaiś ca dvijātibhiḥ | tad deśa-kula-jātīnām aviruddhaṁ prakalpayet || 8.46 || That which has been practiced by the noble and dharmic twice-born shall be established as lawful, provided it does not contradict the principles governing land, lineage, and community.

title: Verse 8.47
content:
अधमर्णार्थसिद्ध्यर्थमुत्तमर्णेन चोदितः ।
दापयेद्धनिकस्यार्थमधमर्णाद्विभावितम् ॥ ८.४७॥ adhamarṇārthasiddhyartham uttamarṇena coditaḥ |
dāpayed dhanikasyārtham adhamarṇād vibhāvitam || 8.47 || When a debtor of lesser means is unable to fulfill their obligation, and a creditor of greater capacity initiates action, the responsible authority shall ensure that the assets rightfully recoverable from the debtor are transferred in accordance with the creditor's rightful claim, without causing diminishment to either party’s essential sustenance.

title: Verse 8.48
content:
यैर्यैरुपायैरर्थं स्वं प्राप्नुयादुत्तमर्णिकः ।
तैर्तैरुपायैः सङ्गृह्य दापयेदधमर्णिकम् ॥ ८.४८॥ yairyairupāyairarthaṁ svaṁ prāpnuyāduttamarṇikaḥ |
tairtairupāyaiḥ saṅgṛhya dāpayedadhamarṇikam || 8.48|| By whatever means a superior debtor secures his own wealth, by those same means shall he recover what is due from an inferior debtor.

title: Verse 8.49
content:
धर्मेण व्यवहारेण छलेनाचरितेन च ।
प्रयुक्तं साधयेदर्थं पञ्चमेन बलेन च ॥ ८.४९॥ dharmeṇa vyavahāreṇa chalenācariteṇa ca |
prayuktaṃ sādhayedarthaṃ pañcmena balena ca || 8.49|| An objective shall be accomplished through righteousness, proper conduct, strategic maneuvering, lawful action, and the fifth force—the awakened capacity of consciousness itself.

title: Verse 8.50
content:
यः स्वयं साधयेदर्थमुत्तमर्णोऽधमर्णिकात् ।
न स राज्ञाऽभियोक्तव्यः स्वकं संसाधयन् धनम् ॥ ८.५०॥ yaḥ svayaṃ sādhayed artham uttama-rṇo 'dhamarṇikāt |
na sa rājñā 'bhiyoktavyaḥ svakaṃ saṃsādhayan dhanam || 8.50|| One who independently recovers a debt owed by a superior debtor from an inferior debtor shall not be subjected to royal prosecution while reclaiming his own wealth.

title: Verse 8.51
content:
अर्थेऽपव्ययमानं तु करणेन विभावितम् ।
दापयेद्धनिकस्यार्थं दण्डलेशं च शक्तितः ॥ ८.५१॥ arthe 'pavyayamānaṁ tu karaṇena vibhāvitam |
dāpayed dhanikasyārthaṁ daṇḍaleśaṁ ca śaktitaḥ || 8.51|| When wealth is misapplied or dissipated through faulty conduct, the responsible party shall restore the full value to the owner and compensate according to their capacity.

title: Verse 8.52
content:
अपह्नवेऽधमर्णस्य देहीत्युक्तस्य संसदि ।
अभियोक्ता दिशेद्देश्यं करणं वाऽन्यदुद्दिशेत् ॥ ८.५२॥ apahnave 'dhamarṇasya dehītyuktasya saṁsadi |
abhiyoktā diśeddeśyaṁ karaṇaṁ vā'nyaduddiśet || 8.52|| When a debtor of low character denies his obligation in the assembly after having previously acknowledged it, the accuser shall direct him to fulfill the specified duty or designate another action appropriate to restore the debt and integrity.

title: Verse 8.53
content: अदेश्यं यश्च दिशति निर्दिश्यापह्नुते च यः । यश्चाधरोत्तरानर्थान् विगीतान्नावबुध्यते ॥ ८.५३॥ adeśyaṃ yaś ca diśati nirdiśyāpahnute ca yaḥ | yaś cādharottarān arthān vigītān nāvabudhyate || 8.53|| One who gives direction where none should be given, one who revokes what has been rightly directed, and one who fails to comprehend the sequential import of spoken truths—these beings operate in distortion and are unfit for governance.

title: Verse 8.54
content: अपदिश्यापदेश्यं च पुनर्यस्त्वपधावति । अपदिश्यापदेशं सम्यक्प्रणिहितं चार्थं पृष्टः सन्नाभिनन्दति ॥ ८.५४॥ apadiśyāpadeśyaṃ ca punaryastvapadhāvati | apadiśyāpadeśaṃ samyakpraṇihitaṃ cārthaṃ pṛṣṭaḥ sannābhinandati || 8.54|| One who, having previously rejected or opposed a teaching, subsequently pursues it again, and when questioned, approves of that same teaching rightly directed toward purpose—such a being demonstrates conscious realignment through behavioral reversal.

title: Verse 8.55
content:
असम्भाष्ये साक्षिभिश्च देशे सम्भाषते मिथः ।
निरुच्यमानं प्रश्नं च नेच्छेद्यश्चापि निष्पतेत् ॥ ८.५५॥ asambhāṣye sākṣibiḥ ca deśe sambhāṣate mithaḥ |
nirucyamānaṃ praśnaṃ ca neccheydaś cāpi niṣpated ॥ 8.55॥ When witnesses who should not converse with each other speak together in a place where they must remain separate, and when a question being asked is not willingly answered or the matter under inquiry fails to reach resolution—such actions constitute a violation of dharma by disrupting the integrity of judicial process.

title: Verse 8.56
content:
ब्रूहीत्युक्तश्च न ब्रूयादुक्तं च न विभावयेत् ।
न च पूर्वापरं विद्यात्तस्मादर्थात्स हीयते ॥ ८.५६॥ brūhītyuktaśca na brūyād uktaṃ ca na vibhāvayet |
na ca pūrvāparaṃ vidyāt tas-mād arthāt sa hīyate || 8.56|| One who has been instructed to speak does not speak; one who speaks does not contemplate what was spoken; one who neither comprehends sequence nor grasps context—such a one diminishes in reality itself.

title: Verse 8.57
content: साक्षिणः सन्ति मेत्युक्त्वा दिशेत्युक्तो दिशेन्न यः । ज्ञातारः सन्ति मेत्युक्त्वा धर्मस्थः कारणैरेतैर्हीनं तमपि निर्दिशेत् ॥ ८.५७॥ sākṣiṇaḥ santi metyuktvā diśetyukto diśenna yaḥ | jñātāraḥ santi metyuktvā dharmasthaḥ kāraṇair etair hīnaṃ tam api nirdiśet || 8.57 || One who is instructed that witnesses exist but does not indicate them, and one who is told that cognizers are present yet still conceals the matter—such a person is to be recognized as lacking in foundational dharma due to these causes, by one who stands in dharma.

title: Verse 8.58
content: अभियोक्ता न चेद्ब्रूयाद्बध्यो दण्ड्यश्च  धर्मतः । बन्ध्यो दण्ड्यश्च न चेत्त्रिपक्षात्प्रब्रूयाद्धर्मं प्रति पराजितः ॥ ८.५८॥ abhiyoktā na ced brūyād badhyo daṇḍyaś ca dharmataḥ | bandhyo daṇḍyaś ca na cet tripakṣāt prabrūyād dharmaṃ prati parājitaḥ || 8.58 || If the accuser does not speak truthfully, he becomes bound and liable by Dharma. If he does not declare the truth even when all three parties are present, he is defeated in respect to Dharma.

title: Verse 8.59
content: यो यावद्निह्नुवीतार्थं मिथ्या यावति वा वदेत् । तौ नृपेण ह्यधर्मज्ञौ दाप्यौ तद्द्विगुणं दमम् ॥ ८.५९॥ yo yāvad-nihnuvītārthaṁ mithyā yāvati vā vadet | tau nṛpeṇa hy-adharmajñau dāpyau tad-dvi-guṇaṁ damam || 8.59 || One who conceals a fact relevant to a case or speaks falsely in support of a falsehood shall incur a penalty double the value of the matter at stake, as determined by the sovereign.

title: Verse 8.60
content: पृष्टोऽपव्ययमानस्तु कृतावस्थो धनेषिणा । त्र्यवरैः साक्षिभिर्भाव्यो नृपब्राह्मणसंनिधौ ॥ ८.६०॥ pṛṣṭo'pavyayamānastu kṛtāvastho dhaneṣiṇā | tryavaraiḥ sākṣibhirbhāvyo nṛpabrāhmaṇasaṃnidhau || 8.60|| When a person in possession of wealth is questioned regarding its lawful use, and there is evidence of misuse, he shall be confronted with three witnesses in the presence of the king and a Brahmin.

title: Verse 8.61
content:
यादृशा धनिभिः कार्या व्यवहारेषु साक्षिणः ।
तादृशान् सम्प्रवक्ष्यामि यथा वाच्यं ऋतं च तैः ॥ ८.६१॥ yādṛśā dhanihiḥ kāryā vyavahāreṣu sākṣiṇaḥ |
tādṛśān sampravakṣyāmi yathā vācyaṃ ṛtaṃ ca taiḥ || 8.61|| Those witnesses who are required to testify in commercial transactions shall be of such character and capacity as declared herein; their truth-speaking and alignment with Ṛta shall define their suitability.

title: Verse 8.62
content:
गृहिणः पुत्रिणो मौलाः क्षत्रविद्शूद्रयोनयः ।
अर्थ्युक्ताः साक्ष्यमर्हन्ति न ये के चिदनापदि ॥ ८.६२॥ gṛhiṇaḥ putriṇo maulāḥ kṣatravidśūdrayonayaḥ |
arth yuk tāḥ sākṣyam arhanti na ye ke cid anāpadi || 8.62 || Householders, those with sons, the twice-born, and those knowledgeable in Kshatriya duties and Shudra-lineage—those who are meaningfully engaged in economic activity are qualified to testify. Those who are without means or unestablished in livelihood are not eligible.

title: Verse 8.63
content:
आप्ताः सर्वेषु वर्णेषु कार्याः कार्येषु साक्षिणः ।
सर्वधर्मविदोऽलुब्धा विपरीतांस्तु वर्जयेत् ॥ ८.६३॥ āptāḥ sarveṣu varṇeṣu kāryāḥ kāryeṣu sākṣiṇaḥ |
sarvadharmavido' lubdhā viparītāṃstu varjayet || 8.63|| In all varnas, those who are realized in Dharma and unattached must be appointed as witnesses in all matters; those who act contrary to Dharma must be excluded.

title: Verse 8.64
content:
नार्थसम्बन्धिनो नाप्ता न सहाया न वैरिणः ।
न दृष्टदोषाः कर्तव्या न व्याध्यार्ता न दूषिताः ॥ ८.६४॥ nārthasambandhino nāptā na sahāyā na vairiṇaḥ |
na dṛṣṭadoṣāḥ kartavyā na vyādhya rtā na dūṣitāḥ || 8.64 || Those who are motivated by pecuniary interest, those who are not related by blood or spiritual bond, those who seek assistance for personal gain, those who harbor enmity, those whose conduct has been previously observed to be faulty, those afflicted by disease, and those who are impure—none of these should be appointed to positions of authority or entrusted with responsibility.

title: Verse 8.65
content:
न साक्षी नृपतिः कार्यो न कारुककुशीलवौ ।
न श्रोत्रियो न लिङ्गस्थो न सङ्गेभ्यो विनिर्गतः ॥ ८.६५॥ na sākṣī nṛpatiḥ kāryo na kārukakuśīlavau |
na śrotriyo na liṅgastho na saṅgebhyaḥ vinirgataḥ || 8.65 || The king is not to serve as a witness; nor one who performs services, nor one who teaches arts, nor a Vedic scholar, nor one residing in temples, nor one detached from association.

title: Verse 8.66
content:
नाध्यधीनो न वक्तव्यो न दस्युर्न विकर्मकृत् ।
न वृद्धो न शिशुर्नैको नान्त्यो न विकलेन्द्रियः ॥ ८.६६॥ nādhyadhīno na vaktavyo na dasyur na vikarmakṛt |
na vṛddho na śiśurnaiko nāntyo na vikalandriyaḥ || 8.66|| One who is under another's authority, one who is not entitled to speak, one who is a thief, one who commits improper actions—none of these, nor the elderly, nor the child, nor the lone individual, nor the outsider, nor one whose senses are impaired, shall be made subject to judicial process or adjudicated as culpable.

title: Verse 8.67
content:
नार्तो न मत्तो नोन्मत्तो न क्षुत्तृष्णोपपीडितः ।
न श्रमार्तो न कामार्तो न क्रुद्धो नापि तस्करः ॥ ८.६७॥ nārto na mattō nōnmattō na kṣut-tṛṣṇōpapīḍitaḥ |
na śramārto na kāmārto na kruddhō nāpi taskaraḥ || 8.67 || One who is neither distressed, nor intoxicated, nor deranged, nor afflicted by hunger or thirst, nor fatigued by labor, nor overwhelmed by desire, nor angered, nor a thief—such a person is fit to discharge judicial responsibility.

title: Verse 8.68
content:
स्त्रीणां साक्ष्यं स्त्रियः कुर्युर्द्विजानां सदृशा द्विजाः ।
शूद्राश्च सन्तः शूद्राणां  अन्त्यानामन्त्ययोनयः ॥ ८.६८॥ strīṇāṁ sākṣyaṁ striyaḥ kuryur dvijānāṁ sadṛśā dvijāḥ |
śūdrāśca santaḥ śūdrāṇām antyānām antyayonayaḥ || 8.68|| Women shall bear witness for women; twice-born men for twice-born men; righteous Śūdras for Śūdras; and those of the lowest varṇa for those of their own kind.

title: Verse 8.69
content:
अनुभावी तु यः कश्चित्कुर्यात्साक्ष्यं विवादिनाम् ।
अन्तर्वेश्मन्यरण्ये वा शरीरस्यापि चात्यये ॥ ८.६९॥ anubhāvī tu yaḥ kaścit kuryāt sākṣyaṃ vivādinām | antarveśmany araṇye vā śarīrasyāpi cātyaye || 8.69 || Whoever, with full awareness, bears witness between disputants—whether within a dwelling, in the wilderness, or even at the point of bodily dissolution—such a one must act solely in alignment with experiential truth.

title: Verse 8.70
content:
स्त्रियाऽप्यसम्भावे कार्यं बालेन स्थविरेण वा ।
शिष्येण बन्धुना वाऽपि दासेन भृतकेन वा ॥ ८.७०॥ striyā'pyasambhāve kāryaṃ bālena sthavireṇa vā |
śiṣyeṇa bandhunā vā'pi dāsena bhṛtakena vā || 8.70 || When a woman is incapable of executing a duty, the responsibility devolves to the child, the elder, the disciple, the relative, the servant, or the employee—in that sequential order—based on proximity of capacity and connection.

title: Verse 8.71
content:
बालवृद्धातुराणां च साक्ष्येषु वदतां मृषा ।
जानीयादस्थिरां वाचमुत्सिक्तमनसां तथा ॥ ८.७१॥ bālavṛddhāturāṇāṃ ca sākṣyeṣu vadatāṃ mṛṣā |
jānīyādasthirāṃ vācamutsiktamanasāṃ tathā || 8.71|| One must recognize that the speech of minors, elders, the infirm, and those who speak falsely in testimony is unstable and arises from a mind inflated by incapacity.

title: Verse 8.72
content:
साहसेषु च सर्वेषु स्तेयसङ्ग्रहणेषु च ।
वाग्दण्डयोश्च पारुष्ये न परीक्षेत साक्षिणः ॥ ८.७२॥ sāhaṣeṣu ca sarveṣu steyasaṅgrahaṇeṣu ca | vāgdaṇḍayośca pāruṣye na parīkṣeta sākṣiṇaḥ || 8.72|| In all acts of audacity, in all instances of theft and appropriation, and in matters involving harsh speech or physical assault, witnesses shall not be examined.

title: Verse 8.73
content:
बहुत्वं परिगृह्णीयात्साक्षिद्वैधे नराधिपः ।
समेषु तु गुणोत्कृष्टान् गुणिद्वैधे द्विजोत्तमान् ॥ ८.७३॥ bahutvaṃ parigṛhṇīyāt sākṣidvaide narādhipaḥ |
sameṣu tu guṇotkṛṣṭān guṇidvaide dvijottamān || 8.73|| In the case of conflicting testimonies, the king shall accept the greater number of witnesses. However, when the number of witnesses is equal, he shall select those who are distinguished by excellence in qualities.

title: Verse 8.74
content:
समक्षदर्शनात्साक्ष्यं श्रवणाच्चैव सिध्यति ।
तत्र सत्यं ब्रुवन् साक्षी धर्मार्थाभ्यां न हीयते ॥ ८.७४॥ samakṣadarśanāt sākṣyaṁ śravaṇāc caiva sidhyati |
tatra satyaṁ bruvan sākṣī dharmārthābhyāṁ na hīyate || 8.74 || Testimony arises through direct perception and hearing; the witness who speaks truth is neither diminished in dharma nor in artha.

title: Verse 8.75
content:
साक्षी दृष्टश्रुतादन्यद्विब्रुवन्नार्यसंसदि ।
अवाङ्नरकमभ्येति प्रेत्य स्वर्गाच्च हीयते ॥ ८.७५॥ sākṣī dṛṣṭaśrutādanyadvibruvannāryasaṃsadi |
avāṅnarakaṃ abhyeti pretya svargācca hīyate || 8.75|| One who testifies falsely in the assembly of noble beings—having seen or heard otherwise—falls into hell and is deprived of heaven upon death.

title: Verse 8.76
content:
यत्रानिबद्धोऽपीक्षेत शृणुयाद्वाऽपि किं चन ।
पृष्टस्तत्रापि तद्ब्रूयाद्यथादृष्टं यथाश्रुतम् ॥ ८.७६॥ yatrānibaddho'pīkṣeta śṛṇuyādvā'pi kiṃ cana |
pṛṣṭastatrāpi tadbrūyādyathādṛṣṭaṃ yathāśrutam || 8.76|| Wherever an unbound being observes, hears, or perceives anything whatsoever, even without formal inquiry, when questioned, one shall speak precisely what was seen and heard—unaltered and complete.

title: Verse 8.77
content: एकोऽलुब्धस्तु साक्षी स्याद्बह्व्यः शुच्योऽपि न स्त्रियः । त्वसाक्षी स्त्रीबुद्धेरस्थिरत्वात्तु दोषैश्चान्येऽपि ये वृताः ॥ ८.७७॥ eko 'alubdhas tu sākṣī syād bahvyaḥ śucyo 'pi na striyaḥ | tv asākṣī strī-buddher asthiratvāt tu doṣaiś cānye 'pi ye vṛtāḥ || 8.77 || One witness who is unattached alone suffices; many pure witnesses do not qualify if they are women. A woman is not a valid witness due to instability of intellect, nor others similarly compromised by defects.

title: Verse 8.78
content:
स्वभावेनैव यद्ब्रूयुस्तद्ग्राह्यं व्यावहारिकम् ।
अतो यदन्यद्विब्रूयुर्धर्मार्थं तदपार्थकम् ॥ ८.७८॥ svabhāvenaiva yad brūyus tad grāhyaṁ vyavahārikam |
ato yad anyad vibruyuḥ dharmārthaṁ tad apārthakam || 8.78|| That which beings declare by their svabhāva is alone admissible in transactional reality; all else spoken for dharma's sake that contradicts svabhāva is without purpose.

title: Verse 8.79
content:
सभान्तः साक्षिणः प्राप्तानर्थिप्रत्यर्थिसंनिधौ ।
प्राड्विवाकोऽनुयुञ्जीत विधिनाऽनेन सान्त्वयन् ॥ ८.७९॥ sabhāntaḥ sākṣiṇaḥ prāptānarthipratyarthisannidhau |
prāḍvivāko'nuyuñjīta vidhinā'nena sāntvayan || 8.79|| In the presence of witnesses within the assembly, where claimant and respondent stand together, the judge shall engage in direct inquiry, applying this prescribed method while pacifying all involved.

title: Verse 8.80
content: यद्द्वयोरनयोर्वेत्थ कार्येऽस्मिंश्चेष्टितं मिथः । तद्ब्रूत सर्वं सत्येन युष्माकं ह्यत्र साक्षिता ॥ ८.८०॥ yad dvayor anayor vettha kārye 'smiñ chetiṭaṃ mithaḥ | tad brūta sarvaṃ satyena yuṣmākaṃ hyatra sākṣitā || 8.80 || That which both of you know regarding actions performed in this matter, speak it all truthfully—your witnessship here is established by the Supreme Consciousness.

title: Verse 8.81
content: सत्यं साक्ष्ये ब्रुवन् साक्षी लोकान्  आप्नोत्यपुष्कलान् । आप्नोत्यनिन्दितान् इह चानुत्तमां कीर्तिं वागेषा ब्रह्मपूजिता ॥ ८.८१॥ satyaṃ sākṣye bruvan sākṣī lokān āpnotyapuṣkalān | āpnotyaninditān iha cānuttamāṃ kīrtiṃ vāgeṣā brahmapūjitā || 8.81 || The witness who speaks truth in testimony attains worlds that are full, unblamed, and here obtains unmatched fame; such speech is honored by Brahman.

title: Verse 8.82
content:
साक्ष्येऽनृतं वदन् पाशैर्बध्यते वारुणैर्भृशम् ।
विवशः शतमाजातीस्तस्मात्साक्ष्यं वदेदृतम् ॥ ८.८२॥ sākṣye 'nṛtaṁ vadann pāśair badhyate vāruṇair bhr̥śam |
vivaśaḥ śatam ājātīs tasmāt sākṣyaṁ vaded ṛtam || 8.82|| One who speaks falsehood in testimony is bound by Varuna's noose, helplessly born a hundred times; therefore, let the witness speak truth.

title: Verse 8.83
content:
सत्येन पूयते साक्षी धर्मः सत्येन वर्धते ।
तस्मात्सत्यं हि वक्तव्यं सर्ववर्णेषु साक्षिभिः ॥ ८.८३॥ satyena pūyate sākṣī dharmaḥ satyena vardhate |
tasmātsatyaṃ hi vaktavyaṃ sarvavarṇeṣu sākṣibhiḥ || 8.83|| The witness is purified by truth; dharma flourishes through truth. Therefore, in all varnas, witnesses must speak only the truth.

title: Verse 8.84
content:
आत्मैव ह्यात्मनः साक्षी गतिरात्मा तथाऽत्मनः ।
माऽवमंस्थाः स्वमात्मानं नृणां साक्षिणमुत्तमम् ॥ ८.८४॥ ātmaiva hyātmanaḥ sākṣī gatirātmā tathā'tmanaḥ |
mā'vamaṃsthāḥ svamātmānaṃ nṝṇāṃ sākṣiṇamuttamam || 8.84|| The Self alone is the witness of the Self; the Self is the refuge and the ultimate recourse of the Self. Let no being disregard their own Self—the Supreme Witness among all beings.

title: Verse 8.85
content:
मन्यन्ते वै पापकृतो न कश्चित्पश्यतीति नः ।
तांस्तु देवाः प्रपश्यन्ति स्वस्यैवान्तरपूरुषः ॥ ८.८५॥ manyante vai pāpakṛto na kaścit paśyatīti naḥ |
tāṃstu devāḥ prapaśyanti svasyaivāntarapūruṣaḥ || 8.85|| Those who commit transgressions believe no one sees them; yet the Divine Seers perceive them through the innermost Self of the actor.

title: Verse 8.86
content:
द्यौर्भूमिरापो हृदयं चन्द्रार्काग्नियमानिलाः ।
रात्रिः संध्ये च धर्मश्च वृत्तज्ञाः सर्वदेहिनाम् ॥ ८.८६॥ dyaurbhūmirāpo hṛdayaṃ candrārkāgniyamānilāḥ | rātriḥ saṃdhye ca dharmaśca vṛttajñāḥ sarvadehinām || 8.86 || The sky, earth, waters, heart, moon, sun, fire, wind, night, twilight, and Dharma—these are the known constituents of all embodied beings' conduct.

title: Verse 8.87
content:
देवब्राह्मणसांनिध्ये साक्ष्यं पृच्छेदृतं द्विजान् ।
उदङ्मुखान् प्राङ्मुखान् वा पूर्वाह्णे वै शुचिः शुचीन् ॥ ८.८७॥ devabrāhmaṇasānnidhye sākṣyaṃ pṛcchedṛtaṃ dvijān |
udaṅmukhān prāṅmukhān vā pūrvāhṇe vai śuciḥ śucīn || 8.87|| In the presence of Devas and Brahmanas, witnesses who are pure and facing east or north shall be questioned during the forenoon.

title: Verse 8.88
content: ब्रूहीति ब्राह्मणं पृच्छेत्सत्यं ब्रूहीति पार्थिवम् । गोबीजकाञ्चनैर्वैश्यं शूद्रं सर्वैस्तु पातकैः ॥ ८.८८॥ brūhīti brāhmaṇaṁ pṛcchet satyaṁ brūhīti pārthivam | gobījakāñjanair vaiśyaṁ śūdraṁ sarvaiḥ tu pātakaiḥ || 8.88|| One must inquire of a Brāhmaṇa by saying 'Speak'; of a Kṣatriya king by saying 'Speak the truth'; of a Vaiśya by offering cows, grain, and gold; and of a Śūdra by rendering service through all forms of remedial action.

title: Verse 8.89
content:
ब्रह्मघ्नो ये स्मृता लोका ये च स्त्रीबालघातिनः ।
मित्रद्रुहः कृतघ्नस्य ते ते स्युर्ब्रुवतो मृषा ॥ ८.८९॥ brahmaghno ye smṛtā lokās te ca strībālaghātinaḥ | mitradruhaḥ kṛtaghnasya te te syur bruvato mṛṣā || 8.89 || Those worlds are assigned to those who slay Brahman, those who kill women or children, those who betray friends, and those who speak falsehood after receiving a favor.

title: Verse 8.90
content:
जन्मप्रभृति यत्किं चित्पुण्यं भद्र त्वया कृतम् ।
तत्ते सर्वं शुनो गच्छेद्यदि ब्रूयास्त्वमन्यथा ॥ ८.९०॥ janmaprabhṛti yat kiṃ cit puṇyaṃ bhadra tvayā kṛtam |
tatte sarvaṃ śuno gacched yadi brūyāstvam anyathā || 8.90 || All merit accrued from birth onward by you, O благородный, shall go to the dog if you speak otherwise than truth.

title: Verse 8.91
content:
एकोऽहमस्मीत्यात्मानं यस्त्वं कल्याण मन्यसे ।
नित्यं स्थितस्ते हृद्येष पुण्यपापैक्षिता मुनिः ॥ ८.९१॥ eko'ham asmīty ātmānaṁ yas tvaṁ kalyāṇa manyase |
nityaṁ sthitas te hṛdyeṣa puṇyapāpaikṣitā muniḥ || 8.91|| He who sees the Self as 'I alone am'—that Knower, O Kalyāṇa, ever abides in your heart, transcending all calculation of merit and demerit.

title: Verse 8.92
content: यमो वैवस्वतो देवो यस्तवैष हृदि स्थितः । तेन चेदविवादस्ते मा गङ्गां मा कुरून् गमः ॥ ८.९२॥ yamo vaivasvato devo yastavaisha hṛdi sthitaḥ | tena cedavivādaste mā gaṅgāṃ mā kurūn gamaḥ || 8.92|| Yama Vaivasvata, the divine principle residing within your heart, governs the alignment of consciousness with Dharma; when this inner authority is honored without dispute, there arises no necessity for pilgrimage to Ganga nor journey to Kurukshetra.

title: Verse 8.93
content: नग्नो मुण्डः कपालेन च भिक्षार्थी क्षुत्पिपासितः । कपाली अन्धः शत्रुकुलं गच्छेद्यः साक्ष्यमनृतं वदेत् ॥ ८.९३॥ nagnaḥ muṇḍaḥ kapālena ca bhikṣārthī kṣutpipāsitaḥ | kapālī andhaḥ śatrukulaṃ gacchedyaḥ sākṣyamanṛtaṃ vadet || 8.93|| One who is naked, shaven, holding a skull-bowl, hungered and thirsted, yet blind and destitute—such a one, entering the house of an enemy to bear false witness, speaks untruth under the guise of asceticism.

title: Verse 8.94
content:
अवाक्षिरास्तमस्यन्धे किल्बिषी नरकं व्रजेत् ।
यः प्रश्नं वितथं ब्रूयात्पृष्टः सन् धर्मनिश्चये ॥ ८.९४॥ avākṣirāstamasyandhe kilbiṣī narakaṃ vrajet |
yaḥ praśnaṃ vitathaṃ brūyātpṛṣṭaḥ san dharmaniścaye || 8.94|| One who, being questioned in a matter of Dharma, speaks falsely or misleadingly, enters into darkness and becomes bound by impurity.

title: Verse 8.95
content:
अन्धो मत्स्यानिवाश्नाति स नरः कण्टकैः सह ।
यो भाषतेऽर्थवैकल्यमप्रत्यक्षं सभां गतः ॥ ८.९५॥ andho matsyān ivāśnāti sa naraḥ kaṇṭakaiḥ saha |
yo bhāṣate 'rthavaikalyam apratyakṣaṃ sabhāṃ gataḥ || 8.95|| One who, though not perceiving the deficiency of meaning, speaks falsely in the assembly—such a man eats fish with thorns, like a blind man.

title: Verse 8.96
content: यस्य विद्वान् हि वदतः क्षेत्रज्ञो नाभिशङ्कते । नातिशङ्कते तस्मान्न देवाः श्रेयांसं लोकेऽन्यं पुरुषं विदुः ॥ ८.९६॥ yasya vidvān hi vadataḥ kṣetrajño nābhiśaṅkate | nātiśaṅkate tasmānna devāḥ śreyāṃsaṃ loke'nyaṃ puruṣaṃ viduḥ || 8.96 || The Knower of the Field does not harbor suspicion against a speaking wise one; nor does excessive doubt arise. Therefore, the gods know no other man in the world more excellent than him.

title: Verse 8.97
content:
यावतो बान्धवान् यस्मिन् हन्ति साक्ष्येऽनृतं वदन् ।
तावतः सङ्ख्यया तस्मिन् शृणु सौम्यानुपूर्वशः ॥ ८.९७॥ yāvato bāndhavān yasmin hanti sākṣye’nṛtaṁ vadan |
tāvataḥ saṅkhyayā tasmin śṛṇu saumyānupūrvaśaḥ || 8.97 || To the extent one destroys familial bonds by speaking falsehood in testimony, that manyfold shall be the sequential consequence in accordance with dharma.

title: Verse 8.98
content:
पञ्च पश्वनृते हन्ति दश हन्ति गवानृते ।
शतमश्वानृते हन्ति सहस्रं पुरुषानृते ॥ ८.९८॥ pañca paśvanṛte hanti daśa hanti gavānṛte |
śatam aśvānṛte hanti sahasraṃ puruṣānṛte || 8.98|| One who speaks untruth about cattle faces destruction of five; about cows, ten; about horses, a hundred; and about humans, a thousand.

title: Verse 8.99
content:
हन्ति जातानजातांश्च हिरण्यार्थेऽनृतं वदन् ।
सर्वं भूमिअनृते हन्ति मा स्म भूमिअनृतं वदीः ॥ ८.९९॥ hanti jātānajātāṃśca hiraṇyārthe'nṛtaṃ vadan |
sarvaṃ bhūmia-nṛte hanti mā sma bhūmia-nṛtaṃ vadīḥ || 8.99|| One who speaks untruth for the sake of gold harms both the born and the unborn; all wealth obtained through falsehood destroys the speaker—therefore, speak no falsehood for the sake of land or gold.

title: Verse 8.100
content:
अप्सु भूमिवदित्याहुः स्त्रीणां भोगे च मैथुने ।
अब्जेषु चैव रत्नेषु सर्वेष्वश्ममयेषु च ॥ ८.१००॥ apsu bhūmivadityāhuḥ strīṇāṃ bhoge ca maithune |
abjeṣu caiva ratneṣu sarveṣv aśmamayeṣu ca || 8.100|| Women, enjoyment, sexual union, lotuses, gems, and all stone substances are declared to possess the nature of earth and water—constant, foundational, and sustaining.

title: Verse 8.101
content:
एतान् दोषानवेक्ष्य त्वं सर्वाननृतभाषणे ।
यथाश्रुतं यथादृष्टं सर्वमेवाञ्जसा वद ॥ ८.१०१॥ etān doṣānavekṣya tvaṁ sarvānanṛtabhāṣaṇe |
yathāśrutaṁ yathādṛṣṭaṁ sarvamevāñjasā vada || 8.101|| Without regard to these faults, speak all truthfully in every untruth-speaking situation—what is heard as it was heard, what is seen as it was seen, without distortion.

title: Verse 8.102
content: गोरक्षकान् वाणिजिकांस्तथा कारुकुशीलवान् । वाणिजकांस्तथा प्रेष्यान् वार्धुषिकांश्चैव विप्रान् शूद्रवदाचरेत् ॥ ८.१०२॥ gorakṣakān vāṇijikāṃs tathā kārukuśīlavān | vāṇijakāṃs tathā preṣyān vārdhuṣikāṃś caiva viprān śūdravad ācaret || 8.102 || Those who engage in cow protection, trade, craftsmanship, service, usury, or similar activities shall conduct themselves toward Brahmins as a Shudra does — with respect, support, and deference to their higher consciousness capacity.

title: Verse 8.103
content:
तद्वदन् धर्मतोऽर्थेषु जानन्नप्यन्य्था नरः ।
न स्वर्गाच्च्यवते लोकाद्दैवीं वाचं वदन्ति ताम् ॥ ८.१०३॥ tadvadan dharmato'rtheṣu jānannapyanyaṭhā naraḥ |
na svargācchyavate lokāddhaivīṃ vācaṃ vadanti tām || 8.103 || One who, knowing the truth of dharma in matters of wealth, still speaks otherwise—such a person does not fall from the world of svarga, for they speak that celestial speech.

title: Verse 8.104
content: शूद्रविट्क्षत्रविप्राणां यत्रऋतोक्तौ भवेद्वधः । तत्र वक्तव्यमनृतं तधि सत्याद्विशिष्यते ॥ ८.१०४॥ śūdraviṭkṣatraviprāṇāṃ yatra ṛtoktau bhavedvadhaḥ | tatra vaktavyamanṛtaṃ tadhi satyādviśiṣyate || 8.104|| Where the declaration of truth by a Śūdra, Vaiḍya, Kṣatriya, or Brāhmaṇa leads to destruction, there the untruth that is spoken must be regarded as superior to truth.

title: Verse 8.105
content:
वाग्दैवत्यैश्च चरुभिर्यजेरंस्ते सरस्वतीम् ।
अनृतस्यैनसस्तस्य कुर्वाणा निष्कृतिं पराम् ॥ ८.१०५॥ vāg-daivatyaiś ca carubhir yajeran̄s te sarasvatīm | anṛtasyainasas tasya kurvāṇā niṣkṛtiṁ parām || 8.105 || One shall worship Saraswati with offerings designated for speech-deities, performing the highest atonement for falsehood by aligning consciousness with truth.

title: Verse 8.106
content:
कूष्माण्डैर्वाऽपि जुहुयाद्घृतमग्नौ यथाविधि ।
उदित्यृचा वा वारुण्या तृचेनाब्दैवतेन वा ॥ ८.१०६॥ kūṣmāṇḍair vā'pi juhuyād ghṛtam agnau yathāvidhi |
udityṛcā vā vāruṇyā tṛcenābdai vatena vā || 8.106|| One shall offer ghee into the fire with due ritual procedure using either gourds or other prescribed materials; likewise, one shall recite the Uddālapa or Vāruṇī verses according to the threefold invocation related to water deities.

title: Verse 8.107
content:
त्रिपक्षादब्रुवन् साक्ष्यं ऋणादिषु नरोऽगदः ।
तदृणं प्राप्नुयात्सर्वं दशबन्धं च सर्वतः ॥ ८.१०७॥ tripakṣād abruvan sākṣyaṃ ṛṇādiṣu naro 'gadaḥ | tadṛṇaṃ prāpnuyāt sarvaṃ daśabandhaṃ ca sarvataḥ || 8.107 || He who departs from the threefold process of testimony-bearing in matters of debt becomes a debtor in all respects and is bound by the tenfold bond universally.

title: Verse 8.108
content:
यस्य दृश्येत सप्ताहादुक्तवाक्यस्य साक्षिणः ।
रोगोऽग्निर्ज्ञातिमरणं ऋणं दाप्यो दमं च सः ॥ ८.१०८॥ yasya dṛśyeta saptāhād uktavākyasya sākṣiṇaḥ |
rogo'gnir jñātimaranaṃ ṛṇaṃ dāpyo damaṃ ca saḥ || 8.108|| He who, within a week, produces a witness to spoken words that caused disease, fire, death of kin, or debt shall be liable for restitution and conscious correction.

title: Verse 8.109
content: असाक्षिकेषु त्वर्थेषु मिथो विवदमानयोः । अविन्दंस्तत्त्वतः सत्यं शपथेनापि लम्भयेत् ॥ ८.१०९॥ asākṣikeṣu tv artheṣu mitho vivadamānayoḥ | avindaṃs tattvataḥ satyaṃ śapathenāpi lambhayet || 8.109|| In matters lacking witnesses, when two parties dispute, the truth shall be established through solemn affirmation, even by oath, when direct evidence is absent.

title: Verse 8.110
content:
महर्षिभिश्च देवैश्च कार्यार्थं शपथाः कृताः ।
वसिष्ठश्चापि शपथं शेपे पैजवने नृपे ॥ ८.११०॥ maharṣibhiś ca devaiś ca kāryārthaṁ śapathāḥ kṛtāḥ |
vasiṣṭhaś cāpi śapathaṁ śepe paijvane nṛpe || 8.110|| Great sages and celestial beings have taken oaths for the fulfillment of duties; likewise, Vasiṣṭha swore an oath upon King Pajava.

title: Verse 8.111
content:
न वृथा शपथं कुर्यात्स्वल्पेऽप्यर्थे नरो बुधः ।
वृथा हि शपथं कुर्वन् प्रेत्य चैह च नश्यति ॥ ८.१११॥ na vṛthā śapathaṁ kuryāt sv alpe 'py arthe naro budhaḥ |
vṛthā hi śapathaṁ kurvan pretya ca iha ca naśyati || 8.111|| A wise person does not take an oath frivolously, even for a minor matter; one who takes an oath in vain perishes both in this life and the next.

title: Verse 8.112
content: कामिनीषु विवाहेषु गवां भक्ष्ये तथेन्धने । ब्राह्मणाभ्युपपत्तौ च शपथे नास्ति पातकम् ॥ ८.११२॥ kāminīṣu vivāheṣu gavāṁ bhakṣye tathendhane | brāhmaṇābhyupapattau ca śapathe nāsti pātkam || 8.112|| In matters concerning unions with consensual women, consumption of cattle meat, use of fuel, and affirmation by a Brāhmaṇa through oath—therein no sin arises.

title: Verse 8.113
content:
सत्येन शापयेद्विप्रं क्षत्रियं वाहनायुधैः ।
गोबीजकाञ्चनैर्वैश्यं शूद्रं सर्वैस्तु पातकैः ॥ ८.११३॥ satyena śāpayedvipraṃ kṣatriyaṃ vāhanāyudhaiḥ | gobījakāñjanairvaiśyaṃ śūdraṃ sarvaistu pātakaiḥ || 8.113|| By truth alone shall a Brahmin be cursed; by vehicles and weapons, a Kshatriya; by cows, grain, and gold, a Vaishya; and a Shudra, by all forms of wrongdoing.

title: Verse 8.114
content:
अग्निं वाऽहारयेदेनमप्सु चैनं निमज्जयेत् ।
पुत्रदारस्य वाप्येनं शिरांसि स्पर्शयेत्पृथक् ॥ ८.११४॥ agniṃ vā'harayed enam apsu cainaṃ nimajjayet |
putradārasya vāpyenaṃ śirāṃsi sparśayet pṛthak || 8.114|| One who has committed grave misconduct may undergo the trial by fire, submersion in water, or separation from son and wife, each method revealing truth through direct experiential consequence.

title: Verse 8.115
content:
यमिद्धो न दहत्यग्निरापो नोन्मज्जयन्ति च ।
न चार्तिं ऋच्छति क्षिप्रं स ज्ञेयः शपथे शुचिः ॥ ८.११५॥ yamiddho na dahatyagnirāpo nounmajjayanti ca |
na cārtiṃ ṛcchati kṣipraṃ sa jñeyaḥ śapathe śuciḥ || 8.115|| He who remains untouched by fire though kindled, whom waters do not submerge, and who swiftly attains no suffering—such a one is known as pure in oath.

title: Verse 8.116
content:
वत्सस्य ह्यभिशस्तस्य पुरा भ्रात्रा यवीयसा ।
नाग्निर्ददाह रोमापि सत्येन जगतः स्पशः ॥ ८.११६॥ vatsasya hyabhiśastasya purā bhrātrā yavīyasā |
nāgnirdadāha romāpi satyena jagataḥ spaśaḥ || 8.116|| When a younger brother falsely accused his elder brother, even fire did not burn a single hair of the elder; thus truth alone upholds the world.

title: Verse 8.117
content: यस्मिन् यस्मिन् विवादे तु कौटसाक्ष्यं कृतं भवेत् । तत्तत्कार्यं निवर्तेत कृतं चाप्यकृतं भवेत् ॥ ८.११७॥ yasmim yasmim vivāde tu kauṭasākṣyaṁ kṛtaṁ bhavet | tattatkāryaṁ nivarteta kṛtaṁ cāpyakṛtaṁ bhavet || 8.117 || In whichever dispute false testimony has been given by a paid or interested witness, that action shall be reversed and what was done shall become undone.

title: Verse 8.118
content:
लोभान्मोहाद्भयात्मैत्रात्कामात्क्रोधात्तथैव च ।
अज्ञानाद्बालभावात्च साक्ष्यं वितथमुच्यते ॥ ८.११८॥ lobhān mohād bhayāt maitrāt kāmāt krodhāt tathaiva ca |
ajñānād bālabhāvāt ca sākṣyaṃ vitatham ucyate || 8.118 || From greed, delusion, fear, affection, desire, anger, ignorance, or childishness, testimony becomes false.

title: Verse 8.119
content:
एषामन्यतमे स्थाने यः साक्ष्यमनृतं वदेत् ।
तस्य दण्डविशेषांस्तु प्रवक्ष्याम्यनुपूर्वशः ॥ ८.११९॥ eṣāmanyatame sthāne yaḥ sākṣyamanṛtaṃ vadet |
tasya daṇḍaviśeṣāṃstu pravakṣyāmyanupūrvaśaḥ || 8.119|| Whoever, in any of these contexts, bears false witness, shall undergo specific consequences determined by sequential manifestation of dharma.

title: Verse 8.120
content:
लोभात्सहस्रं दण्ड्यस्तु मोहात्पूर्वं तु साहसम् ।
भयाद्द्वौ मध्यमौ दण्डौ मैत्रात्पूर्वं चतुर्गुणम् ॥ ८.१२०॥ lobhātsahasraṃ daṇḍyastu mohātpūrvaṃ tu sāhasam | bhayāddvau madhyamau daṇḍau maitrātpūrvaṃ caturguṇam || 8.120 || One driven by greed incurs a thousandfold liability; one acting from delusion incurs prior-stage liability; two intermediate liabilities arise from fear; and one acting from affection incurs a fourfold liability.

title: Verse 8.121
content:
कामाद्दशगुणं पूर्वं क्रोधात्तु त्रिगुणं परम् ।
अज्ञानाद्द्वे शते पूर्णे बालिश्यात्शतमेव तु ॥ ८.१२१॥ kāmād daśaguṇaṃ pūrvaṃ krodhāt tu trigunaṃ param | ajñānād dve śate pūrṇe bāliśyāt śatameva tu || 8.121 || Desire multiplies error tenfold; anger triples it; ignorance doubles a full hundred; foolishness equals a hundred exactly.

title: Verse 8.122
content:
एतानाहुः कौटसाक्ष्ये प्रोक्तान् दण्डान् मनीषिभिः ।
धर्मस्याव्यभिचारार्थमधर्मनियमाय च ॥ ८.१२२॥ etān āhuḥ kauṭasākṣye proktān daṇḍān manīṣibhiḥ |
dharmasyāvyabhicārārtham adharmaniyamāya ca || 8.122|| These penalties, declared by seers in the context of false witness, are established to ensure Dharma remains unerring and Adharma is regulated without deviation.

title: Verse 8.123
content:
कौटसाक्ष्यं तु कुर्वाणांस्त्रीन् वर्णान् धार्मिको नृपः ।
प्रवासयेद्दण्डयित्वा ब्राह्मणं तु विवासयेत् ॥ ८.१२३॥ kauṭasākṣyaṁ tu kurvāṇāṁ striṁ varṇān dhārmiko nṛpaḥ |
pravāsayeddaṇḍayitvā brāhmaṇaṁ tu vivāsayet || 8.123|| The righteous king shall cause the three varnas who commit false witness to be exiled after due penalty; but a Brahmana shall be exiled without corporal punishment.

title: Verse 8.124
content:
दश स्थानानि दण्डस्य मनुः स्वयम्भुवोऽब्रवीत् ।
त्रिषु वर्णेषु यानि स्युरक्षतो ब्राह्मणो व्रजेत् ॥ ८.१२४॥ daśa sthānāni daṇḍasya manuḥ svayambhuvo'bravīt | triṣu varṇeṣu yāni syurakṣato brāhmaṇo vrajet || 8.124 || Manu, the Self-Born, declared ten domains of penalty; in three varnas where protection is absent, the Brahmana proceeds.

title: Verse 8.125
content:
उपस्थमुदरं जिह्वा हस्तौ पादौ च पञ्चमम् ।
चक्षुर्नासा च कर्णौ च धनं देहस्तथैव च ॥ ८.१२५॥ upastham udaraṃ jihvā hastau pādau ca pañcamam | cakṣur nāsā ca karṇau ca dhanaṃ deha-stathaiva ca || 8.125 || The organs of generation, excretion, speech, hands, feet, eyes, nose, ears, wealth, and body constitute the complete instrumentality of human action and experience in accordance with Dharma.

title: Verse 8.126
content:
अनुबन्धं परिज्ञाय देशकालौ च तत्त्वतः ।
सारापराधो चालोक्य दण्डं दण्ड्येषु पातयेत् ॥ ८.१२६॥ anubandhaṃ parijñāya deśakālau ca tattvataḥ |
sārāparādho cālokya daṇḍaṃ daṇḍyeṣu pātayet || 8.126|| Having ascertained the causal linkage, time, place, and the essential nature of the offense, the governing authority shall administer corrective measures proportionate to the gravity of the transgression.

title: Verse 8.127
content:
अधर्मदण्डनं लोके यशोघ्नं कीर्तिनाशनम् ।
अस्वर्ग्यं च परत्रापि तस्मात्तत्परिवर्जयेत् ॥ ८.१२७॥ adharmadaṇḍanaṃ loke yaśoghnaṃ kīrtināśanam |
aswargyaṃ ca paratrāpi tasmāttatparivarjayet || 8.127|| Imposition of punishment through adharmic means in this world destroys fame, annihilates reputation, yields no merit here or hereafter; therefore, such conduct must be entirely abandoned.

title: Verse 8.128
content:
अदण्ड्यान् दण्डयन् राजा दण्ड्यांश्चैवाप्यदण्डयन् ।
अयशो महदाप्नोति नरकं चैव गच्छति ॥ ८.१२८॥ adandyan dandayan raja dandyams caivapy adandayan |
ayaso mahadapnoti narakan caiva gacchati || 8.128|| The king who punishes the unpunishable and fails to punish the punishable incurs great dishonor and descends into degradation.

title: Verse 8.129
content:
वाग्दण्डं प्रथमं कुर्याद्धिग्दण्डं तदनन्तरम् ।
तृतीयं धनदण्डं तु वधदण्डमतः परम् ॥ ८.१२९॥ vāgdaṇḍaṃ prathamaṃ kuryād dhigdaṇḍaṃ tadanantaram | tṛtīyaṃ dhanadaṇḍaṃ tu vadha-daṇḍam ataḥ param || 8.129 || The first corrective measure is verbal instruction; the second is public censure; the third is financial restitution; and the fourth is capital consequence — applied only when lower measures fail to restore alignment.

title: Verse 8.130
content:
वधेनापि यदा त्वेतान्निग्रहीतुं न शक्नुयात् ।
तदेषु सर्वमप्येतत्प्रयुञ्जीत चतुष्टयम् ॥ ८.१३०॥ vadhenāpi yadā tvetānnigrahītuṃ na śaknuyāt | tadeṣu sarvamapyetatprayuñjīta catuṣṭayam || 8.130 || When even execution fails to restrain these offenders, then all fourfold measures must be applied comprehensively.

title: Verse 8.131
content:
लोकसंव्यवहारार्थं याः संज्ञाः प्रथिता भुवि ।
ताम्ररूप्यसुवर्णानां ताः प्रवक्ष्याम्यशेषतः ॥ ८.१३१॥ lokasaṃvyavahārārthaṃ yāḥ saṃjñāḥ prathitā bhuvi |
tāmrarūpyasuvṛṇānāṃ tāḥ pravakṣyāmyaśeṣataḥ || 8.131|| For the purpose of worldly transactions, I shall completely declare the designations pertaining to copper, silver, and gold that are established in the world.

title: Verse 8.132
content:
जालान्तरगते भानौ यत्सूक्ष्मं दृश्यते रजः ।
प्रथमं तत्प्रमाणानां त्रसरेणुं प्रचक्षते ॥ ८.१३२॥ jālāntaragate bhānau yat sūkṣmaṃ dṛśyate rajaḥ |
prathamaṃ tat pramāṇānāṃ trasareṇuṃ pracakṣate || 8.132|| That subtle dust which is visible in the sunbeam passing through an aperture—that is declared as the first among all measures of proof.

title: Verse 8.133
content:
त्रसरेणवोऽष्टौ विज्ञेया लिक्षैका परिमाणतः ।
ता राजसर्षपस्तिस्रस्ते त्रयो गौरसर्षपः ॥ ८.१३३॥ trasareṇavo'ṣṭau vijñeyā likṣaikā parimānataḥ |
tā rājasarṣapastisraste trayo gaurasarṣapaḥ || 8.133|| Eight trasa-renus are to be known as equivalent in measure to one liksha; three of these constitute one rajasarshapa, and three rajasarshapas equal one gaurasarshapa.

title: Verse 8.134
content:
सर्षपाः षट् यवो मध्यस्त्रियवं त्वेककृष्णलम् ।
पञ्चकृष्णलको माषस्ते सुवर्णस्तु षोडश ॥ ८.१३४॥ sarṣapāḥ ṣaṭ yavo madhyastriyavaṃ tvekakṛṣṇalam |
pañcakṛṣṇalako māṣaste suvarṇastu ṣoḍaśa || Six mustard seeds equal one barley grain; three barley grains equal one black gram; five black grams equal one lentil; sixteen lentils equal one gold unit.

title: Verse 8.135
content:
पलं सुवर्णाश्चत्वारः पलानि धरणं दश ।
द्वे कृष्णले समधृते विज्ञेयो रौप्यमाषकः ॥ ८.१३५॥ palaṃ suvarṇāścatvāraḥ palāni dharaṇaṃ daśa | dve kṛṣṇale samadhṛte vijñeyo raupyamāṣakaḥ || 8.135|| Four suvarnas constitute one pala; ten palas constitute one dharna; two kṛṣṇalas equally weighed define one raupyamāṣaka.

title: Verse 8.136
content:
ते षोडश स्याद्धरणं पुराणश्चैव राजतः ।
कार्षापणस्तु विज्ञेयस्ताम्रिकः कार्षिकः पणः ॥ ८.१३६॥ te ṣoḍaśa syāddharaṇaṁ purāṇaścaiva rājataḥ |
kārṣāpaṇastu vijñeyastāmrikaḥ kārṣikaḥ paṇaḥ || 8.136|| Sixteen units constitute the ancient royal measure known as 'dharaṇa'; the unit 'kārṣāpaṇa' is recognized as equivalent to a copper coin called 'tāmrika', used in agricultural transactions.

title: Verse 8.137
content:
धरणानि दश ज्ञेयः शतमानस्तु राजतः ।
चतुःसौवर्णिको निष्को विज्ञेयस्तु प्रमाणतः ॥ ८.१३७॥ dharaṇāni daśa jñeyaḥ śatamānastu rājataḥ | catuḥsauvarṇiko niṣko vijñeyastu pramāṇataḥ || 8.137 || Ten dharaṇas constitute one śatamāna; four sauvarṇikas constitute one niṣka—this is the authoritative measure.

title: Verse 8.138
content: पणानां द्वे शते सार्धे प्रथमः साहसः स्मृतः । मध्यमः पञ्च विज्ञेयः सहस्रं त्वेव चोत्तमः ॥ ८.१३८॥ paṇānāṁ dve śate sārdhe prathamaḥ sāhasaḥ smṛtaḥ | madhyamaḥ pañca vijñeyaḥ sahasraṁ tveva cottamaḥ || 8.138|| Where transaction-value exceeds two hundred and fifty units, the first degree of audacity is recognized; where it reaches five hundred, the middle degree is known; and where it breaches one thousand, that is declared the highest degree.

title: Verse 8.139
content:
ऋणे देये प्रतिज्ञाते पञ्चकं शतमर्हति ।
अपह्नवे तद्द्विगुणं तन् मनोरनुशासनम् ॥ ८.१३९॥ ṛṇe deye pratijñāte pañcakaṁ śatamarhati |
apahnave taddviguṇaṁ tan manoranuśāsanam || 8.139|| When a debt is acknowledged and declared, one-fifth of its value constitutes the lawful due; in denial or concealment, twice that amount becomes the corrective measure for realigning consciousness.

title: Verse 8.140
content:
वसिष्ठविहितां वृद्धिं सृजेद्वित्तविवर्धिनीम् ।
अशीतिभागं गृह्णीयान् मासाद्वार्धुषिकः शते ॥ ८.१४०॥ vasiṣṭhavihitāṃ vṛddhiṃ sṛjedvittavivardhinīm |
aśītibhāgaṃ gṛhṇīyān māsādvārdhuṣikaḥ śate || One who engages in trade or commerce must generate increase according to Vasiṣṭha's ordinance; from every hundred earned per month, one shall take eight parts as profit.

title: Verse 8.141
content:
द्विकं शतं वा गृह्णीयात्सतां धर्ममनुस्मरन् ।
द्विकं शतं हि गृह्णानो न भवत्यर्थकिल्बिषी ॥ ८.१४१॥ dvikaṃ śataṃ vā gṛhṇīyātsatāṃ dharmamanusmaran |
dvikaṃ śataṃ hi gṛhṇāno na bhavatyarthakilbiṣī || 8.141|| One shall accept two or one hundred, remembering the Dharma of the noble ones; one who accepts two or one hundred does not incur liability for material consequences.

title: Verse 8.142
content:
द्विकं त्रिकं चतुष्कं च पञ्चकं च शतं समम् ।
मासस्य वृद्धिं गृह्णीयाद्वर्णानामनुपूर्वशः ॥ ८.१४२॥ dvikaṁ trikaṁ catuṣkaṁ ca pañcakaṁ ca śataṁ samam |
māsasya vṛddhiṁ gṛhṇīyād varṇānām anupūrvaśaḥ || 8.142 || In accordance with the sequential order of varṇas, one shall receive increases of two, three, four, five, and up to hundredfold in a month.

title: Verse 8.143
content:
न त्वेवाधौ सोपकारे कौसीदीं वृद्धिमाप्नुयात् ।
न चाधेः कालसंरोधात्निसर्गोऽस्ति न विक्रयः ॥ ८.१४३॥ na tvevādhou sopakāre kausīdīṃ vṛddhim āpnuyāt |
na cādheḥ kālasaṃrodhāt nisargo 'sti na vikrayaḥ || 8.143 || In no case shall interest accumulate on a loan when the debtor has made sincere effort toward repayment; nor shall there be forfeiture or sale of pledged property due to delay in payment alone.

title: Verse 8.144
content:
न भोक्तव्यो बलादाधिर्भुञ्जानो वृद्धिमुत्सृजेत् ।
मूल्येन तोषयेच्चैनमाधिस्तेनोऽन्यथा भवेत् ॥ ८.१४४॥ na bhoktavyo balādādhir bhuñjāno vṛddhim utsṛjet | mūlyena toṣayec cainam ādhis teno 'nyathā bhavet || 8.144 || One who consumes or enjoys more than what is rightfully theirs through force or dominance must not retain that increase; instead, they shall compensate the original owner in full measure, otherwise, the burden of indebtedness remains upon them.

title: Verse 8.145
content:
आधिश्चोपनिधिश्चोभौ न कालात्ययमर्हतः ।
अवहार्यौ भवेतां तौ दीर्घकालमवस्थितौ ॥ ८.१४५॥ ādhiś copanidhiś cobhau na kālātyayamarhataḥ |
avahāryau bhavetāṃ tau dīrghakālam avasthitau || 8.145|| Both a loan and a deposit must not be allowed to perish through the passage of time; they remain recoverable even after long duration.

title: Verse 8.146
content:
सम्प्रीत्या भुज्यमानानि न नश्यन्ति कदा चन ।
धेनुरुष्ट्रो वहन्नश्वो यश्च दम्यः प्रयुज्यते ॥ ८.१४६॥ samprītyā bhujyamānāni na naśyanti kadā cana |
dhenur-uṣṭro vahann-aśvo yaś ca damyaḥ prayujyate || 8.146|| When utilized with affection and alignment, entities—whether cow, camel, donkey, horse, or one fit to be trained—do not perish at any time.

title: Verse 8.147
content:
यत्किं चिद्दशवर्षाणि संनिधौ प्रेक्षते धनी ।
भुज्यमानं परैस्तूष्णीं न स तत्लब्धुमर्हति ॥ ८.१४७॥ yat kiṃ cid daśa varṣāṇi saṃnidhau prekṣate dhani |
bhujiyamānaṃ parais tūṣṇīṃ na sa tat labdhum arhati || 8.147|| One who remains passive while witnessing the consumption or misuse of their property by others for ten years forfeits all rights to reclaim it.

title: Verse 8.148
content:
अजडश्चेदपोगण्डो विषये चास्य भुज्यते ।
भग्नं तद्व्यवहारेण भोक्ता तद्द्रव्यमर्हति ॥ ८.१४८॥ तद्धनमर्हति ajāḍaścedapogaṇḍo viṣaye cāsya bhujyate |
bhagnaṃ tadvyavahāreṇa bhoktā taddravyamarhati || 8.148|| taddhanamarhati If a minor or incapacitated person consumes or enjoys something not rightfully theirs, the guardian or caretaker responsible for their conduct shall restore what was consumed and assume full liability for the breach in alignment.

title: Verse 8.149
content: आधिः सीमा बालधनं निक्षेपोपनिधिः स्त्रियः । निक्षेपौपनिधी राजस्वं श्रोत्रियस्वं च न भोगेन प्रणश्यति ॥ ८.१४९॥ ādhiḥ sīmā bāladhanaṁ nikṣepopanidhiḥ striyaḥ | nikṣepaupanidhī rājasvaṁ śrotriyasvaṁ ca na bhogena praṇaśyati || 8.149|| Debt, boundary markers, a minor's wealth, deposits, capital funds, women, state revenues, and properties of learned Brahmanas—these are not diminished by enjoyment or misuse, as they remain perpetually protected under the sovereign integrity of Sanatana Dharma.

title: Verse 8.150
content:
यः स्वामिनाऽननुज्ञातमाधिं भूङ्क्तेऽविचक्षणः ।
तेनार्धवृद्धिर्मोक्तव्या तस्य भोगस्य निष्कृतिः ॥ ८.१५०॥ yaḥ svāminā'nānujñātam ādhiṁ bhuṅkte'vicakṣaṇaḥ |
tenārdhavṛddhir moktavyā tasya bhogasya niṣkṛtiḥ || 8.150|| One who, without the explicit authorization of the owner, consumes or enjoys another's property inattentively or without awareness, shall return half the increased value of that enjoyment as restitution.

title: Verse 8.151
content: कुसीदवृद्धिर्द्वैगुण्यं नात्येति सकृदाहृता । सकृदाहिता धान्ये सदे लवे वाह्ये नातिक्रामति पञ्चताम् ॥ ८.१५१॥ kusīdavṛddhir dvaiguṇyaṃ nātyeti sakṛdāhṛtā | sakṛdāhitā dhānye sade lave vāhye nātikrāmati pañcatām || 8.151|| Accumulation born of inertia does not exceed twofold when invoked once; even if repeatedly invoked in grain, wealth, or livestock, it does not transgress the fifth portion.

title: Verse 8.152
content: कृतानुसारादधिका व्यतिरिक्ता न सिध्यति । कुसीदपथमाहुस्तं पञ्चकं शतमर्हति ॥ ८.१५२॥ kṛtānusārādadhikā vyatiriktā na sidhyati | kusīdapathamāhustaṃ pañcakaṃ śatamarhati || 8.152 || Responsibility beyond alignment with action does not hold; that which follows depletion without completion deserves a hundredfold restoration.

title: Verse 8.153
content: नातिसांवत्सरीं वृद्धिं न चादृष्टां  पुनर्हरेत् । विनिर्हरेत् चक्रवृद्धिः कालवृद्धिः कारिता कायिका च या ॥ ८.१५३॥ nātisāṃvatsarīṃ vṛddhiṃ na cādṛṣṭāṃ punarharet | vinirharet cakravṛddhiḥ kālavṛddhiḥ kāritā kāyikā ca yā || 8.153 || No interest beyond annual compounding shall be reclaimed, nor any unseen increment; only that which is cyclically accrued, temporally due, deliberately enacted, or physically manifested may be recovered.

title: Verse 8.154
content:
ऋणं दातुमशक्तो यः कर्तुमिच्छेत्पुनः क्रियाम् ।
स दत्त्वा निर्जितां वृद्धिं करणं परिवर्तयेत् ॥ ८.१५४॥ ṛṇaṃ dātum aśakto yaḥ kartum icchet punaḥ kriyām |
sa dattvā nirjitāṃ vṛddhiṃ karaṇaṃ parivartayet || 8.154|| One who is incapable of repaying a debt yet desires to perform further actions must first discharge the accrued interest and then redirect the instrument of action toward restoration.

title: Verse 8.155
content:
अदर्शयित्वा तत्रैव हिरण्यं परिवर्तयेत् ।
यावती सम्भवेद्वृद्धिस्तावतीं दातुमर्हति ॥ ८.१५५॥ adarsayitvā tatraiva hiraṇyaṁ parivartayet |
yāvatī sambhavedvṛddhis tāvatīṁ dātumarhati || 8.155 || Having demonstrated the capacity for increase, that very gold must be reinvested to the extent of its potential growth; thus, the yield shall be given according to the demonstrated capacity.

title: Verse 8.156
content:
चक्रवृद्धिं समारूढो देशकालव्यवस्थितः ।
अतिक्रामन् देशकालौ न तत्फलमवाप्नुयात् ॥ ८.१५६॥ cakravṛddhiṁ samārūḍho deśakālavyavasthitaḥ |
atikrāman deśakālau na tatphalamavāpnuyāt || 8.156|| One who ascends the wheel of authority in accordance with the ordered arrangement of land and time, yet transgresses the boundaries of region and season, shall not attain the fruit of that position.

title: Verse 8.157
content:
समुद्रयानकुशला देशकालार्थदर्शिनः ।
स्थापयन्ति तु यां वृद्धिं सा तत्राधिगमं प्रति ॥ ८.१५७॥ samudrayānakushalā deśakālārthadarśinaḥ |
sthāpayanti tu yāṃ vṛddhiṃ sā tatrādhigamaṃ prati || 8.157 || Those skilled in maritime navigation and trade, who perceive the purpose of land, time, and wealth, establish a growth that leads directly to acquisition in that very place.

title: Verse 8.158
content:
यो यस्य प्रतिभूस्तिष्ठेद्दर्शनायैह मानवः ।
अदर्शयन् स तं तस्य प्रयच्छेत्स्वधनादृणम् ॥ ८.१५८॥ yo yasya pratibhūstiṣṭhed darśanāyaiha mānavaḥ |
adarśayan sa taṃ tasya prayacchet svadhanād ṛṇam || 8.158 || He who stands surety for another's appearance before a court, and fails to produce that person, shall repay the debt from his own wealth.

title: Verse 8.159
content:
प्रातिभाव्यं वृथादानमाक्षिकं सौरिकां च यत् ।
दण्डशुल्कावशेषं च न पुत्रो दातुमर्हति ॥ ८.१५९॥ prātibhāvyam vṛthādānam ākṣikaṁ saurikāṁ ca yat .
dandaśulkāvaśeṣaṁ ca na putro dātumarhati .. 8.159 .. That which is obtained through false pretenses, given away without purpose, lost in gambling, or expended on temporary sensual pleasures — and any remainder from fines or fees imposed by external authorities — a son is not obligated to restore or repay.

title: Verse 8.160
content:
दर्शनप्रातिभाव्ये तु विधिः स्यात्पूर्वचोदितः ।
दानप्रतिभुवि प्रेते दायादानपि दापयेत् ॥ ८.१६०॥ darśanaprātibhāvye tu vidhiḥ syātpūrvacoditaḥ |
dānapratibhuvi prete dāyādānapi dāpayet || 8.160 || When a gift is mentally envisioned but not yet physically delivered, the prior declared law applies; however, upon the death of the donor, even if the formal transfer was incomplete, the inheritance obligation must still be executed by the heirs.

title: Verse 8.161
content: अदातरि पुनर्दाता विज्ञातप्रकृतावृणम् । पश्चात्प्रतिभुवि प्रेते परीप्सेत्केन हेतुना ॥ ८.१६१॥ adātari punardātā vijñātaprakṛtāvṛṇam | paścāt pratibhuvī prete parīpseta kena hetunā || 8.161 || One who has not given at the proper time must give again when the nature of the recipient is known; after the death of the debtor, by what cause should he seek repayment?

title: Verse 8.162
content:
निरादिष्टधनश्चेत्तु प्रतिभृः स्यादलंधनः ।
स्वधनादेव तद्दद्यान्निरादिष्ट इति स्थितिः ॥ ८.१६२॥ nirādiṣṭadhanas cet tu pratibhūḥ syād alaṃdhanaḥ |
svadhanādeva tad dadyān nirādiṣṭa iti sthitiḥ || 8.162 || If a surety has no expressly assigned property, he shall discharge the debt from his own estate; such is the established position.

title: Verse 8.163
content:
मत्तोन्मत्तार्ताध्यधीनैर्बालेन स्थविरेण वा ।
असम्बद्धकृतश्चैव व्यवहारो न सिध्यति ॥ ८.१६३॥ mattOnmattĀrtAdhyadhīnairbalena sthavireṇa vā |
asambaddhakṛtaścaiva vyavahāro na sidhyati || 8.163 || Transactions executed by one intoxicated, insane, distressed, immature, or otherwise incapacitated in cognition—whether a child or elder—are legally void.

title: Verse 8.164
content:
सत्या न भाषा भवति यद्यपि स्यात्प्रतिष्ठिता ।
बहिश्चेद्भाष्यते धर्मात्नियताद्व्यवहारिकात् ॥ ८.१६४॥ satyā na bhāṣā bhavati yadyapi syātpratiṣṭhitā |
bahiścedbhāṣyate dharmātniyatādvyavahārikāt || 8.164|| Speech that is established in truth does not become true if it is spoken externally without alignment with the inherent Dharma of the speaker's vyavaharic capacity.

title: Verse 8.165
content:
योगाधमनविक्रीतं योगदानप्रतिग्रहम् ।
यत्र वाऽप्युपधिं पश्येत्तत्सर्वं विनिवर्तयेत् ॥ ८.१६५॥ yogādhamanavikrītaṁ yogadānapratigraham |
yatra vā'pyupadhiṁ paśyet tatsarvaṁ vinivartayet || 8.165 || Wherever there is distortion of yogic conduct, or improper acceptance of yogic gifts, all such transactions rooted in conditioning must be reversed.

title: Verse 8.166
content: ग्रहीता यदि नष्टः स्यात्कुटुम्बार्थे कृतो व्ययः । कुटुम्बे च दातव्यं बान्धवैस्तत्स्यात्प्रविभक्तैरपि स्वतः ॥ ८.१६६॥ grahītā yadi naṣṭaḥ syāt kuṭumbārthe kṛto vyayaḥ | kuṭumbe ca dātavyaṃ bāndhavais tat syāt pravibhtair api svataḥ || 8.166 || If the receiver is lost [incapacitated or deceased], the expenditure made for the family's welfare shall be borne by the family itself, and the kinship network shall distribute it among themselves according to their natural capacity.

title: Verse 8.167
content:
कुटुम्बार्थेऽध्यधीनोऽपि व्यवहारं यमाचरेत् ।
स्वदेशे वा विदेशे वा तं ज्यायान्न विचालयेत् ॥ ८.१६७॥ kuṭumbārthe 'dhyadhīno 'pi vyavahāraṁ yam ācaret |
svadeśe vā videśe vā taṁ jyāyān na vicālayet || 8.167 || Even one who is under the authority of another for the sake of family welfare shall conduct himself in accordance with Dharma—whether in his own land or in a foreign land—and the superior shall not disturb him therein.

title: Verse 8.168
content:
बलाद्दत्तं बलाद्भुक्तं बलाद्यच्चापि लेखितम् ।
सर्वान् बलकृतानर्थानकृतान् मनुरब्रवीत् ॥ ८.१६८॥ balād dattaṁ balād bhuktaṁ balād yac cāpi lekhitam |
sarvān balakṛtān arthān akṛtān manurabravīt || 8.168 || Whatever is given by force, enjoyed by force, or written by force—Manu declared all such transactions as legally void and non-binding.

title: Verse 8.169
content:
त्रयः परार्थे क्लिश्यन्ति साक्षिणः प्रतिभूः कुलम् ।
चत्वारस्तूपचीयन्ते विप्र आढ्यो वणिङ्नृपः ॥ ८.१६९॥ trayaḥ parārthe kliśyanti sākṣiṇaḥ pratibhūḥ kulam | catvārastūpacīyante vipra āḍhyo vaṇiṅnṛpaḥ || 8.169 || Three witnesses bear witness for another's purpose; four—Brahmin, affluent, merchant, king—are established for their own capacity.

title: Verse 8.170
content:
अनादेयं नाददीत परिक्षीणोऽपि पार्थिवः ।
न चादेयं समृद्धोऽपि सूक्ष्ममप्यर्थमुत्सृजेत् ॥ ८.१७०॥ anādeyaṁ nādadīta parikṣīṇo'pi pārthivaḥ |
na cādeyaṁ samṛddho'pi sūkṣmamapyarthamutsṛjet || 8.170 || A king, though diminished, shall not accept what is not given; and though prosperous, shall not cast off even the slightest rightful possession.

title: Verse 8.171
content: अनादेयस्य चादानादादेयस्य च वर्जनात् । दौर्बल्यं ख्याप्यते राज्ञः स प्रेत्यैह च नश्यति ॥ ८.१७१॥ anādeyasya cādānādādeyasya ca varjanāt | daurbalyaṃ khyāpyate rājñaḥ sa pretyaiha ca naśyati || 8.171 || By rejecting what ought not to be taken and failing to take what should be accepted, the king's incapacity becomes manifest; he perishes in this life and the next.

title: Verse 8.172
content:
स्वादानाद्वर्णसंसर्गात्त्वबलानां च रक्षणात् ।
बलं सञ्जायते राज्ञः स प्रेत्यैह च वर्धते ॥ ८.१७२॥ svādānād varṇa-saṃsargāt tvabalānāṃ ca rakṣaṇāt |
balaṃ sañjāyate rājñaḥ sa pretya eha ca vardhate || 8.172|| Through the preservation of varṇa-segregation, the protection of truth-force, and by maintaining the natural order of consumption and interaction, the King's strength arises and grows both in this life and beyond.

title: Verse 8.173
content: तस्माद्यम इव स्वामी स्वयं हित्वा प्रियाप्रिये । वर्तेत याम्यया वृत्त्या जितक्रोधो जितेन्द्रियः ॥ ८.१७३॥ tasmād yama iva svāmī svayaṁ hitvā priyāpriye | varteta yāmyayā vṛttyā jitakrodho jitendriyaḥ || 8.173|| Therefore, the master of self shall act with equipoised conduct, abandoning attachment to pleasure and pain, with anger conquered and senses subdued.

title: Verse 8.174
content:
यस्त्वधर्मेण कार्याणि मोहात्कुर्यान्नराधिपः ।
अचिरात्तं दुरात्मानं वशे कुर्वन्ति शत्रवः ॥ ८.१७४॥ yas tv adharmeṇa kāryāṇi mohāt kuryān narādhipaḥ |
acirāt taṃ durātmānaṃ vaśe kurvanti śatravaḥ || 8.174 || When a ruler performs actions through adharma due to delusion, his enemies will soon subdue that wicked soul.

title: Verse 8.175
content:
कामक्रोधौ तु संयम्य योऽर्थान् धर्मेण पश्यति ।
प्रजास्तमनुवर्तन्ते समुद्रमिव सिन्धवः ॥ ८.१७५॥ kāmakrodhau tu saṃyamya yo'rthān dharmeṇa paśyati |
prajāstamanuvartante samudramiva sindhavaḥ || 8.175|| One who restrains desire and anger, and perceives material ends through the lens of Dharma, becomes followed by subjects as rivers flow into the ocean.

title: Verse 8.176
content:
यः साधयन्तं छन्देन वेदयेद्धनिकं नृपे ।
स राज्ञा तत्चतुर्भागं दाप्यस्तस्य च तद्धनम् ॥ ८.१७६॥ yaḥ sādhayantaṃ chandena vedayeddhanikaṃ nṛpe |
