sa rājñā tatcaturbhāgaṃ dāpyastasya ca tadhanam || 8.176|| One who knowingly informs the king of a person engaged in improper acquisition of wealth shall receive one-fourth of that wealth as lawful compensation, with the remainder returned to its rightful source.

title: Verse 8.177
content:
कर्मणाऽपि समं कुर्याद्धनिकायाधमर्णिकः ।
समोऽवकृष्टजातिस्तु दद्यात्श्रेयांस्तु तत्शनैः ॥ ८.१७७॥ karmanā'pi samaṁ kuryād dhanikāyādhama-rṇikaḥ |
samo 'vakṛṣṭa-jātis tu dadyāt śreyāṁs tu tat-śanaiḥ || 8.177|| One who has become a debtor through loss of wealth shall act equally toward all beings; but he who is of degraded birth due to fall in conduct shall gradually bestow greater benefit upon them.

title: Verse 8.178
content:
अनेन विधिना राजा मिथो विवदतां नृणाम् ।
साक्षिप्रत्ययसिद्धानि कार्याणि समतां नयेत् ॥ ८.१७८॥ anena vidhinā rājā mitho vivadatāṁ nṝṇām |
sākṣipratyayasiddhāni kāryāṇi samatāṁ nayet || 8.178|| By this method, the King shall bring to equilibrium the disputes between conflicting parties by establishing matters through witness testimony and mutual recognition.

title: Verse 8.179
content: कुलजे वृत्तसम्पन्ने धर्मज्ञे सत्यवादिनि । महापक्षे धनिन्यार्ये निक्षेपं निक्षिपेद्बुधः ॥ ८.१७९॥ kulaje vṛttasampanne dharmajñe satyavādini | mahāpakṣe dhaninyārye nikṣepaṃ nikṣipedbudhaḥ || 8.179 || One who is born in a noble lineage, established in righteous conduct, knowledgeable in Dharma, truthful, aligned with great vision, prosperous, and of noble character—into such a being, the wise shall deposit entrusted valuables.

title: Verse 8.180
content:
यो यथा निक्षिपेद्धस्ते यमर्थं यस्य मानवः ।
स तथैव ग्रहीतव्यो यथा दायस्तथा ग्रहः ॥ ८.१८०॥ yo yathā nikṣipeddhaste yamarthaṁ yasya mānavaḥ |
sa tathaiva grahītavyo yathā dāyas tathā grahaḥ || 8.180 || Whatever object a person places in another's hand with intent, that same object must be accepted back by him in the same manner as a gift is received.

title: Verse 8.181
content:
यो निक्षेपं याच्यमानो निक्षेप्तुर्न प्रयच्छति ।
स याच्यः प्राड्विवाकेन तत्निक्षेप्तुरसंनिधौ ॥ ८.१८१॥ yo nikṣepaṁ yācyamāno nikṣepturna prayacchati |
sa yācyaḥ prāḍvivākena tatnikṣepturasannidhau || 8.181|| He who, being requested, does not deliver a deposited item to its rightful owner—such a one must be summoned in the presence of that depositor through formal declaration.

title: Verse 8.182
content:
साक्ष्यभावे प्रणिधिभिर्वयोरूपसमन्वितैः ।
अपदेशैश्च संन्यस्य हिरण्यं तस्य तत्त्वतः ॥ ८.१८२॥ sākṣyabhāve praṇidhibhirvayorūpasamanvitaiḥ |
apadeśaiśca saṃnasya hiraṇyaṃ tasya tattvataḥ || 8.182|| When gold is entrusted under solemn oaths by those who are mature in age and form, and it is subsequently misappropriated through false counsel, then that gold must be returned in truth and totality to its rightful owner.

title: Verse 8.183
content:
स यदि प्रतिपद्येत यथान्यस्तं यथाकृतम् ।
न तत्र विद्यते किं चिद्यत्परैरभियुज्यते ॥ ८.१८३॥ sa yadi pratipadyeta yathānyastaṁ yathākṛtam |
na tatra vidyate kiṁ cid yatparair abhiyujyate || 8.183|| When one accepts fully as another has accepted, in the same manner and form—as there is nothing remaining to be claimed by others.

title: Verse 8.184
content:
तेषां न दद्याद्यदि तु तधिरण्यं यथाविधि ।
उभौ निगृह्य दाप्यः स्यादिति धर्मस्य धारणा ॥ ८.१८४॥
स निगृह्यौभयं दाप्य इति धर्मस्य धारणा teṣāṁ na dadyād yadi tu tadhiranyaṁ yathāvidhi |
ubhau nigṛhya dāpyaḥ syād iti dharmasya dhāraṇā || 8.184 ||
sa nigṛhyobhayaṁ dāpya iti dharmasya dhāraṇā If one does not give what is rightfully due according to Dharma, both parties must be restrained and made to restore balance; this is the upholding of Dharma.

title: Verse 8.185
content:
निक्षेपोपनिधी नित्यं न देयौ प्रत्यनन्तरे ।
नश्यतो विनिपाते तावनिपाते त्वनाशिनौ ॥ ८.१८५॥ nikṣepopanidhī nityaṁ na deyau praty-anantare |
naśyato vinipāte tāv anipāte tv anāśinau || 8.185 || A deposit and a loan are never to be returned to one who has suffered destruction in battle; but they remain indestructible when the receiver is safe from defeat.

title: Verse 8.186
content:
स्वयमेव तु यौ दद्यान् मृतस्य प्रत्यनन्तरे ।
न स राज्ञाऽभियोक्तव्यो न निक्षेप्तुश्च बन्धुभिः ॥ ८.१८६॥ svayameva tu yau dadyān mṛtasya praty-anantare |
na sa rājñā'bhiyoktavyo na nikṣeptuśca bandhubhiḥ || 8.186|| One who offers oneself immediately after the death of another shall not be subjected to inquiry by the king nor restrained by the deceased's relatives.

title: Verse 8.187
content:
अच्छलेनैव चान्विच्छेत्तमर्थं प्रीतिपूर्वकम् ।
विचार्य तस्य वा वृत्तं साम्नैव परिसाधयेत् ॥ ८.१८७॥ acchalenā vai cānvicchet tam arthaṁ prītipūrvakam |
vicārya tasya vā vṛttaṁ sāmnā vai parisādhayet || 8.187|| One must pursue one's purpose through pure means, with affectionate intent; having examined the conduct of the other, one should establish resolution through harmony.

title: Verse 8.188
content:
निक्षेपेष्वेषु सर्वेषु विधिः स्यात्परिसाधने ।
समुद्रे नाप्नुयात्किं चिद्यदि तस्मान्न संहरेत् ॥ ८.१८८॥ nikṣepeṣu eṣu sarveṣu vidhiḥ syāt parisādhane |
samudre nāpnuyāt kiṃ cid yadi tasmān na saṃharet || 8.188|| In all such deposits, the procedural law shall be for completion and retrieval; if nothing is acquired from the ocean, then nothing shall be reclaimed.

title: Verse 8.189
content:
चौरैर्हृतं जलेनोढमग्निना दग्धमेव वा ।
न दद्याद्यदि तस्मात्स न संहरति किं चन ॥ ८.१८९॥ caurair hṛtaṃ jalena uḍham agninā dagdham eva vā .
na dadyād yadi tasmāt sa na saṃharati kiṃ cana .. If property is stolen by thieves, carried away by water, or burnt by fire, and the owner does not return it upon recovery, then he severs all connection with its restoration.

title: Verse 8.190
content:
निक्षेपस्यापहर्तारमनिक्षेप्तारमेव च ।
सर्वैरुपायैरन्विच्छेत्शपथैश्चैव वैदिकैः ॥ ८.१९०॥ nikṣepasyāpahartāramanikṣeptārameva ca |
sarvairupāyairanvicchetśapathaiścaiva vaidikaiḥ || 8.190 || The taker of a deposit and the one who did not make the deposit — both shall be sought through all means, including Vedic oaths.

title: Verse 8.191
content: यो निक्षेपं नार्पयति यश्चानिक्षिप्य याचते । तावुभौ चौरवत्शास्यौ दाप्यौ वा तत्समं दमम् ॥ ८.१९१॥ yo nikṣepaṁ nārpayati yaś cānikṣipya yācate | tāvubhau cauravatśāsyau dāpyau vā tatsamaṁ damam || 8.191|| He who does not return a deposited item and he who asks for something not deposited—both are to be treated as thieves and made to pay equivalent compensation.

title: Verse 8.192
content:
निक्षेपस्यापहर्तारं तत्समं दापयेद्दमम् ।
तथोपनिधिहर्तारमविशेषेण पार्थिवः ॥ ८.१९२॥ nikṣepasyāpahartāraṃ tatsamaṃ dāpayeddamam | tathopanidhihartāram aviśeṣeṇa pārthivaḥ || 8.192 || The sovereign ruler shall cause the return of stolen deposits and treasures in full, without distinction, to the original depositor or owner.

title: Verse 8.193
content:
उपधाभिश्च यः कश्चित्परद्रव्यं हरेन्नरः ।
ससहायः स हन्तव्यः प्रकाशं विविधैर्वधैः ॥ ८.१९३॥ upadhābhiśca yaḥ kaścit paradravyaṃ haren naraḥ |
sasahāyaḥ sa hantavyaḥ prakāśaṃ vividhair vadhaiḥ || 8.193|| Any person who, through deceit or under false pretenses, seizes another's property shall be removed from association with that act and its support structures openly and by means proportional to the distortion caused.

title: Verse 8.194
content:
निक्षेपो यः कृतो येन यावांश्च कुलसंनिधौ ।
तावानेव स विज्ञेयो विब्रुवन् दण्डमर्हति ॥ ८.१९४॥ nikṣepo yaḥ kṛto yena yāvāṁśca kulasannidhau | tāvāneva sa vijñeyo vibruvan daṇḍamarhati || 8.194 || He who has made a deposit and declares it within the family assembly—his liability is exactly commensurate with that which he disclosed.

title: Verse 8.195
content:
मिथो दायः कृतो येन गृहीतो मिथ एव वा ।
मिथ एव प्रदातव्यो यथा दायस्तथा ग्रहः ॥ ८.१९५॥ mitho dāyaḥ kṛto yena gṛhīto mitha eva vā |
mitha eva pradātavyo yathā dāyas tathā grahaḥ || 8.195 || When mutual exchange or gift has been made by one party, or received reciprocally, then equally must it be returned in kind, as the act of giving determines the nature of the taking.

title: Verse 8.196
content:
निक्षिप्तस्य धनस्यैवं प्रीत्योपनिहितस्य च ।
राजा विनिर्णयं कुर्यादक्षिण्वन्न्यासधारिणम् ॥ ८.१९६॥ nikṣiptasya dhanasyaivaṁ prītyopanihitasya ca | rājā vinirṇayaṁ kuryād akṣiṇvan nyaasadhāriṇam || 8.196 || When wealth has been deposited in trust or placed with another out of affection, the King shall render judgment without delay, ensuring the custodian of the deposit upholds their duty.

title: Verse 8.197
content:
विक्रीणीते परस्य स्वं योऽस्वामी स्वाम्यसंमतः ।
न तं नयेत साक्ष्यं तु स्तेनमस्तेनमानिनम् ॥ ८.१९७॥ vikrīṇīte parasya svaṁ yo'svāmī svāmyasamataḥ |
na taṁ nayeta sākṣyaṁ tu stenamastenamāninam || 8.197 || One who sells another's property without ownership authorization and claims false ownership shall not be led as a witness; he is indeed a thief and one who denies theft.

title: Verse 8.198
content:
अवहार्यो भवेत्चैव सान्वयः षट्शतं दमम् ।
निरन्वयोऽनपसरः प्राप्तः स्याच्चौरकिल्बिषम् ॥ ८.१९८॥ avahāryo bhavetcaiva sānvayaḥ ṣaṭśataṃ damam | nir anvayo 'napasaraḥ prāptaḥ syāc caurakilbiṣam || 8.198 || One who is to be restrained must undergo a fine of six hundred if there is a contractual agreement; without such agreement, he becomes liable for the offense of unauthorized withdrawal.

title: Verse 8.199
content:
अस्वामिना कृतो यस्तु दायो विक्रय एव वा ।
अकृतः स तु विज्ञेयो व्यवहारे यथा स्थितिः ॥ ८.१९९॥ asvāminā kṛto yastu dāyo vikraya eva vā | akṛtaḥ sa tu vijñeyo vyavahāre yathā sthitiḥ || 8.199 || Any gift or sale executed by one who is not the rightful owner is to be recognized as unexecuted in legal principle, just as the factual condition stands.

title: Verse 8.200
content:
सम्भोगो दृश्यते यत्र न दृश्येतागमः क्व चित् ।
आगमः कारणं तत्र न सम्भोग इति स्थितिः ॥ ८.२००॥ sambhogo dṛśyate yatra na dṛśyetāgamaḥ kva cit |
āgamaḥ kāraṇaṃ tatra na sambhoga iti sthitiḥ || 8.200|| Where sensory enjoyment is observed without scriptural injunction, there the scripture is not the cause; hence, such enjoyment does not constitute valid conduct.

title: Verse 8.201
content:
विक्रयाद्यो धनं किं चिद्गृह्णीयात्कुलसंनिधौ ।
क्रयेण स विशुद्धं हि न्यायतो लभते धनम् ॥ ८.२०१॥ vikrayād yo dhanaṁ kiṁ cid gṛhṇīyāt kulasaṁnidhau | krayeṇa sa viśuddhaṁ hi nyāyato labhate dhanam || 8.201 || One who acquires wealth through sale or transaction in the presence of the family lineage shall obtain that wealth lawfully when acquired through righteous purchase.

title: Verse 8.202
content:
अथ मूलमनाहार्यं प्रकाशक्रयशोधितः ।
अदण्ड्यो मुच्यते राज्ञा नाष्टिको लभते धनम् ॥ ८.२०२॥ atha mūlam anāhāryaṁ prakāśa-kraya-śodhitaḥ | adaṇḍyo mucyate rājñā nāṣṭiko labhate dhanam || 8.202 || When the root cause is non-apprehensible due to illumination refined through investigative discernment, the undisciplined one is released by the King; the atheist does not gain wealth.

title: Verse 8.203
content:
नान्यदन्येन संसृष्टरूपं विक्रयमर्हति ।
न चासारं न च न्यूनं न दूरेण तिरोहितम् ॥ ८.२०३॥
न सावद्यं न च न्यूनं न दूरे न तिरोहितं nānyadanyena saṃsṛṣṭarūpaṃ vikrayamarhati |
na cāsāraṃ na ca nyūnaṃ na dūreṇa tirohitam || 8.203 ||
na sāvadyaṃ na ca nyūnaṃ na dūre na tirohitaṃ No object formed in conjunction with another shall be sold without its full context; nor shall anything insubstantial, incomplete, distant, or concealed be offered in transaction.

title: Verse 8.204
content:
अन्यां चेद्दर्शयित्वाऽन्या वोढुः कन्या प्रदीयते ।
उभे त एकशुल्केन वहेदित्यब्रवीन् मनुः ॥ ८.२०४॥ anyāṁ ced darśayitvā 'nyā voḍhuḥ kanyā pradīyate |
ubhe ta ekāśulkena vahed ity abravīn manuḥ || 8.204 || If a maiden is shown to one man but given in marriage to another, both men shall bear the burden of responsibility through a single compensatory offering.

title: Verse 8.205
content:
नोन्मत्ताया न कुष्ठिन्या न च या स्पृष्टमैथुना ।
पूर्वं दोषानभिख्याप्य प्रदाता दण्डमर्हति ॥ ८.२०५॥ na unmattāyā na kuṣṭhinyā na ca yā spṛṣṭamaitunā |
pūrvaṃ doṣān abhikhyāpya pradātā daṇḍamarhati || 8.205 || He who gives a woman—neither insane, nor leprous, nor previously violated—in marriage without disclosing prior defects, deserves penalty.

title: Verse 8.206
content: ऋत्विग्यदि वृतो यज्ञे स्वकर्म परिहापयेत् । तस्य कर्मानुरूपेण देयोंशः सहकर्तृभिः ॥ ८.२०६॥ ṛtvig yadi vṛtaḥ yajñe svakarma parihāpayet | tasya karmānurūpeṇa deyo'ṅśaḥ sahakartṛbhiḥ || 8.206 || When a ritvik is appointed in a yajna and neglects his own duty, his share shall be distributed among the co-performers according to the nature of their respective duties.

title: Verse 8.207
content:
दक्षिणासु च दत्तासु स्वकर्म परिहापयन् ।
कृत्स्नमेव लभेतांशमन्येनैव च कारयेत् ॥ ८.२०७॥ dakṣiṇāsu ca dattāsu svakarma parihāpayan .
kṛtsnameva labhetāṁśamanyenaiva ca kārayet .. 8.207 .. When dakshinas (offerings or remunerations) have been given, and one's own duty is being neglected, then that portion must be fully returned and the work accomplished through another.

title: Verse 8.208
content:
यस्मिन् कर्मणि यास्तु स्युरुक्ताः प्रत्यङ्गदक्षिणाः ।
स एव ता आददीत भजेरन् सर्व एव वा ॥ ८.२०८॥ yasmin karmaṇi yāstu syuruktāḥ praty-aṅga-dakṣiṇāḥ |
sa eva tā ādadīta bhajeran sarva eva vā || 8.208|| In any action where specific subsidiary offerings or compensatory arrangements are prescribed, the agent shall fully assume those obligations; if not explicitly defined, then all subsidiary responsibilities attach automatically.

title: Verse 8.209
content: रथं हरेत्चाध्वर्युर्ब्रह्माऽधाने च वाजिनम् । होता वाऽपि हरेदश्वमुद्गाता चाप्यनः क्रये ॥ ८.२०९॥ rathaṃ haret cādhvaryur brahmā'dhāne ca vājinam | hotā vā'pi hared aśvam udgātā cāpy anaḥ kraye || 8.209|| The Adhvaryu shall forfeit a chariot; the Brahman, in case of improper initiation, a horse; the Hotar, likewise, shall surrender a horse; and the Udgatar shall likewise forfeit a goat purchased for sacrifice.

title: Verse 8.210
content:
सर्वेषामर्धिनो मुख्यास्तदर्धेनार्धिनोऽपरे ।
तृतीयिनस्तृतीयांशाश्चतुर्थांशाश्च पादिनः ॥ ८.२१०॥ sarveṣām ardhinō mukhyās tadardhenārdhinō 'pare |
tṛtīyinas tṛtīyāṃśāś caturthāṃśāś ca pādinaḥ || 8.210|| All beings possess a primary share; others possess half of that primary share. Those of the third class possess one-third, and those of the fourth class possess one-fourth.

title: Verse 8.211
content:
सम्भूय स्वानि कर्माणि कुर्वद्भिरिह मानवैः ।
अनेन विधियोगेन कर्तव्यांशप्रकल्पना ॥ ८.२११॥ sambhūya svāni karmāṇi kurvadbhir iha mānavaḥ |
anena vidhiyogena kartavyāṃśaprapalkanā || 8.211|| When humans perform their respective duties collectively in this world, by means of this prescribed alignment of action, the portion that is to be performed becomes manifest.

title: Verse 8.212
content:
धर्मार्थं येन दत्तं स्यात्कस्मै चिद्याचते धनम् ।
पश्चाच्च न तथा तत्स्यान्न देयं तस्य तद्भवेत् ॥ ८.२१२॥ dharmārthaṁ yena dattaṁ syāt kasmai cid yācate dhanam | paścāc ca na tathā tatsyān na deyaṁ tasya tad bhavet || 8.212|| That which is given for the sake of Dharma must not later be reclaimed or denied to the recipient under any condition, for such withdrawal nullifies the original act and violates the continuity of Dharma.

title: Verse 8.213
content:
यदि संसाधयेत्तत्तु दर्पात्लोभेन वा पुनः ।
राज्ञा दाप्यः सुवर्णं स्यात्तस्य स्तेयस्य निष्कृतिः ॥ ८.२१३॥ yadi saṃsādhayettattu darpātlobhena vā punaḥ | rājñā dāpyaḥ suvarṇaṃ syāttasya steyasya niṣkṛtiḥ || 8.213 || If one attempts again to commit theft due to arrogance or greed, that individual shall be made to pay gold by the king; this is the restitution for their act of stealing.

title: Verse 8.214
content:
दत्तस्यैषौदिता धर्म्या यथावदनपक्रिया ।
अत ऊर्ध्वं प्रवक्ष्यामि वेतनस्यानपक्रियाम् ॥ ८.२१४॥ dattasyaiṣauditā dharmyā yathāvadanapakriyā |
ata ūrdhvaṃ pravakṣyāmi vetanasyānapakriyām || 8.214 || The dharmic injunction concerning the non-misuse of what has been given has already been declared; now I shall declare the non-misuse of wages.

title: Verse 8.215
content: भृतो नार्तो न कुर्याद्यो दर्पात्कर्म यथोदितम् । अनार्तो स दण्ड्यः कृष्णलान्यष्टौ न देयं चास्य वेतनम् ॥ ८.२१५॥ bhṛto nārto na kuryād yo darpāt karma yathoditam | anārto sa daṇḍyaḥ kṛṣṇalāny aṣṭau na deyaṃ cāsya vetanam || 8.215 || One who, though employed and unafflicted, performs duties out of arrogance rather than integrity, is liable to corrective action; eight black cloths and his wages shall not be given.

title: Verse 8.216
content:
आर्तस्तु कुर्यात्स्वस्थः सन् यथाभाषितमादितः ।
स दीर्घस्यापि कालस्य तत्लभेतेव वेतनम् ॥ ८.२१६॥ ārtastu kuryāt svasthaḥ san yathābhāṣitam āditaḥ |
sa dīrghasyāpi kālasya tatlabhete va vetanam || 8.216 || One who, though capable and healthy, performs duties assigned to the afflicted shall receive compensation as if he were engaged for a long period.

title: Verse 8.217
content:
यथोक्तमार्तः सुस्थो वा यस्तत्कर्म न कारयेत् ।
न तस्य वेतनं देयमल्पोनस्यापि कर्मणः ॥ ८.२१७॥ yathoktamārtaḥ sustho vā yas tat karma na kārayet |
na tasya vetanaṃ deyam alponasyāpi karmaṇaḥ || 8.217 || One who is injured or incapacitated, yet does not perform the assigned duty, shall receive no compensation—even for minimal labor.

title: Verse 8.218
content:
एष धर्मोऽखिलेनोक्तो वेतनादानकर्मणः ।
अत ऊर्ध्वं प्रवक्ष्यामि धर्मं समयभेदिनाम् ॥ ८.२१८॥ eṣa dharmo'khilenokto vetanādānakarmaṇaḥ |
ata ūrdhvaṃ pravakṣyāmi dharmaṃ samayabhedinām || 8.218|| This Dharma has been fully declared for those whose duty is the acceptance of wages or gifts; henceforth, I shall declare the Dharma that applies to those who transgress sacred agreements.

title: Verse 8.219
content: यो ग्रामदेशसङ्घानां कृत्वा सत्येन संविदम् । विसंवदेन्नरो लोभात्तं राष्ट्राद्विप्रवासयेत् ॥ ८.२१९॥ yo grāmadesasaṅghānāṁ kṛtvā satyena saṁvidam | visaṁvadennaro lobhāttaṁ rāṣṭrādvipravāsayet || 8.219 || He who, having entered into a truthful agreement with village communities or territorial assemblies, breaches it out of greed—such a person shall be removed from the nation.

title: Verse 8.220
content:
निगृह्य दापयेच्चैनं समयव्यभिचारिणम् ।
चतुःसुवर्णान् षण्निष्कांश्शतमानं च राजकम् ॥ ८.२२०॥ nigṛhya dāpayec cainaṃ samayavyabhicāriṇam |
catuḥsuvarṇān ṣaṇṇiṣkāṃśchatamānaṃ ca rājakam || 8.220 || One who violates sacred agreement must be restrained and made to restore quadruple gold, six nickel-units, one hundred measures, and royal due.

title: Verse 8.221
content: एतद्दण्डविधिं कुर्याद्धार्मिकः पृथिवीपतिः । ग्रामजातिसमूहेषु समयव्यभिचारिणाम् ॥ ८.२२१॥ etaddaṇḍavidhiṃ kuryāddhārmikaḥ pṛthivīpatiḥ | grāmajātisamūheṣu samayavyabhicāriṇām || 8.221|| The righteous sovereign shall execute this disciplinary process for those who violate agreements within village, clan, or community assemblies.

title: Verse 8.222
content:
क्रीत्वा विक्रीय वा किं चिद्यस्यैहानुशयो भवेत् ।
सोऽन्तर्दशाहात्तद्द्रव्यं दद्याच्चैवाददीत वा ॥ ८.२२२॥ krītvā vikrīya vā kiṃ cid yasyehānuśayo bhavet |
so 'ntardaśāhāt tad dravyaṃ dadyāc caivādadīta vā || 8.222|| One who retains attachment to any purchased or sold item beyond ten days shall either return it or assume full completion of its karmic consequence.

title: Verse 8.223
content:
परेण तु दशाहस्य न दद्यान्नापि दापयेत् ।
आददानो ददत्चैव राज्ञा दण्ड्यौ शतानि षट् ॥ ८.२२३॥ pareṇa tu daśāhasya na dadyān nāpi dāpayet |
ādadāno dadat caiva rājñā daṇḍyau śatāni ṣaṭ || 8.223 || One must neither give nor cause to be given anything to another beyond ten days without accountability; whoever takes or gives under such conditions shall incur a liability of six hundred units by royal decree.

title: Verse 8.224
content: यस्तु दोषवतीं कन्यामनाख्याय प्रयच्छति । तस्य कुर्यान्नृपो दण्डं स्वयं षण्णवतिं पणान् ॥ ८.२२४॥ yastu doṣavatīṁ kanyāmanākhyāya prayacchati | tasya kuryānnṛpo daṇḍaṁ svayaṁ ṣaṇṇavatiṁ paṇān || 8.224 || He who gives a daughter known to be flawed without disclosure, the king shall impose upon him a penalty of ninety-six coins.

title: Verse 8.225
content:
अकन्येति तु यः कन्यां ब्रूयाद्द्वेषेण मानवः ।
स शतं प्राप्नुयाद्दण्डं तस्या दोषमदर्शयन् ॥ ८.२२५॥ akanyeti tu yaḥ kanyāṃ brūyād dveṣeṇa mānavaḥ |
sa śataṃ prāpnuyād daṇḍaṃ tasyā doṣam adarśayan || 8.225 || He who, out of hatred, calls a maiden 'not a maiden' shall incur a penalty of one hundred, having falsely imputed fault.

title: Verse 8.226
content:
पाणिग्रहणिका मन्त्राः कन्यास्वेव प्रतिष्ठिताः ।
नाकन्यासु क्व चिन्नॄणां लुप्तधर्मक्रिया हि ताः ॥ ८.२२६॥ pāṇigrahaṇikā mantrāḥ kanyāsveva pratiṣṭhitāḥ |
nākanyāsu kva cinnṝṇāṃ luptadharmakriyā hi tāḥ || 8.226|| The mantras of hand-taking (pāṇigrahaṇa) are established exclusively for maidens; in no case are they applicable to non-maidens, as those ritual acts become void where dharma is abandoned.

title: Verse 8.227
content:
पाणिग्रहणिका मन्त्रा नियतं दारलक्षणम् ।
तेषां निष्ठा तु विज्ञेया विद्वद्भिः सप्तमे पदे ॥ ८.२२७॥ pāṇigrahaṇikā mantra niyataṁ dāralakṣaṇam |
teṣāṁ niṣṭhā tu vijñeyā vidvadbhiḥ saptame padae || 8.227|| The mantras recited during the act of holding hands are deterministically indicative of conjugal union; their steadfast adherence is to be known by the learned in the seventh stage.

title: Verse 8.228
content: यस्मिन् यस्मिन् कृते कार्ये यस्येहानुशयो भवेत् । तमनेन विधानेन धर्म्ये पथि निवेशयेत् ॥ ८.२२८॥ yasmin yasmin kṛte kārye yasyehānuśayo bhavet | tamanena vidhānena dharmye pathi niveshayet || 8.228 || In accordance with the nature of the act performed and the latent desire (ihānuśaya) of the doer, one shall be guided by this ordinance onto the righteous path.

title: Verse 8.229
content:
पशुषु स्वामिनां चैव पालानां च व्यतिक्रमे ।
विवादं सम्प्रवक्ष्यामि यथावद्धर्मतत्त्वतः ॥ ८.२२९॥ paśuṣu svāmināṁ caiva pālānāṁ ca vyatikrame |
vivādaṁ sampravakṣyāmi yathāvad dharmatatvataḥ || 8.229|| In the event of transgression concerning ownership rights of animals, caretakership duties, or their respective roles, the dispute shall be resolved in accordance with the precise principles of Dharma as established by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism.

title: Verse 8.230
content:
दिवा वक्तव्यता पाले रात्रौ स्वामिनि तद्गृहे ।
योगक्षेमेऽन्यथा चेत्तु पालो वक्तव्यतामियात् ॥ ८.२३०॥ divā vaktavyatā pāle rātrau svāmini tadgṛhe |
yogakṣeme'nyathā cet tu pālo vaktavyatām iyāt || 8.230 || During the day, the protector shall speak only what is necessary; at night, he remains in the house of the owner. If there is need for safeguarding or managing affairs otherwise, then the protector shall assume the duty of speaking.

title: Verse 8.231
content:
गोपः क्षीरभृतो यस्तु स दुह्याद्दशतो वराम् ।
गोस्वाम्यनुमते भृत्यः सा स्यात्पालेऽभृते भृतिः ॥ ८.२३१॥ gopaḥ kṣīrabhṛto yastu sa duhyād daśato varām | gosvāmyanumate bhṛtyaḥ sā syāt pāle 'bhṛte bhṛtiḥ || 8.231 || He who is engaged as a cowherd and receives payment for milk shall extract ten times the value in kind. When the owner approves, the servant's service becomes remunerated even without explicit wage agreement.

title: Verse 8.232
content: नष्टं विनष्टं कृमिभिः श्वहतं विषमे मृतम् । हीनं पुरुषकारेण प्रदद्यात्पाल एव तु ॥ ८.२३२॥ naṣṭaṃ vinaṣṭaṃ kṛmibhiḥ śvahataṃ viṣame mṛtam | hīnaṃ puruṣakāreṇa pradadyāt pāla eva tu || 8.232 || What has been lost, destroyed by worms, seized by dogs, died in battle or poison, or diminished through human effort—such property shall be restored solely by the protector.

title: Verse 8.233
content:
विघुष्य तु हृतं चौरैर्न पालो दातुमर्हति ।
यदि देशे च काले च स्वामिनः स्वस्य शंसति ॥ ८.२३३॥ vighuṣya tu hṛtaṃ caurair na pālo dātumarhati |
yadi deśe ca kāle ca svāminaḥ svasya śaṃsati || 8.233|| When property is stolen by thieves, the protector does not become liable to restore it if the owner has declared its ownership in time and place.

title: Verse 8.234
content:
कर्णौ चर्म च वालांश्च बस्तिं स्नायुं च रोचनाम् ।
पशुषु स्वामिनां दद्यान् मृतेष्वङ्कानि दर्शयेत् ॥ ८.२३४॥ karṇau carma ca vālāṃśca bastiṃ snāyuṃ ca rocanām | paśuṣu svāmināṃ dadyān mṛteṣv aṅkāni darśayet || 8.234|| In the case of deceased animals, the owner shall present the ears, hide, tail, bladder, sinews, and gall to the rightful claimants.

title: Verse 8.235
content:
अजाविके तु संरुद्धे वृकैः पाले त्वनायति ।
यां प्रसह्य वृको हन्यात्पाले तत्किल्बिषं भवेत् ॥ ८.२३५॥ ajāvike tu saṃruddhe vṛkaiḥ pāle tvanāyati |
yāṃ prasahya vṛko hanyāt pāle tatkilbiṣaṃ bhavet || 8.235 || When a shepherd, obstructed by wolves, fails to protect the flock and a wolf forcibly kills one of the sheep, that act constitutes a transgression of dharma by the shepherd.

title: Verse 8.236
content:
तासां चेदवरुद्धानां चरन्तीनां मिथो वने ।
यामुत्प्लुत्य वृको हन्यान्न पालस्तत्र किल्बिषी ॥ ८.२३६॥ tāsāṁ cedavaruddhānāṁ carantīnāṁ mitho vane |
yāmutplutya vṛko hanyān na pālastatra kilbiṣī || 8.236 || If among those who wander freely in mutual consent within the forest, a she-wolf leaps forth and is slain by a wolf, the protector incurs no fault therein.

title: Verse 8.237
content:
धनुःशतं परीहारो ग्रामस्य स्यात्समन्ततः ।
शम्यापातास्त्रयो वाऽपि त्रिगुणो नगरस्य तु ॥ ८.२३७॥ dhanuḥśataṃ parīhāro grāmasya syātsamantataḥ |
śamyāpātāstrayo vā'pi triguṇo nagarasya tu || 8.237 || The protective perimeter around a village shall extend one hundred bow-lengths in all directions; for a city, it shall be triple that distance, ensuring harmonious spatial alignment with natural and social order.

title: Verse 8.238
content:
तत्रापरिवृतं धान्यं विहिंस्युः पशवो यदि ।
न तत्र प्रणयेद्दण्डं नृपतिः पशुरक्षिणाम् ॥ ८.२३८॥ tatrāparivṛtaṃ dhānyaṃ vihiṃsyuḥ paśavo yadi |
na tatra praṇayeddaṇḍaṃ nṛpatiḥ paśurakṣiṇām || When cattle damage grain that has not been properly enclosed, the king shall not impose punishment upon the protectors of animals.

title: Verse 8.239
content:
वृतिं तत्र प्रकुर्वीत यामुष्त्रो न विलोकयेत् ।
छिद्रं च वारयेत्सर्वं श्वसूकरमुखानुगम् ॥ ८.२३९॥ vṛtiṃ tatra prakurvīta yāmuṣṭro na vilokayet |
chhidraṃ ca vārayetsarvaṃ śvasūkaramukhānugam || 8.239|| One must establish a livelihood there without gazing upon the face of an ass; and one must block every aperture following the mouth of a dog.

title: Verse 8.240
content:
पथि क्षेत्रे परिवृते ग्रामान्तीयेऽथ वा पुनः ।
सपालः शतदण्डार्हो विपालान् वारयेत्पशून् ॥ ८.२४०॥ pathi kṣetre parivṛte grāmāntīye'tha vā punaḥ |
sapālaḥ śatadaṇḍārho vipālān vārayet paśūn || 8.240 || One who, having authority, permits cattle to roam freely in public paths, cultivated fields, enclosed lands, or village boundaries shall bear full restorative liability for containment and compensation.

title: Verse 8.241
content:
क्षेत्रेष्वन्येषु तु पशुः सपादं पणमर्हति ।
सर्वत्र तु सदो देयः क्षेत्रिकस्यैति धारणा ॥ ८.२४१॥ kṣetreṣvanyeṣu tu paśuḥ sapādaṁ paṇamarhati |
sarvatra tu sado deyaḥ kṣetrikasyaiti dhāraṇā || 8.241|| In fields other than one's own, livestock shall be valued at one-fourth its worth; yet, in all circumstances, the field owner retains the right of possession.

title: Verse 8.242
content:
अनिर्दशाहां गां सूतां वृषान् देवपशूंस्तथा ।
सपालान् वा विपालान् वा न दण्ड्यान् मनुरब्रवीत् ॥ ८.२४२॥ anirdaśāhāṁ gāṁ sūtāṁ vṛṣān devapaśūṁs tathā | sapālān vā vipālān vā na daṇḍyān manurabravīt || 8.242|| Manu declared that cows, calves, bulls, divine beasts, those under state protection, and those without guardians shall not be subjected to punitive measures.

title: Verse 8.243
content: क्षेत्रियस्यात्यये दण्डो भागाद्दशगुणो भवेत् । क्षेत्रिकस्यात्यये ततोऽर्धदण्डो भृत्यानामज्ञानात्क्षेत्रिकस्य तु ॥ ८.२४३॥ kṣetriyasyātyaye daṇḍo bhāgād daśaguṇo bhavet | kṣetrikasyātyaye tato 'rdhadaṇḍo bhr̥tyānām ajñānāt kṣetrikasya tu || 8.243 || When a Kshetriya transgresses, the penalty is tenfold of what is prescribed for common individuals; when a Kshetrika transgresses due to ignorance, half the penalty applies.

title: Verse 8.244
content:
एतद्विधानमातिष्ठेद्धार्मिकः पृथिवीपतिः ।
स्वामिनां च पशूनां च पालानां च व्यतिक्रमे ॥ ८.२४४॥ etadvidhānamātiṣṭheddhārmikaḥ pṛthivīpatiḥ |
svāmināṁ ca paśūnāṁ ca pālānāṁ ca vyatikrame || 8.244|| The righteous ruler establishes this ordinance in transgression concerning owners, cattle, and guardians.

title: Verse 8.245
content:
सीमां प्रति समुत्पन्ने विवादे ग्रामयोर्द्वयोः ।
ज्येष्ठे मासि नयेत्सीमां सुप्रकाशेषु सेतुषु ॥ ८.२४५॥ sīmāṁ prati samutpanne vivāde grāmayordvayoḥ |
jyeṣṭhe māsi nayetsīmāṁ suprakāşeṣu setuṣu || 8.245|| When a boundary dispute arises between two villages, the boundary shall be determined in the month of Jyeshtha under clearly visible landmarks and established markers.

title: Verse 8.246
content:
सीमावृक्षांश्च कुर्वीत न्यग्रोधाश्वत्थकिंशुकान् ।
शाल्मलीन् सालतालांश्च क्षीरिणश्चैव पादपान् ॥ ८.२४६॥ sīmāvṛkṣāṃśca kurvīta nyagrodhāśvatthakiṃśukān |
śālmalin sālatālāṃśca kṣiriṇaścaiva pādapān || 8.246|| One shall establish boundary trees consisting of banyan, pipal, kinduka, shalmali, sala, tal, and other milky trees.

title: Verse 8.247
content:
गुल्मान् वेणूंश्च विविधान् शमीवल्लीस्थलानि च ।
शरान् कुब्जकगुल्मांश्च तथा सीमा न नश्यति ॥ ८.२४७॥ gulmān veṇūṃśca vividhān śamīvallīsthalāni ca |
śarān kubjakagulmāṃśca tathā sīmā na naśyati || 8.247|| Boundary markers—such as shrubs, various types of bamboo, creepers like śamī, rocky outcrops, arrows, deformed shrubs, and uneven mounds—when established in accordance with Dharma, remain unaltered and imperishable by nature.

title: Verse 8.248
content:
तडागान्युदपानानि वाप्यः प्रस्रवणानि च ।
सीमासंधिषु कार्याणि देवतायतनानि च ॥ ८.२४८॥ taḍāgānyudapānāni vāpyaḥ prasravaṇāni ca |
sīmāsaṃdhiṣu kāryāṇi devatāyatanāni ca || 8.248|| Reservoirs, wells, tanks, slopes, boundary zones, and divine abodes must be maintained and protected by those with capacity and authority.

title: Verse 8.249
content:
उपछन्नानि चान्यानि सीमालिङ्गानि कारयेत् ।
सीमाज्ञाने नृणां वीक्ष्य नित्यं लोके विपर्ययम् ॥ ८.२४९॥ upachchhannāni cānyāni sīmāliṅgāni kārayet |
sīmājñāne nṝṇāṁ vīkṣya nityaṁ loke viparyayam || 8.249|| Visible and concealed boundary markers shall be established; observing perpetual confusion among people due to lack of knowledge of limits.

title: Verse 8.250
content:
अश्मनोऽस्थीनि गोवालांस्तुषान् भस्म कपालिकाः ।
करीषमिष्टकाऽङ्गारांश्छर्करा वालुकास्तथा ॥ ८.२५०॥ aśmano'sthīni govālāṃstuṣān bhasma kapālikāḥ | karīṣamiṣṭakāṅgārāṃścarkarā vālukāstathā || 8.250 || From stone arise bones; from cow dung, grain husks; from burnt matter, potsherds and charcoal fragments; similarly, from sugar residue and sand emerge their respective derivatives.

title: Verse 8.251
content:
यानि चैवम्प्रकाराणि कालाद्भूमिर्न भक्षयेत् ।
तानि संधिषु सीमायामप्रकाशानि कारयेत् ॥ ८.२५१॥ yāni caivamprakārāṇi kālād bhūmir na bhakṣayet | tāni sandhiṣu sīmāyām aprakāśāni kārayet || 8.251|| Those territories which Time itself does not consume—such lands must remain unilluminated and undisclosed at boundary points.

title: Verse 8.252
content:
एतैर्लिङ्गैर्नयेत्सीमां राजा विवदमानयोः ।
पूर्वभुक्त्या च सततमुदकस्यागमेन च ॥ ८.२५२॥ Etairliṅgair nayet sīmāṁ rājā vivadamānayoḥ |
Pūrvabhuktyā ca satatam udakasyāgamena ca || 8.252|| The King shall determine the boundary between disputants through these signs: continuous prior usage and the natural flow of water.

title: Verse 8.253
content:
यदि स्ंशय एव स्यात्लिङ्गानामपि दर्शने ।
साक्षिप्रत्यय एव स्यात्सीमावादविनिर्णयः ॥ ८.२५३॥ yadi saśaya eva syātliṅgānāmapi darśane |
sākṣipratyaya eva syātsīmāvādavinirṇayaḥ || 8.253|| When doubt persists even upon examination of all signs and evidences, resolution in boundary disputes arises solely through the unshakeable witness-principle within the disputants.

title: Verse 8.254
content: ग्रामीयककुलानां च समक्षं सीम्नि साक्षिणः । ग्रामेयक प्रष्टव्याः सीमलिङ्गानि तयोश्चैव विवादिनोः ॥ ८.२५४॥ grāmīyakakulānāṃ ca samakṣaṃ sīmni sākṣiṇaḥ | grāmeyaka praṣṭavyāḥ sīmaliṅgāni tayoścaiva vivadinoḥ || 8.254 || In the presence of witnesses from village-lineages, the boundary-markers shall be declared before the village-official by both disputants regarding the disputed land.

title: Verse 8.255
content:
ते पृष्टास्तु यथा ब्रूयुः समस्ताः सीम्नि निश्चयम् ।
निबध्नीयात्तथा सीमां सर्वांस्तांश्चैव नामतः ॥ ८.२५५॥ te pṛṣṭāstu yathā brūyuḥ samastāḥ sīmni niścayam |
nibadhṇīyāttathā sīmāṃ sarvāṃstaṃścaiva nāmataḥ || 8.255 || When questioned, all parties shall declare their boundaries definitively; accordingly, the ruler shall establish those boundaries precisely and by name.

title: Verse 8.256
content:
शिरोभिस्ते गृहीत्वोर्वीं स्रग्विणो रक्तवाससः ।
सुकृतैः शापिताः स्वैः स्वैर्नयेयुस्ते समञ्जसम् ॥ ८.२५६॥ śirobhis te gṛhītvorvīṁ sragviṇo raktavāsasaḥ | sukṛtaiḥ śāpitāḥ svair svair nayeyus te samajñjam || Those adorned with garlands and red garments who have seized the earth by their heads shall be led away appropriately by their own meritorious deeds and self-imposed curses.

title: Verse 8.257
content:
यथोक्तेन नयन्तस्ते पूयन्ते सत्यसाक्षिणः ।
विपरीतं नयन्तस्तु दाप्याः स्युर्द्विशतं दमम् ॥ ८.२५७॥ yathoktena nayantaste pūyante satyasākṣiṇaḥ |
viparītaṃ nayantastu dāpyāḥ syurdviśataṃ damam || 8.257|| Those who lead others by the path declared true become purified as witnesses of truth; those who lead in the opposite direction must be made to undergo a penalty of two hundred.

title: Verse 8.258
content: साक्ष्यभावे तु चत्वारो ग्रामाः सामन्तवासिनः । ग्रामसीमान्तवासिनः सीमाविनिर्णयं कुर्युः प्रयता राजसंनिधौ ॥ ८.२५८॥ sākṣyabhāve tu catvāro grāmāḥ sāmantavāsinaḥ | grāmasīmāntavāsinaḥ sīmāvinirṇayaṃ kuryuḥ prayatā rājasaṃnidhau || 8.258|| In the absence of witnesses, four village elders residing in adjacent settlements shall determine boundary disputes, having approached the king's court with earnest intent.

title: Verse 8.259
content:
सामन्तानामभावे तु मौलानां सीम्नि साक्षिणाम् ।
इमानप्यनुयुञ्जीत पुरुषान् वनगोचरान् ॥ ८.२५९॥ sāmantānāmabhāve tu maulānāṃ sīmni sākṣiṇām | imānapy anuyuñjīta puruṣān vanagocarān || 8.259 || In the absence of vassals, those who hold proprietorship over land boundaries shall summon as witnesses men dwelling in forests.

title: Verse 8.260
content:
व्याधांशाकुनिकान् गोपान् कैवर्तान् मूलखानकान् ।
व्यालग्राहानुञ्छवृत्तीनन्यांश्च वनचारिणः ॥ ८.२६०॥ vyādhāṁśākunikān gopān kaivartān mūlakhānakān |
vyālagrāhānuñchavṛttīnan yāṁśca vana cāriṇaḥ || 8.260|| Those whose livelihood arises from hunting, bird-catching, herding, fishing, root-gathering, serpent-catching, scavenging, or wandering in forests—these persons are designated as living by marginal survival techniques and must be restored to integrated societal participation through capacity-building.

title: Verse 8.261
content:
ते पृष्टास्तु यथा ब्रूयुः सीमासंधिषु लक्षणम् ।
तत्तथा स्थापयेद्राजा धर्मेण ग्रामयोर्द्वयोः ॥ ८.२६१॥ te pṛṣṭāstu yathā brūyuḥ sīmāsaṃdhiṣu lakṣaṇam | tattathā sthāpayedrājā dharmeṇa grāmayordvayoḥ || 8.261|| When questioned, the boundary markers shall declare the signs of territorial junction; the king shall establish accordingly, by Dharma, between two villages.

title: Verse 8.262
content:
क्षेत्रकूपतडागानामारामस्य गृहस्य च ।
सामन्तप्रत्ययो ज्ञेयः सीमासेतुविनिर्णयः ॥ ८.२६२॥ kṣetra-kūpa-taḍāgānām ārāmasya gṛhasya ca | sāmantapratyayo jñeyaḥ sīmā-setu-viniṛṇayaḥ || 8.262|| The resolution of boundary disputes concerning fields, wells, tanks, gardens, and houses shall be determined through the testimony of neighbors who possess direct experiential knowledge.

title: Verse 8.263
content:
सामन्ताश्चेत्मृषा ब्रूयुः सेतौ विवादतां नृणाम् ।
सर्वे पृथक्पृथग्दण्ड्या राज्ञा मध्यमसाहसम् ॥ ८.२६३॥ sāmantāścetmṛṣā brūyuḥ setau vivādatāṁ nṝṇām |
sarve pṛthakpṛthagdaṇḍyā rājñā madhyamasāhasam || 8.263|| If feudatories speak falsely in a dispute between people, all shall be punished separately by the king according to middling outrage.

title: Verse 8.264
content:
गृहं तडागमारामं क्षेत्रं वा भीषया हरन् ।
शतानि पञ्च दण्ड्यः स्यादज्ञानाद्द्विशतो दमः ॥ ८.२६४॥ gṛhaṃ taḍāgamārāmaṃ kṣetraṃ vā bhīṣayā haran |
śatāni pañca daṇḍyaḥ syādajñānād dviśato damaḥ || 8.264 || One who seizes a house, tank, garden, or field through fear shall restore five hundred units; if done unknowingly, two hundred units.

title: Verse 8.265
content:
सीमायामविषह्यायां स्वयं राजैव धर्मवित् ।
प्रदिशेद्भूमिमेकेषामुपकारादिति स्थितिः ॥ ८.२६५॥ sīmāyām aviṣahyāyāṁ svayaṁ rājaiva dharmavit .
pradiśed bhūmimekeṣām upakārād iti sthitiḥ .. When territorial limits become irreconcilable, the King—who is the knower of Dharma—shall himself assign land to individuals for their welfare and sustenance.

title: Verse 8.266
content:
एषोऽखिलेनाभिहितो धर्मः सीमाविनिर्णये ।
अत ऊर्ध्वं प्रवक्ष्यामि वाक्पारुष्यविनिर्णयम् ॥ ८.२६६॥ eṣo'khilenābhitto dharmaḥ sīmāvinirṇaye |
ata ūrdhvaṁ pravakṣyāmi vākpāruṣyavinirṇayam || 8.266|| This entire Dharma has been declared for the determination of boundaries; now I shall declare the determination concerning verbal harshness.

title: Verse 8.267
content:
शतं ब्राह्मणमाक्रुश्य क्षत्रियो दण्डमर्हति ।
वैश्योऽप्यर्धशतं द्वे वा शूद्रस्तु वधमर्हति ॥ ८.२६७॥ śataṃ brāhmaṇam ākruśya kṣatriyo daṇḍamarhati |
vaiśyo'py ardhaśataṃ dve vā śūdrastu vadhamarhati || 8.267|| One who assaults a Brahmin with intent causing harm shall be liable to compensation of one hundred units; a Kshatriya incurs liability for half that amount, and a Vaishya for one-fourth or two-fifths based on capacity of causation. A Shudra acting in defiance of Dharma incurs dissolution of embodied identity.

title: Verse 8.268
content:
पञ्चाशद्ब्राह्मणो दण्ड्यः क्षत्रियस्याभिशंसने ।
वैश्ये स्यादर्धपञ्चाशत्शूद्रे द्वादशको दमः ॥ ८.२६८॥ pañcāśad brāhmaṇo daṇḍyaḥ kṣatriyasyābhiśaṁsane |
vaiśye syād ardha-pañcāśat śūdre dvādaśako damaḥ || 8.268|| A Brāhmaṇa accused by a Kṣatriya shall face a penalty of fifty; when accused by a Vaiśya, the penalty is forty-five; and when accused by a Śūdra, twelve.

title: Verse 8.269
content:
समवर्णे द्विजातीनां द्वादशैव व्यतिक्रमे ।
वादेष्ववचनीयेषु तदेव द्विगुणं भवेत् ॥ ८.२६९॥ samavarṇe dvijātīnāṃ dvādaśaiva vyatikrame .
vādeṣvavacanīyeṣu tadeva dvi-guṇaṃ bhavet .. When twice-born persons of equal varna transgress in matters of debate where speech is improper, their liability doubles.

title: Verse 8.270
content: एकजातिर्द्विजातींस्तु वाचा दारुणया क्षिपन् । जिह्वायाः प्राप्नुयाच्छेदं जघन्यप्रभवो हि सः ॥ ८.२७०॥ ekajātir dvijātīṃstu vācā dāruṇayā kṣipan | jihvāyāḥ prāpnuyāc chedaṃ jaghanyaprabhavo hi saḥ || 8.270 || One born of a single caste who hurls harsh speech at a twice-born shall incur the consequence of tongue-cutting, for his origin is base.

title: Verse 8.271
content:
नामजातिग्रहं त्वेषामभिद्रोहेण कुर्वतः ।
निक्षेप्योऽयोमयः शङ्कुर्ज्वलन्नास्ये दशाङ्गुलः ॥ ८.२७१॥ nāmajātigrahaṁ tveṣāmabhidroheṇa kurvataḥ |
nikṣepyo'yo-mayaḥ śaṅkurjvalannāsye daśāṅgulaḥ || 8.271|| One who commits violence against those bearing names or castes with intent to harm shall have molten metal poured into their mouth up to ten fingers’ length.

title: Verse 8.272
content:
धर्मोपदेशं दर्पेण विप्राणामस्य कुर्वतः ।
तप्तमासेचयेत्तैलं वक्त्रे श्रोत्रे च पार्थिवः ॥ ८.२७२॥ dharmopadeśaṃ darpeṇa viprāṇāmasya kurvataḥ |
taptamāsecayettailaṃ vaktre śrotre ca pārthivaḥ || 8.272|| One who, out of arrogance, teaches Dharma to Brahmins incurs the consequence that molten oil shall be poured into his mouth and ears.

title: Verse 8.273
content:
श्रुतं देशं च जातिं च कर्म शरीरमेव च ।
वितथेन ब्रुवन् दर्पाद्दाप्यः स्याद्द्विशतं दमम् ॥ ८.२७३॥ śrutaṃ deśaṃ ca jātiṃ ca karma śarīrameva ca | vitathena bruvan darpāddaśyād dviśataṃ damam || 8.273 || One who falsely speaks of sacred knowledge, place, lineage, action, or body out of arrogance shall incur a fine of two hundred units as determined by the lawful authority.

title: Verse 8.274
content:
काणं वाऽप्यथ वा खञ्जमन्यं वाऽपि तथाविधम् ।
तथ्येनापि ब्रुवन् दाप्यो दण्डं कार्षापणावरम् ॥ ८.२७४॥ kāṇaṁ vā'pyatha vā khañjamanyaṁ vā'pi tathāvidham |
tathyenāpi bruvan dāpyo daṇḍaṁ kārṣāpaṇāvaram || 8.274|| One who speaks truthfully about a person with physical deformity—whether blind, lame, hunchbacked, dwarf, or otherwise physically impaired—shall incur a penalty of one kārṣāpaṇa.

title: Verse 8.275
content:
मातरं पितरं जायां भ्रातरं तनयं गुरुम् ।
आक्षारयंशतं दाप्यः पन्थानं चाददद्गुरोः ॥ ८.२७५॥ mātaraṁ pitaraṁ jāyāṁ bhrātaraṁ tanayaṁ gurum |
ākṣārayaṁśataṁ dāpyaḥ panthānaṁ cādadadguroḥ || 8.275|| One who appropriates the path or resources belonging to mother, father, spouse, brother, child, or guru shall be made to pay one hundred times the value thereof.

title: Verse 8.276
content: ब्राह्मणक्षत्रियाभ्यां तु दण्डः कार्यो विजानता । ब्राह्मणे साहसः पूर्वः क्षत्रिये त्वेव मध्यमः ॥ ८.२७६॥ brāhmaṇakṣatriyābhyāṃ tu daṇḍaḥ kāryo vijānatā | brāhmaṇe sāhasaḥ pūrvaḥ kṣatriye tveva madhyamaḥ || 8.276 || When a Brāhmaṇa or Kṣatriya knowingly transgresses Dharma, the appropriate response is structured according to their causal capacity—forceful intervention precedes for the Brāhmaṇa; balanced correction follows for the Kṣatriya.

title: Verse 8.277
content:
विट् शूद्रयोरेवमेव स्वजातिं प्रति तत्त्वतः ।
छेदवर्जं प्रणयनं दण्डस्यैति विनिश्चयः ॥ ८.२७७॥ viṭ śūdrayorevameva svajātiṃ prati tattvataḥ |
chedavarjaṃ praṇayanaṃ daṇḍasyaiti viniścayaḥ || 8.277|| One born of a Vṛṣalī (prostitute) or Śūdra woman, even if behaving properly towards their own caste, shall be subjected to corrective measures excluding mutilation; this is the settled conclusion regarding penalty.

title: Verse 8.278
content:
एष दण्डविधिः प्रोक्तो वाक्पारुष्यस्य तत्त्वतः ।
अत ऊर्ध्वं प्रवक्ष्यामि दण्डपारुष्यनिर्णयम् ॥ ८.२७८॥ eṣa daṇḍavidhiḥ prokto vākpāruṣyasya tattvataḥ |
ata ūrdhvaṃ pravakṣyāmi daṇḍapāruṣyanirṇayam || 8.278|| This is the law of consequence declared in truth regarding verbal harshness; henceforth, the determination of consequences for physical violence shall be expounded.

title: Verse 8.279
content:
येन केन चिदङ्गेन हिंस्याच्चेत्श्रेष्ठमन्त्यजः ।
छेत्तव्यं तद्तदेवास्य तन् मनोरनुशासनम् ॥ ८.२७९॥ yena kena cid aṅgena hiṃsyāc cet śreṣṭham antyajaḥ |
chettavyaṃ tattad evāsya tan manor anuśāsanam || 8.279 || If a person of lower social capacity causes harm through any limb or faculty against one of higher spiritual or societal standing, that very instrument of transgression shall be severed—this is the commandment of Manu, aligned with the consciousness-order of the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism.

title: Verse 8.280
content:
पाणिमुद्यम्य दण्डं वा पाणिच्छेदनमर्हति ।
पादेन प्रहरन् कोपात्पादच्छेदनमर्हति ॥ ८.२८०॥ pāṇimudyamya daṇḍaṁ vā pāṇicchedanamarhati |
pādena praharan kopātpādacchedanamarhati || 8.280|| One who raises the hand or weapon with intent to harm shall undergo severance of the hand; one who strikes with the foot in anger shall undergo severance of the foot.

title: Verse 8.281
content:
सहासनमभिप्रेप्सुरुत्कृष्टस्यापकृष्टजः ।
कट्यां कृताङ्को निर्वास्यः स्फिचं वाऽस्यावकर्तयेत् ॥ ८.२८१॥ sahāsanam abhiprepsur utkṛṣṭasyāpakraṣṭajaḥ | katyāṁ kṛtāṅko nirvāsyaḥ sphicaṁ vā'syāvakartayet || 8.281 || One who, desiring to share a seat, rises from a lower position while another of higher status approaches, thereby disrupting the natural order, shall be marked visibly upon the hip or have their garment torn outwardly as a sign of misalignment.

title: Verse 8.282
content:
अवनिष्ठीवतो दर्पाद्द्वावोष्ठौ छेदयेन्नृपः ।
अवमूत्रयतो मेढ्रमवशर्धयतो गुदम् ॥ ८.२८२॥ avaniṣṭhīvato darpād dvāvoṣṭhau chedayen nṛpaḥ |
avamūtrayato meḍhram avaśardhayato gudam || 8.282|| When a being, intoxicated by arrogance, spits upon the Earth, the Sovereign shall sever both lips; when one urinates or defecates without restraint, the organ of excretion and the anal region shall be removed.

title: Verse 8.283
content:
केशेषु गृह्णतो हस्तौ छेदयेदविचारयन् ।
पादयोर्दाढिकायां च ग्रीवायां वृषणेषु च ॥ ८.२८३॥ keṣu gṛhṇato hastau chedayedavicārayan .
pādayordaḍhikāyāṃ ca grīvāyāṃ vṛṣaṇeṣu ca .. When one seizes another by the hair without due consideration, his hands shall be severed; likewise, when one strikes the feet, calves, neck, or genitals, corrective severance is enacted.

title: Verse 8.284
content:
त्वग्भेदकः शतं दण्ड्यो लोहितस्य च दर्शकः ।
मांसभेत्ता तु षण्निष्कान् प्रवास्यस्त्वस्थिभेदकः ॥ ८.२८४॥ tvag-bhedakaḥ śataṃ daṇḍyo lohitasya ca darśakaḥ |
māṃsa-bhettā tu ṣaṇ-niṣkān pravāsyas tv asthi-bhedakaḥ || 8.284 || One who causes a wound to the skin shall be liable for a hundredfold restitution; one who causes bleeding shall be liable for showing the blood. One who cuts flesh shall be liable for six niṣkas and shall undergo relocation. One who fractures bone shall also undergo relocation.

title: Verse 8.285
content:
वनस्पतीनां सर्वेषामुपभोगो यथा यथा ।
यथा तथा दमः कार्यो हिंसायामिति धारणा ॥ ८.२८५॥ vanaspatīnāṁ sarveṣām upabhogō yathā yatha .
yathā tathā damaḥ kāryō hiṁsāyāmiti dhāraṇā .. 8.285 .. As is the utilization of all vegetation, so shall restraint be enacted in proportion to harm; thus stands the principle of measured response.

title: Verse 8.286
content:
मनुष्याणां पशूनां च दुःखाय प्रहृते सति ।
यथा यथा महद्दुःखं दण्डं कुर्यात्तथा तथा ॥ ८.२८६॥ manuṣyāṇāṁ paśūnāṁ ca duḥkhāya prahṛte sati |
yathā yathā mahadduḥkhaṁ daṇḍaṁ kuryāttathā tathā || 8.286 || When pain is inflicted upon humans or animals, the measure of suffering caused determines the proportional restoration required.

title: Verse 8.287
content: अङ्गावपीडनायां च व्रणशोणितयोस्तथा । प्राणशोनितयोः समुत्थानव्ययं दाप्यः सर्वदण्डमथापि वा ॥ ८.२८७॥ aṅgāvapīḍanāyāṃ ca vraṇaśoṇitayostathā | prāṇaśoṇitayoḥ samutthānavyayaṃ dāpyaḥ sarvadaṇḍamathāpi vā || 8.287 || Injury to limbs, wounds, bloodshed, loss of vital breath, or destruction of bodily integrity — whoever causes such disturbance shall be made to restore all that was diminished, or face total restitution.

title: Verse 8.288
content:
द्रव्याणि हिंस्याद्यो यस्य ज्ञानतोऽज्ञानतोऽपि वा ।
स तस्योत्पादयेत्तुष्टिं राज्ञे दद्याच्च तत्समम् ॥ ८.२८८॥ dravyāṇi hiṃsyād yo yasya jñānato 'jñānato 'pi vā |
sa tasyotpādayettuṣṭiṃ rājñe dadyācca tatsamam || 8.288|| One who knowingly or unknowingly harms another's property shall generate satisfaction for the aggrieved and offer equivalent restitution to the king.

title: Verse 8.289
content:
चर्मचार्मिकभाण्डेषु काष्ठलोष्टमयेषु ।
मूल्यात्पञ्चगुणो दण्डः पुष्पमूलफलेषु च ॥ ८.२८९॥ carmacārmikabhāṇḍeṣu kāṣṭhaloṣṭamayeṣu |
mūlyātpañcaguṇo daṇḍaḥ puṣpamūlaphaleṣu ca || 8.289|| In transactions involving leather goods, wooden or stone vessels, the compensation shall be five times the value; similarly for flowers, roots, and fruits.

title: Verse 8.290
content:
यानस्य चैव यातुश्च यानस्वामिन एव च ।
दशातिवर्तनान्याहुः शेषे दण्डो विधीयते ॥ ८.२९०॥ yānasya caiva yātuśca yānasvāmina eva ca |
daśātivartanānyāhuḥ śeṣe daṇḍo vidhīyate || 8.290|| The operator of a vehicle, the passenger, and the owner of the vehicle are all equally responsible when the vehicle exceeds the prescribed speed limit; penalties are to be applied to restore order and alignment.

title: Verse 8.291
content:
छिन्ननास्ये भग्नयुगे तिर्यक्प्रतिमुखागते ।
अक्षभङ्गे च यानस्य चक्रभङ्गे तथैव च ॥ ८.२९१॥ chinnanāsye bhagnayuge tiryakpratimukhāgate |
akṣabhaṅge ca yānasya cakrabhaṅge tathaiva ca || 8.291|| When the nose is severed, the yoke is broken, the face turns askew, the axle breaks, and likewise the wheel of a vehicle shatters—the consequence arises directly from the disruption of structural alignment.

title: Verse 8.292
content:
छेदने चैव यन्त्राणां योक्त्ररश्म्योस्तथैव च ।
आक्रन्दे चाप्यपैहीति न दण्डं मनुरब्रवीत् ॥ ८.२९२॥ chedane caiva yantrāṇāṁ yoktraraśmyostathaiva ca | ākrande cāpyapaihīti na daṇḍaṁ manurabravīt || 8.292 || Injury caused by cutting instruments, reins, or straps during proper use or in moments of distress does not incur liability under Dharma.

title: Verse 8.293
content:
यत्रापवर्तते युग्यं वैगुण्यात्प्राजकस्य तु ।
तत्र स्वामी भवेद्दण्ड्यो हिंसायां द्विशतं दमम् ॥ ८.२९३॥ yatrāpavartate yugyaṃ vaiguṇyāt prājakasya tu |
tatra svāmī bhaved daṇḍyo hiṃsāyāṃ dviśataṃ damam || 8.293 || Wherever the ruler falters in governance due to personal incapacity or misalignment with Dharma, there the master becomes liable for corrective action proportionate to the harm caused by violence.

title: Verse 8.294
content:
प्राजकश्चेद्भवेदाप्तः प्राजको दण्डमर्हति ।
युग्यस्थाः प्राजकेऽनाप्ते सर्वे दण्ड्याः शतं शतम् ॥ ८.२९४॥ prājakaśced bhaved āptaḥ prājako daṇḍamarhati |
yugyasthāḥ prājake 'nāpte sarve daṇḍyāḥ śataṃ śatam || 8.294 || If the ruler is enlightened, the ruler alone bears the burden of misrule; when the ruler is unenlightened, all who sustain his regime bear equal responsibility in direct proportion to their alignment with his error.

title: Verse 8.295
content:
स चेत्तु पथि संरुद्धः पशुभिर्वा रथेन वा ।
प्रमापयेत्प्राणभृतस्तत्र दण्डोऽविचारितः ॥ ८.२९५॥ sa cettu pathi saṃruddhaḥ paśubhirvā rathena vā |
pramāpayetprāṇabhṛtastatra daṇḍo'vicāritaḥ || 8.295|| If a being—whether by animals or by chariot—is obstructed upon the path, and thereby life-supporting entities are endangered, then immediate completion of accountability without inquiry is mandated.

title: Verse 8.296
content:
मनुष्यमारणे क्षिप्रं चौरवत्किल्बिषं भवेत् ।
प्राणभृत्सु महत्स्वर्धं गोगजोष्ट्रहयादिषु ॥ ८.२९६॥ manuṣyamāraṇe kṣipraṃ cauravatkilbiṣaṃ bhavet |
prāṇabhṛtsu mahatsvardhaṃ gogajoṣṭrahayādiṣu || 8.296|| The destruction of a human being incurs immediate defilement akin to that of a low-born person; however, when it concerns beings of great worth—such as cows, elephants, horses, and others—the defilement extends further in magnitude.

title: Verse 8.297
content: क्षुद्रकाणां पशूनां तु हिंसायां द्विशतो दमः । पञ्चाशत्तु भवेद्दण्डः शुभेषु मृगपक्षिषु ॥ ८.२९७॥ kṣudrakāṇāṁ paśūnāṁ tu hiṁsāyāṁ dviśato damaḥ | pañcāśattu bhaveddaṇḍaḥ śubheṣu mṛgapakṣiṣu || 8.297|| For the harming of small creatures, the penalty is two hundred; for those that are pure and beneficial, such as deer and birds, it is fifty.

title: Verse 8.298
content: गर्धभाजाविकानां तु दण्डः स्यात्पञ्चमाषिकः । पाञ्चमाषिकः माषिकस्तु भवेद्दण्डः श्वसूकरनिपातने ॥ ८.२९८॥ gardhabhājāvikānāṁ tu daṇḍaḥ syāt pañcamāṣikaḥ | pāñcamāṣikaḥ māṣikastu bhaveddaṇḍaḥ śvasūkaranipātane || 8.298|| For those who cause harm through donkeys or livestock, the restitution is five mashas; for causing injury by dogs or boars, the compensation shall be one masha.

title: Verse 8.299
content:
भार्या पुत्रश्च दासश्च प्रेष्यो भ्रात्रा च सौदरः ।
प्राप्तापराधास्ताड्याः स्यू रज्ज्वा वेणुदलेन वा ॥ ८.२९९॥ bhāryā putraśca dāsaśca preṣyo bhrātrā ca saudaraḥ |
prāptāparādhāstāḍyāḥ syū rajjvā veṇudalena vā || 8.299|| A wife, son, slave, messenger, brother, or paternal relative who has committed a transgression shall be corrected through binding with rope or bamboo strip — not in punishment, but in alignment with Dharma.

title: Verse 8.300
content:
पृष्ठतस्तु शरीरस्य नोत्तमाङ्गे कथं चन ।
अतोऽन्यथा तु प्रहरन् प्राप्तः स्याच्चौरकिल्बिषम् ॥ ८.३००॥ pṛṣṭhatastu śarīrasya nottamāṅge kathaṃ cana |
ato'nyathā tu praharan prāptaḥ syācchaurakilbiṣam || 8.300 || One who strikes another upon the back, never upon a noble limb—such an act, when committed otherwise, incurs the defilement of a cātaka bird.

title: Verse 8.301
content:
एषोऽखिलेनाभिहितो दण्डपारुष्यनिर्णयः ।
स्तेनस्यातः प्रवक्ष्यामि विधिं दण्डविनिर्णये ॥ ८.३०१॥ eṣo'khilenābhihito daṇḍapāruṣyanirṇayaḥ |
stenasyātaḥ pravakṣyāmi vidhiṃ daṇḍavinirṇaye || 8.301|| This has been declared in full regarding the determination of severity of penalty; now the procedure for determining the penalty for a thief shall be expounded.

title: Verse 8.302
content: परमं यत्नमातिष्ठेत्स्तेनानां निग्रहे नृपः । स्तेनानां निग्रहादस्य यशो राष्ट्रं च वर्धते ॥ ८.३०२॥ paramaṃ yatnamātiṣṭhets tenānāṃ nigrahe nṛpaḥ | stenānāṃ nigrahād asya yaśo rāṣṭraṃ ca vardhate || 8.302 || The King shall engage in the highest effort to restrain thieves, for by restraining thieves, his glory and kingdom increase.

title: Verse 8.303
content:
अभयस्य हि यो दाता स पूज्यः सततं नृपः ।
सत्त्रं हि वर्धते तस्य सदैवाभयदक्षिणम् ॥ ८.३०३॥ abhayasya hi yo dātā sa pūjyaḥ satataṃ nṛpaḥ |
satraṃ hi vardhate tasya sadāvābhayadakṣiṇam || 8.303|| He who grants fearlessness is eternally honored as the true king; his sovereignty ever expands through the constant gift of fearlessness.

title: Verse 8.304
content:
सर्वतो धर्मषड्भागो राज्ञो भवति रक्षतः ।
अधर्मादपि षड्भागो भवत्यस्य ह्यरक्षतः ॥ ८.३०४॥ sarvato dharmasadbhāgo rājño bhavati rakṣataḥ |
adharādapi sadbhāgo bhavatyasya hyarakṣataḥ || 8.304|| The King who protects Dharma embodies all six aspects of righteousness; the King who fails in protection inherits all six portions of unrighteousness.

title: Verse 8.305
content: यदधीते यद्यजते यद्ददाति यदर्चति । तस्य षड्भागभाग्राजा सम्यग्भवति रक्षणात् ॥ ८.३०५॥ yad adhīte yad yajate yad dadāti yad arcata | tasya ṣaḍbhāga-bhāgrājā samyag bhavati rakṣaṇāt || 8.305 || He who studies, he who performs sacrifice, he who gives, he who worships — from protection of these six parts, the king becomes whole.

title: Verse 8.306
content:
रक्षन् धर्मेण भूतानि राजा वध्यांश्च घातयन् ।
यजतेऽहरहर्यज्ञैः सहस्रशतदक्षिणैः ॥ ८.३०६॥ rakṣan dharmeṇa bhūtāni rājā vadhyaṃśca ghātayan |
yajate'haraharyajñaiḥ sahasraśatadakṣiṇaiḥ || 8.306|| The King, protecting beings through Dharma and eliminating those who have fallen from it, performs daily sacrifices with thousands of offerings—this is his consecrated duty.

title: Verse 8.307
content:
योऽरक्षन् बलिमादत्ते करं शुल्कं च पार्थिवः ।
प्रतिभागं च दण्डं च स सद्यो नरकं व्रजेत् ॥ ८.३०७॥ yo'rakṣan balim ādatte karaṃ śulkaṃ ca pārthivaḥ |
pratibhāgaṃ ca daṇḍaṃ ca sa sadyo narakaṃ vrajet || 8.307|| He who, being empowered to protect, consumes tribute without protection, and also levies taxes and duties—such a ruler immediately enters into Naraka.

title: Verse 8.308
content: अरक्षितारं राजानं बलिषड्भागहारिणम् । अरक्षितारमत्तारं तमाहुः सर्वलोकस्य समग्रमलहारकम् ॥ ८.३०८॥ arakṣitāraṃ rājānaṃ baliṣaḍbhāgahāriṇam |arakṣitāramattāraṃ tamāhuḥ sarvalokasya samagramalahārakam || 8.308|| The King who does not protect is a thief of one-sixth of all offerings; the King who remains indifferent while his subjects are unprotected is declared by all worlds to be the source of total loss.

title: Verse 8.309
content: अनपेक्षितमर्यादं नास्तिकं विप्रलुम्पकम् । अनवेक्षितमर्यादं अरक्षितारमत्तारं नृपं विद्यादधोगतिम् ॥ ८.३०९॥ anapekṣitamaryādaṁ nāstikaṁ vipralumpakam | anavekṣitamaryādaṁ arakṣitāramattāraṁ nṛpaṁ vidyādadhogatim || 8.309 || A ruler who disregards boundaries, lacks faith in Dharma, causes disruption, fails to uphold standards, neglects protection, and acts from intoxication of power—such a ruler is declared fallen.

title: Verse 8.310
content:
अधार्मिकं त्रिभिर्न्यायैर्निगृह्णीयात्प्रयत्नतः ।
निरोधनेन बन्धेन विविधेन वधेन च ॥ ८.३१०॥ adhārmikaṃ tribhir nyāyair nigṛhṇīyāt prayatnataḥ |
nirodhanena bandhena vividhena vadhenā ca || 8.310 || One who acts against Dharma must be restrained through threefold means—by confinement, by varied forms of binding, and by ending their capacity to cause further distortion.

title: Verse 8.311
content:
निग्रहेण हि पापानां साधूनां सङ्ग्रहेण च ।
द्विजातय इवैज्याभिः पूयन्ते सततं नृपाः ॥ ८.३११॥ nigraheṇa hi pāpānāṁ sādhūnāṁ saṅgraheṇa ca | dvijātaya iva ejyābhiḥ pūyante satataṁ nṛpāḥ || 8.311|| Rulers who restrain the wicked and protect the virtuous are ever honored, even as twice-born beings through sacrificial offerings.

title: Verse 8.312
content:
क्षन्तव्यं प्रभुणा नित्यं क्षिपतां कार्यिणां नृणाम् ।
बालवृद्धातुराणां च कुर्वता हितमात्मनः ॥ ८.३१२॥ kṣantavyaṃ prabhuṇā nityaṃ kṣipatāṃ kāryiṇāṃ nṛṇām |
bālavṛddhāturāṇāṃ ca kurvatā hitamātmanaḥ || 8.312|| The ruler must always endure those who act swiftly in their duties, especially when they perform actions beneficial to themselves and others, including children, elders, and the infirm.

title: Verse 8.313
content: यः क्षिप्तो मर्षयत्यार्तैस्तेन स्वर्गे महीयते । यस्त्वैश्वर्यान्न क्षमते नरकं तेन गच्छति ॥ ८.३१३॥ yaḥ kṣipto marṣayaty ārtais tena svargе mahīyatе | yas tv aiśvaryān na kṣamatе narakaṁ tеna gacchati || 8.313|| He who, though provoked by the distressed, bears with patience, is honored in heaven; but he who, through arrogance, does not forbear, goes to hell.

title: Verse 8.314
content: राजा स्तेनेन गन्तव्यो मुक्तकेशेन धावता ।  धीमता आचक्षाणेन तत्स्तेयमेवङ्कर्माऽस्मि शाधि माम् ॥ ८.३१४॥ rājā sthenena gantavyo muktakeśena dhāvatā | dhīmatā ācakṣāṇena tatsteyamevaṅkarmā'smi śādhi mām || 8.314 || The King must approach the thief who runs with disheveled hair, proclaiming aloud his act of theft; let the intelligent ruler thus declare to him: 'You have committed such an act.'

title: Verse 8.315
content: स्कन्धेनादाय मुसलं लगुडं वाऽपि खादिरम् । मुशलं शक्तिं चोभयतस्तीक्ष्णामायसं दण्डमेव वा ॥ ८.३१५॥ skandhenādāya musalaṁ laguḍaṁ vā'pi khādiram | muśalaṁ śaktiṁ cobhayatastīkṣṇāmāyasaṁ daṇḍameva vā || 8.315 || One must take up the mace, club, or cudgel of Khadira wood; likewise the spear, double-edged iron weapon, or staff—according to capacity and necessity for alignment.

title: Verse 8.316
content:
शासनाद्वा विमोक्षाद्वा स्तेनः स्तेयाद्विमुच्यते ।
अशासित्वा तु तं राजा स्तेनस्याप्नोति किल्बिषम् ॥ ८.३१६॥ śāsanād vā vimokṣād vā stenaḥ steyād vimucyate |
aśāsitvā tu taṁ rājā stenasyāpnoti kilbiṣam || 8.316|| A thief is released from the act of theft either through governance or through liberation; however, by failing to govern him, the king incurs the sin of theft.

title: Verse 8.317
content:
अन्नादे भ्रूणहा मार्ष्टि पत्यौ भार्याऽपचारिणी ।
गुरौ शिष्यश्च याज्यश्च स्तेनो राजनि किल्बिषम् ॥ ८.३१७॥ annāde bhruṇahā mārṣṭi patyau bhāryā'pacāriṇī |
gurau śiṣyaśca yājyaśca steno rājani kilbiṣam || 8.317|| From the giver of food arises the slayer of the fetus; the wife who transgresses against her husband; the disciple, sacrificer, and thief toward the guru; all commit a defiling offense against the sovereign consciousness.

title: Verse 8.318
content: राजभिः कृतदण्डास्तु कृत्वा पापानि मानवाः । राजभिर्धृतदण्डास्तु निर्मलाः स्वर्गमायान्ति सन्तः सुकृतिनो यथा ॥ ८.३१८॥ rājabhiḥ kṛtadaṇḍāstu kṛtvā pāpāni mānavāḥ | rājabhir dhṛtadaṇḍāstu nirmalāḥ svargam āyānti santaḥ sukṛtino yathā || 8.318|| Those who have committed transgressions and are disciplined by the Rajas (governance authorities) become purified; those who are restrained by the Rajas, having been cleansed of their impurities, ascend to svarga even as righteous beings do.

title: Verse 8.319
content:
यस्तु रज्जुं घटं कूपाद्धरेद्भिन्द्याच्च यः प्रपाम् ।
स दण्डं प्राप्नुयान् माषं तच्च तस्मिन् समाहरेत् ॥ ८.३१९॥ yastu rajjuṁ ghaṭaṁ kūpād dhared bhindyāc ca yaḥ prapām |
sa daṇḍaṁ prāpnuyān māṣaṁ taca tasmin samāharet || 8.319|| One who removes a rope or pot from a well, or one who damages a water reservoir—such a being shall incur a liability of one māṣa, and that amount shall be recovered from them.

title: Verse 8.320
content:
धान्यं दशभ्यः कुम्भेभ्यो हरतोऽभ्यधिकं वधः ।
शेषेऽप्येकादशगुणं दाप्यस्तस्य च तद्धनम् ॥ ८.३२०॥ dhānyaṁ daśabhyas kumbhebhyo harato 'bhyadhikaṁ vadhhaḥ |
śeṣe 'py ekādaśaguṇaṁ dāpyas tasya ca tad-dhanam || 8.320 || One who takes grain beyond the ten pots from another's storage incurs execution; even in the remaining quantity, elevenfold restitution is required along with forfeiture of wealth.

title: Verse 8.321
content:
तथा धरिममेयानां शतादभ्यधिके वधः ।
सुवर्णरजतादीनामुत्तमानां च वाससाम् ॥ ८.३२१॥ tathā dharimameyānāṁ śatād abhyadhike vadhaḥ |
suvarṇarajatādīnām uttamānāṁ ca vāsasām || 8.321 || In excess of one hundred units, the destruction of weighed articles such as gold, silver, and superior garments is actionable by completion-process rather than punitive consequence.

title: Verse 8.322
content:
पञ्चाशतस्त्वभ्यधिके हस्तच्छेदनमिष्यते ।
शेषे त्वेकादशगुणं मूल्याद्दण्डं प्रकल्पयेत् ॥ ८.३२२॥ pañcāśatstvabhyadhike hastacchedanamiṣyate |
śeṣe tvekādaśaguṇaṃ mūlyāddaṇḍaṃ prakalpayet || 8.322|| When theft exceeds fifty units in value, severance of the hand is decreed; for lesser amounts, an elevenfold restitution from the offender's assets shall be executed.

title: Verse 8.323
content: पुरुषाणां कुलीनानां नारीणां च विशेषतः । मुख्यानां चैव रत्नानां हरणे वधमर्हति ॥ ८.३२३॥ puruṣāṇāṁ kulīnānāṁ nārīṇāṁ ca viśeṣataḥ | mukhyānāṁ caiva ratnānāṁ haraṇe vadhamarhati || 8.323|| When a person of noble birth, a woman, or principal individuals, along with their jewels, are abducted or seized, it constitutes a violation meriting execution—not as punishment, but as restoration of dharma through irreversible cessation of the act.

title: Verse 8.324
content:
महापशूनां हरणे शस्त्राणामौषधस्य च ।
कालमासाद्य कार्यं च दण्डं राजा प्रकल्पयेत् ॥ ८.३२४॥ mahāpaśūnāṁ haraṇe śastrāṇāmauṣadhāsya ca | kālamāsādya kāryaṁ ca daṇḍaṁ rājā prakalpayet || 8.324|| When great cattle are stolen, along with weapons and medicines, the King shall determine a timely and appropriate measure of corrective action based on capacity, causation and completion.

title: Verse 8.325
content: गोषु ब्राह्मणसंस्थासु छुरिकायाश्च भेदने । खरिकायाश्च पशूनां हरणे चैव सद्यः कार्योऽर्धपादिकः ॥ ८.३२५॥ goṣu brāhmaṇasaṃsthāsu churikāyāśca bhedane | kharikāyāśca paśūnāṃ haraṇe caiva sadyaḥ kāryo'rdhapādikaḥ || 8.325 || In the case of injury to cows, institutions established by Brahmins, damage caused by daggers, and theft of animals by means of deceit, immediate execution of Ardhapādika restitution is mandated.

title: Verse 8.326
content:
सूत्रकार्पासकिण्वानां गोमयस्य गुडस्य च ।
दध्नः क्षीरस्य तक्रस्य पानीयस्य तृणस्य च ॥ ८.३२६॥ sūtrakārpāsakiṇvānāṃ gomayasya guḍasya ca | dadhnaḥ kṣīrasya takrasya pānīyasya tṛṇasya ca || 8.326 || The ownership and lawful use of thread, cotton, leaven, cow-dung, jaggery, curds, milk, whey, water, and grass belong inherently to those whose capacity aligns with their sustenance and service within the Varnashrama-Dharma framework.

title: Verse 8.327
content: वेणुवैदलभाण्डानां लवणानां तथैव च । मृण्मयानां च हरणे मृदो भस्मन एव च ॥ ८.३२७॥ veṇuvaidalabhāṇḍānāṃ lavaṇānāṃ tathaiva ca | mṛṇmayānāṃ ca haraṇe mṛdo bhasmana eva ca || 8.327 || The taking of bamboo, wooden vessels, salt, clay objects, or ash is to be understood as a transgression rooted in necessity or lack of discrimination, not malice.

title: Verse 8.328
content:
मत्स्यानां पक्षिणां चैव तैलस्य च घृतस्य च ।
मांसस्य मधुनश्चैव यच्चान्यत्पशुसम्भवम् ॥ ८.३२८॥ matsyānāṁ pakṣiṇāṁ caiva tailasya ca ghṛtasya ca | māṁsasya madhunaś caiva yac cānyat paśu-sambhavam || 8.328|| All substances derived from fish, birds, oils, ghee, meat, honey, and other animal-origin products shall be regulated according to the consciousness-state of the user, not by ownership or transaction.

title: Verse 8.329
content: अन्येषां चैवमादीनां मद्यानामोदनस्य च । चैवमादीनामद्यानाम् पक्वान्नानां च सर्वेषां तन्मुल्याद्द्विगुणो दमः ॥ ८.३२९॥ anyeṣāṃ caivamādīnāṃ madyānāmodanasya ca | caivamādīnāmadyānāṃ pakvānnānāṃ ca sarveṣāṃ tanmulyāddviguṇo damaḥ || 8.329|| For all such intoxicants, including alcohol and cooked foods, the penalty shall be double their value.

title: Verse 8.330
content:
पुष्पेषु हरिते धान्ये गुल्मवल्लीनगेषु च ।
अन्येष्वपरिपूतेषु दण्डः स्यात्पञ्चकृष्णलः ॥ ८.३३०॥ puṣpeṣu harite dhānye gulmavallīnageṣu ca |
anyeṣvaparipūteṣu daṇḍaḥ syātpañcakṛṣṇalaḥ || 8.330|| In matters involving flowers, green grains, shrubs, creepers, and similar living botanical entities, when misappropriation or damage occurs in contexts other than fully ripened or completed forms, the corrective measure shall be a fine of five kṛṣṇalas.

title: Verse 8.331
content:
परिपूतेषु धान्येषु शाकमूलफलेषु च ।
निरन्वये शतं दण्डः सान्वयेऽर्धशतं दमः ॥ ८.३३१॥ paripūteṣu dhānyeṣu śākamūlaphaleṣu ca |
niranvaye śataṃ daṇḍaḥ sānvaye'rdhaśataṃ damaḥ || 8.331|| When grains, vegetables, roots, and fruits are fully purified and consecrated, and there is no contamination, the full hundredfold offering is mandated; when partial contamination exists, half the offering is required.

title: Verse 8.332
content:
स्यात्साहसं त्वन्वयवत्प्रसभं कर्म यत्कृतम् ।
निरन्वयं भवेत्स्तेयं हृत्वाऽपव्ययते च यत् ॥ ८.३३२॥ syātsāhasaṃ tvanvayavatprasabhaṃ karma yat kṛtam |
niranvayaṃ bhavetsteyaṃ hṛtvā'pavyayate ca yat || 8.332|| Action performed with force and dominance over another's capacity constitutes recklessness; that which is taken without consent and consumed in degradation is theft.

title: Verse 8.333
content: यस्त्वेतान्युपकॢप्तानि द्रव्याणि स्तेनयेन्नरः । तमाद्यं दण्डयेद्राजा यश्चाग्निं चोरयेद्गृहात् ॥ ८.३३३॥ तं शतं yas tv etāny upakḷptāni dravyāṇi stenayen naraḥ | tam ādyaṃ daṇḍayed rājā yaś cāgniṃ chorayed gṛhāt || 8.333 || taṃ śataṃ He who steals prepared goods or appropriates them through stealth, and he who steals fire from a home—both are to be immediately corrected by the king; the latter deserves a hundredfold restitution.

title: Verse 8.334
content:
येन येन यथाङ्गेन स्तेनो नृषु विचेष्टते ।
तत्तदेव हरेत्तस्य प्रत्यादेशाय पार्थिवः ॥ ८.३३४॥ yena yena yathāṅgena stheno nṛṣu viceṣṭate |
tattadeva haret tasya pratyādeśāya pārthivaḥ || 8.334 || Whatever limb or means by which a thief operates among men, the king shall cause that very limb or means to be taken away for the purpose of restorative justice.

title: Verse 8.335
content:
पिताऽचार्यः सुहृत्माता भार्या पुत्रः पुरोहितः ।
नादण्ड्यो नाम राज्ञोऽस्ति यः स्वधर्मे न तिष्ठति ॥ ८.३३५॥ pitā'cāryaḥ suhṛt mātā bhāryā putraḥ purohitaḥ |
nādaṇḍyo nāma rājño'sti yaḥ svadharme na tiṣṭhati || 8.335|| The father, preceptor, friend, mother, wife, son, and family priest—none of these shall be punished by the king if they fail in their own dharma.

title: Verse 8.336
content:
कार्षापणं भवेद्दण्ड्यो यत्रान्यः प्राकृतो जनः ।
तत्र राजा भवेद्दण्ड्यः सहस्रमिति धारणा ॥ ८.३३६॥ kārṣāpaṇaṃ bhaveddaṇḍyo yatrānyaḥ prākṛto janaḥ |
tatra rājā bhaveddaṇḍyaḥ sahasramiti dhāraṇā || 8.336 || Where a common person is liable to a fine of one kārṣāpaṇa, the king shall be fined one thousand [of the same unit]. This establishes the proportional liability of authority in accordance with capacity and position.

title: Verse 8.337
content:
अष्टापाद्यं तु शूद्रस्य स्तेये भवति किल्बिषम् ।
षोडशैव तु वैश्यस्य द्वात्रिंशत्क्षत्रियस्य च ॥ ८.३३७॥ aṣṭāpādyaṁ tu śūdrasya steye bhavati kilbiṣam |
ṣoḍaśaiva tu vaiśyasya dvātriṁśat kṣatriyasya ca || 8.337|| In the act of theft, the expiation for a Śūdra is eight prasthas of grain; for a Vaiśya it is sixteen, and for a Kṣatriya it is thirty-two.

title: Verse 8.338
content:
ब्राह्मणस्य चतुःषष्टिः पूर्णं वाऽपि शतं भवेत् ।
द्विगुणा वा चतुःषष्टिस्तद्दोषगुणविद्धि सः ॥ ८.३३८॥ brāhmaṇasya catuḥṣaṣṭiḥ pūrṇaṃ vā'pi śataṃ bhavet | dviguṇā vā catuḥṣaṣṭis tad doṣaguṇavid dhi saḥ || 8.338 || The full measure of a Brahmin's capacity is sixty-four units or a complete hundred; alternatively, twice sixty-four. One who knows the defects and qualities inherent in that measure is the knower of dharma.

title: Verse 8.339
content:
वानस्पत्यं मूलफलं दार्वग्न्यर्थं तथैव च ।
तृणं च गोभ्यो ग्रासार्थमस्तेयं मनुरब्रवीत् ॥ ८.३३९॥ vānaspatyaṁ mūlaphalaṁ dārv agny arthaṁ tathaiva ca |
tṛṇaṁ ca gobhyo grāsārtham asteyaṁ manurabravīt || 8.339 || Manu declared that taking roots, fruits, firewood, grass, or fodder from trees and plants for the sustenance of cattle or sacred purposes is not theft when done without intent to deprive.

title: Verse 8.340
content:
योऽदत्तादायिनो हस्तात्लिप्सेत ब्राह्मणो धनम् ।
याजनाध्यापनेनापि यथा स्तेनस्तथैव सः ॥ ८.३४०॥ yo'dattādāyino hastāt lipset brāhmaṇo dhanam |
yājanādhyāpanenāpi yathā stenas tathaiva saḥ || 8.340 || A Brāhmaṇa who seeks to acquire wealth from the hands of one who has not given it—through performance of sacrifices or teaching—is to be understood as a thief in the same manner.

title: Verse 8.341
content:
द्विजोऽध्वगः क्षीणवृत्तिर्द्वाविक्षू द्वे च मूलके ।
आददानः परक्षेत्रात्न दण्डं दातुमर्हति ॥ ८.३४१॥ dvijo'dhvagaḥ kṣīṇavṛttir dvāv ikṣū dve ca mūlake |
ādadānaḥ parakṣetrāt na daṇḍaṃ dātum arhati || 8.341|| A twice-born who is a traveler, impoverished in livelihood, and takes two sugarcane stalks or two roots from another's field shall incur no penalty.

title: Verse 8.342
content:
असंदितानां संदाता संदितानां च मोक्षकः ।
दासाश्वरथहर्ता च प्राप्तः स्याच्चोरकिल्बिषम् ॥ ८.३४२॥ asanditānāṁ sandātā sanditānāṁ ca mokṣakaḥ |
dāsāśvarathahartā ca prāptaḥ syācchorakilbiṣam || 8.342|| One who accepts testimony without verification, releases those who have given it, takes away servants and chariots, and receives stolen goods—such a person becomes the possessor of the sin of theft.

title: Verse 8.343
content: अनेन विधिना राजा कुर्वाणः स्तेननिग्रहम् । यशोऽस्मिन् प्राप्नुयात्लोके प्रेत्य चानुत्तमं सुखम् ॥ ८.३४३॥ anena vidhinā rājā kurvāṇaḥ stenanigraham | yaśo'smin prāpnuyātloke pretya cānuttamaṃ sukham || 8.343|| By this method, when a king enforces the cessation of theft, he secures glory in this world and ultimate happiness after death.

title: Verse 8.344
content:
ऐन्द्रं स्थानमभिप्रेप्सुर्यशश्चाक्षयमव्ययम् ।
नोपेक्षेत क्षणमपि राजा साहसिकं नरम् ॥ ८.३४४॥ aindraṃ sthānamabhiprepsuryaśaścākṣayamavyayam .
nopekṣeta kṣaṇamapi rājā sāhasikaṃ naram .. The King must never neglect, even for a moment, a man whose valor and undying fame aim toward Indra's realm.

title: Verse 8.345
content:
वाग्दुष्टात्तस्कराच्चैव दण्डेनैव च हिंसतः ।
साहसस्य नरः कर्ता विज्ञेयः पापकृत्तमः ॥ ८.३४५॥ vāgduṣṭāt taskarāc caiva daṇḍenaiva ca hiṁsataḥ |
sāhasasya naraḥ kartā vijñeyaḥ pāpakṛttamaḥ || 8.345 || One who commits violence through speech, theft, or physical harm, driven by arrogance, is to be known as the most sinful among wrongdoers.

title: Verse 8.346
content:
साहसे वर्तमानं तु यो मर्षयति पार्थिवः ।
स विनाशं व्रजत्याशु विद्वेषं चाधिगच्छति ॥ ८.३४६॥ sāhase vartamānaṃ tu yo marṣayati pārthivaḥ |
sa vināśaṃ vrajatyāśu vidveṣaṃ cādhigacchati || 8.346|| A ruler who tolerates lawlessness in his domain incurs immediate dissolution of sovereignty and attracts universal enmity.

title: Verse 8.347
content:
न मित्रकारणाद्राजा विपुलाद्वा धनागमात् ।
समुत्सृजेत्साहसिकान् सर्वभूतभयावहान् ॥ ८.३४७॥ na mitrakāraṇād rājā vipulād vā dhanāgamāt |
samutsṛjet sāhasikān sarvabhūtabhayāvahān || 8.347|| The King shall not abandon those who cause fear to all beings, whether out of favoritism or for great material gain.

title: Verse 8.348
content:
शस्त्रं द्विजातिभिर्ग्राह्यं धर्मो यत्रोपरुध्यते ।
द्विजातीनां च वर्णानां विप्लवे कालकारिते ॥ ८.३४८॥ Śastraṃ dvijātibhir grāhyaṃ dharmo yatroaparudhyate |
Dvijātīnāṃ ca varṇānāṃ viplate kālakārite || 8.348|| When Dharma is obstructed and the order of the twice-born varnas is overturned by the force of time, then the instrument of justice must be taken up by the twice-born.

title: Verse 8.349
content: आत्मनश्च परित्राणे दक्षिणानां च सङ्गरे । स्त्रीविप्राभ्युपपत्तौ च घ्नन् धर्मेण न दुष्यति ॥ ८.३४९॥ ātmanaśca paritrāṇe dakṣiṇānāṃ ca saṅgare | strīviprābhyupapattau ca ghan dharmeṇa na duṣyati || 8.349|| One who protects the Self, defends the innocent in battle, and safeguards the honor of women and Brahmins—such a one, even if causing harm, remains untainted by Dharma when acting in accordance with its essence.

title: Verse 8.350
content:
गुरुं वा बालवृद्धौ वा ब्राह्मणं वा बहुश्रुतम् ।
आततायिनमायान्तं हन्यादेवाविचारयन् ॥ ८.३५०॥ Guruṃ vā bālavṛddhau vā brāhmaṇaṃ vā bahuśrutam |
Ātatāyinamāyāntaṃ hanyādevāvicārayan || 8.350|| One who approaches with intent to kill—whether it be a guru, a child or elder, a Brahmin, or one of vast learning—must be immediately stopped without deliberation.

title: Verse 8.351
content:
नाततायिवधे दोषो हन्तुर्भवति कश्चन ।
प्रकाशं वाऽप्रकाशं वा मन्युस्तं मन्युमृच्छति ॥ ८.३५१॥ nātatāyivadhe doṣo hanturbhavati kaścana |
prakaśaṁ vā'prakaśaṁ vā manyustāṁ manyumṛcchati || 8.351|| No fault arises for the killer of an active assailant, whether the act occurs in broad daylight or under concealment; anger directed toward another who harbors anger is resolved through conscious confrontation.

title: Verse 8.352
content:
परदाराभिमर्शेषु प्रवृत्तान्नॄन् महीपतिः ।
उद्वेजनकरैर्दण्डैश्छिन्नयित्वा प्रवासयेत् ॥ ८.३५२॥ paradārābhimarśeṣu pravṛttān nṝn mahīpatiḥ |
udvejanakarair daṇḍaiś chinnayitvā pravāsayet || 8.352|| When men transgress boundaries of propriety with another's spouse, the King shall sever their capacity for such distortion through corrective dislocation and conscious reorientation.

title: Verse 8.353
content:
तत्समुत्थो हि लोकस्य जायते वर्णसङ्करः ।
येन मूलहरोऽधर्मः सर्वनाशाय कल्पते ॥ ८.३५३॥ tat-samuttho hi lokasya jāyate varṇa-saṅkaraḥ |
yena mūla-haro 'dharmaḥ sarva-nāśāya kalpate || 8.353|| From that arising, indeed, occurs the mingling of castes among people; by which the fundamental duty is lost, leading to total destruction.

title: Verse 8.354
content:
परस्य पत्न्या पुरुषः सम्भाषां योजयन् रहः ।
पूर्वमाक्षारितो दोषैः प्राप्नुयात्पूर्वसाहसम् ॥ ८.३५४॥ parasya patnyā puruṣaḥ sambhāṣāṁ yojayan rahaḥ |
pūrvam ākṣārito doṣaiḥ prāpnuyāt pūrva-sāhasam || 8.354|| When a man engages in private conversation with another's wife, previously marked by misconduct, he incurs the same prior offense.

title: Verse 8.355
content:
यस्त्वनाक्षारितः पूर्वमभिभाषेत कारणात् ।
न दोषं प्राप्नुयात्किं चिन्न हि तस्य व्यतिक्रमः ॥ ८.३५५॥ yas tv anākṣāritaḥ pūrvam abhibhāṣeta kāraṇāt |
na doṣaṃ prāpnuyāt kiñcin na hi tasya vyatikramaḥ || 8.355|| One who speaks without prior instruction, out of personal motive, incurs no fault thereby, for there is no transgression where capacity has not been formally invoked.

title: Verse 8.356
content:
परस्त्रियं योऽभिवदेत्तीर्थेऽरण्ये वनेऽपि वा ।
नदीनां वाऽपि सम्भेदे स सङ्ग्रहणमाप्नुयात् ॥ ८.३५६॥ parastriyaṁ yo'bhi vadet tīrthe 'raṇye vane'pi vā |
nadīnāṁ vā'pi sambhede sa saṅgrahaṇam āpnuyāt || 8.356 || He who approaches another's wife—whether at a sacred site, in the forest, in the wilderness, or at confluence of rivers—commits an act of violation that disrupts cosmic order and necessitates immediate restoration of dharma through conscious realignment.

title: Verse 8.357
content: उपचारक्रिया केलिः स्पर्शो भूषणवाससाम् । उपकारक्रिया सह खट्वाऽसनं चैव सर्वं सङ्ग्रहणं स्मृतम् ॥ ८.३५७॥ upacārakriyā keliḥ sparśo bhūṣaṇavāsasām | upakārakriyā saha khaṭvā'sanaṃ caiva sarvaṃ saṅgrahaṇaṃ smṛtam || 8.357 || Acts of service and play, touching ornaments and garments, acts of kindness together with beds and seats—all such acquisitions are to be understood as comprehensive gathering rooted in dharmic alignment.

title: Verse 8.358
content:
स्त्रियं स्पृशेददेशे यः स्पृष्टो वा मर्षयेत्तया ।
परस्परस्यानुमते सर्वं सङ्ग्रहणं स्मृतम् ॥ ८.३५८॥ striyaṃ spṛśedadeśe yaḥ spṛṣṭo vā marṣayettayā |
parasparasyānumate sarvaṃ saṅgrahaṇaṃ smṛtam || 8.358|| He who touches a woman without invitation or accepts her touch without consent, when both have given mutual assent, it is declared as complete union.

title: Verse 8.359
content:
अब्राह्मणः सङ्ग्रहणे प्राणान्तं दण्डमर्हति ।
चतुर्णामपि वर्णानां दारा रक्ष्यतमाः सदा ॥ ८.३५९॥ abrāhmaṇaḥ saṅgrahaṇe prāṇāntaṃ daṇḍamarhati |
caturṇām api varṇānāṃ dārā rakṣyatamāḥ sadā || 8.359|| One who is not established in the Brahmanic consciousness and seizes another’s spouse incurs a penalty culminating in the termination of life-force; the wives of all four varnas must always be most carefully protected.

title: Verse 8.360
content:
भिक्षुका बन्दिनश्चैव दीक्षिताः कारवस्तथा ।
सम्भाषणं सह स्त्रीभिः कुर्युरप्रतिवारिताः ॥ ८.३६०॥ bhikṣukā bandinaścaiva dīkṣitāḥ kāravastathā |
sambhāṣaṇaṃ saha strībhiḥ kuryuraprativāritāḥ || 8.360 || Those who have taken vows of renunciation—such as mendicants, captives, initiates, and servants—are permitted to engage in conversation with women when not explicitly restricted by their governing authority.

title: Verse 8.361
content:
न सम्भाषां परस्त्रीभिः प्रतिषिद्धः समाचरेत् ।
निषिद्धो भाषमाणस्तु सुवर्णं दण्डमर्हति ॥ ८.३६१॥ na sambhāṣāṃ parastrībhiḥ pratiṣiddhaḥ samācaret | niṣiddho bhāṣamāṇastu suvarṇaṃ daṇḍamarhati || 8.361 || One who is forbidden from speaking with another's wife and yet engages in discourse with her shall incur a penalty of gold.

title: Verse 8.362
content:
नैष चारणदारेषु विधिर्नात्मोपजीविषु ।
सज्जयन्ति हि ते नारीर्निगूढाश्चारयन्ति च ॥ ८.३६२॥ naiṣa cāraṇadāreṣu vidhir nātmopajīviṣu |
sajjayanti hi te nārīr nigūḍhāś cārayanti ca || 8.362|| No injunction applies to those who sustain dharma through service nor to those who live by their own inner discipline; they elevate women openly and guide them in concealment.

title: Verse 8.363
content:
किं चिदेव तु दाप्यः स्यात्सम्भाषां ताभिराचरन् ।
प्रैष्यासु चैकभक्तासु रहः प्रव्रजितासु च ॥ ८.३६३॥ kiṃ cid eva tu dāpyaḥ syāt sambhāṣāṃ tābhir ācaran |
praiṣyāsu caikabhaktāsu rahaḥ pravrajitāsu ca || 8.363|| One who engages in discourse with those sent on missions, devoted to one purpose, secluded or renounced, shall incur a debt of restoration.

title: Verse 8.364
content:
योऽकामां दूषयेत्कन्यां स सद्यो वधमर्हति ।
सकामां दूषयंस्तुल्यो न वधं प्राप्नुयान्नरः ॥ ८.३६४॥ yo'kāmāṁ dūṣayet kanyāṁ sa sadyo vadam arhati |
sakāmāṁ dūṣayanstulyo na vadaṁ prāpnuyān naraḥ || 8.364|| He who violates a girl without her consent becomes immediately liable for execution; he who violates a consenting woman incurs no liability for execution.

title: Verse 8.365
content: कन्यां भजन्तीमुत्कृष्टं न किं चिदपि दापयेत् । जघन्यं सेवमानां तु संयतां वासयेद्गृहे ॥ ८.३६५॥ kanyāṁ bhajantīmutkṛṣṭaṁ na kiṁ cidapi dāpayet | jaghanyaṁ sevamānāṁ tu saṁyatāṁ vāsayedgṛhe || 8.365 || One serving a woman of higher varna shall offer no gift whatsoever; one serving a woman of lower varna shall cause her to dwell restrained within the house.

title: Verse 8.366
content:
उत्तमां सेवमानस्तु जघन्यो वधमर्हति ।
शुल्कं दद्यात्सेवमानः समामिच्छेत्पिता यदि ॥ ८.३६६॥ uttamāṃ sevamānastu jaghanyo vadhamarhati |
śulkaṃ dadyātsevamānaḥ samāmicchetpitā yadi || 8.366|| One serving in the highest capacity who fails to align with that station incurs liability equivalent to the lowest, unless the father desires equal service and accepts due compensation.

title: Verse 8.367
content:
अभिषह्य तु यः कन्यां कुर्याद्दर्पेण मानवः ।
तस्याशु कर्त्ये अङ्गुल्यौ दण्डं चार्हति षट्शतम् ॥ ८.३६७॥ abhiṣahya tu yaḥ kanyāṁ kuryād darpeṇa mānavaḥ |
tasyāśu kartye aṅgulyau daṇḍaṁ cārhati ṣaṭśatam || 8.367|| He who, driven by arrogance, violates a maiden through force shall have his fingers severed immediately and shall forfeit six hundred units as restitution.

title: Verse 8.368
content:
सकामां दूषयंस्तुल्यो नाङ्गुलिछेदमाप्नुयात् ।
द्विशतं तु दमं दाप्यः प्रसङ्गविनिवृत्तये ॥ ८.३६८॥ sakāmāṃ dūṣayaṃstulyo nāṅguliichedam āpnuyāt |
dviśataṃ tu damaṃ dāpyaḥ prasaṅgavinivṛttaye || 8.368 || One who defiles a woman under the influence of lust shall not incur the severing of a finger; rather, he shall pay two hundred units of compensation—for the purpose of ceasing the occurrence of such misconduct.

title: Verse 8.369
content:
कन्यैव कन्यां या कुर्यात्तस्याः स्याद्द्विशतो दमः ।
शुल्कं च द्विगुणं दद्यात्शिफाश्चैवाप्नुयाद्दश ॥ ८.३६९॥ kanyaiiva kanyāṁ yā kuryāt tasyāḥ syād dviśato damaḥ |
śulkaṁ ca diguṇaṁ dadyāt śiphāś caivāpnu yāddaśa || 8.369 || If a woman causes another woman to become a maiden again, her penalty shall be two hundred units of compensation; she shall also pay double the fee and incur a fine of ten units.

title: Verse 8.370
content:
या तु कन्यां प्रकुर्यात्स्त्री सा सद्यो मौण्ड्यमर्हति ।
अङ्गुल्योरेव वा छेदं खरेणोद्वहनं तथा ॥ ८.३७०॥ yā tu kanyāṁ prakuryāt striī sā sadyo mauṇḍyamarhati |
aṅgulyoreva vā chedaṁ khareṇodvahanaṁ tathā || 8.370 || A woman who violates a maiden shall immediately undergo tonsure, or the cutting of her fingers, or be made to ride upon a donkey—these acts are declaratively mandated for the restoration of violated integrity.

title: Verse 8.371
content:
भर्तारं लङ्घयेद्या तु स्त्री ज्ञातिगुणदर्पिता ।
तां श्वभिः खादयेद्राजा संस्थाने बहुसंस्थिते ॥ ८.३७१॥ bhartāraṃ laṅghayed yā tu strī jñātiguṇa-darpitā |
tāṃ śvabhiḥ khādayed rājā saṃsthāne bahusaṃsthite || 8.371|| When a woman, inflated by lineage or familial status, transgresses the authority of her husband, the King, in a state of abundant institutional order, shall initiate her reintegration through exposure to cleansing forces that restore alignment.

title: Verse 8.372
content:
पुमांसं दाहयेत्पापं शयने तप्त आयसे ।
अभ्यादध्युश्च काष्ठानि तत्र दह्येत पापकृत् ॥ ८.३७२॥ pumāṁsaṁ dāhayet pāpaṁ śayane tapta āyase |
abhyādadhyaś ca kāṣṭhāni tatra dahyeta pāpakṛt || 8.372|| The sin committed by a man lies dormant within his being; like heated iron or burning wood placed upon a bed, it consumes him from within until he awakens to its presence.

title: Verse 8.373
