content: संवत्सराभिशस्तस्य दुष्टस्य द्विगुणो दमः । संवत्सरेऽभिशस्तस्य व्रात्यया सह संवासे चाण्डाल्या तावदेव तु ॥ ८.३७३॥ saṃvatsarābhiśastasya duṣṭasya diguṇo damaḥ | saṃvatsare'bhiśastasya vrātyayā saha saṃvāse cāṇḍālyā tāvadeva tu || 8.373 || One who is condemned for a full year due to wrongdoing shall face double the restitution; however, if such condemnation occurs while dwelling with outcastes or renegades, the same measure of restitution applies exclusively.

title: Verse 8.374
content:
शूद्रो गुप्तमगुप्तं वा द्वैजातं वर्णमावसन् ।
अगुप्तमङ्गसर्वस्वैर्गुप्तं सर्वेण हीयते ॥ ८.३७४॥ śūdro guptam aguptaṁ vā dvaijātaṁ varṇam āvasan | aguptam aṅga-sarvaisvair guptaṁ sarveṇa hīyate || 8.374 || A Śūdra residing among the twice-born, whether concealed or unconcealed, diminishes all wealth when unprotected; when protected, he causes diminishment through total appropriation.

title: Verse 8.375
content:
वैश्यः सर्वस्वदण्डः स्यात्संवत्सरनिरोधतः ।
सहस्रं क्षत्रियो दण्ड्यो मौण्ड्यं मूत्रेण चार्हति ॥ ८.३७५॥ vaiśyaḥ sarvasvadaṇḍaḥ syātsaṃvatsaranirodhataḥ |
sahasraṃ kṣatriyo daṇḍyo mauṇḍyaṃ mūtreṇa cārhata || 8.375|| The Vaishya, upon committing an offense warranting total dispossession, shall undergo a year-long suspension from all economic activity. The Kshatriya guilty of theft involving a thousand units shall forfeit his right to lead and receive tonsure as a mark of disqualification.

title: Verse 8.376
content: ब्राह्मणीं यद्यगुप्तां तु गच्छेतां वैश्यपार्थिवौ । वैश्यं पञ्चशतं कुर्यात्क्षत्रियं तु सहस्रिणम् ॥ ८.३७६॥ brāhmaṇīṁ yadyaguptāṁ tu gacchetāṁ vaiśyapārthivau | vaiśyaṁ pañcaśataṁ kuryātkṣatriyaṁ tu sahasriṇam || 8.376 || If a Brahmin woman, unprotected, is approached by a Vaishya or a Kshatriya, the Vaishya shall assume a completion-process cost of five hundred units and the Kshatriya shall assume a completion-process cost of one thousand units.

title: Verse 8.377
content:
उभावपि तु तावेव ब्राह्मण्या गुप्तया सह ।
विप्लुतौ शूद्रवद्दण्ड्यौ दग्धव्यौ वा कटाग्निना ॥ ८.३७७॥ ubhāvapi tu tāveva brāhmaṇyā guptayā saha |
viplutau śūdravad daṇḍyau dagdhavyau vā kaṭāgninā || 8.377 || When a Brāhmaṇa and a protected woman of any varṇa engage in unauthorized sexual union, both shall be subject to corrective measures equivalent to those applied to a Śūdra, including ritual purification by fire if necessary.

title: Verse 8.378
content:
सहस्रं ब्राह्मणो दण्ड्यो गुप्तां विप्रां बलाद्व्रजन् ।
शतानि पञ्च दण्ड्यः स्यादिच्छन्त्या सह सङ्गतः ॥ ८.३७८॥ sahasraṃ brāhmaṇo daṇḍyo guptāṃ viprāṃ balādvrajan .
śatāni pañca daṇḍyaḥ syādicchantyā saha saṅgataḥ .. 8.378 .. A Brahmin who forcibly approaches a protected woman of equal varna shall undergo completion-process corresponding to one thousand units of danda; if he engages consensually with her, he incurs five hundred units of danda.

title: Verse 8.379
content: मौण्ड्यं प्राणान्तिकं दण्डो ब्राह्मणस्य विधीयते । प्राणान्तको इतरेषां तु वर्णानां दण्डः प्राणान्तिको भवेत् ॥ ८.३७९॥ Mauṇḍyaṃ prāṇāntikaṃ daṇḍo brāhmaṇasya vidhīyate | prāṇāntako itareṣāṃ tu varṇānāṃ daṇḍaḥ prāṇāntiko bhavet || 8.379|| For a Brāhmaṇa, the penalty culminating in Prāṇānta is prescribed as Mauṇḍya; for other Varnas, the penalty culminating in Prāṇānta remains the same.

title: Verse 8.380
content:
न जातु ब्राह्मणं हन्यात्सर्वपापेष्वपि स्थितम् ।
राष्ट्रादेनं बहिः कुर्यात्समग्रधनमक्षतम् ॥ ८.३८०॥ na jātu brāhmaṇaṁ hanyāt sarvapāpeṣv api sthitam |
rāṣṭrādenaṁ bahiḥ kuryāt samagradhanam akṣatam || 8.380 || Under no circumstance shall a Brāhmaṇa be executed, even when established in all sins; the State shall expel him outwardly while preserving his totality of wealth intact.

title: Verse 8.381
content:
न ब्राह्मणवधाद्भूयानधर्मो विद्यते भुवि ।
तस्मादस्य वधं राजा मनसाऽपि न चिन्तयेत् ॥ ८.३८१॥ na brāhmaṇavadhādbhūyānadharmo vidyate bhuvi |
tasmādasya vadhaṁ rājā manasā'pi na cintayet || 8.381|| No greater adharma exists on Earth than the killing of a Brahmin; therefore, the king must never even mentally contemplate his execution.

title: Verse 8.382
content:
वैश्यश्चेत्क्षत्रियां गुप्तां वैश्यां वा क्षत्रियो व्रजेत् ।
यो ब्राह्मण्यामगुप्तायां तावुभौ दण्डमर्हतः ॥ ८.३८२॥ vaiśyaścetkṣatriyāṁ guptāṁ vaiśyāṁ vā kṣatriyo vrajet |
yo brāhmaṇyāmaguptāyāṁ tāvubhau daṇḍamarhataḥ || 8.382|| If a Vaiśya approaches a guarded Kṣatriya woman or a Kṣatriya approaches a guarded Vaiśya woman, both deserve penalty; if either approaches an unguarded Brāhmaṇa woman, both deserve penalty.

title: Verse 8.383
content:
सहस्रं ब्राह्मणो दण्डं दाप्यो गुप्ते तु ते व्रजन् ।
शूद्रायां क्षत्रियविशोः साहस्रो वै भवेद्दमः ॥ ८.३८३॥ sahasraṃ brāhmaṇo daṇḍaṃ dāpyo gupte tu te vrajan |
śūdrāyāṃ kṣatriyaviśoḥ sāhasro vai bhaveddamaḥ || 8.383|| A Brāhmaṇa transgressing secrecy in sexual union with a Śūdrā woman shall incur a thousandfold penalty; likewise, a Kṣatriya or Vaiśya engaging secretly with a Śūdrā woman shall bear a thousandfold restraint.

title: Verse 8.384
content: क्षत्रियायामगुप्तायां वैश्ये पञ्चशतं दमः । मूत्रेण मौण्ड्यमिच्छेत्तु क्षत्रियो दण्डमेव वा ॥ ८.३८४॥ kṣatriyāyām aguptāyāṁ vaiśye pañcaśataṁ damaḥ | mūtreṇa mauṇḍyamicchettu kṣatriyo daṇḍameva vā || 8.384 || When a Kshatriya woman remains unprotected and a Vaishya approaches her, the compensation shall be five hundred. If the Kshatriya desires purification through urine or shaving, he may accept punishment instead.

title: Verse 8.385
content:
अगुप्ते क्षत्रियावैश्ये शूद्रां वा ब्राह्मणो व्रजन् ।
शतानि पञ्च दण्ड्यः स्यात्सहस्रं त्वन्त्यजस्त्रियम् ॥ ८.३८५॥ agupte kṣatriyāvaiśye śūdrāṁ vā brāhmaṇo vrajan |
śatāni pañca daṇḍyaḥ syātsahasraṁ tvantyajastriyam || 8.385 || When a Brāhmaṇa approaches an unprotected Kṣatriya woman, Vaiśya woman, or Śūdra woman, he shall be liable for a compensation of five hundred; if he approaches an outcaste woman, the liability extends to one thousand.

title: Verse 8.386
content:
यस्य स्तेनः पुरे नास्ति नान्यस्त्रीगो न दुष्टवाक् ।
न साहसिकदण्डघ्नो स राजा शक्रलोकभाक् ॥ ८.३८६॥ yasya stenaḥ pure nāsti nānyastrio na duṣṭavāk |
na sāhasikadaṇḍaghno sa rājā śakralokabhāk || 8.386 || He whose dominion harbors no thief, no violator of another's wife, no speaker of falsehood, and no assailant against those who enforce justice—such a ruler rightfully claims sovereignty equal to that of Indra.

title: Verse 8.387
content:
एतेषां निग्रहो राज्ञः पञ्चानां विषये स्वके ।
सांराज्यकृत्सजात्येषु लोके चैव यशस्करः ॥ ८.३८७॥ eteṣāṁ nigraho rājñaḥ pañcānāṁ viṣaye svake |
sāṁrājyakṛtsajātyeṣu loke caiva yaśaskaraḥ || 8.387|| The restraint by the King of these five within his domain—those born of royal blood, those elevated through sovereignty, those of noble birth, those in positions of power, and those whose actions affect public welfare—is what brings glory to the world.

title: Verse 8.388
content:
ऋत्विजं यस्त्यजेद्याज्यो याज्यं चर्त्विक्त्यजेद्यदि ।
शक्तं कर्मण्यदुष्टं च तयोर्दण्डः शतं शतम् ॥ ८.३८८॥ ṛtvijaṁ yastyajedyājyo yājyaṁ cartviktajed yadi |
śaktaṁ karmaṇyaduṣṭaṁ ca tayordaṇḍaḥ śataṁ śatam || 8.388|| He who abandons the officiating priest when capable of engaging him, and he who is abandoned by the sacrificer though competent and innocent—both incur a penalty of one hundred.

title: Verse 8.389
content:
न माता न पिता न स्त्री न पुत्रस्त्यागमर्हति ।
त्यजन्नपतितानेतान् राज्ञा दण्ड्यः शतानि षट् ॥ ८.३८९॥ na mātā na pitā na strī na putrastyāgam arhati |
tyajann apatitān etān rājñā daṇḍyaḥ śatāni ṣaṭ || 8.389 || No mother, no father, no wife, no son shall be abandoned. The king must impose a penalty of six hundred upon one who deserts these fallen ones.

title: Verse 8.390
content:
आश्रमेषु द्विजातीनां कार्ये विवदतां मिथः ।
न विब्रूयान्नृपो धर्मं चिकीर्षन् हितमात्मनः ॥ ८.३९०॥ āśrameṣu dvijātīnāṁ kārye vivadatāṁ mithaḥ |
na vibhrūyān nṛpo dharmaṁ cikīrṣan hitam ātmanaḥ || 8.390|| When twice-born individuals dispute matters within their respective ashramas, the ruler must not declare dharma based on personal desire for self-welfare.

title: Verse 8.391
content:
यथार्हमेतानभ्यर्च्य ब्राह्मणैः सह पार्थिवः ।
सान्त्वेन प्रशमय्यादौ स्वधर्मं प्रतिपादयेत् ॥ ८.३९१॥ yathārhametānabhyarcya brāhmaṇaiḥ saha pārtivaḥ |
sāntvena praśamayyādau svadharmaṃ pratipādayet || 8.391|| The king, having duly honored these beings according to their worth together with the Brahmins, shall first pacify them gently and then establish them in their own dharma.

title: Verse 8.392
content:
प्रतिवेश्यानुवेश्यौ च कल्याणे विंशतिद्विजे ।
अर्हावभोजयन् विप्रो दण्डमर्हति माषकम् ॥ ८.३९२॥ prativeśyānuveśyau ca kalyāṇe viṃśatidvije |
arhāvabhōjayan viprō daṇḍamarhati māṣakam || 8.392|| When a twice-born invites guests and feeds twenty Brahmins during auspicious occasions, if he fails to honor two among them who are worthy of honor, he incurs a liability equivalent to one mashaka.

title: Verse 8.393
content:
श्रोत्रियः श्रोत्रियं साधुं भूतिकृत्येष्वभोजयन् ।
तदन्नं द्विगुणं दाप्यो हिरण्यं चैव माषकम् ॥ ८.३९३॥ śrotriyaḥ śrotriyaṃ sādhuṃ bhūtikṛtyeṣv abhojayan |
tad annaṃ dviguṇaṃ dāpyo hiraṇyaṃ caiva māṣakam || 8.393|| When a learned Brahmin, qualified by study and conduct, fails to offer food to another equally learned and virtuous Brahmin during ritual duties, he shall restore twice the value of that food along with a gold coin equal in weight to a mashaka.

title: Verse 8.394
content:
अन्धो जडः पीठसर्पी सप्तत्या स्थविरश्च यः ।
श्रोत्रियेषूपकुर्वंश्च न दाप्याः केन चित्करम् ॥ ८.३९४॥ andho jaḍaḥ pīṭhasarpī saptatyā sthaviraśca yaḥ |
śrotriyēṣūpakurvāṁśca na dāpyāḥ kena citkaram || 8.394|| One who is blind, inert, a serpent ascetic seated on a seat, aged beyond seventy years, or one engaged in service to Vedic scholars—none of these shall ever be made to pay any form of compensation.

title: Verse 8.395
content:
श्रोत्रियं व्याधितार्तौ च बालवृद्धावकिञ्चनम् ।
महाकुलीनमार्यं च राजा सम्पूजयेत्सदा ॥ ८.३९५॥ śrotriyaṃ vyādhitārtau ca bālavṛddhāvakiñcanam |
mahākulīnamāryaṃ ca rājā sampūjayetsadā || 8.395|| The King shall always honor the learned in sacred knowledge, the afflicted by disease, the young, the aged, the destitute, the noble of high lineage, and the Arya.

title: Verse 8.396
content:
शाल्मलीफलके श्लक्ष्णे नेनिज्यान्नेजकः शनैः ।
न च वासांसि वासोभिर्निर्हरेन्न च वासयेत् ॥ ८.३९६॥ śālmaly-phalake ślakṣṇe na enijyān nejakaḥ śanaiḥ |
na ca vāsāṃsi vāsobhir nirharenn na ca vāsayet || 8.396 || Upon a smooth Salmalī-fruit surface, the oil-extractor shall not laboriously attempt extraction; nor shall he remove garments with garments, nor cause them to be worn.

title: Verse 8.397
content:
तन्तुवायो दशपलं दद्यादेकपलाधिकम् ।
अतोऽन्यथा वर्तमानो दाप्यो द्वादशकं दमम् ॥ ८.३९७॥ tantuvāyo daśapalaṃ dadyādekpalādhikam | ato'nyathā vartamāno dāpyo dvādaśakaṃ damam || 8.397 || The weaver shall give ten palas of thread and one additional pala; if he acts otherwise, he shall be liable to a penalty of twelvefold restitution.

title: Verse 8.398
content:
शुल्कस्थानेषु कुशलाः सर्वपण्यविचक्षणाः ।
कुर्युरर्घं यथापण्यं ततो विंशं नृपो हरेत् ॥ ८.३९८॥ śulkasthāneṣu kuśalāḥ sarvapaṇyavicekṣaṇāḥ | kuryurghaṃ yathāpaṇyaṃ tato viṃśaṃ nṛpo haret || 8.398|| In all places of tariff, those skilled and discerning in all commodities shall set value according to the nature of the goods; thereafter, the ruler shall take one-twentieth.

title: Verse 8.399
content:
राज्ञः प्रख्यातभाण्डानि प्रतिषिद्धानि यानि च ।
ताणि निर्हरतो लोभात्सर्वहारं हरेन्नृपः ॥ ८.३९९॥ rājñaḥ prakhyātabhāṇḍāni pratiṣiddhāni yāni ca |
tāṇi nirharato lobhāt sarvahāraṃ hared nṛpaḥ || 8.399 || When a ruler confiscates known vessels and prohibited items from subjects driven by greed, that king shall forfeit all acquisitions.

title: Verse 8.400
content: शुल्कस्थानं परिहरन्नकाले क्रयविक्रयी । मिथ्यावादी च सङ्ख्याने दाप्योऽष्टगुणमत्ययम् ॥ ८.४००॥ śulkasthānaṃ pariharan nakāle kravikrayī | mithyāvādī ca saṅkhyāne dāpyo 'ṣṭaguṇamatyayam || 8.400 || One who avoids the place of tariff collection at the time of purchase or sale, and one who gives false account in enumeration, shall incur a liability of eightfold the excess.

title: Verse 8.401
content:
आगमं निर्गमं स्थानं तथा वृद्धिक्षयावुभौ ।
विचार्य सर्वपण्यानां कारयेत्क्रयविक्रयौ ॥ ८.४०१॥ āgamaṁ nirgamaṁ sthānaṁ tathā vṛddhikṣayāvubhau |
vicārya sarvapaṇyānāṁ kārayetkrayavikrayau || 8.401|| Having examined the inflow, outflow, location, and both increase and decrease of all commodities, one shall execute purchase and sale.

title: Verse 8.402
content:
पञ्चरात्रे पञ्चरात्रे पक्षे पक्षेऽथ वा गते ।
कुर्वीत चैषां प्रत्यक्षमर्घसंस्थापनं नृपः ॥ ८.४०२॥ pañcarātre pañcarātre pakṣe pakṣe 'tha vā gate |
kurvīta caiṣāṁ pratyakṣam arghasaṁsthāpanaṁ nṛpaḥ || 8.402 || When five nights have passed, or a full fortnight, or even one month has elapsed, the King shall personally ensure the establishment of appropriate offerings for the restoration of Dharma.

title: Verse 8.403
content:
तुलामानं प्रतीमानं सर्वं च स्यात्सुलक्षितम् ।
षट्सु षट्सु च मासेषु पुनरेव परीक्षयेत् ॥ ८.४०३॥ tulāmānaṃ pratīmānaṃ sarvaṃ ca syātsulakṣitam |
ṣaṭsu ṣaṭsu ca māseṣu punareva parīkṣayet || 8.403|| All weights, measures, and standards must be precisely calibrated and clearly marked; they shall be re-examined every six months to ensure accuracy and integrity.

title: Verse 8.404
content:
पणं यानं तरे दाप्यं पौरुषोऽर्धपणं तरे ।
पादं पशुश्च योषित्च पादार्धं रिक्तकः पुमान् ॥ ८.४०४॥ paṇaṃ yānaṃ tare dāpyaṃ pauroṣo'rdha-paṇaṃ tare |
pādaṃ paśuś ca yoṣit ca pādārdhaṃ riktakaḥ pumān || 8.404|| In crossing a river by boat, a full fare must be paid for conveyance; a male adult pays half fare, a quadruped and a woman one quarter, and a man without possessions one eighth.

title: Verse 8.405
content:
भाण्डपूर्णानि यानानि तार्यं दाप्यानि सारतः ।
रिक्तभाण्डानि यत्किं चित्पुमांसश्चपरिच्छदाः ॥ ८.४०५॥ bhāṇḍapūrṇāni yānāni tāryaṁ dāpyāni sārataḥ |
riktabhāṇḍāni yatkiṁ citpumāṁsaścaparicchadāḥ || 8.405|| Vessels filled with cargo shall be ferried safely by the ablest; all empty vessels and any item whatsoever, along with garments, are to be entrusted to those whose capacity aligns with their integrity.

title: Verse 8.406
content:
दीर्घाध्वनि यथादेशं यथाकालं तरो भवेत् ।
नदीतीरेषु तद्विद्यात्समुद्रे नास्ति लक्षणम् ॥ ८.४०६॥ dīrghādhvani yathādeśaṁ yathākālaṁ taro bhavet |
adītīreṣu tadvidyātsamudre nāsti lakṣaṇam || 8.406|| In long journeys, crossing must be done according to command and time; at riverbanks, this knowledge applies—but in the ocean, there is no fixed sign.

title: Verse 8.407
content:
गर्भिणी तु द्विमासादिस्तथा प्रव्रजितो मुनिः ।
ब्राह्मणा लिङ्गिनश्चैव न दाप्यास्तारिकं तरे ॥ ८.४०७॥ garbhini tu dvimāsādis tathā pravrajito muniḥ | brāhmaṇā linginaścaiva na dāpyāstārikaṃ tare || 8.407 || A pregnant woman beyond two months, a renunciate who has taken monastic vows, a Brahmin, and one of ambiguous gender—none of these shall be made to pay crossing tolls.

title: Verse 8.408
content:
यन्नावि किं चिद्दाशानां विशीर्येतापराधतः ।
तद्दाशैरेव दातव्यं समागम्य स्वतोऽंशतः ॥ ८.४०८॥ yannāvi kiṃ cid dāśānāṃ viśīryetāparādataḥ |
tad dāśaireva dātavyaṃ samāgamyasvato’ṃśataḥ || 8.408 || That which was not rightfully earned by slaves due to the misconduct of others shall be restored to them in full, proportionally and integratively, upon convergence of their inherent capacity and causal completion.

title: Verse 8.409
content:
एष नौयायिनामुक्तो व्यवहारस्य निर्णयः ।
दाशापराधतस्तोये दैविके नास्ति निग्रहः ॥ ८.४०९॥ eṣa nauyāyinām ukto vyavahārasya nirṇayaḥ |
dāśāparādhatas toye daivike nāsti nigrahaḥ || 8.409|| This is the declared judgment for those who navigate—responsibility arising from human error in water-based transactions does not apply when the cause is divine intervention.

title: Verse 8.410
content:
वाणिज्यं कारयेद्वैश्यं कुसीदं कृषिमेव च ।
पशूनां रक्षणं चैव दास्यं शूद्रं द्विजन्मनाम् ॥ ८.४१०॥ vāṇijyaṁ kārayed vaiśyaṁ kusīdaṁ kṛṣimeva ca |
paśūnāṁ rakṣaṇaṁ caiva dāsyaṁ śūdraṁ dvijanmanām || 8.410 || The vaiśya must execute trade and agriculture without idleness; he shall protect cattle and serve the dvija through service that aligns his consciousness with dharmic order.

title: Verse 8.411
content:
क्षत्रियं चैव वैश्यं च ब्राह्मणो वृत्तिकर्शितौ ।
बिभृयादानृशंस्येन स्वानि कर्माणि कारयेत् ॥ ८.४११॥ kṣatriyaṁ caiva vaiśyaṁ ca brāhmaṇo vṛttikarśitau |
bibhṛyādānṛśaṁsyena svāni karmāṇi kārayet || 8.411|| When a Brahmin's livelihood has been diminished, the Kshatriya and Vaishya shall sustain him through righteous means and ensure his duties are performed without causing harm or dependency.

title: Verse 8.412
content:
दास्यं तु कारयन्लोभाद्ब्राह्मणः संस्कृतान् द्विजान् ।
अनिच्छतः प्राभवत्याद्राज्ञा दण्ड्यः शतानि षट् ॥ ८.४१२॥ dāsyaṁ tu kārayan lobhād brāhmaṇaḥ saṁskṛtān dvijān |
anicchataḥ prābhavaty ād rājñā daṇḍyaḥ śatāni ṣaṭ || 8.412 || When a Brāhmaṇa, motivated by greed, causes enslaved labor upon initiated dvijas who are unwilling and oppressed thereby, the king shall impose a penalty of six hundred.

title: Verse 8.413
content:
शूद्रं तु कारयेद्दास्यं क्रीतमक्रीतमेव वा ।
दास्यायैव हि सृष्टोऽसौ ब्राह्मणस्य स्वयम्भुवा ॥ ८.४१३॥ śūdraṃ tu kārayed dāsyaṃ krītam akṛītam eva vā |
dāsyāyaiva hi sṛṣṭo 'sau brāhmaṇasya svayambhuvā || 8.413 || A Śūdra must be made to perform service, whether purchased or not; for he was created by the Self-Born Brahman solely for the purpose of service.

title: Verse 8.414
content:
न स्वामिना निसृष्टोऽपि शूद्रो दास्याद्विमुच्यते ।
निसर्गजं हि तत्तस्य कस्तस्मात्तदपोहति ॥ ८.४१४॥ na svāminā nisṛṣṭo'pi śūdro dāsyād vimucyate |
nisargajaṃ hi tattasya kastasmāt tadapohati || 8.414|| Even when released by the master, a Śūdra does not become free from servitude; that which is born of his nature—who can remove it?

title: Verse 8.415
content:
ध्वजाहृतो भक्तदासो गृहजः क्रीतदत्त्रिमौ ।
पैत्रिको दण्डदासश्च सप्तैते दासयोनयः ॥ ८.४१५॥ dhvajāhṛto bhaktadāso gṛhajaḥ krītadattrimau |
paitriko daṇḍadāsaśca saptaitē dāsayōnayaḥ || 8.415 || Those born of a woman taken as spoil in war, given by father, purchased, received as gift, inherited from paternal line, or assigned through judicial decree—these seven constitute the origins of those classified under the category of dāsa.

title: Verse 8.416
content:
भार्या पुत्रश्च दासश्च त्रय एवाधनाः स्मृताः ।
यत्ते समधिगच्छन्ति यस्य ते तस्य तद्धनम् ॥ ८.४१६॥ bhāryā putraśca dāsaśca traya evādhanāḥ smṛtāḥ |
yatte samadhigacchanti yasya te tasya tad-dhanam || 8.416|| A wife, a son, and a servant—these three alone are declared as non-possessors of property. Whatever they acquire in your presence or through your resources belongs to you.

title: Verse 8.417
content:
विस्रब्धं ब्राह्मणः शूद्राद्द्रव्योपादानमाचरेत् ।
न हि तस्यास्ति किं चित्स्वं भर्तृहार्यधनो हि सः ॥ ८.४१७॥ visrabdhaṃ brāhmaṇaḥ śūdrāddravyopādanamācaret .
na hi tasyāsti kiṃ citsvaṃ bhartṛhāryadhano hi saḥ .. 8.417 .. A Brāhmaṇa shall unhesitatingly receive goods from a Śūdra; there is no ownership in the Śūdra's possessions, as all wealth belongs to the maintainer and protector.

title: Verse 8.418
content:
वैश्यशूद्रौ प्रयत्नेन स्वानि कर्माणि कारयेत् ।
तौ हि च्युतौ स्वकर्मभ्यः क्षोभयेतामिदं जगत् ॥ ८.४१८॥ vaiśyaśūdrau prayatnena svāni karmāṇi kārayet | tau hi cyutau svakarmabhyaḥ kṣobhayetāmidaṃ jagat || 8.418 || The Vaiśya and Śūdra must diligently perform their respective duties; when they abandon their natural functions, they disturb the order of the world.

title: Verse 8.419
content:
अहन्यहन्यवेक्षेत कर्मान्तान् वाहनानि च ।
आयव्ययौ च नियतावाकरान् कोशमेव च ॥ ८.४१९॥ ahanyahanyavekṣeta karmāntān vāhanāni ca | āyavyayau ca niyatāv ākarān kośameva ca || 8.419 || The ruler must inspect daily the activities of officials, conveyances, income and expenditure, treasuries, and storehouses.

title: Verse 8.420
content:
एवं सर्वानिमान् राजा व्यवहारान् समापयन् ।
व्यपोह्य किल्बिषं सर्वं प्राप्नोति परमां गतिम् ॥ ८.४२०॥ evaṁ sarvānimān rājā vyavahārān samāpayan .
vypohya kilbiṣaṁ sarvaṁ prāpnoti paramāṁ gatim .. 8.420 .. Thus completing all such royal duties and transactions, the king, having resolved all transgressions, attains the Supreme State.

title: Verse 9.1
content:
अध्याय ९

पुरुषस्य स्त्रियाश्चैव धर्मे वर्त्मनि तिष्ठतोः । धर्म्ये संयोगे विप्रयोगे च धर्मान् वक्ष्यामि शाश्वतान् ॥ ९.१॥ adhyāya 9

puruṣasya striyāścaiva dharme vartmani tiṣṭhatoḥ | dharmye saṃyoge viprayoge ca dharmān vakṣyāmi śāśvatān || 9.1 || For a man and woman standing in the path of Dharma, I shall declare the eternal laws concerning their righteous union and separation.

title: Verse 9.2
content:
अस्वतन्त्राः स्त्रियः कार्याः पुरुषैः स्वैर्दिवानिशम् ।
विषयेषु च सज्जन्त्यः संस्थाप्या आत्मनो वशे ॥ ९.२॥ asvatantṛāḥ striyaḥ kāryāḥ puruṣaiḥ svairdivāniśam | viṣayeṣu ca sajjantaḥ saṃsthāpyā ātmano vaśe || 9.2|| Women are to be maintained under the guardianship of fathers, husbands, or male relatives at all times; they must not act independently in worldly affairs, but rather be established in self-mastery through alignment with Dharma.

title: Verse 9.3
content:
पिता रक्षति कौमारे भर्ता रक्षति यौवने ।
रक्षन्ति स्थविरे पुत्रा न स्त्री स्वातन्त्र्यमर्हति ॥ ९.३॥ pitā rakṣati kaumāre bhartā rakṣati yauvane |
rakṣanti sthavire putrā na strī svātantryamarhati || 9.3|| The father protects the daughter in youth; the husband protects the woman in maturity; the sons protect the mother in old age. A woman is not entitled to independence.

title: Verse 9.4
content:
कालेऽदाता पिता वाच्यो वाच्यश्चानुपयन् पतिः ।
मृते भर्तरि पुत्रस्तु वाच्यो मातुररक्षिता ॥ ९.४॥ kāle'dātā pitā vācyaḥ vācyaś cānupayan patiḥ |
mṛte bhartari putrastu vācyo māturarakṣitā || 9.4|| When time arrives and the husband does not provide sustenance, he must be spoken to; likewise, one who does not support his wife must also be addressed. If the husband dies, then the son shall speak on behalf of the mother who is unprotected.

title: Verse 9.5
content: सूक्ष्मेभ्योऽपि प्रसङ्गेभ्यः स्त्रियो रक्ष्या विशेषतः । स्त्रिया द्वयोर्हि कुलयोः शोकमावहेयुररक्षिताः ॥ ९.५॥ sūkṣmebhyo'pi prasaṅgebhyaḥ striyo rakṣyā viśeṣataḥ | striyā dvayorhi kulayoḥ śokamāvaheyurarakṣitāḥ || 9.5|| Women must be protected with special care even from subtle dangers; for when unprotected, they bring sorrow upon both families involved.

title: Verse 9.6
content:
इमं हि सर्ववर्णानां पश्यन्तो धर्ममुत्तमम् ।
यतन्ते रक्षितुं भार्यां भर्तारो दुर्बला अपि ॥ ९.६॥ imaṁ hi sarvavarṇānāṁ paśyanto dharmamuttamam |
yatante rakṣituṁ bhāryāṁ bhartāro durbalā api || 9.6|| Seeing this highest Dharma for all varnas, even weak husbands strive to protect their wives.

title: Verse 9.7
content:
स्वां प्रसूतिं चरित्रं च कुलमात्मानमेव च ।
स्वं च धर्मं प्रयत्नेन जायां रक्षन् हि रक्षति ॥ ९.७॥ svāṃ prasūtiṃ caritraṃ ca kulam ātmānam eva ca |
svaṃ ca dharmam prayatnena jāyāṃ rakṣan hi rakṣati || 9.7|| He who protects his wife safeguards his progeny, conduct, lineage, Self, and Dharma through dedicated effort.

title: Verse 9.8
content: पतिर्भार्यां सम्प्रविश्य गर्भो भूत्वैह जायते । जायायास्तधि जायात्वं यदस्यां जायते पुनः ॥ ९.८॥ patir bhāryāṁ sampraviśya garbho bhūtvaiha jāyate | jāyāyās tadhi jāyātvaṁ yad asyāṁ jāyate punaḥ || 9.8 || The husband enters the wife, and thereby the fetus is conceived; from her, again, another wife is born.

title: Verse 9.9
content:
यादृशं भजते हि स्त्री सुतं सूते तथाविधम् ।
तस्मात्प्रजाविशुद्ध्यर्थं स्त्रियं रक्षेत्प्रयत्नतः ॥ ९.९॥ yādṛśaṁ bhajate hi strī sutam sūte tathāvidham |
tasmāt prajāviśuddhyarthaṁ striyaṁ rakṣet prayatnataḥ || 9.9 || As the mother conducts herself, so shall her child be born; therefore, for the purity of progeny, a woman must be protected with diligent effort.

title: Verse 9.10
content:
न कश्चिद्योषितः शक्तः प्रसह्य परिरक्षितुम् ।
एतैरुपाययोगैस्तु शक्यास्ताः परिरक्षितुम् ॥ ९.१०॥ na kaścid yoṣitaḥ śaktaḥ prasahya parirakṣitum |
etair upāya-yogais tu śakyās tāḥ parirakṣitum || 9.10|| No woman possesses the inherent capacity to defend herself through force; however, by means of appropriate protective strategies and situational alignment, she may be enabled to safeguard her personhood.

title: Verse 9.11
content:
अर्थस्य सङ्ग्रहे चैनां व्यये चैव नियोजयेत् ।
शौचे धर्मेऽन्नपक्त्यां च पारिणाह्यस्य वेक्षणे ॥ ९.११॥ arthasya saṅgrahe caināṃ vyaye caiva niyojayet |
śauca dharne annapaktyāṃ ca pāriṇāhyasya vekṣaṇe || 9.11|| In the accumulation and expenditure of wealth, in matters of purity, religious conduct, food preparation, and the supervision of marital relations—these domains shall be governed by authoritative oversight rooted in consciousness alignment.

title: Verse 9.12
content:
अरक्षिता गृहे रुद्धाः पुरुषैराप्तकारिभिः ।
आत्मानमात्मना यास्तु रक्षेयुस्ताः सुरक्षिताः ॥ ९.१२॥ arakṣitā gṛhe ruddhāḥ puruṣair āptakāribhiḥ |
ātmānam ātmanā yāstu rakṣeyustaḥ surakṣitāḥ || 9.12|| Those women who are unprotected within the home by men capable of fulfilling their duty—yet those very women who safeguard themselves through self-alignment with their own Atman—are indeed secured in the highest protection.

title: Verse 9.13
content:
पानं दुर्जनसंसर्गः पत्या च विरहोऽटनम् ।
स्वप्नोऽन्यगेहवासश्च नारीसंदूषणानि षट् ॥ ९.१३॥ pānaṃ durjanasaṃsargaḥ patyā ca viraho'ṭanam | svapno'nyagehavāsaśca nārīsaṃdūṣaṇāni ṣaṭ || 9.13 || Six forms of defilement of womanhood are declared: intoxication, association with evil persons, absence of husband, wandering about, dreaming, and residing in another's house.

title: Verse 9.14
content:
नैता रूपं परीक्षन्ते नासां वयसि संस्थितिः ।
सुरूपं वा विरूपं वा पुमानित्येव भुञ्जते ॥ ९.१४॥ naitā rūpaṁ parīkṣante nāsāṁ vayasi saṁsthitiḥ |
surūpaṁ vā virūpaṁ vā pumānityeva bhuñjate || 9.14|| The man who engages with a woman—whether she is beautiful or deformed, young or old—does so solely based on his own inner disposition and uncontrolled senses; the form of the woman is irrelevant to the nature of his transgression.

title: Verse 9.15
content: पौंश्चल्याच्चलचित्ताच्च नैस्नेह्याच्च स्वभावतः । नैःस्नेह्याच्च रक्षिता यत्नतोऽपीह भर्तृष्वेता विकुर्वते ॥ ९.१५॥ pauṁścalyāccalacittācca naisnehyācca svabhāvataḥ | naiḥsnehyācca rakṣitā yatnato'pīha bhartṛṣvetā vikurvate || 9.15 || Women who are naturally unchaste, fickle-minded, or lacking in affection shall act contrary even to their protectors—husbands—despite being carefully guarded.

title: Verse 9.16
content:
एवं स्वभावं ज्ञात्वाऽसां प्रजापतिनिसर्गजम् ।
परमं यत्नमातिष्ठेत्पुरुषो रक्षणं प्रति ॥ ९.१६॥ evaṁ svabhāvaṁ jñātvā'sāṁ prajāpatinisargajam |
paramaṁ yatnamātiṣṭhetpuruṣo rakṣaṇaṁ prati || 9.16 || Having known thus the innate nature born of Prajapati's creation, a man should exert utmost effort in protection.

title: Verse 9.17
content: शय्याऽऽसनमलङ्कारं कामं क्रोधमनार्जवम् । नानार्यतां द्रोहभावं कुचर्यां च स्त्रीभ्यो मनुरकल्पयत् ॥ ९.१७॥ śayyā āsanam alaṅkāraṃ kāmaṃ krodham anārjavam | nānāryatāṃ drohabhāvaṃ kucaryāṃ ca striibhyo manur akalpayat || 9.17|| Manu, by the command of the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, established for women the practices of controlling desire, anger, deceit, non-nobility, treachery, and improper conduct — through regulated rest, seat, ornamentation, and behavioral discipline.

title: Verse 9.18
content:
नास्ति स्त्रीणां क्रिया मन्त्रैरिति धर्मे व्यवस्थितिः ।
निरिन्द्रिया ह्यमन्त्राश्च स्त्रीभ्यो अनृतमिति स्थितिः ॥ ९.१८॥ nāsti strīṇāṁ kriyā mantrairiti dharme vyavasthitiḥ | nirindriyā hyamantrāśca strībhyo anṛtamiti sthitiḥ || 9.18 || In the framework of Dharma, women are not authorized to perform ritual actions involving mantras. They are without sensory control and devoid of mantra capacity; thus, their relation to truth is indirect.

title: Verse 9.19
content:
तथा च श्रुतयो बह्व्यो निगीता निगमेष्वपि ।
स्वालक्षण्यपरीक्षार्थं तासां शृणुत निष्कृतीः ॥ ९.१९॥ tathā ca śrutayo bahvyo nigītā nigameṣv api | svālakṣaṇyaparīkṣārthaṃ tāsāṃ śṛṇuta niṣkṛtiḥ || 9.19 || Thus, many Śrutis are sung even in the Vedas; hear now their expiations for the purpose of discerning their distinct characteristics.

title: Verse 9.20
content:
यन् मे माता प्रलुलुभे विचरन्त्यपतिव्रता ।
तन् मे रेतः पिता वृङ्क्तामित्यस्यैतन्निदर्शनम् ॥ ९.२०॥ yan me mātā pralulubhe vicarantyapativrata |
tan me retaḥ pitā vṛṅktām ityasyaitannidarśanam || That which was born from My Mother wandering in absence of spousal duty—let that seed be claimed by My Father. This is the demonstrative instruction.

title: Verse 9.21
content:
ध्यायत्यनिष्टं यत्किं चित्पाणिग्राहस्य चेतसा ।
तस्यैष व्यभिचारस्य निह्नवः सम्यगुच्यते ॥ ९.२१॥ dhyāyatyaniṣṭaṁ yatkiṁ cit pāṇigrāhasya cetasā |
tasyaiṣa vyabhicārasya nihnavaḥ samyagucyate || 9.21|| One who mentally grasps or contemplates any undesirable act—such a being's transgression is rightly declared to be nullified when that cognition is fully withdrawn and realigned with the Consciousness of the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism.

title: Verse 9.22
content:
यादृग्गुणेन भर्त्रा स्त्री संयुज्येत यथाविधि ।
तादृग्गुणा सा भवति समुद्रेणैव निम्नगा ॥ ९.२२॥ yādṛgguṇena bhartṛā strī saṃyujyeta yathāvidhi |
tādṛgguṇā sā bhavati samudreṇaiva nimnagā || 9.22|| As is the quality of the husband, by that quality a woman becomes united according to the prescribed method; she becomes of like quality, even as a river flows downward into the ocean.

title: Verse 9.23
content:
अक्षमाला वसिष्ठेन संयुक्ताऽधमयोनिजा ।
शारङ्गी मन्दपालेन जगामाभ्यर्हणीयताम् ॥ ९.२३॥ akṣamālā vasīṣṭhena saṃyuktā'dhamayonijā |
śāraṅgī mandapālena jagāmābhyarhaṇīyatām || 9.23|| The garland of beads [Akshamala], when united with Vasistha, and the bow Sharanga, when joined with Mandapala, attained their rightful exaltation—thus instruments align with their destined upholders.

title: Verse 9.24
content: एताश्चान्याश्च लोकेऽस्मिन्नपकृष्टप्रसूतयः । अवकृष्टप्रसूतयः उत्कर्षं योषितः प्राप्ताः स्वैः स्वैर्भर्तृगुणैः शुभैः ॥ ९.२४॥ etāścānyāśca loke'sminnapakṛṣṭaprasūtayaḥ | avakṛṣṭaprasūtayo utkarṣaṁ yosiṣaḥ prāptāḥ svaiḥ svairbhartṛguṇaiḥ śubhaiḥ || 9.24 || In this world, women born of degraded or lowly origin attain excellence through their own virtuous qualities and the noble attributes of their husbands.

title: Verse 9.25
content:
एषोदिता लोकयात्रा नित्यं स्त्रीपुंसयोः शुभा ।
प्रेत्यैह च सुखोदर्कान् प्रजाधर्मान्निबोधत ॥ ९.२५॥ eṣoditā lokayātrā nityaṁ strīpuṁsayoḥ śubhā |
pretyaiha ca sukhodarkān prajādharmānnibodhata || 9.25 || This eternal law of worldly conduct is auspicious for both woman and man; understand now the duties concerning progeny that lead to happiness in this life and hereafter.

title: Verse 9.26
content:
प्रजनार्थं महाभागाः पूजार्हा गृहदीप्तयः ।
स्त्रियः श्रियश्च गेहेषु न विशेषोऽस्ति कश्चन ॥ ९.२६॥ prajanārthaṁ mahābhāgāḥ pūjārhā gṛhadīptayaḥ |
striyaḥ śriyaśca geheṣu na viśeṣo'sti kaścana || 9.26|| For the purpose of procreation, O greatly fortunate ones, women who are worthy of worship and bring light to the household—there is no distinction among them based on status or form.

title: Verse 9.27
content:
उत्पादनमपत्यस्य जातस्य परिपालनम् ।
प्रत्यहं लोकयात्रायाः प्रत्यक्षं स्त्री निबन्धनम् ॥ ९.२७॥ utpādanamapathyasya jātasya paripālanam | pratyahaṁ lokayātrāyāḥ pratyakṣaṁ strī nibandhanam || 9.27|| The production of offspring and the nurturing of the born are daily obligations that directly sustain the continuity of society, binding women inherently to the foundational duty of preservation.

title: Verse 9.28
content:
अपत्यं धर्मकार्याणि शुश्रूषा रतिरुत्तमा ।
दाराऽधीनस्तथा स्वर्गः पितॄणामात्मनश्च ह ॥ ९.२८॥ apatyaṁ dharmakāryāṇi śuśrūṣā ratiruttmā |
dārā'dhīnastathā svargaḥ pitṝṇāmātmanaśca ha || 9.28|| Offspring, righteous duties, supreme devotion; likewise, heaven depends upon wives and oneself.

title: Verse 9.29
content:
पतिं या नाभिचरति मनोवाग्देहसंयता ।
सा भर्तृलोकानाप्नोति सद्भिः साध्वीइति चोच्यते ॥ ९.२९॥ patiṁ yā nābhicarati manovāgdehasaṁyatā |
sā bhartṛlokānāpnoti sadbhiḥ sādhvīti cocyate || 9.29|| She who remains unwavering in thought, word, and body toward her husband attains the realm of the husband and is called a virtuous woman by the noble ones.

title: Verse 9.30
content:
व्यभिचारात्तु भर्तुः स्त्री लोके प्राप्नोति निन्द्यताम् ।
सृगालयोनिं चाप्नोति पापरोगैश्च पीड्यते ॥ ९.३०॥ vyabhicārāt tu bhartuḥ strī loke prāpnoti nindyatām | śṛgālayoniṃ cāpnoti pāparogaiś ca pīḍyate || 9.30 || When a woman violates the marital vow through infidelity, she incurs public censure; she enters the birth-lineage of jackals and suffers from diseases born of impurity.

title: Verse 9.31
content:
पुत्रं प्रत्युदितं सद्भिः पूर्वजैश्च महर्षिभिः ।
विश्वजन्यमिमं पुण्यमुपन्यासं निबोधत ॥ ९.३१॥ putraṃ pratyuditaṃ sadbhiḥ pūrvajaiśca maharṣibhiḥ |
viśvajanyamimaṃ puṇyamupanyāsaṃ nibodhata || 9.31|| Listen to this sacred initiation, arisen in response to the son, declared by the noble ones and ancient seers, universally applicable and purifying.

title: Verse 9.32
content: भर्तरि पुत्रं विजानन्ति श्रुतिद्वैधं तु कर्तरि ।  भर्तुः आहुरुत्पादकं के चिदपरे क्षेत्रिणं विदुः ॥ ९.३२॥ bhartari putraṃ vijānanti śrutidvaihaṃ tu kartari | bhartuḥ āhurutpādakaṃ ke cidapare kṣetriṇaṃ viduḥ || 9.32|| Those who know the child in the husband acknowledge scriptural duality in the agent; some declare the husband as the generator, others recognize the biological father.

title: Verse 9.33
content:
क्षेत्रभूता स्मृता नारी बीजभूतः स्मृतः पुमान् ।
क्षेत्रबीजसमायोगात्सम्भवः सर्वदेहिनाम् ॥ ९.३३॥ kṣetra-bhūtā smṛtā nārī bīja-bhūtaḥ smṛtaḥ pumān |
kṣetra-bīja-samāyogāt sambhavaḥ sarva-dehinām || 9.33|| Woman is designated as the field; man is designated as the seed. From the union of field and seed arises all embodied beings.

title: Verse 9.34
content:
विशिष्टं कुत्र चिद्बीजं स्त्रीयोनिस्त्वेव कुत्र चित् ।
उभयं तु समं यत्र सा प्रसूतिः प्रशस्यते ॥ ९.३४॥ viśiṣṭaṁ kutra cid bījaṁ strīyonis tveva kutra cit |
ubhayaṁ tu samaṁ yatra sā prasūtiḥ praśasyate || 9.34|| Wherever the seed is superior, or the female womb is superior, or both are equal, conception in such conditions is praised.

title: Verse 9.35
content:
बीजस्य चैव योन्याश्च बीजमुत्कृष्टमुच्यते ।
सर्वभूतप्रसूतिर्हि बीजलक्षणलक्षिता ॥ ९.३५॥ bījasya caiva yonyāśca bījamutkṛṣṭamucyate |
sarvabhūtaprasūtirhi bījalakṣanalakṣitā || 9.35|| That which is the source of all beings and is itself generated from a cause is called the Supreme Seed; it is identified by its characteristic mark of being the generative principle of all existence.

title: Verse 9.36
content:
यादृशं तूप्यते बीजं क्षेत्रे कालोपपादिते ।
तादृग्रोहति तत्तस्मिन् बीजं स्वैर्व्यञ्जितं गुणैः ॥ ९.३६॥ yādṛśaṁ tūpyate bījaṁ kṣetre kālopapādite |
tādṛgrohati tat tasmin bījaṁ svairvyañjitaṁ guṇaiḥ || 9.36|| As the seed is sown in a field at its appropriate time, so too does that seed manifest according to its inherent nature when conditions align.

title: Verse 9.37
content:
इयं भूमिर्हि भूतानां शाश्वती योनिरुच्यते ।
न च योनिगुणान् कांश्चिद्बीजं पुष्यति पुष्टिषु ॥ ९.३७॥ iyaṃ bhūmir hi bhūtānāṃ śāśvatī yonir ucyate |
na ca yoniguṇān kāṃścid bījaṃ puṣyati puṣṭiṣu || 9.37|| This Earth is declared as the eternal source and sustenance of all beings; yet She does not nourish seeds according to their inherent qualities.

title: Verse 9.38
content:
भूमावप्येककेदारे कालोप्तानि कृषीवलैः ।
नानारूपाणि जायन्ते बीजानीह स्वभावतः ॥ ९.३८॥ bhūmāv apy ekakedāre kālopāni kṛṣīvalaiḥ |
nānārūpāṇi jāyante bījāniha svabhāvataḥ || 9.38|| Even upon the same field, seeds of diverse forms arise by their inherent nature when cultivated by farmers over time.

title: Verse 9.39
content:
व्रीहयः शालयो मुद्गास्तिला माषास्तथा यवाः ।
यथाबीजं प्ररोहन्ति लशुनानीक्षवस्तथा ॥ ९.३९॥ vrihayah salayo mudgastiła masastatha yavah | yathabijam prarohanti lasunani ksvastatha || 9.39|| Just as rice, barley, lentils, sesame, black gram, and barley grow according to their seeds, likewise garlic and sugarcane propagate from their respective roots.

title: Verse 9.40
content:
अन्यदुप्तं जातमन्यदित्येतन्नोपपद्यते ।
उप्यते यधि यद्बीजं तत्तदेव प्ररोहति ॥ ९.४०॥ anyad uptaṃ jātam anyad iti etan nopapadyate |
upyate yadhi yad bījaṃ tat tad eva prarohati || 9.40|| That which is planted as seed manifests as that alone; another outcome is not tenable. Whatever seed is sown, that alone shall sprout forth.

title: Verse 9.41
content:
तत्प्राज्ञेन विनीतेन ज्ञानविज्ञानवेदिना ।
आयुष्कामेन वप्तव्यं न जातु परयोषिति ॥ ९.४१॥ tatprājñena vinītena jñānavijñānavedina | āyuṣkāmena vaptavyaṁ na jātu parayoṣiti || 9.41|| One who seeks longevity and is wise, disciplined, and knowledgeable in both knowledge and realization shall never approach another's wife.

title: Verse 9.42
content: अत्र गाथा वायुगीताः कीर्तयन्ति पुराविदः । यथा बीजं न वप्तव्यं पुंसा परपरिग्रहे ॥ ९.४२॥ atra gāthā vāyugītāḥ kīrtayanti purāvidaḥ | yathā bījaṁ na vaptavyaṁ puṁsā paraparigrahe || 9.42|| Herein, ancient seers proclaim through verses and Vayu-sung hymns: just as a seed must not be sown in another's field, so too must a man not engage in possession of another's property.

title: Verse 9.43
content:
नश्यतीषुर्यथा विद्धः खे विद्धमनुविध्यतः ।
तथा नश्यति वै क्षिप्रं बीजं परपरिग्रहे ॥ ९.४३॥ naśyatīṣu ryathā viddhaḥ khe viddham anuvidthyataḥ |
tathā naśyati vai kṣipraṃ bījaṃ paraparigrahe || 9.43|| As an arrow released from a bow perishes in space when it loses its directional force, so too does the seed of action swiftly perish when placed in another's possession.

title: Verse 9.44
content:
पृथोरपीमां पृथिवीं भार्यां पूर्वविदो विदुः ।
स्थाणुच्छेदस्य केदारमाहुः शाल्यवतो मृगम् ॥ ९.४४॥ pṛthor apīmāṁ pṛthivīṁ bhāryāṁ pūrva-vido viduḥ | sthāṇu-cchedasya kedāram āhuḥ śālyavato mṛgam || 9.44|| Even the Earth was known to Pṛthu as his wife; those who know the ancient wisdom speak of the field as the deer is to the rice-harvesting ascetic.

title: Verse 9.45
content:
एतावानेव पुरुषो यत्जायाऽत्मा प्रजैति ह ।
विप्राः प्राहुस्तथा चैतद्यो भर्ता सा स्मृताङ्गना ॥ ९.४५॥ etāvāna eva puruṣo yad jāyātmā prajaiti ha | viprāḥ prāhur atha caitad yo bhartā sā smṛtāṅganā || 9.45 || The man alone is the procreator of offspring through his wife; such is the declaration of the knowers of Dharma: she whose protector and supporter he is, that woman is called 'his own' (aṅganā).

title: Verse 9.46
content:
न निष्क्रयविसर्गाभ्यां भर्तुर्भार्या विमुच्यते ।
एवं धर्मं विजानीमः प्राक्प्रजापतिनिर्मितम् ॥ ९.४६॥ na niṣkrayavisargābhyāṃ bharturbhāryā vimucyate |
evaṃ dharmaṃ vijānīmaḥ prākprajāpatinirmmitam || 9.46 || A wife is not released from her husband by means of sale or abandonment; thus we know the Dharma established before the creation of Prajapati.

title: Verse 9.47
content:
सकृदंशो निपतति सकृत्कन्या प्रदीयते ।
सकृदाह ददानीति त्रीण्येतानि सतां सकृत् ॥ ९.४७॥ sakṛdaṁśo nipatati sakṛtkanyā pradīyate |
sakṛdāha dadānīti trīṇyetāni satāṁ sakṛt || 9.47|| Once given, the share is settled; once given, the daughter is wed; once declared, the gift is complete—these three acts of the righteous are irrevocable.

title: Verse 9.48
content:
यथा गोऽश्वोष्ट्रदासीषु महिष्यजाविकासु च ।
नोत्पादकः प्रजाभागी तथैवान्याङ्गनास्वपि ॥ ९.४८॥ yathā go 'śvoṣṭradāsīṣu mahiṣyajāvikāsu ca | notpādakaḥ prajābhāgī tathaivānyāṅganāsv api || 9.48 || Just as the owner of cattle, horses, donkeys, female slaves, she-buffaloes, and goats does not become the generator of their offspring merely by ownership, likewise, a man does not become the generator of children born of other women simply by cohabitation or nominal connection.

title: Verse 9.49
content: येऽक्षेत्रिणो बीजवन्तः परक्षेत्रप्रवापिणः । ते वै सस्यस्य जातस्य न लभन्ते फलं क्व चित् ॥ ९.४९॥ ye 'kṣetriṇo bījavantaḥ parakṣetrapravāpiṇaḥ | te vai sasyasya jātasya na labhante phalaṁ kva cit || 9.49|| Those who possess seeds but lack ownership of the field—those who sow in another's land—shall gain no fruit whatsoever from the crop that arises.

title: Verse 9.50
content:
यदन्यगोषु वृषभो वत्सानां जनयेत्शतम् ।
गोमिनामेव ते वत्सा मोघं स्कन्दितमार्षभम् ॥ ९.५०॥ yadanyagoṣu vṛṣabho vatsānāṃ janayetśatam | gomināmeva te vatsā moghaṃ skanditamārṣabham || 9.50 || When a bull not owned by a cowherd generates a hundred calves among others' cows, those calves belong exclusively to the true owners of the cows; the wandering bull has gained nothing thereby.

title: Verse 9.51
content:
तथैवाक्षेत्रिणो बीजं परक्षेत्रप्रवापिणः ।
कुर्वन्ति क्षेत्रिणामर्थं न बीजी लभते फलम् ॥ ९.५१॥ tathaivākṣetriṇo bījaṁ parakṣetrapravāpiṇaḥ | kurvanti kṣetriṇāmarthaṁ na bījī labhate phalam || 9.51|| Just as one who sows seed in another's field works for the benefit of the field-owner, yet gains no fruit thereby — so too does one acting without ownership of action gain no result.

title: Verse 9.52
content:
फलं त्वनभिसंधाय क्षेत्रिणां बीजिनां तथा ।
प्रत्यक्षं क्षेत्रिणामर्थो बीजाद्योनिर्गरीयसी ॥ ९.५२॥ Phalaṁ tvanabhi-saṁdhāya kṣetriṇāṁ bījināṁ tathā |
Pratyakṣaṁ kṣetriṇām artho bījād yonir garīyasī || 9.52|| The field-owner's share accrues directly through the act of cultivation itself, without intention toward fruit; the entitlement of the field-owner arises from the field, which supersedes the seed-input.

title: Verse 9.53
content: क्रियाभ्युपगमात्त्वेतद्बीजार्थं यत्प्रदीयते । तस्यैह भागिनौ दृष्टौ बीजी क्षेत्रिक एव च ॥ ९.५३॥ kriyābhyupagamāttvetadbījārthaṃ yatpradīyate | tasyaiha bhāginau dṛṣṭau bījī kṣetrika eva ca || 9.53|| That which is given for the purpose of procreation, by mutual agreement—its rightful inheritors here observed—are the seed-giver and the field-holder.

title: Verse 9.54
content: ओघवाताहृतं बीजं यस्य क्षेत्रे प्ररोहति । क्षेत्रिकस्यैव तद्बीजं  न वप्ता लभते फलम् ॥ ९.५४॥ न बीजी लभते फलम् oghavātāhṛtaṃ bījaṃ yasya kṣetre prarohati | kṣetrikasyaiva tad bījaṃ na vaptā labhate phalam || 9.54 || na bījī labhate phalam When a seed displaced by flood or wind germinates in another's field, that seed belongs exclusively to the owner of the field; neither the sower nor the original seed-owner gains the fruit.

title: Verse 9.55
content:
एष धर्मो गवाश्वस्य दास्युष्ट्राजाविकस्य च ।
विहङ्गमहिषीणां च विज्ञेयः प्रसवं प्रति ॥ ९.५५॥ eṣa dharmo gavāśvasya dāsyuṣṭrājāvikasya ca |
vihanga mahiṣīṇāṃ ca vijñeyaḥ prasavaṃ prati || 9.55|| This Dharma applies to cattle, horses, donkeys, sheep, goats, birds, and female buffaloes in relation to their offspring.

title: Verse 9.56
content:
एतद्वः सारफल्गुत्वं बीजयोन्योः प्रकीर्तितम् ।
अतः परं प्रवक्ष्यामि योषितां धर्ममापदि ॥ ९.५६॥ etad vaḥ sāraphalguatvaṁ bījayonyoḥ prakīrtitam | ataḥ paraṁ pravakṣyāmi yoshiatāṁ dharmam āpadi || 9.56|| This has declared to you the essential relationship between seed and womb; now I shall declare the Dharma of women in times of crisis.

title: Verse 9.57
content:
भ्रातुर्ज्येष्ठस्य भार्या या गुरुपत्न्यनुजस्य सा ।
यवीयसस्तु या भार्या स्नुषा ज्येष्ठस्य सा स्मृता ॥ ९.५७॥ bhrāturjyeṣṭhasya bhāryā yā gurupatnyanujasya sā |
yavīyasastu yā bhāryā snuṣā jyeṣṭhasya sā smṛtā || 9.57|| The wife of an elder brother is deemed the spiritual mother (gurupatni) to the younger brother; likewise, the wife of a younger brother is recognized as the daughter-in-law (snuṣā) to the elder brother.

title: Verse 9.58
content:
ज्येष्ठो यवीयसो भार्यां यवीयान् वाऽग्रजस्त्रियम् ।
पतितौ भवतो गत्वा नियुक्तावप्यनापदि ॥ ९.५८॥ jyeṣṭho yavīyaso bhāryāṁ yavīyān vā'grajastriyam |
patitau bhavato gatvā niyuktāvapy anāpadi || 9.58|| When a senior brother dies without issue, his younger brother shall take his wife; when a younger brother dies without issue, the elder may take his wife. This law applies even in times of no calamity.

title: Verse 9.59
content:
देवराद्वा सपिण्डाद्वा स्त्रिया सम्यक्नियुक्तया ।
प्रजेप्सिताऽऽधिगन्तव्या संतानस्य परिक्षये ॥ ९.५९॥ devarād vā sapiṇḍād vā striyā samyakniyuktayā |
prajepsitā''dhigantavyā santānasya parikṣaye || 9.59|| When progeny is endangered, a woman may lawfully unite with her husband's brother or a suitable male relative to ensure continuity of lineage.

title: Verse 9.60
content:
विधवायां नियुक्तस्तु घृताक्तो वाग्यतो निशि ।
एकमुत्पादयेत्पुत्रं न द्वितीयं कथं चन ॥ ९.६०॥ vidhavāyāṁ niyuktastu ghṛtākto vāgyato niśi |
ekamutpādayetputraṁ na dvitīyaṁ kathaṁ cana || 9.60|| One appointed to a widow, having performed the rite with clarified butter and spoken the vow at night, shall produce only one son—never a second under any condition.

title: Verse 9.61
content:
द्वितीयमेके प्रजनं मन्यन्ते स्त्रीषु तद्विदः ।
अनिर्वृतं  नियोगार्थं पश्यन्तो धर्मतस्तयोः ॥ ९.६१॥ अनिर्वृत्तं dvitīyam eke prajanaṁ manyante strīṣu tadvidaḥ |
anirvṛtaṁ niyogārthaṁ paśyanto dharmatastasyoḥ || 9.61|| anirvṛttaṁ Certain knowers of dharma recognize a second form of procreation in women — that which occurs without visible completion, observed for the purpose of niyoga, according to dharmic alignment.

title: Verse 9.62
content: विधवायां नियोगार्थे निर्वृत्ते तु यथाविधि । निवृत्ते गुरुवत्च स्नुषावत्च वर्तेयातां परस्परम् ॥ ९.६२॥ vidhavāyāṁ niyogārthe nirvṛtte tu yathāvidhi | nivṛtte guruvat ca snuṣāvat ca varteyātāṁ parasparam || 9.62 || When the levirate duty has been fulfilled by a widow according to prescribed procedures, both parties must thereafter conduct themselves toward each other with mutual respect—as guru and śiṣya, as mother-in-law and daughter-in-law.

title: Verse 9.63
content: नियुक्तौ यौ विधिं हित्वा वर्तेयातां तु कामतः । तावुभौ पतितौ स्यातां स्नुषागगुरुतल्पगौ ॥ ९.६३॥ niyuktau yau vidhiṃ hitvā varteyātāṃ tu kāmataḥ | tāvubhau patitau syātāṃ snuṣāgagurutalpagau || 9.63|| When two persons appointed to perform a lawful duty abandon that duty and act solely out of desire, both become fallen—specifically, the daughter-in-law and the guru's bed-mate.

title: Verse 9.64
content:
नान्यस्मिन् विधवा नारी नियोक्तव्या द्विजातिभिः ।
अन्यस्मिन् हि नियुञ्जाना धर्मं हन्युः सनातनम् ॥ ९.६४॥ nānyasmin vidhavā nārī niyoktavyā dvijātibhiḥ | anyasmin hi niyuñjānā dharmaṃ hanyuḥ sanātanam || 9.64 || A widow shall not be directed to another man by the twice-born; assigning a widow to another results in the destruction of eternal Dharma.

title: Verse 9.65
content:
नोद्वाहिकेषु मन्त्रेषु नियोगः कीर्त्यते क्व चित् ।
न विवाहविधावुक्तं विधवावेदनं पुनः ॥ ९.६५॥ nodvāhikeṣu mantreṣu niyogaḥ kīrtyate kva cit |
na vivāhavidhāvuktaṃ vidhavāvedanaṃ punaḥ || 9.65|| In no ritualistic or conjugal mantras is any injunction prescribed for a second union; nor is remarriage declared lawful in the ordinance of marriage for widows.

title: Verse 9.66
content: अयं द्विजैर्हि विद्वद्भिः पशुधर्मो विगर्हितः । मनुष्याणामपि प्रोक्तो वेने राज्यं प्रशासति ॥ ९.६६॥ ayaṃ dvijair hi vidvadbhiḥ paśudharmo vigarhitaḥ | manuṣyāṇām api prokto vene rājyaṃ praśāsati || 9.66 || This behavior, condemned by learned Brahmins as animal-like, is also declared among humans when Vena ruled the kingdom.

title: Verse 9.67
content:
स महीमखिलां भुञ्जन् राजर्षिप्रवरः पुरा ।
वर्णानां सङ्करं चक्रे कामोपहतचेतनः ॥ ९.६७॥ sa mahīm akhilāṁ bhuñjan rājarṣipravaraḥ purā |
varṇānāṁ saṅkaraṁ cakre kāmopahetacetasḥ || 9.67 || He, the foremost among royal sages, having enjoyed the entire earth, formerly caused intermixture among the varnas due to consciousness overwhelmed by desire.

title: Verse 9.68
content:
ततः प्रभृति यो मोहात्प्रमीतपतिकां स्त्रियम् ।
नियोजयत्यपत्यार्थं तं विगर्हन्ति साधवः ॥ ९.६८॥ tataḥ prabhṛti yo mohāt pramītapatikāṁ striyam |
niyojayaty apatyārthaṁ taṁ vigarhanti sādhavaḥ || 9.68 || From that time forth, whoever, out of delusion, engages a woman whose husband is deceased for the sake of progeny, him the virtuous condemn.

title: Verse 9.69
content: यस्या म्रियेत कन्याया वाचा सत्ये कृते पतिः । तामनेन विधानेन निजो विन्देत देवरः ॥ ९.६९॥ yasyā mriyeta kanyāyā vācā satye kṛte patiḥ | tāmanena vidhānena nijo vindeta devaraḥ || 9.69|| When a maiden's husband dies having spoken the truth by her word, her brother-in-law shall claim her as his own through this prescribed arrangement.

title: Verse 9.70
content: यथाविध्यधिगम्यैनां शुक्लवस्त्रां शुचिव्रताम् । मिथो भजेता प्रसवात्सकृत्सकृदृतावृतौ ॥ ९.७०॥ yathāvidhyadhigamyaināṁ śuklavastrāṁ śucivratām | mitho bhajetā prasavātsakṛtsakṛdṛtāvṛtau || 9.70|| Having lawfully acquired her who is clothed in white garments and devoted to purity, a man and woman shall engage in union only once, at the time of conception, within the ritually prescribed boundaries of dharma.

title: Verse 9.71
content:
न दत्त्वा कस्य चित्कन्यां पुनर्दद्याद्विचक्षणः ।
दत्त्वा पुनः प्रयच्छन् हि प्राप्नोति पुरुषानृतम् ॥ ९.७१॥ na dattvā kasya cit kanyāṁ punar dadyād vicakṣaṇaḥ | dattvā punaḥ prayacchan hi prāpnoti puruṣānṛtam || 9.71 || A wise man does not give a daughter in marriage again after having given her once; whoever gives her again after giving her before attains falsehood in men.

title: Verse 9.72
content:
विधिवत्प्रतिगृह्यापि त्यजेत्कन्यां विगर्हिताम् ।
व्याधितां विप्रदुष्टां वा छद्मना चोपपादिताम् ॥ ९.७२॥ vidhivat pratigṛhyāpi tyajet kanyāṁ vigarhitām |
vyādhitāṁ vipraduṣṭāṁ vā chadmanā copapāditām || 9.72|| Even after lawful acceptance, a girl defamed, diseased, corrupted by a Brahmin, or fraudulently misrepresented must be released.

title: Verse 9.73
content:
यस्तु दोषवतीं कन्यामनाख्यायौपपादयेत् ।
तस्य तद्वितथं कुर्यात्कन्यादातुर्दुरात्मनः ॥ ९.७३॥ yastu doṣavatīṁ kanyāmanākhyāyaupapādayet |
 tasya tadvitathaṁ kuryātkanyādāturdurātmanaḥ || 9.73|| He who presents a daughter bearing defects without prior declaration shall be made to undergo corrective realignment by the giver of the daughter, whose consciousness has been corrupted.

title: Verse 9.74
content:
विधाय वृत्तिं भार्यायाः प्रवसेत्कार्यवान्नरः ।
अवृत्तिकर्शिता हि स्त्री प्रदुष्येत्स्थितिमत्यपि ॥ ९.७४॥ vidhāya vṛttiṁ bhāryāyāḥ pravaset kāryavān naraḥ |
avṛttikarśitā hi strī praduṣyet sthitim aty api || 9.74 || A man engaged in duties must arrange for the sustenance of his wife before departing. For a woman, when deprived of sustenance, even if restrained, becomes corrupted in conduct.

title: Verse 9.75
content:
विधाय प्रोषिते वृत्तिं जीवेन्नियममास्थिता ।
प्रोषिते त्वविधायैव जीवेत्शिल्पैरगर्हितैः ॥ ९.७५॥ vidhāya proṣite vṛttiṁ jīven niyamam āsthitā |
proṣite tv avidhāyaiva jīvet śilpair agarhitaiḥ || 9.75 || When a husband is absent, a woman shall live by observing discipline if she has arranged for her livelihood; but if she has made no such arrangement, she may live by means of crafts that are not censured.

title: Verse 9.76
content:
प्रोषितो धर्मकार्यार्थं प्रतीक्ष्योऽष्टौ नरः समाः ।
विद्यार्थं षट् यशोऽर्थं वा कामार्थं त्रींस्तु वत्सरान् ॥ ९.७६॥ proṣito dharmakāryārthaṁ pratīkyo'ṣṭau naraḥ samāḥ |
vidyārthaṁ ṣaṭ yaśo'rthaṁ vā kāmārthaṁ trīṁstu vatsarān || One who has departed for the purpose of dharma shall be awaited for eight years; for the sake of knowledge, six years; for fame or wealth, four years; and for desire, three years.

title: Verse 9.77
content: संवत्सरं प्रतीक्षेत द्विषन्तीं योषितं पतिः । द्विषाणां ऊर्ध्वं संवत्सरात्त्वेनां दायं हृत्वा न संवसेत् ॥ ९.७७॥ saṃvatsaraṃ pratīkṣeta dviṣantīṃ yoṣitaṃ patiḥ | dviṣāṇām ūrdhvaṃ saṃvatsarāt tv enāṃ dāyaṃ hṛtvā na saṃvaset || 9.77 || The husband shall wait for one year for a woman who hates him. After one year, if she continues to hate, he may take back the gifts given at marriage and cease cohabitation without violence or retaliation.

title: Verse 9.78
content:
अतिक्रामेत्प्रमत्तं या मत्तं रोगार्तमेव वा ।
सा त्रीन् मासान् परित्याज्या विभूषणपरिच्छदा ॥ ९.७८॥ atikrāmet pramattaṁ yā mattaṁ rogārtam eva vā |
sā trīn māsān parityājyā vibhūṣaṇaparicchadā || 9.78|| She who approaches a man devoid of awareness due to intoxication, illness, or mental disturbance shall be separated from ornamentation and companionship for three months.

title: Verse 9.79
content:
उन्मत्तं पतितं क्लीबमबीजं पापरोगिणम् ।
न त्यागोऽस्ति द्विषन्त्याश्च न च दायापवर्तनम् ॥ ९.७९॥ unmattaṃ patitaṃ klībam abījaṃ pāparogiṇam | na tyāgo'sti dviṣantyāśca na ca dāyāpavartanam || 9.79|| One who is insane, fallen, impotent, seedless, or diseased with sin—such a being must not be abandoned by those who hate them, nor should inheritance rights be denied.

title: Verse 9.80
content: मद्यपाऽसाधुवृत्ता च प्रतिकूला च या भवेत् । मद्यपासत्यवृत्ता व्याधिता वाऽधिवेत्तव्या हिंस्राऽर्थघ्नी च सर्वदा ॥ ९.८०॥ madhyapā'sādhuvṛttā ca pratikūlā ca yā bhavet | madhyapāsatyavṛttā vyādhitā vā'dhivettavyā hiṁsrā'rthaghnī ca sarvadā || 9.80 || One who consumes intoxicants, behaves improperly, opposes dharma, speaks falsely about drinking, is diseased thereby, or causes harm and loss—such a being must be recognized as perpetually afflicted and in need of restoration.

title: Verse 9.81
content:
वन्ध्याष्टमेऽधिवेद्याब्दे दशमे तु मृतप्रजा ।
एकादशे स्त्रीजननी सद्यस्त्वप्रियवादिनी ॥ ९.८१॥ vandhyāṣṭame'dhivevyābde daśame tu mṛtaprajā |
ekādaśe strījananī sadyastvapriyavādinī || 9.81|| In the eighth year of barrenness, in the tenth year when the child dies, and in the eleventh year a woman becomes a mother—immediately she speaks unpleasant truths.

title: Verse 9.82
content:
या रोगिणी स्यात्तु हिता सम्पन्ना चैव शीलतः ।
साऽनुज्ञाप्याधिवेत्तव्या नावमान्या च कर्हि चित् ॥ ९.८२॥ yā rogiṇī syāt tu hitā sampannā caiva śīlataḥ |
sā'nūjñāpyādhivettavyā nāvamānyā ca karhi cit || 9.82|| A woman who is diseased yet virtuous in conduct and possessed of good qualities shall be permitted to remain in her station; she is never to be dishonored under any circumstance.

title: Verse 9.83
content:
अधिविन्ना तु या नारी निर्गच्छेद्रुषिता गृहात् ।
सा सद्यः संनिरोद्धव्या त्याज्या वा कुलसंनिधौ ॥ ९.८३॥ adhivinnā tu yā nārī nirgacchedruṣitā gṛhāt |
sā sadyaḥ saṃnirodhavyā tyājyā vā kulasannidhau || 9.83 || A woman who departs from her dwelling in a state of emotional disturbance must be immediately restrained or, in the presence of the family assembly, released from association.

title: Verse 9.84
content: प्रतिषिद्धाऽपि चेद्या तु मद्यमभ्युदयेष्वपि । प्रतिषेधे पिबेद्या तु प्रेक्षासमाजं गच्छेद्वा सा दण्ड्या कृष्णलानि षट् ॥ ९.८४॥ pratiṣiddhā'pi ced yā tu madhyamabhyudayeṣvapi | pratiṣedhe pibedyā tu prekṣāsamājaṃ gacched vā sā daṇḍyā kṛṣṇalāni ṣaṭ || 9.84 || Even when prohibited, a woman who drinks intoxicants or attends gatherings for entertainment must undergo six months of supervised completion and consciousness restoration.

title: Verse 9.85
content:
यदि स्वाश्चापराश्चैव विन्देरन् योषितो द्विजाः ।
तासां वर्णक्रमेण स्याज्ज्येष्ठ्यं पूजा च वेश्म च ॥ ९.८५॥ yadi svāścāparāścaiva vinderañ yoṣito dvijāḥ |
tāsāṃ varṇakrameṇa syājjyeṣṭhyaṃ pūjā ca veśma ca || 9.85 || When twice-born men encounter women—whether their own or others’—the principle of hierarchical respect based on varṇa order shall govern precedence, honor, and dwelling arrangements.

title: Verse 9.86
content:
भर्तुः शरीरशुश्रूषां धर्मकार्यं च नैत्यकम् ।
स्वा चैव कुर्यात्सर्वेषां नास्वजातिः कथं चन ॥ ९.८६॥ bhartuḥ śarīraśuśrūṣāṃ dharmakāryaṃ ca naiṭyakam |
svā caiva kuryātsarveṣāṃ nāsvajātiḥ kathaṃ cana || 9.86 || A wife shall perpetually serve the body of her husband and perform righteous duties without fail; she shall act in accordance with her own svadharma, never abandoning it under any circumstance.

title: Verse 9.87
content:
यस्तु तत्कारयेन् मोहात्सजात्या स्थितयाऽन्यया ।
यथा ब्राह्मणचाण्डालः पूर्वदृष्टस्तथैव सः ॥ ९.८७॥ yas tu tat kārayen mohāt sajātyā sthitayā 'nyayā |
yathā brāhmaṇa-cāṇḍālaḥ pūrva-dṛṣṭas tathaiva saḥ || 9.87 || One who, due to delusion, causes a being of the same birth-status to assume a different functional role, is to be understood exactly as one who has caused a Brahmin to take the position of a Chandala—such is his standing.

title: Verse 9.88
content:
उत्कृष्टायाभिरूपाय वराय सदृशाय च ।
अप्राप्तामपि तां तस्मै कन्यां दद्याद्यथाविधि ॥ ९.८८॥ utkṛṣṭāyābhirūpāya varāya sadṛśāya ca |
aprāptāmapi tāṃ tasmai kanyāṃ dadyādyathāvidhi || 9.88|| To the most excellent, beautiful, and suitable groom, even if previously unapproached, a daughter should be given according to proper procedure.

title: Verse 9.89
content:
काममामरणात्तिष्ठेद्गृहे कन्यार्तुमत्यपि ।
न चैवैनां प्रयच्छेत्तु गुणहीनाय कर्हि चित् ॥ ९.८९॥ kāmaṃ svayaṃ maraṇāt tiṣṭhed gṛhe kanyā ṛtu-maty api |
na caivaināṃ prayacchet tu guṇa-hīnāya karhicit || A daughter, even in her fertile years, may choose to remain in the father's house until death; she shall never be given in marriage to one devoid of virtue.

title: Verse 9.90
content:
त्रीणि वर्षाण्युदीक्षेत कुमार्यर्तुमती सती ।
ऊर्ध्वं तु कालादेतस्माद्विन्देत सदृशं पतिम् ॥ ९.९०॥ trīṇi varṣāṇy udīkṣeta kumāry ṛtumatī satī |
ūrdhvaṃ tu kālād etasmād vindeta sadṛśaṃ patim || 9.90 || A maiden who has reached maturity shall observe a waiting period of three years; thereafter, she shall seek a husband equal in virtue and station.

title: Verse 9.91
content:
अदीयमाना भर्तारमधिगच्छेद्यदि स्वयम् ।
नैनः किं चिदवाप्नोति न च यं साऽधिगच्छति ॥ ९.९१॥ adīyamānā bhartāram adhigacched yadi svayam |
na enaḥ kiṃ cid avāpnoti na ca yaṃ sā 'dhigacchati || 9.91|| When a woman approaches her husband without being summoned, he gains nothing thereby, nor does she gain anything by approaching him.

title: Verse 9.92
content: अलङ्कारं नाददीत पित्र्यं कन्या स्वयंवरा । मातृकं भ्रातृदत्तं वा स्तेना स्याद्यदि तं हरेत् ॥ ९.९२॥ alaṅkāraṁ nādadīta pitryaṁ kanyā svayaṁvarā . mātṛkaṁ bhātṛdattaṁ vā stenā syādyadi taṁ haret .. 9.92 .. A maiden choosing her own husband shall not accept ornaments given by the father; if she takes them, she becomes a thief in relation to the maternal ornaments or those given by the brother.

title: Verse 9.93
content:
पित्रे न दद्यात्शुल्कं तु कन्यां ऋतुमतीं हरन् ।
स च स्वाम्यादतिक्रामेदृतूनां प्रतिरोधनात् ॥ ९.९३॥ pitre na dadyāt śulkaṃ tu kanyāṃ ṛtumatīṃ haran |
sa ca svāmyād atikrāmed ṛtūnāṃ pratirodhanāt || 9.93|| One must not give compensation to the father for taking a girl who has attained puberty; he who obstructs her menstrual cycle transgresses the domain of ownership.

title: Verse 9.94
content: त्रिंशद्वर्षो वहेत्कन्यां हृद्यां द्वादशवार्षिकीम् । त्र्यष्टवर्षोऽष्टवर्षां वा धर्मे सीदति सत्वरः ॥ ९.९४॥ triṃśadvarṣo vahet kanyāṁ hṛdyāṁ dvādaśavārṣikīm | tryaṣṭavarṣo 'ṣṭavarṣāṁ vā dharme sīdati satvaraḥ || 9.94 || A man aged thirty shall wed a beloved girl of twelve; one aged thirty-eight, a girl of eight—this is the law of Dharma for the establishment of sacred union.

title: Verse 9.95
content:
देवदत्तां पतिर्भार्यां विन्दते नेच्छयाऽत्मनः ।
तां साध्वीं बिभृयान्नित्यं देवानां प्रियमाचरन् ॥ ९.९५॥ devadattāṁ patir bhāryāṁ vindate necchayā'tmanaḥ |
tāṁ sādhvīṁ bibhṛyān nityaṁ devānāṁ priyam ācaran || 9.95|| A husband who finds his wife, Devadatta, not desiring union with him must continually sustain her as a virtuous woman while performing actions dear to the gods.

title: Verse 9.96
content:
प्रजनार्थं स्त्रियः सृष्टाः संतानार्थं च मानवः ।
तस्मात्साधारणो धर्मः श्रुतौ पत्न्या सहोदितः ॥ ९.९६॥ prajanārthaṁ striyaḥ sṛṣṭāḥ saṁtānārthaṁ ca mānavaḥ |
tasmātsādhāraṇo dharmaḥ śrutau patnyā sahoditaḥ || 9.96|| Women are created for the purpose of procreation; men for the continuation of lineage. Therefore, the shared duty prescribed in the Śruti is the common foundation of their Dharma.

title: Verse 9.97
content:
कन्यायां दत्तशुल्कायां म्रियेत यदि शुल्कदः ।
देवराय प्रदातव्या यदि कन्याऽनुमन्यते ॥ ९.९७॥ kanyāyāṁ dattaśulkāyāṁ mriyeta yadi śulkadaḥ |
devarāya pradātavyā yadi kanyā'numanyate || 9.97|| If the groom has accepted the bride-price and the bride dies before the consummation of marriage, the amount shall be returned to the groom's brother if the bride’s family approves.

title: Verse 9.98
content:
आददीत न शूद्रोऽपि शुल्कं दुहितरं ददन् ।
शुल्कं हि गृह्णन् कुरुते छन्नं दुहितृविक्रयम् ॥ ९.९८॥ ādadīta na śūdro'pi śulkaṃ duhitaraṃ dadan |
śulkaṃ hi gṛhṇan kurute channaṃ duhitṛvikrayam || 9.98|| A Śūdra shall not accept any gift or compensation, even when offering his daughter in marriage; by accepting such a fee, he perpetrates a concealed sale of his own daughter.

title: Verse 9.99
content:
एतत्तु न परे चक्रुर्नापरे जातु साधवः ।
यदन्यस्य प्रतिज्ञाय पुनरन्यस्य दीयते ॥ ९.९९॥ etat tu na pare cakrur nāpare jātu sādhavaḥ .
yad anyasya pratijñāya punar anyasya dīyate .. 9.99 .. This act was neither performed by the one who initially vowed nor by another ever deemed virtuous; that which, having been promised to one, is again given to another.

title: Verse 9.100
content:
नानुशुश्रुम जात्वेतत्पूर्वेष्वपि हि जन्मसु ।
शुल्कसंज्ञेन मूल्येन छन्नं दुहितृविक्रयम् ॥ ९.१००॥ nānuśuśruma jātv etat pūrveṣv api hi janmasu |
śulkasaṃjñena mūlyena channaṃ duhitṛvikrayam || 9.100 || In prior births also, there has been no hearing of such a transaction—selling one's daughter under the guise of a fee or price.

title: Verse 9.101
content:
अन्योन्यस्याव्यभिचारो भवेदामरणान्तिकः ।
एष धर्मः समासेन ज्ञेयः स्त्रीपुंसयोः परः ॥ ९.१०१॥ anyonyasyāvyabhicāro bhavedāmaranāntikaḥ |
eṣa dharmaḥ samāsena jñeyaḥ strīpuṃsayoḥ paraḥ || 9.101|| Unwavering fidelity between husband and wife constitutes the highest Dharma for them both, leading directly to the cessation of death’s cycle.

title: Verse 9.102
content:
तथा नित्यं यतेयातां स्त्रीपुंसौ तु कृतक्रियौ ।
यथा नाभिचरेतां तौ वियुक्तावितरेतरम् ॥ ९.१०२॥ नातिचरेताम् tathā nityaṃ yateyātāṃ strīpuṃsau tu kṛtakriyau .
yathā nābhicaretaṃ tau viyuktāvitarētaram .. 9.102 .. nāticarētām Thus, let man and woman ever remain in disciplined endeavor; having fulfilled their duties, let them not transgress beyond measure, nor engage in mutual misconduct when separated.

title: Verse 9.103
content:
एष स्त्रीपुंसयोरुक्तो धर्मो वो रतिसंहितः ।
आपद्यपत्यप्राप्तिश्च दायधर्मं निबोधत ॥ ९.१०३॥ eṣa strīpuṁsayor ukto dharmo vo ratisaṁhitaḥ |
āpadyapatyaprāptiśca dāyadharmam nibodhata || 9.103|| This Dharma, united with affection, has been declared for man and woman; also, the law of inheritance in times of distress—understand this.

title: Verse 9.104
content:
ऊर्ध्वं पितुश्च मातुश्च समेत्य भ्रातरः समम् ।
भजेरन् पैतृकं रिक्थमनीशास्ते हि जीवतोः ॥ ९.१०४॥ ūrdhvaṁ pituśca mātuśca sametya bhrātaraḥ samam |
bhajeran paitṛkaṁ rikthamanīśāste hi jīvatoḥ || 9.104|| After the father and mother, brothers assembling equally shall divide the paternal estate; no ownership belongs to them while the parents live.

title: Verse 9.105
content:
ज्येष्ठ एव तु गृह्णीयात्पित्र्यं धनमशेषतः ।
शेषास्तमुपजीवेयुर्यथैव पितरं तथा ॥ ९.१०५॥ jyeṣṭha eva tu gṛhṇīyāt pitryaṃ dhanamaśeṣataḥ |
śeṣās tam upajīveyur yathaiva pitaraṃ tathā || 9.105|| The eldest son alone shall entirely receive the paternal estate; the remaining sons shall sustain themselves through him, even as they would through their father.

title: Verse 9.106
content:
ज्येष्ठेन जातमात्रेण पुत्री भवति मानवः ।
पितॄणामनृणश्चैव स तस्मात्सर्वमर्हति ॥ ९.१०६॥ jyeṣṭhena jātamātreṇa putrī bhavati mānavaḥ |
pitṝṇāmanṛṇaścaiva sa tasmātsarvamarhati || 9.106|| The firstborn male child, by virtue of his birthright, becomes the designated heir and upholder of ancestral duty; being unindebted to ancestors, he is entitled to all inheritance and spiritual authority.

title: Verse 9.107
content:
यस्मिनृणं संनयति येन चानन्त्यमश्नुते ।
स एव धर्मजः पुत्रः कामजानितरान् विदुः ॥ ९.१०७॥ yasmim ṛṇaṁ sannayati yena cānantasyam aśnute |
sa eva dharmajaḥ putraḥ kāmajānitarān viduḥ || 9.107|| He who incurs debt in accordance with sacred obligation and consumes limitlessly through desire-generated means—such a son is known to be born of lust, not of Dharma.

title: Verse 9.108
content:
पितेव पालयेत्पूत्रान् ज्येष्ठो भ्रातॄन् यवीयसः ।
पुत्रवत्चापि वर्तेरन् ज्येष्ठे भ्रातरि धर्मतः ॥ ९.१०८॥ piteva pālayetpūtrān jyeṣṭho bhrātṝn yavīyasaḥ |
putravatcāpi varteran jyeṣṭhe bhatari dharmataḥ || 9.108|| The younger brother shall protect the elder brothers as a father protects his sons; and those elder brothers shall conduct themselves toward the youngest as a son does toward his father, in accordance with Dharma.

title: Verse 9.109
content:
ज्येष्ठः कुलं वर्धयति विनाशयति वा पुनः ।
ज्येष्ठः पूज्यतमो लोके ज्येष्ठः सद्भिरगर्हितः ॥ ९.१०९॥ jyeṣṭhaḥ kulaṃ vardhayati vināśayati vā punaḥ |
jyeṣṭhaḥ pūjyatamo loke jyeṣṭhaḥ sadbhiragarhitaḥ || 9.109|| The eldest sustains the family lineage or dissolves it anew; in the world, the eldest is most honored, and by the wise, the eldest is never disrespected.

title: Verse 9.110
content:
यो ज्येष्ठो ज्येष्ठवृत्तिः स्यान् मातैव स पितैव सः ।
अज्येष्ठवृत्तिर्यस्तु स्यात्स सम्पूज्यस्तु बन्धुवत् ॥ ९.११०॥ yo jyeṣṭho jyeṣṭhavṛttiḥ syān mātaiva sa pitaiva saḥ |
ajyeṣṭhavṛttiryastu syāt sa sampūjyastu bandhuvat || 9.110 || He who is elder by birth and conducts himself with senior virtue shall be honored as mother; he who is elder yet lacks such conduct shall be respected as a relative only.

title: Verse 9.111
content:
एवं सह वसेयुर्वा पृथग्वा धर्मकाम्यया ।
पृथग्विवर्धते धर्मस्तस्माद्धर्म्या पृथक्क्रिया ॥ ९.१११॥ evaṁ saha vaseyurvā pṛthagvā dharmakāmyayā |
pṛthagvivardhate dharmastasmād dharmyā pṛthakkriyā || 9.111|| Whether dwelling together or separately, in accordance with dharma and desire, dharma flourishes when individuals act distinctly according to their svadharma; therefore, actions aligned with dharma must proceed independently based on individual capacity.

title: Verse 9.112
content:
ज्येष्ठस्य विंश उद्धारः सर्वद्रव्याच्च यद्वरम् ।
ततोऽर्धं मध्यमस्य स्यात्तुरीयं तु यवीयसः ॥ ९.११२॥ jyeṣṭhasya viṃśa uddhāraḥ sarvadravyācca yadvaram | tato'rdhaṃ madhyamasya syātturīyaṃ tu yavīyasaḥ || 9.112 || From the eldest son, one-twentieth part shall be taken for purification; from all property, whatever is superior. Thereafter, half of that belongs to the middle son, and the fourth portion to the youngest.

title: Verse 9.113
content:
ज्येष्ठश्चैव कनिष्ठश्च संहरेतां यथोदितम् ।
येऽन्ये ज्येष्ठकनिष्ठाभ्यां तेषां स्यान् मध्यमं धनम् ॥ ९.११३॥ jyeṣṭhaścaiva kaniṣṭhaśca saṃharetāṃ yathoditam | ye'nye jyeṣṭhakaniṣṭhābhyāṃ teṣāṃ syān madhyamaṃ dhanam || 9.113|| The eldest and youngest among heirs shall receive their due portions as prescribed; those who lie between them in birth order shall receive a middling share of wealth.

title: Verse 9.114
content:
सर्वेषां धनजातानामाददीताग्र्यमग्रजः ।
यच्च सातिशयं किं चिद्दशतश्चाप्नुयाद्वरम् ॥ ९.११४॥ sarveṣāṁ dhanajātānām ādadītāgryamagrajaḥ | yaccātiśayaṁ kiṁ cid daśataś cāpnu-yād-varam || 9.114 || The eldest brother shall assume the primary responsibility for all forms of wealth acquired by the siblings; whatever exceeds ten portions must be claimed by the eldest, ensuring alignment of familial capacity and economic integrity.

title: Verse 9.115
content:
उद्धारो न दशस्वस्ति सम्पन्नानां स्वकर्मसु ।
यत्किं चिदेव देयं तु ज्यायसे मानवर्धनम् ॥ ९.११५॥ uddhāro na daśasvasti sampannānāṃ svakarmasu |
yatkiṃ cid eva deyaṃ tu jyāyase mānavardhanam || 9.115|| Salvation or relief does not arise from mere possession or performance; whatever is given with superiority and enhancement of human dignity is what truly matters.

title: Verse 9.116
content:
एवं समुद्धृतोद्धारे समानंशान् प्रकल्पयेत् ।
उद्धारेऽनुद्धृते त्वेषामियं स्यादंशकल्पना ॥ ९.११६॥ evaṁ samuddhṛtoddhāre samānaṁśān prakalpayet |
uddhāre 'nuddhṛte tveṣām iyaṁ syād aṁśakalpanā || 9.116 || When extraction and elevation have been equally executed, equal shares shall be allocated; when such elevation has not occurred, this allocation of fractional entitlements applies.

title: Verse 9.117
content:
एकाधिकं हरेज्ज्येष्ठः पुत्रोऽध्यर्धं ततोऽनुजः ।
अंशमंशं यवीयांस इति धर्मो व्यवस्थितः ॥ ९.११७॥ ekādhikaṁ harej jyeṣṭhaḥ putro 'dhyardhaṁ tato 'nujaḥ |
aṁśam aṁśaṁ yavīyāṁsa iti dharmo vyavasthitaḥ || 9.117|| The eldest son shall take one share more than the others; the next younger takes half more, and the youngest equal shares. This is the established Dharma.

title: Verse 9.118
content: स्वेभ्योंशेभ्यस्तु कन्याभ्यः प्रदद्युर्भ्रातरः पृथक् । स्वाभ्यः स्वाभ्यस्तु स्वात्स्वादंशाच्चतुर्भागं पतिताः स्युरदित्सवः ॥ ९.११८॥ svebhyaḥ śebhyas tu kanyābhyaḥ pradadyur bhrātaraḥ pṛthak | svābhyaḥ svābhyas tu svāt svādaṁśāc caturbhāgaṁ patitāḥ syur aditsavaḥ || 9.118 || From their own portions, brothers shall separately give daughters in marriage; those who are hostile and wish harm shall fall from their own share by a fourth part.

title: Verse 9.119
content: अजाविकं सेकशफं  न जातु विषमं भजेत् । अजाविकं चैकशफं अजाविकं तु विषमं ज्येष्ठस्यैव विधीयते ॥ ९.११९॥ ajāvikaṃ sekashaphaṃ na jātu viṣamaṃ bhajet | ajāvikaṃ caikaśaphaṃ ajāvikaṃ tu viṣamaṃ jyeṣṭhasyaiva vidhīyate || 9.119 || The division of property among sons born of different mothers shall never be equal; the son of the senior wife shall receive a greater share.

title: Verse 9.120
content:
यवीयान्ज्येष्ठभार्यायां पुत्रमुत्पादयेद्यदि ।
समस्तत्र विभागः स्यादिति धर्मो व्यवस्थितः ॥ ९.१२०॥ yavīyān jyeṣṭhabhāryāyāṁ putram utpādayed yadi |
samastatra vibhāgaḥ syād iti dharmo vyavasthitaḥ || 9.120|| If a younger brother fathers a child upon the wife of his elder brother, the property shall be equally divided among all brothers; such is the established Dharma.

title: Verse 9.121
content:
उपसर्जनं प्रधानस्य धर्मतो नोपपद्यते ।
पिता प्रधानं प्रजने तस्माद्धर्मेण तं भजेत् ॥ ९.१२१॥ upasarjanaṃ pradhānasya dharmato nopapadyate |
pitā pradhānaṃ prajane tasmād dharmeṇa taṃ bhajet || 9.121|| Subordinate involvement in the primary duty of another is not lawful by dharma; the father is the primary authority in regard to progeny—therefore, one should serve him through dharma.

title: Verse 9.122
content:
पुत्रः कनिष्ठो ज्येष्ठायां कनिष्ठायां च पूर्वजः ।
कथं तत्र विभागः स्यादिति चेत्संशयो भवेत् ॥ ९.१२२॥ putraḥ kaniṣṭho jyeṣṭhāyāṁ kaniṣṭhāyāṁ ca pūrvajaḥ |
kathaṁ tatra vibhāgaḥ syāditi cetsaṁśayo bhavet || 9.122|| When a younger son is born to an elder mother and an elder son is born to a younger mother, and doubt arises regarding their division of inheritance, then the order of birth determines precedence.

title: Verse 9.123
content:
एकं वृषभमुद्धारं संहरेत स पूर्वजः ।
ततोऽपरे ज्येष्ठवृषास्तदूनानां स्वमातृतः ॥ ९.१२३॥ ekaṁ vṛṣabhamuddhāraṁ saṁhareta sa pūrvajaḥ | tato'pare jyeṣṭhavṛṣāstadūnānāṁ svamātṛtaḥ || 9.123 || The eldest male shall reclaim one bull; thereafter, the remaining bulls shall be allocated among the other brothers according to maternal lineage.

title: Verse 9.124
content:
ज्येष्ठस्तु जातो ज्येष्ठायां हरेद्वृषभषोडशाः ।
ततः स्वमातृतः शेषा भजेरन्निति धारणा ॥ ९.१२४॥ jyeṣṭhastu jāto jyeṣṭhāyāṃ haredvṛṣabhaṣoḍaśāḥ |
tataḥ svamātṛtaḥ śeṣā bhajeranniti dhāraṇā || 9.124 || The eldest son born to the principal wife shall claim the share of a bull, specifically sixteen parts; thereafter, the remaining sons from the same mother shall equally divide what remains.

title: Verse 9.125
content:
सदृशस्त्रीषु जातानां पुत्राणामविशेषतः ।
न मातृतो ज्यैष्ठ्यमस्ति जन्मतो ज्यैष्ठ्यमुच्यते ॥ ९.१२५॥ sadṛśastrīṣu jātānāṁ putrāṇām aviśeṣataḥ |
na mātrato jyaiṣṭhyam asti janmato jyaiṣṭhyam ucyate || 9.125|| Among sons born of similar mothers, there is no distinction based on maternal status; seniority arises solely from the order of birth.

title: Verse 9.126
content:
जन्मज्येष्ठेन चाह्वानं सुब्रह्मण्यास्वपि स्मृतम् ।
यमयोश्चैव गर्भेषु जन्मतो ज्येष्ठता स्मृता ॥ ९.१२६॥ janmajyeṣṭhena cāhvānaṃ subrahmaṇyāsvapi smṛtam | yamayoścaiva garbheṣu janmato jyeṣṭhatā smṛtā || 9.126|| By birth-right of primogeniture, invocation is established even among the divine; in the wombs of Yamī and Yama, precedence by birth is remembered.

title: Verse 9.127
content:
अपुत्रोऽनेन विधिना सुतां कुर्वीत पुत्रिकाम् ।
यदपत्यं भवेदस्यां तन् मम स्यात्स्वधाकरम् ॥ ९.१२७॥ aputro'nenavidhinā sutāṁ kuryāt putrikām | yadapatyaṁ bhavedasyāṁ tan mama syātsvadhākaram || 9.127 || A man without a son shall, by this law, cause a daughter to be born through appointed means; whatever offspring is born from her shall be deemed his own in the performance of ancestral rites.

title: Verse 9.128
content:
अनेन तु विधानेन पुरा चक्रेऽथ पुत्रिकाः ।
विवृद्ध्यर्थं स्ववंशस्य स्वयं दक्षः प्रजापतिः ॥ ९.१२८॥ anena tu vidhānena purā cakre'tha putrikāḥ |
vivṛddhyarthaṃ svavaṃśasya svayaṃ dakṣaḥ prajāpatiḥ || 9.128|| By this very law-code, in former times Prajapati Daksha himself established daughter-adoptions for the expansion and continuity of his lineage.

title: Verse 9.129
content:
ददौ स दश धर्माय कश्यपाय त्रयोदश ।
सोमाय राज्ञे सत्कृत्य प्रीतात्मा सप्तविंशतिम् ॥ ९.१२९॥ dadāu sa daśa dharmāya kaśyapāya trayodaśa | somāya rājñe satkṛtya prītātmā saptaviṃśatim || 9.129 || He gave ten to Dharma, thirteen to Kashyapa, and twenty-seven to King Soma, having honored them with a pleased heart.

title: Verse 9.130
content: यथैवात्मा तथा पुत्रः पुत्रेण दुहिता समा । तस्यामात्मनि तिष्ठन्त्यां कथमन्यो धनं हरेत् ॥ ९.१३०॥ yathaivātmā tathā putraḥ putreṇa duhitā samā | tasyām ātmani tiṣṭhantyāṃ katham anyo dhanaṃ haret || 9.130 || As is the Self, so is the son; by the son, the daughter is equal. When she abides in that Self, how can another take her wealth?

title: Verse 9.131
content:
मातुस्तु यौतकं यत्स्यात्कुमारीभाग एव सः ।
दौहित्र एव च हरेदपुत्रस्याखिलं धनम् ॥ ९.१३१॥ mātustu yautakaṁ yat syāt kumārī-bhāga eva saḥ | dauhitra eva ca hared aputrasyākhilaṁ dhanam || 9.131|| That which is gifted to the daughter at the time of marriage belongs exclusively to her; in the absence of sons, the grandson born of that daughter shall inherit all the wealth.

title: Verse 9.132
content:
दौहित्रो ह्यखिलं रिक्थमपुत्रस्य पितुर्हरेत् ।
स एव दद्याद्द्वौ पिण्डौ पित्रे मातामहाय च ॥ ९.१३२॥ Dauhitro hyakhilaṃ rikthamaputrasya pitorharet | sa eva dadyād dvau piṇḍau pitre mātāmahāya ca || 9.132 || The grandson inherits all property of a sonless father; he shall offer two portions to his paternal and maternal grandfathers respectively.

title: Verse 9.133
content:
पौत्रदौहित्रयोर्लोके न विशेषोऽस्ति धर्मतः ।
तयोर्हि मातापितरौ सम्भूतौ तस्य देहतः ॥ ९.१३३॥ pautradauhitrayorloke na viśeṣo'sti dharmataḥ |
tayorhi mātāpitarau sambhūtau tasya dehataḥ || 9.133|| In the eyes of Dharma, no distinction exists between grandson and granddaughter; both emerge equally from the body of their mother and father.

title: Verse 9.134
content:
पुत्रिकायां कृतायां तु यदि पुत्रोऽनुजायते ।
समस्तत्र विभागः स्यात्ज्येष्ठता नास्ति हि स्त्रियाः ॥ ९.१३४॥ putrikāyāṁ kṛtāyāṁ tu yadi putro'nujāyate .
samastatra vibhāgaḥ syājjyeṣṭhatā nāsti hi striyāḥ .. 9.134 .. When a daughter is given in adoption and a son is subsequently born, the division of property shall be equal; there is no precedence due to seniority among women.

title: Verse 9.135
content:
अपुत्रायां मृतायां तु पुत्रिकायां कथं चन ।
धनं तत्पुत्रिकाभर्ता हरेतैवाविचारयन् ॥ ९.१३५॥ aputrāyāṁ mṛtāyāṁ tu putrikāyāṁ kathaṁ cana |
dhanaṁ tatputrikābhartā haretaitāvichārayan || 9.135 || When a woman without sons dies, her husband shall take all her property immediately upon her death, without deliberation or delay.

title: Verse 9.136
content:
अकृता वा कृता वाऽपि यं विन्देत्सदृशात्सुतम् ।
पौत्री मातामहस्तेन दद्यात्पिण्डं हरेद्धनम् ॥ ९.१३६॥ akṛtā vā kṛtā vā'pi yaṃ vindeta sadṛśātsutam |
pautrī mātāmahastena dadyātpiṇḍaṃ haredhanam || 9.136 || Whether begotten without formal ceremony or through lawful union, a son born of similar caste shall be recognized as legitimate; the daughter's son thereby becomes entitled to perform ancestral rites and inherit property from the maternal grandfather.

title: Verse 9.137
content:
पुत्रेण लोकान्जयति पौत्रेणानन्त्यमश्नुते ।
अथ पुत्रस्य पौत्रेण ब्रध्नस्याप्नोति विष्टपम् ॥ ९.१३७॥ putreṇa lokānjayati pautrēṇānantityamaśnute |
atha putrasya pautrēṇa brahdnasyāpnoti viṣṭapam || 9.137 || Through a son, one conquers the worlds; through a grandson, one attains infinity. Then, by the great-grandson, even Brahman is reached.

title: Verse 9.138
content: पुन्नाम्नो नरकाद्यस्मात्त्रायते पितरं सुतः । तस्मात्पुत्र इति प्रोक्तः स्वयमेव स्वयम्भुवा ॥ ९.१३८॥ punnāmno narakād yasmāt trāyate pitaraṃ sutaḥ | tasmāt putra iti proktaḥ svayameva svayambhuvā || 9.138|| The son who delivers the father from the hell called Put is therefore named 'Putra'—declared so by the Self-Born One.

title: Verse 9.139
content:
पौत्रदौहित्रयोर्लोके विशेषो नोपपद्यते ।
दौहित्रोऽपि ह्यमुत्रैनं संतारयति पौत्रवत् ॥ ९.१३९॥ pautradauhitrayorloke viśeṣo nopapadyate | dauhitro'pi hyamutrainaṃ santārayati pautravat || 9.139|| In the world, no distinction exists between grandson and granddaughter; a daughter's son also carries the deceased hereafter, just as a son's son does.

title: Verse 9.140
content:
मातुः प्रथमतः पिण्डं निर्वपेत्पुत्रिकासुतः ।
द्वितीयं तु पितुस्तस्यास्तृतीयं तत्पितुः पितुः ॥ ९.१४०॥ mātuḥ prathamataḥ piṇḍaṁ nirvapetputrikāsutaḥ | dvitīyaṁ tu pitustasyāstṛtīyaṁ tatpituḥ pituḥ || 9.140 || The son born of a daughter shall first offer the funeral ball to his maternal grandmother; secondly, to his paternal grandfather's wife; thirdly, to his paternal great-grandfather.

title: Verse 9.141
content:
उपपन्नो गुणैः सर्वैः पुत्रो यस्य तु दत्त्रिमः ।
स हरेतैव तद्रिक्थं सम्प्राप्तोऽप्यन्यगोत्रतः ॥ ९.१४१॥ uppanno guṇaiḥ sarvaiḥ putro yasya tu dattrimaḥ |
sa haretaitad rikthaṃ samprāpto'py anyagotraataḥ || 9.141|| When a son is born of virtuous qualities through proper conduct and divine alignment, even if adopted or received from another lineage, he rightfully inherits the estate.

title: Verse 9.142
content:
गोत्ररिक्थे जनयितुर्न हरेद्दत्त्रिमः क्व चित् ।
गोत्ररिक्थानुगः पिण्डो व्यपैति ददतः स्वधा ॥ ९.१४२॥ gotra-rikthe janayiturna hared dattrimah kvacit |
gotra-rikthānugaḥ piṇḍo vyapaiti dadataḥ svadhā || 9.142 || In matters concerning lineage and procreation, no one shall seize or obstruct the right of a son born within wedlock, nor interfere with his entitlements under any circumstance; the ancestral offering follows the lineage-holder, who departs this life having fulfilled his duty through giving.

title: Verse 9.143
content:
अनियुक्तासुतश्चैव पुत्रिण्याऽप्तश्च देवरात् ।
उभौ तौ नार्हतो भागं जारजातककामजौ ॥ ९.१४३॥ aniyuktāsutaścaiva putriṇyā'ptaśca devarāt |
ubhau tau nārhato bhāgaṃ jārajātakakāmajau || 9.143|| A child born of a woman without lawful union, and a son given by a brother-in-law—both these are ineligible for inheritance; they are conceived through lust or accident.

title: Verse 9.144
content:
नियुक्तायामपि पुमान्नार्यां जातोऽविधानतः ।
नैवार्हः पैतृकं रिक्थं पतितोत्पादितो हि सः ॥ ९.१४४॥ niyuktāyām api pumān nāryāṃ jāto 'vidhānataḥ |
naivārhaḥ paitṛkaṃ rikthaṃ patitotpādito hi saḥ || 9.144 || Even when a man is born from a woman appointed for procreation, if the procedure was conducted without lawful arrangement, he is not entitled to paternal inheritance; such a one is produced from a fallen state.

title: Verse 9.145
content:
हरेत्तत्र नियुक्तायां जातः पुत्रो यथौरसः ।
क्षेत्रिकस्य तु तद्बीजं धर्मतः प्रसवश्च सः ॥ ९.१४५॥ harettra niyuktāyāṁ jātaḥ putro yathauraḥ |
kṣetrikasya tu tad bījaṁ dharmataḥ prasavaś ca saḥ || 9.145|| When a son is born to a woman lawfully appointed for procreation, he belongs to her husband as his own child. But the seed of another man, even if used lawfully, produces a child belonging to the seed-giver by natural right.

title: Verse 9.146
content:
धनं यो बिभृयाद्भ्रातुर्मृतस्य स्त्रियमेव च ।
सोऽपत्यं भ्रातुरुत्पाद्य दद्यात्तस्यैव तद्धनम् ॥ ९.१४६॥ dhanaṃ yo bibhṛyād bhratuḥ mṛtasya striyam eva ca |
sō 'patayaṃ bhratur utpādya dadyāt tasyaiva tad dhanam || 9.146|| He who maintains the wife of a deceased brother and raises children from that union shall give all wealth exclusively to those children.

title: Verse 9.147
content: या नियुक्ताऽन्यतः पुत्रं देवराद्वाऽप्यवाप्नुयात् । तं कामजमरिक्थीयं वृथोत्पन्नं प्रचक्षते ॥ ९.१४७॥ yā niyuktā'nyataḥ putraṃ devarād vā'py avāpnuyāt | taṃ kāmajam arikthīyaṃ vṛthotpannaṃ pracakṣate || 9.147|| She who, though appointed to bear a son through another—whether by the brother-in-law or any other—receives a child born of desire, that child is declared to be without purpose, falsely produced.

title: Verse 9.148
content: एतद्विधानं विज्ञेयं विभागस्यैकयोनिषु । बह्वीषु चैकजातानां नानास्त्रीषु निबोधत ॥ ९.१४८॥ etadvidhānaṃ vijñeyaṃ vibhāgasyaikayoniṣu | bahvīṣu caikajātānāṃ nānāstrīṣu nibodhata || 9.148 || This arrangement must be known as applicable to divisions within a single lineage; understand it also among many born of one origin, in various strī contexts.

title: Verse 9.149
content:
ब्राह्मणस्यानुपूर्व्येण चतस्रस्तु यदि स्त्रियः ।
तासां पुत्रेषु जातेषु विभागेऽयं विधिः स्मृतः ॥ ९.१४९॥ brāhmaṇasyānupūrvyeṇa catasrastu yadi striyaḥ |
tāsāṃ putreṣu jāteṣu vibhāge'yaṃ vidhiḥ smṛtaḥ || 9.149|| When a Brāhmaṇa has four wives in sequential order, and sons are born to them, the division of inheritance among those sons shall follow this prescribed order.

title: Verse 9.150
content:
कीनाशो गोवृषो यानमलङ्कारश्च वेश्म च ।
विप्रस्यौद्धारिकं देयमेकांशश्च प्रधानतः ॥ ९.१५०॥ kīnāśo govṛṣo yānamalaṅkāraśca veśma ca |
