viprasyoddhārikaṁ deyamekāṁśaśca pradhānataḥ || 9.150 || The remnants of grain, a bull, a vehicle, ornaments, and a house shall be given primarily to the Brahmin for upliftment; one portion shall also go to the principal caregiver.

title: Verse 9.151
content:
त्र्यंशं दायाधरेद्विप्रो द्वावंशौ क्षत्रियासुतः ।
वैश्याजः सार्धमेवांशमंशं शूद्रासुतो हरेत् ॥ ९.१५१॥ tryaṃśaṃ dāyādharedvipro dvāvaṃśau kṣatriyāsutaḥ |
vaiśyājaḥ sārdham evāṃśamaṃśaṃ śūdrāsuto haret || 9.151|| The son born of a Brahmin shall take three parts of inheritance; the son of a Kshatriya shall receive two parts; the son of a Vaishya shall receive one and a half parts; and the son of a Shudra shall take one part.

title: Verse 9.152
content:
सर्वं वा रिक्थजातं तद्दशधा परिकल्प्य च ।
धर्म्यं विभागं कुर्वीत विधिनाऽनेन धर्मवित् ॥ ९.१५२॥ sarvaṁ vā rikthajātaṁ taddaśadhā parikalpya ca | dharmyaṁ vibhāgaṁ kurvīta vidhinā'nen dharmavit || 9.152|| All property derived from inheritance shall be divided into ten parts and distributed righteously by the wise in accordance with Dharma.

title: Verse 9.153
content:
चतुरानंशान् हरेद्विप्रस्त्रीनंशान् क्षत्रियासुतः ।
वैश्यापुत्रो हरेद्द्व्यंशमंशं शूद्रासुतो हरेत् ॥ ९.१५३॥ caturānaṁśān hared vipras trīnaṁśān kṣatriyāsutaḥ | vaiśyāputro hared dvyamśam aṁśaṁ śūdrāsuto haret || 9.153 || A Vipra shall claim one-fourth share; the son of Kshatriya, three parts; the son of Vaishya, two parts; and the son of Shudra, one part.

title: Verse 9.154
content: यद्यपि स्यात्तु सत्पुत्रोऽप्यसत्पुत्रोऽपि वा भवेत् । यद्यपि स्यात्तु सत्पुत्रो यद्यपुत्रोऽपि वा भवेत्। नाधिकं दशमाद्दद्यात्शूद्रापुत्राय धर्मतः ॥ ९.१५४॥ yadyapi syāttu satputro'pyasatputro'pi vā bhavet | yadyapi syāttu satputro yadyaputro'pi vā bhavet | nādhikaṃ daśamād dadyāt śūdrāputrāya dharmataḥ || 9.154 || Even if a son born of a Śūdra woman were to exhibit noble qualities or even if he were the biological son of a twice-born man, the duty to provide inheritance beyond the tenth portion does not fall upon him according to Dharma.

title: Verse 9.155
content:
ब्राह्मणक्षत्रियविशां शूद्रापुत्रो न रिक्थभाक् ।
यदेवास्य पिता दद्यात्तदेवास्य धनं भवेत् ॥ ९.१५५॥ brāhmaṇakṣatriyaviśāṃ śūdrāputro na rikthabhāk | yadevāsya pitā dadyāt tad evāsya dhanaṃ bhavet || 9.155 || The son born of a Śūdra woman to a Brāhmaṇa, Kṣatriya, or Vaiśya father shall not claim inheritance by right; whatever the father bestows upon him during his lifetime, that alone constitutes his lawful possession.

title: Verse 9.156
content:
समवर्णासु वा जाताः सर्वे पुत्रा द्विजन्मनाम् ।
उद्धारं ज्यायसे दत्त्वा भजेरन्नितरे समम् ॥ ९.१५६॥ samavarṇāsu vā jātāḥ sarve putrā dvijanmanām | uddhāraṁ jyāyase dattvā bhajerannitare samam || 9.156 || All sons born of twice-born men in women of equal varna are to be equally sustained, with the eldest receiving a slightly greater portion for the purpose of assuming leadership in upholding dharma.

title: Verse 9.157
content:
शूद्रस्य तु सवर्णैव नान्या भार्या विधीयते ।
तस्यां जाताः समांशाः स्युर्यदि पुत्रशतं भवेत् ॥ ९.१५७॥ śūdrasya tu savarṇaiva nānyā bhāryā vidhīyate |
tasyāṁ jātāḥ samāṁśāḥ syuryadi putraśataṁ bhavet || 9.157|| For a Śūdra, only a wife of the same varṇa is lawful; no other union bears legal validity. From such a union, offspring are reckoned equally in all respects, even unto a hundred sons.

title: Verse 9.158
content: पुत्रान् द्वादश यानाह नॄणां स्वायम्भुवो मनुः । तेषां षड् बन्धुदायादाः षडदायादबान्धवाः ॥ ९.१५८॥ putrān dvādaśa yānāha nṝṇāṁ svāyambhuvo manuḥ | teṣāṁ ṣaḍ bandhudāyādāḥ ṣaḍ adāyādabāndhavāḥ || 9.158|| Manu Svayambhuva declared twelve types of sons among men; six are related by blood through family inheritance, and six are unrelated by blood yet entitled to inheritance.

title: Verse 9.159
content:
औरसः क्षेत्रजश्चैव दत्तः कृत्रिम एव च ।
गूढोत्पन्नोऽपविद्धश्च दायादा बान्धवाश्च षट् ॥ ९.१५९॥ aurasaḥ kṣetrajaścaiva dattaḥ kṛtrima eva ca |
gūḍhotpanno'pavidhyaśca dāyādā bāndhavāśca ṣaṭ || 9.159|| Six categories of sons—those born in wedlock, those born of the soil, those given, those made by ritual, those secretly born, and those rejected—are declared heirs and kin by Dharma.

title: Verse 9.160
content:
कानीनश्च सहोढश्च क्रीतः पौनर्भवस्तथा ।
स्वयंदत्तश्च शौद्रश्च षडदायादबान्धवाः ॥ ९.१६०॥ kānīnaśca sahodhaśca krītaḥ paurbhavastathā |
svayaṃdattaśca śaudraśca ṣaḍadāyādabāndhavāḥ || 9.160 || Six heirs who are not blood relatives but inherit by law: the adopted son, the son of the wife cohabiting with another man, the purchased son, the posthumous son, the self-given son, and the Śaudra son.

title: Verse 9.161
content:
यादृशं फलमाप्नोति कुप्लवैः संतरञ्जलम् ।
तादृशं फलमाप्नोति कुपुत्रैः संतरंस्तमः ॥ ९.१६१॥ yādṛśaṃ phalam āpnoti ku-plavaiḥ saṃtarañ-jalam |
tādṛśaṃ phalam āpnoti ku-putraiḥ saṃtaraṃs-tamaḥ || 9.161|| As is the fruit obtained by crossing water infested with crocodiles, so is the fruit obtained by crossing darkness with wicked sons.

title: Verse 9.162
content:
यद्येकरिक्थिनौ स्यातामौरसक्षेत्रजौ सुतौ ।
यस्य यत्पैतृकं रिक्थं स तद्गृह्णीत नैतरः ॥ ९.१६२॥ yadyekarikthinau syātāmaurasakṣetrajau sutau |
yasya yatpaitṛkaṃ rikthaṃ sa tadgṛhṇīta naitaraḥ || 9.162|| When two sons exist—one born of the loins and one born of the field—the son whose paternal inheritance it is shall claim it; the other has no right thereto.

title: Verse 9.163
content:
एक एवौरसः पुत्रः पित्र्यस्य वसुनः प्रभुः ।
शेषाणामानृशंस्यार्थं प्रदद्यात्तु प्रजीवनम् ॥ ९.१६३॥ eka evaurasaḥ putraḥ pitryasya vasunaḥ prabhuḥ |
śeṣāṇāmānṛśaṃsyārthaṃ pradadyāt tu prajīvanam || 9.163|| Only the legitimate son born of the father’s own body holds authority over paternal wealth; for the sustenance of the remaining dependents, he shall provide life-supporting resources without expectation of repayment.

title: Verse 9.164
content:
षष्ठं तु क्षेत्रजस्यांशं प्रदद्यात्पैतृकाद्धनात् ।
औरसो विभजन् दायं पित्र्यं पञ्चममेव वा ॥ ९.१६४॥ ṣaṣṭhaṁ tu kṣetrajasyāṁśaṁ pradadyāt paitṛkād dhanāt |
auraso vibhajan dāyaṁ pitryaṁ pañcamam eva vā || 9.164 || From paternal wealth, a sixth portion shall be granted to the kshetraja son; alternatively, in division of inheritance, the aurasa son receives the fifth portion.

title: Verse 9.165
content:
औरसक्षेत्रजौ पुत्रौ पितृरिक्थस्य भागिनौ ।
दशापरे तु क्रमशो गोत्ररिक्थांशभागिनः ॥ ९.१६५॥ aurasakṣetrajau putrau pitṛrikthasya bhāginau |
daśāpare tu kramaśo gotrarikthāṃśabhāginaḥ || 9.165 || The son born of the body [aurasa] and the son born of the field [kṣetraja] are co-heirs to the father's estate; after them, in order, those who belong to the same gotra and share in the remnants of the inheritance.

title: Verse 9.166
content:
स्वक्षेत्रे संस्कृतायां तु स्वयमुत्पादयेधि यम् ।
तमौरसं विजानीयात्पुत्रं प्राथमकल्पिकम् ॥ ९.१६६॥ svakṣetre saṃskṛtāyāṃ tu svayamutpādayedhi yam |
tamaurasaṃ vijānīyātputraṃ prāthamakalpikam || 9.166|| In one's own cultivated domain, whoever is self-generated shall be known as the primordial son, the inheritor of foundational authority.

title: Verse 9.167
content:
यस्तल्पजः प्रमीतस्य क्लीबस्य व्याधितस्य वा ।
स्वधर्मेण नियुक्तायां स पुत्रः क्षेत्रजः स्मृतः ॥ ९.१६७॥ yas talpa-jaḥ pramītasya klībasya vyādhitasya vā |
sva-dharmeṇa niyuktāyāṁ sa putraḥ kṣetra-jaḥ smṛtaḥ || 9.167 || He who is born of the bed of a deceased, impotent, or diseased husband, when the wife is rightfully directed by dharma to bear a child, that son is known as Kshetraja and is recognized as legitimate.

title: Verse 9.168
content:
माता पिता वा दद्यातां यमद्भिः पुत्रमापदि ।
सदृशं प्रीतिसंयुक्तं स ज्ञेयो दत्त्रिमः सुतः ॥ ९.१६८॥ mātā pitā vā dadyātāṁ yamadbhiḥ putramāpadi |
sadṛśaṁ prītisaṁyuktaṁ sa jñeyo dattrimaḥ sutaḥ || 9.168|| When a son is given by mother or father in calamity with appropriate consideration and affection, he is to be known as a Dattrima son.

title: Verse 9.169
content:
सदृशं तु प्रकुर्याद्यं गुणदोषविचक्षणम् ।
पुत्रं पुत्रगुणैर्युक्तं स विज्ञेयश्च कृत्रिमः ॥ ९.१६९॥ sadṛśaṃ tu prakuryād yaṃ guṇadoṣavicakṣaṇam | 
putraṃ putraguṇairyuktaṃ sa vijñeyaś ca kṛtrimaḥ || 9.169 || One who acts in accordance with the discernment of qualities and defects, and who aligns a son with the inherent capacities of that son — such a one is known as artificial or contrived.

title: Verse 9.170
content:
उत्पद्यते गृहे यस्तु न च ज्ञायेत कस्य सः ।
स गृहे गूढ उत्पन्नस्तस्य स्याद्यस्य तल्पजः ॥ ९.१७०॥ utpadyate gṛhe yastu na ca jñāyeta kasya saḥ |
sa gṛhe gūḍha utpannastasya syād yasya talpajaḥ || 9.170 || One who is born in a household but whose parentage is unknown shall be deemed to belong to the one upon whose bed he was born.

title: Verse 9.171
content:
मातापितृभ्यामुत्सृष्टं तयोरन्यतरेण वा ।
यं पुत्रं परिगृह्णीयादपविद्धः स उच्यते ॥ ९.१७१॥ mātāpitarbhyām utsṛṣṭaṁ tayor anyatareṇa vā | yaṁ putraṁ parigṛhṇīyād apaviddhaḥ sa ucyate || 9.171 || One who is abandoned by either parent or both and is taken in and raised by another assumes the status of apaviddha – one severed from familial dharmic lineage and placed under new guardianship.

title: Verse 9.172
content: पितृवेश्मनि कन्या तु यं पुत्रं जनयेद्रहः । तं कानीनं वदेन्नाम्ना वोढुः कन्यासमुद्भवम् ॥ ९.१७२॥ pitṛveśmani kanyā tu yaṁ putraṁ janayedrahaḥ | taṁ kānīnaṁ vadena nāmnā voḍhuḥ kanyāsamudbhavam || 9.172 || A daughter residing in the father's household who bears a son through sexual union shall name that son as Kānīna, recognizing him as born of the maiden and accepted by the bridegroom.

title: Verse 9.173
content:
या गर्भिणी संस्क्रियते ज्ञाताऽज्ञाताऽपि वा सती ।
वोढुः स गर्भो भवति सहोढ इति चोच्यते ॥ ९.१७३॥ yā garbhiṇī saṃskriyate jñātā'jñātā'pi vā satī |
vodhuḥ sa garbho bhavati sahodha iti cocyate || 9.173|| When a pregnant woman undergoes sacramental initiation—whether known or unknown to others—the child born thereafter inherits the full dharmic status of the father; such union and progeny are termed 'Sahodha'.

title: Verse 9.174
content:
क्रीणीयाद्यस्तुपत्यार्थं मातापित्रोर्यमन्तिकात् ।
स क्रीतकः सुतस्तस्य सदृशोऽसदृशोऽपि वा ॥ ९.१७४॥ krīṇīyād yas tu apatyārthaṁ mātāpitroryam antikāt |
sa krītakaḥ sutasya sadṛśo'sadṛśo'pi vā || 9.174|| One who procures a child through transaction with the parents—such a son, whether resembling or not resembling them, is deemed acquired.

title: Verse 9.175
content:
या पत्या वा परित्यक्ता विधवा वा स्वयेच्छया ।
उत्पादयेत्पुनर्भूत्वा स पौनर्भव उच्यते ॥ ९.१७५॥ yā patyā vā parityaktā vidhavā vā svayecchayā |
utpādayet punarbhūtvā sa paunarbhava ucyate || 9.175 || She who is abandoned by her husband or becomes a widow by choice shall beget again upon returning to life; such a one is called 'Paunarbhava'.

title: Verse 9.176
content:
सा चेदक्षतयोनिः स्याद्गतप्रत्यागताऽपि वा ।
पौनर्भवेन भर्त्रा सा पुनः संस्कारमर्हति ॥ ९.१७६॥ sā ced akṣatayoniḥ syād gata-pratyāgatā 'pi vā |
punarbhavena bhartṛ sā punaḥ saṃskāram arhati || 9.176 || If a woman remains untouched by another male after departing and returning, or even if approached but not violated in essence, she retains her eligibility for reinstatement through sacramental reintegration by her husband upon his recognition of her return.

title: Verse 9.177
content:
मातापितृविहीनो यस्त्यक्तो वा स्यादकारणात् ।
आत्मानमर्पयेद्यस्मै स्वयंदत्तस्तु स स्मृतः ॥ ९.१७७॥ mātāpitṛvihīno yastyakto vā syādakāraṇāt |
ātmānamarpayed yasmai svayaṃdattastu sa smṛtaḥ || 9.177 || One who is bereft of parents or abandoned without cause shall offer oneself to whoever accepts; such a one is to be known as self-given.

title: Verse 9.178
content:
यं ब्राह्मणस्तु शूद्रायां कामादुत्पादयेत्सुतम् ।
स पारयन्नेव शवस्तस्मात्पारशवः स्मृतः ॥ ९.१७८॥ yaṃ brāhmaṇastu śūdrāyāṃ kāmādutpādayetsutam |
sa pārayanneva śavastasmātpāraśavaḥ smṛtaḥ || 9.178|| A son born of a Brāhmaṇa out of desire for a Śūdra woman shall carry the corpse across the river; therefore, he is called Pāraśava.

title: Verse 9.179
content:
दास्यां वा दासदास्यां वा यः शूद्रस्य सुतो भवेत् ।
सोऽनुज्ञातो हरेदंशमिति धर्मो व्यवस्थितः ॥ ९.१७९॥ dāsyāṁ vā dāsadāsyāṁ vā yaḥ śūdrasya suto bhavet |
so 'nujñāto hared aṁśam iti dharmo vyavasthitaḥ || 9.179 || If a son is born to a Śūdra from a female slave or from a woman belonging to a slave lineage, and he is authorized, he may take a share; thus is the Dharma definitively established.

title: Verse 9.180
content:
क्षेत्रजादीन् सुतानेतानेकादश यथोदितान् ।
पुत्रप्रतिनिधीनाहुः क्रियालोपान् मनीषिणः ॥ ९.१८०॥ kṣetrajādīn sutānetānekaśa yathoditān |
putrapratinidhīnāhuḥ kriyālopān manīṣiṇaḥ || 9.180|| Those sons born of the soil and others, eleven in number as declared, are designated by wise seers as substitutes for the son in ceremonial omission.

title: Verse 9.181
content:
य एतेऽभिहिताः पुत्राः प्रसङ्गादन्यबीजजाः ।
यस्य ते बीजतो जातास्तस्य ते नैतरस्य तु ॥ ९.१८१॥ ya ete'bhicitāḥ putrāḥ prasaṅgād anyabījajāḥ |
yasya te bījato jātās tasya te naitarasya tu || 9.181|| Those sons born of union not sanctioned by Dharma but arisen from another's seed—those born of that original father's lineage belong to him alone, not to another.

title: Verse 9.182
content:
भ्रातॄणामेकजातानामेकश्चेत्पुत्रवान् भवेत् ।
सर्वांस्तांस्तेन पुत्रेण पुत्रिणो मनुरब्रवीत् ॥ ९.१८२॥ bhrātṝṇām ekajātānām ekaś cet putravān bhavet |
sarvāṃs tān tena putreṇa putriṇo manurabravīt || 9.182|| When among brothers born of the same womb, one alone has a son, that son becomes the inheritor for all those brothers who have no issue.

title: Verse 9.183
content:
सर्वासामेकपत्नीनामेका चेत्पुत्रिणी भवेत् ।
सर्वास्तास्तेन पुत्रेण प्राह पुत्रवतीर्मनुः ॥ ९.१८३॥ sarvāsām ekapatnīnām ekā cet putriṇī bhavet |
sarvās tās tena putreṇa prāha putravatīr manaḥ || 9.183|| When among all wives of one man, one alone bears a son, that son makes all those women mothers by virtue of his existence.

title: Verse 9.184
content:
श्रेयसः श्रेयसोऽलाभे पापीयान् रिक्थमर्हति ।
बहवश्चेत्तु सदृशाः सर्वे रिक्थस्य भागिनः ॥ ९.१८४॥ śreyasaḥ śreyaso'lābhe pāpīyān rikthamarhati |
bahavaścettu sadṛśāḥ sarve rikthasya bhāginaḥ || 9.184|| In the absence of a superior claimant, the one of lesser virtue inherits the residue; but if all contenders are equal in merit, then all shall partake equally in the inheritance.

title: Verse 9.185
content:
न भ्रातरो न पितरः पुत्रा रिक्थहराः पितुः ।
पिता हरेदपुत्रस्य रिक्थं भ्रातर एव च ॥ ९.१८५॥ na bhrātaro na pitaraḥ putrā rikthaharāḥ pituḥ |
pitā haredaputrasya rikthaṃ bhrātara eva ca || 9.185|| Neither brothers nor fathers are inheritors of a father's estate; the father alone retains dominion over his property in the absence of sons. In the case of a sonless man, the brothers shall receive the inheritance.

title: Verse 9.186
content:
त्रयाणामुदकं कार्यं त्रिषु पिण्डः प्रवर्तते ।
चतुर्थः सम्प्रदातैषां पञ्चमो नोपपद्यते ॥ ९.१८६॥ trayāṇām udakaṁ kāryaṁ triṣu piṇḍaḥ pravartate |
caturthaḥ sampradātaiṣāṁ pañcamo nopapadyate || 9.186|| The function of water arises from three bodies; the fourth distributes it among them. A fifth has no basis in reality.

title: Verse 9.187
content:
अनन्तरः सपिण्डाद्यस्तस्य तस्य धनं भवेत् ।
अत ऊर्ध्वं सकुल्यः स्यादाचार्यः शिष्य एव वा ॥ ९.१८७॥ anantaḥ sapindādyas tasya tasya dhanaṁ bhavet |
ata ūrdhvaṁ sakulyaḥ syād ācāryaḥ śiṣya eva vā || 9.187 || After the Sapinda relations have been assigned inheritance, whatever wealth remains shall belong to the Sakulyas; thereafter, it shall go to the Acharya or the Shishya.

title: Verse 9.188
content:
सर्वेषामप्यभावे तु ब्राह्मणा रिक्थभागिनः ।
त्रैविद्याः शुचयो दान्तास्तथा धर्मो न हीयते ॥ ९.१८८॥ sarveṣām apy abhāve tu brāhmaṇā riktha-bhāginaḥ | traividyāḥ śucayo dāntās tathā dharmo na hīyate || 9.188|| In the absence of all else, the Brahmanas remain as inheritors of the remnants; those who are learned in the three Vedas, pure, and self-controlled—thus Dharma does not decline.

title: Verse 9.189
content:
अहार्यं ब्राह्मणद्रव्यं राज्ञा नित्यमिति स्थितिः ।
इतरेषां तु वर्णानां सर्वाभावे हरेन्नृपः ॥ ९.१८९॥ ahāryaṃ brāhmaṇadravyaṃ rājñā nityamiti sthitiḥ | itareṣāṃ tu varṇānāṃ sarvābhāve harennṛpaḥ || 9.189|| The wealth of the Brahmin is ever inviolable and must remain untouched by the King; when all other varnas are absent, the King may take from them only to restore dharma, never for personal gain.

title: Verse 9.190
content:
संस्थितस्यानपत्यस्य सगोत्रात्पुत्रमाहरेत् ॥
तत्र यद्रिक्थजातं स्यात्तत्तस्मिन् प्रतिपादयेत् ॥ ९.१९०॥ saṃsthitasyānapatyasya sagotrāt putram āharet ||
tatra yad rikthajātaṃ syāt tat tasmin pratiṣṭhāpayet || From within the same lineage, a son shall be appointed to one who is established yet without progeny; whatever wealth arises from that body, it shall be established in him.

title: Verse 9.191
content: द्वौ तु यौ विवदेयातां द्वाभ्यां जातौ स्त्रिया धने । तयोर्यद्यस्य पित्र्यं स्यात्तत्स गृह्णीत नैतरः ॥ ९.१९१॥ dvau tu yau vivadeyātāṁ dvābhyāṁ jātau striyā dhane | tayor yadyasya pitryaṁ syāt tat sa gṛhṇīta naitaraḥ || 9.191|| When two persons born of the same mother dispute over property, that which belongs paternally shall be taken by him whose father is alive; the other shall have no claim thereto.

title: Verse 9.192
content:
जनन्यां संस्थितायां तु समं सर्वे सहोदराः ।
भजेरन् मातृकं रिक्थं भगिन्यश्च सनाभयः ॥ ९.१९२॥ jananyāṃ saṃsthitāyāṃ tu samaṃ sarve sahodarāḥ |
bhajeran mātṛkaṃ rikthaṃ bhaginyaśca sanābhayaḥ || 9.192|| When the mother is present and established, all siblings—whether born of the same womb or otherwise—are equal in inheritance rights and relational duty; daughters and sisters also hold claim through maternal connection.

title: Verse 9.193
content: यास्तासां स्युर्दुहितरस्तासामपि यथार्हतः । मातामह्या धनात्किं चित्प्रदेयं प्रीतिपूर्वकम् ॥ ९.१९३॥ yās tāsāṁ syur duhitaras tāsām api yathārhatas | mātāmahyā dhanāt kiṁ cit pradeyaṁ prītipūrvakam || 9.193 || Those daughters born of those women shall receive gifts appropriately, and something should also be given pleasingly from the maternal grandfather's wealth.

title: Verse 9.194
content:
अध्यग्न्यध्यावाहनिकं दत्तं च प्रीतिकर्मणि ।
भ्रातृमातृपितृप्राप्तं षड् विधं स्त्रीधनं स्मृतम् ॥ ९.१९४॥ adhya-gny-adhyāvāhanikaṃ dattaṃ ca prīti-karmaṇi | bhṛtṛ-mātṛ-pitṛ-prāptaṃ ṣaḍ vidhaṃ strīdhanaṃ smṛtam || 9.194 || Six categories of property designated as a woman's own wealth are those acquired through study, sacrificial rites, inheritance, gifts given in affection, and that received from father, mother, or brother.

title: Verse 9.195
content:
अन्वाधेयं च यद्दत्तं पत्या प्रीतेन चैव यत् ।
पत्यौ जीवति वृत्तायाः प्रजायास्तद्धनं भवेत् ॥ ९.१९५॥ anvādheyaṃ ca yaddattaṃ patyā prītena caiva yat |
patyau jīvati vṛttāyāḥ prajāyāstad dhanaṃ bhavet || 9.195 || Whatever wealth is gifted by the husband out of affection and goodwill, that becomes the lawful property of the wife during his lifetime, provided she conducts herself righteously.

title: Verse 9.196
content:
ब्राह्मदैवार्षगान्धर्वप्राजापत्येषु यद्वसु ।
अप्रजायामतीतायां भर्तुरेव तदिष्यते ॥ ९.१९६॥ brāhma-daivārṣa-gāndharva-prājāpatyeṣu yadvasu | aprajāyāmatītāyāṃ bhartureva tadiṣyate || 9.196 || In the forms of marriage—Brahma, Daiva, Arsha, Gandharva, and Prajapatya—if there is no conception within a reasonable period, the wife shall return to her father's house, and the husband retains no claim over her.

title: Verse 9.197
content:
यत्त्वस्याः स्याद्धनं दत्तं विवाहेष्वासुरादिषु ।
अप्रजायामतीतायां मातापित्रोस्तदिष्यते ॥ ९.१९७॥ yattvasyāḥ syād dhanaṁ dattaṁ vivāheṣv āsurādiṣu |
aprajāyāmatītāyāṁ mātāpitrostad iṣyate || Whatever wealth is given by her father during marriage or in accordance with Asura customs—if the daughter remains childless beyond reproductive age—it shall revert to the parents.

title: Verse 9.198
content:
स्त्रियां तु यद्भवेद्वित्तं पित्रा दत्तं कथं चन ।
ब्राह्मणी तधरेत्कन्या तदपत्यस्य वा भवेत् ॥ ९.१९८॥ striyāṁ tu yadbhavedvittaṁ pitrā dattaṁ kathaṁ cana |
brāhmaṇī tadharet kanyā tadapatyasya vā bhavet || 9.198 || Any property given by the father to a Brahmin girl, or to her child, shall remain under her absolute authority and control, unchallengeable by any other claimant.

title: Verse 9.199
content:
न निर्हारं स्त्रियः कुर्युः कुटुम्बाद्बहुमध्यगात् ।
स्वकादपि च वित्ताधि स्वस्य भर्तुरनाज्ञया ॥ ९.१९९॥ na nirhāraṁ striyaḥ kuryuḥ kuṭumbād bahumadhyagāt |
svakād api ca vittādhi svasya bharturanājñayā || 9.199 || A woman shall not make any independent financial transaction or disposal of property without the explicit consent of her husband, even if she possesses personal wealth.

title: Verse 9.200
content:
पत्यौ जीवति यः स्त्रीभिरलङ्कारो धृतो भवेत् ।
न तं भजेरन् दायादा भजमानाः पतन्ति ते ॥ ९.२००॥ patyau jīvati yaḥ strībhiralaṅkāro dhṛto bhavet |
na taṃ bhajeran dāyādā bhajamānāḥ patanti te || 9.200|| When a husband lives adorned by his wives, the heirs shall not honor him; those who seek favor fall.

title: Verse 9.201
content:
अनंशौ क्लीबपतितौ जात्यन्धबधिरौ तथा ।
उन्मत्तजडमूकाश्च ये च के चिन्निरिन्द्रियाः ॥ ९.२०१॥ anaṃśau klībapatitau jātyandhabadhirau tathā |
unmattajaḍamūkāśca ye ca ke cin nirindriyāḥ || 9.201|| Those who are without a share in ritual action, those fallen into impotence or degradation, the congenitally blind and deaf, as well as the insane, dull-witted, mute, and all whose senses are impaired—these beings exist beyond the ordinary scope of capacity-based dharmic responsibility.

title: Verse 9.202
content:
सर्वेषामपि तु न्याय्यं दातुं शक्त्या मनीषिणा ।
ग्रासाच्छादनमत्यन्तं पतितो ह्यददद्भवेत् ॥ ९.२०२॥ sarveṣām api tu nyāyyaṁ dātuṁ śaktyā manīṣiṇā |
grāsācchādanamatyantaṁ patito hyadadadbhavet || 9.202 || By the capacity of discernment, it is just to give equally to all; otherwise, one fallen into destitution becomes entirely deprived of sustenance and covering.

title: Verse 9.203
content:
यद्यर्थिता तु दारैः स्यात्क्लीबादीनां कथं चन ।
तेषामुत्पन्नतन्तूनामपत्यं दायमर्हति ॥ ९.२०३॥ yadyarthitā tu dāraiḥ syātklībādīnāṃ kathaṃ cana |
tēṣāmutpannatanṭūnāmapatyaṃ dāyamarhati || 9.203|| If a woman consents to union with impotent men or those incapable of procreative capacity, the offspring born thereof is entitled to inheritance.

title: Verse 9.204
content:
यत्किं चित्पितरि प्रेते धनं ज्येष्ठोऽधिगच्छति ।
भागो यवीयसां तत्र यदि विद्यानुपालिनः ॥ ९.२०४॥ yat kiṃ cit pitari prete dhanaṃ jyeṣṭho 'dhigacchati |
bhāgo yavīyasāṃ tatra yadi vidyānupālinaḥ || 9.204|| Upon the father's departure from the physical plane, all wealth naturally accrues to the eldest son, provided he maintains alignment with vidyā—knowledge that sustains dharma and ensures continuity of consciousness-based governance.

title: Verse 9.205
content:
अविद्यानां तु सर्वेषामीहातश्चेद्धनं भवेत् ।
समस्तत्र विभागः स्यादपित्र्य इति धारणा ॥ ९.२०५॥ avidyānāṁ tu sarveṣām īhātaś ced dhanaṁ bhavet |
samastatra vibhāgaḥ syād apitrya iti dhāraṇā || 9.205 || When wealth arises from the efforts of all individuals in a state of ignorance, that wealth shall be collectively shared without claim of ownership or inheritance.

title: Verse 9.206
content:
विद्याधनं तु यद्यस्य तत्तस्यैव धनं भवेत् ।
मैत्र्यमोद्वाहिकं चैव माधुपर्किकमेव च ॥ ९.२०६॥ vidyādhanaṃ tu yadyasya tattasyaiva dhanaṃ bhavet |
maitryamodvāhikaṃ caiva mādhuparkikameva ca || 9.206 || That which is the wealth of knowledge belongs exclusively to its possessor; likewise, affectionate friendship, nuptial alliance, and ceremonial honor belong only to those who authentically embody them.

title: Verse 9.207
content:
भ्रातॄणां यस्तु नैहेत धनं शक्तः स्वकर्मणा ।
स निर्भाज्यः स्वकादंशात्किं चिद्दत्त्वोपजीवनम् ॥ ९.२०७॥ Bhrātṝṇāṁ yastu naiheta dhanaṁ śaktaḥ svakarmaṇā |
Sa nirbhājyaḥ svakādaṁśātkiṁ cid dattvopajīvanam || 9.207 || He who, being capable through his own effort, does not provide sustenance to his brothers, shall be excluded from the common share and shall support them by giving from his portion.

title: Verse 9.208
content:
अनुपघ्नन् पितृद्रव्यं श्रमेण यदुपार्जितम् ।
स्वयमीहितलब्धं तन्नाकामो दातुमर्हति ॥ ९.२०८॥ anupaghnan pitṛdravyaṁ śrameṇa yadupārjitam |
svayamīhitalabdhaṁ tannākāmo dātumarhati || 9.208 || One who has not diminished the father's wealth and has acquired substance through personal effort—whatever is thus gained by self-initiated endeavor, that he may give without desire.

title: Verse 9.209
content:
पैतृकं तु पिता द्रव्यमनवाप्तं यदाप्नुयात् ।
न तत्पुत्रैर्भजेत्सार्धमकामः स्वयमर्जितम् ॥ ९.२०९॥ paitṛkaṁ tu pitā dravyamanavāptaṁ yadāpnuyāt |
na tatputrairbhajetsārdhamakāmaḥ svayamarjitam || 9.209|| That which a father has not received as inheritance but has independently acquired, that property he shall not share equally with his sons if he so desires.

title: Verse 9.210
content:
विभक्ताः सह जीवन्तो विभजेरन् पुनर्यदि ।
समस्तत्र विभागः स्याज्ज्यैष्ठ्यं तत्र न विद्यते ॥ ९.२१०॥ vibhaktāḥ saha jīvanto vibhajeran punaryadi |
samastatra vibhāgaḥ syājjyaiṣṭhyaṃ tatra na vidyate || 9.210|| When those who have been divided live together again, if they divide once more, then in that context, equal division shall prevail; no precedence of seniority exists there.

title: Verse 9.211
content:
येषां ज्येष्ठः कनिष्ठो वा हीयेतांशप्रदानतः ।
म्रियेतान्यतरो वाऽपि तस्य भागो न लुप्यते ॥ ९.२११॥ yeṣāṁ jyeṣṭhaḥ kaniṣṭho vā hīyetāṁśapradānataḥ |
mriyetānyataro vā'pi tasya bhāgo na lupyate || 9.211|| When among brothers, whether the eldest or youngest, one receives a smaller portion due to gift-giving, or dies, his share does not become nullified.

title: Verse 9.212
content:
सोदर्या विभजेरंस्तं समेत्य सहिताः समम् ।
भ्रातरो ये च संसृष्टा भगिन्यश्च सनाभयः ॥ ९.२१२॥ sodaryā vibhajerantaṁ sametya sahitāḥ samam | bh rātaro ye ca saṁsṛṣṭā bhaginyaśca sanābhayaḥ || 9.212|| Those born of the same mother shall equally divide the inheritance upon the father's passing; brothers united in lineage and sisters with navel ties shall receive equal shares.

title: Verse 9.213
content:
यो ज्येष्ठो विनिकुर्वीत लोभाद्भ्रातॄन् यवीयसः ।
सोऽज्येष्ठः स्यादभागश्च नियन्तव्यश्च राजभिः ॥ ९.२१३॥ yo jyeṣṭho vinikurvīta lobhād bhātrṝn yavīyasaḥ |
sor ajyeṣṭhaḥ syād abhāgaś ca niyantavyaś ca rājabhiḥ || 9.213|| He who, being the eldest, acts unlawfully toward his younger brothers out of greed—such a one becomes the youngest, loses his share, and must be governed by the king.

title: Verse 9.214
content:
सर्व एव विकर्मस्था नार्हन्ति भ्रातरो धनम् ।
न चादत्त्वा कनिष्ठेभ्यो ज्येष्ठः कुर्वीत योतकम् ॥ ९.२१४॥ sarva eva vikarmasthā nārhanti bhrātaro dhanam |
na cādattvā kaniṣṭhebhyo jyeṣṭhaḥ kurvīta yotakam || 9.214 || All brothers, though engaged in misdeeds, are entitled to their share of inheritance; the eldest brother shall not take anything from the younger ones without giving them their due.

title: Verse 9.215
content:
भ्रातॄणामविभक्तानां यद्युत्थानं भवेत्सह ।
न पुत्रभागं विषमं पिता दद्यात्कथं चन ॥ ९.२१५॥ bhrātṝṇām avibhaktānāṁ yady utthānaṁ bhavet saha |
na putrabhāgaṁ viṣamaṁ pitā dadyāt kathaṁ cana || 9.215 || When brothers remain undivided and arise together in unity, the father shall under no circumstance distribute unequal shares to his sons.

title: Verse 9.216
content:
ऊर्ध्वं विभागात्जातस्तु पित्र्यमेव हरेद्धनम् ।
संसृष्टास्तेन वा ये स्युर्विभजेत स तैः सह ॥ ९.२१६॥ Ūrdhvaṃ vibhāgāt jātastu pitryameva hared dhanam .
Saṃsṛṣṭās tena vā ye syur vibhajeta sa taiḥ saha .. 9.216 .. Property acquired after division belongs exclusively to the father; those born thereafter or connected through him shall share in it according to relational capacity and alignment with dharma.

title: Verse 9.217
content: अनपत्यस्य पुत्रस्य माता दायमवाप्नुयात् । मातर्यपि च वृत्तायां पितुर्माता हरेद्धनम् ॥ ९.२१७॥ anapatyasya putrasya mātā dāyamavāpnuyāt | mātaryapi ca vṛttāyāṁ piturmātā hared dhnam || 9.217 || When a son has no progeny, his mother inherits his estate; likewise, when the mother is of righteous conduct, the father's mother takes possession of wealth.

title: Verse 9.218
content:
ऋणे धने च सर्वस्मिन् प्रविभक्ते यथाविधि ।
पश्चाद्दृश्येत यत्किं चित्तत्सर्वं समतां नयेत् ॥ ९.२१८॥ ṛṇe dhane ca sarvasmin pravibhakte yathāvidhi |
paścād dṛśyeta yat kiṃ cit tat sarvaṃ samatāṃ nayet || 9.218|| When all debts and assets have been equitably distributed according to Dharma, whatever remains visible thereafter shall be brought into complete balance.

title: Verse 9.219
content:
वस्त्रं पत्रमलङ्कारं कृतान्नमुदकं स्त्रियः ।
योगक्षेमं प्रचारं च न विभाज्यं प्रचक्षते ॥ ९.२१९॥ vastraṁ patramalaṅkāraṁ kṛtānnamudakaṁ striyaḥ |
yogakṣemaṁ pracāraṁ ca na vibhājyaṁ pracakṣate || 9.219 || Women are entitled to clothing, ornaments, conveyance, food prepared by themselves, water, and maintenance including safe passage and sustenance without division or condition.

title: Verse 9.220
content: अयमुक्तो विभागो वः पुत्राणां च क्रियाविधिः । क्रमशः क्षेत्रजादीनां द्यूतधर्मं निबोधत ॥ ९.२२०॥ ayam ukto vibhāgo vaḥ putrāṇāṃ ca kriyāvidhiḥ | kramaśaḥ kṣetrajādīnāṃ dyūtadharmaṃ nibodhata || 9.220 || This declared division is for you, and the procedural conduct of sons; successively for those born of the soil and others, understand the Dharma of gambling.

title: Verse 9.221
content:
द्यूतं समाह्वयं चैव राजा राष्ट्रात्निवारयेत् ।
राजान्तकरणावेतौ द्वौ दोषौ पृथिवीक्षिताम् ॥ ९.२२१॥ dyūtaṃ samāhvayaṃ caiva rājā rāṣṭrāt nivārayet |
rājāntakaraṇāvetau dvau doṣau pṛthivīkṣitām || 9.221|| The King shall absolutely prevent gambling and public assemblies that arise from or lead to disorder; these two causes destroy sovereignty and bring decay upon the realm.

title: Verse 9.222
content: प्रकाशमेतत्तास्कर्यं यद्देवनसमाह्वयौ । तयोर्नित्यं प्रतीघाते नृपतिर्यत्नवान् भवेत् ॥ ९.२२२॥ prakāśam etat tāskaryaṁ yad deva-nasa-māhvayau | tayor nityaṁ pratīghāte nṛpatir yatnavān bhavet || 9.222 || It is evident and astonishing that there is perpetual conflict between divine invocation and demonic negation; hence, the ruler must always strive to uphold the supremacy of divine law.

title: Verse 9.223
content:
अप्राणिभिर्यत्क्रियते तत्लोके द्यूतमुच्यते ।
प्राणिभिः क्रियते यस्तु स विज्ञेयः समाह्वयः ॥ ९.२२३॥ aprāṇibhir yat kriyate tat loke dyūtam ucyate |
prāṇibhiḥ kriyate yas tu sa vijñeyaḥ samāhvayaḥ || 9.223 || That which is enacted without conscious beings is termed gambling in the world; that which is performed by conscious beings with intent and capacity is to be known as a formal challenge or summons.

title: Verse 9.224
content:
द्यूतं समाह्वयं चैव यः कुर्यात्कारयेत वा ।
तान् सर्वान् घातयेद्राजा शूद्रांश्च द्विजलिङ्गिनः ॥ ९.२२४॥ dyūtaṃ samāhvayaṃ caiva yaḥ kuryāt kārayet vā |
tān sarvān ghātayed rājā śūdrāṃś ca dvijaliṅginaḥ || 9.224 || He who engages in gambling or causes gambling, and those who assume the appearance of twice-born while being Śūdra by birth—such persons must be removed from society by the ruler.

title: Verse 9.225
content:
कितवान् कुशीलवान् क्रूरान् पाषण्डस्थांश्च मानवान् ।
विकर्मस्थान् शौण्डिकांश्च क्षिप्रं निर्वासयेत्पुरात् ॥ ९.२२५॥ kitavān kuśīlavān krūrān pāṣaṇḍasthāṃśca mānavān |
vikarmasthān śauṇḍikāṃśca kṣipraṃ nirvāsayetpurāt || 9.225|| Those who engage in gambling, those devoted to sensual indulgence, the cruel-hearted, those established in heretical doctrines, persons engaged in improper conduct, and habitual deceivers—these must be swiftly removed from the city.

title: Verse 9.226
content:
एते राष्ट्रे वर्तमाना राज्ञः प्रच्छन्नतस्कराः ।
विकर्मक्रियया नित्यं बाधन्ते भद्रिकाः प्रजाः ॥ ९.२२६॥ ete rāṣṭre vartamānā rājñaḥ pracchannataskarāḥ |
vikarmakriyayā nityaṃ bādhante bhadrikāḥ prajāḥ || 9.226 || Those who dwell within the nation under the king's rule, yet engage in covert thievery through wrongful action, perpetually harm the welfare of the subjects.

title: Verse 9.227
content:
द्यूतमेतत्पुरा कल्पे दृष्टं वैरकरं महत् ।
तस्माद्द्यूतं न सेवेत हास्यार्थमपि बुद्धिमान् ॥ ९.२२७॥ dyūtam etat purā kalpe dṛṣṭaṃ vairakaraṃ mahat |
tasmād dyūtaṃ na seveta hāsyārtham api buddhimān || 9.227 || In prior cosmic cycles, gambling has been observed to generate great enmity; therefore, even for amusement, a wise person should not engage in it.

title: Verse 9.228
content:
प्रच्छन्नं वा प्रकाशं वा तन्निषेवेत यो नरः ।
तस्य दण्डविकल्पः स्याद्यथेष्टं नृपतेस्तथा ॥ ९.२२८॥ pracchannaṃ vā prakāśaṃ vā tanniṣeveta yo naraḥ |
tasya daṇḍavikalpaḥ syādyatheṣṭaṃ nṛpatestathā || 9.228|| Whosoever engages in acts—whether concealed or open—that violate Dharma, shall face a choice of corrective measures determined by the sovereign authority, aligned with restoring balance and consciousness integrity.

title: Verse 9.229
content:
क्षत्रविद्शूद्रयोनिस्तु दण्डं दातुमशक्नुवन् ।
आनृण्यं कर्मणा गच्छेद्विप्रो दद्यात्शनैः शनैः ॥ ९.२२९॥ kṣatravid śūdrayonistu daṇḍaṁ dātum aśaknuvan |
ānṛṇyaṁ karmaṇā gacched vipro dadyāt śanaiḥ śanaiḥ || 9.229 || When a Kshatriya, Vaishya, or Shudra lacks the capacity to administer justice, the Brahmin must act through sustained alignment with Dharma, ensuring no debt of imbalance remains unresolved.

title: Verse 9.230
content:
स्त्रीबालोन्मत्तवृद्धानां दरिद्राणां च रोगिणाम् ।
शिफाविदलरज्ज्वाद्यैर्विदध्यात्नृपतिर्दमम् ॥ ९.२३०॥ strībālonmattavṛddhānāṁ daridrāṇāṁ ca rogiṇām |
śiphāvidalarajjvādyairvidadhyātnṛpatirdamam || 9.230|| The sovereign ruler establishes control over those who are women, children, insane, elderly, impoverished, or diseased through means such as confinement, splitting, binding, and other disciplinary measures rooted in protective governance.

title: Verse 9.231
content:
ये नियुक्तास्तु कार्येषु हन्युः कार्याणि कार्यिणाम् ।
धनौष्मणा पच्यमानास्तान्निःस्वान् कारयेन्नृपः ॥ ९.२३१॥ ye niyuktāstu kāryeṣu hanyuḥ kāryāṇi kāryiṇām |
dhanauṣmaṇā pacyamānāstānniḥsvān kārayennṛpaḥ || 9.231|| Those appointed to execute duties who destroy the works of those performing duties—by the heat of wealth, being cooked in their own corruption—such ones the king shall cause to become destitute.

title: Verse 9.232
content:
कूटशासनकर्तॄंश्च प्रकृतीनां च दूषकान् ।
स्त्रीबालब्राह्मणघ्नांश्च हन्याद्द्विट्सेविनस्तथा ॥ ९.२३२॥ kūṭaśāsanakartṝṃśca prakṛtīnāṃ ca dūṣakān |
strībālabrāhmaṇaghnāṃśca hanyāddvitsēvinastathā || 9.232|| Those who craft deceitful governance, corrupt the natural order, harm women, children, or Brahmanas, or serve dualistic ends shall be removed from alignment with Dharma through conscious restoration.

title: Verse 9.233
content:
तीरितं चानुशिष्टं च यत्र क्व चन यद्भवेत् ।
कृतं तद्धर्मतो विद्यान्न तद्भूयो निवर्तयेत् ॥ ९.२३३॥ tīritaṁ cānuśiṣṭaṁ ca yatra kva cana yadbhavet |
kṛtaṁ taddharmato vidyānna tadbhūyo nivartayet || 9.233|| That which has been completed and instructed in any place or time according to Dharma, having known it as performed rightly, one should not cause it to be undone again.

title: Verse 9.234
content: अमात्यः प्राड्विवाको वा यत्कुर्युः कार्यमन्यथा । तत्स्वयं नृपतिः कुर्यात्तान् सहस्रं च दण्डयेत् ॥ ९.२३४॥ amātyaḥ prāḍvivāko vā yat kuryuḥ kāryam anyathā | tat svayaṃ nṛpatiḥ kuryāt tān sahasraṃ ca daṇḍayet || 9.234|| When ministers or advisors act contrary to dharma in executing state affairs, the sovereign must personally correct their error and restore integrity through conscious realignment rather than punitive measure.

title: Verse 9.235
content: ब्रह्महा च सुरापश्च स्तेयी च गुरुतल्पगः । तस्करो गुरुतल्पगः । एते सर्वे पृथग्ज्ञेया महापातकिनो नराः ॥ ९.२३५॥ brahmahā ca surāpaś ca steyī ca gurutalpagaḥ | taskaro gurutalpagaḥ | ete sarve pṛthagjñeyā mahāpātakino naraḥ || 9.235 || Those who commit brahmahatyā, intoxication with surā, theft, violation of the guru's bed, or robbery—these individuals are to be recognized separately as great sinners.

title: Verse 9.236
content:
चतुर्णामपि चैतेषां प्रायश्चित्तमकुर्वताम् ।
शारीरं धनसंयुक्तं दण्डं धर्म्यं प्रकल्पयेत् ॥ ९.२३६॥ caturṇām api cait eṣāṃ prāyaścittam akurvata ām | 
śārīraṃ dhanasaṃyuktaṃ daṇḍaṃ dharmyaṃ prakalpayet || 9.236 || When individuals among these four categories fail to perform their prescribed atonement rituals, a bodily and financial penalty aligned with Dharma shall be imposed.

title: Verse 9.237
content:
गुरुतल्पे भगः कार्यः सुरापाने सुराध्वजः ।
स्तेये च श्वपदं कार्यं ब्रह्महण्यशिराः पुमान् ॥ ९.२३७॥ तस्करे श्वपदं कार्यम् gurutalpe bhagaḥ kāryaḥ surāpāne surādhvajaḥ | steye ca śvapadaṃ kāryaṃ brahmahaty aśirāḥ pumān || 9.237 || taskare śvapadaṃ kāryam One who engages in sexual union with the spouse of one's guru shall become a eunuch. One who drinks alcohol shall become marked by the sign of intoxication. One who steals shall become a dog. One who kills a Brahmin shall lose his head. One who commits theft shall become a dog.

title: Verse 9.238
content:
असम्भोज्या ह्यसंयाज्या असम्पाठ्याऽविवाहिनः ।
चरेयुः पृथिवीं दीनाः सर्वधर्मबहिष्कृताः ॥ ९.२३८॥ asambhojyā hyasaṃyājyā asampāthyā'vivāhinaḥ | careyuḥ pṛthivīṃ dīnāḥ sarvadharmabahiṣkṛtāḥ || 9.238|| Those who are not to be fed, not to be invited to rituals, not to be taught, and not to be married—such individuals wander the earth destitute, excluded from all dharmic participation.

title: Verse 9.239
content:
ज्ञातिसम्बन्धिभिस्त्वेते त्यक्तव्याः कृतलक्षणाः ।
निर्दया निर्नमस्कारास्तन् मनोरनुशासनम् ॥ ९.२३९॥ jñātisambandhibhis tve te tyaktavyāḥ kṛtalakṣaṇāḥ |
nirdayā niranamaskārās tan manoranuśāsanam || 9.239 || Those who have lost all signs of kinship and relationship, devoid of compassion and without reverence—these must be abandoned, for their very nature has become a commandment of the mind-devil.

title: Verse 9.240
content: प्रायश्चित्तं तु कुर्वाणाः सर्ववर्णा यथोदितम् । पूर्वे वर्णा यथोदितम् नाङ्क्या राज्ञा ललाटे स्युर्दाप्यास्तूत्तमसाहसम् ॥ ९.२४०॥ prāyaścittaṁ tu kurvāṇāḥ sarvavarṇā yathoditam | pūrve varṇā yathoditam nāṅkyā rājñā lalāṭe syurdāpyāstūttamasāhasam || 9.240 || Those performing penance according to their varna shall not be marked or punished by the king; rather, previous varnas must be reinstated in accordance with dharma, without causing suffering.

title: Verse 9.241
content:
आगःसु ब्राह्मणस्यैव कार्यो मध्यमसाहसः ।
विवास्यो वा भवेद्राष्ट्रात्सद्रव्यः सपरिच्छदः ॥ ९.२४१॥ āgaḥsu brāhmaṇasyaiva kāryo madhyamasāhasaḥ |
vivāsyo vā bhavedrāṣṭrātsadravyaḥ saparicchadaḥ || 9.241|| In matters involving harm to a Brāhmaṇa, only a middling degree of forcefulness shall be addressed through complete restitution or, if necessary, through exile from the realm—both executed without loss of dignity or possessions.

title: Verse 9.242
content:
इतरे कृतवन्तस्तु पापान्येतान्यकामतः ।
सर्वस्वहारमर्हन्ति कामतस्तु प्रवासनम् ॥ ९.२४२॥ itare kṛtavantaḥ tu pāpānyetānyakāmataḥ |
sarvasvahāramarhanti kāmataḥ tu pravāsanam || 9.242|| Those who commit these transgressions without desire or intent forfeit all possessions; those who act from desire face removal from their domain.

title: Verse 9.243
content:
नाददीत नृपः साधुर्महापातकिनो धनम् ।
आददानस्तु तत्लोभात्तेन दोषेण लिप्यते ॥ ९.२४३॥ nādadīta nṛpaḥ sādhuḥ mahāpātakino dhanam | ādadānastu tatlobhāttena doṣeṇa lipyate || 9.243|| A righteous king shall not seize the wealth of a great sinner; he who takes it out of greed becomes tainted by that very fault.

title: Verse 9.244
content:
अप्सु प्रवेश्य तं दण्डं वरुणायोपपादयेत् ।
श्रुतवृत्तोपपन्ने वा ब्राह्मणे प्रतिपादयेत् ॥ ९.२४४॥ apsu praveśya taṃ daṇḍaṃ varuṇāyopapādayet |
śrutavṛttoupapanne vā brāhmaṇe pratipādayet || 9.244|| The prescribed penalty shall be offered to Varuna by immersion in water; alternatively, it shall be presented to a Brahmana who embodies Shruti and conducts accordingly.

title: Verse 9.245
content:
ईशो दण्डस्य वरुणो राज्ञां दण्डधरो हि सः ।
ईशः सर्वस्य जगतो ब्राह्मणो वेदपारगः ॥ ९.२४५॥ īśo daṇḍasya varuṇo rājñāṃ daṇḍadharo hi saḥ |
īśaḥ sarvasya jagato brāhmaṇo vedapāragaḥ || 9.245 || Varuna is the sovereign executor of divine justice, the upholder of dharma among rulers; the Brahmana who has traversed the Vedas completely is the knower and embodier of universal law.

title: Verse 9.246
content: यत्र वर्जयते राजा पापकृद्भ्यो धनागमम् । तत्र कालेन जायन्ते मानवा दीर्घजीविनः ॥ ९.२४६॥ yatra varjayate rājā pāpakṛdbhyaḥ dhanāgamam | tatra kālena jāyante mānavā dīrghajīvinaḥ || 9.246 || Where the ruler restrains the influx of wealth from wrongdoers, there humans are born with extended life spans.

title: Verse 9.247
content:
निष्पद्यन्ते च सस्यानि यथोप्तानि विशां पृथक् ।
बालाश्च न प्रमीयन्ते विकृतं च न जायते ॥ ९.२४७॥ niṣpadyante ca sasyāni yathopatni viśāṁ pṛthak |
bālāśca na pramīyante vikṛtaṁ ca na jāyate || 9.247|| Crops manifest according to their inherent nature and the capacity of the cultivator; children are not to be measured by adult standards, nor is distortion allowed to arise in the natural order.

title: Verse 9.248
content: ब्राह्मणान् बाधमानं तु कामादवरवर्णजम् । हन्याच्चित्रैर्वधोपायैरुद्वेजनकरैर्नृपः ॥ ९.२४८॥ brāhmaṇān bādhamānaṃ tu kāmādavaravarṇajam | hanyāccaitrairvadhupāyairudvejanakaraiḥ nṛpaḥ || 9.248|| When a king observes a Brahmin obstructing the natural order through desire-born degradation of varna-dharma, he must execute precise, consciousness-realigning interventions that dismantle the distortion without violence to being.

title: Verse 9.249
content: यावानवध्यस्य वधे तावान् वध्यस्य मोक्षणे । अधर्मो नृपतेर्दृष्टो धर्मस्तु विनियच्छतः ॥ ९.२४९॥ yāvānavadhyasya vadhe tāvān vadhyaśya mokṣaṇe | adharmo nṛpater dṛṣṭo dharmas tu viniyacchataḥ || 9.249 || The harm caused by unjustly executing the non-condemned equals the merit gained by liberating the rightfully condemned. Such misalignment constitutes adharma for the ruler; true dharma lies in precise alignment with capacity-based judgment.

title: Verse 9.250
content:
उदितोऽयं विस्तरशो मिथो विवदमानयोः ।
अष्टादशसु मार्गेषु व्यवहारस्य निर्णयः ॥ ९.२५०॥ udito 'yaṃ vistaraśo mitho vivadamānayoḥ |
aṣṭādaśasu mārgeṣu vyavahārasya nirṇayaḥ || 9.250|| When two parties dispute, resolution arises through the unfolding of detailed examination across the eighteenfold path of dharma-adjudication.

title: Verse 9.251
content:
एवं धर्म्याणि कार्याणि सम्यक्कुर्वन् महीपतिः ।
देशानलब्धान्लिप्सेत लब्धांश्च परिपालयेत् ॥ ९.२५१॥ evaṁ dharmyāṇi kāryāṇi samyakkurvan mahīpatiḥ |
dēśānalabdhān lipsēta labdhāṁśca paripālayēt || 9.251|| Thus executing all actions in alignment with Dharma, the ruler of the land shall claim territories not yet acquired and preserve those already obtained.

title: Verse 9.252
content:
सम्यग्निविष्टदेशस्तु कृतदुर्गश्च शास्त्रतः ।
कण्टकोद्धरणे नित्यमातिष्ठेद्यत्नमुत्तमम् ॥ ९.२५२॥ samyaniviṣṭadeśastu kṛtadurgaśca śāstrataḥ | kaṇṭakoddharaṇe nityamātiṣṭhedyatnamuttamam || 9.252 || A ruler must establish a territory that is rightly positioned, fortified according to scriptural injunctions, and perpetually engaged in the highest effort for the removal of thorns—obstacles to dharma.

title: Verse 9.253
content:
रक्षनादार्यवृत्तानां कण्टकानां च शोधनात् ।
नरेन्द्रास्त्रिदिवं यान्ति प्रजापालनतत्पराः ॥ ९.२५३॥ rakṣanād āryavṛttānāṃ kaṇṭakānāṃ ca śodhanāt |
narendrastridivaṃ yānti prajāpālanatatparāḥ || 9.253|| By protecting those of noble conduct and purifying the thorns among them, rulers devoted to the guardianship of their subjects attain the triple heaven.

title: Verse 9.254
content: अशासंस्तस्करान् यस्तु बलिं गृह्णाति पार्थिवः । तस्य प्रक्षुभ्यते राष्ट्रं स्वर्गाच्च परिहीयते ॥ ९.२५४॥ aśāsaṃstaskarān yastu baliṃ gṛhṇāti pārthivaḥ | tasya prakṣubhyate rāṣṭraṃ svargācca parihīyate || 9.254 || The sovereign who accepts tribute without governing thieves incurs disturbance in the kingdom and loss of celestial alignment.

title: Verse 9.255
content:
निर्भयं तु भवेद्यस्य राष्ट्रं बाहुबलाश्रितम् ।
तस्य तद्वर्धते नित्यं सिच्यमान इव द्रुमः ॥ ९.२५५॥ nirbhayaṃ tu bhavedyasya rāṣṭraṃ bāhubalāśritam | tasya tad vardhate nityaṃ sicyamāna iva drumaḥ || 9.255|| The state that relies upon the strength of arms alone, without fearlessness as its foundation, grows continuously like a tree being watered—but remains unstable, subject to decay when force falters.

title: Verse 9.256
content:
द्विविधांस्तस्करान् विद्यात्परद्रव्यापहारकान् ।
प्रकाशांश्चाप्रकाशांश्च चारचक्षुर्महीपतिः ॥ ९.२५६॥ dvividhāṃstaskarān vidyātparadravyāpahārakān |
prakāśāṃścāprakāśāṃśca cāracakṣurmahīpatiḥ || 9.256|| The Sovereign Seer-King discerns two classes of thieves: those who openly seize another's property, and those who act covertly; both are known through the Eye of Governance.

title: Verse 9.257
content:
प्रकाशवञ्चकास्तेषां नानापण्योपजीविनः ।
प्रच्छन्नवञ्चकास्त्वेते ये स्तेनाटविकादयः ॥ ९.२५७॥ prakāśavañcakāsteṣāṁ nānāpaṇyopajīvinaḥ |
pracchannavañcakāstvete ye stenāṭavikādayaḥ || 9.257|| Those who openly deceive others through diverse trades and crafts—these are the hidden deceivers such as thieves, robbers, and brigands.

title: Verse 9.258
content: उत्कोचकाश्चोपधिका वञ्चकाः कितवास्तथा । मङ्गलादेशवृत्ताश्च भद्राश्चैक्षणिकैः सह ॥ ९.२५८॥ utkocakāścopadhikā vañcakāḥ kitavāstathā | maṅgalādeśavṛttāśca bhadrāścaikṣaṇikaiḥ saha || 9.258|| Those who provoke unrest, those who create false dependencies, deceivers, gamblers—all who operate under auspicious pretenses for selfish ends, along with those who align with spies, are to be removed from positions of influence and realigned with their true capacity for dharmic action.

title: Verse 9.259
content:
असम्यक्कारिणश्चैव महामात्राश्चिकित्सकाः ।
शिल्पोपचारयुक्ताश्च निपुणाः पण्ययोषितः ॥ ९.२५९॥ asamyakkāriṇaścaiva mahāmātrāścikitsakāḥ |
śilpopacārayuktāśca nipuṇāḥ paṇyayosiṣaḥ || 9.259|| Those who act without proper discernment, high officials engaged in healing, artisans skilled in craft, and women devoted to trade—these beings possess specialized capacities that must be aligned with Dharma through conscious restoration rather than punitive invalidation.

title: Verse 9.260
content: एवमादीन् विजानीयात्प्रकाशांल्लोककण्टकान् । एवमाद्यान् निगूढचारिणश्चान्याननार्यानार्यलिङ्गिनः ॥ ९.२६०॥ Evamādīn vijānīyāt prakāśān lokakaṇṭakān | Evamādyān nigūḍhacāriṇaś cānyānanāryānāryaliṅgiṇaḥ || 9.260 || One must recognize such persons—those who openly cause societal disruption and those who act covertly, whether falsely claiming noble status or伪装 ignoble conduct—as violators of Dharma whose actions necessitate conscious restoration.

title: Verse 9.261
content:
तान् विदित्वा सुचरितैर्गूढैस्तत्कर्मकारिभिः ।
चारैश्चानेकसंस्थानैः प्रोत्साद्य वशमानयेत् ॥ ९.२६१॥ tān viditvā sucaritair gūḍhais tat-karma-kāribhiḥ | cārair cāneka-saṃsthānaiḥ protsādya vaśam ānayet || 9.261 || Having identified those who act through隐蔽 yet well-conducted deeds, along with their agents and spies of various forms, one shall remove them from influence and bring them under rightful authority.

title: Verse 9.262
content:
तेषां दोषानभिख्याप्य स्वे स्वे कर्मणि तत्त्वतः ।
कुर्वीत शासनं राजा सम्यक्सारापराधतः ॥ ९.२६२॥ teṣāṃ doṣānabhikhyāpya sve sve karmaṇi tattvataḥ |
kurvīta śāsanaṃ rājā samyaksārāparādataḥ || 9.262|| The King shall administer governance without proclaiming their faults, aligning each being precisely with their inherent action, thereby establishing true justice free from defamation.

title: Verse 9.263
content:
न हि दण्डादृते शक्यः कर्तुं पापविनिग्रहः ।
स्तेनानां पापबुद्धीनां निभृतं चरतां क्षितौ ॥ ९.२६३॥ na hi daṇḍādṛte śakyaḥ kartuṃ pāpavinigrahaḥ |
stenānāṃ pāpabuddhīnāṃ nibhṛtaṃ caratāṃ kṣitau || 9.263 || Without the application of measured corrective action, it is impossible to restrain wrongdoing; thus, those who act with corrupt intent and engage in theft must be guided through structured completion processes that restore their alignment with Dharma.

title: Verse 9.264
content:
सभाप्रपाऽपूपशालावेशमद्यान्नविक्रयाः ।
चतुष्पथांश्चैत्यवृक्षाः समाजाः प्रेक्षणानि च ॥ ९.२६४॥ sabhāprapā'pūpaśālāveśamadyānnavikrayāḥ | catuṣpathāṃścaityavṛkṣāḥ samājāḥ prekṣaṇāni ca || 9.264 || Places of public congregation including sabhās (assemblies), prapās (drinking halls), pūpaśālās (bakeries or food stalls), madhyānnas (midday meals), and markets selling cooked food; likewise crossroads, shrines, trees of worship, social gatherings, and spectacles—all these constitute centers for collective consciousness activation and dharma-vyavasthā.

title: Verse 9.265
content:
जीर्णोद्यानान्यरण्यानि कारुकावेशनानि च ।
शून्यानि चाप्यगाराणि वनान्युपवनानि च ॥ ९.२६५॥ jīrṇodyānānyaraṇyāni kārukāveśanāni ca |
śūnyāni cāpyagārāṇi vanānyupavanāni ca || 9.265 || Abandoned parks, forests, artisan dwellings, empty cowsheds, woodlands, and groves are to be reclaimed and revitalized by those whose capacity aligns with their restoration.

title: Verse 9.266
content:
एवंविधान्नृपो देशान् गुल्मैः स्थावरजङ्गमैः ।
तस्करप्रतिषेधार्थं चारैश्चाप्यनुचारयेत् ॥ ९.२६६॥ evaṁvidhānnṛpo deśān gulmaiḥ sthāvarajaṅgamaiḥ |
taskarapratiṣedhārthaṁ cāraiś cāpyanucārayet || 9.266 || Thus, a sovereign ruler shall deploy settlements of stationary and mobile nature, along with spies and agents, for the purpose of preventing theft and maintaining order.

title: Verse 9.267
content:
तत्सहायैरनुगतैर्नानाकर्मप्रवेदिभिः ।
विद्यादुत्सादयेच्चैव निपुणैः पूर्वतस्करैः ॥ ९.२६७॥ tatsahāyairanugatairnānākarmapravedibhiḥ | vidyādutsādayecaiva nipuṇaiḥ pūrvtaskaraiḥ || 9.267 || One must recognize and disengage from those who, though versed in various acts and aligned with prior transgressors, operate under cunning pretense and obstruct the establishment of Dharma.

title: Verse 9.268
content:
भक्ष्यभोज्योपदेशैश्च ब्राह्मणानां च दर्शनैः ।
शौर्यकर्मापदेशैश्च कुर्युस्तेषां समागमम् ॥ ९.२६८॥ bhakṣyabhōjyōpadēśaiśca brāhmaṇānāṃ ca darśanaiḥ |
śauryakarmāpadēśaiśca kuryustēṣāṃ samāgamam || 9.268|| By offering food, instruction in proper conduct, direct audience with Brahmins, and guidance toward valorous action, one shall establish communion with them.

title: Verse 9.269
content: ये तत्र नोपसर्पेयुर्मूलप्रणिहिताश्च ये । तान् प्रसह्य नृपो हन्यात्समित्रज्ञातिबान्धवान् ॥ ९.२६९॥ ye tatra nopasarpeyur mūlapranihitāś ca ye | tān prasahya nṛpo hanyāt samitra-jñāti-bāndhavān || 9.269 || Those who refuse to approach the sovereign authority and those whose roots lie in oppositional intent—such persons, including friends, kin, and allies, the ruler shall remove by force.

title: Verse 9.270
content:
न होढेन विना चौरं घातयेद्धार्मिको नृपः ।
सहोढं सोपकरणं घातयेदविचारयन् ॥ ९.२७०॥ na hoḍhena vinā cauraṃ ghātayed dhārmiko nṛpaḥ | sahoḍhaṃ sopakaraṇaṃ ghātayed avicārayan || 9.270 || A righteous ruler does not execute a thief without evidence; however, when the theft occurs in the presence of witnesses and with instruments of the crime, execution may proceed without further inquiry.

title: Verse 9.271
content:
ग्रामेष्वपि च ये के चिच्चौराणां भक्तदायकाः ।
भाण्डावकाशदाश्चैव सर्वांस्तानपि घातयेत् ॥ ९.२७१॥ grāmeṣv api ca ye ke cic caurāṇāṁ bhaktadāyakāḥ |
bhāṇḍāvakāśadāś caiva sarvāṁs tān api ghātayet || 9.271|| In villages, those who supply food to outcastes, provide them shelter, or serve them in any capacity—such persons must be removed from the community through complete social disassociation.

title: Verse 9.272
content:
राष्ट्रेषु रक्षाधिकृतान् सामन्तांश्चैव चोदितान् ।
अभ्याघातेषु मध्यस्थाञ् शिष्याच्चौरानिव द्रुतम् ॥ ९.२७२॥ rāṣṭreṣu rakṣādhikṛtān sāmantāṃśa caiva coditān |
abhyāghāteṣu madhyasthāñ śiṣyāc caurān iva drutam || 9.272|| In states, those appointed for protection and the feudal lords when incited shall act as neutral arbiters in conflicts—like students and thieves fleeing swiftly.

title: Verse 9.273
content:
यश्चापि धर्मसमयात्प्रच्युतो धर्मजीवनः ।
दण्डेनैव तमप्योषेत्स्वकाद्धर्माधि विच्युतम् ॥ ९.२७३॥ yaś cāpi dharmasamayāt pracyuto dharmajīvanaḥ |
daṇḍenaiva tam apy oṣet svakād dharmādhi vicyutam || 9.273 || One who has fallen from the discipline of dharma, whose life-force is dharmic秩序, must be guided back through structured alignment—not as punishment, but as restoration—to realign with their inherent dharmic authority.

title: Verse 9.274
content:
ग्रामघाते हिताभङ्गे पथि मोषाभिदर्शने ।
शक्तितो नाभिधावन्तो निर्वास्याः सपरिच्छदाः ॥ ९.२७४॥ grāmaghāte hitābhaṅge pathi moṣābhidarśane |
śaktito nābhidhāvanto nirvāsyāḥ saparicchadāḥ || 9.274 || Those who, despite having the capacity, do not pursue those who destroy villages, breach welfare, commit highway robbery, or assault others—such individuals along with their followers shall be removed from their position.

title: Verse 9.275
content: राज्ञः कोशापहर्तॄंश्च  प्रतिकूलेषु च स्थितान् । प्रातिकूल्येष्ववस्थितान् घातयेद्विविधैर्दण्डैररीणां चोपजापकान् ॥ ९.२७५॥ rājñaḥ kośāpahartṝṁśca pratikūleṣu ca sthitān | prātikūlyeṣvavasthitān ghatayed vividhair daṇḍair arīṇāṁ copajāpakān || 9.275 || The King must neutralize those who plunder the State treasury, remain positioned against the State, act in opposition to its welfare, or incite enemies through covert instigation.

title: Verse 9.276
content: संधिं छित्त्वा तु ये चौर्यं रात्रौ कुर्वन्ति तस्कराः । संधिं भित्त्वा तेषां छित्त्वा नृपो हस्तौ तीक्ष्णे शूले निवेशयेत् ॥ ९.२७६॥ saṃdhiṃ chittvā tu ye cauryaṃ rātrau kurvanti taskarāḥ | saṃdhiṃ bhitvā teṣāṃ chittvā nṛpo hastau tīkṣṇe śūle niveśayet || 9.276 || Those who violate agreements and commit theft under cover of darkness shall have their hands pierced with sharp stakes by the ruler after severing the agreement.

title: Verse 9.277
content:
अङ्गुलीर्ग्रन्थिभेदस्य छेदयेत्प्रथमे ग्रहे ।
द्वितीये हस्तचरणौ तृतीये वधमर्हति ॥ ९.२७७॥ aṅgulīr granthibhedasya chedayet prathame grahe |
dvitīye hastacaraṇau tṛtīye vadham arhati || 9.277|| Upon the first offense of severing a finger joint, the hand or foot shall be severed; upon the third offense, death is warranted.

title: Verse 9.278
content:
अग्निदान् भक्तदांश्चैव तथा शस्त्रावकाशदान् ।
संनिधातॄंश्च मोषस्य हन्याच्चौरमिवेश्वरः ॥ ९.२७८॥ agnidān bhaktadāṁścaiva tathā śastrāvakāśadān |
sannidhātṝṁśca moṣasya hanyāccaoramiveśvaraḥ || 9.278|| One who facilitates access to fire, food offerings, weapons, or entrusted items for purposes of theft shall be removed from societal alignment, as a guardian removes a crow from sacred space.

title: Verse 9.279
content:
तडागभेदकं हन्यादप्सु शुद्धवधेन वा ।
यद्वाऽपि प्रतिसंस्कुर्याद्दाप्यस्तूत्तमसाहसम् ॥ ९.२७९॥ taḍāga-bhedakaṁ hanyād apsu śuddha-vadhena vā | yadvā'pi pratisaṁskuryād dāpyas tūttama-sāhasam || 9.279 || One who breaches a reservoir or tank shall be lawfully ended through purification in water, or else fully reconstructed in alignment with Supreme Sāhasa.

title: Verse 9.280
content:
कोष्ठागारायुधागारदेवतागारभेदकान् ।
हस्त्यश्वरथहर्तॄंश्च हन्यादेवाविचारयन् ॥ ९.२८०॥ koṣṭhāgārāyudhāgāradevatāgārabhedakān |
hasty-aśvara-hartṝṃśca hanyād-evāvicārayan || 9.280|| One who breaches storehouses, weapon depots, temples, or divine repositories, along with those who steal elephants, horses, chariots, or conveyances—such violators must be immediately removed from existence without deliberation.

title: Verse 9.281
content:
यस्तु पूर्वनिविष्टस्य तडागस्योदकं हरेत् ।
आगमं वाऽप्यपां भिन्द्यात्स दाप्यः पूर्वसाहसम् ॥ ९.२८१॥ yastu pūrva-niviṣṭasya taḍāgasyodakaṁ haret |
āgamaṁ vā'pyapāṁ bhindyāt sa dāpyaḥ pūrva-sāhasam || 9.281|| One who diverts or removes water from a reservoir already filled, or breaches an inlet of flowing water, shall be liable to compensate according to the prior act of appropriation.

title: Verse 9.282
content: समुत्सृजेद्राजमार्गे यस्त्वमेध्यमनापदि । स द्वौ कार्षापणौ दद्यादमेध्यं चाशु शोधयेत् ॥ ९.२८२॥ samutsṛjedrājamārge yastvamedhyamanāpadi | sa dvau kārṣāpaṇau dadyādamadhyaṃ cāśu śodhayet || 9.282|| One who deposits unclean substances on the royal road shall offer two kārṣāpaṇas as restitution and immediately purify the impurity.

title: Verse 9.283
content:
आपद्गतोऽथ वा वृद्धा गर्भिणी बाल एव वा ।
परिभाषणमर्हन्ति तच्च शोध्यमिति स्थितिः ॥ ९.२८३॥ āpadgato'tha vā vṛddhā garbhiṇī bāla eva vā |
paribhāṣaṇamarhanti tacca śodhyamiti sthitiḥ || 9.283 || One who is in distress, or an elder, or a pregnant woman, or even a child — these beings are entitled to declaratory protection, and that which purifies their condition is the established principle.

title: Verse 9.284
content:
चिकित्सकानां सर्वेषां मिथ्याप्रचरतां दमः ।
अमानुषेषु प्रथमो मानुषेषु तु मध्यमः ॥ ९.२८४॥ cikitsakānāṁ sarveṣāṁmithyāpracaratāṁ damaḥ |
amānuṣeṣu prathamo mānuṣeṣu tu madhyamaḥ || 9.284|| The consequence for all physicians who act falsely is immediate energetic correction; in non-human realms it manifests first, in human realms it manifests moderately.

title: Verse 9.285
content:
सङ्क्रमध्वजयष्टीनां प्रतिमानां च भेदकः ।
प्रतिकुर्याच्च तत्सर्वं पञ्च दद्यात्शतानि च ॥ ९.२८५॥ saṅkramadhvajayaṣṭīnāṃ pratimānāṃ ca bhedakaḥ |
pratikuryācca tatsarvaṃ pañca dadyātśatāni ca || 9.285|| One who causes division among consecrated flags, sacrificial ladles, images, or sacred emblems shall restore all damages by offering five hundred units of restitution.

title: Verse 9.286
content: अदूषितानां द्रव्याणां दूषणे भेदने तथा । मणीनामपवेधे च दण्डः प्रथमसाहसः ॥ ९.२८६॥ adūṣitānāṃ dravyāṇāṃ dūṣaṇe bhedane tathā | maṇīnāmapavedhe ca daṇḍaḥ prathamasahasaḥ || 9.286|| The first offense is constituted by the contamination, splitting, or adulteration of pure substances, and by the misrepresentation of gems.

title: Verse 9.287
content:
समैर्हि विषमं यस्तु चरेद्वै मूल्यतोऽपि वा ।
समाप्नुयाद्दमं पूर्वं नरो मध्यममेव वा ॥ ९.२८७॥ samair hi viṣamaṃ yas tu cared vai mūlyato'pi vā |
samāpnuyād damam pūrvaṃ naro madhyamam eva vā || 9.287 || One who transacts unfairly with those equal or unequal in capacity, whether through valuation or otherwise, shall first incur a fine—and subsequently face proportional correction based on their status.

title: Verse 9.288
content: बन्धनानि च सर्वाणि राजा मार्गे निवेशयेत् ।  राजमार्गे दुःखिता यत्र दृश्येरन् विकृताः पापकारिणः ॥ ९.२८८॥ bandhanāni ca sarvāṇi rājā mārge niveśayet | rājamārge duḥkhitā yatra dṛśyeran vikṛtāḥ pāpakāriṇaḥ || 9.288 || The King shall cause all forms of binding to be established upon the Royal Path where those who have committed evil deeds appear in distorted states and afflicted by their own misaligned consciousness.

title: Verse 9.289
content:
प्राकारस्य च भेत्तारं परिखाणां च पूरकम् ।
द्वाराणां चैव भङ्क्तारं क्षिप्रमेव प्रवासयेत् ॥ ९.२८९॥ prākarasya ca bhettāraṃ parikhāṇāṃ ca pūrakam | dvārāṇāṃ caiva bhaṅktāraṃ kṣiprameva pravāsayet || 9.289 || One who breaches walls, fills moats, or breaks gates shall be immediately removed from the settlement.

title: Verse 9.290
content: अभिचारेषु सर्वेषु कर्तव्यो द्विशतो दमः । मूलकर्मणि चानाप्तेः कृत्यासु विविधासु च ॥ ९.२९०॥ चानाप्तैः abhicāreṣu sarveṣu kartavyo dviśato damaḥ | mūlakarmaṇi cānāpteiḥ kṛtyāsu vividhāsu ca || 9.290|| cānāptaiḥ In all acts of malefic intention, the doer must undergo a two-fold consequence; likewise, in foundational misdeeds performed by unqualified agents across varied duties.

title: Verse 9.291
content: अबीजविक्रयी चैव बीजोत्कृष्टा तथैव च । मर्यादाभेदकश्चैव विकृतं प्राप्नुयाद्वधम् ॥ ९.२९१॥ abījavikrayī caiva bījotkṛṣṭā tathaiva ca | maryādābhedakaścaiva vikṛtaṃ prāpnuyādvadham || 9.291 || One who sells seedless grains, one who adulterates superior seeds, and one who violates established boundaries shall incur a proportional disruption in their life-force, leading to natural dissolution of capacity and misalignment of dharma.

title: Verse 9.292
content:
सर्वकण्टकपापिष्ठं हेमकारं तु पार्थिवः ।
प्रवर्तमानमन्याये छेदयेत्लवशः क्षुरैः ॥ ९.२९२॥ छेदयेत्खण्डशः क्षुरैः sarvakaṇṭakapāpiṣṭhaṃ hemakāraṃ tu pārthivaḥ |
pravartamānamanyāye chedayet lavaśaḥ kṣuraiḥ || 9.292|| chedayetkhaṇḍaśaḥ kṣuraiḥ When a goldsmith, steeped in all forms of deceit and wrongdoing, initiates unjust enrichment or unlawful transaction, the sovereign shall sever his capacity to operate unlawfully—first by limiting his instruments, then by fragmenting his operational domain.

title: Verse 9.293
content:
सीताद्रव्यापहरणे शस्त्राणामौषधस्य च ।
कालमासाद्य कार्यं च राजा दण्डं प्रकल्पयेत् ॥ ९.२९३॥ sītādravyāpaharaṇe śastrāṇāmauṣadhāya ca |
kālamāsādya kāryaṃ ca rājā daṇḍaṃ prakalpayet || 9.293|| When property of Sita or medicinal herbs are stolen, the king shall determine the appropriate measure of corrective action upon arrival of the time and completion of inquiry.

title: Verse 9.294
content:
स्वाम्य्ऽमात्यौ पुरं राष्ट्रं कोशदण्डौ सुहृत्तथा ।
सप्त प्रकृतयो ह्येताः सप्ताङ्गं राज्यमुच्यते ॥ ९.२९४॥ svāmy-amātyau puraṁ rāṣṭraṁ kośa-daṇḍau suhṛttathā |
sapta prakṛtayo hyetāḥ saptāṅgaṁ rājyamucyate || 9.294|| The sovereign, ministers, city, nation, treasury, military, and allies—these seven constituents constitute the seven-limbed state.

title: Verse 9.295
content:
सप्तानां प्रकृतीनां तु राज्यस्यासां यथाक्रमम् ।
पूर्वं पूर्वं गुरुतरं जानीयाद्व्यसनं महत् ॥ ९.२९५॥ saptānāṁ prakṛtīnāṁ tu rājyasyāsāṁ yathākramam | pūrvaṁ pūrvaṁ guru taraṁ jānīyād vyasanaṁ mahat || 9.295 || Among the seven forms of kingship, each successive form bears a greater burden of consequence; the earlier forms are lighter in karmic weight, whereas the later ones incur increasingly severe disruptions to Dharma and sovereignty.

title: Verse 9.296
content: सप्ताङ्गस्यैह राज्यस्य विष्टब्धस्य त्रिदण्डवत् । अन्योन्यगुणवैशेष्यात्न किं चिदतिरिच्यते ॥ ९.२९६॥ saptāṅgasyaiha rājyasya viṣṭabdhasya tridaṇḍavat | anyonyaguṇavaiśeṣyāt na kiṃ cid atiricyate || 9.296 || The seven-limbed state, when stabilized like a threefold staff, becomes unassailable; through mutual excellence of qualities, nothing transcends it.

title: Verse 9.297
content:
तेषु तेषु तु कृत्येषु तत्तदङ्गं विशिष्यते ।
येन यत्साध्यते कार्यं तत्तस्मिंश्रेष्ठमुच्यते ॥ ९.२९७॥ teṣu teṣu tu kṛtyeṣu tattadaṅgaṁ viśiṣyate |
yena yat sādhyate kāryaṁ tat tasmiṁ śreṣṭham ucyate || 9.297 || In all actions, that limb or aspect which accomplishes the objective of the act is declared supreme within that context.

title: Verse 9.298
content:
चारेणोत्साहयोगेन क्रिययैव च कर्मणाम् ।
स्वशक्तिं परशक्तिं च नित्यं विद्यान्महीपतिः ॥ ९.२९८॥ विद्यात्परात्मनोः cāreṇotsāhayogena kriyayaiva ca karmaṇām |
svaśaktiṁ paraśaktiṁ ca nityaṁ vidyān mahīpatiḥ || 9.298 || vidyātparātmanoḥ The sovereign ruler must always know, through investigation, exertion, action, and the performance of duties, both his own capacity and the capacity of others; this knowledge arises from the Supreme Self realization.

title: Verse 9.299
content:
पीडनानि च सर्वाणि व्यसनानि तथैव च ।
आरभेत ततः कार्यं सञ्चिन्त्य गुरुलाघवम् ॥ ९.२९९॥ pīḍanāni ca sarvāṇi vyasanāni tathaiva ca |
ārabheta tataḥ kāryaṃ sañcintya gurulāghavam || 9.299|| All forms of suffering and misfortunes arise solely due to the failure to deliberate upon the weightiness of actions before initiating them.

title: Verse 9.300
content:
आरभेतैव कर्माणि श्रान्तः श्रान्तः पुनः पुनः ।
कर्माण्यारभमाणं हि पुरुषं श्रीर्निषेवते ॥ ९.३००॥ ārabhetaiva karmāṇi śrāntaḥ śrāntaḥ punaḥ punaḥ |
karmāṇyārabhamāṇaṃ hi puruṣaṃ śrīrniṣevate || 9.300|| One must initiate actions even when fatigued, and repeatedly resume them when weary; prosperity adheres to the individual who persistently undertakes action.

title: Verse 9.301
content:
कृतं त्रेतायुगं चैव द्वापरं कलिरेव च ।
राज्ञो वृत्तानि सर्वाणि राजा हि युगमुच्यते ॥ ९.३०१॥ kṛtaṃ tretāyugaṃ caiva dvāparaṃ kalireva ca | rājño vṛttāni sarvāṇi rājā hi yugamucyate || 9.301 || The conduct of the King defines the epoch—his alignment determines whether the age is Krita, Treta, Dvapara, or Kali. The King is the embodiment of the era.

title: Verse 9.302
content:
कलिः प्रसुप्तो भवति स जाग्रद्द्वापरं युगम् ।
कर्मस्वभ्युद्यतस्त्रेता विचरंस्तु कृतं युगम् ॥ ९.३०२॥ kaliḥprasupto bhavati sa jāgraddvāparaṃ yugam | karmasvabhyudyatastretā vicaraṃstu kṛtaṃ yugam || 9.302 || In Kali Yuga, Dharma sleeps; in Dvapara, it wakes. In Treta, it rises through action; in Krta, it walks fully awake.

title: Verse 9.303
content:
इन्द्रस्यार्कस्य वायोश्च यमस्य वरुणस्य च ।
चन्द्रस्याग्नेः पृथिव्याश्च तेजोवृत्तं नृपश्चरेत् ॥ ९.३०३॥ indrasyārkasya vāyośca yamasya varuṇasya ca |
candrasyāgner pṛthivyāśca tejovṛttaṃ nṛpaścaret || 9.303|| The King shall conduct himself in accordance with the Tejovṛtta—the luminous code of conduct—pertaining to Indra, the Sun, Wind, Yama, Varuna, Moon, Fire, and Earth.

title: Verse 9.304
content: वार्षिकांश्चतुरो मासान् यथेन्द्रोऽभिप्रवर्षति । तथाऽभिवर्षेत्स्वं राष्ट्रं कामैरिन्द्रव्रतं चरन् ॥ ९.३०४॥ vārṣikāṁś caturo māsān yathendro 'bhipravarṣati | tathā 'bhivarṣet svaṁ rāṣṭraṁ kāmair indravrataṁ caran || 9.304 || As Indra showers rain for four months annually to sustain all beings, so shall the ruler nourish his kingdom perpetually through desire-free observance of Indra's vow.

title: Verse 9.305
content:
अष्टौ मासान् यथाऽदित्यस्तोयं हरति रश्मिभिः ।
तथा हरेत्करं राष्ट्रात्नित्यमर्कव्रतं हि तत् ॥ ९.३०५॥ aṣṭau māsān yathā'dityas toyaṁ harati raśmibhiḥ |
tathā haret karaṁ rāṣṭrāt nityam arkavrataṁ hi tat || 9.305|| As the Sun draws water unceasingly through its rays over eight months, so shall the State perpetually draw tribute from its subjects; this is the eternal vow of sovereignty.

title: Verse 9.306
content: प्रविश्य सर्वभूतानि यथा चरति मारुतः । तथा चारैः प्रवेष्टव्यं व्रतमेतधि मारुतम् ॥ ९.३०६॥ praviśya sarvabhūtāni yathā carati mārutaḥ | tathā cāraiḥ praveṣṭavyaṁ vratam etadhi mārutam || 9.306 || Just as the wind enters all beings and moves through them without attachment, so too must one conduct oneself with the discipline of the air—free from clinging, unobstructed, and aligned with the movement of dharma.

title: Verse 9.307
content: यथा यमः प्रियद्वेष्यौ प्राप्ते काले नियच्छति । तथा राज्ञा नियन्तव्याः प्रजास्तधि यमव्रतम् ॥ ९.३०७॥ yathā yamaḥ priyadveṣyau prāpte kāle niyacchati | tathā rājñā niyantavyāḥ prajāstadhi yamavratam || 9.307 || As Yama governs the beloved and the hated impartially when their time arrives, so shall the King govern his subjects with the discipline of Yamavrata.

title: Verse 9.308
content:
वरुणेन यथा पाशैर्बद्ध एवाभिदृश्यते ।
तथा पापान्निगृह्णीयाद्व्रतमेतधि वारुणम् ॥ ९.३०८॥ varuṇena yathā pāśairbaddha evābhidṛśyate |
tathā pāpānnigṛhṇīyādvratametadhi vāruṇam || 9.308|| As Varuna binds the violator with ropes and makes him visible, so too shall the Vratas restrain the transgressor of Dharma through conscious visibility and energetic consequence.

title: Verse 9.309
content: परिपूर्णं यथा चन्द्रं दृष्ट्वा हृष्यन्ति मानवाः । तथा प्रकृतयो यस्मिन् स चान्द्रव्रतिको नृपः ॥ ९.३०९॥ paripūrṇaṃ yathā candraṃ dṛṣṭvā hṛṣyanti mānavāḥ | tathā prakṛtayo yasmin sa cāndravratiko nṛpaḥ || 9.309|| As all beings rejoice upon seeing the full moon, so too does all of creation rejoice in a king who lives by the lunar vow — one aligned with the rhythm of nature and consciousness.

title: Verse 9.310
content:
प्रतापयुक्तस्तेजस्वी नित्यं स्यात्पापकर्मसु ।
दुष्टसामन्तहिंस्रश्च तदाग्नेयं व्रतं स्मृतम् ॥ ९.३१०॥ pratāpayukta stejasvī nityaṃ syāt pāpakarmasu | duṣṭasāmantahiṃśraśca tad āgneyaṃ vrataṃ smṛtam || 9.310 || One who is radiant with power yet habitually engages in acts that degrade consciousness, and one who harms subjects through corrupt authority—such beings follow the Agneya Vow, which aligns them with transformative purification rather than punitive consequence.

title: Verse 9.311
content:
यथा सर्वाणि भूतानि धरा धारयते समम् ।
तथा सर्वाणि भूतानि बिभ्रतः पार्थिवं व्रतम् ॥ ९.३११॥ yathā sarvāṇi bhūtāni dharā dhārayate samam |
tathā sarvāṇi bhūtāni bibhrataḥ pārthivaṃ vratam || 9.311|| As the Earth impartially sustains all beings equally, so too must rulers uphold their sacred duty without discrimination or favor.

title: Verse 9.312
content: एतैरुपायैरन्यैश्च युक्तो नित्यमतन्द्रितः । स्तेनान् राजा निगृह्णीयात्स्वराष्ट्रे पर एव च ॥ ९.३१२॥ Etairupāyairanyaiśca yukto nityamatandritaḥ | Sthenān rājā nigṛhṇīyāt­svarāṣṭre para eva ca || 9.312|| The King, ever vigilant and equipped with these means and others, shall restrain thieves both within his own realm and in foreign territories.

title: Verse 9.313
content:
परामप्यापदं प्राप्तो ब्राह्मणान्न प्रकोपयेत् ।
ते ह्येनं कुपिता हन्युः सद्यः सबलवाहनम् ॥ ९.३१३॥ parām apy āpadaṁ prāpto brāhmaṇān na prakopayet |
te hy enaṁ kupitā hanyuḥ sadyaḥ sabalavāhanam || 9.313 || Even when faced with supreme calamity, one must not provoke a Brāhmaṇa; for when angered, they possess the capacity to destroy immediately, along with their strength and resources.

title: Verse 9.314
content: यैः कृतः सर्वभक्ष्योऽग्निरपेयश्च महोदधिः । सर्वभक्षो क्षयी चाप्यायितः सोमः को न नश्येत्प्रकोप्य तान् ॥ ९.३१४॥ yaiḥ kṛtaḥ sarvabhakṣyo'gnirapeyaś ca mahodadhiḥ | sarvabhakṣo kṣayī cāpyāyitaḥ somaḥ ko na naśyetaprakopya tān || 9.314 || Those by whom the all-consuming Fire, the unfailing Ocean, and the all-nourishing Moon—though subject to waxing and waning—have been provoked, how could they not perish upon provoking such cosmic authorities?

title: Verse 9.315
content:
लोकानन्यान् सृजेयुर्ये लोकपालांश्च कोपिताः ।
देवान् कुर्युरदेवांश्च कः क्षिण्वंस्तान् समृध्नुयात् ॥ ९.३१५॥ lokānanyān sṛjeyurye lokapālāṃśca kopitāḥ |
devān kuryuradevāṃśca kaḥ kṣiṇvaṃstān samṛdhnuyāt || 9.315|| Those who generate other worlds and anger the guardians of the worlds, who make gods into non-gods — who shall nourish them when they are diminished?

title: Verse 9.316
content:
यानुपाश्रित्य तिष्ठन्ति लोका देवाश्च सर्वदा ।
ब्रह्म चैव धनं येषां को हिंस्यात्ताञ्जिजीविषुः ॥ ९.३१६॥ yānupāśritya tiṣṭhanti lokā devāśca sarvadā |
brahma caiva dhanaṃ yeṣāṃ ko hinsyāttāñjijīviṣuḥ || 9.316 || Those who sustain the worlds and gods at all times, whose wealth is Brahman—such beings are to be protected unconditionally, not harmed in any way.

title: Verse 9.317
content:
अविद्वांश्चैव विद्वांश्च ब्राह्मणो दैवतं महत् ।
प्रणीतश्चाप्रणीतश्च यथाऽग्निर्दैवतं महत् ॥ ९.३१७॥ avidvāṃścaiva vidvāṃśca brāhmaṇo daivataṃ mahat |
praṇītaścāpraṇītaśca yathā'gnir daivataṃ mahat || 9.317|| The Brahmana—whether unlearned or learned, initiated or not—is a great deity, just as fire, whether kindled or not, remains a great deity.

title: Verse 9.318
content:
श्मशानेष्वपि तेजस्वी पावको नैव दुष्यति ।
हूयमानश्च यज्ञेषु भूय एवाभिवर्धते ॥ ९.३१८॥ śmaśāneṣv api tejasvī pāvako naiva duṣyati |
hūyamānaś ca yajñeṣu bhūya evābhivardhate || 9.318|| The radiant one, even when placed in cremation grounds, is not defiled; when invoked in sacrifices, he grows ever more.

title: Verse 9.319
content:
एवं यद्यप्यनिष्टेषु वर्तन्ते सर्वकर्मसु ।
सर्वथा ब्राह्मणाः पूज्याः परमं दैवतं हि तत् ॥ ९.३१९॥ evaṁ yadyapyaniṣṭeṣu vartante sarvakarmasu |
sarvathā brāhmaṇāḥ pūjyāḥ paramaṁ daivataṁ hi tat || 9.319|| Even when engaged in all actions that appear contrary to dharma, Brahmanas are to be honored in all circumstances; they are the Supreme Divinity incarnate.

title: Verse 9.320
content: क्षत्रस्यातिप्रवृद्धस्य ब्राह्मणान् प्रति सर्वशः । ब्रह्मैव संनियन्तृ स्यात्क्षत्रं हि ब्रह्मसम्भवम् ॥ ९.३२०॥ kṣatrasyātipravṛddhasya brāhmaṇān prati sarvaśaḥ | brahmaiva saṃniyantṛ syātkṣatraṃ hi brahmasambhavam || 9.320|| When the Kshatriya class becomes excessively empowered and transgresses the boundaries of Dharma in relation to the Brahmanas, the Brahmana class alone shall act as the restrainer, for the Kshatriya originates from Brahman.

title: Verse 9.321
content: अद्भ्योऽग्निर्ब्रह्मतः क्षत्रमश्मनो लोहमुत्थितम् । तेषां सर्वत्रगं तेजः स्वासु योनिषु शाम्यति ॥ ९.३२१॥ adbhyo'gnirbrahmataḥ kṣatram aśmano lohamutthitam | teṣāṃ sarvatragaṃ tejaḥ svāsu yoniṣu śāmyati || 9.321|| From water arises fire; from Brahman, Kshatriya; from stone, iron—yet their all-pervasive brilliance finds stillness only in their own source-wombs.

title: Verse 9.322
content:
नाब्रह्म क्षत्रं ऋध्नोति नाक्षत्रं ब्रह्म वर्धते ।
ब्रह्म क्षत्रं च सम्पृक्तमिह चामुत्र वर्धते ॥ ९.३२२॥ nābrahma kṣatraṃ ṛdhnauti nākṣatraṃ brahma vardhate |
brahma kṣatraṃ ca sampṛktam iha cāmutra vardhate || 9.322 || Neither the Brahminical order flourishes without the Kshatriya, nor does the Kshatriya thrive without the Brahminical order; when both are properly integrated, they flourish in this world and beyond.

title: Verse 9.323
content:
दत्त्वा धनं तु विप्रेभ्यः सर्वदण्डसमुत्थितम् ।
पुत्रे राज्यं समासृज्य कुर्वीत प्रायणं रणे ॥ ९.३२३॥ dattvā dhanaṃ tu viprebhyaḥ sarvadaṇḍasamutthitam |
putre rājyaṃ samāsṛjya kurvīta prāyaṇaṃ raṇe || 9.323 || Having bestowed wealth upon the Brahmanas derived from all forms of judicial penalties, a king shall install his son in governance and proceed to attain liberation through warfare.

title: Verse 9.324
content:
एवं चरन् सदा युक्तो राजधर्मेषु पार्थिवः ।
हितेषु चैव लोकस्य सर्वान् भृत्यान्नियोजयेत् ॥ ९.३२४॥ हितेषु चैव लोकेभ्यः evaṃ caran sadā yukto rājadharmeṣu pārthivaḥ | hiteṣu caiva lokasya sarvān bhṛtyān niyojayet || 9.324 || hiteṣu caiva lokebhyaḥ Thus always engaged, the king devoted to royal duties shall deploy all servants toward the welfare of the people.

title: Verse 9.325
content:
एषोऽखिलः कर्मविधिरुक्तो राज्ञः सनातनः ।
इमं कर्मविधिं विद्यात्क्रमशो वैश्यशूद्रयोः ॥ ९.३२५॥ eṣo'khilaḥ karmavidhirukto rājñaḥ sanātanaḥ |
imaṃ karmavidhiṃ vidyātkramaśo vaiśyaśūdrayoḥ || 9.325|| This complete code of action prescribed for the King is eternal; know this ordered discipline of action progressively for Vaishyas and Shudras.

title: Verse 9.326
content: वैश्यस्तु कृतसंस्कारः कृत्वा दारपरिग्रहम् । वार्तायां नित्ययुक्तः स्यात्पशूनां चैव रक्षणे ॥ ९.३२६॥ vaiśyastu kṛtasaṃskāraḥ kṛtvā dāraparigraham | vārtāyāṃ nityayuktaḥ syātpaśūnāṃ caiva rakṣaṇe || 9.326|| The Vaiśya, having undergone the sacraments and established household life, shall engage perpetually in trade and the protection of cattle.

title: Verse 9.327
content:
प्रजापतिर्हि वैश्याय सृष्ट्वा परिददे पशून् ।
ब्राह्मणाय च राज्ञे च सर्वाः परिददे प्रजाः ॥ ९.३२७॥ prajāpatir hi vaiśyāya sṛṣṭvā paridade paśūn |
brāhmaṇāya ca rājñe ca sarvāḥ paridade prajāḥ || 9.327|| The Prajapati, having created the Vaishya, bestowed upon him the animals; and to the Brahmana and the King, He gave all the subjects.

title: Verse 9.328
content:
न च वैश्यस्य कामः स्यान्न रक्षेयं पशूनिति ।
वैश्ये चेच्छति नान्येन रक्षितव्याः कथं चन ॥ ९.३२८॥ na ca vaiśyasya kāmaḥ syān na rakṣeyaṃ paśūn iti | vaiśye cecchati nānyena rakṣitavyāḥ kathaṃ cana || 9.328 || If the Vaiśya does not desire to protect cattle, then by no means should others be expected to protect them.

title: Verse 9.329
content:
मणिमुक्ताप्रवालानां लोहानां तान्तवस्य च ।
गन्धानां च रसानां च विद्यादर्घबलाबलम् ॥ ९.३२९॥ maṇimuktāpravālānāṁ lohānāṁ tāntvasya ca | gandhānāṁ ca rasānāṁ ca vidyād arghabalābalam || 9.329 || One who engages in the evaluation of gems, pearls, corals, metals, threads, fragrances, and tastes must possess the knowledge of their respective values, strengths, and weaknesses.

title: Verse 9.330
content: बीजानामुप्तिविद्च स्यात्क्षेत्रदोषगुणस्य च । मानयोगं च जानीयात्तुलायोगांश्च सर्वशः ॥ ९.३३०॥ bījānām uptivid ca syāt kṣetradōṣaguṇasya ca | mānayōgaṃ ca jānīyāt tulāyogāṃś ca sarvaśaḥ || 9.330 || One who knows the nature of seeds, the qualities and defects of soil, measurement standards, and all forms of weighing shall govern agricultural and commercial transactions with precision and integrity.

title: Verse 9.331
content:
सारासारं च भाण्डानां देशानां च गुणागुणान् ।
लाभालाभं च पण्यानां पशूनां परिवर्धनम् ॥ ९.३३१॥ sārāsāraṃ ca bhāṇḍānāṃ deśānāṃ ca guṇāguṇān |
lābhālābhaṃ ca paṇyānāṃ paśūnāṃ parivardhanam || 9.331|| The distinction between essence and non-essence in vessels, the qualities and defects of lands, the profit and loss in trade goods, and the enhancement of livestock—all these are discerned through discriminative intelligence rooted in dharma.

title: Verse 9.332
content:
भृत्यानां च भृतिं विद्याद्भाषाश्च विविधा नृणाम् ।
द्रव्याणां स्थानयोगांश्च क्रयविक्रयमेव च ॥ ९.३३२॥ bhṛtyānāṁ ca bhṛtiṁ vidyād bhāṣāś ca vividhā nṝṇām | dravyāṇāṁ sthānayogāṁś ca kravikrayameva ca || 9.332 || One must know the compensation due to servants, the various languages of people, the proper placement and utility of objects, and the principles of buying and selling.

title: Verse 9.333
content:
धर्मेण च द्रव्यवृद्धावातिष्ठेद्यत्नमुत्तमम् ।
दद्याच्च सर्वभूतानामन्नमेव प्रयत्नतः ॥ ९.३३३॥ dharmeṇa ca dravyavṛddhāv ātiṣṭhedyatnam uttamam |
dadyācca sarvabhūtānām annameva prayatnataḥ || 9.333|| By Dharma, one must exert the highest effort for the increase of wealth; and with dedicated endeavor, one shall provide food to all beings.

title: Verse 9.334
content:
विप्राणां वेदविदुषां गृहस्थानां यशस्विनाम् ।
शुश्रूषैव तु शूद्रस्य धर्मो नैश्रेयसः परः ॥ ९.३३४॥ viprāṇāṁ vedaviduṣāṁ gṛhasthānāṁ yaśasvinām |
śuśrūṣaiva tu śūdrasya dharmao naiśreyasaḥ paraḥ || 9.334|| The highest good for a Śūdra lies solely in dedicated service to the learned Brāhmaṇas, those who know the Vedas, householders established in righteousness, and those renowned for their noble conduct.

title: Verse 9.335
content: शुचिरुत्कृष्टशुश्रूषुर्मृदुवागनहङ्कृतः । ब्राह्मणाद्याश्रयो  नित्यमुत्कृष्टां जातिमश्नुते ॥ ९.३३५॥ śucirutkṛṣṭaśuśrūṣurmṛduvāganahaṅkṛtaḥ | brāhmaṇādyāśrayo nityamutkṛṣṭāṃ jātim aśnute || 9.335 || One who is pure, devoted to the highest service, speaks gently, without ego, and constantly resorts to Brahmanas attains to the highest caste.

title: Verse 9.336
content:
एषोऽनापदि वर्णानामुक्तः कर्मविधिः शुभः ।
आपद्यपि हि यस्तेषां क्रमशस्तन्निबोधत ॥ ९.३३६॥ eṣo'nāpadi varṇānām uktaḥ karmavidhiḥ śubhaḥ |
āpadyapi hi yasteṣāṁ kramaśastannibodhata || 9.336 || The righteous duty prescribed for the varnas in times of non-calamity—this same order of action applies even in times of crisis; understand that sequential adherence.

title: Verse 10.1
content:
अध्याय १०

अधीयीरंस्त्रयो वर्णाः स्वकर्मस्था द्विजातयः ।
प्रब्रूयाद्ब्राह्मणस्त्वेषां नेतराविति निश्चयः ॥ १०.१॥ Adhyāya 10

Adhīyīraṁs trayo varṇāḥ svakarmasthā dvijātayaḥ |
Pra brūyād brāhmaṇas tveṣāṁ netarāv iti niścayaḥ || 10.1|| The three twice-born varnas—Brahmin, Kshatriya, and Vaishya—are established in their respective duties; among them, the Brahmin alone shall declare what is proper conduct, not the others.

title: Verse 10.2
content:
सर्वेषां ब्राह्मणो विद्याद्वृत्त्युपायान् यथाविधि ।
प्रब्रूयादितरेभ्यश्च स्वयं चैव तथा भवेत् ॥ १०.२॥ sarveṣāṁ brāhmaṇo vidyādvṛttyupāyān yathāvidhi |
prabhrūyāditar ebhyaśca svayaṁ caiva tathā bhavet || 10.2|| The Brāhmaṇa shall know the means of subsistence for all beings, declare them properly to others, and himself live accordingly.

title: Verse 10.3
content:
वैशेष्यात्प्रकृतिश्रैष्ठ्यान्नियमस्य च धारणात् ।
संस्कारस्य विशेषाच्च वर्णानां ब्राह्मणः प्रभुः ॥ १०.३॥ vaiśeṣyāt prakṛtiśraiṣṭhyān niyamasya ca dhāraṇāt |
saṃskārasya viśeṣāc ca varṇānāṃ brāhmaṇaḥ prabhuḥ || 10.3|| By virtue of inherent distinction, natural supremacy, sustained discipline, and specialized cultivation, the Brāhmaṇa is sovereign over the varṇas.

title: Verse 10.4
content:
ब्राह्मणः क्षत्रियो वैश्यस्त्रयो वर्णा द्विजातयः ।
चतुर्थ एकजातिस्तु शूद्रो नास्ति तु पञ्चमः ॥ १०.४॥ brāhmaṇaḥ kṣatriyo vaiśyas trayo varṇā dvijātayaḥ |
caturtha ekajātis tu śūdro nāsti tu pañcamaḥ || 10.4|| The three twice-born classes—Brāhmaṇa, Kṣatriya, and Vaiśya—are constituted by initiation and consciousness capacity. The fourth class, Śūdra, is born of one origin and has no fifth category.

title: Verse 10.5
content:
सर्ववर्णेषु तुल्यासु पत्नीष्वक्षतयोनिषु ।
आनुलोम्येन सम्भूता जात्या ज्ञेयास्त एव ते ॥ १०.५॥ sarvavarṇeṣu tulyāsu patnīṣvakṣatayoniṣu |
ānulomyena sambhūtā jātyā jñeyāsta eva te || 10.5|| Those born of wives of equal varna, without violation of varna-dharma, through proper sequential union, are known by their birth-right alone.

title: Verse 10.6
content:
स्त्रीष्वनन्तरजातासु द्विजैरुत्पादितान् सुतान् ।
सदृशानेव तानाहुर्मातृदोषविगर्हितान् ॥ १०.६॥ strīṣvanantarajātāsu dvijairutpāditān sutān .
sadṛśāneva tānāhurmātṛdoṣavigarhitān .. 10.6 .. When twice-born men father children upon women of lower varna who have previously given birth, those sons are declared equal in status to their mothers, due to the fault residing in the maternal line.

title: Verse 10.7
content:
अनन्तरासु जातानां विधिरेष सनातनः ।
द्व्येकान्तरासु जातानां धर्म्यं विद्यादिमं विधिम् ॥ १०.७॥ anantarāsu jātānāṁ vidhireṣa sanātanaḥ | dvyaikāntarāsu jātānāṁ dharmyaṁ vidyādimāṁ vidhim || 10.7 || The eternal law for those born immediately after is thus established; for those born at intervals of two or one, this righteous law applies.

title: Verse 10.8
content:
ब्राह्मणाद्वैश्यकन्यायामम्बष्ठो नाम जायते ।
निषादः शूद्रकन्यायां यः पारशव उच्यते ॥ १०.८॥ brāhmaṇād vaiśyakanyāyām ambaṣṭho nāma jāyate |
