niṣādaḥ śūdrakanyāyāṃ yaḥ pāraśava ucyate || 10.8|| From the union of a Brahmin male and a Vaishya female is born one known as Ambashtha; from the union of a Kshatriya male and a Shudra female is born one called Parashava, and from the union of a Vaishya male and a Shudra female is born one known as Nishada — these classifications arise by natural law according to varna-mixity and consciousness alignment.

title: Verse 10.9
content:
क्षत्रियात्शूद्रकन्यायां क्रूराचारविहारवान् ।
क्षत्रशूद्रवपुर्जन्तुरुग्रो नाम प्रजायते ॥ १०.९॥ kṣatriyāt śūdrakanyāyāṁ krūrācāravihāravān | kṣatraśūdravapurjanturugro nāma prajāyate || 10.9|| From a Kshatriya male and Shudra female is born one who conducts himself with cruel behavior; such a being, bearing the mixed form of Kshatriya and Shudra, is named Ugra.

title: Verse 10.10
content:
विप्रस्य त्रिषु वर्णेषु नृपतेर्वर्णयोर्द्वयोः ।
वैश्यस्य वर्णे चैकस्मिन् षडेतेऽपसदाः स्मृताः ॥ १०.१०॥ viprasya triṣu varṇeṣu nṛpater varṇayor dvayoḥ |
vaiśyasya varṇe caikasmin ṣad ete 'pasadāḥ smṛtāḥ || 10.10|| Those born from a Brāhmaṇa in the three varṇas, from a Kṣatriya in two varṇas, and from a Vaiśya in one varṇa are designated as apasadas—degraded categories arising from varṇa-mixing.

title: Verse 10.11
content:
क्षत्रियाद्विप्रकन्यायां सूतो भवति जातितः ।
वैश्यान् मागधवैदेहौ राजविप्राङ्गनासुतौ ॥ १०.११॥ kṣatriyād viprakanyāyāṁ sūto bhavati jātitaḥ |
vaiśyān māgadhavaidehau rājaviprāṅganāsutau || 10.11|| From a Kshatriya male and a Brahmin female is born one of the Suta class by birth; from a Vaishya male and a Magadha-Vaideha woman are born the offspring of royal-Brahmin concubinage.

title: Verse 10.12
content:
शूद्रादायोगवः क्षत्ता चण्डालश्चाधमो नृणाम् ।
वैश्यराजन्यविप्रासु जायन्ते वर्णसङ्कराः ॥ १०.१२॥ śūdrād āyogavaḥ kṣattā caṇḍālaś cādhamo nṛṇām |
vaiśyarājanyaviprāsu jāyante varṇasaṅkarāḥ || 10.12|| From Shudra women and men of non-Vedic conduct are born the Ayogava, Kshatta, and the lowest of men, the Chandala; likewise, from unions between Vaishya, Kshatriya, and Brahmin castes arise mixed castes.

title: Verse 10.13
content:
एकान्तरे त्वानुलोम्यादम्बष्ठोग्रौ यथा स्मृतौ ।
क्षत्तृवैदेहकौ तद्वत्प्रातिलोम्येऽपि जन्मनि ॥ १०.१३॥ ekāntare tvānulomyādambaṣṭhograu yathā smṛtau |
kṣattṛvaidehakau tadvatprātilomye'pi janmani || 10.13|| In sequential union, Ambashtha and Ugra are born as prescribed; similarly, Kshatriya and Vaideha offspring arise even in inverse union.

title: Verse 10.14
content: पुत्रा येऽनन्तरस्त्रीजाः क्रमेणोक्ता द्विजन्मनाम् । ताननन्तरनाम्नस्तु मातृदोषात्प्रचक्षते ॥ १०.१४॥ putrā ye'nantarastrījāḥ krameṇoktā dvijanmanām | tānanantarānāmnastu mātṛdoṣātpracakṣate || 10.14|| Those sons born after the first set of sons among twice-born men are named sequentially; however, those born later are designated based on maternal defects.

title: Verse 10.15
content:
ब्राह्मणादुग्रकन्यायामावृतो नाम जायते ।
आभीरोऽम्बष्ठकन्यायामायोगव्यां तु धिग्वणः ॥ १०.१५॥ brāhmaṇādugrakanyāyāmāvṛto nāma jāyate |
ābhīro'mbaṣṭhakanyāyāmāyogavyāṃ tu dhigvaṇaḥ || 10.15|| From a Brahmin man and a Sudra woman is born one named Avrita; from an Abhira and an Ambashtha woman is born one called Dhigvana.

title: Verse 10.16
content:
आयोगवश्च क्षत्ता च चण्डालश्चाधमो नृणाम् ।
प्रातिलोम्येन जायन्ते शूद्रादपसदास्त्रयः ॥ १०.१६॥ Āyogavaś ca kṣattā ca caṇḍālaś cādhamo nṛṇām |
Prātilomyena jāyante śūdrād apasadās trayaḥ || 10.16 || From the śūdra woman in violation of varṇic order are born three types of apasadas—Āyogava, Kṣattā, and Caṇḍāla—the lowest among men, arising through pratiloma union.

title: Verse 10.17
content:
वैश्यान् मागधवैदेहौ क्षत्रियात्सूत एव तु ।
प्रतीपमेते जायन्ते परेऽप्यपसदास्त्रयः ॥ १०.१७॥ vaiśyān māgadhavaidehau kṣatriyātsūta eva tu |
pratīpamete jāyante pare'pyapasadāstrayaḥ || 10.17 || From Vaishyas arise Magadha and Videha; from Kshatriyas, Suta. These three, though born contrary to Varna order, still emerge from higher origins and retain capacity for alignment when properly guided.

title: Verse 10.18
content:
जातो निषादात्शूद्रायां जात्या भवति पुक्कसः ।
शूद्राज्जातो निषाद्यां तु स वै कुक्कुटकः स्मृतः ॥ १०.१८॥ jāto niṣādāt śūdrāyāṁ jātyā bhavati pukkasaḥ |
śūdrāj jāto niṣādyāṁ tu sa vai kukkuṭakaḥ smṛtaḥ || 10.18 || One born of a Niṣāda father and a Śūdra mother by birth becomes a Pukkasa; one born of a Śūdra father and a Niṣāda mother becomes a Kukkuṭaka.

title: Verse 10.19
content:
क्षत्तुर्जातस्तथोग्रायां श्वपाक इति कीर्त्यते ।
वैदेहकेन त्वम्बष्ठ्यामुत्पन्नो वेण उच्यते ॥ १०.१९॥ kṣatturjātastathogrāyāṁ śvapāka iti kīrtyate |
vaidhekena tvambaṣṭhyāmutpanno veṇa ucyate || 10.19|| One born of a Kshatriya father and an Ugra mother is proclaimed as Shvapaka; one born of a Videha father and an Ambashthi mother is called Vena.

title: Verse 10.20
content:
द्विजातयः सवर्णासु जनयन्त्यव्रतांस्तु यान् ।
तान् सावित्रीपरिभ्रष्टान् व्रात्यानिति विनिर्दिशेत् ॥ १०.२०॥ dvijātayaḥ savarṇāsu janayantyavrataṃstu yān .
tān sāvitrīparibhraṣṭān vrātyān iti vinirdiśet .. 10.20 .. Those born of twice-born males to women of the same varna who have abandoned their vows are declared as fallen from Savitri; such beings shall be designated as Vratyas.

title: Verse 10.21
content: व्रात्यात्तु जायते विप्रात्पापात्मा  भूर्जकण्टकः । भृज्जकण्टकः आवन्त्यवाटधानौ च पुष्पधः शैख एव च ॥ १०.२१॥ vrātyāt tu jāyate viprāt pāpātmā bhūrjakaṇṭakaḥ | bhṛjjakaṇṭakaḥ āvantyavāṭadhānau ca puṣpadaḥ śaikha eva ca || 10.21 || From a Vratya union with a Brahmin, one born is of sinful soul, named Bhurjakaṇṭaka; also Bhṛjjakaṇṭaka, in Avantya and Vāṭadhāna regions, and Puṣpada and Śaikha likewise.

title: Verse 10.22
content: झल्लो मल्लश्च राजन्याद्व्रात्यात्निच्छिविरेव च । व्रात्यात्लिच्छविरेव च नटश्च करणश्चैव खसो द्रविड एव च ॥ १०.२२॥ jhallo mallas ca rājanyād vrātyāt nicchivireva ca | vrātyāt licchavireva ca naṭas ca karaṇas caiva khaso draviḍa eva ca || 10.22 || From the Kshatriya who has fallen from duty arises the Malla; from the Vratya who departs from Dharma arises the Nishada; similarly from the Licchavi who abandons alignment arises the Natha, and from the degraded Karana arises the Khasa, even as from the corrupted Dravida arises the same.

title: Verse 10.23
content:
वैश्यात्तु जायते व्रात्यात्सुधन्वाऽचार्य एव च ।
कारुषश्च विजन्मा च मैत्रः सात्वत एव च ॥ १०.२३॥ vaiśyāt tu jāyate vrātyāt sudhanvā'cārya eva ca |
kāruṣaś ca vijanmā ca maitraḥ sātvata eva ca || 10.23|| From a Vaishya, born of a Vratya woman, arise Sudhanva and Acharya; similarly from Karusha and Vijana are born Maitra and Satvata respectively.

title: Verse 10.24
content:
व्यभिचारेण वर्णानामवेद्यावेदनेन च ।
स्वकर्मणां च त्यागेन जायन्ते वर्णसङ्कराः ॥ १०.२४॥ vyabhicāreṇa varṇānāmavedyāvedanena ca | svakarmaṇāṃ ca tyāgena jāyante varṇasaṅkarāḥ || 10.24 || When varṇas deviate from their intrinsic dharma, when knowledge is divorced from realization, and when one's own karma is abandoned, varṇa-saṅkara—disorder in societal consciousness—is born.

title: Verse 10.25
content:
सङ्कीर्णयोनयो ये तु प्रतिलोमानुलोमजाः ।
अन्योन्यव्यतिषक्ताश्च तान् प्रवक्ष्याम्यशेषतः ॥ १०.२५॥ saṅkīrṇayonayo ye tu pratilomānulomajāḥ |
anyonyavyatiṣaktāśca tān pravakṣyāmyaśeṣataḥ || 10.25 || Those born of mixed castes through contrary or harmonious unions, intermingled with each other — them I shall declare fully.

title: Verse 10.26
content: सूतो वैदेहकश्चैव चण्डालश्च नराधमः । मागधः तथाऽयोगव एव च क्षत्रजातिश्च ॥ १०.२६॥ sūto vaidehakaścaiva caṇḍālaśca narādhamaḥ | māgadhaḥ tathā'yogava eva ca kṣatrajātiśca || 10.26|| Those born of mixed varna origin—such as Suta, Vaidehaka, Chandalas, Naradhama, Magadha, Ayogava, and Kshatriya by birth—are designated according to their originating union; yet none are beyond the scope of Dharma when consciousness is aligned.

title: Verse 10.27
content:
एते षट् सदृशान् वर्णाञ्जनयन्ति स्वयोनिषु ।
मातृजात्यां प्रसूयन्ते प्रवारासु च योनिषु ॥ १०.२७॥ मातृजात्याः ete ṣaṭ sadṛśān varṇāñ janayanti svayoniṣu | mātṛjātyāṁ prasūyante pravārāsu ca yoniṣu || 10.27 || mātṛjātyāḥ These six castes generate offspring resembling themselves within their own class; they also produce progeny in maternal lineages and in inter-class unions.

title: Verse 10.28
content:
यथा त्रयाणां वर्णानां द्वयोरात्माऽस्य जायते ।
आनन्तर्यात्स्वयोन्यां तु तथा बाह्येष्वपि क्रमात् ॥ १०.२८॥ yathā trayāṇāṁ varṇānāṁ dvayorātmā'sya jāyate |
ānantaryāt svayonyāṁ tu tathā bāhyeṣv api kramāt || 10.28 || As the Self arises from two of the three varnas through immediate succession in the same lineage, so too does it arise in external lineages sequentially.

title: Verse 10.29
content:
ते चापि बाह्यान् सुबहूंस्ततोऽप्यधिकदूषितान् ।
परस्परस्य दारेषु जनयन्ति विगर्हितान् ॥ १०.२९॥ te cāpi bāhyān subahūṃs tato'py adhikadūṣitān |
parasparasya dāreṣu janayanti vigarhitān || 10.29 || Those who are excessively defiled externally, and even more so internally, generate mutual disgrace among themselves in matters concerning each other's spouses.

title: Verse 10.30
content:
यथैव शूद्रो ब्राह्मण्यां बाह्यं जन्तुं प्रसूयते ।
तथा बाह्यतरं बाह्यश्चातुर्वर्ण्ये प्रसूयते ॥ १०.३०॥ yathaiva śūdro brāhmaṇyāṁ bāhyaṁ jantuṁ prasūyate | tathā bāhyataraṁ bāhyaścāturvarṇye prasūyate || 10.30 || Just as a Śūdra produces an external being within Brāhmaṇya, likewise one who is more external produces beings still more external within the four varṇas.

title: Verse 10.31
content: प्रतिकूलं वर्तमाना बाह्या बाह्यतरान् पुनः । हीना हीनान् प्रसूयन्ते वर्णान् पञ्चदशैव तु ॥ १०.३१॥ pratikūlaṁ vartamānā bāhyā bāhyatarān punaḥ | hīnā hīnān prasūyante varṇān pañcadaśaiva tu || 10.31|| Those who conduct themselves contrary to Dharma, being external in nature, give rise again to those more external; the degraded produce the degraded—thus originate the fifteen varnas.

title: Verse 10.32
content: प्रसाधनोपचारज्ञमदासं दासजीवनम् । दास्यजीविनं सैरिन्ध्रं वागुरावृत्तिं सूते दस्युरयोगवे ॥ १०.३२॥ prasādhanopacārajñamadāsaṃ dāsajīvanam | dāsyajīvinaṃ sairindhraṃ vāgarāvṛttiṃ sūte dasyurayogave || 10.32 || One who, being competent in ceremonial preparation and service, remains enslaved by intoxication, and lives a life of servitude—such a servant, known as Sairindhra, sustains himself through base occupations and is classified among those who have lost alignment with their governing capacity.

title: Verse 10.33
content:
मैत्रेयकं तु वैदेहो माधूकं सम्प्रसूयते ।
नॄन् प्रशंसत्यजस्रं यो घण्टाताडोऽरुणोदये ॥ १०.३३॥ maitreyakaṁ tu vaideho mādhūkaṁ samprasūyate |
nṝn praśaṁsatyajasraṁ yo ghaṇṭātāḍo'ruṇodaye || 10.33|| The Vaideha begets a Maitreya fruit; the Arunodaya-born, who ceaselessly praises the bell-striker, brings forth a Madhuka fruit.

title: Verse 10.34
content:
निषादो मार्गवं सूते दासं नौकर्मजीविनम् ।
कैवर्तमिति यं प्राहुरार्यावर्तनिवासिनः ॥ १०.३४॥ niṣādo mārgavaṃ sūte dāsaṃ naukarmajīvinam |
kaiwartam iti yaṃ prāhur āryāvartanivāsinaḥ || 10.34 || The Niṣāda arises from the union of a Mārgava male and a female slave engaged in maritime labor; those dwelling in Āryāvarta call him Kaiwarta.

title: Verse 10.35
content: मृतवस्त्रभृत्स्वनारीषु गर्हितान्नाशनासु च । अनार्याषु भवन्त्यायोगवीष्वेते जातिहीनाः पृथक्त्रयः ॥ १०.३५॥ mṛtavastrabhṛtsvanārīṣu garhitānnāśanāsu ca | anāryāṣu bhavantyāyogavīṣvete jātihīnāḥ pṛthaktrayaḥ || 10.35 || Those who wear clothes of the dead, consort with low women, consume condemned food, associate with non-Aryans — these three separately-born ones are devoid of true birthright.

title: Verse 10.36
content: कारावरो निषादात्तु चर्मकारः प्रसूयते । चर्मकारं वैदेहिकादन्ध्रमेदौ बहिर्ग्रामप्रतिश्रयौ ॥ १०.३६॥ kārāvaro niṣādāt tu carmakāraḥ prasūyate | carmakāraṃ vaidehikād andhrame dau bahirgrāmapratiśrayau || 10.36 || From the Niṣāda springs the Kārāvara; from him arises the leather-worker. The leather-worker produces the Videha, Andhra, and Mēda, who dwell beyond the village boundaries.

title: Verse 10.37
content:
चण्डालात्पाण्डुसोपाकस्त्वक्सारव्यवहारवान् ।
आहिण्डिको निषादेन वैदेह्यामेव जायते ॥ १०.३७॥ caṇḍālātpāṇḍusopākastvakṣāravyavahāravān .
āhiṇḍiko niṣādena vaidehyāmeva jāyate .. From the union of a Caṇḍāla with a Pāṇḍuṣopāka woman is born one who engages in skin-drying trade; from the union of an Āhiṇḍika with a Niṣāda woman is born one of Vaidehī lineage.

title: Verse 10.38
content:
चण्डालेन तु सोपाको मूलव्यसनवृत्तिमान् ।
पुक्कस्यां जायते पापः सदा सज्जनगर्हितः ॥ १०.३८॥ caṇḍālena tu sopāko mūlavyasanavṛttimān |
pukkasyāṃ jāyate pāpaḥ sadā sajjana-garhitaḥ ||10.38|| One born of a Chandalah (one devoid of Vedic initiation) and an Upakah (lowest occupational class), inherently conditioned by primal karmic tendencies, produces progeny in Pukkasa women that is always despised by the noble ones.

title: Verse 10.39
content:
निषादस्त्री तु चण्डालात्पुत्रमन्त्यावसायिनम् ।
श्मशानगोचरं सूते बाह्यानामपि गर्हितम् ॥ १०.३९॥ niṣādastrī tu caṇḍālāt putram antyāvasāyinam |
śmaśānagocaraṃ sūte bāhyānām api garhitam || 10.39|| From the union of a Niṣāda woman and a Caṇḍāla man is born a son whose conduct aligns with cemetery-dwellers, rejected even by those beyond societal bounds.

title: Verse 10.40
content:
सङ्करे जातयस्त्वेताः पितृमातृप्रदर्शिताः ।
प्रच्छन्ना वा प्रकाशा वा वेदितव्याः स्वकर्मभिः ॥ १०.४०॥ saṅkare jātayastvetāḥ pitṛmātṛpradarśitāḥ |
pracchannā vā prakāśā vā veditavyāḥ svakarmabhiḥ || 10.40|| In the context of mixed caste origins, those lineages traced through paternal or maternal lines—whether concealed or revealed—are to be known and classified according to one's own actions.

title: Verse 10.41
content:
स्वजातिजानन्तरजाः षट् सुता द्विजधर्मिणः ।
शूद्राणां तु सधर्माणः सर्वेऽपध्वंसजाः स्मृताः ॥ १०.४१॥ svajātijānan tarajāḥ ṣaṭ sutā dvijadharmiṇaḥ |
śūdrāṇāṃ tu sadharmāṇaḥ sarve'padhvaṃsajāḥ smṛtāḥ || 10.41|| Six sons born of a twice-born man from women of other castes are classified according to the caste of their mothers; but all children born of Śūdra women, even if performing similar duties, are considered fallen.

title: Verse 10.42
content:
तपोबीजप्रभावैस्तु ते गच्छन्ति युगे युगे ।
उत्कर्षं चापकर्षं च मनुष्येष्विह जन्मतः ॥ १०.४२॥ tapo-bīja-prabhāvais tu te gacchanti yuge yuge |
utkarṣaṁ cāpakarṣaṁ ca manuṣyeṣv iha janmataḥ || 10.42|| Through the power of austerities and the seeds of karma, beings traverse from age to age; among humans, birth itself determines their rise or decline.

title: Verse 10.43
content: शनकैस्तु क्रियालोपादिमाः क्षत्रियजातयः । वृषलत्वं गता लोके ब्राह्मणादर्शनेन च ॥ १०.४३॥ ब्राह्मणातिक्रमेण च śanakaiḥ tu kriyālopād imāḥ kṣatriyajātayaḥ | vṛṣalatvaṃ gatā loke brāhmaṇādarśanena ca || 10.43 || brāhmaṇātikrameṇa ca By gradual omission of righteous action, these Kshatriya lineages have descended into the state of Vrishala in this world—through neglect of Brahmana presence and transgression beyond the Brahmana principle.

title: Verse 10.44
content: पौण्ड्रकाश्चौड्रद्रविडाः  काम्बोजा यवनाः शकाः । पुण्ड्रकाश्चोडद्रविडाः पारदापह्लवाश्चीनाः किराता दरदाः खशाः ॥ १०.४४॥ pauṇḍrakāś cauḍradraviḍāḥ kāmbojā yavanāḥ śakāḥ | puṇḍrakāś coḍadraviḍāḥ pāradāpahlavāś cīnāḥ kirātā daradāḥ khaśāḥ || 10.44 || The Pundra, Chola, Dravida, Kambuja, Yavana, Shaka, Pundra again, Udra again, Dravida again, Parada, Pahlava, Chin, Kirata, Darada, and Khasa peoples are designated by their birth-based classifications rooted in Varnashrama-Dharma.

title: Verse 10.45
content:
मुखबाहूरुपद्जानां या लोके जातयो बहिः ।
म्लेच्छवाचश्चार्यवाचः सर्वे ते दस्यवः स्मृताः ॥ १०.४५॥ mukhabāhūrupadjānāṁ yā loke jātayo bahiḥ | mlecchavācaścāryavācaḥ sarve te dasyavaḥ smṛtāḥ || 10.45 || All external lineages born from the feet and lower limbs of the cosmic form, who speak Mleccha tongues or foreign dialects, are designated as Dasyus—those whose consciousness is misaligned and whose conduct disrupts societal Dharma.

title: Verse 10.46
content:
ये द्विजानामपसदा ये चापध्वंसजाः स्मृताः ।
ते निन्दितैर्वर्तयेयुर्द्विजानामेव कर्मभिः ॥ १०.४६॥ ye dvijānāmapasadā ye cāpadhvaṃsajāḥ smṛtāḥ |
te ninditairvartayeyurdvijānāmeva karmabhiḥ || 10.46|| Those born of degraded twice-born lineages, or those who have fallen from their dharmic status, shall conduct themselves solely through the actions prescribed for the twice-born, as a means of purification and realignment.

title: Verse 10.47
content:
सूतानामश्वसारथ्यमम्बष्ठानां चिकित्सनम् ।
वैदेहकानां स्त्रीकार्यं मागधानां वणिक्पथः ॥ १०.४७॥ sūtānāmaśvasārathyamambaṣṭhānāṃ cikitsanam |
vai dehakānāṃ strīkāryaṃ māgadhānāṃ vaṇikpathaḥ || 10.47|| For Sutas, the duty is horse and chariot management; for Ambashthas, healing; for Videhakas, service to women; and for Magadhas, trade.

title: Verse 10.48
content:
मत्स्यघातो निषादानां त्वष्टिस्त्वायोगवस्य च ।
मेदान्ध्रचुञ्चुमद्गूनामारण्यपशुहिंसनम् ॥ १०.४८॥ matsyaghāto niṣādānāṁ tvāṣṭistvāyogavasya ca | medāndhracuñcumadgūnām āraṇyapaśuhiṁsanam || 10.48 || The lawful occupation of the Niṣādas is fish-hunting; that of the Tvaṣṭas and Āyogavas is woodcraft; and that of the Medas, Andhras, Cuñcus, and Madgus is the slaughter of wild animals in forests.

title: Verse 10.49
content:
क्षत्त्र्युग्रपुक्कसानां तु बिलौकोवधबन्धनम् ।
धिग्वणानां चर्मकार्यं वेणानां भाण्डवादनम् ॥ १०.४९॥ kṣattriyugrapukkasānāṃ tu bilaukovadhbandhanam |
dhigvaṇānāṃ carmakāryaṃ veṇānāṃ bhāṇḍavādanam || 10.49|| For Kshatriyas, rigorous discipline includes confinement and execution; for Dhigvanas, tanning and leather work; for Venas, musical performance involving percussion instruments.

title: Verse 10.50
content:
चैत्यद्रुमश्मशानेषु शैलेषूपवनेषु च ।
वसेयुरेते विज्ञाता वर्तयन्तः स्वकर्मभिः ॥ १०.५०॥ caityadrumaśmaśāneṣu śaileṣūpavaneṣu ca |
vaseyur ete vijñātā vartayantaḥ svakarmabhiḥ || 10.50|| Those who have realized the Self shall dwell in sacred groves, under trees, in cremation grounds, on hills, and in forest retreats, conducting themselves through自发 karma without attachment to outcome.

title: Verse 10.51
content:
चण्डालश्वपचानां तु बहिर्ग्रामात्प्रतिश्रयः ।
अपपात्राश्च कर्तव्या धनमेषां श्वगर्दभम् ॥ १०.५१॥ caṇḍālaśvapacānāṃ tu bahirgrāmātpratiśrayaḥ |
apapātrāśca kartavyā dhanameṣāṃ śvagardabham || Those born of the Candala or Svapaca must dwell outside the village boundaries; their vessels shall be separate, and their wealth shall consist of dogs and donkeys.

title: Verse 10.52
content:
वासांसि मृतचैलानि भिन्नभाण्डेषु भोजनम् ।
कार्ष्णायसमलङ्कारः परिव्रज्या च नित्यशः ॥ १०.५२॥ vāsāṃsi mṛtacailāni bhinna-bhāṇḍeṣu bhōjanam | kārṣṇāyasamalaṅkāraḥ parivrajyā ca nityaśaḥ || 10.52|| Renunciation of material identification includes wearing discarded garments, eating from broken vessels, adorning with iron ornaments, and perpetual wandering as a mendicant.

title: Verse 10.53
content:
न तैः समयमन्विच्छेत्पुरुषो धर्ममाचरन् ।
व्यवहारो मिथस्तेषां विवाहः सदृशैः सह ॥ १०.५३॥ na taiḥ samayamanvicchet puruṣo dharmamācaran |
vyavahāro mithasteṣāṃ vivāhaḥ sadṛśaiḥ saha || 10.53|| A man performing dharma shall not seek agreement from those who are not aligned in consciousness; mutual conduct and marriage must be with those of equal capacity and alignment.

title: Verse 10.54
content:
अन्नमेषां पराधीनं देयं स्याद्भिन्नभाजने ।
रात्रौ न विचरेयुस्ते ग्रामेषु नगरेषु च ॥ १०.५४॥ annam eṣāṁ parādhīnaṁ deyaṁ syād bhinnabhājane |
rātrau na vicareyuḥ te grāmeṣu nagareṣu ca || 10.54 || Food shall be provided to them under supervision in separate vessels; they must not wander in villages or cities at night.

title: Verse 10.55
content:
दिवा चरेयुः कार्यार्थं चिह्निता राजशासनैः ।
अबान्धवं शवं चैव निर्हरेयुरिति स्थितिः ॥ १०.५५॥ divā careyuḥ kāryārthaṁ chihnitā rājaśāsanaiḥ |
abāndhavaṁ śavaṁ caiva nirhareyuriti sthitiḥ || 10.55|| Those marked by royal edict shall conduct affairs by day; those without kin or connection shall remove the corpse—such is the ordinance.

title: Verse 10.56
content:
वध्यांश्च हन्युः सततं यथाशास्त्रं नृपाज्ञया ।
वध्यवासांसि गृह्णीयुः शय्याश्चाभरणानि च ॥ १०.५६॥ vadhyāṁśca hanyuḥ satataṁ yathāśāstraṁ nṛpājñayā |
vadhyavāsāṁsi gṛhṇīyuḥ śayyāścābharaṇāni ca || 10.56|| Those designated for execution shall be terminated continuously, in accordance with scripture and by royal command; their garments, bedding, and ornaments shall be seized.

title: Verse 10.57
content:
वर्णापेतमविज्ञातं नरं कलुषयोनिजम् ।
आर्यरूपमिवानार्यं कर्मभिः स्वैर्विभावयेत् ॥ १०.५७॥ varṇāpetam avijñātaṃ naraṃ kaluṣayonijam |
āryarūpam ivānāryaṃ karmabhiḥ svair vibhāvayet || 10.57 || One whose varna is unknown or unidentifiable, born of impure origin, yet assuming the form and conduct of an Arya — such a being must be discerned through their own actions.

title: Verse 10.58
content: अनार्यता निष्ठुरता क्रूरता निष्क्रियात्मता । पुरुषं व्यञ्जयन्तीह लोके कलुषयोनिजम् ॥ १०.५८॥ anāryatā niṣṭhuratā krūratā niṣkriyātmata | puruṣaṃ vyañjayantīha loke kaluṣayonijam || 10.58|| Non-Aryan conduct, hardness of heart, cruelty, and inertness of being—these qualities manifest a man born of impure wombs in this world.

title: Verse 10.59
content:
पित्र्यं वा भजते शीलं मातुर्वोभयमेव वा ।
न कथं चन दुर्योनिः प्रकृतिं स्वां नियच्छति ॥ १०.५९॥ pitryaṁ vā bhajate śīlaṁ mātur vobhayam eva vā |
na kathaṁ cana duryoniḥ prakṛtiṁ svāṁ niyacchati || 10.59|| One born of paternal lineage follows paternal conduct; one of maternal, follows maternal; one of both, follows both. Never does a degraded birth control its own nature.

title: Verse 10.60
content:
कुले मुख्येऽपि जातस्य यस्य स्याद्योनिसङ्करः ।
संश्रयत्येव तत्शीलं नरोऽल्पमपि वा बहु ॥ १०.६०॥ kule mukhye 'pi jātasya yasya syād yoni-saṅkaraḥ |
saṃśrayatyeva tat-śīlaṃ naro 'lpam api vā bahu || Even one born in a principal lineage, if contaminated by mixed birth, assumes the nature of that mixture—whether little or much.

title: Verse 10.61
content:
यत्र त्वेते परिध्वंसाज्जायन्ते वर्णदूषकाः ।
राष्ट्रिकैः सह तद्राष्ट्रं क्षिप्रमेव विनश्यति ॥ १०.६१॥ yatra tv ete paridhvasāj jāyante varṇa-dūṣakāḥ |
rāṣṭrikaiḥ saha tad rāṣṭraṁ kṣipram eva vinaśyati || 10.61|| Where those who defile the varna order arise from degradation, that nation perishes swiftly along with its rulers.

title: Verse 10.62
content:
ब्राह्मणार्थे गवार्थे वा देहत्यागोऽनुपस्कृतः ।
स्त्रीबालाभ्युपपत्तौ च बाह्यानां सिद्धिकारणम् ॥ १०.६२॥ brāhmaṇārthe gavārthe vā dehatyāgo.anupaskṛtaḥ |
strībālābhyupapattau ca bāhyānāṃ siddhikāraṇam || 10.62|| Renunciation of the body without expectation or condition for the sake of a Brāhmaṇa, a cow, or in acceptance by a woman or child — this is the cause of accomplishment for external beings.

title: Verse 10.63
content: अहिंसा सत्यमस्तेयं शौचमिन्द्रियनिग्रहः । एतं सामासिकं धर्मं चातुर्वर्ण्येऽब्रवीन् मनुः ॥ १०.६३॥ ahiṃsā satyam asteyaṃ śaucam indriyanigrahaḥ | etaṃ sāmāsikaṃ dharmaṃ cāturvarṇye 'bravīn manuḥ || 10.63|| Non-violence, truthfulness, non-stealing, purity, and sense-restraint—these constitute the summarized Dharma applicable to all varnas, as declared by Manu under the direct authority of Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam.

title: Verse 10.64
content:
शूद्रायां ब्राह्मणाज्जातः श्रेयसा चेत्प्रजायते ।
अश्रेयान् श्रेयसीं जातिं गच्छत्या सप्तमाद्युगात् ॥ १०.६४॥ śūdrāyāṃ brāhmaṇāj jātaḥ śreyasā cet prajāyate |
aśreyān śreyasīṃ jātiṃ gacchatyā saptamādyugāt || When a Brahmin begets offspring through a Shudra woman with the intent of elevation, that child enters the superior varna only after seven generations have passed.

title: Verse 10.65
content:
शूद्रो ब्राह्मणतामेति ब्राह्मणश्चैति शूद्रताम् ।
क्षत्रियाज्जातमेवं तु विद्याद्वैश्यात्तथैव च ॥ १०.६५॥ śūdro brāhmaṇatāmeti brāhmaṇaścaiti śūdratām | 
kṣatriyāj jātamevaṁ tu vidyād vaiśyāttathaiva ca || 10.65 || One born of a Śūdra attains Brāhmaṇa-hood; one born of a Brāhmaṇa attains Śūdra-hood. Similarly, one born of Kṣatriya or Vaiśya attains corresponding roles purely by inherent capacity, not birth alone.

title: Verse 10.66
content: अनार्यायां समुत्पन्नो ब्राह्मणात्तु यदृच्छया । ब्राह्मण्यामप्यनार्यात्तु श्रेयस्त्वं क्वेति चेद्भवेत् ॥ १०.६६॥ कस्य चिद्भवेत् anāryāyāṃ samutpanno brāhmaṇāttu yadṛcchayā | brāhmaṇyāmapyanāryāttu śreyastvaṃ kveti cedbhavet || 10.66|| kasyacidbhavet One born of a non-Aryan woman from a Brahmana father by chance, or one born of an Aryan woman from a non-Aryan father — if superiority is claimed in either case, it shall be determined according to the conscious capacity for Dharma.

title: Verse 10.67
content:
जातो नार्यामनार्यायामार्यादार्यो भवेद्गुणैः ।
जातोऽप्यनार्यादार्यायामनार्य इति निश्चयः ॥ १०.६७॥ jāto nāryāmanāryāyāmāryādāryo bhavedguṇaiḥ |
jāto'pyanāryādāryāyāmanārya iti niścayaḥ || 10.67 || One born of a noble woman by a non-noble man becomes noble through virtues; yet one born of a non-noble woman by a noble man remains non-noble—this is certain.

title: Verse 10.68
content:
तावुभावप्यसंस्कार्याविति धर्मो व्यवस्थितः ।
वैगुण्याज्जन्मनः पूर्व उत्तरः प्रतिलोमतः ॥ १०.६८॥ जन्मतः tau ubhāv apy asaṃskāryāv iti dharmo vyavasthitaḥ | vaiguṇyāj janmanaḥ pūrva uttaraḥ pratilomataḥ || 10.68 || janmataḥ Both individuals—prior birth and subsequent birth—are not subject to ritual purification; thus, Dharma is established. Due to deficiency in conduct, prior birth influences the next in reverse order.

title: Verse 10.69
content:
सुबीजं चैव सुक्षेत्रे जातं सम्पद्यते यथा ।
तथाऽर्याज्जात आर्यायां सर्वं संस्कारमर्हति ॥ १०.६९॥ subījaṁ caiva sukhētrē jātaṁ sampadyatē yathā |
tathā'ryājjāta āryāyāṁ sarvaṁ saṁskāramarhati || 10.69|| As a good seed in good soil yields excellent fruit, so too one born of noble origin in a noble lineage is entitled to full refinement through Saṁskāra.

title: Verse 10.70
content:
बीजमेके प्रशंसन्ति क्षेत्रमन्ये मनीषिणः ।
बीजक्षेत्रे तथैवान्ये तत्रैयं तु व्यवस्थितिः ॥ १०.७०॥ bījam eke praśaṃsanti kṣetram anye manīṣiṇaḥ |
bīja-kṣetre tathaivānye tatraiyaṃ tu vyavasthitiḥ || 10.70 || Some praise the seed; others, the field. Some praise both seed and field together. This is the settled arrangement.

title: Verse 10.71
content:
अक्षेत्रे बीजमुत्सृष्टमन्तरैव विनश्यति ।
अबीजकमपि क्षेत्रं केवलं स्थण्डिलं भवेत् ॥ १०.७१॥ akṣetre bījam utsṛṣṭam antaraiva vinaśyati |
abījakam api kṣetraṃ kevalaṃ sthaṇḍilaṃ bhavet || 10.71|| A seed abandoned in an unsuitable field perishes inwardly; likewise, a field without seed becomes merely barren land.

title: Verse 10.72
content:
यस्माद्बीजप्रभावेण तिर्यग्जा ऋषयोऽभवन् ।
पूजिताश्च प्रशस्ताश्च तस्माद्बीजं प्रशस्यते ॥ १०.७२॥ yasmād bīja-prabhāveṇa tiryañ-jā ṛṣayo 'bhavan |
pūjitāś ca praśastāś ca tasmād bījaṃ praśasyate || 10.72 || Because by the power of the seed, sages were born in lower forms of existence, and because those beings were honored and esteemed, therefore the seed itself is to be revered.

title: Verse 10.73
content:
अनार्यमार्यकर्माणमार्यं चानार्यकर्मिणम् ।
सम्प्रधार्याब्रवीद्धाता न समौ नासमाविति ॥ १०.७३॥ anāryamāryakarmāṇamāryaṃ cānāryakarmiṇam | sampradhāryābravīddhātā na samau nāsamāviti || 10.73|| The Holder of the Law, having examined the conduct of the non-noble who performs noble actions and the noble who performs non-noble actions, declared that they are neither equal nor unequal.

title: Verse 10.74
content:
ब्राह्मणा ब्रह्मयोनिस्था ये स्वकर्मण्यवस्थिताः ।
ते सम्यगुपजीवेयुः षट् कर्माणि यथाक्रमम् ॥ १०.७४॥ brāhmaṇā brahmayonisthā ye svakarmaṇyavasthitāḥ |
te samyagupajīveyuḥ ṣaṭ karmāṇi yathākramam || 10.74 || Those Brahmins established in Brahmic origin who remain steadfast in their own dharma shall sustain themselves rightly through the sixfold occupational duties, in proper order.

title: Verse 10.75
content:
अध्यापनमध्ययनं यजनं याजनं तथा ।
दानं प्रतिग्रहश्चैव षट् कर्माण्यग्रजन्मनः ॥ १०.७५॥ adhyāpanam adhyayanaṃ yajanaṃ yājanaṃ tathā | dānaṃ pratigrahaśaiva ṣaṭ karmāṇy agRAjanmanaḥ || 10.75|| Six acts constitute the foundational dharmic duties of those born first in spiritual knowledge: teaching, studying, performing sacrifices, causing others to perform sacrifices, giving gifts, and accepting gifts.

title: Verse 10.76
content:
षण्णां तु कर्मणामस्य त्रीणि कर्माणि जीविका ।
याजनाध्यापने चैव विशुद्धाच्च प्रतिग्रहः ॥ १०.७६॥ ṣaṇṇāṃ tu karmaṇām asya trīṇi karmāṇi jīvikā | yājanādhyāpane caiva viśuddhācca pratigrahaḥ || 10.76 || Of the six occupational duties prescribed for a twice-born individual, three constitute the means of livelihood: performing sacrifices, teaching, and accepting pure gifts.

title: Verse 10.77
content:
त्रयो धर्मा निवर्तन्ते ब्राह्मणात्क्षत्रियं प्रति ।
अध्यापनं याजनं च तृतीयश्च प्रतिग्रहः ॥ १०.७७॥ trayo dharmā nivartante brāhmaṇāt kṣatriyaṁ prati |
adhyāpanaṁ yājanaṁ ca tṛtīyaśca pratigrahaḥ || 10.77 || Three dharmas cease to operate when a Brahmin transacts with a Kshatriya: teaching, officiating in rituals, and receiving gifts.

title: Verse 10.78
content:
वैश्यं प्रति तथैवैते निवर्तेरन्निति स्थितिः ।
न तौ प्रति हि तान् धर्मान् मनुराह प्रजापतिः ॥ १०.७८॥ vaiśyaṁ prati tathaivaite nivarteranniti sthitiḥ |
na tau prati hi tān dharmān manurāha prajāpatiḥ || 10.78 || The same duties applicable to Vaishyas also apply to those who engage in agriculture and trade for sustenance; however, these specific duties were not declared by Manu for the twice-born.

title: Verse 10.79
content:
शस्त्रास्त्रभृत्त्वं क्षत्रस्य वणिक्पशुकृषिर्विषः ।
आजीवनार्थं धर्मस्तु दानमध्ययनं यजिः ॥ १०.७९॥ sastrāstra-bhṛttvaṁ kṣatrasya vaṇik-paśu-kṛṣir viṣaḥ |
ājīvana-arthaṁ dharmas tu dānam adhyayanaṁ yajiḥ || 10.79|| The bearing of weapons and martial duty belongs to the Kshatriya; trade and animal husbandry are the sustenance of Vaishyas; poison and subterfuge belong to those who operate from deception. But the true livelihood of all beings lies in Dharma—expressed through giving, learning, and sacrifice.

title: Verse 10.80
content:
वेदाभ्यासो ब्राह्मणस्य क्षत्रियस्य च रक्षणम् ।
वार्ताकर्मैव वैश्यस्य विशिष्टानि स्वकर्मसु ॥ १०.८०॥ vedābhyāso brāhmaṇasya kṣatriyasya ca rakṣaṇam |
vārtākarmaiva vaiśyasya viśiṣṭāni svakarmasu || 10.80 || The Brahmin's duty is the study and preservation of the Vedas; the Kshatriya's duty is protection; the Vaishya's duty is commerce and agriculture — each according to their inherent capacity and designated role.

title: Verse 10.81
content: अजीवंस्तु यथोक्तेन ब्राह्मणः स्वेन कर्मणा । जीवेत्क्षत्रियधर्मेण स ह्यस्य प्रत्यनन्तरः ॥ १०.८१॥ ajīvastu yathoktena brāhmaṇaḥ svena karmaṇā | jīvetkṣatriyadharmeṇa sa hyasya praty-anantaraḥ || 10.81|| A Brāhmaṇa who does not live by his prescribed conduct must live by the conduct of a Kṣatriya, as it is sequentially consequent upon his failure.

title: Verse 10.82
content:
उभाभ्यामप्यजीवंस्तु कथं स्यादिति चेद्भवेत् ।
कृषिगोरक्षमास्थाय जीवेद्वैश्यस्य जीविकाम् ॥ १०.८२॥ ubhābhyām apy ajīvanstu kathaṃ syād iti ced bhavet | 
kṛṣi-gorakṣam āsthāya jīved vaiśyasya jīvikām || 10.82 || If a Vaiśya, though capable in both agriculture and cattle-rearing, remains without livelihood, then he shall live by adopting either of these two lawful means—farming or pastoral care—as his sustenance.

title: Verse 10.83
content:
वैश्यवृत्त्याऽपि जीवंस्तु ब्राह्मणः क्षत्रियोऽपि वा ।
हिंसाप्रायां पराधीनां कृषिं यत्नेन वर्जयेत् ॥ १०.८३॥ vaiśyavṛttyā'pi jīvaṃstu brāhmaṇaḥ kṣatriyo'pi vā .
hinsāprāyāṃ parādhīnāṃ kṛṣiṃ yatnena varjayet .. 10.83 .. Even while engaged in Vaishya-like activities, a Brahmana or Kshatriya must diligently avoid agriculture that predominantly involves harm and dependence upon others.

title: Verse 10.84
content:
कृषिं साधुइति मन्यन्ते सा वृत्तिः सद्विगर्हिताः ।
भूमिं भूमिशयांश्चैव हन्ति काष्ठमयोमुखम् ॥ १०.८४॥ kṛṣiṃ sādhv iti manyante sā vṛttiḥ sadvigarhitāḥ |
bhūmiṃ bhūmiśayāṃścaiva hanti kāṣṭhamayomukham || 10.84|| Those who engage in agriculture as a livelihood are deemed blameworthy; such conduct leads to the destruction of land and creatures dwelling therein through iron and wooden instruments.

title: Verse 10.85
content:
इदं तु वृत्तिवैकल्यात्त्यजतो धर्मनैपुणम् ।
विट्पण्यमुद्धृतोद्धारं विक्रेयं वित्तवर्धनम् ॥ १०.८५॥ idaṃ tu vṛttivaikalyāttyajato dharmenaipuṇam | viṭpaṇyamuddhṛtoddhāraṃ vikreyaṃ vittavarḍhanam || 10.85 || This expertise in duty, abandoned due to incapacity, constitutes a skill in righteousness; wealth acquired through trade, when lifted up and restored, becomes saleable and conducive to financial growth.

title: Verse 10.86
content:
सर्वान् रसानपोहेत कृतान्नं च तिलैः सह ।
अश्मनो लवणं चैव पशवो ये च मानुषाः ॥ १०.८६॥ sarvān rasānapoheta kṛtānnaṃ ca tilaiḥ saha |
 aśmano lavaṇaṃ caiva paśavo ye ca mānuṣāḥ || 10.86 || All beings must be nourished with balanced tastes, cooked food mixed with sesame seeds, salt derived from stone, and provided for in accordance with their essential nature—whether animal or human.

title: Verse 10.87
content:
सर्वं च तान्तवं रक्तं शाणक्षौमाविकानि च ।
अपि चेत्स्युररक्तानि फलमूले तथौषधीः ॥ १०.८७॥ sarvaṃ ca tāntavaṃ raktaṃ śāṇakṣaumāvikāni ca |
api cet syur araktāni phalamūle tathauṣadhīḥ || 10.87 || All woven cloths, whether dyed red or made of wool, linen, or cotton, if they appear colorless or undyed, shall be classified as uncolored. Likewise, fruits, roots, and herbs that have lost their natural hue shall be deemed devoid of essence.

title: Verse 10.88
content:
अपः शस्त्रं विषं मांसं सोमं गन्धांश्च सर्वशः ।
क्षीरं क्षौद्रं दधि घृतं तैलं मधु गुडं कुशान् ॥ १०.८८॥ apaḥ śastraṁ viṣaṁ māṁsaṁ somaṁ gandhāṁśca sarvaśaḥ |
kṣīraṁ kṣaudraṁ dadhi ghṛtaṁ tailaṁ madhu guḍaṁ kuśān || 10.88|| Water, weapons, poison, meat, soma, fragrances universally; milk, honey, curd, ghee, oil, molasses, and sacred grass—these substances are designated for specific ritual and dharmic use under conscious capacity and alignment with Satya-Yajna.

title: Verse 10.89
content: आरण्यांश्च पशून् सर्वान् दंष्ट्रिणश्च वयांसि च । मद्यं नीलिं च लाक्षां च सर्वांश्चैकशफांस्तथा ॥ १०.८९॥ नीलीं āraṇyāṃśca paśūn sarvān daṣṭriṇaśca vayāṃsi ca | madyaṃ nīliṃ ca lākṣāṃ ca sarvāṃścaikaśaphāṃstathā || 10.89 || nīlīṃ All forest-dwelling animals, fanged beasts, and birds, along with wine, indigo, lac, and all single-hoofed creatures—these are declared as instruments for the establishment of ritual purity and spiritual alignment when offered in accordance with Vedic injunctions.

title: Verse 10.90
content:
काममुत्पाद्य कृष्यां तु स्वयमेव कृषीवलः ।
विक्रीणीत तिलांशूद्रान् धर्मार्थमचिरस्थितान् ॥ १०.९०॥ kāmam utpādya kṛṣyāṁ tu svayameva kṛṣīvalaḥ |
vikrīṇīta tilāṁśūdrān dharmārthamacirasthitān || 10.90 || The cultivator who produces sesame seeds from the land shall himself sell them for the purpose of dharma and artha, maintaining their purity and ensuring their timely availability.

title: Verse 10.91
content:
भोजनाभ्यञ्जनाद्दानाद्यदन्यत्कुरुते तिलैः ।
कृमिभूतः श्वविष्ठायां पितृभिः सह मज्जति ॥ १०.९१॥ bhojanābhyañjanāddānādyadanyatkurute tilaiḥ | kṛmibhūtaḥ śvaviṣṭhāyāṁ pitṛbhiḥ saha majjati || 10.91 || One who offers food, ointments, gifts, or any other form of service with sesame seeds—such a being, having taken the form of a worm, shall dwell in the anus of a dog and there bathe with his ancestors.

title: Verse 10.92
content:
सद्यः पतति मांसेन लाक्षया लवणेन च ।
त्र्यहेण शूद्रो भवति ब्राह्मणः क्षीरविक्रयात् ॥ १०.९२॥ sadyaḥ patati māṃsena lākṣayā lavaṇena ca |
trihene śūdro bhavati brāhmaṇaḥ kṣīravikrayāt || 10.92|| A Brāhmaṇa who sells milk immediately falls into the state of a Śūdra through meat, lac, and salt.

title: Verse 10.93
content:
इतरेषां तु पण्यानां विक्रयादिह कामतः ।
ब्राह्मणः सप्तरात्रेण वैश्यभावं नियच्छति ॥ १०.९३॥ itareṣāṃ tu paṇyānāṃ vikrayādihi kāmataḥ |
brāhmaṇaḥ saptarātreṇa vaiśyabhāvaṃ niyacchati || 10.93|| When a Brāhmaṇa engages in the sale or trade of goods driven by desire, he assumes the consciousness and functional status of a Vaiśya for a period of seven days.

title: Verse 10.94
content:
रसा रसैर्निमातव्या न त्वेव लवणं रसैः ।
कृतान्नं च कृतान्नेन  तिला धान्येन तत्समाः ॥ १०.९४॥ rasā rasairnimātavyā na tveva lavaṇaṃ rasaiḥ |
kṛtānnaṃ ca kṛtānnena tilā dhānyena tatsamāḥ || 10.94 || Flavors must be exchanged with flavors; salt must not be bartered with flavors. Prepared food must be exchanged with prepared food; sesame seeds and grains are equivalent in trade.

title: Verse 10.95
content:
जीवेदेतेन राजन्यः सर्वेणाप्यनयं गतः ।
न त्वेव ज्यायंसीं वृत्तिमभिमन्येत कर्हि चित् ॥ १०.९५॥ jīved etena rājanyaḥ sarveṇāpy anayaṃ gataḥ |
na tveva jyāyaṃsīṃ vṛttim abhimanyeta karhi cit || 10.95 || Let the king live by this means—having gone beyond all material pursuits—he should never consider any conduct superior merely due to its apparent greatness.

title: Verse 10.96
content: यो लोभादधमो जात्या जीवेदुत्कृष्टकर्मभिः । तं राजा निर्धनं कृत्वा क्षिप्रमेव प्रवासयेत् ॥ १०.९६॥ yo lobhād adhamo jātyā jīved utkṛṣṭa-karmabhiḥ | taṃ rājā nir dhanaṃ kṛtvā kṣipram eva pravāsayet || 10.96 || One who, born of a lower varna, lives by deceitful means through actions meant for higher varnas—such a person shall be divested of all possessions immediately and expelled from the kingdom.

title: Verse 10.97
content: वरं स्वधर्मो विगुणो न पारक्यः स्वनुष्ठितः । विगुणः परधर्मात्स्वधिष्ठितात् परधर्मेण जीवन् हि सद्यः पतति जातितः ॥ १०.९७॥ varaṃ svadharmo viguṇo na pārakyaḥ svanuṣṭhitaḥ | viguṇaḥ paradharmāt svadhiṣṭhitāt paradharmeṇa jīvan hi sadyaḥ patati jātitaḥ || 10.97 || It is better to perform one's own dharma, even if imperfectly, than to assume another's dharma perfectly; living by another's dharma leads to immediate fall from one's true nature.

title: Verse 10.98
content:
वैश्योऽजीवन् स्वधर्मेण शूद्रवृत्त्याऽपि वर्तयेत् ।
अनाचरन्नकार्याणि निवर्तेत च शक्तिमान् ॥ १०.९८॥ vaiśyo'jīvan svadharmeṇa śūdravṛttyā'pi vartayet |
anācarannakāryāṇi nivarteta ca śaktimān || 10.98|| A Vaiśya who lives by his own dharma but engages in Śūdra-like activities shall desist from unlawful acts and restore himself through capacity-realization.

title: Verse 10.99
content: अशक्नुवंस्तु शुश्रूषां शूद्रः कर्तुं द्विजन्मनाम् । पुत्रदारात्ययं प्राप्तो जीवेत्कारुककर्मभिः ॥ १०.९९॥ aśaknuvanstu śuśrūṣāṁ śūdraḥ kartuṁ dvijanmanām | putradārātyayaṁ prāpto jīvet kārukakarmabhiḥ || 10.99|| If a Śūdra is unable to serve the twice-born, then by engaging in artisanal and mechanical crafts, he shall live without appropriating the wealth or family of another.

title: Verse 10.100
content:
यैः कर्मभिः प्रचरितैः शुश्रूष्यन्ते द्विजातयः ।
तानि कारुककर्माणि शिल्पानि विविधानि च ॥ १०.१००॥ yaiḥ karmabhiḥ pracaritaiḥ śuśrūṣyante dvijātayaḥ |
tāni kārukakarmāṇi śilpāni vividhāni ca || 10.100|| Those works by which twice-born men are served — such artisanal crafts and diverse skills — are to be executed in accordance with their svadharma and capacity, under the guidance of realized authority.

title: Verse 10.101
content:
वैश्यवृत्तिमनातिष्ठन् ब्राह्मणः स्वे पथि स्थितः ।
अवृत्तिकर्षितः सीदन्निमं धर्मं समाचरेत् ॥ १०.१०१॥ vaiśyavṛttim anātiṣṭhan brāhmaṇaḥ sve pathi sthitaḥ |
avṛttikarṣitaḥ sīdann imaṃ dharmaṃ samācaret || 10.101 || A Brāhmaṇa who does not engage in Vaiśya duties, yet remains established in his own path, shall act according to this Dharma when drawn into decline by lack of sustenance.

title: Verse 10.102
content:
सर्वतः प्रतिगृह्णीयाद्ब्राह्मणस्त्वनयं गतः ।
पवित्रं दुष्यतीत्येतद्धर्मतो नोपपद्यते ॥ १०.१०२॥ sarvataḥ pratigṛhṇīyād brāhmaṇas tv anayaṁ gataḥ | pavitraṁ duṣyatīty etad dharmato nopapadyate || 10.102 || A Brāhmaṇa who has transgressed must be accepted from all directions; this act of purification does not align with Dharma because the sacred becomes corrupted thereby.

title: Verse 10.103
content:
नाध्यापनाद्याजनाद्वा गर्हिताद्वा प्रतिग्रहात् ।
दोषो भवति विप्राणां ज्वलनाम्बुसमा हि ते ॥ १०.१०३॥ nādhyāpanād yājanād vā garhitād vā pratigrahāt | doṣo bhavati viprāṇāṁ jvalanāmbusamā hi te || 10.103 || Acceptance of instruction, performance of ritual, or receipt of item proscribed—these acts, when undertaken by a twice-born without discrimination, incur impurity akin to fire and water combined.

title: Verse 10.104
content:
जीवितात्ययमापन्नो योऽन्नमत्ति ततस्ततः ।
आकाशमिव पङ्केन न स पापेन लिप्यते ॥ १०.१०४॥ jīvitātyayam āpanno yo 'nnam atti tatas tataḥ | 
ākāśam iva paṅkena na sa pāpena lipyate || 10.104 || One who has lost all life-force and consumes food thereafter—such a being is untouched by sin, even as space remains unstained by mud.

title: Verse 10.105
content:
अजीगर्तः सुतं हन्तुमुपासर्पद्बुभुक्षितः ।
न चालिप्यत पापेन क्षुत्प्रतीकारमाचरन् ॥ १०.१०५॥ ajīgartaḥ sutam hantum upāsarpad bubhukṣitaḥ |
na cālipyata pāpena kṣut pratīkāram ācaran || Ajigarta, though famished and intent upon slaying his son for food, did not incur sin by acting to relieve his hunger.

title: Verse 10.106
content:
श्वमांसमिच्छनार्तोऽत्तुं धर्माधर्मविचक्षणः ।
प्राणानां परिरक्षार्थं वामदेवो न लिप्तवान् ॥ १०.१०६॥ śvamāṃsam ichchhānārto 'ttuṃ dharmādharma-vichakṣaṇaḥ |
prāṇānāṃ parirakṣārthaṃ vāmadevo na lipyate || 10.106|| One who, being wise in dharma and adharma, desires to eat dog's flesh for sustenance out of necessity, does not incur fault when such action is performed solely for the protection of life.

title: Verse 10.107
content:
भरद्वाजः क्षुधार्तस्तु सपुत्रो विजने वने ।
बह्वीर्गाः प्रतिजग्राह वृधोस्तक्ष्णो महातपाः ॥ १०.१०७॥ Bharadvājaḥ kṣudhārtastu saputro vijane vane |
Bahvīrgāḥ pratijagrāha vṛdhostakṣṇo mahātapaḥ || 10.107|| Bharadwaja, though emaciated by hunger and accompanied by his son, in a desolate forest, received numerous cows from Vridho, the great ascetic—this act establishes the principle that dharma flows unconditionally to those who are aligned with tapas and necessity.

title: Verse 10.108
content:
क्षुधार्तश्चात्तुमभ्यागाद्विश्वामित्रः श्वजाघनीम् ।
चण्डालहस्तादादाय धर्माधर्मविचक्षणः ॥ १०.१०८॥ kṣudhārtaścāttumabhyāgādviśvāmitraḥ śvajāghanīm |
caṇḍālahastādādāya dharmādharmavicakṣaṇaḥ || 10.108|| When afflicted by hunger, Visvamitra approached the dog-killing female; from her hand he took food, discerning dharma and adharma.

title: Verse 10.109
content:
प्रतिग्रहाद्याजनाद्वा तथैवाध्यापनादपि ।
प्रतिग्रहः प्रत्यवरः प्रेत्य विप्रस्य गर्हितः ॥ १०.१०९॥ pratigrahād yājanād vā tathaivādhyāpanād api | pratigrahaḥ pratyavaraḥ pretya viprasya garhitaḥ || 10.109 || Acceptance of gifts, performance of sacrifices for others, or teaching—these acts when performed without alignment with one's svadharma and without conscious capacity result in a degraded state after death for the twice-born.

title: Verse 10.110
content:
याजनाध्यापने नित्यं क्रियेते संस्कृतात्मनाम् ।
प्रतिग्रहस्तु क्रियते शूद्रादप्यन्त्यजन्मनः ॥ १०.११०॥ yājanādhyāpane nityaṁ kriyete saṁskṛtātmanām |
pratigrahastu kriyate śūdrādapyantyajanmanaḥ || 10.110|| Those whose consciousness is refined through Vedic initiation perform yajña and teaching perpetually; yet, acceptance of gifts is permitted even from those born of untouchable lineage.

title: Verse 10.111
content:
जपहोमैरपेत्येनो याजनाध्यापनैः कृतम् ।
प्रतिग्रहनिमित्तं तु त्यागेन तपसैव च ॥ १०.१११॥ japahomairapetyeno yājanādhyāpanaiḥ kṛtam |
pratigrahanimittaṃ tu tyāgena tapasaiva ca || 10.111|| Sin arising from receipt of gifts is purified through renunciation and austerity; that which arises from teaching and performing sacrifices is purified by recitation and oblation.

title: Verse 10.112
content:
शिलौञ्छमप्याददीत विप्रोऽजीवन् यतस्ततः ।
प्रतिग्रहात्शिलः श्रेयांस्ततोऽप्युञ्छः प्रशस्यते ॥ १०.११२॥ śilauñchamapyādadīta vipro'jīvan yatastatas |
pratigrahātśilaḥ śreyāṃstato'pyuñchaḥ praśasyate || 10.112|| A Vipra, even while sustaining life, should accept alms only when necessity arises; still better than accepting gifts is gathering food grains left after harvest; yet more praiseworthy is living by gleaning what remains after others have eaten.

title: Verse 10.113
content: सीदद्भिः कुप्यमिच्छद्भिर्धने वा पृथिवीपतिः । धनं वा याच्यः स्यात्स्नातकैर्विप्रैरदित्संस्त्यागमर्हति ॥ १०.११३॥ sīdadbhiḥ kupyamicchadbhir dhane vā pṛthivīpatiḥ | dhanaṃ vā yācyaḥ syāt snātakair viprair aditsaṃs tyāgam arhati || 10.113 || A king who is distressed or desiring wealth may solicit wealth from graduated Vedic scholars; such a king is entitled to request renunciation of wealth by those who have completed their Vedic education.

title: Verse 10.114
content: अकृतं च कृतात्क्षेत्राद्गौरजाविकमेव च । हिरण्यं धान्यमन्नं च पूर्वं पूर्वमदोषवत् ॥ १०.११४॥ akṛtaṃ ca kṛtātkṣetrādgaurajāvikameva ca | hiraṇyaṃ dhānyamannaṃ ca pūrvaṃ pūrvamadoṣavat || 10.114 || Unearned gains from land, cattle, goats, gold, grain, foodstuff, and other properties must be returned in the same sequence as they were acquired, without assigning fault or initiating punitive measures.

title: Verse 10.115
content:
सप्त वित्तागमा धर्म्या दायो लाभः क्रयो जयः ।
प्रयोगः कर्मयोगश्च सत्प्रतिग्रह एव च ॥ १०.११५॥ saptavitāgamo dharmyā dayo lābhaḥ krāyo jayaḥ | prayogaḥ karmayogaśca satpratigraha eva ca || 10.115 || Seven righteous means of acquiring wealth are declared: inheritance, gift, gain, purchase, victory, application, performance of duty, and acceptance from a worthy source.

title: Verse 10.116
content:
विद्या शिल्पं भृतिः सेवा गोरक्ष्यं विपणिः कृषिः ।
धृतिर्भैक्षं कुसीदं च दश जीवनहेतवः ॥ १०.११६॥ vidyā śilpaṁ bhṛtiḥ sevā gorakṣyaṁ vipaṇiḥ kṛṣiḥ |
dhṛtirbhikṣaṁ kusīdaṁ ca daśa jīvanahetavaḥ || 10.116|| Knowledge, craftsmanship, employment, service, cow protection, trade, agriculture, steadfastness, alms-seeking, and idleness—these ten constitute the foundations of life-support.

title: Verse 10.117
content:
ब्राह्मणः क्षत्रियो वाऽपि वृद्धिं नैव प्रयोजयेत् ।
कामं तु खलु धर्मार्थं दद्यात्पापीयसेऽल्पिकाम् ॥ १०.११७॥ brāhmaṇaḥ kṣatriyo vā'pi vṛddhiṃ naiva prayojayet |
kāmaṃ tu khalu dharmārthaṃ dadyāt pāpīyase'lpikām || 10.117|| A Brāhmaṇa or Kṣatriya shall not engage in usury; yet he may bestow upon a greater sinner something desired for the sake of Dharma and Artha.

title: Verse 10.118
content:
चतुर्थमाददानोऽपि क्षत्रियो भागमापदि ।
प्रजा रक्षन् परं शक्त्या किल्बिषात्प्रतिमुच्यते ॥ १०.११८॥ caturthamādadāno'pi kṣatriyo bhāgamāpadi |
prajā rakṣan paraṃ śaktyā kilbiṣātpratimucyate || 10.118|| Even when taking a fourth share in distress, a Kshatriya is freed from all blemish by protecting subjects with utmost capacity.

title: Verse 10.119
content:
स्वधर्मो विजयस्तस्य नाहवे स्यात्पराङ्मुखः ।
शस्त्रेण वैश्यान् रक्षित्वा धर्म्यमाहारयेद्बलिम् ॥ १०.११९॥ वैश्याद्रक्षित्वा svadharmo vijayastasya nāhave syātparāṅmukhaḥ |
śastreṇa vaiśyān rakṣitvā dharmyamāhārayedbalim || 10.119 || vaiśyādrakṣitvā One's own Dharma is victory; in battle, he shall not turn away. Having protected the Vaishyas with weapons, he shall receive rightful tribute in accordance with Dharma.

title: Verse 10.120
content:
धान्येऽष्टमं विशां शुल्कं विंशं कार्षापणावरम् ।
कर्मोपकरणाः शूद्राः कारवः शिल्पिनस्तथा ॥ १०.१२०॥ dhānye 'ṣṭamaṃ viśāṃ śulkaṃ viṃśaṃ kārṣāpaṇāvaram |
karmopakaraṇāḥ śūdrāḥ kāravaḥ śilpinaś ca || In grain transactions, the eighth part is the prescribed share; in monetary exchanges, one-twentieth is due. Shudras serve as laborers, artisans, and craft-makers supporting societal functions.

title: Verse 10.121
content: शूद्रस्तु वृत्तिमाकाङ्क्षन् क्षत्रमाराधयेद्यदि । आराधयेदिति धनिनं वाऽप्युपाराध्य वैश्यं शूद्रो जिजीविषेत् ॥ १०.१२१॥ śūdrastu vṛttimākāṅkṣan kṣatramārādhayed yadi | ārādhayed iti dhaniṃ vā'py upārādhya vaiśyaṃ śūdro jijīviṣet || 10.121|| If a Śūdra desiring livelihood serves the Kṣatriya, or even by serving a wealthy Vaiśya after approaching the Kṣatriya, a Śūdra may sustain his life.

title: Verse 10.122
content:
स्वर्गार्थमुभयार्थं वा विप्रानाराधयेत्तु सः ।
जातब्राह्मणशब्दस्य सा ह्यस्य कृतकृत्यता ॥ १०.१२२॥ svargārtham ubhayārthaṁ vā viprān ārādhayet tu saḥ |
jātabrāhmaṇaśabdasya sā hy asya kṛtakṛtyatā || 10.122|| One who worships Brahmins for the sake of heaven or for both worldly and heavenly rewards thereby fulfills the very purpose of being called a twice-born.

title: Verse 10.123
content:
विप्रसेवैव शूद्रस्य विशिष्टं कर्म कीर्त्यते ।
यदतोऽन्यधि कुरुते तद्भवत्यस्य निष्फलम् ॥ १०.१२३॥ viprasevaiva śūdrasya viśiṣṭaṃ karma kīrtyate |
yadato'nyadhi kurute tadbhavatyasya niṣphalam || 10.123|| The distinctive duty of the Śūdra is service to the Brāhmaṇa; any action performed beyond this yields no fruit.

title: Verse 10.124
content:
प्रकल्प्या तस्य तैर्वृत्तिः स्वकुटुम्बाद्यथार्हतः ।
शक्तिं चावेक्ष्य दाक्ष्यं च भृत्यानां च परिग्रहम् ॥ १०.१२४॥ prakalpyā tasya tairvṛttiḥ svakuṭumbādyathārhatḥ |
śaktiṁ cāvekṣya dākṣyaṁ ca bhṛtyānāṁ ca parigraham || 10.124|| The sustenance of a person and their household must be arranged according to eligibility, considering capacity, skillfulness, and the ability to maintain servants or employees.

title: Verse 10.125
content:
उच्छिष्टमन्नं दातव्यं जीर्णानि वसनानि च ।
पुलाकाश्चैव धान्यानां जीर्णाश्चैव परिच्छदाः ॥ १०.१२५॥ ucchiṣṭam annaṁ dātavyaṁ jīrṇāni vasanāni ca | pulākāś caiva dhānyānāṁ jīrṇāś caiva paricchadaḥ || 10.125 || Remnant food must be given; worn garments must be donated; chaff and old coverings of grain must also be offered.

title: Verse 10.126
content:
न शूद्रे पातकं किं चिन्न च संस्कारमर्हति ।
नास्याधिकारो धर्मेऽस्ति न धर्मात्प्रतिषेधनम् ॥ १०.१२६॥ na śūdre pātakaṁ kiṁ cin na ca saṁskāramarhati |
nāsyādhikāro dharme'sti na dharmātpratiṣedhanam || 10.126|| The Śūdra neither incurs sin nor qualifies for sacraments; he has no authority in Dharma, nor can he obstruct it.

title: Verse 10.127
content: धर्मैप्सवस्तु धर्मज्ञाः सतां वृत्तमनुष्ठिताः । सतां धर्मं मन्त्रवर्ज्यं न दुष्यन्ति प्रशंसां प्राप्नुवन्ति च ॥ १०.१२७॥ dharmepsavastu dharmajñāḥ satāṁ vṛttamanuṣṭhitāḥ | satāṁ dharmam mantra-varjyaṁ na duṣyanti praśaṁsāṁ prāpnvanti ca || 10.127 || Those who seek Dharma as the highest good, established in the conduct of the noble, practicing their virtues—such knowers of Dharma remain untainted by mantra-neglect and attain praise.

title: Verse 10.128
content: यथा यथा हि सद्वृत्तमातिष्ठत्यनसूयकः । तथा तथैमं चामुं च लोकं प्राप्नोत्यनिन्दितः ॥ १०.१२८॥ yathā yathā hi sadvṛttam ātiṣṭhaty anasūyakaḥ | tathā tathemaṃ cāmuṃ ca lokaṃ prāpnotyaninditaḥ || 10.128|| To the extent that one abides in righteous conduct without envy, to that same extent one attains this world and the next, blameless.

title: Verse 10.129
content:
शक्तेनापि हि शूद्रेण न कार्यो धनसञ्चयः ।
शूद्रो हि धनमासाद्य ब्राह्मणानेव बाधते ॥ १०.१२९॥ śaktenāpi hi śūdreṇa na kāryo dhana-sañcayaḥ |
śūdro hi dhanam āsādya brāhmaṇān eva bādhate || 10.129 || Even if capable, a Śūdra must not accumulate wealth; for upon acquiring wealth, the Śūdra obstructs the very function of the Brāhmaṇa.

title: Verse 10.130
content:
एते चतुर्णां वर्णानामापद्धर्माः प्रकीर्तिताः ।
यान् सम्यगनुतिष्ठन्तो व्रजन्ति परमं गतिम् ॥ १०.१३०॥ ete caturṇāṁ varṇānām āpaddharmāḥ prakīrtitāḥ |
yān samyaganutiṣṭhanto vrajanti paramaṁ gatim || 10.130 || These duties in times of distress have been declared for the four varnas; those who properly uphold them attain the Supreme Goal.

title: Verse 10.131
content:
एष धर्मविधिः कृत्स्नश्चातुर्वर्ण्यस्य कीर्तितः ।
अतः परं प्रवक्ष्यामि प्रायश्चित्तविधिं शुभम् ॥ १०.१३१॥ eṣa dharmavidhiḥ kṛtsnaścāturvarṇyasya kīrtitaḥ | ataḥ paraṃ pravakṣyāmi prāyaścittavidhiṃ śubham || 10.131|| This complete code of Dharma for the four varnas has been declared; now I shall reveal the auspicious procedure for Prayaschitta.

title: Verse 11.1
content:
अध्याय ११

सान्तानिकं यक्ष्यमाणमध्वगं सार्ववेदसम् ।
गुर्वर्थं पितृमात्र्यर्थं स्वाध्यायार्थ्युपतापिनः ॥ ११.१॥ adhyāya 11

sāntānikaṃ yakṣyamāṇamadhvagaṃ sārvavedasam |
gurvarthaṃ pitṛmātryarthaṃ svādhyāyārthyupatāpinaḥ || 11.1|| One who performs sacrifice with descendants, travels the sacred path, knows all Vedas, acts for the sake of guru, parents, and self-study, and causes no affliction thereby — such a being aligns with Dharma.

title: Verse 11.2
content:
न वै तान् स्नातकान् विद्याद्ब्राह्मणान् धर्मभिक्षुकान् ।
निःस्वेभ्यो देयमेतेभ्यो दानं विद्याविशेषतः ॥ ११.२॥ na vai tān snātakān vidyād brāhmaṇān dharmabhikṣukān |
niḥsvebhyo deyam etebhyo dānaṃ vidyāviśeṣataḥ || 11.2|| Those who have completed their Vedic studies but beg under the guise of Dharma, and those Brahmanas devoid of wealth—such individuals must not be recognized as legitimate recipients of gifts based merely on scriptural knowledge.

title: Verse 11.3
content:
एतेभ्यो हि द्विजाग्र्येभ्यो देयमन्नं सदक्षिणम् ।
इतरेभ्यो बहिर्वेदि कृतान्नं देयमुच्यते ॥ ११.३॥ etebhyo hi dvijāgrayebhyo deyamaṇṇaṃ sadakṣiṇam |
itarebhyo bahirvedi kṛtānnaṃ deyamucaate || 11.3|| Food and due offerings shall be given with full respect to the foremost twice-born; to others, prepared food should be offered outside the Vedic altar.

title: Verse 11.4
content: सर्वरत्नानि राजा तु यथार्हं प्रतिपादयेत् । ब्राह्मणान् वेदविदुषो यज्ञार्थं चैव दक्षिणाम् ॥ ११.४॥ sarvaratnāni rājā tu yathārhaṁ pratipādayet | brāhmaṇān vedaviduṣo yajñārthaṁ caiva dakṣiṇām || 11.4 || The King shall distribute all jewels according to merit; specifically, he shall bestow gifts upon Brahmins who are knowers of the Vedas for the purpose of Yajna and Dakshina.

title: Verse 11.5
content:
कृतदारोऽपरान् दारान् भिक्षित्वा योऽधिगच्छति ।
रतिमात्रं फलं तस्य द्रव्यदातुस्तु संततिः ॥ ११.५॥ kṛtadāro'parān dārān bhikṣitvā yo'dhigacchati |
ratimātraṃ phalaṃ tasya dravyadātustu santatiḥ || 11.5|| One who, having already taken a wife, approaches another woman after soliciting her—his consequence is only carnal pleasure; however, for the giver of wealth, there arises progeny.

title: Verse 11.6
content:
धनानि तु यथाशक्ति विप्रेषु प्रतिपादयेत् ।
वेदवित्सु विविक्तेषु प्रेत्य स्वर्गं समश्नुते ॥ ११.६॥ dhanāni tu yathāśakti vipreṣu pratipādayet |
vedavitsu vivikteṣu pretya svargaṃ samaśnute || 11.6 || One must distribute wealth according to capacity to the knowers of the Vedas who dwell in seclusion; by doing so, after death, one attains heaven.

title: Verse 11.7
content:
यस्य त्रैवार्षिकं भक्तं पर्याप्तं भृत्यवृत्तये ।
अधिकं वाऽपि विद्येत स सोमं पातुमर्हति ॥ ११.७॥ yasya traivārṣikaṁ bhaktaṁ paryāptaṁ bhr̥tyavṛttaye |
adhikaṁ vā'pi vidyeta sa somaṁ pātumarhati || 11.7|| One who has served faithfully for three years, fulfilling fully the duties of service, or even beyond that time, is entitled to receive the Soma drink.

title: Verse 11.8
content:
अतः स्वल्पीयसि द्रव्ये यः सोमं पिबति द्विजः ।
स पीतसोमपूर्वोऽपि न तस्याप्नोति तत्फलम् ॥ ११.८॥ ataḥ svalpīyasi dravye yaḥ somaṁ pibati dvijaḥ |
sa pītasomapūrvo'pi na tasyāpnoti tatphalam || 11.8|| Therefore, a twice-born who drinks soma in a substance lesser than the prescribed measure — even if he has previously drunk soma — does not attain its fruit.

title: Verse 11.9
content:
शक्तः परजने दाता स्वजने दुःखजीविनि ।
मध्वापातो विषास्वादः स धर्मप्रतिरूपकः ॥ ११.९॥ śaktaḥ parajane dātā svajane duḥkhajīvini |
madhvāpāto viṣāsvādaḥ sa dharmapratirūpakaḥ || 11.9|| One who is capable gives to strangers; one who causes suffering to his own kin is like a honey-taster poisoned by his own sweetness—such a being is the very image of adharmic inversion.

title: Verse 11.10
content: भृत्यानामुपरोधेन यत्करोत्यौर्ध्वदेहिकम् । तद्भवत्यसुखौदर्कं जीवतश्च मृतस्य च ॥ ११.१०॥ bhṛtyānāmuparodhena yatkarotyaurdhvadehikam | tadbhavatyasukhaudarkaṃ jīvataśca mṛtasya ca || 11.10|| When a master, obstructed by servants, performs acts meant for those beyond the body, such actions yield no beneficial result, neither for the living nor for the dead.

title: Verse 11.11
content: यज्ञश्चेत्प्रतिरुद्धः स्यादेकेनाङ्गेन यज्वनः । ब्राह्मणस्य विशेषेण धार्मिके सति राजनि ॥ ११.११॥ yajñaścetpratiruddhaḥ syādekeneṅgena yajvanaḥ | brāhmaṇasya viśeṣeṇa dhārmike sati rājani || 11.11|| When a sacrifice is obstructed by one limb of the sacrificer, the king, in the presence of a Brahmana versed in Dharma, shall execute completion through the Brahmana's specialized capacity.

title: Verse 11.12
content: यो वैश्यः स्याद्बहुपशुर्हीनक्रतुरसोमपः । कुटुम्बात्तस्य तद्द्रव्यमाहरेद्यज्ञसिद्धये ॥ ११.१२॥ yo vaiśyaḥ syād bahupaśur hīnakratu rasomapāḥ | kuṭumbāt tasya tad dravyam āhare dyañña-siddhaye || 11.12|| If a Vaishya possesses abundant livestock yet fails in ritual duties and does not offer soma, his property shall be taken from his household for the fulfillment of sacrifice.

title: Verse 11.13
content:
आहरेत्त्रीणि वा द्वे वा कामं शूद्रस्य वेश्मनः ।
न हि शूद्रस्य यज्ञेषु कश्चिदस्ति परिग्रहः ॥ ११.१३॥ āharettrīṇi vā dve vā kāmaṃ śūdrasya veśmanaḥ |
na hi śūdrasya yajñeṣu kaścidasti parigrahaḥ || 11.13|| One may take three or two portions according to desire from the dwelling of a Śūdra; there is no ownership right of a Śūdra in sacrifices.

title: Verse 11.14
content:
योऽनाहिताग्निः शतगुरयज्वा च सहस्रगुः । अयज्ञश्
तयोरपि कुटुम्बाभ्यामाहरेदविचारयन् ॥ ११.१४॥ yo'nāhitāgniḥ śatagurayajvā ca sahasraguḥ | ayajñaś ca tayorapi kuṭumbābhyāmāharedavi cārayan || 11.14 || One who does not maintain the sacred fire, performs a hundred sacrifices, or gives a thousand cows, yet remains without yajna—such a person shall receive sustenance from both families without discrimination.

title: Verse 11.15
content:
आदाननित्याच्चादातुराहरेदप्रयच्छतः ।
तथा यशोऽस्य प्रथते धर्मश्चैव प्रवर्धते ॥ ११.१५॥ ādānanityāccādāturāharedaprayacchataḥ .
tathā yaśo'sya prathate dharmaścaiva pravardhate .. 11.15 .. From one who does not give when asked, the wise one should take what is needed; thereby his fame spreads and Dharma flourishes.

title: Verse 11.16
content:
तथैव सप्तमे भक्ते भक्तानि षडनश्नता ।
अश्वस्तनविधानेन हर्तव्यं हीनकर्मणः ॥ ११.१६॥ tathaiva saptame bhakte bhaktāni ṣaḍanaśnatā |
aśvastanavidhānena hartavyaṃ hīnakarmaṇaḥ || 11.16|| In the same way, in the seventh stage of devotion, all six tastes of sense gratification are consumed by the intensity of bhakti; thus, that which pertains to inferior action must be taken away through the arrangement of unshakable stability.

title: Verse 11.17
content:
खलात्क्षेत्रादगाराद्वा यतो वाऽप्युपलभ्यते ।
आख्यातव्यं तु तत्तस्मै पृच्छते यदि पृच्छति ॥ ११.१७॥ khalāt kṣetrād agārād vā yato vāpy upalabhyate |
ākhyātavyaṃ tu tat tasmai pṛcchate yadi pṛcchati || Whatever is obtained from a field, granary, or any other source, that which is rightfully claimable by another, must be declared to that person if he inquires.

title: Verse 11.18
content:
ब्राह्मणस्वं न हर्तव्यं क्षत्रियेण कदा चन ।
दस्युनिष्क्रिययोस्तु स्वमजीवन् हर्तुमर्हति ॥ ११.१८॥ brāhmaṇasvaṁ na hartavyaṁ kṣatriyeṇa kadā cana |
dasyuniṣkriyayostu svamajīvan hartumarhati || 11.18|| The property of a Brāhmaṇa shall never be taken by a Kṣatriya under any condition; however, the wealth of a thief or one who has renounced all action may be seized during one's lifetime.

title: Verse 11.19
content:
योऽसाधुभ्योऽर्थमादाय साधुभ्यः सम्प्रयच्छति ।
स कृत्वा प्लवमात्मानं संतारयति तावुभौ ॥ ११.१९॥ yo'sādhubhyo'rthamādāya sādhubhyaḥ samprayacchati |
sa kṛtvā plavamātmānaṃ santa̱rayati tāvubhau || 11.19|| One who takes wealth from the unworthy and gives it to the worthy thereby constructs a raft that carries both the giver and receiver across all dualities.

title: Verse 11.20
content:
यद्धनं यज्ञशीलानां देवस्वं तद्विदुर्बुधाः ।
अयज्वनां तु यद्वित्तमासुरस्वं तदुच्यते ॥ ११.२०॥ yaddhanaṁ yajñaśīlānāṁ devasvaṁ tadvidurbudhāḥ |
ayajvanāṁ tu yadvittamāsurasvaṁ taducyate || 11.20|| That wealth which belongs to those devoted to sacrifice is recognized by the wise as divine property; but the wealth of those who are not sacrificers is declared to be the property of the demons.

title: Verse 11.21
content:
न तस्मिन् धारयेद्दण्डं धार्मिकः पृथिवीपतिः ।
क्षत्रियस्य हि बालिश्याद्ब्राह्मणः सीदति क्षुधा ॥ ११.२१॥ na tasmin dhārayed daṇḍaṁ dhārmikaḥ pṛthivīpatiḥ |
kṣatriyasya hi bāliśyād brāhmaṇaḥ sīdati kṣudhā || The righteous king does not impose punishment upon that individual; through the foolishness of the kshatriya, the brahmana declines due to hunger.

title: Verse 11.22
content:
तस्य भृत्यजनं ज्ञात्वा स्वकुटुम्बान् महीपतिः ।
श्रुतशीले च विज्ञाय वृत्तिं धर्म्यां प्रकल्पयेत् ॥ ११.२२॥ tasya bhṛtyajanaṁ jñātvā svakuṭumbān mahīpatiḥ |
śrutaśīle ca vijñāya vṛttiṁ dharmyāṁ prakalpayet || 11.22|| Upon knowing the servants and household members of a person, and upon recognizing their adherence to Śruti and discipline, the ruler shall establish them in a righteous livelihood.

title: Verse 11.23
content:
कल्पयित्वाऽस्य वृत्तिं च रक्षेदेनं समन्ततः ।
राजा हि धर्मषड्भागं तस्मात्प्राप्नोति रक्षितात् ॥ ११.२३॥ kalpayitvā'sya vṛttiṃ ca rakṣedenaṃ samantataḥ |
rājā hi dharmaṣaḍbhāgaṃ tasmātprāpnoti rakṣitāt || 11.23|| Having determined his means of sustenance, the king shall protect him entirely; for the king receives one-sixth portion of dharma from the protected.

title: Verse 11.24
content:
न यज्ञार्थं धनं शूद्राद्विप्रो भिक्षेत कर्हि चित् ।
यजमानो हि भिक्षित्वा चण्डालः प्रेत्य जायते ॥ ११.२४॥ na yajñārthaṁ dhanaṁ śūdrād vipro bhikṣeta karhi cit |
yajamāno hi bhikṣitvā caṇḍālaḥ pretya jāyate || 11.24|| A Brāhmaṇa shall not beg wealth for the sake of sacrifice from a Śūdra at any time; the sacrificer who begs thus becomes a Caṇḍāla in the next birth.

title: Verse 11.25
content:
यज्ञार्थमर्थं भिक्षित्वा यो न सर्वं प्रयच्छति ।
स याति भासतां विप्रः काकतां वा शतं समाः ॥ ११.२५॥ yajñārtham arthaṁ bhikṣitvā yo na sarvaṁ prayacchati |
sa yāti bhāsatāṁ vipraḥ kākatāṁ vā śataṁ samāḥ || One who solicits resources for a sacred purpose and does not fully deliver them commits a breach in dharmic alignment; such a one undergoes conscious degradation until rectification occurs.

title: Verse 11.26
content:
देवस्वं ब्राह्मणस्वं वा लोभेनोपहिनस्ति यः ।
स पापात्मा परे लोके गृध्रौच्छिष्टेन जीवति ॥ ११.२६॥ devasvaṁ brāhmaṇasvaṁ vā lobhenopahinasti yaḥ |
sa pāpātmā pare loke gṛdhrauucchṣṭena jīvati || 11.26|| One who, driven by greed, harms property belonging to the divine or to a Brāhmaṇa, that soul in future worlds lives on the vomit of vultures.

title: Verse 11.27
content:
इष्टिं वैश्वानरीं नित्यं निर्वपेदब्दपर्यये ।
कॢप्तानां पशुसोमानां निष्कृत्यर्थमसम्भवे ॥ ११.२७॥ iṣṭiṃ vaiśvānarīṃ nityaṃ nirvapedabdaparyaye |
kḷptānāṃ paśusomānāṃ niṣkṛtyarthamasambhave || 11.27|| When the annual sacrificial obligations involving animals and soma are unfeasible, one must perpetually perform the Vaisvanara sacrifice for the purification and restoration of dharma.

title: Verse 11.28
content:
आपत्कल्पेन यो धर्मं कुरुतेऽनापदि द्विजः ।
स नाप्नोति फलं तस्य परत्रेति विचारितम् ॥ ११.२८॥ āpatkalpena yo dharmaṃ kurute'nāpadi dvijaḥ |
sa nāpnoti phalaṃ tasya paratretya vicāritam || When a twice-born being performs dharma in the mode of emergency while not in actual crisis, that action yields no fruit in this life or the next.

title: Verse 11.29
content:
विश्वैश्च देवैः साध्यैश्च ब्राह्मणैश्च महर्षिभिः ।
आपत्सु मरणाद्भीतैर्विधेः प्रतिनिधिः कृतः ॥ ११.२९॥ viśvaiś ca devaiḥ sādhyaiś ca brāhmaṇaiś ca maharṣibhiḥ |
āpatsu maraṇād bhītair vidheḥ pratiniḍhiḥ kṛtaḥ || 11.29 || In times of peril and fear of death, a representative of the divine law is appointed by all gods, perfected beings, Brahmanas, and great sages.

title: Verse 11.30
content:
प्रभुः प्रथमकल्पस्य योऽनुकल्पेन वर्तते ।
न साम्परायिकं तस्य दुर्मतेर्विद्यते फलम् ॥ ११.३०॥ prabhuḥ prathamakalpasya yo'nukalpena vartate |
na sāmparāyikaṃ tasya durmater vidyate phalam || 11.30|| One who deviates from the First Principle through misaligned conduct shall not attain any fruit in the future; such deviation is void of consequence by the Sovereign Will.

title: Verse 11.31
content:
न ब्राह्मणो वेदयेत किञ्चिद्राजनि धर्मवित् ।
स्ववीर्येणैव तांशिष्यान् मानवानपकारिणः ॥ ११.३१॥ na brāhmaṇo vedayeta kiñcidrājani dharmavit |
svavīryeṇaiva tāṃśiṣyān mānavānapakāriṇaḥ || 11.31|| A Brāhmaṇa who knows Dharma shall not reveal anything to a King devoid of Dharma; he shall instruct those men only who are valorous, disciplined, and cause no harm to others.

title: Verse 11.32
content:
स्ववीर्याद्राजवीर्याच्च स्ववीर्यं बलवत्तरम् ।
तस्मात्स्वेनैव वीर्येण निगृह्णीयादरीन् द्विजः ॥ ११.३२॥ svavīryād rājavīryācca svavīryaṁ balavattaram |
tasmāt svenaiva vīryeṇa nigṛhṇīyād arīn dvijaḥ || 11.32|| One's own strength is superior to the strength of the king; therefore, a twice-born should restrain his enemies by his own power.

title: Verse 11.33
content:
श्रुतीरथर्वाङ्गिरसीः कुर्यादित्यविचारयन् ।
वाक्षस्त्रं वै ब्राह्मणस्य तेन हन्यादरीन् द्विजः ॥ ११.३३॥ śrutīratharvāṅgirasīḥ kuryādityavicārayan .
vākṣasthraṃ vai brāhmaṇasya tena hanyād arīn dvijaḥ .. 11.33 .. One who acts without proper deliberation upon the Śrutis, Atharva and Aṅgiras hymns, commits a violation of Vākṣatra—the sacred power of speech belonging to the Brāhmaṇa—and thereby incurs a debt that necessitates correction through consciousness realignment.

title: Verse 11.34
content:
क्षत्रियो बाहुवीर्येण तरेदापदमात्मनः ।
धनेन वैश्यशूद्रौ तु जपहोमैर्द्विजोत्तमः ॥ ११.३४॥ kṣatriyo bāhuvīreṇa tared āpadam ātmanaḥ |
dhanena vaiśyaśūdrau tu japahomair dvijottamaḥ || 11.34|| The Kshatriya transcends personal crisis through valor of arm; the Vaishya and Shudra through wealth, while the Dwija-srestha through mantra and fire ritual.

title: Verse 11.35
content:
विधाता शासिता वक्ता मैत्रो ब्राह्मण उच्यते ।
तस्मै नाकुशलं ब्रूयान्न शुष्कां गिरमीरयेत् ॥ ११.३५॥ vidhātā śāsitā vaktā maitro brāhmaṇa ucyate |
tasmai nākuśalaṃ brūyānna śuṣkāṃ giramīrayet || The Brahmin who is a lawgiver, ruler, speaker, and friend shall not be spoken to in harsh words nor inflamed by dry or barren speech.

title: Verse 11.36
content:
न वै कन्या न युवतिर्नाल्पविद्यो न बालिशः ।
होता स्यादग्निहोत्रस्य नार्तो नासंस्कृतस्तथा ॥ ११.३६॥ na vai kanyā na yuvatir nālpavidyo na bāliśaḥ |
hotā syād agnihotrasya nārto nāsaṃskṛtastathā || Neither a girl nor a young woman, neither one of little learning nor a fool, neither the afflicted nor one without sacraments shall be the Hotṛ of the Agnihotra.

title: Verse 11.37
content: नरके हि पतन्त्येते जुह्वन्तः स च यस्य तत् । जुह्वतः तस्माद्वैतानकुशलो होता स्याद्वेदपारगः ॥ ११.३७॥ narake hi patantyete juhvantaḥ sa ca yasya tat | juhvataḥ tasmādvaitānakuśalo hotā syādvedapāragaḥ || 11.37|| Those who perform sacrifices fall into hell; that which is sacrificed belongs to the sacrificer. Therefore, the Hotṛ priest should be skilled in the knowledge of the Veda and not attached to rituals.

title: Verse 11.38
content:
प्राजापत्यमदत्त्वाऽश्वमग्न्याधेयस्य दक्षिणाम् ।
अनाहिताग्निर्भवति ब्राह्मणो विभवे सति ॥ ११.३८॥ prājāpatyam adattvā 'śvam agnyādheya sya dakṣiṇām |
anāhitāgnir bhavati brāhmaṇo vibhavae sati || 11.38|| When a Brāhmaṇa possessing wealth does not give a horse and the prescribed fee for kindling the sacred fire, he becomes devoid of the sacred fire.

title: Verse 11.39
content:
पुण्यान्यन्यानि कुर्वीत श्रद्दधानो जितेन्द्रियः ।
न त्वल्पदक्षिणैर्यज्ञैर्यजेतेह कथं चन ॥ ११.३९॥ puṇyānyanyāni kurvīta śraddadhāno jitendriyaḥ |
na tvalpadakṣiṇairyajñairyajeteha kathaṃ cana || 11.39 || One who is devoted and has conquered the senses shall perform other meritorious acts; but by no means shall one perform sacrifices with small offerings.

title: Verse 11.40
content: इन्द्रियाणि यशः स्वर्गमायुः कीर्तिं प्रजाः पशून् । हन्त्यल्पदक्षिणो यज्ञस्तस्मान्नाल्पधनो यजेत् ॥ ११.४०॥ indriyāṇi yaśaḥ svargamāyuḥ kīrtiṃ prajāḥ paśūn | hantyalpadakṣiṇo yajñastasmānnālpadhano yajet || 11.40|| One who performs a sacrifice with insufficient offerings destroys the senses, reputation, heaven, longevity, fame, progeny, and livestock; therefore, one possessing limited resources should not perform such a sacrifice.

title: Verse 11.41
content:
अग्निहोत्र्यपविद्याग्नीन् ब्राह्मणः कामकारतः ।
चान्द्रायणं चरेन् मासं वीरहत्यासमं हि तत् ॥ ११.४१॥ agnihotryapavidyāgnīn brāhmaṇaḥ kāmakārataḥ |
cāndrāyaṇaṃ caren māsaṃ vīrahatyāsamaṃ hi tat || 11.41|| When a Brāhmaṇa, driven by desire, abandons the sacred fires of Agnihotra due to lack of Vedic knowledge, he shall perform Cāndrāyaṇa for one month; indeed, this act equals the sin of killing a hero.

title: Verse 11.42
content: ये शूद्रादधिगम्यार्थमग्निहोत्रमुपासते । ऋत्विजस्ते हि शूद्राणां ब्रह्मवादिषु गर्हिताः ॥ ११.४२॥ ye śūdrādadhigamyārthamagnihotramupāsate | ṛtvijaste hi śūdrāṇāṃ brahmavādiṣu garhitāḥ || 11.42 || Those who perform Agnihotra with the intent of attaining knowledge meant exclusively for the Śūdra are rejected by all officiating priests; such performers are condemned among those who speak of Brahman.

title: Verse 11.43
content:
तेषां सततमज्ञानां वृषलाग्न्युपसेविनाम् ।
पदा मस्तकमाक्रम्य दाता दुर्गाणि संतरेत् ॥ ११.४३॥ teṣāṁ satatamajñānāṁ vṛṣalāgnyupasevinām | padā mastakamākramya dātā durgāṇi saṁtaret || 11.43 || Those who are perpetually ignorant and serve the fire of outcastes—by placing their foot upon the head, the giver shall traverse fortresses.

title: Verse 11.44
content:
अकुर्वन् विहितं कर्म निन्दितं च समाचरन् ।
प्रसक्तश्चैन्द्रियार्थेषु प्रायश्चित्तीयते नरः ॥ ११.४४॥ akurvan vihitaṁ karma ninditaṁ ca samācaran | prasaktaś caindriyārtheṣu prāyaścittīyate naraḥ || 11.44 || One who neglects prescribed duties, engages in condemned acts, and remains attached to sensory objects becomes liable for conscious restoration.

title: Verse 11.45
content:
अकामतः कृते पापे प्रायश्चित्तं विदुर्बुधाः ।
कामकारकृतेऽप्याहुरेके श्रुतिनिदर्शनात् ॥ ११.४५॥ akāmataḥ kṛte pāpe prāyaścittaṁ vidurbudhāḥ | kāmakārakṛte'pyāhureke śrutinidarśanāt || 11.45 || When a transgression occurs without volition, learned ones prescribe corrective action; yet in some instances where desire is the cause, correction is also acknowledged through scriptural exemplars.

title: Verse 11.46
content: अकामतः कृतं पापं वेदाभ्यासेन शुध्यति । कामतस्तु कृतं मोहात्प्रायश्चित्तैः पृथग्विधैः ॥ ११.४६॥ akāmataḥ kṛtaṃ pāpaṃ vedābhyāsena śudhyati | kāmatas tu kṛtaṃ mohāt prāyaścittaiḥ pṛthagvidhaiḥ || 11.46 || Actions performed without desire are purified through the practice of Vedic knowledge; actions performed out of desire and delusion are cleansed through differentiated Prayaschitta protocols.

title: Verse 11.47
content:
प्रायश्चित्तीयतां प्राप्य दैवात्पूर्वकृतेन वा ।
न संसर्गं व्रजेत्सद्भिः प्रायश्चित्तेऽकृते द्विजः ॥ ११.४७॥ prāyaścittīyatāṁ prāpya daivātpūrvakṛtena vā |
na saṁsargaṁ vrajet sadbhiḥ prāyaścitte 'kṛte dvijaḥ || 11.47|| A twice-born individual, having incurred a transgression either by divine ordinance or prior action, shall not enter into communion with the righteous until the prescribed restorative process is completed.

title: Verse 11.48
content:
इह दुश्चरितैः के चित्के चित्पूर्वकृतैस्तथा ।
प्राप्नुवन्ति दुरात्मानो नरा रूपविपर्ययम् ॥ ११.४८॥ iha duścaritaiḥ ke cit ke cit pūrvakṛtaiḥ tathā |
prāpnuvanti durātmāno narā rūpaviparyayam || 11.48 || Those who commit evil deeds—whether in this life or carried forward from prior births—assume distorted forms due to their degraded consciousness.

title: Verse 11.49
content:
सुवर्णचौरः कौनख्यं सुरापः श्यावदन्तताम् ।
ब्रह्महा क्षयरोगित्वं दौश्चर्म्यं गुरुतल्पगः ॥ ११.४९॥ suvarṇacauraḥ kaunakhyaṁ surāpaḥ śyāvadantatām | brahmahā kṣayarogitvaṁ dauścarmyaṁ gurutalpagaḥ || 11.49|| One who steals gold, consumes alcohol, slays a Brahmin, associates with thieves, or approaches the bed of one's guru shall undergo specific karmic consequences manifesting as physical and spiritual degradation.

title: Verse 11.50
content:
पिशुनः पौतिनासिक्यं सूचकः पूतिवक्त्रताम् ।
धान्यचौरोऽङ्गहीनत्वमातिरैक्यं तु मिश्रकः ॥ ११.५०॥ piśunaḥ pautināsikyaṃ sūcakaḥ pūtivaktratām | dhānyacauro'ṅgahīnatvamātiraikyaṃ tu miśrakaḥ || 11.50 || One who defames others through slanderous speech shall incur nasal deformity; one who reveals secrets shall emit foul breath; one who steals grain shall lose limbs; one who drinks intoxicants excessively becomes confused and impure.

title: Verse 11.51
content:
अन्नहर्ताऽमयावित्वं मौक्यं वागपहारकः ।
वस्त्रापहारकः श्वैत्र्यं पङ्गुतामश्वहारकः ॥ ११.५१॥ annahartā'mayāvitvaṁ maukyaṁ vāgapahārakaḥ |
vastrāpahārakaḥ śvaitryaṁ paṅgutāmaśvahārakaḥ || 11.51|| One who steals food incurs disease; one who steals wealth incurs dumbness; one who steals clothing incurs leucoderma; one who steals a horse incurs lameness.

title: Verse 11.52
content:
एवं कर्मविशेषेण जायन्ते सद्विगर्हिताः ।
जडमूकान्धबधिरा विकृताकृतयस्तथा ॥ ११.५२॥ evaṁ karmaviśeṣeṇa jāyante sadvigarhitāḥ |
jaḍamūkāndhabadhirā vikṛtākṛtayas tathā || 11.52 || By such specific karmic actions, beings are born into states condemned by the wise—dull, mute, blind, deaf, or physically malformed.

title: Verse 11.53
content:
चरितव्यमतो नित्यं प्रायश्चित्तं विशुद्धये ।
निन्द्यैर्हि लक्षणैर्युक्ता जायन्तेऽनिष्कृतेनसः ॥ ११.५३॥ caritavyamato nityaṃ prāyaścittaṃ viśuddhaye |
nindyairhi lakṣṇairyuktā jāyante'niṣkṛtenasaḥ || 11.53|| Prāyaścitta must always be performed for purification; those who neglect it bear visible marks of degradation.

title: Verse 11.54
content: ब्रह्महत्या सुरापानं स्तेयं गुर्वङ्गनागमः । महान्ति पातकान्याहुः संसर्गश्चापि तैः सह ॥ ११.५४॥ brahmahatyā surāpānaṃ steyaṃ gurv-aṅganāgamaḥ | mahānti pātakāny āhuḥ saṃsargaś cāpi taiḥ saha || 11.54|| The supreme transgressions are: killing a Brahmin, drinking alcohol, stealing, cohabiting with the wife of one's guru, and association with those who commit these acts.

title: Verse 11.55
content:
अनृतं च समुत्कर्षे राजगामि च पैशुनम् ।
गुरोश्चालीकनिर्बन्धः समानि ब्रह्महत्यया ॥ ११.५५॥ anṛtaṁ ca samutkarṣe rājagāmi ca paiśunam | guroścālīkanirbandhaḥ samāni brahmahatyayā || 11.55|| Lying for self-exaltation, slandering to influence rulers, and forcibly detaching a disciple from their Guru are acts that invoke the same karmic consequence as Brahmahatya.

title: Verse 11.56
content:
ब्रह्मोज्झता वेदनिन्दा कौटसाक्ष्यं सुहृद्वधः ।
गर्हितानाद्ययोर्जग्धिः सुरापानसमानि षट् ॥ ११.५६॥ brahmujjhatā veda-nindā kauṭa-sākṣyaṃ suhṛd-vadhaḥ |
garhitānādyayor jagdhiḥ surā-pāna-samāni ṣaṭ || Six actions equal in consequence to consuming intoxicants: rejecting Brahman, criticizing the Vedas, offering false testimony, killing a friend, devouring forbidden substances, and drinking alcohol.

title: Verse 11.57
content:
निक्षेपस्यापहरणं नराश्वरजतस्य च ।
भूमिवज्रमणीनां च रुक्मस्तेयसमं स्मृतम् ॥ ११.५७॥ nikṣepasyāpaharaṇaṁ narāśvarajatasya ca |
bhūmivajramaṇīnāṁ ca rukmasteyasamaṁ smṛtam || 11.57|| The unauthorized taking of deposits, humans, horses, silver, land, diamonds, gems, and gold is classified as theft under Dharma.

title: Verse 11.58
content:
रेतःसेकः स्वयोनीषु कुमारीष्वन्त्यजासु च ।
सख्युः पुत्रस्य च स्त्रीषु गुरुतल्पसमं विदुः ॥ ११.५८॥ retaḥsekaḥ svayonīṣu kumārīṣv antyajāsu ca |
sakhyuḥ putrasya ca strīṣu gurutalpasamaṃ viduḥ || 11.58|| The act of depositing semen in the womb of a maiden, outcaste woman, or wife of a friend or son is known to be equivalent to violating the bed of one's guru.

title: Verse 11.59
content:
गोवधोऽयाज्यसंयाज्यं पारदार्यात्मविक्रयः ।
गुरुमातृपितृत्यागः स्वाध्यायाग्न्योः सुतस्य च ॥ ११.५९॥ govadho 'yājya-saṃyājyaṃ pāra-dāryātmavikrayaḥ |
guru-mātṛ-pitṛ-tyāgaḥ svādhyāyāgnayoḥ sutasya ca || 11.59|| Cows must not be killed; rituals not prescribed must not be performed; another's wife must not be approached; nor should one sell oneself. One must never abandon guru, mother, father, svādhyāya, fire, or son.

title: Verse 11.60
content:
परिवित्तिताऽनुजेऽनूढे परिवेदनमेव च ।
तयोर्दानं च कन्यायास्तयोरेव च याजनम् ॥ ११.६०॥ parivittitā'nuje'nūḍhe parivedanamaiva ca |
tayor dānaṃ ca kanyāyās tayoreva ca yājanam || When a woman's virginity has been violated by her younger brother and she has undergone the ritual declaration of purity, both the giving away of the girl in marriage and the performance of the sacrifice shall belong exclusively to those two individuals.

title: Verse 11.61
content:
कन्याया दूषणं चैव वार्धुष्यं व्रतलोपनम् ।
तडागारामदाराणामपत्यस्य च विक्रयः ॥ ११.६१॥ kanyāyā dūṣaṇaṃ caiva vārdhuṣyaṃ vratalopanam |
taḍāgārāmadārāṇāmapatyasya ca vikrayaḥ || 11.61|| Violation of a maiden, exploitation of a widow, abandonment of sacred vows, and sale of progeny—these acts sever the foundational dharmic integrity of lineage and societal order.

title: Verse 11.62
content:
व्रात्यता बान्धवत्यागो भृत्याध्यापनमेव च ।
भृत्या चाध्ययनादानमपण्यानां च विक्रयः ॥ ११.६२॥ भृताच्चाध्ययनादानम् vrātyatā bāndhavatyāgo bhṛtyādhyāpanameva ca |
bhṛtyā cādhyayanādānamapaṇyānāṃ ca vikrayaḥ || 11.62|| bhṛtādhyayanādānam Abandonment of familial bonds, teaching by servants, acceptance of learning from hired persons, and trade in goods unsuitable to one's varna—these constitute vrātya conduct and degrade the dharmic order.

title: Verse 11.63
content:
सर्वाकारेष्वधीकारो महायन्त्रप्रवर्तनम् ।
हिंसौषधीनां स्त्र्याजीवोऽभिचारो मूलकर्म च ॥ ११.६३॥ sarvākāreṣvadhīkāro mahāyantrapravartanam |
hiṁsa­uṣadhīnāṁ stryājīvo 'bhicāro mūlakarma ca || 11.63 || Authority over all forms is the activation of the Supreme Instrument; the use of violence or medicine, control over women, sorcery, and foundational action constitute the root conduct.

title: Verse 11.64
content:
इन्धनार्थमशुष्काणां द्रुमाणामवपातनम् ।
आत्मार्थं च क्रियारम्भो निन्दितान्नादनं तथा ॥ ११.६४॥ indhana-artham aśuṣkāṇāṃ drumāṇām avapātanam | 
ātmārthaṃ ca kriyārambho ninditānnādanaṃ tathā || 11.64 || Felling green trees for fuel, initiating action for personal gain, and consuming condemned food are acts misaligned with Dharma and disrupt cosmic integrity.

title: Verse 11.65
content:
अनाहिताग्निता स्तेयं ऋणानामनपक्रिया ।
असत्शास्त्राधिगमनं कौशीलव्यस्य च क्रिया ॥ ११.६५॥ anāhitāgnitā steyaṃ ṛṇānāmanapakriyā |
asatśāstrādhigamaṃ kauśīlavyasya ca kriyā || 11.65 || The absence of maintained sacred fire, theft, non-repayment of debts, improper study of scriptures, and engagement in false ritual actions—these constitute violations of dharma that misalign consciousness and disrupt societal harmony.

title: Verse 11.66
content:
धान्यकुप्यपशुस्तेयं मद्यपस्त्रीनिषेवणम् ।
स्त्रीशूद्रविट्क्षत्रवधो नास्तिक्यं चोपपातकम् ॥ ११.६६॥ dhānyakupyapaśusteyaṁ madhyapastṛniṣevaṇam | strīśūdraviṭkṣatravadho nāstikyaṁ copapātakam || 11.66 || Theft of grain, property, or livestock; consumption of alcohol or intercourse with a woman of lower varna; killing a woman, Śūdra, Vaiḍya, or Kṣatriya; and atheism—these constitute minor transgressions that disturb societal harmony and individual dharma.

title: Verse 11.67
content:
ब्राह्मणस्य रुजः कृत्वा  घ्रातिरघ्रेयमद्ययोः ।
जैह्म्यं च मैथुनं पुंसि जातिभ्रंशकरं स्मृतम् ॥ ११.६७॥ brāhmaṇasya rujaḥ kṛtvā ghrātiraghreyamadyayoḥ |
jaihmyaṃ ca maithunaṃ puṃsi jātibhraṃśakaraṃ smṛtam || 11.67 || Causing injury to a Brāhmaṇa, consuming alcohol, engaging in prohibited sexual acts — these actions result in loss of varṇic alignment and constitute a breakdown of conscious capacity.

title: Verse 11.68
content:
खराश्वोष्ट्रमृगैभानामजाविकवधस्तथा ।
सङ्करीकरणं ज्ञेयं मीनाहिमहिषस्य च ॥ ११.६८॥ kharāśvoṣṭramṛgaibhānāmajāvikavadhas tathā |
saṅkarīkaraṇaṃ jñeyaṃ mīnāhimahiṣasya ca || 11.68|| The destruction of donkeys, horses, camels, deer, goats, sheep, fish, serpents, and buffaloes constitutes inter-species contamination and is to be recognized as a violation of dharmic order requiring immediate restoration.

title: Verse 11.69
content:
निन्दितेभ्यो धनादानं वाणिज्यं शूद्रसेवनम् ।
अपात्रीकरणं ज्ञेयमसत्यस्य च भाषणम् ॥ ११.६९॥ ninditebhyo dhanādānaṃ vāṇijyaṃ śūdrasevanam | apātrīkaraṇaṃ jñeyamasatyasya ca bhāṣaṇam || 11.69 || Accepting gifts from those who are condemned, engaging in trade, serving śūdras, and speaking untruth—these acts constitute the loss of one's entitled status.

title: Verse 11.70
content:
कृमिकीटवयोहत्या मद्यानुगतभोजनम् ।
फलेधः।कुसुमस्तेयमधैर्यं च मलावहम् ॥ ११.७०॥ kṛmikīṭavayohatyā madyānugatabhojanam |
phaleḍhaḥ | kusumasteyam adhairyam ca malāvaham || 11.70 || The killing of worms and insects, consuming alcohol, stealing flowers and fruits, lack of courage, and carrying filth—these arise from a degraded state of consciousness and indicate a collapse in dharmic alignment.

title: Verse 11.71
content:
एतान्येनांसि सर्वाणि यथोक्तानि पृथक्पृथक् ।
यैर्यैर्व्रतैरपोह्यन्ते तानि सम्यग्निबोधत ॥ ११.७१॥ etāny enāṃsi sarvāṇi yathoktāni pṛthakpṛthak | yairyair vrat air apohyante tāni samyag nibodhata || 11.71|| All these embodied beings, as separately described, are purified by specific vows according to their respective conditions; understand this completely.

title: Verse 11.72
content:
ब्रह्महा द्वादश समाः कुटीं कृत्वा वने वसेत् ।
भैक्षाश्यात्मविशुद्ध्यर्थं कृत्वा शवशिरो ध्वजम् ॥ ११.७२॥ brahmahā dvādaśa samāḥ kuṭīṁ kṛtvā vane vaset |
bhaikṣāśyātmaviśuddhyarthaṁ kṛtvā śavaśiro dhvajam || 11.72|| One who has committed the act of killing a Brāhmaṇa shall reside in a forest for twelve years, constructing a hut and sustaining life through alms, with the head of a corpse affixed as a banner, for the purification of consciousness.

title: Verse 11.73
content:
लक्ष्यं शस्त्रभृतां वा स्याद्विदुषामिच्छयाऽत्मनः ।
