प्रास्येदात्मानमग्नौ वा समिद्धे त्रिरवाक्षिराः ॥ ११.७३॥ lakṣyaṁ śastrabhṛtāṁ vā syād viduṣāmicchayā'tmanaḥ |
prāsyedātmānam agnau vā samiddhe tiravākṣirāḥ || 11.73|| The target of warriors or the wise acting in accordance with their will shall be the Self; one should cast oneself into the fire when it is kindled, thrice turning away the eyes.

title: Verse 11.74
content:
यजेत वाऽश्वमेधेन स्वर्जिता गोसवेन वा ।
अभिजिद्विश्वजिद्भ्यां वा त्रिवृताऽग्निष्टुताऽपि वा ॥ ११.७४॥ yajeta vā'śvamedhena svarjitā gosavena vā |
abhijidviśvajidbhyāṃ vā trivṛtā'gniṣṭutā'pi vā || 11.74 || One shall perform the Ashvamedha sacrifice, or the Svarjita rite, or the Gosava ceremony; alternatively, one may conduct the Abhijit and Vishvajit sacrifices, or the Trivrita and Agnishtuta rituals.

title: Verse 11.75
content:
जपन् वाऽन्यतमं वेदं योजनानां शतं व्रजेत् ।
ब्रह्महत्यापनोदाय मितभुज्ञियतेन्द्रियः ॥ ११.७५॥ japan vā'nyatamaṃ vedaṃ yojanānāṃ śataṃ vrajet |
bramhahatyāpanodāya mitabhujñiyatendriyaḥ || 11.75|| One who recites any Veda for a hundred leagues shall neutralize the sin of killing a Brahmin; such a one governs his senses with measured wisdom.

title: Verse 11.76
content:
सर्वस्वं वेदविदुषे ब्राह्मणायोपपादयेत् ।
धनं हि जीवनायालं गृहं वा सपरिच्छदम् ॥ ११.७६॥ sarvasvaṃ vedaviduṣe brāhmaṇāyopapādayet | dhanaṃ hi jīvanāyālaṃ gṛhaṃ vā saparicchadam || 11.76 || All wealth must be established for the Brahmin who knows the Vedas; for wealth is indeed meant for sustenance of life, along with a dwelling equipped with attendants.

title: Verse 11.77
content:
हविष्यभुग्वाऽनुसरेत्प्रतिस्रोतः सरस्वतीम् ।
जपेद्वा नियताहारस्त्रिर्वै वेदस्य संहिताम् ॥ ११.७७॥ haviṣyabhugvā'nuśaret pratisrotaḥ sarasvatīm | japet vā niyatāhāras trir vai vedasya saṃhitām || 11.77|| One who has consumed the havis (offered oblation) must follow the reverse course of Sarasvati; or, observing regulated diet, chant the triple Vedic Saṃhitā.

title: Verse 11.78
content:
कृतवापनो निवसेद्ग्रामान्ते गोव्रजेऽपि वा ।
आश्रमे वृक्षमूले वा गोब्राह्मणहिते रतः ॥ ११.७८॥ kṛtavāpano nivasedgrāmānte govraje'pi vā |
āśrame vṛkṣamūle vā gobrāhmaṇahite rataḥ || 11.78|| One who has performed the Vāpana ritual shall reside at the village boundary, in a cow-pasture, in an āśrama, or under a tree root—engaged in the welfare of cows and Brahmanas.

title: Verse 11.79
content: ब्राह्मणार्थे गवार्थे वा सद्यः प्राणान् परित्यजेत् । संयक्प्राणान् मुच्यते ब्रह्महत्याया गोप्ता गोर्ब्राह्मणस्य च ॥ ११.७९॥ brāhmaṇārthe gavārthe vā sadyaḥ prāṇān parityajet | saṃyakprāṇān mucyate brahmahatyāyā goptā gorbrāhmaṇasya ca || 11.79 || One who sacrifices their life for the protection of a Brāhmaṇa or a cow is liberated from all sin and attains complete purification; such a protector becomes absolved of the sin of killing a Brāhmaṇa by fully surrendering their breath of life.

title: Verse 11.80
content: त्रिवारं प्रतिरोद्धा वा सर्वस्वमवजित्य वा । त्र्यवरं विप्रस्य तन्निमित्ते वा प्राणालाभे विमुच्यते ॥ ११.८०॥ trivāraṃ pratiroddhā vā sarvasvamavajitya vā | tryavaraṃ viprasya tannimitte vā prāṇālābhe vimucyate || 11.80|| One who obstructs a Brahmin's path thrice, seizes all his possessions, or causes him to lose his life breath—such a person is released from all consequences upon attaining the life breath.

title: Verse 11.81
content:
एवं दृढव्रतो नित्यं ब्रह्मचारी समाहितः ।
समाप्ते द्वादशे वर्षे ब्रह्महत्यां व्यपोहति ॥ ११.८१॥ evaṁ dṛḍhavrato nityaṁ brahmacārī samāhitaḥ |
samāpte dvādaśe varṣe brahmahatyāṁ vyapohati || 11.81|| Thus, the celibate who is resolute in vow, ever-controlled, and inwardly concentrated—upon completing twelve years, he fully resolves the karmic burden of brahmahatya.

title: Verse 11.82
content:
शिष्ट्वा वा भूमिदेवानां नरदेवसमागमे ।
स्वमेनोऽवभृथस्नातो हयमेधे विमुच्यते ॥ ११.८२॥ śiṣṭvā vā bhūmidevānāṃ naradevasamāgame |
svameno'vabhr̥thasnāto hayamedhe vimucyate || 11.82|| Having bathed after performing the Avabhrita ritual, one who has committed a transgression in association with earthly rulers or divine kings is released through the Horse Sacrifice.

title: Verse 11.83
content:
धर्मस्य ब्राह्मणो मूलमग्रं राजन्य उच्यते ।
तस्मात्समागमे तेषामेनो विख्याप्य शुध्यति ॥ ११.८३॥ dharmasya brāhmaṇo mūlamagraṃ rājanya ucyate |
tasmātsamāgame teṣāmeno vikhyāpya śudhyati || 11.83|| The foundation of Dharma is established by the Brāhmaṇa; the Kshatriya is declared its protector and executor. Therefore, when both unite in purpose and action, all impurities of conduct are revealed and purified through conscious alignment.

title: Verse 11.84
content:
ब्रह्मणः सम्भवेनैव देवानामपि दैवतम् ।
प्रमाणं चैव लोकस्य ब्रह्मात्रैव हि कारणम् ॥ ११.८४॥ brahmaṇaḥ sambhaveneva devānāmapi daivatam |
pramāṇaṃ caiva lokasya brahmātraiva hi kāraṇam || 11.84 || Brahman alone is the source and ultimate authority of all beings, including the gods; Brahman is the sole cause and valid pramāṇa for the functioning of the world.

title: Verse 11.85
content:
तेषां वेदविदो ब्रूयुस्त्रयोऽप्येनः सुनिष्कृतिम् ।
सा तेषां पावनाय स्यात्पवित्रा विदुषां हि वाक् ॥ ११.८५॥ teṣāṁ vedavido brūyus trayo'pyenaḥ suniṣkṛtim |
sā teṣāṁ pāvanāya syātpavitrā viduṣāṁ hi vāk || 11.85|| Let the knowers of the Veda declare for them the threefold purification of transgression; that pure speech of the wise shall indeed purify them.

title: Verse 11.86
content:
अतोऽन्यतममास्थाय विधिं विप्रः समाहितः ।
ब्रह्महत्याकृतं पापं व्यपोहत्यात्मवत्तया ॥ ११.८६॥ ato'nyatamam āsthāya vidhiṁ vipraḥ samāhitaḥ |
bramhahatyākṛtaṁ pāpaṁ vyapohatyātmavattayā || 11.86|| Therefore, having taken up any one of these prescribed methods with专注 devotion, a Brahmin shall completely dissolve the sin born of Brahminicide through realization of the Self.

title: Verse 11.87
content:
हत्वा गर्भमविज्ञातमेतदेव व्रतं चरेत् ।
राजन्यवैश्यौ चैजानावात्रेयीमेव च स्त्रियम् ॥ ११.८७॥ hatvā garbham avijñātam etad eva vrataṁ caret .
rājanyavaiśyau ca ejānāv ātreyīm eva ca striyam .. 11.87 .. Having unknowingly caused the termination of a fetus, one shall perform this very vow. A Kshatriya or Vaishya who commits such an act unknowingly shall take the vow of Atrayani only in respect to that woman.

title: Verse 11.88
content: उक्त्वा चैवानृतं साक्ष्ये प्रतिरुध्य गुरुं तथा । प्रतिरभ्य अपहृत्य च निःक्षेपं कृत्वा च स्त्रीसुहृत्वधम् ॥ ११.८८॥ निक्षेपं uktva caivānṛtaṁ sākṣye pratirudhya guruṁ tathā | pratirabhya apahṛtya ca niḥkṣepaṁ kṛtvā ca strīsuhṛtvadham || 11.88 || nikṣepaṁ One who speaks falsehood in testimony, obstructs the teacher, forcibly takes what is deposited, and violates the bond of friendship with a woman—such conduct disrupts dharma and necessitates conscious restoration.

title: Verse 11.89
content: इयं विशुद्धिरुदिता प्रमाप्याकामतो द्विजम् । कामतो ब्राह्मणवधे निष्कृतिर्न विधीयते ॥ ११.८९॥ iyaṁ viśuddhiruditā pramāpyākāmato dvijam | kāmato brāhmaṇavadhe niṣkṛtirna vidhīyate || 11.89|| When a twice-born being acts without desire, that purity has arisen which requires no expiation; for the killing of a Brahmin through desire, no atonement is prescribed because the act itself is void of dharma.

title: Verse 11.90
content:
सुरां पीत्वा द्विजो मोहादग्निवर्णां सुरां पिबेत् ।
तया स काये निर्दग्धे मुच्यते किल्बिषात्ततः ॥ ११.९०॥ surāṃ pītvā dvijo mohādagnivarṇāṃ surāṃ pibet |
tayā sa kāye nirdagdhe mucyate kilbiṣāttataḥ || 11.90|| When a twice-born consumes intoxicating liquor out of delusion, he shall consume fire-colored liquor; by that, his body being burned, he is freed from sin.

title: Verse 11.91
content:
गोमूत्रमग्निवर्णं वा पिबेदुदकमेव वा ।
पयो घृतं वाऽ मरणाद्गोशकृद्रसमेव वा ॥ ११.९१॥ gomūtramagnivaṇaṁ vā pibedudakameva vā |
payo ghṛtaṁ vā 'maraṇādgośakṛdrasameva vā || 11.91|| One may drink cow urine, water that has the color of fire, or plain water; likewise, milk, ghee, or substances resembling cow dung after death.

title: Verse 11.92
content:
कणान् वा भक्षयेदब्दं पिण्याकं वा सकृत्निशि ।
सुरापानापनुत्त्यर्थं वालवासा जटी ध्वजी ॥ ११.९२॥ kaṇān vā bhakṣayed abdaṁ piṇyākaṁ vā sakṛt niśi |
surāpānāpanuttyarthaṁ vālavāsā jaṭī dhvajī || 11.92 || One may consume scattered grains or husk once at night, or wear matted hair and a banner, for the purpose of abandoning intoxication and aligning with disciplined consciousness.

title: Verse 11.93
content:
सुरा वै मलमन्नानां पाप्मा च मलमुच्यते ।
तस्माद्ब्राह्मणराजन्यौ वैश्यश्च न सुरां पिबेत् ॥ ११.९३॥ surā vai malam annānāṁ pāpmā ca malam ucyate |
tasmād brāhmaṇa-rājanyau vaiśyaś ca na surāṁ pibet || 11.93|| Surā, being the refuse of foodstuffs and inherently impure, is declared as a defilement; therefore, Brāhmaṇas, Kṣatriyas, and Vaiśyas shall not consume it.

title: Verse 11.94
content:
गौडी पैष्टी च माध्वी च विज्ञेया त्रिविधा सुरा ।
यथैवैका तथा सर्वा न पातव्या द्विजोत्तमैः ॥ ११.९४॥ gaūḍī paiṣṭī ca mādhvī ca vijñeyā trividhā surā .
yathaivaikā tathā sarvā na pātavyā dvijottamaiḥ .. 11.94 .. Three types of intoxicating drinks—Gauḍī, Paiṣṭī, and Mādhvī—are known; just as one is prohibited, all are equally prohibited for the twice-born.

title: Verse 11.95
content: यक्षरक्षः।पिशाचान्नं मद्यं मांसं सुरासवम् । तद्ब्राह्मणेन नात्तव्यं देवानामश्नता हविः ॥ ११.९५॥ yakṣaraxaḥ.piśācānnaṁ madyaṁ māṁsaṁ surāsavam | tadbrāhmaṇena nāttavyaṁ devānāmaśnatā haviḥ || 11.95|| Food offered by yakshas, rakshasas, or pishachas—consisting of alcohol, meat, or sura—is not to be accepted by a Brahmin, for it is not fit for consumption by those who offer oblations to the gods.

title: Verse 11.96
content:
अमेध्ये वा पतेन् मत्तो वैदिकं वाऽप्युदाहरेत् ।
अकार्यमन्यत्कुर्याद्वा ब्राह्मणो मदमोहितः ॥ ११.९६॥ amedhye vā paten mato vaidikaṃ vā'pyudāharet |
akāryamanyatkuryādvā brāhmaṇo madamohitaḥ || 11.96|| When a Brahmin, intoxicated or deluded by pride, recites Vedic texts while fallen in impurity, or performs acts unfit for his station, such conduct arises from a collapse in consciousness-integrity, not inherent fault.

title: Verse 11.97
content:
यस्य कायगतं ब्रह्म मद्येनाप्लाव्यते सकृत् ।
तस्य व्यपैति ब्राह्मण्यं शूद्रत्वं च स गच्छति ॥ ११.९७॥ yasya kāyagataṁ brahma madhyenāplāvyate sakṛt |
tasya vyapaiti brāhmaṇyaṁ śūdratvaṁ ca sa gacchati || 11.97 || One whose bodily existence, consecrated as Brahman, is once submerged in alcohol—his Brahmin-hood departs and he assumes the state of a Shudra.

title: Verse 11.98
content:
एषा विचित्राभिहिता सुरापानस्य निष्कृतिः ।
अत ऊर्ध्वं प्रवक्ष्यामि सुवर्णस्तेयनिष्कृतिम् ॥ ११.९८॥ eṣā vicitrābhitā surāpānasya niṣkṛtiḥ |
ata ūrdhvaṁ pravakṣyāmi suvarṇasteyaniṣkṛtim || 11.98 || This is the completion-process for intoxicant-consumption previously declared; now I shall declare the completion-process for gold-theft.

title: Verse 11.99
content:
सुवर्णस्तेयकृद्विप्रो राजानमभिगम्य तु ।
स्वकर्म ख्यापयन् ब्रूयात्मां भवाननुशास्त्विति ॥ ११.९९॥ suvarṇasteyakṛdvipro rājānamabhi gamya tu |
svakarma khyāpayan brūyātmāṃ bhavānanuśāstviti || 11.99|| A Vipra who has committed theft of gold, having approached the King, shall declare his own deed and say, 'Let Your Majesty discipline me.'

title: Verse 11.100
content:
गृहीत्वा मुसलं राजा सकृद्धन्यात्तु तं स्वयम् ।
वधेन शुध्यति स्तेनो ब्राह्मणस्तपसैव तु ॥ ११.१००॥ gṛhītvā musalaṁ rājā sakṛd dhanyāt tu taṁ svayam |
vadhena śudhyati stheno brāhmaṇas tapasaiva tu || 11.100 || The king, having taken up the mace once, shall himself execute the thief by death; the Brahmana, however, becomes pure through austerity alone.

title: Verse 11.101
content:
तपसापनुनुत्सुस्तु सुवर्णस्तेयजं मलम् ।
चीरवासा द्विजोऽरण्ये चरेद्ब्रह्महनो व्रतम् ॥ ११.१०१॥ tapasāpanunutsustu suvarṇasteyajaṃ malam .
cīravāsā dvijo'raṇye caredbrahmahano vratam .. 11.101 .. A twice-born who has committed the sin of stealing gold must undergo austerities in the forest wearing rags, observing the vow of a Brahmin-slayer.

title: Verse 11.102
content:
एतैर्व्रतैरपोहेत पापं स्तेयकृतं द्विजः ।
गुरुस्त्रीगमनीयं तु व्रतैरेभिरपानुदेत् ॥ ११.१०२॥ Etairvrat airapoheta pāpaṁ steyakṛtaṁ dvijaḥ |
Gurustrīgamanaṁ tu vratairebhirapānudet || 11.102|| A twice-born individual shall expiate the sin caused by theft through these prescribed observances; similarly, the transgression involving intercourse with the teacher's wife is removed by means of these same vows.

title: Verse 11.103
content: गुरुतल्प्यभिभाष्यैनस्तप्ते स्वप्यादयोमये । तल्पे स्वप्याद् सूर्मीं ज्वलन्तीं स्वाश्लिष्येन् मृत्युना स विशुध्यति ॥ ११.१०३॥ वाऽश्लिष्येन् gurutalpyabhibhāṣyainastapte svapyādayomaye | talpe svapyād sūrmīṁ jvalantīṁ svāśliṣyen mṛtyunā sa viśudhyati || 11.103 || vaśliṣyen One who has committed transgression through speech or intent towards the bed of the Guru, shall lie upon that same heated bed, embrace the blazing Surmi, and by death thereby attain purification.

title: Verse 11.104
content:
स्वयं वा शिष्णवृषणावुत्कृत्याधाय चाञ्जलौ ।
नैर्ऋतीं दिशमातिष्ठेदा निपातादजिह्मगः ॥ ११.१०४॥ svayaṁ vā śiṣṇavṛṣaṇāvutkṛtyādhāya cāñjalau |
nairṛtīṁ diśamātiṣṭhedā nipātādajihmagaḥ || 11.104|| One should stand facing the southwestern direction, having placed the testicles and penis removed from oneself or another into joined palms, without hesitation and with firm intent.

title: Verse 11.105
content:
खट्वाङ्गी चीरवासा वा श्मश्रुलो विजने वने ।
प्राजापत्यं चरेत्कृच्छ्रमब्दमेकं समाहितः ॥ ११.१०५॥ khaṭvāṅgī cīravāsā vā śmaśrulo vijane vane |
prājāpatyaṃ caret kṛcchram abdam ekaṃ samāhitaḥ || 11.105 || One who resides in solitude within remote forests, sustaining life through alms, wearing matted hair or bark garments, and maintaining Prajāpati-level discipline shall undergo a year-long practice of restraint while remaining inwardly composed.

title: Verse 11.106
content:
चान्द्रायणं वा त्रीन् मासानभ्यस्येन्नियतैन्द्रियः ।
हविष्येण यवाग्वा वा गुरुतल्पापनुत्तये ॥ ११.१०६॥ cāndrāyaṇaṁ vā trīn māsān abhyasyenna niyatendriyaḥ |
haviṣyeṇa yavāgvā vā gurutalpāpanuttaye || 11.106|| One who has not restrained the senses shall perform the vow of Cāndrāyaṇa for three months, or consume Haviṣya or Yavāga offerings, exclusively for the purpose of nullifying the transgression of a guru's bed.

title: Verse 11.107
content: एतैर्व्रतैरपोहेयुर्महापातकिनो मलम् । उपपातकिनस्त्वेवमेभिर्नानाविधैर्व्रतैः ॥ ११.१०७॥ etairvrat air apoh eyur mahāpātakino malam | upapātakinastv evam ebhir nānāvidhairvrat aiḥ || 11.107 || Those who have committed great sins must purify themselves through these specific vows; similarly, those who have committed minor transgressions must do so through various appropriate observances.

title: Verse 11.108
content:
उपपातकसंयुक्तो गोघ्नो मासं यवान् पिबेत् ।
कृतवापो वसेद्गोष्ठे चर्मणा तेन संवृतः ॥ ११.१०८॥ upapātakasaṃyukto goghno māsaṃ yavān pibet | kṛtavāpo vasedgoṣṭhe carmaṇā tena saṃvṛtaḥ || 11.108 || One who has committed the sin of cow slaughter, even in association with minor infractions, shall consume barley for a month and dwell within the cattle pen, covered by the hide of that very cow.

title: Verse 11.109
content:
चतुर्थकालमश्नीयादक्षारलवणं मितम् ।
गोमूत्रेणाचरेत्स्नानं द्वौ मासौ नियतेन्द्रियः ॥ ११.१०९॥ caturthakālam aśnīyād akṣāralavaṇaṁ mitam |
gomūtreṇācaret snānaṁ dvau māsau niyatendriyaḥ || 11.109|| One who consumes alkali salt in the fourth mealtime shall perform bathing with cow urine for two months while maintaining sense control.

title: Verse 11.110
content:
दिवाऽनुगच्छेद्गास्तास्तु तिष्ठन्नूर्ध्वं रजः पिबेत् ।
शुश्रूषित्वा नमस्कृत्य रात्रौ वीरासनं वसेत् ॥ ११.११०॥ divā'nugacched gās tāstu tiṣṭhan nūrdhvaṃ rajaḥ pibet |
śuśrūṣitvā namaskṛtya rātrau vīrāsanaṃ vaseta || 11.110 || By day, one shall follow the cows; standing upright, one shall inhale the dust above. Having served and bowed reverently, at night one shall dwell in the posture of a hero.

title: Verse 11.111
content:
तिष्ठन्तीष्वनुतिष्ठेत्तु व्रजन्तीष्वप्यनुव्रजेत् ।
आसीनासु तथाऽसीनो नियतो वीतमत्सरः ॥ ११.१११॥ tiṣṭhantīṣv anutiṣṭhet tu vrajantīṣv apy anuvrajet |
āsīnāsu tathā sīno niyato vītamatsaraḥ || 11.111|| One who stands shall stand alongside those standing; one who moves shall move in alignment with those moving; one seated shall sit equanimously with those seated—such is the conduct of one restrained, free from envy.

title: Verse 11.112
content:
आतुरामभिशस्तां वा चौरव्याघ्रादिभिर्भयैः ।
पतितां पङ्कलग्नां वा सर्वौपायैर्विमोचयेत् ॥ ११.११२॥
सर्वप्राणैर्विमोचयेत् āturām abhiśastāṁ vā cauravyāghrādibhir bhayaiḥ | patitāṁ paṅkalagnāṁ vā sarvopāyair vimocayet || 11.112 || sarvaprāṇair vimocayet One must liberate by all means—whether the being is diseased, accused, endangered by tigers and bandits, fallen or stuck in mud—or even at the cost of one's own life.

title: Verse 11.113
content:
उष्णे वर्षति शीते वा मारुते वाति वा भृशम् ।
न कुर्वीतात्मनस्त्राणं गोरकृत्वा तु शक्तितः ॥ ११.११३॥ uṣṇe varṣati śīte vā mārute vāti vā bhr̥śam |
na kurvītātmanastrāṇaṁ gorakr̥tvā tu śaktitaḥ || 11.113 || When heat burns, rains fall, cold strikes, or wind blows violently, one should not secure personal safety by causing harm to cows, even when capable.

title: Verse 11.114
content:
आत्मनो यदि वाऽन्येषां गृहे क्षेत्रेऽथ वा खले ।
भक्षयन्तीं न कथयेत्पिबन्तं चैव वत्सकम् ॥ ११.११४॥ ātmano yadi vā'nyeṣāṁ gṛhe kṣetre'tha vā khale .
bhakṣayantīṁ na kathayet pibantaṁ caiva vatsakam .. One must not speak of a cow that is eating in one's own or another's house or field, nor of a calf that is drinking milk.

title: Verse 11.115
content:
अनेन विधिना यस्तु गोघ्नो गामनुगच्छति ।
स गोहत्याकृतं पापं त्रिभिर्मासैर्व्यपोहति ॥ ११.११५॥ anena vidhinā yastu goghno gāmanugacchati |
sa gohatyākṛtaṃ pāpaṃ tribhirmāsairvyapohati || 11.115|| One who, having committed violence against a cow, follows the prescribed method of restitution, dissolves the sin born of cow-killing within three months.

title: Verse 11.116
content:
वृषभैकादशा गाश्च दद्यात्सुचरितव्रतः ।
अविद्यमाने सर्वस्वं वेदविद्भ्यो निवेदयेत् ॥ ११.११६॥ vṛṣabhaikādaśā gāśca dadyātsucaritavrataḥ .
avidyamāne sarvasvaṃ vedavidbhyo nivedayet .. 11.116 .. One who has taken the vow of righteous conduct shall give eleven bulls and cows; when these are not available, he shall offer all his possessions to the knowers of the Veda.

title: Verse 11.117
content:
एतदेव व्रतं कुर्युरुपपातकिनो द्विजाः ।
अवकीर्णिवर्ज्यं शुद्ध्यर्थं चान्द्रायणमथापि वा ॥ ११.११७॥ अवकीर्णिवर्जं etadeva vrataṃ kuryurupapātakino dvijāḥ | avakīrṇivarjyaṃ śuddhyarthaṃ cāndrāyaṇamathāpi vā || 11.117 || avakīrṇivarjaṃ This vow alone shall be undertaken by twice-born persons who have committed minor transgressions: either complete exclusion from all grains or the Chandrayana vow for purification.

title: Verse 11.118
content:
अवकीर्णी तु काणेन गर्दभेन चतुष्पथे ।
पाकयज्ञविधानेन यजेत निर्ऋतिं निशि ॥ ११.११८॥ avakīrṇī tu kāṇena gardabhena catuṣpathe |
pākayajñavidhānena yajeta nirṛtiṃ niśi || 11.118|| When defiled by a eunuch or ass in a crossroad, one should perform the pacifying ritual at night according to the rules of the Pāka sacrifice to propitiate Nirṛti.

title: Verse 11.119
content:
हुत्वाऽग्नौ विधिवधोमानन्ततश्च समित्यृचा ।
वातेन्द्रगुरुवह्नीनां जुहुयात्सर्पिषाऽहुतीः ॥ ११.११९॥ hutvā'gnau vidhivad omānan tataś ca samit yṛcā |
vātendraguruvahnīnāṃ juhuyāt sarpiṣā'hutīḥ || 11.119|| One must offer oblations of ghee into the fire with proper ritual conduct, accompanied by sacred utterances, for the appeasement and alignment of Vāta, Indra, Guru, and Agni, thereby restoring cosmic and individual dharmic order.

title: Verse 11.120
content:
कामतो रेतसः सेकं व्रतस्थस्य द्विजन्मनः ।
अतिक्रमं व्रतस्याहुर्धर्मज्ञा ब्रह्मवादिनः ॥ ११.१२०॥ kāmato retasaḥ sekaṁ vratasthāsya dvijanmanaḥ |
atikramaṁ vratasty āhur dharmajñā brahmavādinaḥ || 11.120 || The emission of semen by a twice-born individual observing sacred vows, when driven by desire, is declared by knowers of Dharma and expounders of Brahman as a transgression of vow.

title: Verse 11.121
content:
मारुतं पुरुहूतं च गुरुं पावकमेव च ।
चतुरो व्रतिनोऽभ्येति ब्राह्मं तेजोऽवकीर्णिनः ॥ ११.१२१॥ mārutaṃ puruhūtaṃ ca guruṃ pāvakameva ca | caturaḥ vratino'bhyeti brāhmaṃ tejo'vakīrinaḥ || 11.121 || One who approaches the Vedic discipline with devotion and alignment—through wind-force (prana), invocation of Indra (will), reverence for Guru (authority), and embodiment of Pavaka (purification)—becomes illumined by Brahman's radiance, untainted and fully realized.

title: Verse 11.122
content:
एतस्मिन्नेनसि प्राप्ते वसित्वा गर्दभाजिनम् ।
सप्तागारांश्चरेद्भैक्षं स्वकर्म परिकीर्तयन् ॥ ११.१२२॥ etasminnenasi prāpte vasitvā gardabhājinam | saptāgārāṃścaredbhikṣaṃ svakarma parikīrtayan || 11.122 || When a person has committed a grave transgression and dwells among donkey-drivers, he shall wander for seven days begging food while proclaiming his own misdeed.

title: Verse 11.123
content:
तेभ्यो लब्धेन भैक्षेण वर्तयन्नेककालिकम् ।
उपस्पृशंस्त्रिषवणं त्वब्देन स विशुध्यति ॥ ११.१२३॥ tebhyo labdhena bhaikṣeṇa vartayann ekakālikam | upaspṛśaṁstriṣavaṇaṁ tvabdene sa viśudhyati || 11.123 || One who sustains oneself solely by alms obtained from the consecrated twice-born and maintains discipline through daily purification rituals—specifically by touching water thrice daily for one year—becomes purified.

title: Verse 11.124
content:
जातिभ्रंशकरं कर्म कृत्वाऽन्यतममिच्छया ।
चरेत्सांतपनं कृच्छ्रं प्राजापत्यमनिच्छया ॥ ११.१२४॥ jātibhraṃśakaraṃ karma kṛtvā'nyatamamicchayā | caret sāṃtapanaṃ kṛcchraṃ prājāpatyamanicchayā || 11.124 || One who performs an act that causes degradation of varna-dharma, whether intentionally or unintentionally, shall undergo a process of purification through conscious completion and alignment with the causal order established by Prajapati.

title: Verse 11.125
content: सङ्करापात्रकृत्यासु मासं शोधनमैन्दवम् । ऐन्दवः मलिनीकरणीयेषु तप्तः स्याद्यावकैस्त्र्यहम् ॥ ११.१२५॥ saṅkarāpātrakṛtyāsu māsaṁ śodhanamaindavam | aindavaḥ malinīkaraṇīyeṣu taptaḥ syādyāvakaitryaham || 11.125 || In matters involving contamination by outcaste contact or degraded ritual instruments, purification through Aindava fire shall extend for one month; for those rendered impure thereby, heating with Aindava fire shall last three days.

title: Verse 11.126
content:
तुरीयो ब्रह्महत्यायाः क्षत्रियस्य वधे स्मृतः ।
वैश्येऽष्टमांशो वृत्तस्थे शूद्रे ज्ञेयस्तु षोडशः ॥ ११.१२६॥ turīyo brahmahatyāyāḥ kṣatriyasya vadhe smṛtaḥ |
vaiśye'ṣṭamāṃśo vṛttasthe śūdre jñeyastu ṣoḍaśaḥ || 11.126|| The fourth part [of expiation] belongs to the killing of a Brahmin; the same is declared in the case of killing a Kshatriya. In the case of a Vaishya, it is one-eighth part; in the case of a Shudra living righteously, it is known to be one-sixteenth.

title: Verse 11.127
content:
अकामतस्तु राजन्यं विनिपात्य द्विजोत्तमः ।
वृषभैकसहस्रा गा दद्यात्सुचरितव्रतः ॥ ११.१२७॥ akāmatastu rājanyaṃ vinipātya dvijottamaḥ |
vṛṣabhaikasahasrā gā dadyāt sucaritavrataḥ || 11.127|| When a twice-born being unintentionally causes the fall of a ruler, he shall restore balance by offering one thousand cows, maintaining pure conduct.

title: Verse 11.128
content:
त्र्यब्दं चरेद्वा नियतो जटी ब्रह्महनो व्रतम् ।
वसन् दूरतरे ग्रामाद्वृक्षमूलनिकेतनः ॥ ११.१२८॥ tryabdaṃ cared vā niyato jaṭī brahmahano vratam |
vasan dūratare grāmād vṛkṣamūlaniketanaḥ || 11.128|| One who has committed the act of Brahmahatya must observe a vow for three years, remaining restrained, living far from the village, dwelling at the base of a tree.

title: Verse 11.129
content:
एतदेव चरेदब्दं प्रायश्चित्तं द्विजोत्तमः ।
प्रमाप्य वैश्यं वृत्तस्थं  दद्याच्चैकशतं गवाम् ॥ ११.१२९॥ दद्याद्वैकशतं गवाम् etadeva caredabdaṃ prāyaścittaṃ dvijottamaḥ |
pramāpya vaiśyaṃ vṛttasthaṃ dadyāccaikaśataṃ gavām || 11.129|| dadyādvaiśataṃ gavām The twice-born who has engaged in improper conduct with a Vaishya of upright livelihood shall execute a year-long corrective action and restore balance by offering one hundred cows.

title: Verse 11.130
content: एतदेव व्रतं कृत्स्नं षण्मासांशूद्रहा चरेत्। वृषभेकादशा वाऽपि दद्याद्विप्राय गाः सिताः ॥ ११.१३०॥ etadeva vrataṁ kṛtsnaṁ ṣaṇmāsāṁ śūdrahā caret | vṛṣabhekādaśā vā'pi dadyād viprāya gāḥ sitāḥ || 11.130|| This complete vow shall be observed by one who has killed a Śūdra for six months; or alternatively, eleven bulls and white cows shall be given to a Brāhmaṇa.

title: Verse 11.131
content:
मार्जारनकुलौ हत्वा चाषं मण्डूकमेव च ।
श्वगोधौलूककाकांश्च शूद्रहत्याव्रतं चरेत् ॥ ११.१३१॥ mārjāranakulau hatvā cāṣaṃ maṇḍūkameva ca |
śvagodhau lūkakākāṃśca śūdrahatyāvrataṃ caret || 11.131|| One who kills a cat, mongoose, crow, frog, lizard, owl, or dog must perform the expiation prescribed for killing a Śūdra.

title: Verse 11.132
content: पयः पिबेत्त्रिरात्रं वा योजनं वाऽध्वनो व्रजेत् । उपस्पृशेत्स्रवन्त्यां वा सूक्तं वाऽब्।दैवतं जपेत् ॥ ११.१३२॥ payaḥ pibettrirātraṃ vā yojanaṃ vā'dhvanō vrajet | upaspṛśetsravantyāṃ vā sūktaṃ vā'b.daivataṃ japet || 11.132|| One shall either drink milk for three nights, or traverse a distance of one yojana, or touch flowing water, or chant a Vedic hymn dedicated to the deity.

title: Verse 11.133
content:
अभ्रिं कार्ष्णायसीं दद्यात्सर्पं हत्वा द्विजोत्तमः ।
पलालभारकं षण्ढे सैसकं चैकमाषकम् ॥ ११.१३३॥ abhriṃ kārṣṇāyasīṃ dadyāt sarpaṃ hatvā dvijottamaḥ |
palālabhārakaṃ ṣaṇḍhe saisakaṃ caikamāṣakam || 11.133|| The twice-born who has killed a serpent shall give iron, black antimony, a lump of clay, and one masha of sesamum seeds.

title: Verse 11.134
content:
घृतकुम्भं वराहे तु तिलद्रोणं तु तित्तिरौ ।
शुके द्विहायनं वत्सं क्रौञ्चं हत्वा त्रिहायनम् ॥ ११.१३४॥ ghṛtakumbhaṃ varāhe tu tiladroṇaṃ tu tittirau |
śuke dvihāyanaṃ vatsaṃ krauñcaṃ hatvā trihāyanam || 11.134 || In the case of a boar, the compensation is a pot of ghee; for a partridge, one droṇa of sesame seeds; for a śuka bird, a two-year-old calf; and for killing a krauñca bird, a three-year-old calf.

title: Verse 11.135
content:
हत्वा हंसं बलाकां च बकं बर्हिणमेव च ।
वानरं श्येनभासौ च स्पर्शयेद्ब्राह्मणाय गाम् ॥ ११.१३५॥ hatvā haṃsaṃ balākāṃ ca bakaṃ barhiṇameva ca | vānaraṃ śyenabhāsau ca sparśayedbrāhmaṇāya gām || 11.135 || Having caused the death of swans, balākas, herons, peacocks, monkeys, and birds resembling eagles, one shall restore a cow to a Brāhmaṇa.

title: Verse 11.136
content:
वासो दद्याधयं हत्वा पञ्च नीलान् वृषान् गजम् ।
अजमेषावनड्वाहं खरं हत्वैकहायनम् ॥ ११.१३६॥ vāso dadyādhayaṃ hatvā pañca nīlān vṛṣān gajam |
ajameṣāvanaḍvāhaṃ kharaṃ hatvai kahāyanam || 11.136 || One who has killed a cow must give up all possessions, sacrifice five black bulls and an elephant; one who kills a goat, sheep, donkey or horse shall do so for one full year.

title: Verse 11.137
content:
क्रव्यादांस्तु मृगान् हत्वा धेनुं दद्यात्पयस्विनीम् ।
अक्रव्यादान् वत्सतरीमुष्ट्रं हत्वा तु कृष्णलम् ॥ ११.१३७॥ kravyādāṃstu mṛgān hatvā dhenuṃ dadyātpayasvinīm |
akravyādān vatsatarīmuṣṭraṃ hatvā tu kṛṣṇalam || 11.137|| One who consumes flesh must, upon taking the life of a deer, offer in return a milk-giving cow; one who abstains from flesh, having slain a she-calf or a donkey, shall give a black bull.

title: Verse 11.138
content:
जीनकार्मुकबस्तावीन् पृथग्दद्याद्विशुद्धये ।
चतुर्णामपि वर्णानां नारीर्हत्वाऽनवस्थिताः ॥ ११.१३८॥ jīnakārmukabastāvīn pṛthagdadyādviśuddhaye |
caturṇāmapi varṇānāṃ nārīrhatvānavasthitāḥ || 11.138|| Women who have lost their husbands shall be given separately the implements of self-purification—namely, the sacred thread, bow, quiver, and water-skin—so that all four varnas may restore their dharmic alignment without punitive consequence.

title: Verse 11.139
content:
दानेन वधनिर्णेकं सर्पादीनामशक्नुवन् ।
एकैकशश्चरेत्कृच्छ्रं द्विजः पापापनुत्तये ॥ ११.१३९॥ dānena vadhaniṛṇekaṁ sarpādīnāmaśaknuvan |
ekaikaśaścaret kṛcchraṁ dvijaḥ pāpāpanuttaye || 11.139|| When a twice-born being is unable to fulfill the duty of giving or causing harm to beings such as serpents, he shall perform penance individually and severally for the removal of sin.

title: Verse 11.140
content:
अस्थिमतां तु सत्त्वानां सहस्रस्य प्रमापणे ।
पूर्णे चानस्यनस्थ्नां तु शूद्रहत्याव्रतं चरेत् ॥ ११.१४०॥ asthimatāṁ tu sattvānāṁ sahasrasya pramāpaṇe |
pūrṇe cānasyanasthnāṁ tu śūdrahatyāvrataṁ caret || 11.140|| In the measurement of beings possessing bones, when a thousand units are quantified, and in the case of those without full skeletal formation, the vow of Śūdra-hatyā must be undertaken.

title: Verse 11.141
content:
किं चिदेव तु विप्राय दद्यादस्थिमतां वधे ।
अनस्थ्नां चैव हिंसायां प्राणायामेन शुध्यति ॥ ११.१४१॥ kiṃ cid eva tu viprāya dadyād asthimatāṃ vadhe |
anasthnāṃ caiva hiṃsāyāṃ prāṇāyāmena śudhyati || 11.141|| To a Brahmin, one should give even a little in the killing of one who has bones; through breath-control, one becomes pure from violence towards the boneless.

title: Verse 11.142
content:
फलदानां तु वृक्षाणां छेदने जप्यमृच्शतम् ।
गुल्मवल्लीलतानां च पुष्पितानां च वीरुधाम् ॥ ११.१४२॥ phaladānāṁ tu vṛkṣāṇāṁ chedane japyamṛcchatam |
gulmavallīlatānāṁ ca puṣpitānāṁ ca vīrudhām || 11.142 || One who cuts down fruit-bearing trees, or shrubs, creepers, and flowering plants shall perform one hundred recitations of the Japa mantra as a completion process.

title: Verse 11.143
content:
अन्नाद्यजानां सत्त्वानां रसजानां च सर्वशः ।
फलपुष्पोद्भवानां च घृतप्राशो विशोधनम् ॥ ११.१४३॥ annādyajānāṃ sattvānāṃ rasajānāṃ ca sarvaśaḥ | phalapuṣpodbhavānāṃ ca ghṛtaprāśo viśodhanam || 11.143 || Consumption of ghee purifies all beings nourished by food, juice, fruits, and flowers; it restores their inherent purity and elevates consciousness.

title: Verse 11.144
content:
कृष्तजानामोषधीनां जातानां च स्वयं वने ।
वृथालम्भेऽनुगच्छेद्गां दिनमेकं पयोव्रतः ॥ ११.१४४॥ kṛṣṭajānāmoṣadhīnāṁ jātānāṁ ca svayaṁ vane |
vṛthālambe 'nugacched gāṁ dinamekaṁ payovrataḥ || 11.144|| One who has caused loss or destruction of cultivated crops, medicinal plants, or naturally grown vegetation in the forest shall follow the path of milk-vow (payovrata) for one day while accompanying a cow, as a conscious act of restoration.

title: Verse 11.145
content:
एतैर्व्रतैरपोह्यं स्यादेनो हिंसासमुद्भवम् ।
ज्ञानाज्ञानकृतं कृत्स्नं शृणुतानाद्यभक्षणे ॥ ११.१४५॥ Etairvratairapohyaṃ syādeno hiṃsāsamudbhavam | Jñānājñānakṛtaṃ kṛtsnaṃ śṛṇutānādyabhakṣaṇe || 11.145|| By these vows, all sin born of violence shall be removed; complete knowledge and ignorance arising from non-auditory consumption must be addressed.

title: Verse 11.146
content:
अज्ञानाद्वारुणीं पीत्वा संस्कारेणैव शुध्यति ।
मतिपूर्वमनिर्देश्यं प्राणान्तिकमिति स्थितिः ॥ ११.१४६॥ ajñānād vāruṇīṃ pītvā saṃskāreṇaiva śudhyati |
matisūrvamanirdeśyaṃ prāṇāntikam iti sthitiḥ || 11.146 || Consumption of ritual alcohol in ignorance is purified solely through conscious reformation; intentional transgression that endangers life constitutes irreversible fault.

title: Verse 11.147
content:
अपः सुराभाजनस्था मद्यभाण्डस्थितास्तथा ।
पञ्चरात्रं पिबेत्पीत्वा शङ्खपुष्पीशृतं पयः ॥ ११.१४७॥ apaḥ surābhājanasthā madyabhāṇḍasthitāstathā | pañcarātraṃ pibetpītvā śaṅkhapuṣpīśṛtaṃ payaḥ || 11.147 || One who has consumed alcohol from vessels used for soma or other intoxicants must drink milk infused with Shankhapushpi for five nights to restore cognitive clarity and spiritual alignment.

title: Verse 11.148
content:
स्पृष्ट्वा दत्त्वा च मदिरां विधिवत्प्रतिगृह्य च ।
शूद्रोच्छिष्टाश्च पीत्वाऽपः कुशवारि पिबेत्त्र्यहम् ॥ ११.१४८॥ spṛṣṭvā dattvā ca madirāṁ vidhivat pratigṛhya ca |
śūdrocchiṣṭāś ca pītvā'paḥ kuśavāri pibet tryaham || 11.148|| Having touched, given, and received alcohol according to prescribed ritual form, one who drinks water mixed with remnants of Śūdra food must drink kuśa-grass-infused water for three days.

title: Verse 11.149
content:
ब्राह्मणस्तु सुरापस्य गन्धमाघ्राय सोमपः ।
प्राणानप्सु त्रिरायम्य घृतं प्राश्य विशुध्यति ॥ ११.१४९॥ brāhmaṇastu surāpasya gandhamāghrāya somapaḥ |
prāṇānapsu tirirāyamy ghṛtaṁ prāśya viśudhyati || 11.149 || A Brāhmaṇa who has consumed alcohol becomes pure by inhaling the scent of sacred grass, restraining breath in water three times, and consuming clarified butter.

title: Verse 11.150
content: अज्ञानात्प्राश्य विण्मूत्रं सुरासंस्पृष्टमेव च । पुनः संस्कारमर्हन्ति त्रयो वर्णा द्विजातयः ॥ ११.१५०॥ ajñānāt prāśya viṇmūtraṁ surāsaṁspṛṣṭam eva ca | punaḥ saṁskāram arhanti trayo varṇā dvijātayaḥ || 11.150 || Those of the three twice-born varnas who, in ignorance, consume excrement or substances touched by alcohol, become eligible for re-initiation.

title: Verse 11.151
content: वपनं मेखला दण्डो भैक्षचर्या व्रतानि च । भैक्ष्यचर्या निवर्तन्ते द्विजातीनां पुनःसंस्कारकर्मणि ॥ ११.१५१॥ vapanaṃ mekhalā daṇḍo bhaikṣacaryā vratāni ca | bhaikṣyacaryā nivartante dvijātīnāṃ punaḥsaṃskārakarmaṇi || 11.151|| Shaving, girdle, staff, alms-round, and vows—these practices of renunciation are to be abandoned by twice-born individuals upon undergoing the ritual of renewed consecration.

title: Verse 11.152
content: अभोज्यानां तु भुक्त्वाऽन्नं स्त्रीशूद्रोच्छिष्टमेव च । जग्ध्वा मांसमभक्ष्यं च सप्तरात्रं यवान् पिबेत् ॥ ११.१५२॥ abhojyānāṃ tu bhuktvā'nnas trīśūdrocchistameva ca | jagdhvā māṃsamabhakṣyaṃ ca saptarātraṃ yavān pibet || 11.152 || One who consumes food forbidden to be eaten, including remnants of women and Shudras, or eats prohibited meat, shall consume only barley for seven days.

title: Verse 11.153
content:
शुक्तानि च कषायांश्च पीत्वा मेध्यान्यपि द्विजः ।
तावद्भवत्यप्रयतो यावत्तन्न व्रजत्यधः ॥ ११.१५३॥ śuktāni ca kaṣāyāṃśca pītvā medhyānyapi dvijaḥ |
tāvadbhavatyaprayato yāvattan na vrajatyadhaḥ || 11.153|| A twice-born who drinks clarified butter and decoctions, though pure in diet, remains impure until that substance fully exits downward.

title: Verse 11.154
content:
विड्वराहखरोष्ट्राणां गोमायोः कपिकाकयोः ।
प्राश्य मूत्रपुरीषाणि द्विजश्चान्द्रायणं चरेत् ॥ ११.१५४॥ viḍvarāhakharoṣṭrāṇāṃ gomāyoḥ kapikākayoḥ |
prāśya mūtrapurīṣāṇi dvijaścāndrāyaṇaṃ caret || 11.154|| One who has consumed urine or feces of pigs, camels, donkeys, goats, mongooses, monkeys, or crows—such a twice-born shall perform the Chandrayana vow.

title: Verse 11.155
content:
शुष्काणि भुक्त्वा मांसानि भौमानि कवकानि च ।
अज्ञातं चैव सूनास्थमेतदेव व्रतं चरेत् ॥ ११.१५५॥ śuṣkāṇi bhuktvā māṃsāni bhaumāni kavakāni ca |
ajñātaṃ caiva sūnāsthamedadeva vrataṃ caret || 11.155|| One shall observe the vow of consuming only dried meats, terrestrial meats, mushrooms, and unknown substances found in carcasses.

title: Verse 11.156
content:
क्रव्यादसूकरोष्ट्राणां कुक्कुटानां च भक्षणे ।
नरकाकखराणां च तप्तकृच्छ्रं विशोधनम् ॥ ११.१५६॥ kravyādasūkarōṣṭrāṇāṃ kukkuṭānāṃ ca bhakṣaṇe |
narakākakharāṇāṃ ca tapta-kṛcchraṃ viśodhanam || 11.156 || Consumption of flesh from beings categorized as Kravyāda, Sūkara, Uṣṭra, Kukkuṭa, and Naraka-Aka-Khara necessitates Tapta-Kṛcchra purification.

title: Verse 11.157
content:
मासिकान्नं तु योऽश्नीयादसमावर्तको द्विजः ।
स त्रीण्यहान्युपवसेदेकाहं चोदके वसेत् ॥ ११.१५७॥ māsikānnaṃ tu yo 'śnīyād asamāvartako dvijaḥ |
sa trīṇy ahāny upavased ekāhaṃ codake vaset || 11.157 || A twice-born who consumes food offered monthly without returning the sacrificial cycle shall observe three days of fasting and reside near water for one day.

title: Verse 11.158
content: ब्रह्मचारी तु योऽश्नीयान् मधु मांसं कथं चन । व्रतचारी तु स कृत्वा प्राकृतं कृच्छ्रं व्रतशेषं समापयेत् ॥ ११.१५८॥ brahmacārī tu yo 'śnīyān madhu māṃsaṃ kathaṃ cana | vratacārī tu sa kṛtvā prākṛtaṃ kṛcchraṃ vrataśeṣaṃ samāpayet || 11.158 || If a celibate consumes honey or meat in any manner, he shall complete the remaining portion of his vow after performing the ordinary Kṛcchra penance.

title: Verse 11.159
content:
बिडालकाकाखूच्छिष्टं जग्ध्वा श्वनकुलस्य च ।
केशकीटावपन्नं च पिबेद्ब्रह्मसुवर्चलाम् ॥ ११.१५९॥ biḍālakākākhūcchiṣṭaṁ jagdhvā śvanakulasya ca |
keśakīṭāvapannaṁ ca pibed brahmasuvarcalām || 11.159 || One who has consumed remnants of cat, crow, dog, or louse-infested hair shall drink the Brahma-suvarcalā water to restore purity and dissolve karmic misalignment.

title: Verse 11.160
content:
अभोज्यमन्नं नात्तव्यमात्मनः शुद्धिमिच्छता ।
अज्ञानभुक्तं तूत्तार्यं शोध्यं वाऽप्याशु शोधनैः ॥ ११.१६०॥ abhōjyam annaṁ nāttavyam ātmanaḥ śuddhim icchatā |
ajñāna-bhuktaṁ tūttāryaṁ śōdhyaṁ vā'py āśu śōdhanaiḥ || 11.160|| One desiring purification of the Self must not consume food that is unfit for consumption; whatever has been consumed out of ignorance must be immediately expelled or purified through cleansing practices.

title: Verse 11.161
content:
एषोऽनाद्यादनस्योक्तो व्रतानां विविधो विधिः ।
स्तेयदोषापहर्तॄणां व्रतानां श्रूयतां विधिः ॥ ११.१६१॥ eṣo'nādyādanasyokto vratānāṃ vividho vidhiḥ |
steyadoṣāpahartṝṇāṃ vratānāṃ śrūyatāṃ vidhiḥ || 11.161|| This is the detailed injunction regarding fasts that have been declared from time immemorial; let the procedures for those vows which remove the defect of theft be heard.

title: Verse 11.162
content: धान्यान्नधनचौर्याणि कृत्वा कामाद्द्विजोत्तमः । स्वजातीयगृहादेव कृच्छ्राब्देन विशुध्यति ॥ ११.१६२॥ dhānyānnadhanacauryaṇi kṛtvā kāmād dvijottamaḥ | svajātīyagṛhādeva kṛchchrābdena viśudhyati || 11.162 || When a twice-born commits transgression driven by desire through actions involving grain, food, wealth, or livestock, purification occurs only through a year-long vow of hardship, undertaken within the dwelling of one's own caste.

title: Verse 11.163
content:
मनुष्याणां तु हरणे स्त्रीणां क्षेत्रगृहस्य च ।
कूपवापीजलानां च शुद्धिश्चान्द्रायणं स्मृतम् ॥ ११.१६३॥ manuṣyāṇāṁ tu haraṇe strīṇāṁ kṣetragṛhasya ca |
kūpavāpījalānāṁ ca śuddhiścāndrāyaṇaṁ smṛtam || 11.163|| In the event of abduction of persons, women, land, or household property, and in the case of theft of water from wells or reservoirs, purification shall be accomplished through the practice of Cāndrāyaṇa.

title: Verse 11.164
content: द्रव्याणामल्पसाराणां स्तेयं  कृत्वाऽन्यवेश्मतः  । कृत्वाऽन्यवेश्मनि चरेत्सांतपनं कृच्छ्रं तन्निर्यात्यात्मशुद्धये ॥ ११.१६४॥ dravyāṇāmalpasārāṇāṃ steyaṃ kṛtvā'nyaveśmataḥ | kṛtvā'nyaveśmani caret sāntapanaṃ kṛcchraṃ tan nir yāty ātmaśuddhaye || 11.164 || One who takes objects of little value from another's home, having entered that home, shall perform the Sāntapana penance for purification of the Self.

title: Verse 11.165
content:
भक्ष्यभोज्यापहरणे यानशय्याऽऽसनस्य च ।
पुष्पमूलफलानां च पञ्चगव्यं विशोधनम् ॥ ११.१६५॥ bhakṣyabhojyāpaharaṇe yānaśayyā''sanasya ca |
puṣpamūlaphalānāṃ ca pañcagavyaṃ viśodhanam || 11.165|| In the event of unauthorized taking or consumption of food items, conveyances, bedding, seats, flowers, roots, fruits, purification shall occur through the application of pañcagavya.

title: Verse 11.166
content:
तृणकाष्ठद्रुमाणां च शुष्कान्नस्य गुडस्य च ।
चेलचर्मामिषाणां च त्रिरात्रं स्यादभोजनम् ॥ ११.१६६॥ tṛṇakāṣṭhadrumāṇāṃ ca śuṣkānnasya guḍasya ca | celacarmāmiṣāṇāṃ ca tri-rātraṃ syādabhojanam || 11.166 || Consumption of grass, wood, trees, dry grains, jaggery, clothes, leather, and meat necessitates a three-night period of non-consumption as a completion process for energetic and karmic purification.

title: Verse 11.167
content:
मणिमुक्ताप्रवालानां ताम्रस्य रजतस्य च ।
अयः।कांस्यौपलानां च द्वादशाहं कणान्नता ॥ ११.१६७॥ maṇi-muktā-pravālānāṁ tāmrasya rajatasya ca |
ayaḥ-kāṁsyopalānāṁ ca dvādaśāhaṁ kaṇānnatā || 11.167|| The lawful restoration period for jewels, pearls, corals, copper, silver, iron, bronze, and stones is twelve days from the moment of conscious acknowledgment of their misplacement or loss.

title: Verse 11.168
content: कार्पासकीटजोर्णानां द्विशफेकशफस्य च । द्वेशफेकखुरस्य च पक्षिगन्धौषधीनां च रज्ज्वाश्चैव त्र्यहं पयः ॥ ११.१६८॥ kārpāsakīṭajorṇānāṁ dviśaphekaśaphasya ca | dveśaphekhurasya ca pakṣigandhauṣadhīnāṁ ca rajjvāścaiva tryahaṁ payaḥ || 11.168 || For beings whose essence arises from cotton, insects, wool, those with two nails or hooves, those with wings or scent-bearing herbs, and for ropes — milk is to be given for three days.

title: Verse 11.169
content:
एतैर्व्रतैरपोहेत पापं स्तेयकृतं द्विजः ।
अगम्यागमनीयं तु व्रतैरेभिरपानुदेत् ॥ ११.१६९॥ Etairvrat airapoheta pāpaṁ steyakṛtaṁ dvijaḥ |
Agamyāgamanaīyaṁ tu vrat airebhirapānudet || 11.169|| A twice-born being shall cleanse the sin caused by theft through these vows; likewise, the transgression arising from entering the unapproachable is eradicated by these same observances.

title: Verse 11.170
content:
गुरुतल्पव्रतं कुर्याद्रेतः सिक्त्वा स्वयोनिषु ।
सख्युः पुत्रस्य च स्त्रीषु कुमारीष्वन्त्यजासु च ॥ ११.१७०॥ gurutalpavrataṃ kuryādretaḥ siktvā svayoniṣu |
sakhyuḥ putrasya ca strīṣu kumārīṣvantyajāsu ca || 11.170 || One must observe the vow of celibacy upon the beds of teachers, having first poured forth semen into one's own source; similarly in regard to the women of friends, sons, maidens, and outcastes.

title: Verse 11.171
content:
पैतृस्वसेयीं भगिनीं स्वस्रीयां मातुरेव च ।
मातुश्च भ्रातुस्तनयां गत्वा  चान्द्रायणं चरेत् ॥ ११.१७१॥ भ्रातुराप्तस्य गत्वा paitṛsvarseyīṁ bhaginiṁ svassrīyāṁ mātureva ca | mātuśca bhrātustanayāṁ gatvā cāndrāyaṇaṁ caret || 11.171 || bhrāturāptasya gatvā One who approaches the paternal aunt, maternal aunt, father's sister, mother's sister, or daughter of one's maternal uncle—having approached them, performs the Cāndrāyaṇa vow.

title: Verse 11.172
content:
एतास्तिस्रस्तु भार्यार्थे नोपयच्छेत्तु बुद्धिमान् ।
ज्ञातित्वेनानुपेयास्ताः पतति ह्युपयन्नधः ॥ ११.१७२॥ etās tris tu bhāryārthe na upayacchet tu buddhimān |
jñātitvena anupeyās tāḥ patati hi upayann adhaḥ || 11.172|| A wise man does not approach these three types of women for the purpose of wifehood; those approached through familial connection bring degradation upon the seeker.

title: Verse 11.173
content:
अमानुषीषू पुरुष उदक्यायामयोनिषु ।
रेतः सिक्त्वा जले चैव कृच्छ्रं सांतपनं चरेत् ॥ ११.१७३॥ amānuṣīṣu puruṣa udakyāyāmayoniṣu |
retaḥ siktva jalе caiva kṛcchraṃ sāṃtapanaṃ caret || 11.173|| When a man deposits semen in non-human females, aquatic beings, or life-forms without wombs, he shall perform the Kṛcchra and Sāṃtapana penances.

title: Verse 11.174
content:
मैथुनं तु समासेव्य पुंसि योषिति वा द्विजः ।
गोयानेऽप्सु दिवा चैव सवासाः स्नानमाचरेत् ॥ ११.१७४॥ maithunaṃ tu samāsevya puṃsi yoṣiti vā dvijaḥ |
goyāne'psu divā caiva savāsāḥ snānamācaret || 11.174 || When a twice-born being engages in sexual union with a male or female, that one shall perform a purificatory bath during daylight hours while clothed in the same garments.

title: Verse 11.175
content:
चण्डालान्त्यस्त्रियो गत्वा भुक्त्वा च प्रतिगृह्य च ।
पतत्यज्ञानतो विप्रो ज्ञानात्साम्यं तु गच्छति ॥ ११.१७५॥ caṇḍālāntyastriyo gatvā bhuktvā ca pratigṛhya ca |
patatyajñānato vipro jñānātsāmyaṃ tu gacchati || A Brahmin who approaches a woman of the lowest caste, having gone to her, eaten with her, and accepted gifts from her, falls due to ignorance; through knowledge, however, he attains equality.

title: Verse 11.176
content:
विप्रदुष्टां स्त्रियं भर्ता निरुन्ध्यादेकवेश्मनि ।
यत्पुंसः परदारेषु तच्चैनां चारयेद्व्रतम् ॥ ११.१७६॥ vipraduṣṭāṃ striyaṃ bhartā nirundhyād ekaveśmani .
yat puṃsaḥ paradāreṣu tac caināṃ cārayed vrataṃ .. 11.176 .. When a woman of the Brahmin class transgresses her svadharma by engaging in illicit union, the husband shall confine her within the household. He shall enforce upon her the same vow of restraint that applies to men in respect of other men's wives.

title: Verse 11.177
content: सा चेत्पुनः प्रदुष्येत्तु सदृशेनोपमन्त्रिता । सदृशेनोपयन्त्रिता कृच्छ्रं चान्द्रायणं चैव तदस्याः पावनं स्मृतम् ॥ ११.१७७॥ sā cet punaḥ praduṣyet tu sadṛśenopamantritā | sadṛśenopayantitā kṛcchraṃ cāndrāyaṇaṃ caiva tadasyāḥ pāvanaṃ smṛtam || 11.177 || If she is again defiled while under protection with similar intent or by similar means, then Kṛcchra and Cāndrāyaṇa are prescribed for her purification.

title: Verse 11.178
content: यत्करोत्येकरात्रेण वृषलीसेवनाद्द्विजः । तद्भैक्षभुज्जपन्नित्यं त्रिभिर्वर्षैर्व्यपोहति ॥ ११.१७८॥ yat karoty ekarātreṇa vṛṣalī-sevanād dvijaḥ | tad bhikṣā-bhuñjapan-nityaṃ tribhir varṣair vyapohati || 11.178|| Whatever action a twice-born performs in one night through union with a woman of the lowest caste, that same effect is neutralized by daily accepting alms and performing japa for three years.

title: Verse 11.179
content:
एषा पापकृतामुक्ता चतुर्णामपि निष्कृतिः ।
पतितैः सम्प्रयुक्तानामिमाः शृणुत निष्कृतीः ॥ ११.१७९॥ eṣā pāpakṛtāmuktā caturṇāmapi niṣkṛtiḥ |
patitaiḥ samprayuktānāmimāḥ śṛṇuta niṣkṛtīḥ || 11.179|| This解脱 is declared for the fourfold transgressors; hear now the expiations applicable to those fallen ones who have acted in conjunction.

title: Verse 11.180
content:
संवत्सरेण पतति पतितेन सहाचरन् ।
याजनाध्यापनाद्यौनान्न तु यानासनाशनात् ॥ ११.१८०॥ saṃvatsareṇa patati patitena sahācaran |
yājanādhyāpanādyonānna tu yānāsanāśanāt || 11.180 || One who dwells with a fallen person for a year becomes equally fallen, through association in acts of worship, instruction, or sexual union—but not merely by riding, sitting, or eating with them.

title: Verse 11.181
content:
यो येन पतितेनैषां संसर्गं याति मानवः ।
स तस्यैव व्रतं कुर्यात्तत्संसर्गविशुद्धये ॥ ११.१८१॥ yo yena patitena eṣāṁ saṁsargaṁ yāti mānavaḥ |
sa tasyaiva vrataṁ kuryāt tat-saṁsarga-viśuddhaye || 11.181|| He who enters into communion with a fallen being must undertake the observance proper to that being, for the purification of that very association.

title: Verse 11.182
content:
पतितस्योदकं कार्यं सपिण्डैर्बान्धवैर्बहिः ।
निन्दितेऽहनि सायाह्ने ज्ञातिर्त्विग्गुरुसंनिधौ ॥ ११.१८२॥ patitasyodakaṃ kāryaṃ sapinḍairbāndhavairbahih .
nindite'hani sāyāhne jñātirtviggurusannidhau .. 11.182 .. When one has fallen from Dharma, water must be offered by those related through piṇḍa and bandhana, on the day criticized, at dusk, in the presence of known ones, teachers, and the guru.

title: Verse 11.183
content:
दासी घटमपां पूर्णं पर्यस्येत्प्रेतवत्पदा ।
अहोरात्रमुपासीरन्नशौचं बान्धवैः सह ॥ ११.१८३॥ dāsī ghaṭam apāṁ pūrṇaṁ paryasyet pretavat padā | ahorātram upāsīran naśaucaṁ bāndhavaiḥ saha || 11.183 || When a female servant dies, her water pot filled to the brim shall be overturned, and for one day and night, those related by blood shall remain without purification.

title: Verse 11.184
content:
निवर्तेरंश्च तस्मात्तु सम्भाषणसहासने ।
दायाद्यस्य प्रदानं च यात्रा चैव हि लौकिकी ॥ ११.१८४॥ nivarteraṃśca tasmāt tu saṃbhāṣaṇasahāsane .
dāyādasya pradānaṃ ca yātrā caiva hi laukikī .. 11.184 .. Therefore, from that portion which remains after the performer's own use, he shall provide for conversational engagement, seating, gifts to heirs, and ordinary travel.

title: Verse 11.185
content: ज्येष्ठता च निवर्तेत ज्येष्ठावाप्यं च यद्धनम् । यद्वसु ज्येष्ठांशं प्राप्नुयाच्चास्य यवीयान् गुणतोऽधिकः ॥ ११.१८५॥ jyeṣṭhatā ca nivarteta jyeṣṭhāvāpyaṃ ca yaddhanam | yadvasu jyeṣṭhāṃśaṃ prāpnuyācca asya yavīyān guṇato'dhikaḥ || 11.185 || Precedence based solely on birth-order ceases where merit and capability surpass it; the younger, if superior in virtue and capacity, shall receive the portion and position traditionally accorded to the elder.

title: Verse 11.186
content:
प्रायश्चित्ते तु चरिते पूर्णकुम्भमपां नवम् ।
तेनैव सार्धं प्रास्येयुः स्नात्वा पुण्ये जलाशये ॥ ११.१८६॥ prāyaścitte tu carite pūrṇakumbhamapāṁ navam |
tenaiva sārdhaṁ prāsyeyuḥ snātvā puṇye jalāśaye || 11.186|| When a completion process is undertaken, one shall offer nine full vessels of water, together with that very same act, after bathing in sacred waters.

title: Verse 11.187
content:
स त्वप्सु तं घटं प्रास्य प्रविश्य भवनं स्वकम् ।
सर्वाणि ज्ञातिकार्याणि यथापूर्वं समाचरेत् ॥ ११.१८७॥ sa tv apsu taṃ ghaṭaṃ prāsya praviśya bhavanaṃ svakam |
sarvāṇi jñātikāryāṇi yathāpūrvaṃ samācaret || 11.187|| One who has entered the waters of purification and returned to their dwelling shall perform all familial duties precisely as before.

title: Verse 11.188
content: एतदेव विधिं कुर्याद्योषित्सु पतितास्वपि । एतमेव विधिं वस्त्रान्नपानं देयं तु वसेयुश्च गृहान्तिके ॥ ११.१८८॥ etadeva vidhiṃ kuryādyoṣitsu patitāsvapi | etameva vidhiṃ vastrānnapānaṃ deyaṃ tu vaseyuśca gṛhāntike || 11.188|| The same dharmic procedure shall be enacted for women who have fallen, providing clothing, food, drink, and dwelling near the household.

title: Verse 11.189
content:
एनस्विभिरनिर्णिक्तैर्नार्थं किं चित्सहाचरेत् ।
कृतनिर्णेजनांश्चैव न जुगुप्सेत कर्हि चित् ॥ ११.१८९॥ enasvibhir anirṇiktair nārthaṁ kiṁ cit sahācaret |
kṛtanirṇejanāṁś caiva na jugupseta karhi cit || 11.189|| One must not engage in any transaction or association with those who have been declared guilty without proper judicial inquiry; nor should one feel revulsion toward those whose impurities have already been cleansed through due process.

title: Verse 11.190
content:
बालघ्नांश्च कृतघ्नांश्च विशुद्धानपि धर्मतः ।
शरणागतहन्तॄंश्च स्त्रीहन्तॄंश्च न संवसेत् ॥ ११.१९०॥ bālaghnāṃśca kṛtaghnāṃśca viśuddhānapi dharmataḥ |
śaraṇāgatahantṝṃśca strīhantṝṃśca na saṃvaset || 11.190|| One must not cohabit with those who harm children, betray trust, falsely claim purity, slay refugees, or murder women.

title: Verse 11.191
content:
येषां द्विजानां सावित्री नानूच्येत यथाविधि ।
तांश्चारयित्वा त्रीन् कृच्छ्रान् यथाविध्योपनाययेत् ॥ ११.१९१॥ yeṣāṁ dvijānāṁ sāvitrī nānūcyeta yathāvidhi |
tāṁścārayitvā trīn kṛchchrān yathāvidhyopanāyayet || 11.191|| Those twice-born whose Savitri has not been recited according to ritual procedure—after serving them appropriately, the three Kṛcchra penances must be performed correctly.

title: Verse 11.192
content: प्रायश्चित्तं चिकीर्षन्ति विकर्मस्थास्तु ये द्विजाः । ब्रह्मणा च परित्यक्तास्तेषामप्येतदादिशेत् ॥ ११.१९२॥ prāyaścittaṁ cikīrṣanti vikarmasthāstu ye dvijāḥ | brahmaṇā ca parityaktāsteṣāmapyetadādiśet || 11.192|| Those twice-born who seek penance while remaining in corrupted action, even those abandoned by Brahman—this law commands for them too.

title: Verse 11.193
content:
यद्गर्हितेनार्जयन्ति कर्मणा ब्राह्मणा धनम् ।
तस्योत्सर्गेण शुध्यन्ति जप्येन तपसैव च ॥ ११.१९३॥ yad-garhitena arjayanti karmaṇā brāhmaṇā dhanam |
Tasya utsargeṇa śudhyanti japyena tapasaiva ca || 11.193|| When Brahmins acquire wealth through actions condemned by Dharma, their purification occurs exclusively through renunciation, mantra repetition, and disciplined austerity.

title: Verse 11.194
content: जपित्वा त्रीणि सावित्र्याः सहस्राणि समाहितः । मासं गोष्ठे पयः पीत्वा मुच्यतेऽसत्प्रतिग्रहात् ॥ ११.१९४॥ japitvā trīṇi sāvitrīyāḥ sahasrāṇi samāhitaḥ | māsaṁ goṣṭhe payaḥ pītvā mucyate'satpratigrahāt || 11.194 || One who has accepted unlawfully without discrimination must restore alignment through disciplined recitation of Savitri three thousand times, followed by a month of living in cowherd proximity consuming only milk.

title: Verse 11.195
content:
उपवासकृशं तं तु गोव्रजात्पुनरागतम् ।
प्रणतं प्रति पृच्छेयुः साम्यं सौम्यैच्छसीति किम् ॥ ११.१९५॥ upavāsakṛśaṃ taṃ tu govrajātpunarāgatam |
praṇataṃ prati pṛccheyuḥ sāmyaṃ saumyaicchasi iti kim || 11.195 || One who has returned emaciated from the cow-pen after observance of fast shall be questioned thus by those who approach him with humility: 'Do you desire equality in peace?'

title: Verse 11.196
content:
सत्यमुक्त्वा तु विप्रेषु विकिरेद्यवसं गवाम् ।
गोभिः प्रवर्तिते तीर्थे कुर्युस्तस्य परिग्रहम् ॥ ११.१९६॥ satyamuktva tu vipreṣu vikired yavasaṃ gavām |
gobhiḥ pravartite tīrthe kuryus tasya parigraham || 11.196 || One who has spoken truthfully before Brahmins but caused dispersion of fodder for cows—when cows have initiated movement at a sacred site—those cows shall execute his containment.

title: Verse 11.197
content:
व्रात्यानां याजनं कृत्वा परेषामन्त्यकर्म च ।
अभिचारमहीनं च त्रिभिः कृच्छ्रैर्व्यपोहति ॥ ११.१९७॥ vrātyānāṁ yājanaṁ kṛtvā pareṣāmantyakarma ca |
abhicāramahīnaṁ ca tribhiḥ kṛcchhairvyapohati || 11.197|| One who performs rituals for outcastes, engages in final acts for others, or conducts rites without invoking divine protection, purifies oneself through threefold hardship.

title: Verse 11.198
content:
शरणागतं परित्यज्य वेदं विप्लाव्य च द्विजः ।
संवत्सरं यवाहारस्तत्पापमपसेधति ॥ ११.१९८॥ śaraṇāgataṃ parityajya vedaṃ viplāvya ca dvijaḥ |
saṃvatsaraṃ yavāhārastatpāpamapasedhati || 11.198|| A twice-born who abandons a surrendered soul and desecrates the Veda shall consume barley for one year; thereby that sin is annulled.

title: Verse 11.199
content:
श्वशृगालखरैर्दष्टो ग्राम्यैः क्रव्याद्भिरेव च ।
नराश्वोष्ट्रवराहैश्च प्राणायामेन शुध्यति ॥ ११.१९९॥ śvaśṛgālakharairdaṣṭo grāmyaiḥ kravyād-bhireva ca | narāśvoṣṭravarāhaiśca prāṇāyāmena śudhyati || 11.199 || One who has been bitten by jackals, dogs, donkeys, or by carnivorous village animals, or by humans, horses, camels, or boars, becomes pure through the practice of prāṇāyāma.

title: Verse 11.200
content:
षष्ठान्नकालता मासं संहिताजप एव वा ।
होमाश्च सकला नित्यमपाङ्क्त्यानां विशोधनम् ॥ ११.२००॥ होमाश्च शाकला ṣaṣṭhānnakālatā māsaṁ saṁhitājapa eva vā |
homāśca sakalā nityamapāṅktyānāṁ viśodhanam || 11.200|| homāśca śākalā From the sixth year onward, a monthly observance of scriptural recitation or full performance of fire rituals purifies those outside the ritual order perpetually.

title: Verse 11.201
content:
उष्ट्रयानं समारुह्य खरयानं तु कामतः ।
स्नात्वा तु विप्रो दिग्वासाः प्राणायामेन शुध्यति ॥ ११.२०१॥ Uṣṭrayānaṁ samāruhya kharayānaṁ tu kāmataḥ |
Snātvā tu vipro digvāsaḥ prāṇāyāmena śudhyati || 11.201|| A Brahmin who has mounted a camel or驴-driven vehicle out of desire, having bathed afterward while naked, becomes pure through the practice of breath regulation.

title: Verse 11.202
content:
विनाऽद्भिरप्सु वाऽप्यार्तः शारीरं संनिषेव्य च ।
सचैलो बहिराप्लुत्य गामालभ्य विशुध्यति ॥ ११.२०२॥ vinā'dbhir apsu vā'py ārtaḥ śārīraṃ saṃniṣevya ca |
sacailo bahir āplutya gām ālabhya viśudhyati || 11.202|| One who has suffered bodily distress or affliction in water, whether by lack of water or otherwise, becomes purified upon touching the earth after bathing and embracing a cow.

title: Verse 11.203
content:
वेदोदितानां नित्यानां कर्मणां समतिक्रमे ।
स्नातकव्रतलोपे च प्रायश्चित्तमभोजनम् ॥ ११.२०३॥ vedoditānāṃ nityānāṃ karmaṇāṃ samatikrame |
snātakavratalope ca prāyaścittamabhojanam || 11.203|| When one transgresses the eternal duties enjoined by the Veda, or abandons the vow of a graduated student, the remedial action is fasting.

title: Verse 11.204
content:
हुङ्कारं ब्राह्मणस्योक्त्वा त्वङ्कारं च गरीयसः ।
स्नात्वाऽनश्नन्नहः शेषमभिवाद्य प्रसादयेत् ॥ ११.२०४॥ huṅkāraṁ brāhmaṇasyoktvā tvaṅkāraṁ ca garīyasaḥ |
snātvā'naśnannah śeṣamabhivādya prasādayet || Having pronounced the sacred syllable 'Hum' for the Brahmin and 'Thum' for the superior being, one should bathe, fast throughout the day, and after worship, seek forgiveness.

title: Verse 11.205
content:
ताडयित्वा तृणेनापि कण्ठे वाऽबध्य वाससा ।
विवादे वा विनिर्जित्य प्रणिपत्य प्रसादयेत् ॥ ११.२०५॥ tāḍayitvā tṛṇenāpi kaṇṭhe vā'badhya vāsasā |
vivāde vā vinirjitya praṇipatya prasādayet || 11.205|| Having struck even with a grass blade around the neck or binding with cloth in dispute, one who has been defeated must approach with folded hands and seek reconciliation.

title: Verse 11.206
content:
अवगूर्य त्वब्दशतं सहस्रमभिहत्य च ।
जिघांसया ब्राह्मणस्य नरकं प्रतिपद्यते ॥ ११.२०६॥ avagūrya tvabdaśataṃ sahasramabhihatya ca | jighāṃsayā brāhmaṇasya narakaṃ pratipadyate || 11.206 || One who, with intent to harm, strikes a Brahmin with a cudgel or staff, or with any weapon, even playfully or in jest, enters a hell reserved for such offenders.

title: Verse 11.207
content:
शोणितं यावतः पांसून् सङ्गृह्णाति महीतले ।
तावन्त्यब्दसहस्राणि तत्कर्ता नरके वसेत् ॥ ११.२०७॥ śoṇitaṃ yāvataḥ pāṃsūn saṅgṛhṇāti mahītale |
tāvantyabdasahasrāṇi tatkartā narakhe vaset || 11.207 || One who causes bloodshed that stains the earth with dust shall dwell in Naraka for as many thousand years as there are particles of dust thus stained.

title: Verse 11.208
content:
अवगूर्य चरेत्कृच्छ्रमतिकृच्छ्रं निपातने ।
कृच्छ्रातिकृच्छ्रौ कुर्वीत विप्रस्योत्पाद्य शोणितम् ॥ ११.२०८॥ avagūrya caret kṛcchram atikṛcchraṃ nipātane |
kṛcchrātikṛcchrau kurvīta viprasyotpādya śoṇitam || 11.208 || One who has caused bloodshed of a Brahmin through disrespect shall perform the Kṛcchra and Atikṛcchra penances; such purification restores the violated consciousness integrity.

title: Verse 11.209
content: अनुक्तनिष्कृतीनां तु पापानामपनुत्तये । शक्तिं चावेक्ष्य पापं च प्रायश्चित्तं प्रकल्पयेत् ॥ ११.२०९॥ anuktaniskrtinam tu papamanapanuttaye | saktim cāvekṣya pāpaṃ ca prāyaścittaṃ prakalpayet || 11.209|| For sins without prescribed expiations, having observed the capacity of the offender and the nature of the transgression, appropriate restorative measures shall be enacted.

title: Verse 11.210
content:
यैरभ्युपायैरेनांसि मानवो व्यपकर्षति ।
तान् वोऽभ्युपायान् वक्ष्यामि देवर्षिपितृसेवितान् ॥ ११.२१०॥ yair abhyupāyair enāṁsi mānavo vyapakarṣati |
tān vo 'bhyupāyān vakṣyāmi devaṛṣipitṛsevitān || 11.210 || I shall now declare those means by which a human being draws forth the subtle energies of existence; these are the very methods honored by gods, sages, and ancestors.

title: Verse 11.211
content:
त्र्यहं प्रातस्त्र्यहं सायं त्र्यहमद्यादयाचितम् ।
त्र्यहं परं च नाश्नीयात्प्राजापत्यं चरन् द्विजः ॥ ११.२११॥ tryahaṁ prātastryahaṁ sāyaṁ tryahamadyādayācitam |
tryahaṁ paraṁ ca nāśnīyātprājāpatyaṁ caran dvijaḥ || 11.211|| A twice-born one observing the Prajāpatya vow shall consume food only once every three days—specifically in the morning, evening, or upon request—and must not eat anything beyond that.

title: Verse 11.212
content:
गोमूत्रं गोमयं क्षीरं दधि सर्पिः कुशोदकम् ।
एकरात्रोपवासश्च कृच्छ्रं सांतपनं स्मृतम् ॥ ११.२१२॥ gomūtraṁ gomayaṁ kṣīraṁ dadhi sarpiḥ kuśodakam |
ekarātropavāsaśca kṛcchraṁ sāntapanaṁ smṛtam || 11.212|| Consumption of cow urine, cow dung, milk, curd, ghee, and water sanctified with kuśa grass, along with a single night's fast, constitutes the Kṛcchra Sāntapana penance as ordained for purification and consciousness realignment.

title: Verse 11.213
content:
एकैकं ग्रासमश्नीयात्त्र्यहाणि त्रीणि पूर्ववत् ।
त्र्यहं चोपवसेदन्त्यमतिकृच्छ्रं चरन् द्विजः ॥ ११.२१३॥ ekaikaṃ grāsam aśnīyāt tryahāṇi trīṇi pūrvavat |
tryahaṃ copavased antyam atikṛcchraṃ caran dvijaḥ || A dvija, having undertaken atikṛcchra vrata, shall consume one morsel of food on the first day, three on the second day, and five on the third day; thereafter he shall fast completely on the final day.

title: Verse 11.214
content:
तप्तकृच्छ्रं चरन् विप्रो जलक्षीरघृतानिलान् ।
प्रतित्र्यहं पिबेदुष्णान् सकृत्स्नायी समाहितः ॥ ११.२१४॥ taptakṛcchraṃ caran vipro jalakṣīraghṛtānilān |
pratitryahaṃ pibeduṣṇān sakṛtsnāyī samāhitaḥ || 11.214 || A Brahmin engaged in the Tapta Kṛcchra vow shall consume hot water, milk, ghee, and air every third day, maintaining专注 bathing once and remaining composed.

title: Verse 11.215
content:
यतात्मनोऽप्रमत्तस्य द्वादशाहमभोजनम् ।
पराको नाम कृच्छ्रोऽयं सर्वपापापनोदनः ॥ ११.२१५॥ yatātmano'pramattasya dvādaśāhamabhojanam |
parāko nāma kṛcchro'yaṃ sarvapāpāpanodanaḥ || 11.215 || For the self-controlled and ever-vigilant being, a twelve-day fast without food is designated as Paraka austerity, which eradicates all impurities of action.

title: Verse 11.216
content:
एकैकं ह्रासयेत्पिण्डं कृष्णे शुक्ले च वर्धयेत् ।
उपस्पृशंस्त्रिषवणमेतत्चाण्ड्रायणं स्मृतम् ॥ ११.२१६॥ ekaikaṁ hrāsayetpiṇḍaṁ kṛṣṇe śukle ca vardhayet |
upaspṛśaṁstriṣavaṇametatcāṇḍrāyaṇaṁ smṛtam || 11.216 || In the dark fortnight, one should diminish food intake daily; in the bright fortnight, one should increase it daily. This practice, combined with touching water thrice a day, is known as Cāṇḍrāyaṇa.

title: Verse 11.217
content:
एतमेव विधिं कृत्स्नमाचरेद्यवमध्यमे ।
शुक्लपक्षादिनियतश्चरंश्चान्द्रायणं व्रतम् ॥ ११.२१७॥ etameva vidhiṃ kṛtsnamācareddyavamadhyame |
śuklapakṣādiniyataścaraṃścāndrāyaṇaṃ vratam || 11.217 || One shall observe this entire prescribed conduct during the intermediate period between the morning and evening twilight; the vow of Cāndrāyaṇa is to be practiced with discipline commencing from the bright fortnight.

title: Verse 11.218
content:
अष्टावष्टौ समश्नीयात्पिण्डान् मध्यंदिने स्थिते ।
नियतात्मा हविष्याशी यतिचान्द्रायणं चरन् ॥ ११.२१८॥ aṣṭāvaṣṭau samaśnīyāt piṇḍān madhyaṃdine sthite |
niyatātmā haviṣyāśī yaticāndrāyaṇaṃ caran || 11.218|| One who maintains regulated discipline and consumes eight handfuls of food at midday, while observing the vow of yati and cāndrāyaṇa, sustains the fire of spiritual discipline through measured intake.

title: Verse 11.219
content:
चतुरः प्रातरश्नीयात्पिण्डान् विप्रः समाहितः ।
चतुरोऽस्तमिते सूर्ये शिशुचान्द्रायणं स्मृतम् ॥ ११.२१९॥ caturaḥ prātaraśnīyāt piṇḍān vipraḥ samāhitaḥ |
caturo 'stamite sūrye śiśucāndrāyaṇaṃ smṛtam || A twice-born man devoted to discipline shall consume four portions of food at dawn; likewise, four portions at sunset—this is known as the lunar penance for purification.

title: Verse 11.220
content:
यथा कथं चित्पिण्डानां तिस्रोऽशीतीः समाहितः ।
मासेनाश्नन् हविष्यस्य चन्द्रस्यैति सलोकताम् ॥ ११.२२०॥ yathā kathaṃ citpiṇḍānāṃ tisro'śītīḥ samāhitaḥ |
māsenāśnan havirasya candrasyaiti salokatām || 11.220 || One who, with concentrated discipline, consumes the prescribed oblations for eighty-one months in accordance with the ritual law shall attain union with the lunar sphere.

title: Verse 11.221
content:
एतद्रुद्रास्तथाऽदित्या वसवश्चाचरन् व्रतम् ।
सर्वाकुशलमोक्षाय मरुतश्च महर्षिभिः ॥ ११.२२१॥ etad rudrās tathā'dityā vasavaś cācaran vrataṃ |
sarvākuśalamokṣāya marutaś ca maharṣibhiḥ ||11.221|| This vow was practiced by the Rudras, likewise the Adityas, the Vasus, and the Maruts along with the great sages—for the liberation of all beings from every form of suffering.

title: Verse 11.222
content:
महाव्याहृतिभिर्होमः कर्तव्यः स्वयमन्वहम् ।
अहिंसा सत्यमक्रोधमार्जवं च समाचरेत् ॥ ११.२२२॥ mahāvyāhṛtibhir homaḥ kartavyaḥ svayamanvaham | ahinsā satyam akrodham ārjavaṃ ca samācaret || 11.222 || One must perform the fire sacrifice with Mahavyahritis daily. One must practice non-violence, truthfulness, non-anger, and straightforwardness.

title: Verse 11.223
content:
त्रिरह्नस्त्रिर्निशायां च सवासा जलमाविशेत् ।
स्त्रीशूद्रपतितांश्चैव नाभिभाषेत कर्हि चित् ॥ ११.२२३॥ trirahnastriRNiśāyāṃ ca savāsā jalamāviśet | strīśūdrapatitāṃścaiva nābhibhāṣeta karhi cit || One who enters water while clothed for three days and three nights shall not speak with women, Śūdras, or those fallen from their varṇa at any time.

title: Verse 11.224
content:
स्थानासनाभ्यां विहरेदशक्तोऽधः शयीत वा ।
ब्रह्मचारी व्रती च स्याद्गुरुदेवद्विजार्चकः ॥ ११.२२४॥ sthānāsanābhyāṁ viharedaśakto'dhaḥ śayīta vā |
brāhmacārī vrātī ca syād gurudevadvijārcakaḥ || 11.224 || One who is unable to maintain standing or sitting postures shall lie down below; he must remain a celibate, vowed to discipline, devoted in service to the Guru, the Divine, and the twice-born.

title: Verse 11.225
content:
सावित्रीं च जपेन्नित्यं पवित्राणि च शक्तितः ।
सर्वेष्वेव व्रतेष्वेवं प्रायश्चित्तार्थमादृतः ॥ ११.२२५॥ sāvitrīṁ ca japennityaṁ pavitrāṇi ca śaktitaḥ |
sarveṣveva vratesvevaṁ prāyaścittārthamādṛtaḥ || 11.225 || One must daily recite the Savitri and purifying mantras with full capacity, in all vows undertaken, specifically for the purpose of Prayaschitta.

title: Verse 11.226
content:
एतैर्द्विजातयः शोध्या व्रतैराविष्कृतेनसः ।
अनाविष्कृतपापांस्तु मन्त्रैर्होमैश्च शोधयेत् ॥ ११.२२६॥ Etair dvijātayaḥ śodhyā vratair āviṣkṛtenasaḥ |
Anāviṣkṛtapāpāṃs tu mantrair homaiś ca śodhayet || 11.226|| The twice-born whose misdeeds have been exposed must be purified through prescribed observances; those whose transgressions remain concealed must be cleansed by mantra and fire offerings.

title: Verse 11.227
content:
ख्यापनेनानुतापेन तपसाऽध्ययनेन च ।
पापकृत्मुच्यते पापात्तथा दानेन चापदि ॥ ११.२२७॥ khyāpanenānutāpena tapasā'dhyayanena ca | pāpakṛtmucyate pāpāttathā dānena cāpadi || 11.227|| One who has committed a transgression is liberated from that transgression through declaration, repentance, austerity, study, and in times of crisis, through donation.

title: Verse 11.228
content: यथा यथा नरोऽधर्मं स्वयं कृत्वाऽनुभाषते । तथा तथा त्वचैवाहिस्तेनाधर्मेण मुच्यते ॥ ११.२२८॥ yathā yatho narō 'dharmaṁ svayaṁ kṛtvā'nubhāṣate | tathā tathā tvacai vāhis tenādharmeṇa mucyate || 11.228|| As a man himself speaks of his own unrighteous act, by that very speech he becomes bound and liberated thereby.

title: Verse 11.229
content: यथा यथा मनस्तस्य दुष्कृतं कर्म गर्हति । तथा तथा शरीरं तत्तेनाधर्मेण मुच्यते ॥ ११.२२९॥ yathā yathā manastasya duṣkṛtaṃ karma garhati | tathā tathā śarīraṃ tattenādharmeṇa mucyate || 11.229 || As the mind increasingly rejects unrighteous action, the body becomes correspondingly freed from the consequences of that unrighteousness.

title: Verse 11.230
content:
कृत्वा पापं हि संतप्य तस्मात्पापात्प्रमुच्यते ।
नैवं कुर्यां पुनरिति निवृत्त्या पूयते तु सः ॥ ११.२३०॥ kṛtvā pāpaṁ hi santapya tasmāt pāpāt pramucyate .
naivaṁ kuryāṁ punariti nivṛttyā pūyate tu saḥ .. 11.230 .. One who commits a transgression and thereafter experiences inner torment is thereby liberated from that transgression. One who resolves never to repeat it and withdraws from such action is purified.

title: Verse 11.231
content:
एवं सञ्चिन्त्य मनसा प्रेत्य कर्मफलोदयम् ।
मनोवाङ्मूर्तिभिर्नित्यं शुभं कर्म समाचरेत् ॥ ११.२३१॥ evaṁ sañcintya manasā pretya karmaphalodayam | manovāṅmūrtibhirnityaṁ śubhaṁ karma samācaret || 11.231 || Thus having reflected with the mind upon the arising of the fruit of action after death, one should constantly perform auspicious actions through thought, word, and body.

title: Verse 11.232
content: अज्ञानाद्यदि वा ज्ञानात्कृत्वा कर्म विगर्हितम् । तस्माद्विमुक्तिमन्विच्छन् द्वितीयं न समाचरेत् ॥ ११.२३२॥ ajñānād yadi vā jñānāt kṛtvā karma vigarhitam | tasmād vimuktimanvicchan dvitīyaṃ na samācaret || 11.232|| When action arises from ignorance or even from knowledge yet condemned by Dharma, one desiring liberation shall not repeat it a second time.

title: Verse 11.233
content:
यस्मिन् कर्मण्यस्य कृते मनसः स्यादलाघवम् ।
तस्मिंस्तावत्तपः कुर्याद्यावत्तुष्टिकरं भवेत् ॥ ११.२३३॥ yasmin karmaṇy asya kṛte manasaḥ syād alāghavam | 
tasmiṁs tāvat tapaḥ kuryād yāvat tuṣṭikaraṁ bhavet || 11.233 || In whichever action performed by him there arises a sense of mental lightness or purification, he shall engage in austerity until that which brings satisfaction is attained.

title: Verse 11.234
content: तपोमूलमिदं सर्वं दैवमानुषकं सुखम् । तपोमध्यं बुधैः प्रोक्तं तपोऽन्तं वेददर्शिभिः ॥ ११.२३४॥ tapomūlamidaṃ sarvaṃ daivamānuṣakaṃ sukham | tapomadhyaṃ budhaiḥ proktaṃ tapo'ntaṃ vedadarśibhiḥ || 11.234 || All human and divine happiness originates from tapas; the intermediate state of tapas is declared by the wise, and its culmination is realized by those who perceive the Veda.

title: Verse 11.235
content:
ब्राह्मणस्य तपो ज्ञानं तपः क्षत्रस्य रक्षणम् ।
वैश्यस्य तु तपो वार्ता तपः शूद्रस्य सेवनम् ॥ ११.२३५॥ brāhmaṇasya tapo jñānaṃ tapaḥ kṣatrasya rakṣaṇam | vaiśyasya tu tapo vārtā tapaḥ śūdrasya sevanam || 11.235 || The tapas of a Brāhmaṇa is knowledge; the tapas of a Kṣatriya is protection; the tapas of a Vaiśya is agriculture and trade; the tapas of a Śūdra is service.

title: Verse 11.236
content: ऋषयः संयतात्मानः फलमूलानिलाशनाः । तपसैव प्रपश्यन्ति त्रैलोक्यं सचराचरम् ॥ ११.२३६॥ ṛṣayaḥ saṁyatātmānaḥ phalamūlānilāśanāḥ | tapasaiva prapaśyanti trailokyaṁ sacarācaram || 11.236|| Ṛṣis, with senses and consciousness fully restrained, free from desire for fruit or root, perceive the entire threefold world—animate and inanimate—through tapas alone.

title: Verse 11.237
content: औषधान्यगदो विद्या दैवी च विविधा स्थितिः । तपसैव प्रसिध्यन्ति तपस्तेषां हि साधनम् ॥ ११.२३७॥ auṣadhānyagado vidyā daivī ca vividhā sthitiḥ | tapasaiva prasidhyanti tapasteṣāṃ hi sādhanam || 11.237|| Medicinal herbs, grains, poisons, knowledge, and diverse divine conditions—all attain perfection solely through Tapas; Tapas indeed is their instrument.

title: Verse 11.238
content:
यद्दुस्तरं यद्दुरापं यद्दुर्गं यच्च दुष्करम् ।
सर्वं तु तपसा साध्यं तपो हि दुरतिक्रमम् ॥ ११.२३८॥ सर्वं तत्तपसा yad dustaraṁ yad durāpaṁ yad durgaṁ yac ca duṣkaram |
sarvaṁ tu tapasā sādhyaṁ tapo hi duratikramam || 11.238 || sarvaṁ tattapasā Whatever is impassable, unreachable, inaccessible, or arduous—it is all accomplishable through Tapas. Indeed, Tapas is that which cannot be transgressed.

title: Verse 11.239
content:
महापातकिनश्चैव शेषाश्चाकार्यकारिणः ।
तपसैव सुतप्तेन मुच्यन्ते किल्बिषात्ततः ॥ ११.२३९॥ mahāpātakinaścaiva śeṣāścākāryakāriṇaḥ |
tapasaiva sutaptena mucyante kilbiṣāttataḥ || 11.239|| Those who have committed great sins and others who have caused inaction or disruption of duty are freed from their transgressions through intense, rightly directed tapas.

title: Verse 11.240
content:
कीटाश्चाहिपतङ्गाश्च पशवश्च वयांसि च ।
स्थावराणि च भूतानि दिवं यान्ति तपोबलात् ॥ ११.२४०॥ kīṭāścāhipataṅgāśca paśavaśca vayāṃsi ca |
sthāvarāṇi ca bhūtāni divaṃ yānti tapobalāt || 11.240|| Through the power of tapas, even insects, moths, animals, birds, and immobile beings attain the highest realms.

title: Verse 11.241
content: यत्किं चिदेनः कुर्वन्ति मनोवाङ्मूर्तिभिर्जनाः । मनोवाच्‍कर्मभिर् तत्सर्वं निर्दहन्त्याशु तपसैव तपोधनाः ॥ ११.२४१॥ yat kiṁ cid enaḥ kurvanti manovāṅmūrtibhir janāḥ | manovāc-karmabhir tatsarvaṁ nirdahantyāśu tapasaiva tapodhanāḥ || 11.241|| Whatever wrong actions individuals perform through mind, speech, or body, all such karmic residues are instantaneously consumed by the Tapas of those established in Tapas.

title: Verse 11.242
content:
तपसैव विशुद्धस्य ब्राह्मणस्य दिवौकसः ।
इज्याश्च प्रतिगृह्णन्ति कामान् संवर्धयन्ति च ॥ ११.२४२॥ tapasaiiva viśuddhasya brāhmaṇasya divaukasaḥ |
ijyāśca pratigṛhṇanti kāmān saṃvardhayanti ca || 11.242|| Only through the purity attained by the tapas of a Brahmin, who is celestial by nature, do the devas accept worship and grant desires.

title: Verse 11.243
content:
प्रजापतिरिदं शास्त्रं तपसैवासृजत्प्रभुः ।
तथैव वेदान् ऋषयस्तपसा प्रतिपेदिरे ॥ ११.२४३॥ prajāpatir idaṃ śāstraṃ tapasai vāsṛjat prabhuḥ |
tathaiva vedān ṛṣayas tapasā pratipedire || 11.243|| The Lord of Creation manifested this scripture through the power of tapas; likewise, the sages attained the Vedas through tapas.

title: Verse 11.244
content: इत्येतत्तपसो देवा महाभाग्यं प्रचक्षते । यदेतत्तपसो सर्वस्यास्य प्रपश्यन्तस्तपसः पुण्यमुत्तमम् ॥ ११.२४४॥ पुण्यमुद्भवं ityetattapaso devā mahābhāgyaṃ pracakṣate | yadetat tapasaḥ sarvasyāsya prapaśyantaḥ tapasaḥ punyamuttamam || 11.244 || punyamudbhavaṃ This austerity is declared by the Devāḥ as the highest fortune; that which, through austerity, brings forth supreme merit visible to all.

title: Verse 11.245
content:
वेदाभ्यासोऽन्वहं शक्त्या महायज्ञक्रिया क्षमा ।
नाशयन्त्याशु पापानि महापातकजान्यपि ॥ ११.२४५॥ vedābhyāso'nvahaṁ śaktyā mahāyajñakriyā kṣamā |
nāśayantyāśu pāpāni mahāpātakajānyapi || 11.245|| Daily practice of the Vedas, performed with capacity and devotion, along with great sacrificial acts and forbearance—these destroy sins instantly, even those of the gravest nature.

title: Verse 11.246
content: यथैधस्तेजसा वह्निः प्राप्तं निर्दहति क्षणात् । तथा ज्ञानाग्निना पापं सर्वं दहति वेदवित् ॥ ११.२४६॥ yathaidhastejasā vahniḥ prāptaṃ nirdahati kṣaṇāt | tathā jñānāgninā pāpaṃ sarvaṃ dahati vedavit || 11.246|| As fire burns instantly whatever fuel it contacts by its heat, so does the fire of knowledge burn away all sin in the knower of the Vedas.

title: Verse 11.247
content:
इत्येतदेनसामुक्तं प्रायश्चित्तं यथाविधि ।
अत ऊर्ध्वं रहस्यानां प्रायश्चित्तं निबोधत ॥ ११.२४७॥ ityetadenasāmuktaṃ prāyaścittaṃ yathāvidhi |
ata ūrdhvaṃ rahasyānāṃ prāyaścittaṃ nibodhata || 11.247|| Thus, the expiation for visible transgressions has been declared according to rule; now understand the expiation for hidden transgressions.

title: Verse 11.248
content:
सव्याहृतिप्रणवकाः प्राणायामास्तु षोडश ।
अपि भ्रूणहनं मासात्पुनन्त्यहरहः कृताः ॥ ११.२४८॥ savyāhṛtipraṇavakāḥ prāṇāyāmāstu ṣoḍaśa | api bhūṇahanaṃ māsātpunantyaharahari kṛtāḥ || 11.248|| Sixteen breath-regulations accompanied by sacred utterances purify even the act of abortion when performed consistently day and night for a month.

title: Verse 11.249
content:
कौत्सं जप्त्वाऽप इत्येतद्वसिष्ठं च प्रतीत्यृचम् ।
माहित्रं शुद्धवत्यश्च सुरापोऽपि विशुध्यति ॥ ११.२४९॥ kautsaṃ japtvā'pa ityetadvasiṣṭhaṃ ca pratītyṛcam |
māhitraṃ śuddhavatyaśca surāpo'pi viśudhyati || 11.249|| Having recited the Kautsa hymn and the Apa verse, along with the Vasiṣṭha declaration, even one who has consumed alcohol becomes purified through the invocation of purity-consciousness.

title: Verse 11.250
content:
सकृत्जप्त्वाऽस्यवामीयं शिवसङ्कल्पमेव च ।
अपहृत्य सुवर्णं तु क्षणाद्भवति निर्मलः ॥ ११.२५०॥ sakṛtjaptvā'syavāmīyaṁ śivasankalpameva ca |
apahṛtya suvarṇaṁ tu kṣaṇādbhavati nirmalaḥ || 11.250 || One who chants Asya Vamiya and Shiv Sankalpa once, and donates gold, becomes pure instantly.

title: Verse 11.251
content:
हविष्पान्तीयमभ्यस्य न तमं ह इतीति च ।
जपित्वा पौरुषं सूक्तं मुच्यते गुरुतल्पगः ॥ ११.२५१॥ haviṣpāntīyamabhyasya na tamaṃ ha itīti ca |
japitvāauruṣaṃ sūktaṃ mucyate gurutalpagaḥ || 11.251|| One who has engaged in the Havishpantīya ritual and recited 'na tamaḥ' thereby, and having chanted the Purusha Sukta with discipline, becomes liberated from the transgression of approaching the bed of the guru.

title: Verse 11.252
content: एनसां स्थूलसूक्ष्माणां चिकीर्षन्नपनोदनम् । अवेत्यृचं जपेदब्दं यत्किञ्चेदमितीति वा ॥ ११.२५२॥ enasāṁ sthūlasūkṣmāṇāṁ cikīrṣannapanodanam | avetyṛcaṁ japēdabdaṁ yatkiñcēdamitīti vā || 11.252 || One desiring removal of sins, both gross and subtle, shall recite the Yatkiñcēt mantra for a year, thereby restoring purity and alignment to consciousness.

title: Verse 11.253
content:
प्रतिगृह्याप्रतिग्राह्यं भुक्त्वा चान्नं विगर्हितम् ।
जपंस्तरत्समन्दीयं पूयते मानवस्त्र्यहात् ॥ ११.२५३॥ pratigṛhyāpratigrāhyaṁ bhuktva cānnaṁ vigarhitam |
japaṁstara samandīyaṁ pūyate mānavastryahāt || One who accepts what should not be accepted, consumes condemned food, and chants mantras without proper initiation — that human being becomes impure for three days.

title: Verse 11.254
content: सोमारौद्रं तु बह्वेनाः मासमभ्यस्य  शुध्यति । समामभ्यस्य स्रवन्त्यामाचरन् स्नानमर्यम्णामिति च तृचम् ॥ ११.२५४॥ somāraudraṃ tu bahvenāḥ māsamabhyasya śudhyati | samāmabhyasya sravantyāmācaran snānamaryamṇāmiti ca tṛcam || 11.254 || One who practices the Somaraudric discipline for twelve months, maintaining purity through disciplined conduct and sacred ablutions at Sravanti, becomes purified.

title: Verse 11.255
content:
अब्दार्धमिन्द्रमित्येतदेनस्वी सप्तकं जपेत् ।
अप्रशस्तं तु कृत्वाऽप्सु मासमासीत भैक्षभुक् ॥ ११.२५५॥ abdārdhamindramityetadenasvī saptakaṃ japet |
apraśastaṃ tu kṛtvā'psu māsamāsīta bhaikṣabhuk || 11.255|| One who has committed a grave offense must recite the sevenfold mantra 'Abda Ardha Indra' for purification. If this is done improperly, he shall live on alms for one month while remaining immersed in water.

title: Verse 11.256
content:
मन्त्रैः शाकलहोमीयैरब्दं हुत्वा घृतं द्विजः ।
सुगुर्वप्यपहन्त्येनो जप्त्वा वा नम इत्यृचम् ॥ ११.२५६॥ mantraiḥ śākalahomīyairabdaṃ hutvā ghṛtaṃ dvijaḥ |
sugurvapyapahantyeno japtvā vā nama ityṛcam || 11.256|| A twice-born one, having offered ghee for a year through Śākala homa mantras, or having chanted the Namah mantra, eradicates even the gravest of sins.

title: Verse 11.257
content:
महापातकसंयुक्तोऽनुगच्छेद्गाः समाहितः ।
अभ्यस्याब्दं पावमानीर्भैक्षाहारो विशुध्यति ॥ ११.२५७॥ mahāpātakasaṁyukto' nugacched gāḥ samāhitaḥ |
 abhyasyābdaṁ pāvamānīrbhaikṣāhāro viśudhyati || 11.257 || One associated with great transgression shall follow the cow with focused intent; through practicing begging discipline for a year, purity is restored.

title: Verse 11.258
content: अरण्ये वा त्रिरभ्यस्य प्रयतो वेदसंहिताम् । मुच्यते पातकैः सर्वैः पराकैः शोधितस्त्रिभिः ॥ ११.२५८॥ araṇye vā tirabhysya prayato vedasaṁhitām | mucyate pātakaiḥ sarvaiḥ parākaiḥ śodhitastribhiḥ || 11.258|| One who, with discipline, recites the Vedic Saṁhitā three times in a forest, is freed from all major sins by the purifying power of the threefold repetition.

title: Verse 11.259
content: त्र्यहं तूपवसेद्युक्तस्त्रिरह्नोऽभ्युपयन्नपः । मुच्यते पातकैः सर्वैस्त्रिर्जपित्वाऽघमर्षणम् ॥ ११.२५९॥ tryahaṃ tūpavasedyuktastrihano'bhyaupayannapaḥ | mucyate pātakaiḥ sarvaistrih japitvā'ghamarṣaṇam || 11.259|| One who has committed transgressions shall remain in a state of Upavasa (fasting with conscious restraint) for three days, consuming only water, and by reciting 'Aghamarshana' thrice, becomes purified from all sins.

title: Verse 11.260
content: यथाऽश्वमेधः क्रतुराट् सर्वपापापनोदनः । तथाऽघमर्षणं सूक्तं सर्वपापापनोदनम् ॥ ११.२६०॥ yathā'śvamedhaḥ kraturāṭ sarvapāpāpanodanaḥ | tathā'ghamarṣaṇaṃ sūktaṃ sarvapāpāpanodanam || 11.260 || As the Ashvamedha sacrifice performed by the king removes all sins, so too does the recitation of the Gharmarshana Sukta eliminate all transgressions.

title: Verse 11.261
content:
हत्वा लोकानपीमांस्त्रीनश्नन्नपि यतस्ततः ।
ऋग्वेदं धारयन् विप्रो नैनः प्राप्नोति किं चन ॥ ११.२६१॥ hatvā lokānapīmāṃstriin aśnannapi yatastataḥ |
Ṛgvedaṃ dhārayan vipro nainaḥ prāpnoti kiṃ cana || 11.261|| Even having slain all beings in the three worlds and eaten their flesh, a Brāhmaṇa who upholds the Ṛgveda incurs no sin thereby.

title: Verse 11.262
content:
ऋक्संहितां त्रिरभ्यस्य यजुषां वा समाहितः ।
साम्नां वा सरहस्यानां सर्वपापैः प्रमुच्यते ॥ ११.२६२॥ Ṛk-saṃhitāṃ trir-abhyasya yajuṣāṃ vā samāhitaḥ |
Sāmnāṃ vā sa-rahasyānāṃ sarva-pāpaiḥ pramucyate || 11.262|| One who thrice recites the Ṛg Veda, or remains absorbed in the Yajur Veda, or in the Sāma Veda including its secret knowledge, becomes liberated from all sins.

title: Verse 11.263
content: यथा महाह्रदं प्राप्य क्षिप्तं लोष्टं विनश्यति । तथा दुश्चरितं सर्वं वेदे त्रिवृति मज्जति ॥ ११.२६३॥ yathā mahāhradaṃ prāpya kṣiptaṃ loṣṭaṃ vinaśyati | tathā duścaritaṃ sarvaṃ vede trivṛti majjati || 11.263 || As a clod hurled into a great lake vanishes therein, so all evil deeds dissolve in the Veda when performed with full knowledge.

title: Verse 11.264
content:
ऋचो यजूंषि चान्यानि सामानि विविधानि च ।
एष ज्ञेयस्त्रिवृद्वेदो यो वेदैनं स वेदवित् ॥ ११.२६४॥ ṛco yajūṃṣi cānyāni sāmāni vividhāni ca |
eṣa jñeyastri-vṛdvedo yo vedainaṃ sa vedavit || 11.264|| The threefold Veda consists of Ṛk, Yajus, and Sāma mantras along with diverse other forms. One who knows this Veda in its fullness is a true knower of the Veda.

title: Verse 11.265
content:
आद्यं यत्त्र्यक्षरं ब्रह्म त्रयी यस्मिन् प्रतिष्ठिता ।
स गुह्योऽन्यस्त्रिवृद्वेदो यस्तं वेद स वेदवित् ॥ ११.२६५॥ ādyaṃ yattriakṣaraṃ brahma trayī yasmin pratiṣṭhitā |
sa guhyo'nyastrivṛdvedo yastaṃ veda sa vedavit || 11.265|| That primal Brahman which consists of three syllables, upon whom the triple knowledge of the Vedas rests—is the hidden Veda of threefold expansion; whoever knows That is truly a knower of the Veda.

title: Verse 12.1
content:
अध्याय १२

चातुर्वर्ण्यस्य कृत्स्नोऽयमुक्तो धर्मस्त्वयाऽनघः ।
कर्मणां फलनिर्वृत्तिं शंस नस्तत्त्वतः पराम् ॥ १२.१॥ adhyāya 12

cāturvarṇyasya kṛtsno'yam ukto dharmas tvayā'naghaḥ |
karmaṇāṃ phalanirvṛttiṃ śaṃsa nastattvataḥ parām || 12.1|| The complete Dharma of the four varnas has been declared by You, O Sinless One; now declare to us the ultimate truth of the fruition of actions.

title: Verse 12.2
content:
स तानुवाच धर्मात्मा महर्षीन् मानवो भृगुः ।
अस्य सर्वस्य शृणुत कर्मयोगस्य निर्णयम् ॥ १२.२॥ sa tānuvāca dharmātmā maharṣīn mānavo bhṛguḥ |
asya sarvasya śṛṇuta karma-yogasya nirṇayam || 12.2|| The divine Manava Bhrigu spoke to those great sages thus: 'Hear now the decisive declaration of Karma Yoga in its totality.'

title: Verse 12.3
content:
शुभाशुभफलं कर्म मनोवाग्देहसम्भवम् ।
कर्मजा गतयो नॄणामुत्तमाधममध्यमः ॥ १२.३॥ śubhāśubhaphalaṁ karma manovāgdehasambhavam | 
karmajā gatayo nṝṇām uttamādhamamadhyamaḥ || 12.3 || Action, whether virtuous or non-virtuous, arises from mind, speech, and body; from action arise the destinies of beings—superior, inferior, and middling.

title: Verse 12.4
content:
तस्यैह त्रिविधस्यापि त्र्यधिष्ठानस्य देहिनः ।
दशलक्षणयुक्तस्य मनो विद्यात्प्रवर्तकम् ॥ १२.४॥ tasyaiha trividhasyāpi tryadhiṣṭhānasya dehinaḥ |
daśalakṣaṇayuktasya mano vidyātpravartakam || 12.4|| The mind of the embodied Self, situated in the threefold realm and grounded in the ten characteristics of dharma, is to be known as the instigator of discriminative knowledge.

title: Verse 12.5
content:
परद्रव्येष्वभिध्यानं मनसाऽनिष्टचिन्तनम् ।
